%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@b%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@…Ref. Matt. 3:7%fn~
%u@[%u@r%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@s%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@s%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@…Lit: %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@t%u@]%i@b%i@y%i@…Lit: %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@u%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@…Lit: %i@s%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@v%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@a%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@w%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@e%i@t%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@x%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@c%i@…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@…OT law permitted this, see Deut. 23:25%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@S%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@…The Showbread was bread offering to God that was placed on a special table in the Holy Place of the temple%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%I@S%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@-%i@u%i@p%i@…Lit: %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@.%i@ His hand had the appearance of a plant, a tree, maybe even a piece of meat, which for one reason or another had dried up. When something like that dries up, it shrinks, becomes stiff, forms ridges and cracks, becomes brittle.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@…According to OT law, the criminal prosecution of a violation of the Law of Moses required that witnesses (accusers) of the wrongdoing present their accusations in court in order to convict the accused. The judge determined that this was done in order. There was no jury.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@b%i@l%i@a%i@s%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@…Blaspheming the Holy Spirit is to reject, deny, or be in opposition to a miracle which was done by the power of the Holy Spirit and whose miraculous origin is manifest. As faith by nature is to believe in something which you cannot definitely prove in this natural world, having been confronted with natural evidence, yet still remaining hard of heart, is proof that one’s heart is so hard that he’ll never turn to God. This person will never ask for forgiveness, and God will never forgive them of their sin.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@b%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@m%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@.%i@ Liberty taken to adapt the wording to a contemporary court proceeding. In the original text, Jesus portrays the Ninevites standing as witnesses and accusers against the Israelites.%fn~
%u@[%U@G%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@d%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@…Jesus outlines the principles by which demons (literally, %i@u%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@s) work. A demon leaves a man (v. 43) not because it wants to leave, but when that man resists it or when it’s cast out of him. He travels over “uninhabitable, inhospitable landscape.” This is not physical landscape but it’s a landscape of human beings. The demon is looking for another person to inhabit, which is what is meant in v. 43 by “seeking residency” (literally, %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t). To enter a person, he dangles a suggestion in front of them, and they must take it, then it must grow, then he eventually enters them. The uninhabitable, inhospitable landscape (literally, %i@d%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@s) consists of people who one by one reject the suggestions or subsequent advances of that demon. Having been rejected by others, in v. 44 the demon returns to his original host (literally, %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e).%fn~
%u@[%U@H%u@]Some manuscripts include v. 47, some don’t%fn~
%i@%sb~
Matthew Chapter 13%hb~
          %u@1About that time, Jesus left his house and took a seat along the seashore. %u@2A large crowd gathered around him, to the extent that he had to get in a boat and cast out a bit and sit there instead, while the crowd stood along the shoreline. %u@3He used a lot of analogies when speaking. As an example he said, %r@“%R@H%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@w%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@W%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@w%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@i%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@O%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@c%r@k%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@i%r@l%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@q%r@u%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@n%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@c%r@o%r@r%r@c%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@d%r@g%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@i%r@l%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@o%r@k%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@w%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@u%r@i%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@i%r@e%r@l%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@3%r@0%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@1%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@i%r@e%r@l%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@6%r@0%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@1%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@i%r@e%r@l%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@1%r@0%r@0%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@1%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@A%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@f%r@f%r@i%r@c%r@i%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@”%u@%vn~
          %u@1%u@0His disciples approached him and said, “Why do you speak to them in analogies?” %u@1%u@1He answered, %r@“%R@I%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@o%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@(%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@)%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@q%r@u%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@l%r@y%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@q%r@u%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@I%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@o%r@g%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@:%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@‘%r@w%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@’%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@A%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@P%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@s%r@a%r@i%r@a%r@h%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@c%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@,%r@%vn~

%r@“%R@W%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@%vp~

          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%r@”%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@s%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@N%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@r%r@o%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@a%r@b%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@L%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@F%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@a%r@b%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@r%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@.%r@ %R@C%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@l%r@o%r@.%r@’%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@3%u@1He told them another analogy: %r@“%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@(%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@)%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@o%r@g%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@e%r@l%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@W%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@m%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@-%r@g%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@i%r@g%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@-%r@y%r@i%r@e%r@l%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@i%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@3%u@3He told them another analogy: %r@“%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@o%r@g%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@m%r@b%r@e%r@d%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@t%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@u%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@z%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@t%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@r%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@4Jesus spoke all these things to the crowd by way of parables, and he didn’t say anything apart from using a parable, %u@3%u@5so that the Psalm%u@[%u@i%u@] would be fulfilled,%vn~
%si~
I will open my mouth by means of analogy.%vp~
I will pour out of it%vp~
That which has been hidden from the beginning of time%u@[%u@j%u@].%u@%vp~
%si~
          %u@3%u@6Then he let the crowds go home. His disciples went up to him and asked, “Explain to us the parable of the field’s crab grass.” %u@3%u@7He told them, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@”%R@D%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
      They %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tell him, “yes.”%vn~
          %u@5%u@2He told them, %r@“%R@F%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@w%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@           %u@5%u@3And when Jesus came to the end of speaking these parables, he left that place. %u@5%u@4After he arrived at the place where his kinfolk lived, he taught them in the local synagogue, resulting in them being astonished and going about saying,%vn~
      “’Where’d this guy get this here wisdom and the miracles%u@[%u@s%u@]? %u@5%u@5Isn’t this guy the craftsman’s%u@[%U@E%u@] son? Isn’t his mother the one called Mary and aren’t his brothers%u@[%U@F%u@] James, Joseph, Simon, and Judas? %u@5%u@6And his sisters—don’t they all live around here%u@[%u@t%u@]? Just where did he get all this from?’”%vn~
          %u@5%u@7And they got all bent out of shape about him. Jesus said to them, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@o%r@n%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@c%r@e%r@p%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@f%r@o%r@l%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@t%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@.%r@” %u@5%u@8He didn’t do a lot of miracles there because of their refusal to believe%u@[%U@G%u@].%vn~
%sf~

%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@i%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@d%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@…Lit: %i@h%i@i%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@P%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@m%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@P%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@t%i@%fn~

%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e %I@M%i@a%i@n%i@…Lit: %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n. Ref. Matt. 8:20.%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@…%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@E%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@ %I@O%i@n%i@e%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m and %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@ or %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@e%i@s%i@…Lit: %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@e%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@p%i@e %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@c%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@s. Ref. Matt. 18:6.%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@w%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@.%i@ Ref. note of Matt. 7:23.%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@b%i@l%i@a%i@z%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@e. The use of the definite article along with the awkward use of %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ is a figure of speech which emphasizes the furnace’s intensity.%fn~
%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@y%i@…Lit: %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@y%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@r%u@]%i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@…The Gk. idiom %i@e%i@k%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@o%i@u%i@ , which is ἐκ μέσου (ἐκ /Strong’s 1537), (μέσου/Strong’s 3319)%i@. Means %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ [%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@s%i@h]%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@. Ref. note of Luke 4:30 for more details on %i@e%i@k%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@o%i@u.%fn~
%u@[%u@s%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@s%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@s%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@s. A figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@t%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@…Lit: %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@.%i@ Also could mean, %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@d%i@a%i@y%i@%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@W%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r…There are two sets of eyes and two sets of ears: the physical eyes and ears and the eyes and ears of the heart. As we say, that it “went in one ear and went out the next,” so Jesus has designated that some, though they hear his message, will only hear with their physical ears but won’t hear with the ears of their heart. If is because their heart is not receptive. Jesus’s message must go from the physical ears to the ears of the heart, in order to become effective. Jesus purposely prevents those whose hearts are hardened from receiving the message on the inside.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@c%i@r%i@a%i@b%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@…The GT refers to a common, invasive weed-grass that afflicted wheat fields in that part of the world%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@w%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@n%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@…Ref. Matt. 8:12%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@p%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@w%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@g%i@e…What Jesus is saying here is that when a Scribe, those who were the experts in the Old Testament, becomes a true believer, then he’s like the manager who runs a house, presumably a large one, presumably one where there’s much land, many workers, etc. In this case, there’s a lot of tools, machinery, storage containers, etc. that are buried in closets, warehouses, etc. The manager had been there for years and had known about every item which was made or purchased, what condition it’s in, and where it’s stored. So, for example, if on the farm they need to lift a heavy rock or something, he thinks for a while and then tells everyone, “There’s and old rope and pulley buried in the back of the basement closet. Someone go fetch it, and we’ll use that to lift the rock.” That analogy is applied to the Scribe. He had done all this study and learned the ins and outs of many verses of Scriptures, so when his heart turns to the Lord, he’s able to retrieve old pieces of understanding that he learned years before in the same way as the manager would get some old tool out of the closet.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@a%i@f%i@t%i@s%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@…From this verse many have concluded that Jesus was a carpenter. The Greek word means carpenter but also means craftsman. It’s likely that Jesus was both of these, that the master of the universe had many skills, that he was a jack-of-all trades; since %i@c%i@r%i@a%i@f%i@t%i@s%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ is more general than %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@,%i@ he should be called the former rather than the latter.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@…This enumeration of his four brothers implies that these are all the brothers Jesus had%fn~
%u@[%U@G%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@f%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@. In this context, %i@u%i@n%i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@f is the stubborn refusal to believe what you should believe. In other contexts, the word %i@u%i@n%i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@ may or may not involve this rebellious refusal to have faith. In cases such as this, %i@u%i@n%i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@f is not believing simply because one is in ignorance.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Matthew Chapter 14%hb~
          %u@1In that timeframe, Governor Herod got a report about Jesus. %u@2He said to all those around him, “This is John the Baptist. He’s been raised from the dead, and that explains how he %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@ work these miracles.” %u@3You see, on account of Herodias, his brother Phillip’s wife, Herod arrested John, bound him, and put him away in jail. %u@4This was because John kept on telling him, “It’s not lawful for you to be married to her.” %u@5Though wanting to kill him, he feared the masses, because they considered him to be a prophet. %u@6On Herod’s birthday, Herodias’s daughter performed a dance in front of everyone, %u@7resulting in him making an oath promising that he’d give her anything she asked for. %u@8Her mother nudged her to say, “Give me John the Baptist’s head on a platter.” %u@9The king became deeply upset because of the oath that he made in front of all his guests. He ordered that the request be granted, %u@1%u@0and he sent for John to be beheaded in jail. %u@1%u@1His head was brought on a platter and was given to the teenage girl, and she presented it to her mother. %u@1%u@2His disciples went there and took away his body, buried him, and went and told Jesus what had happened.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3After Jesus heard about this, he left from there by boat to go some place out in the sticks to be alone. When the crowd heard, they followed him on foot from the cities. %u@1%u@4He went out and saw the great crowd and felt a deep inner compassion for them and cured all those who weren’t well. %u@1%u@5When it got late, his disciples came to him and said,%vn~
      “We’re out in the middle of nowhere, and it’s getting late. Dismiss the crowds so that they can venture out to the marketplaces in the surrounding towns and pick up something to eat.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@6Jesus replied, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@m%r@i%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@—%r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@t%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@7They then said, “We don’t have anything here except for five loaves of bread and two fishes.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@8He said, %r@“%R@B%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@9He had everyone in the crowd find a nice spot on the grass to relax%u@[%U@A%u@]. He took the five loaves and the two fishes, he looked up in the sky, gave thanks, broke the bread%u@[%U@B%u@] and gave it to his disciples. %u@2%u@0Everyone ate and ate until they were full. They took away the leftover pieces of bread and filled up twelve baskets with them. %u@2%u@1Of those who had been fed, there were five thousand men, not including women and children.%vn~
          %u@2%u@2Wasting no time, he urged his disciples to climb into a boat and go out ahead of him to the other side, while he, meanwhile, would dismiss the crowd. %u@2%u@3After he dismissed the crowd, he went by himself up a mountain to pray. When evening arrived, he was up there alone. %u@2%u@4The boat had already gotten more than a few miles away from shore, where it was being harassed by the waves, since there was a headwind. %u@2%u@5Around four or five in the morning, he went towards them walking on the water. %u@2%u@6When the disciples saw him walking on the water, they were startled and shouted, “There’s a ghost out there!”. %u@2%u@7Immediately Jesus said to them, %r@“%R@R%r@e%r@l%r@a%r@x%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@r%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@8So Peter replied, “Lord, if it’s you, order me to come to you on the water.” %u@2%u@9Jesus said, “Come.” Peter got out of the boat and walked on water and went towards Jesus. %u@3%u@0Seeing the strong wind, he got scared and started to sink and shouted, “Lord, help, save me!” %u@3%u@1Immediately Jesus reached his hand out and got ahold of him and said, %r@“%R@L%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@l%r@e%r@-%r@f%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@-%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@u%r@b%r@t%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@3%u@2After they got into the boat, the wind died down. %u@3%u@3Those in the boat bowed down low in homage before him saying, “You really are God’s son.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@4Having crossed over, they landed at Gennesaret. %u@3%u@5The men from that area, recognizing him, sent the word out to the entire surrounding area, and they brought to him everyone who wasn’t well. %u@3%u@6They were begging him, again and again, that they just %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o touch the edge%u@[%u@a%u@] of his shawl, and everybody who touched it became completely well.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@w%i@l%i@…Or: %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@w%i@l%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@R%i@e%i@l%i@a%i@x%i@…In the GT is literally %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e. Folks back then laid down on couches when they ate, taking their time at it, enjoying the company of those they were eating with.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@b%i@r%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@.%i@ Breaking a token piece of bread was the ritual back then before eating, something like tapping a champagne glass with a spoon before proposing a toast.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Matthew Chapter 15%hb~
          %u@1Then some Pharisees and designated teachers%u@[%u@a%u@] from Jerusalem arrived saying, %u@2”What’s the reason that your disciples disregard the rituals which have been handed down to us over the years,%u@[%U@A%u@] seeing that they don’t ceremonially wash their hands before eating?” %u@3Jesus answered them, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@r%r@e%r@g%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@a%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@‘%R@F%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@p%r@p%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@‘%R@L%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@d%r@-%r@m%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@s%r@ %r@%si~

          %u@1%u@0He summoned the crowd and said, %r@“%R@L%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@—%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@D%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@2Then his disciples went over to him and said, “Did you know that the Pharisees were offended by what you said?” %u@1%u@3He came back with a response and said, %r@“%R@E%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@L%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@;%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@t%r@c%r@h%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@5Peter answered him, “Explain that analogy %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ to us.” %u@1%u@6He said, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@m%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@t%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@T%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@i%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@…%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@2%u@1Jesus left there and departed for the regions of Tyre and Sidon%u@[%U@E%u@]. %u@2%u@2Out of nowhere, a Canaanite woman from that area came by and shouted, “Have mercy on me, sir, you wonderful man%u@[%u@d%u@]. My daughter is severely demon-possessed.” %u@2%u@3He didn’t say a word to her. His disciples went over to him and started saying, “Get rid of her.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@4He replied to her, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@-%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@-%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@s%r@r%r@a%r@e%r@l%r@.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@5So she came and prostrated herself in front of him and said, “Help me, sir.” %vn~
          %u@2%u@6Jesus replied, %r@“%R@I%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@C%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@’%r@s%r@ %R@B%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@g%r@s%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@F%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@7She said, “Yes, but also, sir: the dogs are fed by the scraps which their masters drop from their tables.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@8Then this produced a response with Jesus; he said, %r@“%R@W%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@g%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@!%r@ %R@A%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@.%r@”%vn~
      …And her daughter was healed that moment.%vn~
          %u@2%u@9Returning from there Jesus went to the Sea of Galilee, and took a seat up in a hill that is alongside it. %u@3%u@0A large crowd approached him, bringing with them their lame, blind, maimed, deaf & dumb, and many other such, and they laid them at his feet (%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@e), and he healed them, %u@3%u@1to the degree that the crowd was awe-struck in seeing the deaf & dumb speak, the maimed become well, the lame walk, and the blind seeing. And they glorified the God of Israel.%vn~
          %u@3%u@2Now Jesus summoned his disciples and said, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@p%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@t%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@m%r@i%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@n%r@g%r@r%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@3%u@3His disciples chimed in,%vn~
      “Where in the middle of nowhere can we get all the bread needed to fill up such a large crowd?”%vn~
          %u@3%u@4Jesus continued and said, “How much bread do you have?”%vn~
      They said, “Seven loaves plus a little bit of fish.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@5He told the crowd to find a nice spot on the ground to relax on.%u@[%u@e%u@] %u@3%u@6He took the seven loaves and the fish, gave thanks, broke the bread, and gave it to his disciples. %u@3%u@7All of them ate until they were stuffed. They gathered up the leftover scraps and filled up seven baskets with them. %u@3%u@8There were four thousand men eating there that day—this doesn’t include women and children. %u@3%u@9He dismissed the crowd, got into a boat, and went to the Magadan region.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@…Lit: %i@s%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@…Lit: %i@l%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@l%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@…Lit: %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@sing. Lying when called upon to give evidence or give testimony in a legal setting%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@…Lit: %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@D%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@d. Ref. Matt. 12:23%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@n%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@l%i@a%i@x%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@…Ref. Matt. 14:19%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s. These are rituals, customs, and traditions which are not part of what’s commanded for the Jews to do in the Bible, in the Law of Moses. They are man-made traditions, not God-made.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@f%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@…Lit: %I@H%i@o%i@n%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r. The well-known commandment. The word honor means not only to honor someone in the sense of the English word, but it also means to support someone financially. In this context, the word means financial support.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@…The Hebrew %i@k%i@o%i@r%i@b%i@a%i@n%i@.%i@ What is hinted is that the Pharisees and Scribes designated these funds as an %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d, but, as custodians of those funds, devised clever ways of spending it on themselves in the name of God and not actually dropping it in the collection basket.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@f%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@…The OT defines a strict delineation between clean and unclean, holy and unholy. These are in respect to physical objects, the bodily hygiene, foods, etc. Transgression of one of these regulations causes a person to become defiled (unclean). Jesus explains here and in other places a parallel concept of clean and unclean in regard to spiritual matters.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%I@T%i@y%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@S%i@i%i@d%i@o%i@n%i@…Tyre and Sidon are gentile regions, outside of Israel, major cities of the Canaanites, the first settlers of Israel. They are not spoken of well in the OT. Though the original Canaanites had long faded out of the area, they are still referred to as such. Jews were not supposed to have any dealings with the Gentiles.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@g%i@s%i@…The Jews had a low regard for dogs; Jesus is saying that it wouldn’t be right for him to take the blessing (the “Children’s Bread”) which is intended for God’s people and give it to the infidel Canaanites. Jesus’s commission from God the Father was to go to His people, the Israelites, not to the Gentiles. But this is one of several incidents in the Bible where a person’s faith transcends the privileges reserved for God’s people, empowering those who believe to acquire what they would otherwise not be entitled to.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Matthew Chapter 16%hb~
          %u@1The Pharisees and Sadducees came by. Testing him, they asked him to perform a spectacular miracle%u@[%u@a%u@] on the spot. %u@2He delivered an answer to them, %r@“%R@A%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@n%r@s%r@e%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@A%r@h%r@…%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@—%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@k%r@y%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@d%r@’%r@;%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@n%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@A%r@h%r@…%r@d%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@d%r@a%r@y%r@—%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@k%r@y%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@’%r@ %R@A%r@l%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@f%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@f%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@k%r@y%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@f%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@A%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@s%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@v%r@a%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %R@Z%r@e%r@i%r@t%r@g%r@e%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@!%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@l%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@?%r@ %R@N%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@m%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@c%r@e%r@p%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %R@J%r@o%r@n%r@a%r@h%r@’%r@s%r@ %R@M%r@i%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@l%r@e%r@”%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]… And he excused himself and departed.%vn~
          %u@5When they crossed over to the next district, the disciples forgot to take bread along with them. %u@6Jesus said to them, %r@“%R@L%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@P%r@h%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@e%r@s%r@’%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@S%r@a%r@d%r@d%r@u%r@c%r@e%r@e%r@s%r@’%r@ %r@y%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@g%r@u%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@“%R@W%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@.%r@” %u@8Jesus, aware of this, said, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@g%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@l%r@e%r@-%r@f%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@-%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@?%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@C%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@H%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@m%r@b%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@s%r@k%r@e%r@t%r@f%r@u%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@p%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@N%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@           %u@1%u@3Having arrived in the parts of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples,%vn~

          %u@1%u@4They replied, “Some, John the Baptist, others Elijah, still others Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”%vn~

          %u@1%u@6Simon Peter replied, “You are the Messiah%u@[%u@e%u@], the Son of the Living God.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@7Jesus came up with a reply and said to him, %r@“%R@H%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@v%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@           %u@2%u@1Starting then, Jesus began to go about showing his disciples that he must travel to Jerusalem in order to suffer greatly at the hands of the %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@l councilmen%u@[%u@k%u@], Chief Priests, and designated teachers%u@[%u@l%u@], to be put to death, and to be resurrected on the third day. %u@2%u@2Peter button-holed him and began to get on his case, “Oh, dear God! Lord! %u@[%u@e%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@a%i@h%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t. Ref. Matt. 2:3%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@f%i@a%i@v%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@…Lit: %i@b%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@.%i@ Means %i@f%i@a%i@v%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@d, but especially %i@f%i@a%i@v%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@.%i@ Also means %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@u%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@l%i@u%i@c%i@k%i@y.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@…Lit: %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@.%i@ Ref. Gal. 1:16.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%I@F%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@…Lit: %i@c%i@h%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@r%i@y%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t. A figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@m%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n. A figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@l%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@…Lit: %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@.%i@ Ref. note of Luke 9:23.%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@…%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@…Lit: %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@j%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@…Lit:%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@…Lit: %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@s%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@C%i@a%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@…Lit: %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n. God performed different kinds of miracles depending on what was needed at the time. Elijah’s miracles were the send-down-fire-from-the-sky type. God performed those kinds of miracles in Elijah’s time (i.e., Elijah’s season or Elijah’s dispensation) because that was what was needed or appropriate for that season. God was performing through Jesus mostly healing miracles, as the season had changed from that of Elijah’s to a season of the mercy of God. The miracles in Jesus’s ministry were of a different nature than Elijah’s, but the Pharisees expected Jesus to vindicate himself through Elijah-type miracles. The Pharisees were demanding a miracle that was relevant to Elijah’s dispensation and would not recognize a miracle which was relevant to Jesus’s dispensation. They could look at the sky, noting the time of day and the weather season, and know what kind of weather to expect, but could not differentiate what miracle was appropriate for the time they lived in.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@J%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@h%i@’%i@s%i@ %I@M%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e…This described in Matt. 12:40. Jonah’s Miracle is Jesus coming back from the dead as he said he would. Jesus is saying that he won’t do any miracle on-demand except for that singular miracle of coming back from the dead. In reality, Jesus did miracles all the time, and the Pharisees could have just followed him around and saw one, but the Pharisees wouldn’t accept any of those.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@?%i@…Jesus reprimands them because all they’re caught up in thinking about where they’re going to find food. That should have faith that God will provide them food and look to the kingdom of heaven.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@s%i@k%i@e%i@t%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@…The account of the leftover baskets here in vv. 9, 10 is repeated Mark 9:17. The lesson is the same: in both miracles of multiplication, the disciples finished with the same number of baskets as when they started. For that matter, had they fed more, they still would have finished with the same number of baskets as they started. The food was not multiplied when Jesus gave thanks before the meal. Jesus did not pray and a heap of food appeared. Instead, the miracle occurred each time a disciple reached his hand into a basket to hand out more food. The food was multiplied on-the-spot over and over again, as many times as was needed. The point Jesus makes is that God’s provision for our daily bread happens on-the-spot, right when it’s needed, as many times as it’s needed, and not provided in a large lump beforehand. Jesus is impressing on them the fact that if they were to need more food, it would appear the moment it was needed, and that they shouldn’t worry about it.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@’%I@F%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@-%I@T%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@’%i@ %I@S%i@i%i@m%i@o%i@n …Lit: %I@S%i@i%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@ %I@B%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@.%i@ %I@B%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@a is an Aramaic word (%I@B%i@a%i@r%i@-%I@J%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@h) translated %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@J%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@h. This if a figure of speech that refers to the Prophet Jonah, as Peter’s real father is named John (ref. John 1:42). Jonah was full throttle in one direction or full throttle in the other direction, but never in-between. So was Peter.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@…Lit: %I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@P%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ [Gk: %i@p%i@e%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@ (Πέτρος /Strong’s 4074)]%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@c%i@k [Gk: %i@p%i@e%i@t%i@r%i@a (πέτρα /Strong’s 4073)]%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@h. Peter’s name means %i@r%i@o%i@c%i@k and Jesus is making a word play here by both referring to Peter by his name and by reminding Peter that he is a rock. Some disagree as to the interpretation of this verse. Some point to Gk. lectionaries and say that petros is a different word than petra, that petros means a rock fragment, that while Peter is the rock fragment, Jesus himself is the petra. The other argument says that petros is the Gk. word petra converted into its name form. I should point out that this second argument is more plausible, for the reason that the attributive adjective construct of the word %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s in the Gk., namely %i@t%i@a%i@u%i@t%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@t%i@r%i@a or ταύτῃ τῇ πέτρᾳ, (ταύτῃ /Strong’s 3778), (τῇ /Strong’s 3588), (πέτρᾳ/Strong’s 4073) binds petros to its antecedent petra, and therefore they are one in the same. It’s worth pointing out that James supplanted Peter in the leadership of the Jewish church in the years following Pentecost.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Matthew Chapter 17%hb~
          %u@1Six days later, Jesus went up a high mountain, bringing along with him Peter, James, and his brother John—those four alone. %u@2He was metamorphosed in front of them, and his face shined like the sun, and his clothing became as bright as the full light of day. %u@3And—like that—Moses and Elijah were seen talking with him. %u@4Peter exclaimed to Jesus, “Lord, it’s a good thing we’re here. If you’d like, I’ll build three little holy edifices %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%u@[%u@a%u@] here, one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.” %u@5A cloud appeared abruptly while he was still in the middle of talking, engulfing them in its shadow, and just as abruptly a voice spoke from out of the cloud saying, “This here is my Beloved Son, in whom I’m quite pleased. Listen to him again and again.” %u@6Once the disciples heard the voice, they fell flat on their faces and became really scared. %u@7Jesus went to them, touched them, and said, %r@“%R@R%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@r%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@8When they opened their eyes, they didn’t see anything except for Jesus back to normal and by himself again.%vn~
          %u@9While they were going down the mountain, Jesus commanded them, %r@“%R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@0The disciples asked him, “So now, why do the designated teachers%u@[%U@A%u@] say that Elijah must come first, %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@e%i@l%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@s?” %u@1%u@1He retorted, %r@“%R@T%r@r%r@u%r@e%r@,%r@ %R@E%r@l%r@i%r@j%r@a%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@E%r@l%r@i%r@j%r@a%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%R@I%r@@%R@G%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@s%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@f%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@3It was then that the disciples understood that he was talking to them about John the Baptist.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4When he got back to the crowd, a man came up to him kneeling in front of him %u@1%u@5saying, “Sir, have pity on my son since he’s epileptic and suffers badly. You see, one moment he’s having a seizure and the next moment he’s back to normal again.%u@[%u@c%u@] %u@1%u@6I brought him to your disciples, and they weren’t able to cure him.” %u@1%u@7Jesus, in his reaction, answered, %r@“%R@O%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %R@Z%r@e%r@i%r@t%r@g%r@e%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@!%r@ %R@J%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@?%r@ %R@J%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@?%r@ %R@B%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@8Jesus dropped the hammer on him, the demon came out of him, and the child was treated that moment. %u@1%u@9While they were alone, his disciples came over to him and asked, “What’s the reason why we couldn’t cast it out on our own?” %u@2%u@0Engaging them, he said, %r@“%R@B%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@l%r@e%r@-%r@f%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@-%r@s%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@-%r@f%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@P%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@,%r@’%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@N%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@m%r@p%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@”%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%vn~
          %u@2%u@2Wrapping it up in Galilee, Jesus said to them, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@ And they became quite sad.%vn~
          %u@2%u@4When he got to Capernaum, the collectors of the annual temple fee paid Peter a visit and said, “Your teacher hasn’t paid this year’s temple fee%u@[%U@C%u@] yet.” %u@2%u@5Peter took note of the comment and said “Ok” and went into the house. Anticipating him, Jesus said to him, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@,%r@ %R@S%r@i%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@?%r@ %R@F%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@u%r@l%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@v%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@x%r@e%r@s%r@?%r@ %R@F%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@n%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@?%r@” %u@2%u@6Peter answered, “From others.” Jesus then said, %r@“%R@A%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@n%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@a%r@p%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@,%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@e%r@l%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@.%r@ %R@O%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@r%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@.%r@”%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@e%i@d%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@…Lit: %i@l%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ [%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s]. The word %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@ refers to the OT tabernacle in Mt. Sinai and likewise the temple in Jerusalem. The concept is extended to mean a place which is designated as holy.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n…Lit: %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n. Ref. Matt. 8:20.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@i%i@z%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@x%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@…Lit:%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@n. Presumably an idiom.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%I@Z%i@e%i@i%i@t%i@g%i@e%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@…Lit: %i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n. Ref. Matt. 3:7%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%I@J%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@d%i@y…Lit: %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@-%i@d%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@m%i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@.%i@ This is a $450 value.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s…Lit: %I@S%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@s. The Scribes were the experts in the OT and used their expertise to ascertain the circumstances, sequences, and events that the OT prophecies indicated about the Messiah’s coming%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]Verse 21 which reads, %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g, is intentionally omitted because it appears to have been added to manuscripts in later centuries and was not part of what Matthew originally wrote.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@e%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@w%i@o%i@-%i@d%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@m%i@a. This is a silver coin of approx. 9 grams weight silver. See conversion note in Matt. 18:28 which translates the purchasing power of a gram of silver in ancient times to $25 in a contemporary, industrialized nation. By this reckoning, a two-drachma is valued at $225 in contemporary US dollars.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Matthew Chapter 18%hb~
          %u@1Around that time Jesus’s disciples came to him saying, “So now, who’s the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?” %u@2He called a child over and stood him in the midst of them %u@3and said, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@”%R@N%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@”%R@K%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%r@s%r@e%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@           %u@2%u@1Then Peter approached him and said, “Lord, how many times must I forgive a friend%u@[%u@e%u@] when he does me wrong? Up to seven%u@[%U@D%u@]%u@ (%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h)?” %u@2%u@2Jesus said, %r@“%R@M%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@y%r@-%r@s%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@F%r@o%r@r%r@
