%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@f%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@c%i@t…Lit: %i@a%i@ %I@G%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%I@K%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d…Lit: %I@T%i@r%i@u%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@b%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@w%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@e%i@e. A phrase used a few times in the NT to mean a handful (example is 1 Cor. 14:29).%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@l%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@…Lit: %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@o%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@T%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n…%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f. The Gk. noun/verb for %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@/%i@s%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ is %i@s%i@k%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@/%i@s%i@k%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@d%i@z%i@ō%i@ (σκάνδαλον/Strong’s 4625), (σκανδαλίζω/Strong’s 4624), and it’s usage and meaning originated in the LXX and from there carried forward into the NT.%i@ %I@S%i@k%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@ appears in Josh. 23:13; Judg. 2:3; (note Num. 23:55 is missing from the LXX).%fn~
Josh. 23:13, “[these nations] will be a snare and a trap to you”; %fn~
Judg. 2:3, “their gods will be a snare to you.”%fn~
These verses refer to two things:%fn~
(1) Israel would always be surrounded by hostile nations waiting to attack her the moment the opportunity presented itself. Matt. 5:30, 8:30, 18:8, 18:9; Mark 9:43, 9:45, 9:47.%fn~
(2) God’s supernatural protection enabled Israel to reign victorious over these nations; when Israel disobeyed, however, this protection was removed and these nations defeated Israel in battle, encroached on her, and eventually enslaved her.%fn~
The LXX meanings of %i@s%i@k%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@n were adapted into the following NT concepts, summarized as %i@l%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@p%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r; %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@b%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f; %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o; %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n; %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@c%i@c%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r; %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@;%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ and enumerated as:%fn~
(a) A person, a thing, an issue, a doctrine, an action (we’ll call these “thing A”) which hassles, vexes, attacks, or irritates a person or some group of people (we’ll call these “party X”). Matt. 13:41.%fn~
(b) Thing A setting a trap and lying in wait to ensnare party X. Matt. 18:7, 16:23, 18:6; Luke 17:1, 17:2; Rom. 11:9, 16:17; 1 Pet. 2:8.%fn~
(c) Party X being affected by a single specific item/thing A; the thing party A is affected by. John 6:61; Rom. 14:21; 1 Cor. 1:23, 8:13; Gal. 5:11; Rev. 2:14.%fn~
(d) Party X’s irritation which arose from thing A. Matt. 15:12; Mark 9:42%fn~
(e) Thing A successfully entrapping party X. Matt. 11:6, 17:27; Mark 4:17; John 16:1; Rom. 9:33, 14:13, 1 Pet. 2:8; 1 John 2:10.%fn~
(f) Party X’s disobedience to God and consequentially their defeat by thing A. Matt 24:10, 26:33; Mark 14:27, 14:29; Luke 17:23; 2 Cor. 11:29; 1 Pet. 2:8.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@I%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@(%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@p%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@—%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@d%i@)… similar wording for the eye. Jesus is not speaking of your physical hands, feet, or eyes here. Throughout the Bible, hands symbolize actions, feet symbolize the direction your life is headed in, and eyes symbolize the meditation of the mind or the desire of the heart. Jesus is therefore saying if you have a habit or some practice which is causing you to sin, quit doing it. If the direction of your life is causing you to head into sin, change the direction of your life. If there’s something that you dream about which causes you to sin, quit dwelling on it.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]Verse 11, which literally reads, %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@s%i@t, is omitted. Ref. note for Matt. 17:21.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@…In the Bible, %i@s%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n is the number of completion. In this context, Peter is thinking of forgiving his brother for a complete set of instances.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@$%i@1%i@0%i@,%i@0%i@0%i@0%i@…Lit: %i@1%i@0%i@0%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@i, which is about 14 ounces (0.4Kg) of silver. Converting this to contemporary US dollar equivalency is not trivial, nor will all agree on the result, but nevertheless, an attempt is made. As it was in ancient times, so it was up until the last century or so, than coins were tethered to their intrinsic value in gold or silver. The average biblical commentator did simple conversions based on the value of silver. But this does not give meaningful results, as the leaps in industrial productivity have made silver relatively plentiful compared to ancient times. The cost of silver in today’s US dollars is around $0.76/gram—but that in no way reflects the purchasing power of silver today verses silver in ancient times. A more accurate method for conversion is to base it on the cost of unskilled labor. Even that varies enormously between industrialized nations and non-industrialized nations. The cost of labor in ancient times can be ascertained from Matt. 20:2, which is namely 1 denarius (4g silver) per day. In US in the 19%u@t%u@h century, a day’s labor went for around $0.80, which was around 18g of silver, or 4.5 times more silver per day than what a worker in ancient times received—which demonstrates the inadequacy of simple conversions based on the price of gold or silver. But if one assumes that an unskilled worker makes $12/hour nowadays in industrialized nations, and therefore is paid $100 per day, then a denarius would represent $100 in today’s purchasing power. Of course, in contemporary, non-industrialized nations, the price of labor per day might be $5–$10, which is substantially less than industrialized nations. So the 100 denarrii equate to $10,000 of purchasing power in industrialized nations, but only $500 in non-industrialized nations.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Matthew Chapter 19%hb~
          %u@1When Jesus came to the end of speaking this collection of messages, he picked up from Galilee and went to the Judean region, on the other side of the Jordan. %u@2A great crowd followed him, and he healed all that were there.%vn~
          %u@3In an attempt to test him, some Pharisees approached him saying, “Is there any reason for which a husband is allowed to divorce his wife?” %u@4In his response he answered, %r@“%R@H%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@q%r@u%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@s%r@b%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@,%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@A%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@O%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@j%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@w%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@’%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@w%r@o%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %R@C%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@e%r@q%r@u%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@l%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@j%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@7Exchanging words, they asked, “Ok, so why does the Old Testament%u@[%u@a%u@] have a commandment which says ‘…to furnish a divorce certificate in order to divorce her…’?” %u@8To this exchange, he replied, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@T%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@m%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@v%r@o%r@r%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@;%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@q%r@u%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@I%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@c%r@e%r@p%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@x%r@u%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@i%r@m%r@m%r@o%r@r%r@a%r@l%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@v%r@o%r@r%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@m%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@i%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@d%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@1%u@0The disciples, responding to what they heard, said to him, “If this is the ask of the person who’s married, you’re better off not getting married.” %u@1%u@1He said, %r@“%R@N%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@s%r@e%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@.%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@3Then children were brought to him in order for him to lay hands on them and to pray for them, but the disciples barked at them and stopped them. %u@1%u@4Jesus said, %r@“%R@L%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@p%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@5He laid his hands on them and then left from there.%vn~
          %u@1%u@6Just like that, a young man approached him and said,%vn~
      “Teacher, what good must I do in order to have that special fullness of life (eternal life)?”%vn~
          %u@1%u@7He said to him, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@?%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@C%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@i%r@c%r@i%r@p%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@8Engaged in the conversation, he said to him, “Which ones?”%vn~
      Jesus said, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@:%r@ %r@‘%R@D%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@…%r@’%R@D%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@d%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@’%r@…%r@’%R@D%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@’%r@…%r@’%R@D%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@’%r@…%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%r@’%R@H%r@o%r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@…%r@’%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@b%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@’%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@0The young man, still engaged, said, “I’ve always been vigilant to do all these things%u@[%u@e%u@]. What am I missing still?”%vn~
          %u@2%u@1Jesus declared, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@p%r@i%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@u%r@a%r@l%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2After the young man heard this reply, he departed with a sulk, since he owned a lot of stuff. %u@2%u@3Jesus said to his disciples, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@d%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@i%r@c%r@i%r@p%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@L%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@—%r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@s%r@i%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@a%r@w%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@m%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@o%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@(%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@.%r@”%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@D%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@] %u@2%u@5When the disciples heard this they were simply stunned%u@[%u@h%u@] and said, “So now, how can anyone avoid this?%u@[%u@i%u@]” %u@2%u@6Jesus looked right at them and said to them, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@7Peter, in his response, answered, “See now, we, for our own part, have left everything and have become your followers. What’s going to happen to us?” %u@2%u@8Jesus said to them, %r@“%R@L%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@—%r@m%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@—%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@x%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@j%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@s%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@w%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@F%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %u@[%u@g%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@%fn~

%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@S%i@o%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w%i@,%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@v%i@o%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@?%i@…Lit: %I@S%i@o%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@?%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n. Ref. note in Matt. 8:20.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@h%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@…Lit: %i@f%i@i%i@e%i@l%i@d%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@…Lit: %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@h%i@u%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@…Lit: %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@-%i@f%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@s%i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@…Lit: %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n. The quote is word-for-word from the Septuagint; the words for %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ and %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ here are older Gk. words hardly found in the NT, giving the reader the feeling that he’s reading something written long beforehand, like the feeling we get when we read the KJV. But the words %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ and %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ have a dual meaning of both man and woman and of husband and wife. This verse employs both meanings.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@w%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@d%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@w%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h. The awkward wording is a figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%I@W%i@h%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@k%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@?%i@ %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d…Lit: %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@k%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@?%i@ %I@O%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@.%i@ The substantive %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ could be a good thing, a good person, or a good being. The context decides which it is. Some early manuscripts were modified to have the ending of v. 17 read, %I@O%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@:%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@a%i@w%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@m%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@g%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@v%i@o%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n…Lit: %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@y%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n…Many believe that the eye of a needle refers to a small gate, perhaps a yard (a meter) high, within a city wall gate which was used at night to let travelers enter a city without having to open the larger gate. A camel could barely fit through this smaller portal if it were to have all its baggage unpacked and it were to squeeze down and inch its way through. The analogy is that the camel, in addition to scrunching, has to unpack all its goods in order to enter in, just as Jesus asks the young man to give up all his belongings in order to enter the kingdom. But regardless of whether one receives this argument or not, a point to be made is that God is not opposed to the wealthy per se, but when the wealthy are made to choose between their earthly riches and the kingdom of God, it is only with great difficulty that they will part with their goods and choose the kingdom. God is not the one who prevents them from entering his kingdom; their own choice prevents them. Also, ref. Luke 18:25.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%I@L%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@—%i@m%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@—%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@x%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n%u@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@s%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@w%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l…Lit: %I@T%i@r%i@u%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@,%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@-%i@b%i@i%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@s%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@w%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@w%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l. In the OT, judges were ad-hoc rulers appointed by God over Israel; hence the word %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@.%i@ Also, at the time Jesus spoke this, several of the twelve tribes of Israel had already been erased from existence. The twelve tribes of Israel here abstractly refer of all Israelites everywhere, and would include those scattered throughout the Roman Empire (see James 1:1).%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@l%i@e%i@g%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@t. Ref. note of Luke 10:25.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Matthew Chapter 20%hb~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@”%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@o%r@g%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@ %R@A%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@I%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@T%r@a%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@m%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@B%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@.%r@’%r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@”%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@r%r@o%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@C%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@-%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@”%r@’%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@y%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@c%r@o%r@r%r@c%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@?%r@’%r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@”%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@p%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@H%r@e%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@d%r@d%r@y%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@ %R@D%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@$%r@1%r@0%r@0%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@T%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@.%r@ %r@%%R@I%r@@%R@I%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@—%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@t%r@?%r@ %R@O%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@t%r@i%r@t%r@u%r@d%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@o%r@s%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@’%r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@I%r@t%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@1%u@7Jesus took the twelve disciples, and they went by themselves up to Jerusalem. Along the way, he told them, %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@”%R@L%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@J%r@e%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@a%r@l%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@e%r@f%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@g%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@R%r@o%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@d%r@i%r@c%r@u%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@o%r@g%r@g%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@u%r@c%r@i%r@f%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@0Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came with her sons to bow down and ask something from him.%vn~
          %u@2%u@1He said, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@?%r@”%vn~
      Taking advantage of the moment, she said, “Appoint these two sons of mine to be your right-hand men in your kingdom.%u@[%u@h%u@]”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2For his response Jesus replied, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@.%r@ %R@W%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@?%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@”%vn~
      Fully aware, they said, “We are able.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@3He, matching their awareness, said, %r@“%R@T%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@-%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@,%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@j%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@4When the other ten heard of this, they became furious with the brothers. %u@2%u@5Jesus summoned them together and said, %r@“%R@A%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@u%r@l%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@b%r@j%r@u%r@g%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@-%r@p%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@f%r@u%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@t%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@I%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@-%r@p%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@f%r@u%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@l%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@—%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@d%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@y%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@2%u@9A large crowd followed him as he left Jericho. %u@3%u@0Suddenly two blind men sitting alongside the road heard that Jesus was passing by, and shouted out,%vn~
      “Have mercy on us, sir, you godsend%u@[%u@k%u@]!”%vn~
          %u@3%u@1But the crowd yelled at them to keep quiet. But all the more louder they shouted out,%vn~
      “Have mercy on us, sir, you godsend!!”%vn~
          %u@3%u@2Jesus halted, called for them, and said, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@?%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@3They said to him, “Sir, that we would be able to see.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@4Jesus felt deep compassion for them and touched their eyes, and right away they gained their sight and became his followers.%vn~
%sf~

%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@…Lit: %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n%i@…Lit: %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n. Ref. note in Matt. 8:20.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@…Lit: %I@S%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%I@R%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@…Lit: %I@G%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%I@A%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@w%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@-%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m…Lit: %I@S%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@w%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@W%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h…Lit: %I@C%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@p%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@?%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%I@T%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@d%i@e…Lit: %I@O%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@p%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e…%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@d%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@…Lit: %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@D%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@d. Ref. Matt. 12:23.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Matthew Chapter 21%hb~
          %u@1When he drew near to Jerusalem and arrived at Bethphage, at the Mount of Olives, at that time Jesus sent out two disciples, %u@2telling them, %r@“%R@G%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@r%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@k%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@x%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@.%r@ %R@U%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@4This happened so that the Prophet %I@I%i@s%i@a%i@i%i@a%i@h%i@’%i@s prophecy would be fulfilled, which says:%vn~
%si~
%u@5Say to the socialites%vp~
In the God-intended city of Jerusalem%u@[%U@A%u@]:%vp~
“Look!—your king is coming your way,%vp~
Self-restrained and soft-spoken%u@[%u@a%u@] and mounted on a donkey%vp~
And upon a pack animal’s foal”%u@[%U@B%u@]%u@%vp~
%si~
          %u@6The disciples went and did what Jesus told them to do. %u@7They lead away the donkey and the foal and placed their outer garments on them, and he sat on them. %u@8Most of the crowd spread their outer garments out on the road before him, while others chopped off tree branches and spread them out on the road. %u@9And the crowd of forerunners and the crowd of tail-runners kept shouting,%vn~
%si~
Rescue us%u@[%u@b%u@] by the godsend!%u@[%u@c%u@]%vp~
Praise be to him who comes at the Lord’s behest%u@[%u@d%u@]%vp~
Rescue us to the max!%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@0Having entered Jerusalem, the whole city was stirred up saying, “Who is this guy?” %u@1%u@1The crowd kept saying, “This here is the Prophet Jesus from Nazareth, Galilee.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@2Jesus entered the temple and threw out all the salesmen and the merchandisers in there. He overturned the tables of the money changers and those selling doves.%u@[%U@C%u@] %u@1%u@3He told them, %r@“%R@I%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%R@I%r@@%R@S%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@M%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@b%r@b%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@4In the temple the blind and lame came to him, and he healed them. %u@1%u@5The chief priests and the designated teachers%u@[%u@e%u@], seeing the wonders that he did and seeing the children going around shouting “Rescue us by the godsend!”, became indignant. %u@1%u@6They said to him, “Do you hear what they’re saying?” Jesus, in step with the conversation, replied, %r@“%R@Y%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@ %R@H%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@q%r@u%r@e%r@u%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@a%r@l%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@f%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@’%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@7Excusing himself from them, he exited the city, went to Bethany, and spent the night there.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8While returning to the city at dawn, he became hungry. %u@1%u@9Seeing a fig tree alongside the road, he went over to it and found that it had nothing within it except for leaves only, and, addressing it, said to it, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@u%r@i%r@t%r@—%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%r@ And right away the tree shriveled up. %u@2%u@0Seeing it, the disciples were amazed and were saying how the fig tree had shriveled up right away. %u@2%u@1Reacting to this, Jesus replied, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@:%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@u%r@b%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@B%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@’%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@3Having come to the temple, the chief priests and the councilmen%u@[%U@D%u@] approached him while he was teaching saying, “By what authority do you do these things? And who gave you this authority?” %u@2%u@4Jesus in his comeback answered, %r@“%R@C%r@o%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@:%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@s%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@q%r@u%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@s%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@ %R@J%r@o%r@h%r@n%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@p%r@t%r@i%r@s%r@m%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@?%r@” They were debating the matter amongst themselves saying, “If we say ‘from heaven’, then he’ll say, ‘Then why didn’t you believe in him?’. %u@2%u@6But if we say, ‘from mankind’, we’ll %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ to be afraid of the crowd since they consider John to be a prophet.” %u@2%u@7They put forth their reply and answered Jesus, “We don’t know.” And so his answer to them was, %r@“%R@N%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@”%R@N%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@?%r@ %R@A%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@w%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@.%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@r%r@!%r@’%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@E%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@W%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@w%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@?%r@” They said, “The first%u@[%u@f%u@].” Jesus said to them, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@—%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@”%R@L%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@o%r@g%r@y%r@.%r@ %R@A%r@n%r@ %r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@4%u@1They told him, “He’s going to cruelly annihilate those wicked men and lease the vineyard out to other farmers, ones who, when harvest time comes, will give him his produce.” %u@4%u@2Jesus said to them, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@%si~
%r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@j%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@:%r@%vp~
%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@.%r@%vp~

          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@”%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@o%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@(%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@i%r@g%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@j%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@(%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@)%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@u%r@m%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@(%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%R@I%r@@%R@G%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@j%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@)%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@z%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@G%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@”%vn~
          %u@4%u@5When the chief priests and Pharisees heard these analogies, they realized that he was talking about them. %u@4%u@6Though they were trying to get their hands on him, they were afraid of the crowd, since they considered him to be a prophet.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@-%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@f%i@t%i@-%i@s%i@p%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@…Lit: %i@m%i@e%i@e%i@k%i@.%i@ Ref. note of Matt. 5:5%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%I@R%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@s…Lit: %I@H%i@o%i@s%i@a%i@n%i@n%i@a, an Aramaic word.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@g%i@o%i@d%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@d…Lit: %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@D%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@d. Ref. Matt. 12:23. %fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@…Lit:%i@ %i@…%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@…Lit: %I@S%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@…This could also mean the older son or could mean the better of the two sons%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@…Lit: %i@m%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@c%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@e%i@c%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@…Lit: %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@…Lit: %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@u%i@i%i@t%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@c%i@r%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@m%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%u@ %i@s%i@o%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@-%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@m%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@Z%i@i%i@o%i@n. The %i@d%i@a%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@Z%i@i%i@o%i@n is a figure of speech which refers figuratively to the socialites in Jerusalem and the surrounding area , the ones who keep up on all the comings and goings, the ones who are apt to spread news. Zion is an alternate name used in the OT for Jerusalem, but Zion refers to the way that God intended Jerusalem to be, which is not what it degenerated into.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@m%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@k%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@l%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@a%i@l…Lit: %i@m%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@k%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@n. This is a figure of speech used in the OT where a fact is given as a statement and then repeated immediately after for effect in a second statement. Usually the repeated statement elaborates with detail omitted from the first statement and, if having to choose between the two, is the more accurate.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@…People regularly made the journey, some from great distances, to the Jerusalem temple to offer sacrifices there, doves in this case. Instead of carrying the sacrificial animal a great distance, it was more convenient to buy such animal on the spot. To do so they had to exchange their foreign currency for domestic. According to Moses’s law, they were supposed to offer up the best of their herds, etc. to God, which implied that they take such on the trip to Jerusalem.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@l%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e. Moses instituted a system where select representatives of the people formed a committee of elders which arbitrated disputes and settled legal cases for the nation.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%I@Y%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %I@S%i@i%i@r%i@!%i@…Lit: %I@I%i@,%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@!, which is short for, %I@H%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@,%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@! The GT expresses something like the German %I@J%i@a%i@w%i@o%i@h%i@l%i@! (pronounced %i@y%i@a%i@-%I@V%I@O%I@W%I@L), which one hears in old war movies when the underling at once straightens up, clicks the heels of his boots together, and receives the order with a firm response of “Jawohl!”%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@b%i@u%i@i%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@t%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@…In ancient Israel, vineyards had walls that had briars planted over them to keep out foxes and other critters—even thieves. The watchtower was a two-story lookout to spot foxes, and was also used as a storage cellar for the grapes and used as a temporary shelter for the workers. Without the fence, the winepress, and the watchtower, the vineyard’s yield would be too low for it to be profitable. Furthermore, it was common practice for an owner to lease out a vineyard to workers who would take a percentage of the harvest as payment.%fn~
This tale of the vineyard comes from Isaiah chapter 5. Jesus starts quoting from Isaiah 5, but as the parable progresses, he deviates from the tale and creates his own ending. %fn~
%u@[%U@G%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@(%i@m%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@b%i@e%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@)%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@(%i@m%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@m%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@)%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d …The fate of two types of unbelievers is described here. The first is the one who falls on the stone. Like other places in the NT, one who falls on a stone is a person who stumbles over a stumbling block. This person willfully and sinfully decides not to obey the Lord. The second type is the one on whom the stone falls upon. This person is one who is punished in a judgment from the Lord. This judgment is imposed on him.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Matthew Chapter 22%hb~
          %u@1As he had been thinking things over for a while, Jesus again spoke to them by way of analogy. He said, %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@”%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@(%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@)%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@o%r@g%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@e%r@w%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@d%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@p%r@a%r@t%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@m%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@d%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@A%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@T%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@e%r@s%r@:%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@n%r@q%r@u%r@e%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@l%r@a%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@.%r@ %R@C%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@d%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@O%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@e%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@f%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@r%r@m%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@f%r@a%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@a%r@b%r@b%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@s%r@a%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@r%r@i%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@i%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@n%r@i%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@W%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@d%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@v%r@i%r@t%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@q%r@u%r@a%r@l%r@i%r@f%r@y%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@-%r@r%r@a%r@m%r@p%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@-%r@r%r@a%r@m%r@p%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@d%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@T%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@d%r@d%r@i%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@d%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@w%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@e%r@r%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@c%r@c%r@a%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@T%r@a%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@H%r@e%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@’%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@d%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@A%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@?%r@’%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@e%r@c%r@h%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@T%r@i%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@e%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@u%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %R@D%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@n%r@a%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@w%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@l%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%u@%vn~
          %u@1%u@5The Pharisees then met together to come up with a plan to find a way to trip him up in one of his statements. %u@1%u@6They sent him their disciples along with the Herodians saying,%vn~
      “Teacher, we know that you’re honest and that what you teach is the true way to God and that you could care less what anyone thinks about you%u@[%u@d%u@]; the fact is, you don’t key off other people’s attitudes%u@[%u@e%u@]. %u@1%u@7Tell us, now, what do you think? Do we have to pay Caesar the poll tax or not?”%vn~
          %u@1%u@8Knowing how evil they were, Jesus said, %r@“%R@H%r@y%r@p%r@o%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@s%r@—%r@w%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@S%r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@x%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@.%r@”%vn~
      They brought him a denarius.%vn~
          %u@2%u@0On top of the situation, he said, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@i%r@c%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@t%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@?%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@1They, keeping up with the conversation, said to him, “Caesar’s.”%vn~
      Then not missing a beat, he said, %r@“%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %R@C%r@a%r@e%r@s%r@a%r@r%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@C%r@a%r@e%r@s%r@a%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2After they heard that, they were stunned and departed, leaving him there.%vn~
          %u@2%u@3Around that time%u@[%u@g%u@], the Sadducees, who state that there is no life after death%u@[%u@h%u@], asked him, %u@2%u@4“Teacher, the Old Testament Law%u@[%u@i%u@] says, ‘If someone who has no children were to die, his brother will marry his wife and raise offspring for his brother.’ %u@2%u@5Now there were%u@[%u@j%u@] seven brothers, and the first was married and died, not having any offspring, his wife was left to his brother. %u@2%u@6The same happened to the second brother, then to the third, and so on, up to the seventh. %u@2%u@7Last of all, the woman died. %u@2%u@8Therefore, in the next life, to which of the seven %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s will this woman be married to, since all of the brothers had married her?” %u@2%u@9Jesus answered them, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@-%r@b%r@a%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@x%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@l%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@’%R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@A%r@b%r@r%r@a%r@h%r@a%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@s%r@a%r@a%r@c%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@J%r@a%r@c%r@o%r@b%r@.%r@’%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@3%u@3The crowd heard this and was amazed at his explanation.%vn~
          %u@3%u@4Now after the Pharisees heard that he’d left the Sadducees speechless, they met together for the same reason. %u@3%u@5Testing him, one of their experts in Old Testament commandments asked him, %u@3%u@6”Teacher, which of the Old Testament commandments is the greatest?” %u@3%u@7He said, %r@“%r@’%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@’%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@m%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@m%r@i%r@l%r@a%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@b%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@T%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@m%r@m%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@z%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@w%r@o%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@4%u@1While the Pharisees were gathered, Jesus asked them, %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@”%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@a%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@?%r@ %R@W%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@c%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@?%r@”%r@ Following along with the conversation, they said, “David’s.” %u@4%u@3Also following along, he said, %r@“%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@D%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@%vn~
%r@%si~
%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@”%R@A%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@-%r@p%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@f%r@u%r@l%r@ %R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@,%r@%vp~
%R@B%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@-%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@%vp~
%R@U%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %R@I%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@b%r@d%r@u%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@e%r@m%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@b%r@j%r@u%r@g%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@%vp~
%r@%si~
%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@”%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %R@D%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@c%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@4%u@6No one could come up with a reply, nor from that day on did anyone dare question him about anything.%nn~
