%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@a%i@h%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@-%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t or %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d. In other words, assume the position and authority as my chief executive, the highest under me%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%I@U%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@d%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@e%i@m%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@j%i@u%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@…Lit: %I@U%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@e%i@m%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@.%i@ An idiom used throughout the Bible.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@d%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@…Throughout the Bible, clothes are symbolic of righteousness, one’s standing before God. One who is clothed properly has right standing before God. This is what Jesus is referring to here. There is a righteousness that man attempts on his own and a righteousness which God provides. Man’s righteousness is his own clothing, and, in this parable, his own clothing is not the proper attire for a wedding. The only attire which is proper for a wedding is that which God provides, His wedding outfit. The bad folk in v.10 who were invited were given the proper clothing to wear, meaning that they received a righteousness given by God, and therefore were not thrown out of the wedding.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@v%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@w%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@w%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@n. From the repetition of words in this passage, it’s clear that Jesus in this verse is referring to the ones who have been invited to the wedding. In other words, the %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ in v.14 here specifically refers to those invited in v.3. The chosen refers to those who in v.8 qualify (are worthy). Jesus is saying that many are invited to the wedding but only a few show up and are dressed properly when they do. In that light, God is not arbitrarily choosing a few out of the many, but lays down simple, easy requirements that only a few will comply with.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Matthew Chapter 23%hb~
          %u@1Then Jesus had a talk with the crowd and his disciples, %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@b%r@e%r@s%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@g%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@—%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@P%r@h%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@r%r@u%r@c%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@b%r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@m%r@i%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@y%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@a%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@g%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@—%r@t%r@o%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@y%r@—%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@,%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@A%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@d%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@E%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@n%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@g%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@y%r@n%r@a%r@g%r@o%r@g%r@u%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@e%r@t%r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@‘%R@R%r@a%r@b%r@b%r@i%r@’%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@‘%R@R%r@a%r@b%r@b%r@i%r@’%r@;%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %R@R%r@a%r@b%r@b%r@i%r@—%r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@-%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@-%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@—%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@‘%R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@;%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@‘%R@L%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@;%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@C%r@h%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@a%r@l%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@a%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@;%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@”%R@W%r@o%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %R@S%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@b%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@P%r@h%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@e%r@s%r@!%r@ %R@H%r@y%r@p%r@o%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@s%r@!%r@—%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@o%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@(%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@)%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@;%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@%vn~

          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%r@”%R@J%r@e%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@a%r@l%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %R@J%r@e%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@a%r@l%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@i%r@t%r@i%r@z%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@T%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@—%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@u%r@n%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@g%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@q%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@P%r@r%r@a%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@.%r@’%r@”%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@%vn~

%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@u%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@…Lit: %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@o%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@r%u@]%I@P%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@t …This is a verbatim quote of the middle of 21:9%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@a%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@—%i@t%i@o%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@y%i@—%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s…In this metaphor, Jesus compares the commandments which the Scribes and Pharisees give to placing a yoke on an ox for the ox to pull a heavy load.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@p%i@h%i@y%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s…These are small boxes containing small scrolls which are tied to the arm and the forehead. These are used as a literal application of verses such as Deut. 6:8, for one. Tassels are mentioned in verses such as Num. 15:38–39 and Deut. 22:12. Jesus, in fact, wore tassels himself.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@-%i@w%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@m%i@b%i@s%i@…Touching the body of a dead person is an act of uncleanness to the Jews. Therefore, their sepulchers (tombs) were painted white to warn of the uncleanness on the inside.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Matthew Chapter 24%hb~
          %u@1Having exited the temple, Jesus was going about his way, and his disciples went over to him to point out what a monumental achievement it was to build the temple. %u@2Jesus responded to them by saying, %r@“%R@S%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@?%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@—%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@f%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@p%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@3When he took a seat on the Mount of Olives, his disciples came alone and said, “Tell us when these things will take place and what will be the sign of your appearance at the finale of the ages?” %u@4Jesus replied, %r@“%R@M%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@a%r@r%r@m%r@e%r@d%r@;%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@.%r@ %R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@”%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@‘%r@a%r@b%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %u@[%u@t%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@o%i@p%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@…Lit: %i@e%i@a%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@u%i@n%i@k%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@u%u@]%i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s…Lit: %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@v%u@]%i@w%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@n%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@…Ref. note in Matt. 8:12.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@y…Verse 14 says that the proclamation of the gospel at the time will be like a person testifying in the old Jewish court of law, where guilt or innocence was determined by testimonies given, and not by a judge or a jury. The evidence will be laid out undeniably for all people in the world, whose only just verdict—based on the evidence presented—is to believe that Jesus is the Christ.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@u%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@r%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e…This is a parenthetical note to the reader (referred to here as the “deacon”). The deacon reads scrolls out loud to the congregation during church services; those in the congregation did not read scrolls themselves, even at home. Matthew’s note here is given to the deacon, with the intention that the deacon read this note to himself ahead of time before the Scripture reading in front of the congregation, and do some research on what the abomination of desolation is, to refresh himself on Daniel’s prophecies, and complete this research before the reading. Then the deacon, when he reached this verse while reading to the congregation, would pause reading the scroll and explain to the congregation in his own words the details of Daniel’s prophecy, then continue.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e…Lit: %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@o%i@f%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e. Ancient Israeli houses used their roofs as porches. What Jesus is saying is to take the quick way down off the roof of the house, which is the ladder on the outside of the house, rather than the slower way down, which is the stairs or ladders on the inside of the house, and while going through the house pick up some belongings. This is a figure of speech, akin to a hyperbole. In reality, those warned to flee would have two minutes or so—but only two minutes—to gather some belongings for the road, get the kids, unhitch the donkey, and get out of there. This is the point Jesus is making.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@f%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@s…It’ll be difficult for a pregnant woman to flee quickly and thereafter travel at a fast pace, since, obviously, pregnant women can’t march easily. Women with infants (breastfeeding women) will have difficulty because there’ll be a limited amount of food to eat compounded by the calories burned while travelling at a fast clip. Such women won’t be able to produce as much milk in these conditions. Furthermore, children who are still breastfeeding likely are still in diapers, and infants are more difficult to carry around on a backpack too, or the like. But it seems that Jesus is using examples of women in a figure of speech, to represent anyone who would have difficulty fleeing…the elderly, the bedridden, the lame, etc.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@h, which consists of not only Saturdays but a myriad of Jewish holidays. Also, bear in mind that the Israeli growing season is in the winter, not in the summer. This begs the question, just why would flight in either the winter time or on Sabbaths and holidays be difficult? The likely answer is that during both of these times, there’s no previously stored food available which can be taken in a hurry for the trip to the mountains. While one must store away food in the off season to eat, when the crops are growing, you’ve already eaten through your cache. Likewise, with the Sabbaths the Jews did all their preparations for the Sabbath on the day before, and didn’t have any bread baked, etc. on the Sabbath day itself, so a there’d be no fresh bread available for the road.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@y%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@…%i@b%i@e%i@d%i@r%i@o%i@o%i@m%i@…Ref 3:1 %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s…%i@c%i@l%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@t. This word closet is the same word Jesus used in 6:6, where he told us to go into a closet and pray in secret. It’s no coincidence that these places are repeated in v.26; the countryside, where John the Baptist was, is a place of self-denial, of fasting, of repentance. The bedroom (closet) is a place of prayer. Both of these are like places for false Messiah’s to appear, as they’d be either fasting or praying.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Matthew Chapter 25%hb~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@”%R@A%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@i%r@l%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@u%r@d%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@a%r@s%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@d%r@d%r@i%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@m%r@p%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@l%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@z%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@I%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@d%r@d%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@H%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@o%r@m%r@!%r@ %R@G%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@!%r@’%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@i%r@m%r@m%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@m%r@p%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@u%r@p%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@u%r@d%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@G%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@i%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@m%r@p%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@u%r@d%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@p%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@’%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@W%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@d%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@F%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@S%r@i%r@r%r@,%r@ %R@S%r@i%r@r%r@—%r@o%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@s%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@C%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@e%r@q%r@u%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@l%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@.%r@%vn~

%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@…Lit: %i@v%i@i%i@r%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@s. These are young ladies in their late teens to early twenties, women eligible for marriage but not married yet.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%I@C%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@b%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@…Lit: %I@E%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@.%i@ An idiom; ref. note of Acts 19:8.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@t%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@p%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m…Lit: %I@F%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@;%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@w%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@n%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@…Ref. note in Matt. 8:12%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n%i@…Lit: %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n. Ref. note in Matt. 8:20%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y. The awkward wording is a figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@s…Lit: %i@h%i@i%i@s %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@s%i@%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@m%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@o%i@m…The virgins waiting to greet the groom as he comes are part of the ancient Jewish marriage ritual. Often the groom was late in coming; not being prepared for this contingency was foolish. Not having these virgins there to greet the groom, lamps in hand, is somewhat analogous to bridesmaids not showing up at the wedding because their dresses weren’t ready. If one can imagine the fury a bride would have if some of her bridesmaids didn’t show up, this is the same anger the groom has here.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@o%i@y%i@e%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@l%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@s; %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@s. Some liberty taken in using %i@e%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@o%i@y%i@e%i@e%i@s%i@ instead of %i@s%i@l%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ as slavery in the form that it existed at that time is too foreign for us to relate too. In the institution of slavery as it existed in the 19%u@t%u@h century, a master would’ve never entrusted slaves like the master did in this parable, nor would 19%u@t%u@h century slaves been able to transact business in their master’s stead.%i@%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@$%i@4%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@…The actual quantity of silver was five talents, two talents, and one talent. One talent weighed 71lbs (32.3kg). Ref. conversion note in Matt. 18:28. 1, which specifies in today’s dollars, for an industrialized nation, $25/gram of silver. Therefore, the equivalent purchasing power of these amounts are valued at $4 million for five talents, $1.6 million for two talents, and $800,000 for one talent.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@…In the GT, the words here are %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ and %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@ are used. These are usually translated %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ and %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d. The right hand indicates favor with Jesus; the left symbolizes disfavor.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@t. Ref. note of Luke 10:25.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Matthew Chapter 26%hb~
          %u@1When Jesus finished up all these messages, he said to his disciples, %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@”%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@P%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@w%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@u%r@c%r@i%r@f%r@i%r@x%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@” %u@3At that time, the chief priests and the councilmen%u@[%u@b%u@] held a council in the courtyard of the High Priest Caiaphas. %u@4In that council, they decided that they must get ahold of Jesus and kill him. %u@5They kept saying, “Not in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@d%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f the festival, lest the people riot.”%vn~
          %u@6While Jesus was in Bethany in the house of Simon the Leper, %u@7a woman came to him with a jar of expensive myrrh and poured it all out on his head while he was sitting at the table%u@[%u@c%u@]. %u@8Seeing this, the disciples were enraged saying, “Why the waste? %u@9We could’ve sold this for a lot of money and given %i@t%i@h%i@e %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@c%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@s to the poor.” %u@1%u@0Aware of this, Jesus told them, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@?%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@f%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@l%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@r%r@r%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@m%r@b%r@a%r@l%r@m%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@—%r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@w%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@c%r@l%r@a%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@s%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@m%r@b%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@4Then one of the Twelve named Judas Iscariot went to the high priest %u@1%u@5and said, “How much would you pay for me to betray him, getting him handed over into your custody%u@[%u@f%u@]?” They agreed to a price of $10,000%u@[%U@A%u@]. %u@1%u@6From then on he began to look for an opportunity to facilitate his arrest by betrayal.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7On the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the disciples said to Jesus, “How would you like us to make Passover preparations for you?” %u@1%u@8He said, %r@“%R@G%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@-%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@-%r@s%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@T%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@c%r@i%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@b%r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@P%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@”%r@.%r@’%r@”%r@ %u@1%u@9The disciples did what Jesus told them to do and made preparations for the Passover. %u@2%u@0When evening came, he was at the table%u@[%u@c%u@] with the Twelve. %u@2%u@1While they were eating, he said, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@—%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@2Being deeply grieved, they started telling him over and over, each one of them, “No way it’s me, right Lord?” %u@2%u@3He came up with a reply and said, “%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@W%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@a%r@j%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@f%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %R@S%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@5Judas, his betrayer, responded, “No way it’s me, right Teacher%u@[%U@C%u@]?” Jesus, engaged by the remark, said, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@6While they were eating, Jesus took a loaf of bread, offered up thanksgiving, and broke it%u@[%u@j%u@] and gave it to his disciples and said, %r@“%R@T%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@7He took a cup, offered up thanksgiving, and gave it to them saying, %r@“%R@A%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@—%r@d%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@:%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@I%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@r%r@m%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@f%r@i%r@n%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@d%r@u%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@e%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@.%r@” %u@3%u@0After they sang some hymns, they departed for the Mount of Olives.%vn~
          %u@3%u@1Then Jesus said to them, %r@“%R@A%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@n%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@%vn~
%r@%si~
%r@“%R@I%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@r%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@d%r@,%r@%vp~
%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@o%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@c%r@a%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@%vp~
%r@%si~
%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@”%R@A%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@h%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@G%r@a%r@l%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@e%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@3%u@3Peter responded to the statement and replied, “Even if everyone else falls out with you, I never will.” %u@3%u@4Jesus said to him, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@n%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@” %u@3%u@5Peter, in line with what he’d been told, said to him, “Even if I have to die together with you, I’ll definitely not deny you.” All the other disciples said the same thing.%nn~
          %u@3%u@6Then Jesus went with them to a place called Gethsemane and prompts the disciples, %r@“%R@S%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@3%u@7Taking along Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, he began to be grieved and to be in anguish. %u@3%u@8Engaging them in conversation, he said to them, %r@“%R@M%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@:%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@3%u@9He ventured out a bit and fell on his face in prayer saying, %r@“%R@M%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ sleeping, and he, sizing things up, said to Peter, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@g%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %u@4%u@2Again, a second time, he went out to pray saying, %r@“%R@M%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@(%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@)%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@.%r@” %u@4%u@3He came again and found them sleeping, as their eyelids had grown heavy. %u@4%u@4Leaving them again, he went out to pray, saying the same thing for the third time. %u@4%u@5Then he went to his disciples and, continuing to engage them, said, %r@“%R@H%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@l%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@?%r@…%R@S%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@—%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@G%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@!%r@—%R@L%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@!%r@ %R@M%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@!%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@4%u@7While he was still speaking, at once Judas, one of the Twelve, arrived with a large crowd, with swords and clubs, %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t from the high priest and the councilmen. %u@4%u@8His betrayer arranged %i@a%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e a signal saying, “Whomever I kiss, he’s the one; seize him.” %u@4%u@9He went straight over to Jesus and said, “Delighted %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u, Teacher%u@[%U@D%u@]!”%u@[%u@m%u@], and kissed him cordially” %u@5%u@0Jesus said to him, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@o%r@ %r@(%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@)%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@?%r@” They then went over and laid their hands on Jesus and apprehended him.%vn~
          %u@5%u@1And, like that, one of the people who were with Jesus drew his sword and struck the high priest’s slave, slicing his ear off. %u@5%u@2Then Jesus said to him, %r@“%R@P%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@;%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@a%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@O%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@p%r@p%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@w%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@g%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@l%r@s%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@T%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@u%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@?%r@” %u@5%u@5At that hour Jesus said to the crowd, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@r%r@e%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@s%r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@u%r@b%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@u%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %R@D%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@i%r@z%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@A%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@O%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@T%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@” Then all the disciples abandoned him and began to flee.%vn~
          %u@5%u@7They took Jesus into custody and led him to the high priest Caiaphas, where the designated teachers%u@[%u@q%u@] and councilmen had gathered. %u@5%u@8Peter followed him at a distance all the way to the high priest’s courtyard and entered it and sat with the attendants in order to see how things would turn out. %u@5%u@9The high priests and the entire Council%u@[%U@E%u@] were trying to find those who would give false, compelling testimony%u@[%U@F%u@] under oath against Jesus, so that they could have him killed, %u@6%u@0and, while many were stepping forward and saying phony things in court, they couldn’t find any. But finally two came forward %u@6%u@1and said, ”This is the guy who said, ‘I can tear down God’s temple and build it back up in three days’ time’.” %u@6%u@2The high priest stood up and said to him, “You have nothing to say in response?” %u@6%u@3But Jesus kept silent. The high priest said to him, “For the love of God%u@[%u@r%u@], I charge you to testify here before us if you are the Messiah, the Christ, the Son of God.” %u@6%u@4Jesus, in full awareness, told them, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@ %R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@:%r@ %R@F%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@-%r@p%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@f%r@u%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@-%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@o%r@u%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@k%r@y%r@’%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@G%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@6%u@5Then the high priest got unglued and in a rage starting breaking things,%u@[%U@H%u@] all the while saying, “He %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t blasphemed! Why do we need to hear any more testimony? You all heard him blaspheme here! %u@6%u@6What have you decided?” They replied, “We sentence him to death.” %u@6%u@7They then spat in his face and beat him. They slapped him while %u@6%u@8saying, “Prophesy for us, Messiah: who slapped you?”%vn~
          %u@6%u@9Now Peter was sitting outside in the courtyard. One of the teen servant-girls went up to him and said, “Weren’t you with Jesus of Galilee too?” %u@7%u@0He denied it in front of everyone saying, “I don’t know what you’re talking about.” %u@7%u@1After he left through the entrance gate, another servant girl saw him and told those nearby, “This fellow was with Jesus of Nazareth.” %u@7%u@2Again he denied it, swearing, “I don’t know the man.” %u@7%u@3A little while later, those who were standing %i@n%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@b%i@y%i@ confronted Peter, “Seriously—you too are one of them, since you too talk with the same accent.” %u@7%u@4Then he began to cuss and swear up and down, “I don’t know the man.” Immediately a rooster crowed. %u@7%u@5And Peter remembered what Jesus had said, that before a rooster sounded off he would deny him three times, and he left that place weeping bitterly.%vn~

%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@…Lit: %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@a%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@,%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@…Also: %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u; %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@d%i@y; %i@a%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@j%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@f%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@S%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@…Lit: %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@b%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@…Lit: %i@w%i@o%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@…Lit: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d. Possibly also rendered, %I@Y%i@a%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r, or, %I@W%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y, or, %I@I%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@?, or, %I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@…Ref. note in Matt. 14:19%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@…Also: %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@l…Lit: %i@c%i@u%i@p%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%I@D%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@,%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@!%i@…Lit: %I@J%i@o%i@y%i@,%i@ %I@R%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@i%i@!%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@b%i@r%i@o%i@ %i@(%i@s%i@p%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@r%i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@)%i@…Lit: %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@.%i@ The definition is more akin to %i@c%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@g%i@u%i@e. Rendered %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@ to convey sarcasm, not to be cheeky. Only found three times in the NT (all in Matt: here, Matt. 20:13; 22:12), and because of this the meaning is influenced by  how it’s used in the other two places. Used confrontationally in 20:13; used sarcastically in 22:12. I chose a sarcastic usage.%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@u%i@g%i@…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@b%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@t%i@s%i@’%i@ %I@S%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@r%u@]%I@F%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@j%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@$%i@1%i@0%i@,%i@0%i@0%i@0…The GT says “thirty pieces of silver”. It’s fair to assume that these pieces of silver are shekels. By coincidence or not, this is the price of a slave specified in Exod. 21:32. If each shekel contained 14 grams of silver, and if in today’s equivalent purchasing power silver would be priced at $25/gram (ref. note in Matt. 18:28), then that’s 420g of silver or approximately $10,000.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@W%i@h%i@o%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@a%i@s%i@t…Raising a glass to offer a toast is a loose analogy in our modern world of the actual ancient tradition; the GT actually reads, %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@p%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@e. Dipping hands in the dish was an ancient custom done during meals where one person dips a piece of bread into a dish containing olive oil or something and put it into a fellow diner’s mouth. It’s a celebration of fellowship. This is a bit like our tradition at a wedding or some place, where a couple locks arms and each drinks from a champagne glass that the other is holding.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@r. %I@O%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ is a NT expression (also used in Gal. 2:5). The word %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ itself is used idiomatically this way throughout the NT. As such, %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ is not to be taken exactly.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%I@T%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@…Lit: %I@R%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@i. The Aramaic word for %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r is used here, whereas the Gk. word for %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ is used in v.18. This contrast emphasizes Judas’s false reverence and deceit.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@C%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@l…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@r%i@i%i@n. The Sanhedrin were a ruling council of Jewish elders that constituted a high court%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@y…The testimony of two or three witnesses (Deut. 19:15) in an ancient Israeli law court was required for conviction. Their court proceedings relied on witnesses instead of material evidence.%fn~
%u@[%U@G%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@-%i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@-%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@k%i@y…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@k%i@i%i@e%i@s. This is a conglomeration of Ps. 110:1 and Dan. 7:13. Also, the phrase %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@ is a figure of speech. Also ref. Matt. 22:44.%fn~
%u@[%U@H%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@g%i@l%i@u%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s…Lit: %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g. Liberties taken. Tearing of one’s clothing is an ancient Israeli custom seen throughout the OT. It is symbolic of an inner fury, rage, resolve, or repentance. %fn~
%i@%sb~
Matthew Chapter 27%hb~
          %u@1At the break of day, all of the high priests and the councilmen%u@[%u@a%u@] met in a council %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ against Jesus in order to have him killed. %u@2They tied him up, transferred him to the governor Pilate, and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@b%i@y placed him in his custody.%vn~
          %u@3Then the traitor Judas, seeing that he was condemned, changed his mind and returned the thirty coins%u@[%u@b%u@] to the high priests and the councilmen %u@4saying, “It’s a sin to betray the blood of an innocent man.” They said, “What do we care? That’s your problem.” %u@5He tossed the money into the collection box for the temple fund%u@[%U@A%u@], departed, and went out and hung himself. %u@6The chief priests took the money and said, “We’re not allowed to put this into the temple fund, since it’s a blood payment.” %u@7They had a meeting over it, took the money, and bought the potter’s field%u@[%U@B%u@] with it, to be used as a graveyard for foreigners. %u@8For this reason, that field’s called the Blood Field nowadays. %u@9Only then was the Prophet Jeremiah’s prophecy fulfilled, which says,%vn~
%si~
And they took the thirty-coin payment%vp~
The price that had been paid by the ultimate Israelites%u@[%U@C%u@]%vp~
%u@1%u@0And they paid for the potter’s field%vp~
According to the arrangements made by my Lord%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@1Now Jesus was made to appear before the governor, and the governor, in his inquisition, asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?” Jesus answered, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@” %u@1%u@2He made no defense against the accusations put forth by the chief priests and councilmen. %u@1%u@3Then Pilate, continuing with the questioning, said to him, “Don’t you hear how severe the charges are that they’re accusing you of?” %u@1%u@4He wouldn’t say a word in reply; as a result, the governor was stupefied.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5According to a holiday custom, the governor would release one prisoner, any prisoner that the crowd wanted. %u@1%u@6At that time they had %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d a notorious prisoner named Barabbas. %u@1%u@7While they were conferring amongst themselves, Pilate took the opportunity to say to them, “Who do you want me to set free, Barabbas or Jesus, who’s called the Messiah?”, %u@1%u@8since he knew that it was because of their jealousy that they’d handed him over to him. %u@1%u@9While he was there presiding as judge,%u@[%u@d%u@] his wife sent him word saying, “Don’t get mixed up with that do-gooder%u@[%u@e%u@], since I’ve been really upset all day because of a dream I had about him.” %u@2%u@0But the chief priests and the councilmen persuaded the crowd to ask for Barabbas, so that Jesus would be disposed of. %u@2%u@1Having considered the matter, the governor said to them,%vn~
      “Which of these two do you want me to set free?”%vn~
      They said, “Barabbas!”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2Not quitting, Pilate said, “What shall I do then with Jesus, who’s called the Messiah?” %vn~
      But making no difference, they all said, “Let him be crucified!”%vn~
          %u@2%u@3He said, “Just what has he done wrong?”%vn~
      But they began to yell louder and louder, “Let him be crucified!”%vn~
%u@2%u@4Seeing that nothing was helping, but instead a riot was forming, he took some water and washed his hands in it in front of the crowd saying, “Don’t blame me for this %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@’%i@s blood; it’s your problem%u@ now%u@[%u@f%u@].” %u@2%u@5And everyone in the crowd responded, “Let the blame fall on us and our children!%u@[%u@g%u@]” %u@2%u@6Then he set Barabbas free, but he flogged Jesus and handed him over to be crucified.%nn~
          %u@2%u@7Then the governor’s soldiers took Jesus to where the governor’s palace guard assembled, and the entire unit %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@g%i@u%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s descended on him. %u@2%u@8They stripped his clothes from him and put a red soldier’s cloak around him, %u@2%u@9and they wove a crown of thorns and placed it on his head and put a stick%u@[%u@h%u@] in his right hand, and they got down on their knees in front of him and toyed with him saying, “Delighted %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u,%u@[%u@i%u@] King of the Jews.” %u@3%u@0They spat on him and took the stick and began to hit his head. %u@3%u@1When they were finished making fun of him, they took the cloak off him, put his clothes back on him, and led him forth to crucifixion.%vn~
          %u@3%u@2While heading out, they found a man from Cyrene named Simon, and they conscripted this fellow to bear his cross. %u@3%u@3Having arrived at a place called Golgotha, which is called the Skull Place, %u@3%u@4they gave him wine mixed with a bitter spice%u@[%u@j%u@] to drink, and when he tasted it, he didn’t want to drink %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@t. %u@3%u@5So they crucified him, rolled dice%u@[%u@k%u@] to divvy up his clothes, %u@3%u@6took a seat, and proceeded to keep track of him there. %u@3%u@7They put a sign indicating the reason %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@x%i@i%i@o%i@n over his head which read, “This is Jesus, King of the Jews.” %u@3%u@8At that time, there were two thugs%u@[%u@l%u@] crucified with him, one to the right of him and one to the left of him. %u@3%u@9Those who came by reviled him, nodding their heads %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@h %u@4%u@0and saying, “The one who’ll %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@l%i@y destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days…Save yourself, if you’re God’s son…Let him come down from the cross.” %u@4%u@1In the same way, the chief priests, along with the designated teachers%u@[%u@m%u@] and the Pharisees, taunted him saying over and over, %u@4%u@2”He rescued others but he can’t rescue himself…So, he’s the King of Israel…Let’s see him come down from the cross now, and we’ll believe in him…%u@4%u@3He placed his trust in God; let Him rescue him now if He wants him, since he said that he’s God’s son.” %u@4%u@4Likewise, the thugs who were selected to be crucified with him insulted him.%vn~
          %u@4%u@5Starting at noon, darkness came over the whole earth, lasting until three in the afternoon. %u@4%u@6Around three, Jesus cried out in a loud voice, %r@“%R@E%r@l%r@i%r@,%r@ %R@E%r@l%r@i%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@m%r@a%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@b%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@i%r@?%r@”, which is, %r@“%R@M%r@y%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@?%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@D%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@”%r@ %u@4%u@7Some who were standing there and who heard it were saying over and over, “He’s calling for Elijah.” %u@4%u@8Immediately, one of them ran and fetched a sponge fully soaked with vinegar wine%u@[%U@E%u@], put it on a stick, and gave it to him to drink. %u@4%u@9The rest of the people there proceeded to say, “Let’s see if Elijah comes and saves him.” %u@5%u@0Again Jesus cried out in a loud voice and gave up the ghost%u@[%u@n%u@]. %u@5%u@1And—just like that—the temple curtain%u@[%U@F%u@] was torn in two from top to bottom, the rocks were shaken, %u@5%u@2and the tombs%u@[%U@G%u@] were opened up and many faithful believers who had died were resurrected%u@[%u@o%u@], %u@5%u@3and with his resurrection left the tombs and went into the holy city and appeared to lots of people. %u@5%u@4The captain of the guard and those who were keeping track of Jesus with him, seeing the earthquake and all the things that had happened, became really frightened, saying, “This guy really was the embodiment of a son of God%u@[%u@p%u@].” %u@5%u@5Now there were many women there who came to watch %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@f%i@a%i@i%i@r from a distance, some of whom had been Jesus’s followers from the Galilean days, attending to him. %u@5%u@6Among them was Mary Magdalene, James’s and Joseph’s mother Mary, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.%vn~
          %u@5%u@7At sunset a rich man from Arimathea named Joseph, who himself had also been discipled by Jesus—%u@5%u@8This fellow approached Pilate and asked for Jesus’s body. Pilate then ordered for it to be given away. %u@5%u@9Joseph took the body and wrapped it in clean linen, %u@6%u@0placed it in his newly-made tomb, which had been hewn into the rock, rolled a huge stone over to the tomb’s entrance, and left. %u@6%u@1Now, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary sat down across from the tomb.%vn~
          %u@6%u@2That night%u@[%u@q%u@], which is a day of preparation %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@a%i@l%u@[%U@H%u@], the chief priests and the Pharisees got together and went to Pilate %u@6%u@3and said, “Sir, we remember what that grifter said while he was still alive, that he would be resurrected after three days. %u@6%u@4Therefore, give the order that the tomb be kept secure under guard %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w until the third day %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@s, lest his disciples come and steal his body%u@[%u@r%u@]%u@ and tell the people, “He rose from the dead”; a final such deception would be worse than any deceiving he did before%u@[%u@s%u@].” %u@6%u@5Pilate said to them, “You’ll get your guard; go out and secure it the best you know how.” %u@6%u@6So they went and secured the tomb, having fortified the rock as it stood against the entrance.%vn~
