%u@[%u@r%u@]%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@u%i@t%i@y%i@…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@s%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@u%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@t%u@]%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@…%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@…In v. 42 %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ are the same Gk. words used in Matt. 18:6; ref. note from there. Also, in v. 43 and onwards, the word %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@ is the same word as %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@;%i@ note of Matt. 18:6 also applies.%fn~
%u@[%u@u%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@.%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d…Or: %I@A%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d. It’s possible that v. 50 is the direct object of the sentence in v. 49, however Luke 14:34 suggests that it’s not.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@H%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@u%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%u@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m…This is an uninterrupted thought from the end of the eighth chapter (Mark 8:39)%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@a%i@m%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@n%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@a%i@m%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@n%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@h. In the GT, two rhyming words are used for %i@f%i@o%i@a%i@m%i@s %i@a%i@n%i@d %i@g%i@n%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@s: %i@a%i@p%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@d%i@z%i@a%i@y %i@k%i@a%i@i%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@d%i@z%i@a%i@y%i@ (ἀφρίζει καὶ τρίζει) (ἀφρίζει /Strong’s 875), (καὶ /Strong’s 2532), (τρίζει/Strong’s 5149). This rhyme or assonance presents a reasonable depiction of the truth (but not necessarily 100% accuracy) in an idiomatic expression. Similar to this, in English we say: wear and tear; hem and haw; whoop and holler; slip and slide.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@i%i@d%i@, %i@t%i@u%i@c%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@s %i@(%i@d%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@)%i@ %i@u%i@p. Same Gk. word used in Matt. 12:9 when describing the man with the shriveled hand. The boy became like a plant, a vegetable, or some other once-living object that shrivels up when it has dried out. When something like this dries out, it becomes stiff, shrinks in size, and tends to curl up upon itself in a ball of a sort.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r%i@…Or: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r. Some manuscripts say %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@.%i@ The word %i@f%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ was added decades or centuries after Mark wrote his original manuscript. A similar insertion was made in 1 Cor. 7:5. There is no other NT reference that casting out evil spirits is contingent on fasting. Such false manuscript insertions (Mark 9:29, 1 Cor. 7:5, Matt. 6:13, Mark 9:44) follow a pattern: years after the NT books were written, a few religious-minded folks read such passages and felt that God’s Word was not severe enough, or pious enough, or austere enough; or fearful of evil forces enough, and needed them to doctor it a bit.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%I@P%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@s…Lit: %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d. By using the present tense here in %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r, Jesus is summarizing a series or collection of events that will stretch out over days, and not just happen in minutes. %fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%I@I%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@n%i@s…Lit: %I@F%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e [i.e. reputation], %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t, …Interpreting this statement literally makes no sense, because of the disagreement in plurality, specifically that one cup of water is being offered to “you all”: several people. This leads to the conclusion that the Gk. phrase for giving a cup of water is an idiomatic expression, the meaning of which is obvious. In addition, there is some disagreement in the manuscripts for the words %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e (or, as others assume, %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e). Some manuscripts have changed %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ to %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@. The significance of this is to highlight the ambiguity of the meaning of this phrase. As such, a secondary translation of %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ was chosen, one found in the OT: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n. This clarifies the ambiguity.%fn~
%u@[%U@G%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@f%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t…Lit: %I@W%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t. Some manuscripts erroneously copied this over to vv. 44 and 46. Ref. note of v.41. In any case, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@m here is a plural adjective modifying a singular noun; therefore, the “worm” referred to here is likely a bodily ailment, a parasitic infestation of worms, something like tapeworms or roundworms (ascariasis). In his short description of hell in v. 48, Jesus says that those in hell have worm infestations on the inside and are surrounded by fire on the outside. As the symptoms of a worm infestation include (but are not limited to) nausea, diarrhea, abdominal pain, a lack of appetite, weight loss, general weakness, Jesus was saying that those in hell experience these symptoms.%fn~
%u@[%U@H%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@l %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@e%i@d…Or: %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@e. Verses 49 and 50 are ambiguous. For v. 49, some manuscripts read, %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@.%i@ Though this alternate reading has been rejected as spurious, the authors’ instincts for the true interpretation of these verses should not be. Therefore, the assumption is that v. 49 speaks of meats being seasoned with salt while being roasted, with salt added as a preservative. Verse 50 reads, %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@d%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s. This becomes a metaphor; believers are compared to a hunk of meat which is roasted over a fire, having salt applied to them. After the roasting is complete, they have the salt in themselves, which means that they have the preservative effects of it. This affect is what allows them to live in peace with one another.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Mark Chapter 10%hb~
          %u@1He headed out from there and went to the Judean area, on the other side of the Jordan %I@R%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@r, and a crowd gathered around him again, and he began teaching them again per usual. %u@2%I@S%i@o%i@m%i@e Pharisees went up to him and started asking if it’s legal%u@[%U@A%u@] for a husband to divorce his wife,%u@[%u@a%u@] trying to catch him in a mistake. %u@3His reply to them was, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@T%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@4They said, “The Old Testament allows you ‘…to write a divorce certificate and cut %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ loose’%u@[%u@c%u@].” %u@5Jesus said, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@w%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@-%r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@g%r@i%r@n%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@s%r@b%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@O%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@w%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@w%r@o%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@T%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@j%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@0When they got back home again, the disciples asked him about this. %u@1%u@1He tells them, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@(%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@.%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@.%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@,%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@)%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@i%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@d%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@s%r@b%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@i%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@d%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@1%u@3They brought children to him for him to affect through touch, but his disciples scolded them. %u@1%u@4Seeing this, Jesus became indignant and said to them, %r@“%R@E%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@(%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@L%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@:%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@,%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@c%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@6He put his arms around them and pronounced a blessing over them while laying his hands on them.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7While venturing out on the road, someone ran up, fell to his knees before him, and asked him,%vn~
      “Good teacher, what do I have to do to lay claim to that special fullness of life (eternal life)?”%vn~
          %u@1%u@8Jesus said, “Why do you call me ‘good’?%u@[%U@B%u@] Nobody’s good except for one %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n: God. %u@1%u@9You know the commandments…do not murder…do not commit adultery…don’t steal…don’t lie when called on to make a statement for the record…don’t rip each other off%u@[%u@i%u@]…honor your mother and father.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@0So he said, “Teacher, I’ve been vigilant to keep all of these since I was a teenager.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@1So Jesus stared at him and felt an appreciation for the great value of his life%u@[%u@j%u@] and said, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@i%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@:%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2Now he became melancholy over this remark and departed with a sulk, since he owned a lot of stuff%u@[%u@k%u@]. %u@2%u@3Jesus looked around and mused to his disciples, %r@“%R@H%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@f%r@f%r@i%r@c%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@u%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@(%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@4His disciples were simply stunned by this statement. But again Jesus, from out of his contemplation, said to them, %r@“%R@B%r@o%r@y%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@f%r@f%r@i%r@c%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@I%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@s%r@i%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@a%r@w%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@m%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@l%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@6But still in a state of shock, they say to one another, “And how can anyone be kept %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%u@[%u@n%u@]?” %u@2%u@7Jesus stared at them and declares, %r@“%R@W%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@—%r@c%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@;%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@8Peter proceeded to say to him, “Look—we for our part left everything so that we could become your followers.” %u@2%u@9Jesus said, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@:%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@b%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@f%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@h%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %R@N%r@e%r@w%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@i%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@—%r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@e%r@—%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@h%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@s%r@—%r@a%r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@c%r@u%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@(%r@e%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@)%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@2They were on their way over to Jerusalem, and Jesus was leading the pack. They were all the while stunned: those following %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d were in a state of fear. Confiding in the Twelve, he began to go over with them what would happen to him, the things%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ that were converging. %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@”%r@…%R@B%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@J%r@e%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@a%r@l%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@q%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@r%r@e%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@e%r@f%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@g%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@o%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@5James and John, the sons of Zebedee, wandered over to him and said to him,%vn~
       “Teacher, we want to ask a favor of you.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@6He said, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@?%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@7They said, “Let one of us be your number-one man and the other your number-two when you’re invested in your regal power.%u@[%u@s%u@]”%vn~
          %u@3%u@8Jesus said, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@d%r@e%r@a%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@.%r@ %R@C%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@?%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@9They said, “We can.”%vn~
      Jesus said, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@n%r@u%r@m%r@b%r@e%r@r%r@-%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@u%r@m%r@b%r@e%r@r%r@-%r@t%r@w%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@4%u@1Once they heard about this, the ten became furious with James and John. %u@4%u@2Jesus called them over and tells them, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@b%r@j%r@u%r@g%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@p%r@u%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@e%r@f%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@C%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@s%r@o%r@l%r@u%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@;%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@,%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@-%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@e%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@u%r@m%r@b%r@e%r@r%r@-%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@s%r@e%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@-%r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@n%r@s%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@y%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@n%r@s%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@4%u@6They came to Jericho, and while he, his disciples, and a sizeable crowd were departing Jericho, the son of Timaeus, Bartimaeus%u@[%U@D%u@] %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e, a blind beggar, was sitting alongside the road. %u@4%u@7Having heard that Jesus of Nazareth was %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@d, he began to cry out repeatedly, saying,%vn~
      “Jesus, you marvelous godsend%u@[%u@v%u@], have pity on me!”%vn~
          %u@4%u@8Many scolded him to hush him up, but he cried out all the more, “You marvelous godsend, have pity on me!”%vn~
          %u@4%u@9Jesus stood still and said, %r@“%R@C%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@.%r@”%vn~
      They called for the blind man, saying to him, “Brace yourself%u@[%u@w%u@]—get up, he’s calling you.”%vn~
          %u@5%u@0He threw off his cloak,%u@[%U@E%u@] shot up, and went to Jesus. %u@5%u@1Jesus answered, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@?%r@”%vn~
      The blind man said, “Teacher—%I@I%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ to see again%u@[%U@F%u@].”%vn~
          %u@5%u@2Jesus said, %r@“%R@G%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@x%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@”%r@ Immediately, he regained his sight and took to the road, as he started being his follower.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@s%i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@v%i@o%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@…Ref. note of Matt. 5:31%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@…Lit: %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s. His name is synonymous with his writing, the Law of Moses, the Torah%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@v%i@o%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@o%i@s%i@e…Quotation from Deut. 24:1%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@-%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s…Lit: %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@-%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@h%i@u%i@s%i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@…Ref. note of Matt. 19:4%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@f%i@e…Ancient NT manuscripts are divided as to whether this phrase is spurious or not.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@w%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@d%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h…Lit: %i@n%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@w%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h. The omission of the word %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h before %i@t%i@w%i@o (not: %i@n%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@w%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h) is a figure of speech. Also, ref. Matt. 19:6.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@…Lit: %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f …This statement is not found in all the ancient manuscripts, and therefore may be spurious.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@f%i@e%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@l%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@…Lit: %i@l%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@d [%i@a%i@g%i@a%i@p%i@a%i@ō, (ἀγαπάω/Strong’s 25)]. Though %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@p%i@ā%i@ means love, it’s the ability to see the great worth in even one who appears most undeserving.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@f%i@f%i@…Also: %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%I@B%i@o%i@y%i@s%i@…Lit: %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n. Similar usage in John 21:5. It does not mean “children” in the literal sense, but in this context means “boys”, “lads”, or perhaps even “folks.”%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%I@I%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@m%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@g%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@…Lit: %I@I%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@y%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@l%i@e…Ref. note of Matt. 19:24%fn~

%u@[%u@o%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %I@N%i@e%i@w%i@s%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@l%fn~

%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n. Ref. note of Matt. 8:20.%fn~
%u@[%u@r%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@…Lit: %I@S%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@s%u@]%I@L%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@-%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@-%i@t%i@w%i@o%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r…Lit: %I@G%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@t%u@]%I@C%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@?…%I@W%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: (v.38): %I@C%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@p%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d; (v.39): %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@p%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@,%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@u%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@…Also: %i@s%i@l%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@v%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@r%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@d%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@…Lit: %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %I@D%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@d. Ref. note of Matt. 12:23.%fn~
%u@[%u@w%u@]%I@B%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@…Also: %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@g%i@e; %i@c%i@h%i@e%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@u%i@p; %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@.%i@ Ref. note of John 16:33.%fn~
%u@[%u@x%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u. Ref. Mark 5:34.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@i%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@l%i@…The legality here is with respect to the Law of Moses%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@W%i@h%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@‘%i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@?%i@…Also ref. to note of Matt. 19:17. Why does Jesus take issue with being called good? He is good, of course. Two answers. First, he does not receive such pronouncements by any person, only by his Father. For the same reason, he rebuked demons when they said that he’s the Christ. It is the truth indeed, but such a truth he will only hear spoken by his Father. Second, he is still under the grand trial appointed to him by his Father, which will only be complete after his crucifixion. In his humility, he doesn’t consider himself to have earned the title of ‘good’ yet, and won’t until he’s raised from the dead. At that time, his Father will call him good, and not he call himself good.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@c%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@s%i@…Lit: %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@s. Implies that they are charismatic, are valor-filled, and have despotic tendencies.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%I@B%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@e%i@u%i@s%i@…Aramaic for %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@T%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@e%i@u%i@s; the Gk. equivalent is listed first but he goes by the Aramaic name. Mark is presenting Bartimaeus in a more familiar light, as an ordinary, common man—indeed, the lowest of the low.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%I@H%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@e%i@w%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@a%i@k%i@…Some have asserted that Bartimaeus’s cloak was required of him being a beggar, and that he, casting it aside, believed he would be healed and therefore not need it anymore.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%I@T%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@,%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@…Lit: %I@R%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@i—%i@s%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n. First, %i@r%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@i here is one of the few places where Mark uses an Aramaic word. Second, only the second half of the sentence (%i@s%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n) is spoken; the first half is understood. Together, this shows Bartimaeus speaking in an everyday, ordinary, down-to-earth way, expected of one so low on the social hierarchy.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Mark Chapter 11%hb~
          %u@1When they neared Jerusalem, arriving at%i@ Bethphage and Bethany at the Mount of Olives, he sent out two of his disciples. %u@2He, giving instructions, says to them, %r@“%R@G%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@r%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@m%r@m%r@e%r@d%r@i%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@l%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@.%r@ %R@U%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@k%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@W%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@?%r@’%r@ %R@S%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@H%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@,%r@’%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@.” %u@4They left and found a colt tied to a gate which was up against the street, and they untied it. %u@5Some people who were standing there proceeded to tell them, “What are you doing, untying the colt?” %u@6They told them what Jesus said, and they left them alone. %u@7They %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ bring the colt to Jesus, toss their outer garments on it, and he mounted it. %u@8Many people spread their outer garments out on the road, and others spread tall grass out, which was chopped down %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ from the fields. %u@9Those preceding and those following kept on shouting out,%vn~
%si~
Rescue us%u@[%u@a%u@]!%vp~
Praise be to him who comes at the Lord’s behest.%vp~
%u@1%u@0Praise be to the coming monarchy of our patriarch David.%vp~
Rescue us to the max!%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@1He entered Jerusalem and went into the temple %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@x%i@ and looked around at everything. It being late in the day already, he departed with the Twelve for Bethany. %u@1%u@2The next day, while they were leaving Bethany, %u@1%u@3seeing from a distance a fig tree that was in leaf, he went %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@t, if perchance he would find anything %i@n%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@d in it, and when he got up close to it, he found nothing except for leaves, since figs weren’t in season.%u@[%U@A%u@] %u@1%u@4He considered %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n and said, %r@“%R@N%r@o%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@—%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@—%r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@u%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@i%r@e%r@l%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@” And his disciples were listening %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5They %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ come to Jerusalem. After entering the temple %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@x, he began to throw out the salesmen and the merchandisers doing business in the temple, and he turned over the tables of the money changers and of those who were seated selling doves.%u@[%U@B%u@] %u@1%u@6He wasn’t letting anyone transport boxes%u@[%u@b%u@] %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@ through the temple. %u@1%u@7He was going about instructing them and, as part of doing so, said to them, %r@“%R@H%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@M%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@’%r@?%r@—%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@b%r@b%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@C%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@1%u@8The chief priests and the designated teachers%u@[%u@c%u@] heard %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ and were trying to find a way they could eliminate him; the fact was, the crowd was amazed at his teaching. %u@1%u@9He was in the habit of leaving the city when evening arrived.%vn~
          %u@2%u@0Passing by in the morning, they saw the fig tree shriveled up from the roots %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@p. %u@2%u@1Peter recalled %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@t and %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@ says, “Teacher, look—the fig tree which you cursed is all shriveled up.” %u@2%u@2Jesus, considering what happened, replied to them, %r@“%R@H%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@-%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@D%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@E%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@—%r@i%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@B%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@,%r@’%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@u%r@b%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@O%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@:%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@r%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@E%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@F%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@6%u@[%U@G%u@]%vn~
          %u@2%u@7He went to Jerusalem again. While he was walking about the temple %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d, the chief priests, the designated teachers, and the councilmen%u@[%u@f%u@] approached him. %u@2%u@8They started speaking to him,%vn~
      “By what authority do you do these things? In other words, who gave you the authority to do these things?”%vn~
          %u@2%u@9Jesus said, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@s%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@q%r@u%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@s%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@J%r@o%r@h%r@n%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@p%r@t%r@i%r@s%r@m%r@:%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@z%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@?%r@—%R@A%r@n%r@s%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@1They talked it over amongst themselves, saying, “If we say ‘From heaven’, he’ll say, ‘Then why didn’t you believe in him?’ %u@3%u@2But if we say, ‘From mankind,’…”—They feared the crowd, since everyone considered John to be a prophet. %u@3%u@3They answered Jesus, “We don’t know.”%vn~
      And Jesus %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tells them, %r@“%R@N%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@.%r@”%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%I@R%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@…Lit: %i@h%i@o%i@s%i@a%i@n%i@n%i@a. Ref. note of Matt 21:9%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@b%i@o%i@x%i@e%i@s%i@…Lit: %i@v%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@s. (Some liberty taken by using %i@b%i@o%i@x%i@e%i@s.)%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@…Lit: %I@S%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%I@H%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@-%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@…The verb tense of this verb (and the other references) insinuate continuous action. This is not a one-time having, believing, or doubting, but a continuation of it unbounded by time.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@a%i@s%i@k%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r%i@…Lit: %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@k. The wording here is a figure of speech called a %i@h%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@a%i@d%i@y%i@s; ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@l%i@m%i@e%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@E%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@s%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@s%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s…Lit: %I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@k%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@s%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n…Lit: %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@S%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@…Jesus found no figs on the fig tree when it wasn’t fig season and as a result cursed the tree. Why did Jesus expect to find figs on a tree when it wasn’t fig season? There are two times a year in which a fig tree bears figs. The main crop is in the late summer or fall and a secondary crop (called a %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@b%i@a) is in the spring. The breba crop comes from shoots from the previous fall’s crop. Also, over the winter a fig tree will shed leaves. New leaves grow back in the spring, and this is what the phrase %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@f refers to in v. 13. Also, the appearance of these new leaves coincides with the breba crop; hence, Jesus saw the new leaves and expected to see figs. When Mark said in v.13 that “figs weren’t in season,” he’s referring to the fall crop, not the breba crop.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@…Ref. note of Matt. 12:21%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@r%i@o%i@b%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@…The Gk. word used here and in Matt. 21:13 is for %i@r%i@o%i@b%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@ and not the one for %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@.%i@ A robber (not a thief) is described in Prov. 1:8–19. He is one who lies in wait for his victim and will apply violence wantonly for even paltry gain. In modern times, you find thugs such as these in gangs or with drug traffickers.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%I@H%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@-%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@…Lit:%i@ %I@B%i@e%i@-%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@-%I@G%i@o%i@d. A couple of relevant facts concerning the Gk. grammar in this short statement. First, the verb tense (present) of %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ insinuates not just having once and being done with it but having continuously. Second, the lack of the definite article before %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ is conspicuous and was omitted intentionally by Mark. As a point of contrast, consider the example of Acts 3:16, where the definite article is used before %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h (and this in a prepositional phrase, which often omits an expected definite article). In the case of v. 22 here, the omission of the definite article emphasizes the nature of the faith. Furthermore, the word %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ is in the genitive case, but when a possessive is constructed in Gk. (an example in English would be, “This is Mary’s jar,” where %I@M%i@a%i@r%i@y%i@ appears in the possessive form), it normally consists of the definite article first, followed by the noun, followed by perhaps another article, then the genitive form of the noun doing the possessing. Since the initial definite article is missing, this disrupts the normal pattern of a Gk. possessive form, and signals a different meaning to the reader. Third, the lack of definite article before %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ emphasizes the nature of the faith.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%I@H%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@-%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@…%i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@…Some of the ancient manuscripts have doctored a few key words in vv.23,24. This is related to previous note. A minor change is in v. 23: some manuscripts have inserted the word %i@t%i@o, changing it from: %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@,%i@ to, %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h. A larger change is in v. 24: some manuscripts have changed the reading, %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ to, %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d…To quote Max & Mary from %I@A%i@ %I@G%i@r%i@a%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %I@A%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@y%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@k%i@ %I@N%i@e%i@w%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t with respect to the verb tense in the words %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d: “the future regarded with such certitude that it is assumed to have been realized already, but in the present is not regarded as having been complete yet.”%fn~
%u@[%U@G%u@]Verse 26’s ending, which reads, %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s, is omitted as spurious. Ref. note of Matt. 17:21.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Mark Chapter 12%hb~
          %u@1He proceeded to speak to them by means of analogy%u@[%u@a%u@]: %r@“%R@A%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@d%r@u%r@c%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@e%r@m%r@p%r@t%r@y%r@-%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@A%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@l%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@.%r@ %R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@…%r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@%%R@I%r@@%R@H%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@:%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@’%r@ %R@L%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@n%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@;%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@,%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@%vn~
%r@%si~
%r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@j%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@—%r@%vp~
%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@.%r@%vp~
%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@B%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@%vp~
%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@y%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%r@%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@2%I@A%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e they were seeking to get ahold of him, but were afraid of the crowd, since they knew that the analogy was directed at them. They left him alone and departed.%nn~
          %u@1%u@3They sent some of the Pharisees and some Herod supporters%u@[%u@d%u@] to him in order to catch him %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e while conversing. %u@1%u@4They went and said to him, “Teacher%u@[%U@A%u@], we know that you’re honest and that what you teach is the true way to God and that you could care less what anyone thinks about you, %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o since you’re not affected by people’s attitudes%u@[%u@e%u@], but you teach God’s way in a truthful manner. Do we have to pay Caesar the poll tax or not? Shall we pay or not pay?” %u@1%u@5Having a %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l view of their hypocrisy %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m, he said,%vn~
      %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@?%r@ %R@B%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@x%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@1%u@6They brought %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e.%vn~
      He %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@i%r@c%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@t%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
      They said, “Caesar’s.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@7Jesus said, %r@“%R@G%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %R@C%r@a%r@e%r@s%r@a%r@r%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@C%r@a%r@e%r@s%r@a%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@”%vn~
      They were stunned.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8The Sadducees, who claim that there is no life after death,%u@[%u@g%u@] went up to him and put a question to him, %u@1%u@9”Teacher%u@[%U@A%u@], the Old Testament%u@[%u@h%u@] says that if someone’s brother dies and leaves a wife behind but didn’t leave a son, his brother will take the woman as his wife for the purpose of producing a male offspring for %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f his %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d brother. %u@2%u@0There were seven brothers. The first got married to a woman and died, not leaving a descendent, %u@2%u@1and the second took her %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ and died, not leaving a descendent, and the third, and so forth. %u@2%u@2The seven left no descendent. Last of all, the woman died. %u@2%u@3Which of them will she be the wife of in the after-life, since all seven had married her?”%vn~
          %u@2%u@4Jesus said, %r@“%R@I%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@p%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@-%r@b%r@a%r@s%r@e%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@-%r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@x%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@u%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@w%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@e%r@:%r@
