%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@W%r@i%r@s%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@c%r@l%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@d%r@-%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@q%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@”%r@%nn~
          %u@3%u@6One of the Pharisees asked if he would dine with him, and he entered the Pharisee’s house and was seated%u@[%u@r%u@]. %u@3%u@7By chance, there was a woman there in that city—a sinner%u@[%U@F%u@]—and she found out that he was dining at the Pharisee’s house, and she took a jar of myrrh %u@3%u@8and stood next to him, across from his feet, sobbing with tears %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r. She proceeded to rain tears down on his feet, wipe them down with her hair and fervently kiss them, and to pour myrrh all over them. %u@3%u@9Seeing this, the Pharisee who invited him over said to himself,%vn~
      “If this guy were a prophet, he’d be mindful of%u@[%U@F%u@] who %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ who’s touching him and of what sort of woman she is, since she’s a sinner.”%vn~
          %u@4%u@0Jesus’s response to this was, %r@“%R@S%r@i%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@”%vn~
      “Speak up, teacher”.%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@”%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@w%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@b%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@$%r@5%r@0%r@,%r@0%r@0%r@0%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@$%r@5%r@,%r@0%r@0%r@0%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@N%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@p%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@.%r@ %R@S%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@4%u@3Simon answered, “I suppose the one who had the greater amount cancelled will be.”%vn~
      He said, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@4%u@4He turned to the woman and said to Simon, %r@“%R@S%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@?%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@v%r@a%r@l%r@u%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@l%r@e%r@.%r@”%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@.%r@” %u@4%u@9The dinner guests started to talk among themselves, “Who is this guy?—He even forgives sins.” %u@5%u@0He said to the woman, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@c%r@u%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@;%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %u@[%u@a%u@]%I@S%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@—%i@a%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@k…Lit: %I@S%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e. An example of the colorful prose of Luke.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@o%i@f. Implies coming for personal reasons.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@o%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@-%i@o%i@f%i@-%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@-%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@o%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@n…More exactly, %i@b%i@i%i@e%i@r%fn~

%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@l…Also: %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@/%i@s%i@o%i@f%i@t%i@/%i@e%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@ %I@J%i@o%i@h%i@n%i@…Lit: %i@n%i@o%i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@g%i@o%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@ %I@J%i@o%i@h%i@n. An expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ [%i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s]%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@-%i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %I@Z%i@e%i@i%i@t%i@g%i@e%i@i%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n. See also Matt. 11:17.%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n. Ref. note of Matt. 8:20.%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@u%i@t%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@u%i@n%i@k%i@a%i@r%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@-%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@l%i@t…Lit: %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@r%u@]%i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ [%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t]%fn~
%u@[%u@s%u@]%i@$%i@5%i@0%i@,%i@0%i@0%i@0…%i@$%i@5%i@,%i@0%i@0%i@0…Lit: %i@5%i@0%i@0%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@i…%i@5%i@0%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@i. Ref. note of Matt. 18:8 for conversion.%fn~
%u@[%u@t%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@o%i@l%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@l%i@u%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ [%i@a%i@g%i@a%i@p%i@a%i@ō%i@ (ἀγαπάω/Strong’s 25)]%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@c%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@u%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@n…The Roman equivalent to an army captain. The issue here was that the centurion was a Gentile and that the Jews were not supposed to have any contact with the Gentiles—certainly not any close contact. This is why the centurion said in v. 6 that it’s not appropriate for Jesus to come pay him a visit of a personal nature.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@d %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@d. The principle manuscripts diverge on this. The other principles instead say, %i@a%i@n%i@d %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@d. The former, %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ is the reading chosen by the UBS NT, the correct choice. The UBS choice is consistent with and confirmed by the centurion’s statement in verse 8 which says,%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@s. The verb tense used in both %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@d (for %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@…%i@b%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@d)%i@ and %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ (for %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@g%i@o) are both 3%u@r%u@d person imperatives. The meaning in the 3%u@r%u@d person imperative of %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ is more clear: the centurion is giving an order to a third party, the order being for the third party to relay another order to the person, the one who’s being summoned. What the centurion wants is for Jesus to relay a command through a third party (his friends), instead of Jesus giving a person-to-person order without the third party relay. This is the way that chain-of-command-structured authority hierarchies work; you can give a command to a subordinate who will in turn pass the command down the chain of subordinates. The centurion’s faith caused him to recognize that the kingdom of God must also be a chain-of-command-structured authority hierarchy, or else if wouldn’t function.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@(%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@d%i@o%i@w%i@)…With the death of her husband and only son, she had nobody to support her; this magnified the pity which Jesus had for her. %fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@y%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s. John spent all of this time out in the wilderness, avoiding cities, due to his austere lifestyle; Jesus visited both wilderness and city.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%I@W%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@e%i@p %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@i%i@l …Ref. note of Matt. 11:17%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@r…%i@b%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f…Also: (%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f) %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@u%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@;%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@g%i@n%i@i%i@z%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f. The way that she’s singled out as being “a sinner” (v.37) and the verb tense in %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ (v. 39) insinuate that she’s an adulterous or is sexually immoral in some other way. This verse literally reads, %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@,%i@ leaving the implication that he would’ve done something about it.%fn~
%u@[%U@G%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@s%i@s…Lit: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@s%i@s. As seen in various places in the NT, it was customary back then to greet someone of the same sex with a kiss. The kiss was a cordial greeting, a sign of friendship and comradery. In fact, the Gk. word %i@p%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@o%i@s (φίλος /Strong’s 5384), usually translated %i@l%i@o%i@v%i@e, sometimes means %i@k%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@ or %i@f%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%U@H%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…%i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@i%i@l…Lit: %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@i%i@l%i@…%i@a%i@n%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@r%i@r%i@h. Myrrh is much more expensive than oil. Ref. note of Matt. 6:17 for anointing with oil.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Luke Chapter 8%hb~
          %u@1The next thing that happened was that he was travelling non-stop from city to city and town to town preaching the good news of God’s involvement with mankind (God’s kingdom), accompanied by the Twelve %u@2and by certain women who had been treated from %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@f%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y filthy, disgusting spirits and from ailments, Mary (called Magdalene), from whom seven demons had come out, %u@3and Joanna the wife of Herod’s butler Chuza, Susanna, and many others, the very women who were there for them time and time again attending to their needs, doing so from out of their personal wealth and belongings.%vn~
          %u@4As a large crowd was gathering—including those travelling from each city to see him—he spoke by means of analogy, %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@”%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@w%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@x%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@e%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@i%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@O%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@c%r@k%r@y%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@           %u@9Now his disciples asked him what the analogy was supposed to mean. %u@1%u@0He said, %r@“%R@I%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@q%r@u%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@f%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@o%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@(%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@l%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@f%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@n%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@,%r@%vn~
%r@%si~
%r@“%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@%vp~

%r@b%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@s%r@i%r@b%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@c%r@r%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@s%r@i%r@b%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@.%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@1%u@9Now his mother and brothers stopped by but weren’t able to pay him a visit on account of the crowd. %u@2%u@0They sent him a message, “Your mother and your brothers are standing outside wanting to see you.” %u@2%u@1But he replied to them, %r@“%R@M%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2Something happened one day. He and his disciples boarded a boat and he told them, %r@“%R@L%r@e%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@,%r@”%r@ and they set sail. %u@2%u@3While sailing, he fell asleep. A wind storm touched down on the lake, and the boat began to take on water and was in danger. %u@2%u@4They went over to him and woke him up, “Boss, boss, we’re going under%u@[%u@e%u@]!” He got up, spoke sternly to the wind and the high waves, and they stopped and it became calm. %u@2%u@5He said to them, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@?%r@”%r@ They became awestruck, saying to each other, “Just who is this guy, that he commands the winds and the water, and they obey him?”%vn~
          %u@2%u@6They landed in the district of the Gerasenes, which is across %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@k%i@e from Galilee. %u@2%u@7After disembarking onto dry land, a man accosted him, someone from the city who had a demon which was harassing him. For a good amount of time, he hadn’t been wearing clothes, and he wasn’t living in a house but instead was %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g in the tombs. %u@2%u@8Seeing Jesus, he screamed, prostrated himself in front of him, and said in a loud voice, “I have no beef with you%u@[%u@f%u@], Jesus son of the Most High God. I’m begging you—don’t torment me.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@9You see, he had commanded the dirty, disgusting spirit to come out of the man. As things were, for a long time it had held a tight grip on him, and he was kept tied up in chains, hands and feet %i@b%i@o%i@t%i@h, continuously being restrained. Constantly breaking the chains, he kept on being driven by the demon out to the middle of nowhere. %u@3%u@0Jesus asked him, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@?%r@”%r@ He said, %r@“%r@’%R@R%r@e%r@g%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@’%r@,%r@”%r@ since many demons had entered him. %u@3%u@1They begged that he wouldn’t order them to be sent away into the Bottomless Pit%u@[%U@B%u@].%vn~
          %u@3%u@2Now there was a sizable herd of pigs there feeding on the hill, and they begged him to permit them to enter into those %i@a%i@n%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@.%i@ He permitted them. %u@3%u@3The demons left the man and entered the pigs, and the herd rushed down the cliff into the lake and drowned.%vn~
          %u@3%u@4Seeing what had happened, the %i@p%i@i%i@g herders began to flee, and they spread the report in the city and in the grain fields. %u@3%u@5People came out to look at %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s what had taken place and went to Jesus and found the man from whom the demons left sitting, clothed, in a sound state of mind, and submitting himself to Jesus, sitting at his feet, and they became terrified. %u@3%u@6Those watching how the demon-possessed man was set straight and restored%u@[%u@h%u@] %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ filled them in on what happened. %u@3%u@7The entire multitude from the area surrounding the Gerasenes asked him to go away, because a tremendous fear had come over them. In response, he got in the boat and returned %i@a%i@c%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@.%i@ %u@3%u@8The man from whom the demons had left kept on begging him if he could be with him %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n. But he sent him away saying, %u@3%u@9“Go back home and tell all about what God did for you.” He went throughout the entire city proclaiming and preaching what Jesus did for him.%vn~
          %u@4%u@0While Jesus was returning, the crowd kept on welcoming him enthusiastically, beckoning him. The fact is, all of them were waiting for him %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@n. %u@4%u@1Out of nowhere, a man named Jairus, and this man was one of the leading men of the synagogue, fell at Jesus’s feet asking him—begging him—to come to his house, %u@4%u@2since his only daughter, who was around twelve years old, was near death.%vn~
      While he was heading %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e, the crowd kept on throttling him. %u@4%u@3A woman with a hemorrhage%u@[%U@B%u@], who had it for the last twelve years, and who spent her entire life-savings on doctors, no one being able to cure her, %u@4%u@4got right up behind %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ and touched the tassel on his outer cloak, and immediately her hemorrhage ceased. %u@4%u@5Jesus said, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@?%r@”%r@ While everyone was denying %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t, Peter said, “Boss, the crowd is crowding in on you non-stop and squeezing you.” %u@4%u@6Jesus said, %r@“%R@S%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@;%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@u%r@l%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@4%u@7Seeing that she hadn’t escaped notice, the woman, trembling, came and prostrated herself before him and announced for all to hear the reason she touched him and how she was healed instantly. %u@4%u@8He told her, %r@“%R@M%r@a%r@’%r@a%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@c%r@u%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@(%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@.%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@.%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@,%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@,%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@,%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@)%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@4%u@9While he was still speaking, a particular person from the synagogue leadership came saying %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@J%i@a%i@i%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@,%i@ “Your daughter has died; you don’t need to bother the teacher anymore.” %u@5%u@0Jesus heard this and responded to him, %r@“%R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@r%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@;%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@c%r@u%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@l%r@a%r@m%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@” %u@5%u@1He entered the house and didn’t allow anyone to enter with him, except for Peter, John, and James, and the child’s father and mother. %u@5%u@2Everyone kept on crying and kept on pounding their chests %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@. He said, %r@“%R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@y%r@;%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@—%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@j%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@l%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@5%u@3They started ridiculing him, having known %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n that she had died. %u@5%u@4He, though, took her hand and called to her loudly, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@!%r@”%r@ %u@5%u@5Her spirit returned to her, and she was resurrected immediately. He left instructions that she be given something to eat. %u@5%u@6Her parents were flabbergasted, but he commanded them not to tell anyone what had happened.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%I@A%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r. Ref. note of Matt. 11:15.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@y%i@/%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@g%i@i%i@e%i@s; according to Max & Mary it means, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@d. Some guesswork, heavily skewed by context, in arriving at the exact meaning of this phrase.%fn~

%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@d…%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@e…%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@d%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@-%i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@a%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d. This is a Gk. expression (%i@k%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@s%i@ %i@k%i@a%i@i%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s/καλῇ καὶ ἀγαθῇ), (καλῇ /Strong’s 2570),( καὶ /Strong’s 2532), (ἀγαθῇ/Strong’s 18), two words which mean that something appears to be good when viewed from the outside and is in fact good on the inside.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@B%i@o%i@t%i@t%i@o%i@m%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %I@P%i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@A%i@b%i@y%i@s%i@s. Mentioned a few times in Scripture (example: . Rev. 9:2, 9:11). This is the place where, some time in the future, demons will be kept locked up.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@r%i@h%i@a%i@g%i@e…See note of Mark 5:25 for nature of illness.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Luke Chapter 9%hb~
          %u@1Having summoned the Twelve, he gave them %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@l power and authority to cure a person of any kind of demon which is harassing him%i@ and to cure diseases. %u@2He sent them out%u@[%u@a%u@] %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s to %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t preaching and proclaiming God’s plan of being involved with mankind (God’s kingdom) and to heal the sick. %u@3He said to them, %r@“%R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@a%r@d%r@:%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@A%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@—%r@w%r@h%r@o%r@l%r@e%r@-%r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@m%r@b%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@—%r@w%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@f%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m.” %u@6%I@E%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ leaving, %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g, they proceeded to go through each and every town telling the good news and curing people everywhere %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@t.%vn~
          %u@7The ruler Herod%u@[%u@c%u@] heard everything which had happened and was quite perplexed on account of what was being said by some, that John was raised from the dead, %u@8but by some that Elijah has appeared, but by others that the prophet so-and-so from way-back-when came back to life. %u@9Herod said, “I beheaded John myself, so who is this guy that I’m hearing such things about?” He was ever trying to see him.%vn~
          %u@1%u@0When they returned, the missionaries told him all about the things that they did. Taking them with him, they withdrew, he and them only, to a city called Bethsaida. %u@1%u@1Knowing this, the crowd followed him. Welcoming them, he proceeded to speak to them about God’s involvement with mankind (God’s kingdom) and proceeded to heal those needing a cure. %u@1%u@2The day was winding down, so the Twelve approached him and said,%vn~
      “Dismiss the crowd, so that they can go into the surrounding towns and farms, retire for the night, and find provision, since we’re out here in the middle of nowhere.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@3He said to them, “You all give them something to eat.”%vn~
      They said, “We don’t have any more than five loaves of bread and two fishes, unless of course we go and buy food for these people.” %u@1%u@4You see, there were around five thousand men there (%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n). He said to his disciples,%vn~
      “Have them find a nice place to relax and gather into dinner parties of about fifty apiece.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@5They did this, and everyone found a place to relax%u@[%u@d%u@]. %u@1%u@6He took the five loaves and two fishes, looked up into the sky, gave thanks for them, broke %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%u@[%u@e%u@], and proceeded to give %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@s to his disciples to distribute to the crowd. %u@1%u@7Everyone ate until they were full, as much as he or she wanted, and twelve baskets of leftover scraps were picked up by them.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8Now on one occasion, he happened to be praying alone and his disciples came over and joined him. He posed a question to them,%vn~
      %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@1%u@9They answered, “John the Baptist. Others say Elijah. Yet others say that you’re some prophet from way-back-when who’s come back to life.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@0He said to them, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@?%r@”%vn~
      Peter replied, “God’s Messiah, the Christ.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@1He got them to promise%u@[%u@f%u@] not to spread this fact around to anyone: %u@2%u@2he said that the Man%u@[%u@g%u@] must undergo a lot of suffering and be rejected after examination by the councilmen%u@[%u@h%u@], the chief priests, and the designated teachers%u@[%u@i%u@], be killed, and be resurrected on the third day after. %u@2%u@3He went on to tell everyone, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@o%r@t%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@p%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@p%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@j%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@f%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@-%r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@r%r@o%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@.%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@f%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@r%r@o%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@-%r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@f%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@(%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@.%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@.%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@,%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@)%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@r%r@o%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@f%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@f%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@h%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@h%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@l%r@s%r@’%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@y%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@M%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@(%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@—%r@a%r@b%r@s%r@o%r@l%r@u%r@t%r@e%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@2%u@8About eight days after %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@k%i@e these words, he took Peter, John, and James%u@[%U@C%u@] with him and ascended a mountain for a session of prayer. %u@2%u@9While he was praying, his facial appearance happened to change, and his clothes %i@a%i@l%i@s%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@d%i@ to a lightning-like white. %u@3%u@0Just like that, two men began to converse with him, none other than Moses and Elijah, %u@3%u@1who were visible in their glorious magnificence, beginning to speak to him about his departure %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@E%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h, which was going to be fulfilled in Jerusalem. %u@3%u@2Peter and those with him were dead asleep%u@[%u@k%u@], but %i@s%i@n%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ became wide awake and saw him in his magnificent splendor and the two men standing together with him.%vn~
          %u@3%u@3While they were parting with him, Peter said to Jesus, “Boss, good thing we’re here. Let’s make three little holy edifices%u@[%u@l%u@], one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah”—not having any idea what he was saying. %u@3%u@4While he was still saying this, a cloud appeared and overshadowed them. Fear came upon them as they entered into the cloud. %u@3%u@5A voice appeared out of the cloud saying, “This is my Son, the Chosen-From-Among-Many One%u@[%u@m%u@], evermore listen to him.” %u@3%u@6With the voice’s appearance, they noticed that Jesus was now alone. For days to come they kept their mouths shut and wouldn’t tell anyone what they had witnessed.%vn~
          %u@3%u@7A large crowd met him the sixth day after they descended the mountain. %u@3%u@8Out of nowhere, a man yelled out from the crowd, “Teacher, I’m begging you to take a look at my son, since he’s the only son I have…”— %u@3%u@9Just like that, a %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n spirit takes hold of him, screams all of a sudden, and throws him into a convulsion, foaming at the mouth, hardly leaving him even for a moment, battering him all the while. %u@4%u@0—“…Your disciples were asked to cast it out, and they weren’t able to.” %u@4%u@1Jesus’s response this was, %r@“%R@O%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@r%r@u%r@p%r@t%r@ %R@Z%r@e%r@i%r@t%r@g%r@e%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@!%r@ %R@J%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@?%r@ %R@B%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@4%u@2They then brought him over to him; the demon threw him to the ground, and convulsed him. Jesus dropped the hammer on the filthy, disgusting spirit , the child was cured%u@[%u@p%u@], and they gave him back to his father. %u@4%u@3Everyone was amazed at the magnificence of God.%vn~
      While everyone was still marveling at everything he was doing, he said to his disciples, %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@“%R@A%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@q%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@.%r@” %u@4%u@5But this remark wasn’t getting through to them. It had been hidden from them, kept %i@l%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@a%i@s a secret from them, so they weren’t seeing it for what it was, and from time to time when they thought about this remark%i@ were afraid to ask him about it.%vn~
          %u@4%u@6Now an argument arose between them, %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ which one of them is the greatest. %u@4%u@7Jesus, understanding what was at the heart of the issue, got ahold of a child, had him stand next to him, %u@4%u@8and said to them, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@l%r@e%r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@l%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@—%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %R@C%r@h%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@u%r@t%r@y%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@4%u@9Upon reflection, John said, “Boss, we saw some people casting out demons %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e authorized and commissioned to do so by you%u@[%u@s%u@], and time and time again we prevented them or otherwise hindered them from doing so, because their initiative didn’t originate from us%u@[%u@t%u@].” %u@5%u@0He said to John, %r@“%R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@p%r@p%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@5%u@1As those days were coming to a close, the days before his ascension, in his inner self he mustered an unwavering determination for going to Jerusalem %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%u@[%U@D%u@]. %u@5%u@2He sent out some agents to the places he was intent on going and was expecting confrontation%u@[%U@E%u@]. In their comings and goings, they went into the towns of Samaria as part of their making preparations for him, %u@5%u@3but they didn’t whole-heartedly welcome him %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@m%i@b%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@y%u@[%u@u%u@]%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e, because he was bent on going to Jerusalem%u@[%u@v%u@]. %u@5%u@4When his disciples witnessed this, James and John said, “Lord, do you want us to call fire down from the sky and incinerate them?” %u@5%u@5He turned and scolded them, %u@5%u@6and they went to another town %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@.%vn~
          %u@5%u@7While they were on the road, someone said to him, “I’ll follow you wherever you decide to go.” %u@5%u@8Jesus said to him, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@x%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@i%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@5%u@9He said to someone else, %r@“%R@B%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@x%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@”%r@ but he said, “Lord, let me first go out and bury my father%u@[%U@F%u@].” %u@6%u@0He said, %r@“%R@L%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@;%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@c%r@l%r@a%r@i%r@m%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@o%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@(%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@6%u@1He said to someone else, “I’ll be your follower, Lord, but first let me say farewell to close friends and family.” %u@6%u@2Jesus said to him, %r@“%R@N%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@i%r@t%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@.%r@”%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t…Lit: %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@s (except it is the verb form of the noun %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e).%i@ Rendered%i@ %I@M%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s (v. 10).%fn~

The use of the word %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ in the literal form is a figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@l%i@e%i@e%i@p…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@s%i@l%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@%fn~

%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@c%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@d. The specific word for %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ is used here, not the more general word for %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d.%fn~
%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@s. An idiom.%fn~

%u@[%u@t%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@i%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@u%i@s…Lit: %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@u%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@-%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@m%i@b%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@y%i@…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m. Ref. v. 48 also.%fn~
%u@[%u@v%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@m…Lit: %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@m. Ref. notes in vv. 51,52 for other relevant uses of the idiomatic word %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ in this passage.%fn~
%u@[%u@w%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@x%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@m%i@e%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e…Jesus is telling the missionaries to accept invitations as they’re offered, but don’t overstay your welcome and don’t get too comfortable in any single place, because there’s more places to visit. This is reinforced by v. 6, which begins with the word %i@d%i@e%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@t%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@p%i@s…Lit: %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@e. This is an idiom. Also means, %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@c%i@i%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ or means something similar to the English idiom %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e. Ref. note of Matt. 4:19. %I@G%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ is the same idiom that’s used in Mark 8:33.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%I@P%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@,%i@ %I@J%i@o%i@h%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@J%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@s…James was listed before John in Luke 6:14, now in Luke 9:28 John precedes him. The implication is that John is more prominent a disciple than James. But Peter is everywhere listed before either of these two, therefore he’s the foremost of the Twelve.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@w%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@m. An idiom used throughout the Bible; in particular, used in Is. 50:7. Is. 29:22; Is. 50:7; Ez. 3:8–9}}%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%I@H%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@f%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e…Lit: %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ [%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@r%i@s]%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e. %I@B%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ is a biblical idiom, and for example is used in Ps. 89:23. The implication is of something that one is preoccupied with; directly in front of; focused on; intently engaged in; in confrontation with.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@b%i@u%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r…Ref. note of Matt. 8:22%fn~

Luke Chapter 10%hb~
          %u@1After these things %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d, the Lord appointed seventy-two others and sent them out in sets of twos as probes%u@[%u@a%u@] into every city and place which he personally intended to visit. %u@2He started %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@ %i@b%i@y saying to them, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@r%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@w%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@H%r@a%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %R@C%r@h%r@i%r@e%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@t%r@a%r@p%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@—%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@G%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@!%r@%vn~
      %r@“%R@T%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@e%r@:%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@m%r@b%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@”%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@,%r@ %R@C%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@a%r@z%r@i%r@n%r@!%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %R@B%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@a%r@!%r@ %R@B%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@c%r@c%r@u%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %R@T%r@y%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@S%r@i%r@d%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@i%r@t%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@r%r@l%r@a%r@p%r@-%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@-%r@a%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@d%r@u%r@c%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@I%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@D%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@l%r@e%r@r%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %R@T%r@y%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@S%r@i%r@d%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@A%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %R@C%r@a%r@p%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@a%r@u%r@m%r@,%r@%vn~
%r@%si~
%r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@l%r@e%r@v%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@%vp~

%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@”%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@r%r@e%r@g%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@r%r@e%r@g%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@r%r@e%r@g%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@r%r@e%r@g%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@”%r@%nn~
          %u@1%u@7The seventy-two returned full of joy saying, “Lord, even the demons obey us when we act using your delegated authority%u@[%u@f%u@].” %u@1%u@8He said to them, %r@“%R@T%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@r%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@j%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@u%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@C%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@R%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@i%r@z%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@:%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@c%r@o%r@r%r@p%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@e%r@m%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@m%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@b%r@i%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@H%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@c%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@b%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@j%r@o%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@u%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@1At that moment he was filled with rapture in the Holy Spirit%u@[%u@h%u@] and said, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@           %u@2%u@5As chance would have it, some expert in the Law of Moses stood up and put him on the spot saying,%vn~
      “Teacher, what must one do to legitimately claim and lay hold of%u@[%U@D%u@] that special fullness of life (eternal life%u@[%U@E%u@])?”%vn~
          %u@2%u@6He said to him, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@b%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@c%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@L%r@a%r@w%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%R@I%r@@%R@M%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@?%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@7His response to him was, “’You shall love the Lord your God from out of your entire heart, with your entire mind, will, and emotions%u@[%u@j%u@], with your entire ability and might, and with your entire intellect.’ Also, ‘%I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@ your neighbor as yourself.’”%vn~
          %u@2%u@8He said, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@s%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@l%r@y%r@.%r@ %R@D%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@9But wanting to vindicate (or exculpate) himself, he said to Jesus, “So who is my neighbor?”%vn~
          %u@3%u@0Jesus formulated%u@[%u@l%u@] %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m: %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@x%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@n%r@k%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@u%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@e%r@k%r@s%r@’%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@y%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@L%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@u%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@W%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@p%r@p%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@c%r@c%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@b%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@m%r@p%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@b%r@b%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@?%r@” %u@3%u@7He said, “The one who had pity on him.” Jesus said to him, %r@“%R@G%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@8While they were travelling about, he himself %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@c%i@i%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ entered a certain town. A woman named Martha was entertaining him, %u@3%u@9and this woman had a sister named Mary, who moreover was sitting near the Lord attentively%u@[%u@q%u@], listening on and on to his message. %u@4%u@0But Martha was constantly being distracted by what was involved in the preparations and waiting on everyone. She went straight up to him%u@[%u@r%u@] and said, “Lord, don’t you care that my sister has left me with all the work%u@[%u@s%u@]? So now, say something to her to get her to help out.” %u@4%u@1His response to her was, %r@“%R@M%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@a%r@,%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@a%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@s%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%R@I%r@@%R@T%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@o%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@;%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@F%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@”%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@b%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e. A common idiom; ref. note of Luke 9:52.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@a%i@p%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t…Lit: %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@g%i@e…Or: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@.%i@ A phrase used repeatedly throughout the NT, originating in the Law of Moses, a principle well-known to all Jews.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h…Lit: %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@t…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e. Also used in Mark 16:17.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ [or%i@ %i@b%i@y]%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@y…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u. Short for %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ or similar to %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t: phrases used throughout the Bible.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@m%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e. Based on the context, the latter phrase is understood to mean the former.%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@o%i@o%i@k.%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…The GT specifies that the man who was assaulted was going “down” to Jericho from Jerusalem, and that the priest was also going “down” as well. As a NT rule, one goes “up” to Jerusalem and goes “down” from Jerusalem. Based on this, the priest was travelling in direction of Jerusalem.%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@r%i@g%i@y%i@m%i@a%i@n…Lit: %I@L%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@t%i@e. Some liberties taken.%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@l%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@f%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@p%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@n%i@e. Some liberties taken.%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@n%i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@e%i@k%i@s%i@’%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@y …Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@w%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@i%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@n%i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@r. Some liberties taken. Two denarii is $200 according to the conversion in Matt. 18:28. A “couple weeks” is a crude estimate; relative to modern times, inns wouldn’t have been cheaper back then than they are today.%fn~
%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@y…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@r%u@]%i@w%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m…Also: %i@a%i@b%i@r%i@u%i@p%i@t%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@s%u@]%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
 %fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@A%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@.%i@ %I@O%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@w%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %I@A%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t. %I@O%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@w%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u. Notice the figurative language here in this passage, and, in fact, starting at the end of the previous chapter. Sprinkled throughout this discourse are Semitic idioms, expressions, etc. (%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@e is a good example). These appear to be literal word-for-word translations from Aramaic to Gk. of Jesus’s actual Aramaic words. In general, Luke uses less Semitic wording than Matthew, but there’s a noticeable difference here in this passage and in the previous chapters of Luke.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@r%i@l%i@a%i@p%i@-%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@-%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@c%i@l%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@s. Ref. note of Matt. 11:21.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%I@T%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@w%i@,%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@j%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ (imperfect%i@ tense)%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g. Luke 10:18 is one of the most misinterpreted verses in the NT. It is commonly understood to be Satan being cast out of heaven prior to the creation of man (ref. Is. 14:12; Ez. 28:16; Rev. 12:7–9). This is not the case. Instead, Jesus is seeing in the spiritual world (ref. “discerning of spirits”, 1 Cor. 12:10) what the seventy-two who had been sent out were doing in the natural world. Jesus was watching in real time; each time they cast out a demon, he saw a lightning strike.%fn~
The elements to the correct interpretation of this passage, first, is that the word translated %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ is in the Gk. imperfect tense. In this case, it insinuates multiple, repeated action, not a single action; plus it insinuates Jesus watching something unfold in real-time (in other words, watching concurrently as the disciples were doing it). Second, the Gk. word for %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ (%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@o%i@s/οὐρανός/Strong’s 3772) can mean either the sky (Acts 1:1), heaven itself (Luke 10:14), the spiritual world around us (1 Cor. 12:2; Eph. 6:12), or a place of spiritual dominion. In the case of Luke 10:18, %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@o%i@s%i@ means the third: a place of spiritual dominion. Third, the word %I@S%i@a%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@ is used as a synecdoche/metonymy for the word %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n (also in Matt. 12:26; Luke 13:16). Fourth, the word %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ refers to somebody or something losing its authority or dominion, usually by force (Rev. 18:2; Rev. 12:7–9).%fn~
The correct interpretation of Jesus seeing multiple demons get cast down in real-time is relevant to the enclosing context. In other words, Jesus sent the disciples out, and in v. 17 they come back rejoicing, telling what had happened. Jesus regurgitating something which happened thousands of years before would be irrelevant and incongruous to the remark his disciples just made.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@l%i@e%i@g%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@t. To %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@t or %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e or simply %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ refer to the same biblical concept. The concept of the inheritance is that God has a specific place He has reserved for you, that you have claim to, and He promises to bring you to it (inheriting) and to keep you in it (salvation), and to restore you to it should you lose it (redemption). The concept of the inheritance starts in the OT with God promising Abraham a land, not only to him but to his descendants, and this land is eventually subdivided into continuously smaller pieces, down to individual, single-family lots. Such subdividing of the land is enumerated in Joshua chapters 13–22. Though the concept of the inheritance begins with God communicating to His man, His tribe, His people that He has promised them a portion of land, it then extends into the journey to get to that land and to the obedience required to take possession of that land. Some examples: Ps. 37:9,29; Prov. 10:30; Is. 14:21; Is. 57:13; 60:21). The concept is applicable beyond land to anything God promises a believer to have, which in the case of v. 25 refers to eternal life.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e…This phrase is used throughout the NT, particularly in the Gospel of John. From the face-value meaning of the words, %i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ would appear to mean life after death, but there are a couple of problems with that interpretation. First, the OT, and by extension Judaism, emphasizes the here-and-now and de-emphasizes life after death, to the point where some Jews (the Sadducees) didn’t even believe in life after death. Second, Jesus said in v. 28, “Do this and you shall live.” He’s talking about the here-and-now, not the life to come. This leaves the unanswered question: what exactly does the NT mean by the phrase %i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e? The answer comes from reading all the passages that talk about eternal life, reading them with an understanding that it’s talking about the here-and-now, not life after death, and meditating on the evidence. The answer will then present itself.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%I@T%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@o%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@.%i@ %I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@,%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@o%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@;%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r…Lit: %I@O%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@.%i@ %I@F%i@o%i@r%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@s%i@o%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@. The rendering is not entirely certain. Max & Mary claim that %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ is short for the Semitic idiom %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@w%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@.%i@ It’s universally agreed that the word %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ is to be translated %i@b%i@e%i@s%i@t. An inference is made with the word %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t, that it is one of many. Put together, it’s assumed that this paints a picture of Mary choosing between good and bad options.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Luke Chapter 11%hb~
          %u@1He happened to be praying somewhere, and just as he finished one of his disciples said to him, “Lord, teach%u@[%u@a%u@] us how to pray, just as John taught his disciples.” %u@2He said to them, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@%vn~

%r@“%R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@y%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@%vp~

%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@F%r@o%r@r%r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@.%r@%vp~

          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@“%R@A%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@b%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@
