%r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@f%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@           %u@1%u@4He was %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@d%i@d%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f casting out a deaf demon (%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@f%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s)%u@[%U@C%u@], and it so happened that when the demon left, the deaf man spoke. The crowd was amazed. %u@1%u@5But some of them said, “He casts out demons by the head demon himself, Beelzebub.” %u@1%u@6But others, testing him in order to expose a fault, time and time again were trying to get him to perform a spectacular miracle%u@[%u@e%u@]. %u@1%u@7He, though, cognizant of the inclination behind their thoughts, said to them, %r@“%R@E%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@           %u@2%u@7It so happened that, when he was in the middle of saying these things, a woman lifted her voice over the crowd, “Blessed be the womb that carried you %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@y and the breast that breast-fed you.” %u@2%u@8He, though, said, %r@“%R@O%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@r%r@y%r@—%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@t%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@9As the crowd built up more and more, he proceeded to say, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@v%r@a%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@”%R@N%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@m%r@p%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@           %u@3%u@7During the talk, the Pharisees asked him if he would dine with them, so he entered %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@l%i@d%i@ and had a seat at the table%u@[%u@t%u@]. %u@3%u@8Seeing this, the Pharisees were stunned because he hadn’t first been immersed in water before the meal. %u@3%u@9The Lord said to them, %r@“%R@R%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@G%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@S%r@t%r@u%r@p%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@D%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@s%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@J%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@”%R@E%r@n%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@—%r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@           %u@4%u@5One of the experts in the Law of Moses%u@[%u@v%u@] %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ retorts, “Teacher, these words insult us as well.” %u@4%u@6Jesus said, “%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@           %u@5%u@3After he left %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e, from there on out, the experts in the Law and the Pharisees held a terrible grudge against him, and over and over tried to get him to make off-the-cuff remarks, questioning him about many things, %u@5%u@4plotting in order to catch him in something %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ blurted out of his mouth %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g.%vn~

%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h…Verb tense specifically means, %i@r%i@u%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@y%i@ %I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n …Lit: %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@d%fn~

This is more figurative than literal, as the number %i@s%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n in the Bible signifies completion.%fn~

%u@[%u@s%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@Q%i@u%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@S%i@h%i@e%i@b%i@a%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %I@J%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %I@D%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@f%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %I@Z%i@e%i@i%i@t%i@g%i@e%i@i%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@Q%i@u%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@%fn~

%u@[%u@x%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@r%i@m…Lit: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@y%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@s%i@d%i@o%i@m…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@s%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d. A figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@z%u@]%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@a%u@a%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@b%u@]%i@j%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@n. An idiom; ref. note of Act 19:8.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@m%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@u%i@c%i@k%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@d. The GT hints that the parents and children are sharing the same bed, and if the friend could not get out of bed without stirring the children also.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m…Two points to make concerning the rendering here. First, The principle manuscripts differ in the addition or omission of a single letter which changes the rendering somewhat. The rendering of the accepted GT reads, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@-%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@-%I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e; the alternate GT reads, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n. Second, the omission of the definite article in %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@.%i@ Although the words for %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ occur in forms throughout the NT in both using and not using the definite article, in this context the omission of the definite article indicates the nature of the gift which the Father is giving, that the nature of the gift is good and never bad, and that if He’s giving the gift of a spirit, you can rest assured that it is none other than the Holy Spirit.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@(%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@f%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@)…Other manuscripts read, %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@f. The majority of the principle manuscripts read the former and not the latter. The demon was a type of harassing spirit that causes deafness.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@é%i@g%i@é%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@?…The only answer the skeptics could give to this question is that their protégés don’t rely on anyone’s help to cast out demons, because they do not nor ever will cast out demons. They’re questioning where Jesus is getting the ability to cast out demons; Jesus is asking why they don’t have any ability to cast out demons. Jesus goes on to say that whatever the answer to this question happens to be will decide whether he (Jesus) is getting help from God or from Beelzebub.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@m%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@l%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@a%i@r%i@m%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n. The GT says %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ instead of %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n in the same way that John 10:10 reads, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@ (both are a figure of speech). Also, the GT emphasizes the fact that the man is wearing armor, as v. 22 literally reads, %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ instead of,%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@d. It is the armor which turns the man a strong man, more so than the weapon he wields. His armor (and presumably a weapon to go along with it) makes him nearly invincible against someone who’s simply armed but is wearing no armor.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@e%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y…Ref. note of Matt. 12:44%fn~
%u@[%U@G%u@]%I@R%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w…The GT suggests that the Pharisees used to clean their cups and plates before each meal, likely making a ceremony out of it, and Jesus was noticing them doing it and for that reason drew up a metaphor of it as they were about to do it.%fn~
%u@[%U@H%u@]%i@a%i@v%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@c%i@e…Lit: the Gk. word %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@p%i@a%i@g%i@a%i@y%i@ (ἁρπαγή/Strong’s 724). This word refers to a physical item: a hook used to draw a bucket out of a well or a garden rake of some sort, something used to gather brush. In both cases, the purpose of the physical object is that of gathering and pulling something in. In the context of this passage here in Luke, and perhaps for most usages, %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@p%i@a%i@g%i@a%i@y%i@ is the pulling in of non-material things, immorally so. It applies not only to wealth but to fame and to other things. Therefore, %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@p%i@a%i@g%i@a%i@y can alternately be translated %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@t%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s, %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@d, or %i@r%i@a%i@p%i@a%i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y. In addition to the word %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@p%i@a%i@g%i@a%i@y%i@,%i@ the Gk. word in the NT more frequently rendered %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@t%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s or %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@d is %i@p%i@l%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@x%i@i%i@a%i@ (πλεονεξία/Strong’s 4124), which is from the root word %i@p%i@l%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@ (πλείων/Strong’s 4119), which means “too much.” %I@P%i@l%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@x%i@i%i@a is defined as, “a disposition to take more than one’s share”; in addition to meaning covetousness and greed, %i@p%i@l%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@x%i@i%i@a can also mean, “something one feels forced to do.” %I@P%i@l%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@x%i@i%i@a is the compulsion to gather an inordinate amount of material goods; %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@p%i@a%i@g%i@a%i@y is the gathering of such things, or the gathering of fame and the like. The word used in 1 Tim. 3:3 for “not covetous” is %i@a%i@p%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@g%i@u%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@ (ἀφιλάργυρος/Strong’s 866), which broken down from its concatenated roots is, %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@-%i@a%i@-%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@l%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@-%i@o%i@f%i@-%i@s%i@i%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@r. Since %i@s%i@i%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@r means %i@m%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@y, it is better rendered%i@,%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@-%i@a%i@-%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@l%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@-%i@o%i@f%i@-%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@y.%fn~
%u@[%U@I%u@]%I@J%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@—%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@—%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@-%i@l%i@i%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e…Lit: %I@B%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@m%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u. The phrase %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@m%i@s appears to be an expression or perhaps even an idiom, and its meaning is inferred from the context. It’s assumed that this phrase is a metaphor that compares the purging of what’s on the inside to someone giving alms.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Luke Chapter 12%hb~
          %u@1As the crowd was aggregating into the thousands, to the point where they were stepping on each other, first and foremost he started off by speaking to his disciples, %r@“%R@B%r@e%r@w%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@(%r@i%r@.%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@y%r@p%r@o%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@y%r@)%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@P%r@h%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@N%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@c%r@r%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@I%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@;%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@p%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@o%r@f%r@t%r@o%r@p%r@s%r@.%r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@”%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@:%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@r%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@r%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@:%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@.%r@ %R@O%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@—%r@f%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@$%r@6%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@A%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@?%r@ %R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@g%r@o%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@f%r@r%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@N%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@r%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@:%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@n%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@s%r@.%r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@”%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@f%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@s%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@f%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@l%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@           %u@1%u@3From out of the crowd someone said, “Teacher, tell my brother to split the %i@f%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@l%i@y%i@ inheritance with me.” %u@1%u@4He said, %r@“%R@M%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@d%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@b%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@?%r@” %u@1%u@5He said to them, %r@“%R@B%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@t%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@(%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@)%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@u%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@           %u@1%u@6He told them an analogy, %r@“%R@S%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@:%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@r%r@n%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@i%r@g%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@S%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@F%r@o%r@o%r@l%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@r%r@i%r@m%r@ %R@R%r@e%r@a%r@p%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@D%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@n%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@.%r@ %R@N%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@:%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@?%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@c%r@k%r@p%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@u%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@q%r@u%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@2%u@2He said to his disciples, %r@“%R@F%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@:%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@m%r@o%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@           %u@4%u@1Peter said, “Lord, are you directing this analogy at us %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ or at everyone?” %u@4%u@2The Lord said, %r@“%R@J%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@“%r@…%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@%vp~

          %u@5%u@4He proceeded to address the crowd as well, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@o%r@u%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@W%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@m%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@H%r@y%r@p%r@o%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@s%r@—%r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@c%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@k%r@y%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@c%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@?%r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%r@”%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@s%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %u@[%u@x%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o…Lit: %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ or, %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@c%i@t. There’s an implication of forced arbitration in what’s decided as the word %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ is the same word rendered %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@ in vv. 52, 53.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@D%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@$%i@6…Lit: %I@D%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@2%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@ [%i@v%i@a%i@l%i@u%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@1%i@/%i@1%i@0%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@m%i@a%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@i%i@e%i@c%i@e]. 1/10 of a drachma is a small-currency coin and is equal to 1/16 of a denarius. See note of Matt. 18:28 for denarius conversion.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@s…Certain angels surround the holy presence of God, who in addition to closing off visibility to Him, act as attendants, courtiers, servants, and the like. They form a king’s court of a sort, and just like in mediaeval or ancient times ambassadors or others, when they had an audience with the king, had an audience with his entire court and not just with the king alone. Often, matters submitted to the king were submitted to the entire court, with the king presiding over it, and the court would vet and argue the matter for the benefit of the king, with the King presiding over the interrogation and giving his final word at the end. Jesus saying that he’ll confess or deny a person in front of God’s angels means that he is doing so in God’s court, the formal venue to present matters which God presides over.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@a%i@s%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n…Ref. note of Mark 3:29 concerning the unforgiveable sin, blasphemy of the Holy Spirit.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@r%i@i%i@m%i@ %I@R%i@e%i@a%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u. The literal rendering uses (howbeit by implication) the word %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y, and in addition the word %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ is in the active voice, not passive. This usage could have one of two meanings. First, it could be an obscure reference to angels whose job it is to appear at the time of death and escort a person from this life to the next life, whether to heaven or to hell. Or second, it could be a tongue-in-cheek reference to some sort of ancient superstition of mythological creatures who appear at the appointed time of death to escort a person somehow.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@l%i@f%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@-%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@e (%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@k%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@m%i@n%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ τὸ μικρὸν ποίμνιον), (τὸ /Strong’s 3588),( μικρὸν /Strong’s 3398), (ποίμνιον/Strong’s 4168). Usage here is strange and is assumed to be an expression or an idiom. Therefore, the meaning is not presumed to be the word-for-word literal interpretation; the exact meaning of this expression is inferred from the context. Some notes on the grammatical construct of this expression in the GT:%fn~
1. The appearance of the definite article (%i@t%i@o) precludes this phrase from being in the vocative case; it must therefore be accusative%fn~
2. The word %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@m%i@n%i@o%i@n (ποίμνιον/Strong’s 4168)%i@ is the diminutive form of %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@m%i@n%i@ā%i@ (ποίμνη/Strong’s 4167)%i@.%i@ Diminutives are likely candidates for usage in expressions.%fn~
3. The use of the adjective %i@m%i@i%i@c%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@ is somewhat redundant considering that %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@m%i@n%i@o%i@n%i@ is already a diminutive, and by implication describes something small.%fn~
4. Preceded by the definite article, the adjective is attributive and not predicative, which makes it more likely to be an expression.%fn~
3. The use of the definite article means that Luke is referring to something specific.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%I@S%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@…%i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@…%i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e…The verb tense used here (the aorist) for these imperative verbs insinuate a few things. First, this tense is more emphatic than the default tense (the present). Second, it implies a one-time action. The one-time action of selling and giving doesn’t mean that there won’t be subsequent times in which this must be done, but it means that one doesn’t have to sell one’s belongings every time one accumulates belongings. Jesus is being emphatic to get them to break a mindset of hoarding possessions, hoarding them for fear of not having enough in a time of need.%fn~
%u@[%U@G%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@g%i@o %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@-%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d%i@ [%i@i%i@n]. This verse (Luke 12:50), along with 1 Cor. 10:2 and with the accounts of John the Baptist, shed light on what the word %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@ means in the Bible, and consequently what it is for a Christian to be baptized. In Luke 12:50, the baptism Jesus is referring to is his death and resurrection. In 1 Cor. 10:2, the nation of Israel was baptized into Moses by the cloud and the sea. And John the Baptist’s baptism was one of repentance. These passages on baptism reveal the following: Baptism is a totally transformative event. A person’s post-baptism life is changed entirely with respect to his pre-baptism life. The person being baptized enters into a binding contract, a covenant, of some sort. In order to undergo the transformation associated with baptism, the person being baptized must surrender his life to the transformation. After the baptism, the covenant which the person entered into is subject to terms, terms not only for the one baptized but also for God. God commits Himself to terms which consists of promises, and though a person is bound by the terms of the covenant, on the other hand he benefits from the terms God commits to, acquiring the promises. This baptism-covenant pattern summarizes Christianity: a total commitment by the one being baptized to the terms of the covenant (God’s commandments); access through faith to the promises of God (found in the Bible) which protects one from the depravations of life.%fn~
%u@[%U@H%u@]%I@A%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@s%i@o%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@…In this parable, Jesus tells his followers that each person should objectively consider both sides of a dispute he’s embroiled in, and determine if his opponent’s case is stronger than his own. Jesus is teaching them to impartially weigh the merits of both sides of the case. He repeats this point in a different parable in Luke 14:31. But in addition to objectively considering both sides to an argument, what Jesus says in vv. 57–59 is that once you weigh both sides of a dispute, you’ll find that your case is in fact the weaker of the two, and that being the situation, it would behoove you to settle the dispute between just the two of you and not let it go before a judge and have him settle it instead. This parable has several applications, the first application is that one is better “settling out of court” and receiving the remission of sins offered by Christ and not attempting to prove one’s own righteousness based on works in a courtroom before God, where the verdict will be against you. Another application is walking in the Spirit rather than walking in your plain self. If you weight the evidence, you’ll find that plain-self, as it turns out, is dominated by the carnal nature, and as such cannot fulfill the lofty requirements of the Christian life. Christians should recognize that living their life apart from the indwelling Spirit is a losing proposition and should seek to redress the problem as soon as possible.%fn~
%u@[%U@I%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@b%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@’%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@u%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@n. Some liberties taken. Up until modern times, if one couldn’t pay the fine or penalty meted out by a court settlement, then that person was thrown in prison (debtors’ prison) until he could pay. The problem, of course, is that once in prison, the debtor is no longer free to earn money to pay the fine or penalty requisite to get out of prison. Unless someone else pays it or they cut you a break on the settlement terms, you’re stuck. And this is the point Jesus makes in v. 59: once thrown in prison, you’ll get not breaks on the settlements and you’ll ever get out.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Luke Chapter 13%hb~
          %u@1Now during that same timeframe, some people who were present were telling him the news about the Galileans whom Pilate was responsible for their being slaughtered%u@[%u@a%u@]. %u@2He thought about it and replied, %r@“%R@D%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@p%r@p%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@a%r@l%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@a%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %R@G%r@a%r@l%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@f%r@u%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@?%r@—%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@C%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@—%r@i%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@O%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %R@S%r@i%r@l%r@o%r@a%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@p%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@:%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@p%r@p%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %R@J%r@e%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@a%r@l%r@e%r@m%r@?%r@—%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@C%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@:%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@—%r@i%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@6He proceeded to tell them this analogy: %r@“%R@S%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@o%r@p%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@p%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@B%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@’%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@’%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@0On %i@m%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@p%i@l%i@e Sabbaths he was teaching in one of the synagogues. %u@1%u@1Attention was directed to a woman who had had a filthy, disgusting spirit for eighteen years, who was bent over and wasn’t able to straighten herself out anymore. %u@1%u@2Seeing her, Jesus called over to her, %r@“%R@W%r@o%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@l%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@l%r@l%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@1%u@3He laid his hands on her and immediately she was restored and was glorifying God and glorifying God. %u@1%u@4The head of the synagogue considered what had happened and became indignant that Jesus treated someone on the Sabbath. He proceeded to tell the crowd, “There are six days %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@e%i@k%i@ in which work can be done; so then, go treat people on those days and not on the Sabbath.” %u@1%u@5The Lord replied, %r@“%R@H%r@y%r@p%r@o%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@f%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@x%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@k%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@a%r@b%r@b%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@—%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@’%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@c%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@A%r@b%r@r%r@a%r@h%r@a%r@m%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@—%r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %R@S%r@a%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@—%r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@—%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@A%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@—%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@f%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@n%r@d%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@i%r@c%r@u%r@l%r@a%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@a%r@b%r@b%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@1%u@7Saying these things, all those opposing him were humiliated, and the entire crowd began to rejoice over all the wonderful things he was causing to happen.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8Thereupon he proceeded to say, %r@“%R@T%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@o%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@(%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@?%r@ %R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@I%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@u%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@g%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@w%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@s%r@u%r@m%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@i%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@0Again he said, %r@“%R@T%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@I%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@r%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@x%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@w%r@l%r@-%r@s%r@i%r@z%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@t%r@c%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@j%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@d%r@d%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@r%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2He travelled throughout continuously, teaching from city to city and town to town, making his way to Jerusalem. %u@2%u@3Someone said to him, “Lord, sure are just a few people being saved (%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m), %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e?” He told them, %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@”%R@S%r@t%r@r%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@—%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@—%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@—%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@—%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@a%r@r%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@u%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%r@%%R@I%r@@%R@F%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@           %u@3%u@1About that time, some Pharisees arrived telling him, “Go now, get away from here, because Herod wants to kill you.” %u@3%u@2He told them, %r@“%R@G%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@x%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@n%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@m%r@o%r@r%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@x%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@N%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@d%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@m%r@o%r@r%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@q%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@x%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@n%r@i%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %R@J%r@e%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@a%r@l%r@e%r@m%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@”%R@J%r@e%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@a%r@l%r@e%r@m%r@…%R@J%r@e%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@a%r@l%r@e%r@m%r@…%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@J%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@t%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@o%r@l%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@f%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@s%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@B%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@o%i@m%i@ %I@P%i@i%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@l%i@a%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@m%i@ %I@P%i@i%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@x%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@s. It’s assumed that this is an idiom; it’s hard to tell what the exact meaning is.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@s…Lit: %i@o%i@w%i@e. Same root word used in Matt. 6:12 for %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ (as in %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@)%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@g%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@n… Lit: %i@v%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@y%i@a%i@r%i@d. Some liberties taken.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y…Lit: %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n…Lit: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@%fn~

%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@—%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@A%i@b%i@r%i@a%i@h%i@a%i@m…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@A%i@b%i@r%i@a%i@h%i@a%i@m%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@x%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@w%i@l%i@-%i@s%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@t%i@c%i@h…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@h%i@s. A seah is an ancient Jewish measurement; three seahs are equivalent to 27 quarts/25 liters.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@w%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@n%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@h…Ref. note of Matt. 8:12%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@o%i@t…Lit%i@:%i@ %I@B%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e. The redundant %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ is an expression and a figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@N%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@,%i@ %I@S%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@,%i@ %I@E%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@W%i@e%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@a%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@a%i@n%i@d. Assumption that this is correct.%fn~
%u@[%u@r%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@h%i@a%i@b%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@s…Lit: %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@s%u@]%I@J%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@o%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %I@B%i@e%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@t%u@]%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@s…This is the literal rendering of the GT. In v. 18, Luke writes %i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ as single word, then when quoting Jesus here in v. 16 he writes %i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ instead of the shorter %i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@.%i@ The longer form is a word-for-word translation from the Aramaic which Jesus spoke into Gk., and is preceded by the word %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ (rendered %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s). Together, the words %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ and %i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ emphasize how long she had been afflicted.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@? The phrase %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ is an expression, the keyword being %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ (%i@p%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n, πόθεν/Strong’s 4159). This expression also appears in John 7:27–28 (three times); John 8:14 (somewhat); John 9:29–30; John 19:9. The expression roughly corresponds to the English, %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@?%i@ Alternately, it may mean, %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@?; w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@?%i@;%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@?%i@;%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@’%i@ê%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@?%i@;%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@;%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@o%i@.%i@ On another note, this phrase is repeated in v. 27. The principle manuscripts differ in the reading. The accepted reading is lit. %I@I%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e; but other principal manuscripts read %I@I%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@.%i@ The latter is a shortened version of a well-known expression, readily understood and registered as such by the hearer because of the conspicuousness of the word %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Luke Chapter 14%hb~
          %u@1He happened to go to the house of some high-up Pharisee for a meal%u@[%u@a%u@] on the Sabbath, and they were watching every step that he made. %u@2As it turned out, somebody there right in front of him was afflicted with dropsy. %u@3Jesus thought a bit and said to the experts in the Law of Moses%u@[%u@b%u@] and to the Pharisees, %r@“%R@I%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@a%r@b%r@b%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@?%r@” %u@4They kept silent. He laid hold of him, healed him, and let him go. %u@5He said to them, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@k%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %R@S%r@a%r@b%r@b%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@6They weren’t able to refute this.%vn~
          %u@7He proceeded to tell an analogy to the guests, mindful of how the places of honor at the table, those seats reserved for the most important guests, were being considered and chosen. %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@“%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@d%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@o%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@g%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@m%r@p%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@           %u@1%u@2He proceeded to speak to the guests, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@u%r@n%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@…%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@           %u@1%u@5Upon hearing these things, one of the fellow guests said to him, “Blessed be whoever has a meal%u@[%u@a%u@] while a participant in God’s plan (in God’s kingdom).” %u@1%u@6He said to him, %r@“%R@S%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@e%r@w%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@n%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@A%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@n%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@%vn~
      %r@“%r@’%R@C%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@’%r@.%r@”%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@g%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@c%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@%vn~
      %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@e%r@l%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@c%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@’%r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%r@”%R@A%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@x%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@k%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@c%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@’%r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%r@”%R@A%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@.%r@’%r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@”%R@A%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@”%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@l%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@I%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@i%r@t%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@p%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@t%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@g%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@c%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@j%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@.%r@ %R@A%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@f%r@f%r@i%r@c%r@i%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@”%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@l…Lit: %i@e%i@a%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d. A restricted meal that fits within the restrictions of the Sabbath, as drinking is omitted.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@e%i@x%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@l%i@a%i@w%i@y%i@e%i@r%i@s %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@P%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@e%i@s%i@.%i@ The lawyers are presumably scribes, but the word %i@s%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@ is not explicitly used.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@f%i@i%i@x%i@i%i@n%i@’%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@c%i@c%i@u%i@p%i@y…Sans colloquialism: %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@c%i@c%i@u%i@p%i@y%i@%fn~

%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@-%i@t%i@o%i@-%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@d…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@m%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@h%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@r%i@o%i@a%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@-%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@a%i@d%i@s. Some liberties taken.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l…Lit: %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@r%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@r%i@d…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@t%i@e. An hyperbole.%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@t%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@p%i@s…Lit: %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@l%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%I@A%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@,%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r. Ref. note of Matt. 11:15.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@s…This is an expression, but an expression which is coincidental to Jesus’s own crucifixion. It means: %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@u%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@z%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@-%i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@;%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@r%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@S%i@o%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l…Lit: %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ [%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d]. It’s uncertain how this should be rendered or what this is referring to (also, see Mark 9:49,50). The interpolation %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@ is a best-guess. Some problems with this passage of vv. 34,35 is this. First, salt doesn’t just become insipid (loses its saltiness). Salt is a simple compound that doesn’t spoil like a biomass. Second, in v. 35, the suggestion is to not put the salt in the ground or the compost pile (lit: %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@l%i@e). Even if salt did lose its potency, it’s still salt, and as salt it will poison any ground or compost it’s applied to. One will never put actual salt in the ground or in a compost pile. There must be more to the story here.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Luke Chapter 15%hb~
          %u@1All of the tax collectors and the sinners%u@[%u@a%u@] were drawing near to him to listen to what he had to say. %u@2The Pharisees and the designated teachers%u@[%u@b%u@] wouldn’t stop grumbling and complaining, saying that this guy heartily welcomes%u@[%u@c%u@] sinners and dines with them. %u@3He told them this analogy, %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@“%R@D%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@t%r@y%r@-%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@d%r@d%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@’%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@c%r@c%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@j%r@o%r@i%r@c%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@O%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@b%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@c%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@.%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@-%r@f%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@!%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@L%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@j%r@o%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@
