%r@%si~
%r@“%R@A%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@j%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@:%r@%vp~
%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@%vp~
%r@%si~
%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@”%R@E%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@u%r@m%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@;%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@z%r@e%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@”%r@%nn~
          %u@1%u@9At that moment, the designated teachers and chief priests sought to lay their hands upon him, but they feared the folk, seeing that they knew that he targeted them when he spoke that analogy.%vn~
          %u@2%u@0On the lookout for an opportunity, they sent agents pretending to be honest, decent people, in order that they might trap him in something he said, so that he could be taken into custody by the chief %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ and %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@ in the jurisdiction of the governor. %u@2%u@1They asked him, “Teacher, we know that you’re straight-up when you speak and teach and that you’re not prone to partiality—not even close—you teach the exact truth of God’s way.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2”Do we have to pay taxes to Caesar or don’t we?”%vn~
          %u@2%u@3Aware of their cunning, he said to them, %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@”%R@S%r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@(%r@a%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@n%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@u%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@C%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@)%r@…%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@m%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@?%r@”%vn~
      They said, “Caesar.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@5He said to them, %r@“%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@-%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %R@C%r@a%r@e%r@s%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@C%r@a%r@e%r@s%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@-%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@6They weren’t capable enough to trap him in any of his statements in front of the folk, and %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ in awe of his answer, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ kept silent.%vn~
          %u@2%u@7Some of the Sadducees (those who say there is no life after death%u@[%u@h%u@]) approached him and asked, %u@2%u@8”Teacher, Moses wrote %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t, ‘If a man who has brothers and who has a wife dies childless, his brother should take the woman as his own wife and with his %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@’%i@s%i@ wife sire and raise a %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e descendent. %u@2%u@9Now there were seven brothers. The first got married and died childless. %u@3%u@0The second %u@3%u@1and the third also married her, etc., up to the seventh, who died without leaving a child. %u@3%u@2Last of all, the woman died. %u@3%u@3In the life-to-come, which of them will find himself married? The fact is, all seven had been married to her %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@4Jesus said to them, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@e%r@           %u@4%u@5While all the folk were hearing this, he said to his disciples, %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@”%R@B%r@e%r@w%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@g%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@b%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@e%r@t%r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@q%r@u%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@y%r@n%r@a%r@g%r@o%r@g%r@u%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@m%r@p%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@n%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@T%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@v%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@d%r@o%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@-%r@w%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@q%r@u%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@d%r@g%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~

%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@f%i@l%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@e%i@m%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@j%i@u%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@e%i@m%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@e%i@t%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@A%i@ %i@c%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@y%i@a%i@r%i@d…Jesus’s parable of the vineyard here is actually a variation of the parable in Isaiah 5:1–7. The Scribes and chief priests were caught up in the telling of the parable (v. 16 %I@H%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@b%i@i%i@d%i@!), instead of thinking on their feet and recollecting the theme of Isaiah’s original parable, which they would’ve surely been familiar with.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@E%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@;%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@z%i@e…Ref. note of Matt. 21:44%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@(%i@a%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@u%i@s%i@)…Lit: %i@d%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@u%i@s. This was a Roman coin. The Jews were forced to use currencies from other nations, but in so doing were benefitting from the Roman system which supported the currency. As beneficiaries of this system, they were obligated to support it through taxation, the point that Jesus makes. In their hypocrisy, they were reaping the benefit but despising the system bestowing it.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Luke Chapter 21%hb~
          %u@1He looked up and saw the rich laying their offerings on the offering plate%u@[%u@a%u@] %u@2and saw a widow there who was poor put in two dollars%u@[%U@A%u@], %u@3and said, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@d%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@r%r@i%r@b%r@u%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@r%r@i%r@b%r@u%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@;%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@r%r@i%r@b%r@u%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@5While a few people were talking about the temple, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ that with pledge-offerings it had been adorned in beautiful stones, he said, %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@”%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@f%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@p%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@7So they asked him, “So now, teacher, when will these things take place? And what will be the %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@l sign when these things are about to happen?” %u@8He said, %r@“%R@S%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@r%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@a%r@i%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@-%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@-%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@’%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@f%r@r%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@’%r@ %R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@r%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@f%r@l%r@i%r@c%r@t%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@v%r@o%r@l%r@u%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@f%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@:%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@N%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@m%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@1%u@0Then he kept on talking telling them, %r@“%R@N%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@b%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@z%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@e%r@t%r@h%r@n%r@i%r@c%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@t%r@h%r@n%r@i%r@c%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@p%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@p%r@l%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@o%r@r%r@m%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@q%r@u%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@&%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@g%r@u%r@e%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@C%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@r%r@r%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@r%r@r%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@g%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@k%r@y%r@.%r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@”%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@u%r@t%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@c%r@u%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@y%r@n%r@a%r@g%r@o%r@g%r@u%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@j%r@a%r@i%r@l%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@e%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@3%u@7He was teaching in the temple during the day, but he was leaving %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ and spending the night on the large hill called %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f Olives. %u@3%u@8And all the folk were getting up early each morning to listen to him in the temple.%vn~

%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@f%i@r%i@a%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%fn~

%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@w%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@h%i@y%i@s%i@i%i@c%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@k%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@b%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@n. Some liberties taken.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%I@M%i@a%i@n…Lit: %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n. Ref. Matt. 8:20.%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@a%i@w%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…This word is taken literally in this context, but on the other hand, perhaps instead it could mean a collection of people of the same mindset or an era of thought in the history of mankind.%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@g%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e…%i@g%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e…Lit: %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@y. A NT expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@d%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u. The word %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ used here in v.34 and also in v.35 has the same meaning as the way it’s used in %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m (v. 10, lit.), which talks about one group attacking another in some way or fashion.%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@e%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@l%i@a%i@x%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h. %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h is an idiom used in the OT, Gen. 7:23 for example.%fn~
%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@r%i@c%i@u%i@m%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@w%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@w%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@s. A lepton was the smallest denomination of Greek coin, and is traditionally 1/100 of a drachma, and a drachma is roughly equal to a denarius (ref. note of Matt. 18:28 for denarius conversions).%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@c%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e. Note that it is %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ rather than %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e, which is used in Mark 16:17 and elsewhere. %I@U%i@p%i@o%i@n has connotations of forcefully taking something that belongs to another, as used in v. 10, lit: %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n. Also, ref. notes of Mark 13:6, Matt. 24:4.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@f%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@&%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@g%i@u%i@e%i@s…The two Gk. words used for %i@f%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@ and %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@g%i@u%i@e%i@ in the phrase %i@l%i@i%i@m%i@o%i@y %i@k%i@a%i@i %i@l%i@o%i@i%i@m%i@o%i@y%i@ (λιμοὶ καὶ λοιμοὶ) are the words %i@l%i@i%i@m%i@o%i@s%i@ (λιμός /Strong’s 3042) and %i@l%i@o%i@i%i@m%i@o%i@s (λοιμός /Strong’s 3061) form an alliteration/assonance, giving credence to the notion that this is an expression and as such is a generalization for all sorts of calamities, not confined to the literal meaning “famine and plague.”%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@a%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a…In the Bible (for example, Rev. 13:1), the sea represents the masses of mankind; random people throughout the globe.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@p%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@s. %I@S%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@p implies straightening up after a fight. %I@L%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@s means to perk up, become optimistic, see the opportunities around you, no longer be downcast, shed your self-abasement.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Luke Chapter 22%hb~
          %u@1Now the festival of unleavened bread known as the Passover was coming up. %u@2The chief priests and the designated teachers%u@[%u@a%u@] were looking for a way to eliminate him; the fact of the matter was that they were engrossed with a fear of the folk-people. %u@3Satan had entered Judas (called Judas Iscariot), included in the twelve, %u@4and he went out and discussed with the chief priests and the captains of the temple guard how he’d go about betraying %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s and delivering him into their custody. %u@5They were thrilled, and they agreed on the amount of money to pay him. %u@6He heartily gave his spoken consent and began seeking an opportune moment when the crowd wasn’t around to betray him, to get him into their custody.%vn~
          %u@7Now the Day of Unleavened Bread arrived, the day during which the Passover sacrificial lamb had to be slaughtered. %u@8He sent for Peter and John to tell them, %r@“%R@G%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@P%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@.%r@” %u@9So they said to him, “Where do you want to have the preparations made?” %u@1%u@0He told them, %r@“%R@P%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@:%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@c%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@1%u@3They went forth and found things just like he had told them it would be and made the Passover preparations.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4When the hour %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@ came around, he sat down %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%u@[%u@b%u@], he and the missionaries%u@[%u@c%u@] together with him. %u@1%u@5He told them, %r@“%R@W%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@f%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@I%r@n%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@…%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@s%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@f%r@a%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@o%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@(%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@           %u@1%u@7Having taken a cup, he gave thanks and said, %r@“%R@T%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@r%r@i%r@b%r@u%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@I%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@g%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@i%r@e%r@l%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@o%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@(%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@9And having taken a loaf of bread, he gave thanks, %i@c%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y broke it%u@[%u@d%u@], and gave it to them, saying, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@f%r@.%r@ %R@D%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@f%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@m%r@b%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@0And %i@h%i@e %i@t%i@o%i@o%i@k the cup in like manner as the %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ dinner, saying, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@p%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@w%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@—%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@—%r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@S%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@e%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@a%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@a%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@;%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@3They, for their part, started discussing amongst themselves who then among them could be the one who intended to perpetrate this.%vn~
          %u@2%u@4There happened to also be a friendly dispute among them, namely %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f which of them he considers to be the greatest. %u@2%u@5He said, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@u%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@”%R@S%r@i%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %R@S%r@i%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@:%r@ %R@S%r@a%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@f%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@;%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@g%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@g%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@r%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@” %u@3%u@3He said to him, “Lord, as far as I’m concerned, I’m prepared to go with you to prison and to my death.” %u@3%u@4But he said, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %R@P%r@e%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@n%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@3%u@5And he said to them, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@s%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@a%r@l%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@?%r@”%r@ They said, “No.” %u@3%u@6He said, %r@“%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@s%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@;%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@.%r@ %R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@j%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@H%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@S%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@:%r@ %r@‘%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@i%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@i%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@j%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@’%r@ %R@I%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@d%r@-%r@g%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@k%r@o%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@3%u@8But they said, “Lord, take a look, there’s two swords right here.” He said, %r@“%R@J%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@,%r@ %R@O%r@k%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@?%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@9According to habit, he departed and went to the Mount of Olives. His disciples followed him %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ also. %u@4%u@0After arriving at that spot, he said to them, %r@“%R@P%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@4%u@1He, though, withdrew about a stone’s-throw away from them, planted his knees, and proceeded to pray, %u@4%u@2saying, %r@“%R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@r%r@p%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@H%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@4%u@3Now an angel was seen strengthening him.%u@[%U@C%u@] %u@4%u@4And while he was in prayer pushing himself more and more to the limit in the suspense of the impending ordeal, his sweat happened %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d like when drops of blood %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@t%i@ drip on the ground%u@[%U@D%u@]. %u@4%u@5He got up from the prayer and went towards the disciples and found them sleeping from the pain, grief, and sorrow. %u@4%u@6He said to them, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@l%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@?%r@ %R@G%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@c%r@c%r@u%r@m%r@b%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@4%u@7While he was in the middle of talking, just like that a crowd appeared, and the one named Judas—one of the Twelve—was out in front of them and got close to Jesus to kiss him. %u@4%u@8Jesus said, %r@“%R@J%r@u%r@d%r@a%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@?%r@” %u@4%u@9Seeing what was about to happen, those surrounding him said, “Let’s strike with a sword, shall we Lord?%u@[%u@m%u@]”— %u@5%u@0And one of them struck the high priest’s servant and severed his right ear. %u@5%u@1In response Jesus said, %r@“%R@E%r@n%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@—%r@l%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@‘%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@”%r@ and he touched his ear and healed him. %u@5%u@2Jesus said to those who appeared by him, chief priests, temple guard, and councilmen%u@[%u@o%u@], %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@s%r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@u%r@b%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@m%r@p%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@u%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@’%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@D%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@D%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@5%u@4They arrested him, led him %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y, and brought him into the high priest’s domicile; Peter followed at a distance. %u@5%u@5A fire had been lit in the middle of the courtyard and seats were gathered around it; Peter proceeded to sit among them. %u@5%u@6Some teenage servant girl saw him sitting in the light, stared at him, and said,%vn~
      “This guys was with him too.”%vn~
          %u@5%u@7He denied it saying, “I don’t know him, lady.”%vn~
          %u@5%u@8A little while later, another person saw him and said, “You’re one of them too.”%vn~
      But Peter said, “No I’m not, mister.”%vn~
          %u@5%u@9About an hour later someone else insisted, saying, “Seriously—this guy was with him too; fact is, he’s also a Galilean.”%vn~
          %u@6%u@0Peter said, “Mister, I don’t know what you’re talking about.”%vn~
      Immediately, while he was still in the middle of saying this, a rooster crowed. %u@6%u@1The Lord turned and looked at Peter, and Peter recalled the Lord’s statement %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t like he spoke %i@i%i@t to him, %r@“%R@B%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@d%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@6%u@2He left and went outside and wept bitterly.%vn~
          %u@6%u@3The men who were holding him began to make fun of him; while beating him %u@6%u@4blindfolded, they asked him, “Prophesy—who hit you?” %u@6%u@5And they went on and on insulting him.%vn~
          %u@6%u@6And as dawn came, the councilmen, and in addition the high priests and designated teachers, were convened in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@s the Sanhedrin, %u@6%u@7saying, “Tell us if you’re the Messiah, the Christ.”%r@ He said, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@p%r@l%r@y%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@F%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@s%r@u%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@i%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@f%r@u%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@e%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@e%r@c%r@u%r@t%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@” %u@7%u@0They all said, “Well then, are you the Son of God?”, so he said to them, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@.%r@” %u@7%u@1They said, “Why do we need %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ any more witnesses%u@[%U@E%u@]? As you can see, we heard it ourselves out of his %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ mouth.”%vn~

%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d. Some liberties taken.%fn~

%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@w%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@s%i@.%i@ Some liberties taken.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@i%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@i%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@s…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@w%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o…An idiom; ref. note of Acts 19:8.%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@l…Lit: %i@c%i@u%i@p%i@.%i@ The word %i@c%i@u%i@p%i@ used this way is a biblical idiom.%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%I@L%i@e%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@,%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@?…Or perhaps: %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@, %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%I@E%i@n%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@—%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@‘%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@e…Lit: %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s. This appears to be an expression, the meaning is not quite certain. Could also mean, %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@l%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@l%i@m%i@e%i@n…Lit: %i@e%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ or %i@e%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@e%i@c%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d. The phrase %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@ is worded as a figure of speech.%fn~
 %fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@W%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@,%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@r%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@r%i@e…Lit: (in Gk.) %i@e%i@p%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@u%i@m%i@i%i@a%i@ %i@e%i@p%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@s%i@a%i@ (Ἐπιθυμίᾳ ἐπεθύμησα), (Ἐπιθυμίᾳ /Strong’s 1939), (ἐπεθύμησα/Strong’s 1937). This redundant use of the same word, howbeit in noun and participle forms, is likely an expression, and if not an expression, would be a figure of speech (alliteration/assonance).%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@k%i@…Also: %i@e%i@n%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@p%i@i%i@c…Or: %I@T%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h. Some ambiguity, as Jesus could be taken to mean “enough of this nonsense” or “that’ll be enough swords.” The former is assumed to be correct, as it is connected to what Jesus said in v. 36: “have him sell his jacket [lit: cloak] and have him buy a sword.” What Jesus meant by this statement of v. 36 is that you’ll no longer need your cloak. Everyone owned a cloak, and most people owned just one, and it was used as a blanket at night—which would be your only blanket too. In the long-term, a cloak was an essential need of life, but in the short-term is not a necessity, like when one is engaged in moderate physical activity, since the body generates enough heat to keep oneself warm without needing a cloak for warmth. The cloak becomes necessary after the activity, of course. The sword refers to going to a war. Together, what v. 36 means is for you to get rid of your cloak since you won’t be needing it anymore, but acquire a sword in its place, since you will be needing that: You’re going to war and you’ll probably be killed. Jesus didn’t literally mean to buy a sword and go off to battle; his meaning was figurative. But the twelve didn’t see it as figurative, taking the statement literally. Jesus didn’t have enough time to explain himself, so he simply dropped the subject by saying “just forget it, ok.”%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]Verses 43 and 44 are not found in some of the most important manuscripts (KJV: “43And there appeared an angel unto him from heaven, strengthening him. 44And being in an agony he prayed more earnestly: and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood falling down to the ground.”)This passage has always been controversial, and that because of its content. Verse 43 has the same spurious feel to it as John 5:4, and verse 44 has been debated for centuries (see next note).%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@w%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d…Jesus didn’t actually sweat drops of blood; this is a simile. The rate at which his drops of sweat dripped onto the ground is compared to the rate at which, say for example, you cut your finger with a knife—the rate at which that cut bleeds. That’s a high rate of perspiration, one which occurs when a person is engaged in highly strenuous exercise, usually complicated by warmer temperatures. The fact that Jesus wasn’t physically moving and that it was chilly enough later in the night for Peter to have to warm himself around a fire makes this extraordinary. On the other hand, there’s dubious (at best) scientific evidence to back up the claim that people under extreme duress sweat blood. It simply does not happen. So if Jesus did actually sweat drops of blood, as many assert, that removes that experience of prayer out of the realm of human experience and into the super-human, even supernatural, and in this instance would have exempted him from suffering as an ordinary human being.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%I@W%i@h%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s?…By the Law of Moses, a conviction in the Jewish court required two or three witnesses.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Luke Chapter 23%hb~
          %u@1The entire group of them got up and brought him to Pilate. %u@2They proceeded to make accusations against him, saying, “We found this guy corrupting our culture, preventing people from paying Caesar taxes, and saying that he himself is a Messiah-king%u@[%u@a%u@].” %u@3So Pilate asked him, “Are you the king of Jews?”, but he answered, %r@“%r@%%R@I%r@@%R@W%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@” %u@4Pilate said to the chief priests and to the throng, “I haven’t found anything to charge this man with,” %u@5but they kept on saying more and more strenuously and assertively, “He incites the folk-people by teaching and instructing them throughout the whole %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@c%i@t of Judea. He started this in Galilee and %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y from there %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n to here.”%vn~
          %u@6After Pilate heard %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s, he asked if the man was a Galilean. %u@7Once he realized that he falls under Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him over to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem during these %i@f%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@a%i@l%i@ days. %u@8Seeing Jesus, Herod was especially delighted, since for quite a long time he’d been dying to see him owing to hearing about him time and time again, and %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@e%i@e%i@ was hoping to see him cause some supernatural sign or miracle to happen. %u@9In a good deal of remarks and statements, he asked him %i@s%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s, but he wouldn’t reply. %u@1%u@0The chief priests and the designated teachers%u@[%u@c%u@] were standing there vehemently accusing him. %u@1%u@1Herod and his soldiers together treated him with contempt, mocked him by dressing him in bright, colorful, beautiful clothing%u@[%U@A%u@], and sent him back to Pilate. %u@1%u@2That very day a friendship formed between Herod and Pilate; hitherto they had been hostile towards each other.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3Now Pilate summoned the chief priests, leaders, and the folk-people. %u@1%u@4He said to them, “You brought me this man who supposedly subverts the folk, and—as you can see—I personally examined him in front of you all and found nothing to charge him with, %u@1%u@5and—no—neither did Herod, seeing that he sent him back to us. And—as you can see—nothing worthy of death has been committed by him. %u@1%u@6So now, I’ll teach him a lesson by flogging him and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ I’ll set him free.” %u@1%u@7%u@[%U@B%u@]%vn~
          %u@1%u@8They shouted back in unison, “Get rid of this guy and let Barabbas go for us.” %u@1%u@9(This was the very person who was thrown in prison for murderer because of some insurrection which occurred in the city.)%vn~
          %u@2%u@0Again, Pilate addressed them, “%I@A%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ wanting to let Jesus go?”,%vn~
          %u@2%u@1but they kept on shouting telling him, “Crucify %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d crucify him %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e%u@[%u@d%u@]!”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2The third time he said to them, “Why? What has this guy done wrong? I’ve found nothing to charge him with which warrants the death penalty. I’ll teach him a lesson by flogging him and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ I’ll set him free.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@3But they kept on piling on in loud voices demanding that he be crucified, and their shouts were overwhelming; %u@2%u@4Pilate decided to acquiesce to their request. %u@2%u@5He freed the one thrown in prison due to an insurrection, the one they kept asking %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@,%i@ but he delivered Jesus over to their will and desire.%vn~
          %u@2%u@6As they were leading him away, they pressed into service one Simon of Cyrene, who was coming %i@h%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ from work, and put the cross on him to carry behind Jesus. %u@2%u@7A large crowd of the folk people followed him, and women who continuously thumped %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@s and wept and wailed and sang dirges. %u@2%u@8Jesus turned to them and said, %r@“%R@D%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@d%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@D%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@—%r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@—%r@d%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@B%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@g%r@n%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@r%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@f%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@…%r@%vn~
%r@%si~
%r@”%r@…%R@S%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@,%r@%vp~
%r@‘%R@F%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@’%r@%vp~
%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@s%r@,%r@%vp~
%r@‘%R@H%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@’%r@.%r@%vp~
%r@%si~
%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@”%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@l%r@y%r@-%r@c%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@u%r@m%r@b%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@-%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@?%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@C%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@”%r@%nn~
          %u@3%u@2Now he and two other criminals along with him were being led %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n to be hoisted up %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@e%i@d. %u@3%u@3When they came to the place called The Skull, there he and the criminals were crucified, one to the right and the other to the left. %u@3%u@4Jesus proceeded to say, %r@“%R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@”%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@] To divide his clothing up amongst themselves, they rolled dice%u@[%u@g%u@]. %u@3%u@5The folk-people stood %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ watching. The rulers also began ridiculing him, saying, “He rescued others; if this guy is God’s Messiah, His Christ—the Chosen One, let him rescue himself.” %u@3%u@6The soldiers also made fun of him by going up to him, bringing him spoiled-wine vinegar, %u@3%u@7and saying, “If you’re the king of the Jews, rescue yourself.” %u@3%u@8There was also a sign on top of him: “This guy is the king of the Jews.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@9One of the criminals hung %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ kept on insulting him saying, “Aren’t you the Messiah, the Christ? Rescue yourself and us as well.” %u@4%u@0But the other responded, scolding him, “Don’t you fear God even one bit because you’re facing the same sentence? %u@4%u@1Sure, we’re being treated justly; indeed we deserve what’s been meted out to us. But this guy did nothing egregious.” %u@4%u@2He said, “Jesus, remember me when you assume your preordained position in your kingdom%u@[%u@h%u@].” %u@4%u@3And he said to him, “Mark my words, you’ll be with me in Paradise today.”%vn~
          %u@4%u@4Around the time it reached noon%u@[%u@i%u@], darkness appeared over the entire land and persisted until three in the afternoon%u@[%u@i%u@], %u@4%u@5while the sun was obscured. The temple curtain was torn in two down the middle. %u@4%u@6Calling out in a loud voice, Jesus said, %r@“%R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@.%r@” %u@4%u@7Upon seeing what had happened, the centurion glorified God saying, “This man really was righteous.” %u@4%u@8And everyone in the crowd of bystanders, having witnessed what had happened, thumped their chests and began to leave. %u@4%u@9Everyone who knew him was standing at a distance to view these things, including the women from Galilee who too accompanied him as his followers.%vn~
          %u@5%u@0As events unfolded a man named Joseph, he being a councilman, and a good and righteous man %u@5%u@1(this fellow was not in agreement with the council and did not consent with what they did), from Arimathea, a city in Judea, one who was embracing God’s invitation for Him to be involved in his life (was receiving God’s kingdom)— %u@5%u@2This fellow approached Pilate and asked for Jesus’s body. %u@5%u@3He pulled him down, wrapped him in fine linen, and put him in a tomb hewn %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@c%i@k, in which nobody had yet been laid to rest.%vn~
          %u@5%u@4It was a preparation day, %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y, and the sun was about to set and %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@l%i@y begin %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@x%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y, the Sabbath%u@[%U@D%u@]. %u@5%u@5The women, those who had come down with him from Galilee, trailed behind following %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m, saw the tomb and how his body was placed, %u@5%u@6and returned and prepared fragrance and ointment.%vn~
      And while, yes, they were inactive on the Sabbath according to the commandment %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@h…%u@[%U@E%u@]%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@a%i@ %I@M%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@a%i@h%i@-%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%I@W%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y…Lit: %I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ [%i@i%i@t]; or possibly: %I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%I@C%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@i%i@f%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@i%i@f%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e…Lit:%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@i%i@f%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@i%i@f%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m. Appears to be an expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%I@D%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@e%i@s…Lit: %I@D%i@a%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@m. More precisely, it means the society women of Israel’s leading metropolis, Jerusalem, as for example used in Song of Solomon 1:5.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@c%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@“%I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@,%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@.%i@”…The principal manuscripts are divided as to whether this sentence is spurious or not.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@r%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@c%i@e…Lit: %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@t%i@s. Some liberties taken.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m…Lit: %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@o%i@n…%i@t%i@h%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@o%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@x%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@r…%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@r%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@b%i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@a%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g…In ancient times, kings, noblemen, and the rich were distinguished from the peasants by wearing this sort of clothing; hence Herod’s mocking of Jesus’s kingship.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]Verse 17 omitted by the better manuscripts%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%I@I%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@c%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@-%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@s?…The lumber Jesus is referring to is the lumber used to make a cross. The answer to Jesus’s question, %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@-%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ is that the dried-out pieces are already in use with bodies still hung on them being crucified. As a result, there are no more pieces of wood lying around which can be used to crucify everyone who’s about to be crucified. The Romans crucified criminals on a regular basis, and undoubtedly reused the same crosses over and over, keeping them in a back room or a warehouse, as this would be easier than finding wood and building a cross each time a criminal needed to be crucified. So they kept enough crosses in storage to handle the day-to-day crucifixions, and these crosses are the “dried-out%i@ pieces”%i@ referred to in this verse. However, there were instances when the Romans performed mass-crucifixions, and the fall of Jerusalem in 70AD would be one such instance. In that case, they wouldn’t have been enough crosses in storage to perform all the crucifixions, as the roads would be lined for miles with those crucified. In that case, they’d have to cut down trees to get the lumber needed for all the crucifixions, hence the “pieces of freshly-cut lumber.”%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%I@I%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@x%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@h…Lit: %I@I%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ [%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o]%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@w%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@h. Though the Gk. word for %i@d%i@a%i@w%i@n%i@ is used in the verse, scholars agree that this is referring to the beginning of a new day, which for the Jews is evening, not morning, and not sunrise per se. Some liberties taken with the wording to make this clearer to the reader.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]The sentence begun at the end of this chapter is completed in the next chapter.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Luke Chapter 24%hb~
          %u@1…%u@[%U@A%u@]Nevertheless, they got up early on Sunday, the first day of the week%u@[%U@B%u@], while it was still quite dark, and went to the tomb bringing the fragrance they had prepared. %u@2They found that the stone had been rolled away from the tomb, %u@3but after entering didn’t find the Lord Jesus’s body. %u@4While %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n were in a state of perplexity over this, out of nowhere two men in gleaming clothing unexpectedly and abruptly showed up standing right next to them%u@[%u@a%u@], %u@5and they became terrified of them. Turning their faces to the ground, they said to them, “Why are you looking for the Living One among the dead? %u@6He’s not here; he’s been resurrected instead. Remember how he spoke to you while you were still in Galilee, %u@7saying that the Man%u@[%u@b%u@] must be betrayed and taken into custody by the hands of sinners, crucified, and resurrected on the third day.”%vn~
          %u@8They remembered his remarks, %u@9returned from the tomb, and announced all these things to the eleven and to everyone else. %u@1%u@0Now Mary Magdalene, Joanna, and James’s mother Mary were %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@m%i@b. The other women who were associated with them proceeded to tell these things to the missionaries%u@[%u@c%u@]. %u@1%u@1The impression that they took away from their presentation was that their remarks were just a lot of gibberish, and they refused to believe them. %u@1%u@2But Peter got up and ran to the tomb, stooped and sees %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t the linens only, and left from there wondering to himself what had happened.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3As events unfolded, on that very same day two of them were walking into a town, they being about seven miles/eleven kilometers%u@[%U@C%u@] from Jerusalem, in %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ named Emmaus. %u@1%u@4They were conversing with one another about how all of these things had transpired%u@[%u@d%u@]. %u@1%u@5It came to pass while they were conversing, making points and counterpoints, that Jesus himself approached them and walked together with them. %u@1%u@6But their eyes were being held %i@s%i@h%i@u%i@t from recognizing him%u@[%u@e%u@]. %u@1%u@7He said to them,%vn~
      %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
      They stood still and looked depressed. %u@1%u@8The one named Cleopas replied, “Are you the only one in Jerusalem who’s totally clueless%u@[%u@f%u@]%u@ and doesn’t know what’s happened these last few days?”%vn~
          %u@1%u@9He said, %r@“%R@L%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@?%r@”%vn~
      They said, “Those things concerning Jesus of Nazareth, a man who became a mighty prophet in deed and in speech as considered by%u@[%u@h%u@] God and by all the folk-people; %u@2%u@0furthermore, how our chief priests and rulers arrested him with the goal of sentencing him to death, and they crucified him. %u@2%u@1We kept on hoping that he’s the one who’s going to do what it takes to liberate Israel; meanwhile, three days have gone by since these things happened and that hasn’t been the case. %u@2%u@2But on top of that, some of the women who hang around us but had gone on an excursion caused us to lose our minds: they were terrified when they were at the tomb %u@2%u@3and didn’t find his body there, and after returning they said that they even saw angels who appeared to them in visible form and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@s%i@ say that he’s alive. %u@2%u@4And certain members of our group left for the tomb and found things to be this way, just like the women told us, but didn’t see him.” %u@2%u@5And he said to them, %r@“%R@O%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@D%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@a%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@C%r@h%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@f%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@y%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@7And having begun from the beginning of the Old Testament and walking through it%u@[%u@i%u@], he proceeded to interpret for them all those references in the Scriptures about him.%vn~
          %u@2%u@8They got near to the town which they were going to, and he acted as if he was going to continue walking further. %u@2%u@9They urged him, “Stay with us, since evening’s approaching and the day’s already come to a close.” He entered %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ to stay with them. %u@3%u@0As a matter of course, while he was relaxed at the dinner table, he took the bread, gave thanks, broke it%u@[%u@j%u@], and gave it to them. %u@3%u@1Their eyes were opened, and they recognized him, but he left and didn’t come back%u@[%u@k%u@]. %u@3%u@2They said to each other, “Weren’t our hearts burning within us as he was speaking to us on the way %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e, as he kept on unfolding the %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ the Scriptures?” %u@3%u@3And they got up that very moment and returned to Jerusalem and found the eleven gathered together, they and those associated with them, %u@3%u@4saying that the Lord really had come back from the dead%u@[%u@l%u@] and was seen by Simon. %u@3%u@5They explained what happened on the road and how he came to be recognized by them in the breaking of bread%u@[%u@j%u@].%vn~
          %u@3%u@6While they were still speaking these %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@,%i@ he stood among them and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says to them, “Peace %i@b%i@e with you%u@[%u@m%u@].” %u@3%u@7They were startled and became frightened and thought they were looking at a ghost. %u@3%u@8He said, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@c%r@l%r@u%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@a%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@c%r@o%r@l%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@T%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@e%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@4%u@0After he said this, he showed them %i@h%i@i%i@s hands and feet. %u@4%u@1Out of the joy, wonder, and marvel %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l, they%i@ just couldn’t believe it%u@[%U@E%u@], so he said to them, %r@“%R@D%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@4%u@2They gave him a piece of broiled fish, %u@4%u@3and he took it and ate it right in front of them.%vn~
          %u@4%u@4He said to them, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@o%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@T%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@4%u@5Then he opened their minds for them to understand the Scriptures. %u@4%u@6He said, %r@“%r@…%r@%%R@I%r@@%R@T%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@           %u@5%u@0He took them all the way out to Bethany and lifted up his hands and blessed them. %u@5%u@1It so happened while he was blessing them that he parted from them and was carried up into the sky, into heaven. %u@5%u@2They worshipped him and returned to Jerusalem with great joy, %u@5%u@3and were in the temple blessing God throughout it all.%vn~

%u@[%u@p%u@]%I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t…Lit: %I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%fn~
