%u@[%U@A%u@]The sentence begun at the end of the last chapter is completed in the start of this chapter.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@e%i@k…Lit: %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@s. There were back-to-back Sabbaths here, although this plural form %I@S%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@s does not prove that in and of itself. Ref. note of Matt. 28:1.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@/%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@l%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@6%i@0%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@a (plural of %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@o%i@n). 1 stadion = 184 meters.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@o%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d…Lit: %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@u%i@p or %i@a%i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@. Unusual to find the wording %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ rather than %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@n; it’s inferred that these things came up from the ground, and the ground is where base, negative, carnal, and evil things of life originate, as insinuated in other parts of the Bible.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%I@O%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@r%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t…This is partly true in a literal sense and partly a figure of speech (ref. Matt. 28:17 for a parallel figure of speech). They believed him but were too stunned to believe him entirely, so he supplied more evidence for their physical senses.%fn~
%i@
The Gospel of John%ha~
       John’s Gospel stands apart from the other three—Matthew, Mark, and Luke, the Synoptic Gospels—in more ways than one. It’s content is different, it’s chronology is different. The Greek that John uses is very simple and is, for the most part, readily translated word-for-word into English. However, underneath the simplistic wording is an enigmatic book which makes vague, abstract generalizations it does not explain. John’s epistles are even more simplistic yet enigmatic and vague.%nv~
       On the one hand, John’s writing needs a good copy editing. Among other things, he uses the wrong verb tenses, is too ambiguous, assuming that the reader will have no problem filling in the missing content. Had I submitted something comparable to the way that John writes as a high school term paper, my English teachers would’ve marked it all up in red.%nv~
       On the other hand, John has his own peculiar meaning of words and phrases that differ from everything else in the NT and which can only be learned by studying his writings, the simple, vague phrases which are enigmatic and profound. In fact, from a language perspective, John’s Gospel should be viewed in a separate light from the remainder of the NT, so different is his writing. Inside this simple fisherman was a deeply spiritual man, one who was Semitic and not Western, one who used words and grammatical constructs his own ways and not the way everyone else does.%nv~
       Of all the books in the NT, John’s Gospel has enjoyed preeminence from the days of the early church. This is proven by the fact that the oldest surviving manuscripts NT manuscripts, and the most numerous of the oldest, are of John. And if Matthew was written to Jews, Mark to Romans, Luke to Greeks, then John was written to Christians.%nv~
%i@%sb~
John Chapter 1%hb~
          %u@1In the beginning%u@[%U@A%u@] was the Concept%u@[%U@B%u@], and the Concept was with God, and the Concept was God, %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e. %u@2This person was in the beginning with God. %u@3Through him all things came into being, and nothing which has come into being came into being apart from him. %u@4In him was life, and the Life was the light of mankind. %u@5And %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@d%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l the Light shined%u@[%U@C%u@] in the Darkness, and the Darkness couldn’t take it down, overpower it, or contain it%u@[%u@a%u@].%vn~
          %u@6A man sent from God appeared on the scene, and his name was John. %u@7This fellow came to give an official account%u@[%u@b%u@], so that he would give an account concerning the Light, so that all would believe through him. %u@8That fellow was not the Light—instead, he came in order that he would testify about the Light: %u@9It%u@[%u@c%u@] was the True Light, that which shines to all mankind, while coming into the world%i@,%i@ the established order of humans%i@.%i@ %u@1%u@0He was in and among the world and the world came into being through him, but the world didn’t know%u@[%u@d%u@] him. %u@1%u@1He went to his own particular group of people, and his own didn’t whole-heartedly welcome and embrace him%u@[%u@e%u@]. %u@1%u@2But to whomever whole-heartedly welcomed and embraced him, %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ to them he gave the authorization and power to become children of God, to those who believe and have faith in his established authority%u@[%u@f%u@], %u@1%u@3to those who %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@g%i@o%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ neither out of %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ blood%u@[%u@g%u@] nor out of a best-effort of self nor out of carnal desire%u@[%u@h%u@] nor out of the will of a man, but instead were begotten from God.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4And the Concept became flesh and set up camp%u@[%U@D%u@] among us. We beheld his glory, glory as that of an only-begotten %i@i%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@e%i@d from the Father, full of grace and truth. %u@1%u@5John testified about him, having cried out, “This fellow here is the one I referred to when I said, ‘The one who comes after me has been the center of my attention%u@[%u@i%u@], because he was (%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s)%i@ superior to me.’”%vn~
          %u@1%u@6When you get to the bottom of it all, all of us have received of his fullness, and grace piled on top of grace%u@[%u@j%u@]. %u@1%u@7When you get to the bottom of it all, the %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ Law was given through Moses; the grace and the truth %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ came into being through Jesus Christ. %u@1%u@8Nobody has seen God fully; God’s only-begotten, who’s in tight with the Father%u@[%U@E%u@]—that’s the person who brought Him out %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@b%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y.”%vn~
        %u@1%u@9John’s testimony%vn~
      When the Judean Jews%u@[%U@F%u@] sent priests and clergymen%u@[%u@k%u@] from Jerusalem to him in order to ask, “Who are you?”, %u@2%u@0he gave them a straight-up answer saying forthrightly%u@[%u@l%u@], “Me?—No, I’m not the Messiah%u@[%u@m%u@].” %u@2%u@1They asked him, %vn~
      “Just who %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u? Are you Elijah?”%vn~
      Jumping right in, he said, “No, I’m not.”%vn~
      “Are you the Prophet?”%vn~
      He answered, “No.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2So they said to him, “Who are you %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n?—%I@T%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@so we can give a reply to those who sent us. Who do you claim to be%u@[%u@n%u@]?”%vn~
          %u@2%u@3He said, “I’m a…%vn~
%si~
“…Voice shouting out in the countryside%u@[%u@o%u@]%vp~
Barricade the road the Lord will take!%vp~
%si~
“…%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ by the Prophet Isaiah.”%nn~
          %u@2%u@4Now the ones who had been sent were sent by the Pharisees. %u@2%u@5They posed a question asking, “So now, why do you perform baptisms if you’re neither the Messiah, Elijah, nor the Prophet?” %u@2%u@6John replied by saying, “My role is to baptize in water. %I@B%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@someone has taken a stand in your midst, someone whom you have no first-hand knowledge of, %u@2%u@7someone who follows in my footsteps, someone whom I’m not %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ worthy of unfastening his sandal strap.” %u@2%u@8These things took place in Bethany alongside the Jordan %I@R%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@r, the place where John was baptizing.%vn~
          %u@2%u@9The next day he saw Jesus coming towards him and said, “Look here—God’s lamb who takes away the world’s sin. %u@3%u@0This is the person whom I referred to when I said, ‘A man’s coming who’ll follow in my footsteps, a man who has become the center of my attention because he is superior to me because he was in existence before I was.’ %u@3%u@1I had no personal first-hand knowledge of him; on the contrary, %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ in order he would become known to Israel %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e. This is the reason my role was to come baptizing in water.” %u@3%u@2And John solemnly declared in a statement for the record that he had beheld the Spirit coming down out of the sky like a dove and remaining upon him from then on: %u@3%u@3”I had no personal first-hand knowledge of him; on the contrary, the One who sent me to baptize in water, He’s the One who said to me, ‘Upon whom you happen to behold the Spirit coming down and remaining upon, that’s the person who baptizes in the Holy Spirit.’ %u@3%u@4And I have beheld %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ personally and have solemnly attested that this person is the Son of God.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@5Again, the next day John was %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ standing %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e, he and two of his disciples, %u@3%u@6and saw Jesus going here and there, and interjected, “Look here—God’s lamb.” %u@3%u@7His two disciples heard him speaking and followed Jesus, %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@c%i@i%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@s. %u@3%u@8Jesus turned and saw them following him and, prompting them, said, “What can I do for you%u@[%u@p%u@]?” So they said to him, “Rabbi (which is translated ‘Teacher’), where are you staying?” %u@3%u@9Keeping their curiosity, he said, “Come and see.” So they went and saw where he was staying and remained in his company%u@[%u@q%u@] that day; it was late afternoon around four. %u@4%u@0One of the two who used to be John’s disciples who heard and became his, %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@’%i@s, disciple was Simon Peter’s brother Andrew. %u@4%u@1First thing he did was to find his brother Simon and tell him, “I’ve found the Messiah” (which translated means ‘Christ’). %u@4%u@2He led him to Jesus. Jesus saw him and said, “%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@i%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@J%r@o%r@h%r@n%r@.%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@‘%R@C%r@e%r@p%r@h%r@a%r@s%r@’%r@”%r@ (which translated means ‘Peter’).%vn~
          %u@4%u@3He wanted to depart for Galilee the next day, and he %i@w%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ finding Phillip. Jumping right in, Jesus said to him, “Be my follower.” %u@4%u@4Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the same city that Andrew and Peter were from. %u@4%u@5Philip tracked down Nathanael and, figuring he’d get a reply, said to him,%vn~
      “We found the person spoken of in the writings of the Old Testament%u@[%u@r%u@], Jesus of Nazareth son of Joseph.”%vn~
          %u@4%u@6Nathanael said, “Can anything good come out of Nazareth?”%vn~
      Philip said to him, “Come take a look.”%vn~
          %u@4%u@7Jesus saw Nathanael coming towards him and said about him, %r@“%R@C%r@h%r@e%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@—%r@a%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@n%r@u%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@-%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@-%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@,%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@s%r@r%r@a%r@e%r@l%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@u%r@p%r@l%r@i%r@c%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@”%r@ %vn~
          %u@4%u@8Nathanael, starting a conversation, said to him, “Where do you know me from?”%vn~
      Jesus replied, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %R@P%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@p%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@w%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@4%u@9Nathanael replied, “Teacher, you’re the Son of God, you’re king over Israel.” %vn~
          %u@5%u@0Jesus formulated a reply, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@w%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@?%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@5%u@1He continued, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@:%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@k%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@c%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@c%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.”%vn~

%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@a%i@n%i@y…Lit: %i@a%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@r%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@P%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@s%u@]%i@d%i@u%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@t…Lit: the Gk. word %i@d%i@o%i@l%i@o%i@s%i@ (δόλος /Strong’s 1388). Dolos originally meant “the bait used for fish.”%fn~
%u@[%u@t%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n. Ref. note of Matt. 8:20.%fn~
 %fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@I%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit (Gk): %i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@i%i@ (Ἐν ἀρχῇ), (Ἐν/Strong’s 1722), (ἀρχῇ/Strong’s 746). Same two-word introduction as is found in Gen. 1:1 of the Septuagint; this is not a coincidence. The rendering therefore the typical English Bible’s Genesis beginning so that the reader would notice the similarity. Otherwise, variations in translation could render %i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@i as “in ancient times” or something like that, as the definite article is missing from %i@b%i@e%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ which means there’s no specific beginning epoch referred to.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@C%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@W%i@o%i@r%i@d. %I@C%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t (short for %I@C%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n)%i@ taken from H.D.F. Kitto’s book %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@k%i@s: “In the works of Man, Reason and Perfection assume a symmetrical form…The Greek for Reason, in the present sense, is ‘logos’, from which the adjective ‘logical’. ‘Logos’ is usually mistranslated ‘word’: is rather ‘speech’, or, the idea which is conveyed by speech. ‘In the beginning was the Word’ really means ‘In the beginning was the Conception’…Here is the culmination of the search made by Greek thinkers for the inner reality, the ‘logos’; The Word was God.” Also, ref. note of Rom. 10:8.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@d%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@s. The use of the present tense for the past tense is a common figure of speech used in the Gospels. Ref. note of Luke 17:37. %fn~
But for this verse, this is a special figure of speech, a subcategory of the usage of present for past, one where in two consecutive, related clauses (first clause: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@D%i@a%i@r%i@k%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s; second clause: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@D%i@a%i@r%i@k%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n), the first clause uses the present tense, but is understood by the reader to be the past tense, and the following clause uses the past tense as expected. This same figure of speech is used in Rev. 12:4a, Rev. 13:14b. The usage of such a figure of speech begs the question: what idea, notion, etc. is the writer communicating beyond the face-value meaning of the words? Some guesswork is involved, but it appears that the present tense in the first clause is similar to some of the modes of the imperfect tense, where in the imperfect directs the reader to pause and ponder what was going on as the event was unfolding. In the present-then-past-tense clauses, the present tense seems to emphasize a difficulty of some sort—perhaps even a long, drawn-out ordeal—and the follow-up past tense clause states with emphasis the outcome of the difficulty.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@p…Lit: %i@d%i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ or %i@p%i@i%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t. Hearkens back to the days of Abraham and also to the sojourning in the wilderness when the people of God lived in tents. As such, it is a Figure of Speech, one used here and there in the Bible. Ref. note of Luke 16:9. It also indicates that Jesus was only to take on flesh and live among us for a brief period of time, then he would—like a nomad—fold up his tent one day, break camp, and go somewhere else.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@s%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r. Same word %i@b%i@o%i@s%i@o%i@m%i@ used for %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@s%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@A%i@b%i@r%i@a%i@h%i@a%i@m; it is the same concept. Ref. note of Luke 16:22.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@J%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@w%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@J%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@s or %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@w%i@s. John uses this word several times when he writes. It can be translated %I@J%i@e%i@w%i@s%i@ or %I@J%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@ depending on the context. When translated %I@J%i@e%i@w%i@s%i@,%i@ it refers to Jews in general, non-Gentiles. When translated %I@J%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@ (ref John 2:18, 3:1 for example), it refers to the Jews who live in Judean, as opposed to Jews who live in Galilee, etc. Also by referring to Judeans, the implication is that these are the Jews who occupy the positions of power in Israel.%fn~
%i@%sb~
John Chapter 2%hb~
          %u@1A wedding occurred on a Tuesday%u@[%U@A%u@] in Cana, Galilee, and Jesus’s mother was attending. %u@2Jesus was also invited—and so were his disciples—to the wedding. %u@3Having run out of wine, Jesus’s mother, in the heat of the moment, said to him,%vn~
      “They don’t have any wine.”%vn~
          %u@4Jesus, consumed with the comment, said, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@f%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@—%r@m%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@!%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@C%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]”%vn~
          %u@5As things were unfolding, his mother said to the waiters, “Do whatever he tells you to do.”%vn~
          %u@6Now according to the Jewish purification %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s, there were six large clay pots lying nearby, with a capacity of up to a keg or a keg and a half apiece%u@[%u@a%u@]. %u@7Jesus, on top of the situation, told them, %r@“%R@F%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%r@ They filled the pots all the way up with water. %u@8Continuing his train of thought, he told them, %r@“%R@N%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@a%r@w%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@î%r@t%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@‘%r@d%r@.%r@” So they brought %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m. %u@9As the maître ‘d tasted the water-which-had-become-wine, not knowing where it came from (the waiters who had drawn the water knew), the maître ‘d called for the groom %u@1%u@0and, going over procedures, told him, “Every person sets out the good wine first and when everyone eventually becomes tipsy %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ the lower-grade stuff. You, though, have withheld the good wine until now.” %u@1%u@1This %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@ that Jesus performed in Cana, Galilee was the first %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ of%i@ miracles %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d, and it evinced his glory and made believers out of his disciples.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2After this he went down to Capernaum, he, his mother, his brothers, and his disciples, and stayed there for many days.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3The Jewish Passover was coming up, and Jesus went down to Jerusalem. %u@1%u@4In the temple he ran across those selling cattle, sheep, and doves, and the money changers seated %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@s, %u@1%u@5and he made a whip out of a cord and drove them all out of the temple, including the sheep and the cattle. He %i@s%i@w%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e money changers’ coins %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ spilling them %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@r and overturned the tables. %u@1%u@6He told the dove sellers, %r@“%R@G%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@—%r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@u%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@r%r@c%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@l%r@e%r@t%r@!%r@”%r@ %u@1%u@7His disciples remembered a verse of Scripture %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@s, “The zeal for Your house utterly consumes me.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@8The Judean Jews, putting two plus two together, responded, “What spectacular miracle%u@[%u@b%u@] %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ demonstrate for us, seeing that you do these things?” %u@1%u@9Jesus answered, %r@“%R@B%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@i%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@0Thereupon the Judeans said, “It took forty-six years to build this temple, and you’ll erect it in three days?” %u@2%u@1But that %i@o%i@l%i@’%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@y was %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@b%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ talking about the temple of his body. %u@2%u@2So now, when he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered what he was saying %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@b%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n, and they believed the %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ Scripture and the remark which Jesus spoke to them.%vn~
          %u@2%u@3As he was in the temple in Jerusalem during the Passover, many believed that he had authority bequeathed on him%u@[%u@c%u@], seeing the miracles that he did. %u@2%u@4Jesus, however, wasn’t inclined to trust them on account of him having an understanding of everything and everyone. %u@2%u@5He didn’t need anyone to spell out plainly and clearly%u@[%u@d%u@] the aspects of human nature%u@[%u@e%u@]; the fact is, he was ever mindful of and was forever discerning human nature%u@[%u@e%u@].%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@i%i@e%i@c%i@e…Lit: %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@w%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@s. A %i@m%i@e%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@t%i@e is 8.75 gallons (40 liters); three metretes make 26.25 gallons (120 liters).%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@a%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@l%i@y…Lit: %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@.%i@ The definite article %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ before %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@,%i@ like %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@ in John 10:10, specifies an archetype rather than a specific person.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %I@T%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@d%i@a%i@y…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@T%i@h%i@i%i@r%i@d%i@ %I@D%i@a%i@y. John’s use of the attributive form of the adjective in conjunction with the definite articles means that he’s referring to something which he’s confident that the reader will know about. In fact, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@T%i@h%i@i%i@r%i@d%i@ %I@D%i@a%i@y%i@ is a variation of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@s%i@;%i@ ref. notes of Math 28:1, Mark 16:2, 1 Cor. 16:2.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@,%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@d%i@y…Lit: %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n; and expanding the inflections, %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n (%i@m%i@e and %i@y%i@o%i@u are in the dative case; the addition of the preposition %i@t%i@o%i@ is necessary when rendered to English). %I@M%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ is an expression used in the NT, and appears in Matt. 8:29, Mark 1:24, Mark 5:7, Luke 8:28 (and perhaps more). Its meaning is deduced by its usage in these various verses.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@,%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@d%i@y%i@—%i@m%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@!…This is the first miracle Jesus ever performed (ref. v. 12), and it’s significant that it occurred at a wedding. This wedding has a symbolic meaning, and what Jesus says here addresses the symbolism of the event. The wedding symbolizes God’s plan for the human race. God intended all of mankind to live life as though it were one long wedding celebration of a sort, but then sin entered into the world and spoiled the party. Wine is what generates the frivolity and lightens the mood, causing the guests to loosen up and celebrate. Wine symbolizes the means by which mankind can enter into life’s celebration. But also, as red wine has a color similar to blood, at the same time it’s symbolic of the blood Jesus shed on our behalf. The symbolism is this: the party is over until someone supplies the wine (the blood), which brings life back to a dead party. When Mary tells Jesus they have no wine, on the symbolic level, she’s telling him to give the blood which will restore the human race to its festivities. This is why Jesus replied, %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d—the time for him to shed his blood had not yet arrived.%fn~
%i@%sb~
John Chapter 3%hb~
          %u@1Now there was a man named Nicodemus who was one of the Pharisees and was a Jewish ruler. %u@2This fellow went to Jesus one night%u@[%u@a%u@] and said,%vn~
      “Rabbi, we know that you’re a teacher sent from God; the fact of the matter is, no one can perform the spectacular miracles%u@[%u@b%u@] which you perform, unless God be with him.”%vn~
          %u@3Jesus, getting to the heart of it all, replied, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@:%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@u%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@A%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@o%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@(%r@c%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@4On the heels of that, Nicodemus said, “How can a person who’s not a baby%u@[%u@d%u@] be born? It’s not possible for him to enter%i@ his mother’s womb a second time and be born.”%vn~
          %u@5Jesus replied, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@:%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@(%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@i%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@(%r@i%r@.%r@e%r@.%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@h%r@y%r@s%r@i%r@c%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@;%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@r%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@)%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@(%r@i%r@.%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@h%r@y%r@s%r@i%r@c%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@;%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@e%r@f%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@s%r@;%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@r%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@)%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@i%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@u%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@u%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@s%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@C%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@9Nicodemus answered, “How can this happen?”%vn~
          %u@1%u@0Jesus answered, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@r%r@u%r@c%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@i%r@l%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@d%r@i%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@;%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@o%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@-%r@b%r@e%r@g%r@o%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@i%r@l%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@d%r@i%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@i%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@;%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@i%r@l%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@I%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@b%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@u%r@g%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@w%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@p%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@w%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@2%u@2After these things %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ Jesus and his disciples went to Judea and started to spend time there, and he was baptizing and baptizing. %u@2%u@3Now John was also baptizing in Aenon which is near Salim, since there was a lot of water there %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@z%i@i%i@n%i@g. %I@P%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e kept on showing up flocking to him, and one after another was being baptized, %u@2%u@4as, you see, John hadn’t been thrown into jail yet. %vn~
          %u@2%u@5Now then, an argument broke out between John’s disciples and %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e Judeans concerning %i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@ purification, %u@2%u@6and they approached John and said, “Teacher, the one who was with you on the other side of the Jordan, to whom you went on record as saying, ‘Take a look here—this fellow’s doing baptisms and everyone’s migrating towards him…’” %u@2%u@7John replied, “A person can’t whole-heartedly take to heart, accept, and embrace a single thing if it hadn’t been granted to him from heaven. %u@2%u@8It was your own selves who declared to me that I am not the Messiah, but rather I’m one sent as a missionary%u@[%u@h%u@] to be a precursor to that fellow. %u@2%u@9A groom takes possession of%u@[%U@D%u@] the bride %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n he %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@w%i@l%i@y%i@w%i@e%i@d%i@s%i@’%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@.%i@ The best-man, the one who’s posted %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@ listening for him %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@d%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@y, is overwhelmed with joy%u@[%u@i%u@] upon hearing the groom’s voice. So now, this is the same joy which has been fulfilled in me. %u@3%u@0That fellow must grow %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@p%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y, while I taper off %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@p%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y.%vn~
          %u@3%u@1”The one from %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@e%i@ above who’s going %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@h is over all. The one who exists out of the %i@l%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ earth is from the earth and speaks %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ from the earth. The one who comes from heaven is over all. %u@3%u@2What he beheld and heard—this is what he’s giving an official account of, and hardly anybody at all%u@[%U@E%u@] whole-heartedly embraces and acts on his account. %u@3%u@3The one who whole-heartedly embraced his account put his stamp of approval on%u@[%u@j%u@] the fact that God is true %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d. %u@3%u@4You see, the one God sent speaks God’s sentences; indeed, He does not limit the quantity of the Spirit which He gives%u@[%u@k%u@]. %u@3%u@5The Father loves the son, and all things have been placed under his direct control%u@[%u@l%u@]. %u@3%u@6The one who believes in the son has that special fullness of life, eternal life. He who’s unconvinced and therefore disobedient, not believing in the son, won’t experience that special fullness of life; instead, the wrath of God hovers over him%u@[%u@m%u@].”%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t…Lit: %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t. The verb tense of %i@w%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ insinuates that this was a one-time visit.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@a%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@-%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@b%i@y…Lit: %i@o%i@l%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@ts…%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@y…%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n. Ref. Matt. 8:20.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@r%i@y…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@-%i@o%i@n%i@e. Same root that word %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@ is derived from.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@l%i@m%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@y…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@y%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@j%i@o%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@s. An expression; ref. note of Matt. 2:10.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%I@H%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s…Lit: %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e [or, %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@x%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@y]. A figure of speech. %fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@l…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@h%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m…Lit: %i@d%i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@b%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@s …Lit: %i@b%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@v%i@e. In the NT, the three concepts of the sky above, heaven, and the spiritual domain are conflated. %fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@w%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…The water refers to the water of repentance, such as the water baptism that John the Baptist performed. The water symbolizes a change in lifestyle. The spirit is the spiritual experience of regeneration which a person must undergo at the same time. In this regeneration, a person is reborn spiritually and the Holy Spirit comes and dwells in his regenerated spirit which is inside of him. The two, water and spirit, are the two elements of Christianity that go hand-in-hand: a change to live the right way and a spiritual life, a life in the Spirit.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@s…Also: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o .The Gk. word used for %i@w%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ here is %i@p%i@n%i@e%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@ (πνεῦμα/Strong’s 4151), the same one used for %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@;%i@ and since the definite article precedes %i@p%i@n%i@e%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@,%i@ it would be %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ instead of %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@.%i@ Jesus is referring to both the actual wind and the Holy Spirit in this sentence.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f…Also: %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g. First, %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g means that this is the moment when the woman is no longer under the authority of her father but instead comes under the authority of her husband. Second, it means directly or insinuates indirectly that the groom is having sex with the bride.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l…Lit: %i@n%i@o%i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y, as in the fuller context, %I@N%i@o%i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@y%i@.%i@ (v.33)%i@ %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e%i@.%i@ Note how John says in v. 32 that nobody received his testimony, then states the opposite in v.33, that some did receive his testimony. The word %i@n%i@o%i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ is not to be taken literally; it is a figure of speech which is something like a combination of a synecdoche and an hyperbole. A key to detecting this figure of speech is that the contradiction occurs immediately after the premise. In this case the word %i@n%i@o%i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ is followed up just a few words (not a few verses) later in v.32 with %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@y%i@.%i@ John uses this figure of speech a few times in both his Gospel and in his epistles, and it can confuse the reader if he is unaware that this is a figure of speech, and to be taken with a grain of salt and not literally. A usage of a figure of speech similar to this in English might be: %I@I%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@a%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@—%i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@—%i@n%i@o%i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@.%i@ %I@B%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@w%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@…%i@%fn~
%i@%sb~
John Chapter 4%hb~
          %u@1So now, as Jesus became aware that the Pharisees heard that he’s making more disciples and doing more baptisms than John— %u@2and yet it wasn’t Jesus himself who was doing the baptisms, but it was his disciples instead— %u@3he abandoned Judea and departed once more for Galilee, %u@4and %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@o had to go through Samaria. %u@5So he came to a Samaritan city called Sychar in the vicinity of where Jacob gave land to his son Joseph. %u@6Now one of Jacob’s wells was there, so Jesus, worn out from the trip, simply proceeded to sit down at the well. It was around noon.%vn~
          %u@7A Samaritan woman came to draw water. Striking up a conversation, Jesus said to her, “Give me a drink %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r,” %u@8seeing that his disciples had gone into the city to buy food. %u@9Engaging in the conversation, the Samaritan woman said,%vn~
      “How is it that you being a Jew ask me, a Samaritan woman, for a drink %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r?” (You see, the Jews don’t have anything to do with the Samaritans.)%vn~
          %u@1%u@0Jesus replied, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@e%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@f%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@x%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@G%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@,%r@’%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@1The woman, engaged in the conversation, said, “Sir, you don’t have any bucket and the well is deep. So where did you get this %i@s%i@o%i@-%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ Living Water from? %u@1%u@2You’re not greater than our ancestor%u@[%u@a%u@] Jacob, who gave us the well and personally drank from it on an ongoing basis (and so did his sons and his livestock), %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u?”%vn~
          %u@1%u@3Jesus answered, %r@“%R@E%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@5The woman, drawn into the dialogue, said, “Sir, give me this water, so that I’ll never get thirsty again or %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ come over here to draw water.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@6He, following right along with everything spoken, said, %r@“%R@G%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@—%r@c%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@s%r@b%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@7The woman answered, “I don’t have a husband.”%vn~
      Jesus, continuing on, told her, %r@“%R@W%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@-%r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@s%r@b%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@s%r@b%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@y%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@l%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@s%r@b%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@e%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@9The woman, still engaged, said, “Sir, I can tell that you’re a prophet. %u@2%u@0Our ancestors held their worship services%u@[%U@A%u@] on%u@[%u@d%u@] this mountain but you all say that Jerusalem is the place where worship services must be held.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@1Jesus, still continuing, told her, %r@“%R@T%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@p%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %R@J%r@e%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@a%r@l%r@e%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@p%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@;%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@p%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@c%r@u%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@T%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@—%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@—%r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@F%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@p%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@p%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@p%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@:%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@2%u@5The woman, whose interest hadn’t subsided, said, “I know that the Messiah, the one called ‘Christ,’ is coming. When that person finally does come, he’ll give us a rundown about everything and anything.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@6He continued and said, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@%%R@I%r@@%R@H%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%R@I%r@@%R@O%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@-%r@%%R@I%r@@%R@A%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@-%r@%%R@I%r@@%R@O%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@-%r@%%R@I%r@@%R@O%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@,%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@7Just then, his disciples came %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k, and they were amazed that he was in the middle of speaking to a woman. But yet, nobody said, “What are you up to?%u@[%u@i%u@]”, or, “Why are you talking to her?” %u@2%u@8So the woman left her %i@b%i@u%i@c%i@k%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ water behind and departed for the city. She said to the people %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@,%i@ %u@2%u@9”Come see a man who told me everything I did %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@n%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@l%i@l.%u@[%u@j%u@] He couldn’t be the Messiah, could he?” %u@3%u@0They left the city and started towards him.%vn~
          %u@3%u@1Meanwhile, the disciples asked him time and again, “Teacher, eat %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g.” %u@3%u@2But he said, “I have food to eat which you have no knowledge of.” %u@3%u@3The disciples started repeating to one another, “Nobody brought him anything to eat, did they?” %u@3%u@4Jesus, engaging with them, said, %r@“%R@M%r@y%r@ %r@‘%r@f%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@t%r@e%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@I%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@-%r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@h%r@s%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@’%r@?%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@y%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@p%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@u%r@n%r@n%r@e%r@l%r@-%r@v%r@i%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@—%r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@e%r@l%r@d%r@s%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@p%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@w%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@e%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@j%r@o%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@p%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@I%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@-%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@O%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@p%r@s%r@’%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@I%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@p%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@;%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@j%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@i%r@c%r@i%r@p%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@b%r@o%r@r%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@9Many from that Samaritan city believed in him through the woman’s account claiming “he told me everything I %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ did.” %u@4%u@0So as the Samaritans approached him, they kept asking him to stay with them, and he remained there for two days. %u@4%u@1Many more believed on account of his message; %u@4%u@2furthermore, they kept on telling the woman, “It’s no longer the case that we believe %i@s%i@i%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@y%i@ as a result of %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r non-stop talking. You see, we have heard and know for a fact that this fellow truly is the savior of the world, the established order of the human race.”%vn~
          %u@4%u@3From there, he departed after two days for Galilee; %u@4%u@4the fact is, Jesus frankly stated that a prophet gets no respect%u@[%u@l%u@] in his hometown and among his relatives. %u@4%u@5So when he arrived in Galilee, the Galileans welcomed him whole-heartedly%u@[%u@m%u@], everyone having seen what he did at the %I@P%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ festival in Jerusalem; for they too had gone to the festival.%vn~
          %u@4%u@6So he once more went to Cana, Galilee, where he had turned the water into wine. There was a court official in Capernaum who had a malady of some sort%u@[%u@n%u@]. %u@4%u@7This fellow heard that Jesus had come from Judea to Galilee and went out to visit him and to ask that he would come over and heal his son, seeing that he was going to die. %u@4%u@8Jesus said to him, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@a%r@c%r@u%r@l%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@4%u@9Distressed, the official said, “Sir, come over before my boy dies.” %u@5%u@0Fully aware, Jesus said, %r@“%R@G%r@o%r@—%r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@”%r@ The man believed the statement which Jesus spoke to him and proceeded to go. %u@5%u@1Now his servants had already come by to meet him saying that his boy is alive, %u@5%u@2so he inquired of them what time it was when he got better. They said that the fever broke yesterday at one o’clock in the afternoon. %u@5%u@3The father knew that that was the time which Jesus told him, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@”%r@ and he believed for himself, he and his entire household too. %u@5%u@4This was yet a second spectacular miracle which Jesus did, having left Judea for Galilee.%vn~

%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@u%i@y%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@l%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w. Similar usage of %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ as in John 3:29; ref. note there%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@i%i@n. The usage of %i@i%i@n%i@ when referring to being on a mountain idiomatic; John repeats this idiomatic usage of the word %i@i%i@n%i@ in Rev. 1:9, %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@P%i@a%i@t%i@m%i@o%i@s%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@t…Also: %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@g%i@r%i@a%i@m…Lit: %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@v%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e…Lit: %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t. The lack of a definite article emphasizes the fact that this is God’s nature.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@:%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h. A figure of speech called a hendiadys. Ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@W%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@?…Lit: %I@W%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@?%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%I@C%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@n%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@l%i@l…In a reading of the GT, the woman insinuates the added words.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@p%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@u%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@l%i@-%i@v%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@y%i@e%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@n%i@o%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@w%i@e%i@l%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@-%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@l%i@y…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@l%i@a%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s. Ref. note of Matt. 4:23.%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@a%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s (v.48); %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n (v. 54)%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@d. Some liberties taken, as the worship John is referring to are the appearances before priests at the temple in Jerusalem, where animals were offered as sacrifices, etc., and not a church or synagogue service as we know it. The feud between the Jews and the Samaritans originated years ago when the northern tribes of Israel under Rehoboam (and the Samaritans are descended from them) severed ties with Judah. A political problem arose for Rehoboam, in that the temple was in Jerusalem, which is in Judah. He figured if his newly-seceded kingdom were to continue their pilgrimages to the Jerusalem temple, their sentiments and affections, and hence their political loyalty, would eventually return to Judah. For this reason, Rehoboam instituted religious observances in the north; this Samaritan woman refers to this.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p…Jesus refers to worship, both to the OT and the NT forms of worship. The OT worship consisted of appearances before priests at the temple, which included (but was not limited to) sacrificial offerings. NT worship is not like that; NT worship in its essence is spiritual. Humans are spiritual beings, God is a spirit, and we offer Him worship out of our spirits. No physical forms are necessary to do this, but man with his religious tendencies yields to the temptation of supplanting spiritual worship with physical or emotional forms.%fn~
%i@%sb~
John Chapter 5%hb~
          %u@1After these %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@c%i@c%i@u%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@d, there was a Jewish %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@i%i@d%i@a%i@y festival, and Jesus went down to Jerusalem. %u@2Among the citizens of Jerusalem, there was a pool at the Sheep Gate (which in Aramaic is called Bethesda), which has five porticos. %u@3In these %i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@o%i@s lay a multitude of those who are feeble with sicknesses of one sort or another%u@[%u@a%u@], of the blind, the lame, and those with shriveled-up %i@l%i@i%i@m%i@b%i@s, perpetually lying there. %u@4%u@[%U@A%u@] %u@5Now there was a man with a sickness who had been there for thirty-eight years, and his sickness made him feeble. %u@6Seeing this fellow lying there, Jesus, knowing that he had been there for a long time, engaged him in conversation and said, %r@“%R@D%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@7The sick man answered, “Sir, I have no person to toss me into the pool when the water’s been agitated%u@[%U@B%u@]. While it’s %i@a%i@g%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d and I’m on my way %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@o%i@l%i@,%i@ someone else cuts in front of me.%u@[%u@b%u@]” %u@8Jesus got to the point and said, %r@“%R@G%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@,%r@ %r@p%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@” %u@9and the man got better immediately, picked his cot up, and walked around.%vn~
      But that was on a Sabbath. %u@1%u@0So now, the Judean Jews proceeded to say to the man who had been healed,%vn~
      “It’s the Sabbath, and you’re not allowed to pick up your cot and take it %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@1He replied, “The guy who made me well told me, %r@‘%R@P%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@’.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@2They asked, “Who’s the person who told you, ‘Pick it up and walk around’?” %u@1%u@3But the man who was healed didn’t know who it was; you see, Jesus had ducked out of sight and into the crowd. %u@1%u@4After all of this%u@[%u@c%u@], Jesus found him in the temple and said, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@.%r@ %R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@5The man left from there and reported to the Judeans that Jesus was the one who made him better. %u@1%u@6Because of this, the Judeans began to go after Jesus, because he did this%u@[%u@c%u@] on the Sabbath. %u@1%u@7Jesus’s reply to them was, %r@“%R@U%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %R@I%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@1%u@8So because of this, the Judeans were all the more trying to kill him, because he wasn’t just going about freeing %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s on the Sabbath, but he also kept saying that God is his own Father, making himself out to be equal to God.%vn~
          %u@1%u@9So Jesus proceeded to defend himself, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@c%r@e%r@p%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@ %R@F%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@O%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@w%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@”%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %u@[%u@a%u@]%i@f%i@e%i@e%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@k.
