%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n. Ref. note of Matt. 8:20.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h…Also: %i@d%i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e %i@a%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@t%i@y%i@p%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n…%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@t%i@y%i@p%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@…%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@e. Use of the definite article here is a figure or speech. Ref. note of John 2:25.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@f%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t…Lit: %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n [or%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h]%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@y…Lit: %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ [%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s]%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@a%i@r%i@—%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@P%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@a%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@L%i@i%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s [or perhaps, %i@h%i@i%i@s] %i@f%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r. A figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e…Also: %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@-%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@a%i@r…Lit%i@:%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@a%i@r. An expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@i%i@s%i@t %i@a%i@s %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@-%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@-%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@-%i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@o%i@n%i@e…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@a%i@m. Ref. note of Mark 13:6.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]Verses 1-11 of this chapter (and John 7:53b, the verse right before) are the story of the woman caught in adultery. For reference, this is translated in the note following. This story indeed is a beautiful illustration of the gospel, and this is the reason why it was spliced into the Gospel of John after John wrote it, as it is a spurious addition: the external evidence (i.e. the manuscript evidence) is overwhelming.%fn~
As far as the internal aspects of this passage (and this is quite subjective), the GT of this passage appears to be more polished than what John writes (John’s text is herky-jerky); this passage is more fluid and therefore easier to translate that what’s found in John’s gospel. Furthermore, John tends to shy away from using specific, descriptive words such as v. 4/%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ (%i@e%i@p%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@o%i@s,  ἐπ' αὐτοφώρῳ); vv. 6,7,8,10/%i@c%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n and %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p (%i@k%i@a%i@t%i@a%i@ %i@k%i@u%i@p%i@t%i@ō/κάτω κύψας%i@ and %i@a%i@n%i@a%i@k%i@u%i@p%i@t%i@ō/ἀνακύψας)%i@.%i@%fn~
The fact that Jesus was writing on the ground with his finger is a bit weird. It also begs the question, if Jesus was teaching in the temple, and all the temple flooring is made of stone, then how could he write something with just his finger, seeing that there’s no soil wherewith to form recognizable letters in?%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]7:53And each one went home, 8:1and Jesus went to the Mount of Olives. 2He appeared in the temple early in the morning, and all the folk-people began to come to him, and he sat teaching them. 3The Scribes and the Pharisees brought him a woman caught by surprise in adultery, and stood her right in front of everyone. 4They said to him, “Teacher, this here woman was caught in the very act of adultery. 5Now in the Law of Moses it’s commanded that such a person be stoned to death. So what do you have to say?” 6They were saying this to test him, so that they would have something to accuse him of. Jesus was crouched down and kept on writing on the ground. 7As they persisted in questioning him, he straightened up and asked them, “Let he who’s without sin throw the first stone.” 8He crouched down again and continued writing on the ground. 9One by one, the listeners began to leave, from the oldest, and he was left alone, the woman being right in front. 10Jesus straightened up and told her, “Woman, where are they? No one’s condemning you.” 11She said, “No one, Lord.” Jesus said, “Nor do I condemn you. Go and, from now on, don’t sin anymore.”%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@e…Refers to actual judging in a court of law and judging outside of a court of law, so as to draw conclusions about people so as to write them off. Ref. Matt. 7:1.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@d%i@i%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@s…Or: %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@e%i@d; %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g. This is an expression, and the first time Jesus uses it (v. 21), he uses it as an expression. When he uses it the other times (v. 24), he means it literally.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@…%i@u%i@p%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@v%i@e…The definition of these as the carnal domain and the spiritual domain respectively is confirmed in Col. 3:1,2,5%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%I@D%i@o%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@?…Various translators disagree on what exactly he meant by this fragment. In my opinion, John left out some words that he assumed the reader would understand and fill in. This is common in conversational speech, English included. In addition, it may be that the text in the UBS Gk. NT, which inserts a space and renders three letters as two words %i@o%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@ (ὅ τι), (ὅ/Strong’s 3739), (τι/Strong’s 5100)(could instead be rendered with no space in the single word %i@h%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@ %i@(whatsoever; whatever), which is the nominative singular neuter form of %i@h%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@ (whosoever; ὅστις), (ὅστις/Strong’s 3748).%fn~
%i@%sb~
John Chapter 9%hb~
          %u@1While passing through, he saw a man who had been blind from birth. %u@2His disciples asked, “Teacher, who sinned, this fellow or his parents, in order for him to have become blind?” %u@3Jesus replied, %r@“%R@N%r@e%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@W%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@u%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@A%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@u%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %R@N%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@b%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@’%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@s%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@.%r@” %u@6Having said this, he spat on the ground and formed a wad of mud out of the saliva and rubbed the mud on the %i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@’%i@s%i@ eyes, %u@7and told him, “%R@G%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@i%r@l%r@o%r@a%r@m%r@ %r@(%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@s%r@l%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@‘%R@S%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@’%r@)%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@o%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@C%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@” So he left and washed himself off %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@o%i@l and went his way able to see.%vn~
          %u@8Then the neighbors and those who used to stare at him because he was a beggar began to say,%vn~
      “Isn’t this guy the one who sits and begs?”%vn~
          %u@9Others began to say, “%I@Y%i@a%i@, that’s the guy.”%vn~
      Others began to say, “No, no, he just %i@l%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@s%i@ like him.”%vn~
      That fellow proceeded to say, “%I@U%i@h%i@-%i@u%i@h%i@, it’s me.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@0They proceeded to say, “How did you gain your sight?”%vn~
          %u@1%u@1That fellow replied, “The man called Jesus made some mud and rubbed it on my eyes and told me, %r@‘%R@G%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@i%r@l%r@o%r@a%r@m%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@o%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@.%r@’%r@ So I left, washed myself, and gained my sight.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@2They said, “Where is that fellow?”%vn~
      He %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says, “I don’t know.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@3They %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ take him (the person who used to be blind) to the Pharisees. %u@1%u@4Now the day of the week that Jesus made the mud and gave him his sight was Saturday—the Sabbath. %u@1%u@5So the Pharisees asked him once again,%vn~
      “How did you gain your sight?”%vn~
      He told them, “He put mud on my eyes, I washed myself off, and now I can see.” %vn~
          %u@1%u@6Then some of the Pharisees proceeded to say, “This guy—this…this person—is not from God, since he doesn’t keep the Sabbath.”%vn~
      But others proceeded to say, “How can a person who’s a sinner perform such miracles%u@[%u@a%u@]?” And they split into factions over him. %vn~
          %u@1%u@7So they %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ say to the blind man, “What do you have to say about him, since he gave you your sight?” He said, “He’s a prophet.” %u@1%u@8So now, the Judeans didn’t believe %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@d%i@ concerning him, that he was blind and gained his sight, until they called for the parents of the man who gained his sight. %u@1%u@9They questioned them,%vn~
      “Is this fellow your son, whom you’re saying was born blind? So how is it that he can see now?”%vn~
          %u@2%u@0His parents comeback was, “We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind, %u@2%u@1but we don’t know how it is that he can see now, nor do we know who gave him his sight. Ask him, he’s an adult. He can speak for himself %i@n%i@o%i@w.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2His parents said these things because they were consumed with the fear of the Judeans. The fact of the matter is that the Pharisees had already decided that if anyone should profess that he is%i@ the%i@ Messiah, the Christ, he’ll be excommunicated. %u@2%u@3This is the reason his parents said, “He’s an adult, ask him.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@4They then called for the man, the one who was blind, a second time and said to him, “Come clean on this and tell us the truth.%u@[%u@b%u@] We know that this man is a sinner.” %vn~
          %u@2%u@5So that fellow answered, “I have no idea if he’s a sinner. But what I do know is that I was blind and now I can see.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@6So they said, “What did he do to you? How did he grant you your sight?” %vn~
          %u@2%u@7He replied, “I told you already and you didn’t listen. Why do you want to hear it all over again? %I@S%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@l%i@y you too don’t want to become his disciples, %i@n%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u?”%vn~
          %u@2%u@8Then they gave him a tongue-lashing, “You’re that guy’s disciple?—We’re disciples of Moses. %u@2%u@9We know that God has spoken to Moses %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s, but we don’t know if this guy needs to get his head straightened out%u@[%u@c%u@].”%vn~
          %u@3%u@0The man retorted, “What’s so amazing about this is that you don’t know if he’s a wacko or not%u@[%u@c%u@], but he granted me the ability to see. %u@3%u@1We know that God doesn’t pay any regard%u@[%u@d%u@] to sinners; on the other hand, if someone is devout%u@[%u@e%u@] and does His will, he’ll give him regard. %u@3%u@2From the beginning of time, no one’s ever heard that someone granted sight to a person who’d been born blind. %u@3%u@3If this fellow isn’t from God, he wouldn’t have been able to go about doing any miracles.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@4They took this in and told him, “You were born entirely into %i@v%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ sins, and you %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@d%i@a%i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o instruct us?” And they shunned him%u@[%u@f%u@] %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@g%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@t%i@y%i@.%vn~
          %u@3%u@5Jesus heard that he’d been shunned, hunted him down, and said, “%R@D%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@3%u@6That fellow replied, “And who would that be, sir, so that I may believe in him?”%vn~
          %u@3%u@7Jesus said, %r@“%R@B%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@3%u@8He said, “I believe, sir!”, and prostrated himself before him.%vn~
          %u@3%u@9Jesus said, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@4%u@0Some of the Pharisees who were with him heard these things and said to him, “We’re not blind too, are we?”%vn~
          %u@4%u@1Jesus told them, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@.%r@ %R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%I@C%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h…Lit: %I@G%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d. An idiom used a few times in the Bible, Josh. 7:19; Acts 12:23 to name a couple of instances.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t…%i@i%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s. An expression; ref. note of Luke 13:25.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@p%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@r%i@d…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@v%i@o%i@u%i@t…Lit: %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@-%i@f%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@s%i@h%i@u%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m…Lit: %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e. Obviously, from its usage in v. 35, this is an expression. Ref. note of John 15:6.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@n. Ref. note of Matt. 8:20.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s. Ref. John 6:56.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@W%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@e…Or perhaps: %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ [or %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@s]. An unusual or incorrect grammatical case for the word %i@w%i@e%i@ causes this verse to be ambiguous. Some ancient manuscripts were modified in an attempt to resolve the ambiguity (Textus Receptus replaces %i@w%i@e%i@ with %I@I, for example).%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@s. The phrase %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@s can also be translated, %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@. John’s referring to the end of a Jewish day which occurs at sundown. A field worker would normally work—say—ten hours, but quit work early enough so there was enough time to walk home in the daylight, receive your daily wage (ref. Matt. 20:8), or whatnot. When night arrives, it gets too dark to get any work done, etc. He would only work in the field until sunset if he had to, like during harvest, when there was too much work and barely enough time to do it. This is what Jesus meant by working until there’s no more daylight—there’s way too much to do and not enough time to do it in (i.e. working overtime; crunch time). Jesus uses a similar analogy about daylight in John 11:9,10 also.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@i%i@l%i@o%i@a%i@m%i@ %i@(%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@‘%I@S%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@’%i@)%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@o%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t…The likely reason why Jesus had him dip in the pool after rubbing the saliva-mud on him is because bodily discharges of any and every sort (spittle included) are specified as unclean in the Law of Moses (ref. Lev. 15, the entire chapter). Lev. 15:5 states that one should wash himself after being in contact with a bodily discharge of any sort; hence Jesus’s instruction for the man to bathe himself. Why Jesus rubbed the saliva-mud on the man’s eyes in the first place is anyone’s guess…%fn~
%i@%sb~
John Chapter 10%hb~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@”%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@b%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@i%r@m%r@b%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@A%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@y%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@e%r@f%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@e%r@f%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@o%r@l%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@u%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@e%r@f%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@v%r@o%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@v%r@o%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@l%r@s%r@e%r@—%r@n%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@u%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@o%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@.%r@” %u@6Jesus told this allegory, but those %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@c%i@i%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@s didn’t understand what he was talking about.%vn~
          %u@7So Jesus spoke again, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@:%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@-%r@d%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@A%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@C%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@o%r@l%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@—%r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@f%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@c%r@c%r@a%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@p%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@z%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@D%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@e%r@f%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@r%r@p%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@r%r@o%r@y%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@.%r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@”%R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@A%r@w%r@e%r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@h%r@e%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@E%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@A%r@w%r@e%r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@h%r@e%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@           %u@1%u@9Yet again, the Judeans split into factions on account of this message. %u@2%u@0The majority said over and over, “He’s demon-possessed and stark-raving mad. Why does anyone listen to him?” %u@2%u@1Others said over and over, “These aren’t the words of a demon-possessed man. Can anyone who’s demon possessed give sight to the blind?”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2That was the time %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ that Hanukkah occurred in Jerusalem, it being late December. %u@2%u@3Jesus was in the temple, in the Portico of Solomon, walking around. %u@2%u@4The Judeans surrounded him and proceeded to say, “How much longer %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@r%i@k? We’re dying to know%u@[%u@f%u@]—if you’re the Messiah%u@[%u@g%u@], tell us straight up and openly.” %u@2%u@5Jesus replied, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@T%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@—%r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %R@M%r@y%r@ %R@S%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@M%r@y%r@ %R@S%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@v%r@o%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@I%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@(%r@e%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@)%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@u%r@i%r@n%r@—%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@M%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@3%u@1Once again, the Judeans hauled stones %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r in order to stone him. %u@3%u@2Jesus responded to them, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@i%r@g%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@e%r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@W%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@?%r@” %u@3%u@3The Judeans replied, “We’re not stoning you for a work that is awesome, but for blasphemy, and because you being a human being make yourself %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e God.” %u@3%u@4Jesus replied, %r@“%R@I%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@T%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@j%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@d%r@s%r@’%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@A%r@s%r@s%r@u%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@—%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@W%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %R@B%r@i%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@d%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@G%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@)%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@i%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@‘%r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@a%r@s%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@N%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@q%r@u%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@u%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@ %u@3%u@9Thereupon they proceeded to try to seize him, but he escaped from their clutches%u@[%u@o%u@].%vn~
          %u@4%u@0He departed once more to beyond the Jordan, to the place where John was originally baptizing, and he stayed there %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e. %u@4%u@1Many came to him, and they kept saying, “Sure, John never performed a miracle%u@[%u@p%u@], but everything John said about him is true.” %u@4%u@2And many there believed in him.%vn~

%u@[%u@a%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@o%i@r%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ [i.e., %i@f%i@o%i@r] %i@h%i@i%i@m. A personification.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@r%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@s…Lit: %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d. A figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e…%I@I%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n…Lit: %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e…%I@I%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e. This same idiom used in v. 11, 15, 17, 18 have similar, howbeit different, meanings. It is both the decision to risk one’s one life (v. 11, 15) and the loss of one’s life as a consequence of such a decision (v. 17, 18).%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@p%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@d%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e…Lit: %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%I@H%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@r%i@k%i@?%i@ %I@W%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w…Lit: %I@H%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y. An hyperbole.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@a%i@h…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@y or %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t…Lit: %i@i%i@f%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@B%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@a%i@c%i@q%i@u%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w [aorist subjunctive] %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w [present subjunctive]. A figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@a%i@p%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@u%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@e%i@x%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@c%i@l%i@i%i@m%i@b%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@l…Lit: %i@g%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@p. In ancient Israel, sheepfolds were enclosed with tall, formidable, stone walls, higher than the average person. These walls were to not only contain the sheep but to prevent predators and thieves from getting in.%i@%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@u%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@b%i@b%i@e%i@r. This is a hendiadys; ref. note of Matt. 3:11. The two Gk. words here for %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@ and %i@r%i@o%i@b%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@ are differentiated in a similar fashion to their English renderings. Generally speaking, a thief attempts to avoid confrontation when stealing; a robber, on the other hand, assaults the person or persons whom he steals from. A robber therefore employs physical harm and violence on a regular basis, and is a much rougher, belligerent, and violent criminal than the ordinary thief. In this hendiadys, Jesus explains that this thief is not your ordinary thief, but one who commits unwarranted and wanton acts of violence in addition to his thievery. When Jesus speaks of the thief in v. 10, the thief he refers to is the same one he describes in vv. 1,8. So the thief of v. 10 is a violent destructive thief, not just simply a larcenist.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@y…Lit: %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ [or %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f] me. First, %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ could be rendered %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@,%i@ resulting in, %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@.%i@ Second, the best manuscripts are split fairly evenly on whether the phrase %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ me/%i@p%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ is spurious or not. The Gk. phrase %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@m%i@o%i@u (πρὸ ἐμοῦ) (πρὸ /Strong’s 4253), (ἐμοῦ/Strong’s 1700) could be rendered %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ or %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e (while a face-value reading would prefer %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@,%i@ the more sensible rendering would be %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@e). No matter what’s chosen, the reader is left scratching his head trying to figure out the point that Jesus through John was trying to get across. My guess (and it is very much a guess) is that the phrase is spurious; I have added the word %i@b%i@y%i@ as a weak guess at an interpolation, which leaves unspecified the time which these thieves came by.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@z%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e. Jesus compares himself to a sheep pen door for a couple of verses. The sheep must pass through the door to get into the pen and must pass through the door to get out of the pen. While they are in the pen, they are %i@k%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@m%i@ (also v. 9). While they are out of the pen, they can %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@,%i@ i.e. eat, drink, etc. The sheep must divide their time between the pen and the pasture; they cannot stay in the one or the other for too long a period. Therefore, they are constantly being shuttled into and out of the pen, and must pass through the door—and this door is narrow—each time. If they’re in the pen for too long, they’ll need to get out; if they’re in the pasture for too long, they’ll need to get in. They must pass through the door in order to have their needs met, in summary.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%I@A%i@w%i@e%i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@h%i@e%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@d…The Gk. word behind %I@A%i@w%i@e%i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ is %i@k%i@a%i@l%i@ō%i@s%i@ (καλῶς /Strong’s 2773) and not %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@ (ἀγαθός/Strong’s 18). %I@K%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@s describes something which is beautiful on the outside; in this context, it speaks of something which is beautiful because it does what it’s supposed to do so well. Applied to being a shepherd, it describes an utra-competent, excellent, diligent, hard-working shepherd, one who excels at what a shepherd is supposed to do. A %i@k%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@s%i@ shepherd is one that others, who by viewing his actions, confirm that he’s excellent at being a shepherd—to the point of being beautiful—at his job. %I@K%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@s%i@ describes excellence by viewing what’s on the inside of a person, his actions, and does not describe (not necessarily) what’s on the inside, the attitudes of the heart, etc. On the other hand, %I@A%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s describes someone who’s good on the inside. Choosing to describe Jesus as the %I@K%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@s Shepherd rather than the %I@A%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s Shepherd doesn’t mean he’s not good on the inside, it simply means that the emphasis is on Jesus’s competency as a shepherd.%fn~
Furthermore, the term %I@A%i@w%i@e%i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@h%i@e%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@d is rendered in English as capitalized because of the use of the Gk. attributive adjective here.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d…Lit: %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@t%i@y%i@a%i@r%i@d. The definition of the Gk. word for %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@t%i@y%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@ is a courtyard enclosed by a house around its perimeter. In this verse, instead of a house, the perimeter of the courtyard is the stone wall of the sheep pen; the courtyard is the pen itself. Jesus is saying that there are other sheep out there which he owns. The sheep in the pen comprise the nation of Israel; those other sheep are the Gentile nations.%fn~
%u@[%U@G%u@]%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ [primary word %i@l%i@o%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@d]; Gk. %i@l%i@u%i@o%i@ (λύω/Strong’s 3089)%i@.%i@ The word %i@k%i@a%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@u%i@o%i@ (καταλύω/Strong’s 2647)%i@,%i@ derived from %i@l%i@u%i@o, is used in Luke 21:6 to describe the destruction of the temple by the disassembling of its stones. The temple was comprised of tightly-fitting stones; its destruction consisted of tearing these stones apart and casting them aside, completely out of place; the use of the word %i@k%i@a%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@u%i@o%i@ describes this, with the prefix %i@k%i@a%i@t%i@a%i@ meaning %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@.%i@ Therefore, a meaning of %i@l%i@u%i@o%i@ is to tear something out of its tightly-fitting location within a larger structure and casting it aside. This is what John means by his use of %i@l%i@u%i@o%i@ in this verse: removing a single verse from the Bible as though you were tearing a carefully-placed stone out of larger structure.%fn~
%i@%sb~
John Chapter 11%hb~
          %u@1There was a certain person who was laid out with an illness, Lazarus of Bethany, which is the same town that Mary and her sister Martha were from. %u@2Now it was Mary who poured oil over the Lord%u@[%u@a%u@] and wiped his feet with her hair, and it was her brother Lazarus who was ill, %u@3so the sisters sent him %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e to tell him, “Attn: Lord, your good friend is ill.” %u@4Upon hearing this, Jesus said, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@l%r@l%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@f%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@.%r@” %u@5Now Jesus loved Martha, her sister, and Lazarus, %u@6so when he heard that he was ill, he loitered in the area for two more%i@ days.%vn~
          %u@7Then, after this, he %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n says to the disciples, “%R@L%r@e%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@J%r@u%r@d%r@e%r@a%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@8The disciples tell him, “Teacher, at the moment the Judeans are trying to stone you to death, and you want to head on back again?”%vn~
          %u@9Jesus replied, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@w%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@?%r@ %R@I%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@u%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@m%r@p%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@b%r@j%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@l%r@l%r@u%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@A%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@m%r@p%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@l%r@l%r@u%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@” %u@1%u@1He said these things and he %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tells them next, %r@“%R@O%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@L%r@a%r@z%r@a%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@l%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@;%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@1%u@2So the disciples said, %r@“%R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@l%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@3Now Jesus had spoken about his death; those %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@c%i@i%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@,%i@ thought that he was talking about actual sleep. %u@1%u@4So then Jesus said to them plainly, %r@“%R@L%r@a%r@z%r@a%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@a%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@E%r@n%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@6So Thomas (called “Twin%u@[%u@b%u@]”) said to his fellow disciples, “Let’s go so we %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o die with him too%u@[%U@C%u@].”%vn~
          %u@1%u@7So Jesus went and found that he’d already been in the tomb for four days. %u@1%u@8Now Bethany was not too far from Jerusalem, just over 1¾ miles/2.7 km%u@[%u@c%u@]. %u@1%u@9Many Judeans had gone to Martha and Mary to console them over %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ their brother. %u@2%u@0So Martha, as she heard that Jesus was coming, confronted him; Mary, meanwhile, was sitting in the house. %u@2%u@1So Martha said to Jesus,%vn~
      “Lord, had you been here, our brother wouldn’t have died. %u@2%u@2But even now I know that if you were to ask God %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g, God would grant you %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@t.” %vn~
          %u@2%u@3Jesus %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@2%u@4Martha %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says, “I know that he’ll come back to life in the Resurrection, %i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@R%i@e%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %I@E%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@t, on the Day of Reckoning%u@[%u@d%u@].”%vn~
          %u@2%u@5Jesus said, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@—%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@a%r@n%r@ %R@W%R@O%R@N%r@’%R@T%r@—%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@.%r@ %R@D%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@2%u@7She %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says, “Yes, Lord. I reached the point where I believe that you yourself are the Messiah, the Christ, the Son of God who comes into the world.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@8Having said this, she left and in private called for her sister Mary, “The Teacher is here now and is calling for you.” %u@2%u@9Right as that %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ heard, she quickly got herself up and proceeded to go to him. %u@3%u@0Jesus hadn’t yet arrived in town, but instead was still at the place where Martha met him, %u@3%u@1so the Judeans who were with her in the house consoling her, seeing that Mary got up in a hurry and left, followed her, thinking she was headed out to the tomb in order to weep there. %u@3%u@2So Mary, as she went to where Jesus was, saw him, fell at his feet, telling him,%vn~
      “Lord, if you’d been here, my brother wouldn’t have died.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@3Thereupon Jesus, as he saw her crying, her and the Judeans who came with her, groaned deeply%u@[%u@e%u@] within his spirit and was deeply disturbed.%vn~
          %u@3%u@4He said, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
      They %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n say, “Lord, come take a look.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@5Jesus wept.%vn~
          %u@3%u@6So the Judeans proceeded to say, “See how close of a friend he was?”%u@3%u@7Some of them said, “Could not this fellow, who granted sight to the blind, have done something to prevent him from dying?”%vn~
          %u@3%u@8So Jesus once more groaned deeply%u@[%u@e%u@] within himself and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ arrives at the tomb. Now there was a cave there, and a stone lying at its %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e. %u@3%u@9Jesus %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says, %vn~
      %r@“%R@R%r@e%r@m%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
      The sister of the deceased, Martha, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says, “Lord, he’ll be reeking by now; it’s been four days, you see.”%vn~
          %u@4%u@0Jesus %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says, %r@“%R@D%r@i%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@4%u@1They removed the stone. Jesus lifted his eyes upwards and said, “Father, I thank you that You hear me this once. %u@4%u@2I have known that You always listen to me—that aside, on account of the crowd which is standing around I said, ‘In order they might believe that You sent me’.” %u@4%u@3Once he said these things, he cried out in a loud voice,%vn~
      %r@“%R@L%r@a%r@z%r@a%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@!%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@4%u@4He who had died exited %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@m%i@b%i@,%i@ feet bound and hands wrapped, and his face wrapped in a handkerchief. Jesus %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says, %r@“%R@L%r@o%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@4%u@5Many of the Judeans who went to Mary’s place and witnessed what he did believed in him. %u@4%u@6Some of them left, went to the Pharisees, and told them what Jesus had done. %u@4%u@7So the Pharisees and Chief Priests gathered together, convened a council, and proceeded to say, “What are we going to do, since this man performs so many miracles%u@[%u@g%u@]? %u@4%u@8If we let him keep doing this, everyone will %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ believe in him, and the Romans will take both the%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ place—%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e—and the nation %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l%i@ as well away from us. %u@4%u@9A certain one of them, %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e, Caiaphas, high priest for that year, told them, “You all don’t know a thing— %u@5%u@0you certainly haven’t figured out that it’s beneficial %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e for one man to die on behalf of the people rather than for the entire nation to be destroyed.” %u@5%u@1Now he hadn’t said this by his own volition, but rather, being that year’s high priest, he prophesied that he was intending for Jesus to die on behalf of the nation, %u@5%u@2and not just for the nation alone but in order that the children of God, the scattered ones, also be gathered into one. %u@5%u@3So from that day on, they began to conspire in order to kill him.%vn~
          %u@5%u@4So Jesus no longer went about in public among the Judeans, but departed from there instead to an area in the middle of nowhere close to the sea, to a town called Ephraim, and remained there with his disciples.%vn~
          %u@5%u@5Now the Jewish Passover was coming up and many from the area went down to Jerusalem before the Passover in order to %i@c%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y purify themselves. %u@5%u@6They kept searching for Jesus, and while standing around in the temple they kept saying to one another, “What do you think? Think he won’t come to the festival?” %u@5%u@7The chief priests and the Pharisees had issued an order that if anyone were to know or were to figure out where he might be, he was to report it, so that they could arrest him.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@p%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d…Lit: %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@i%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@t%i@w%i@i%i@n…Lit: %I@D%i@i%i@d%i@y%i@m%i@u%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@1%i@ %i@¾%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@/%i@2%i@.%i@7%i@k%i@m…Lit: %i@1%i@5%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@a. Ref. note of Luke 24:13%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@D%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@R%i@e%i@c%i@k%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %I@D%i@a%i@y. Ref. John 6:39.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@g%i@r%i@o%i@a%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@l%i@y…Same Gk. word used in Mark 1:43; ref. note there.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t…In the Gk. text, the polite form of %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ is used.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@s%fn~
 %fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@b%i@j%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@l%i@l%i@u%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d. The Gk. word for %i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t is not quite the same as the English word %i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t. In addition to its core meaning, light also means the images of objects as seen by the eye when they are illuminated by a light source. This is way it’s used here in vv. 9,10. This is usage also applies, although to a lesser degree, to Matt. 6:22,23.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@l%i@l%i@u%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d…Jesus is referring to the daylight analogy that he spoke about in 9:4,5, and assumes the disciples remember the point he made then. His point is that you have to strike while the iron is hot. There are just a finite number of instance where God performed spectacular miracles like raising Lazarus from the dead, and Jesus had to act swiftly and decisively to ensure that they took place.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%I@L%i@e%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@o…Thomas is being sarcastic, thinking that if they go to Bethany, which is near Jerusalem, those who are trying to stone Jesus to death will catch them and have them all killed. Thomas sees no sense in risking a visit to a dead man, and it doesn’t occur to him that Jesus is going to raise him from the dead.%fn~
%i@%sb~
John Chapter 12%hb~
          %u@1Six days before the Passover, Jesus went to Bethany, where Lazarus was, whom he, Jesus, raised from the dead, %u@2so they held a dinner for him there; Martha was doing the serving, but Lazarus was one of the ones relaxing at the table%u@[%u@a%u@] with him. %u@3Then Mary takes a can’s worth%u@[%u@b%u@] of fragrant ointment%u@[%u@c%u@]—the pure, genuine expensive %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@f%i@f%i@— poured it on his feet, and wiped his feet off with her hair. The house was filled with the ointment’s fragrance. %u@4Judas Iscariot, one of his disciples, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ who was going to facilitate his arrest, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says, %u@5”Why exactly wasn’t the ointment sold for $30,000%u@[%u@d%u@] and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@c%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@s%i@ donated to the poor?” %u@6Now he didn’t make this remark about the poor because he gave a hoot %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m, but because he was a thief and, being in charge of the purse, carried the donations around non-stop. %u@7So Jesus said to him, %r@“%R@L%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@e%r@m%r@o%r@r%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@m%r@b%r@a%r@l%r@m%r@e%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@9A huge crowd discovered that he was there %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@B%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@,%i@ and they came %i@b%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d not just because of Jesus but also so that they could catch a glimpse of Lazarus, whom he raised from the dead. %u@1%u@0Now the chief priests determined to kill Lazarus too, %u@1%u@1because, on account of him, many of the Judeans kept on departing %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ and believing in Jesus.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2The next day, the huge crowd which had come to the festival heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem, %u@1%u@3took branches off palm trees, went out to meet him, and loudly chanted over and over,%vn~

%si~
%u@1%u@6His disciples didn’t understand this at first, but when Jesus was glorified, they then remembered that these things were written in exact reference to him and that these things were done for him by them%u@[%u@i%u@].%nn~
          %u@1%u@7So then the crowd that was with him when he summoned Lazarus from the tomb and raised him from the dead kept attesting %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@’%i@s validity. %u@1%u@8This is also the reason that the crowd converged on him: it’s because they heard that he had performed this miracle%u@[%u@j%u@]. %u@1%u@9So the Pharisees said amongst themselves, “As you can see, nothing we’re doing is working out%u@[%u@k%u@]. Take a look—the world’s gone chasing after him to be his follower%u@[%U@B%u@].”%vn~
          %u@2%u@0Now some of those who went down to Jerusalem to worship in the festival consisted of Greek-speaking%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@w%i@s%u@[%U@C%u@]. %u@2%u@1These %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e approached Philip of Bethsaida, Galilee and asked him, “Sir, we’d like to see Jesus.” %u@2%u@2Philip %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ goes and speaks to Andrew, and both go and speak to Jesus. %u@2%u@3Jesus’s reply is, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@f%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@r%r@o%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@”%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@—%r@i%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@m%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@i%r@e%r@l%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@j%r@o%r@y%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@D%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@s%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@r%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%r@”%R@A%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@q%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@—%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@?%r@—%r@%%R@I%r@@%R@S%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%R@I%r@@%R@I%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%R@I%r@@%R@Y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@c%r@u%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@?%r@—%R@N%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@r%r@y%r@:%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@f%r@y%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@p%r@u%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@”%r@ Then a voice from heaven came forth,%vn~
%si~
Having glorified %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@y%i@,%i@ I will glorify %i@i%i@t%i@ yet again%i@%vp~
—I will do both, not just one or the other%vp~
%si~
          %u@2%u@9So then, the crowd which was standing there listening proceeded to say that thunder had occurred, but others proceeded to say, “An angel has spoken to him.” %u@3%u@0Jesus responded in this manner, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@o%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@c%r@c%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@f%r@i%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@N%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@d%r@i%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@g%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@y%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@R%r@u%r@l%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %R@S%r@y%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@m%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@H%r@u%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %R@R%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %R@L%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %R@U%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@F%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@3%u@3In the course of saying this, he was signifying the sort of death he would die, %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m. %u@3%u@4Then the crowd replied, “The Old Testament%u@[%u@n%u@] tells us that the Messiah (the Christ) remains %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %I@E%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@ forever and ever, so how can you say that the Man must be hoisted up and killed?” %u@3%u@5Jesus told them, “%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@m%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@ %R@W%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@(%r@i%r@.%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@d%r@u%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@)%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@p%r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@A%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@m%r@b%r@o%r@d%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
      Jesus spoke these things, departed, and concealed himself from them. %u@3%u@7Though he performed so many miracles right in front of them, they %i@s%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ wouldn’t believe in him, %u@3%u@8in order that the quotation from the Prophet Isaiah would be fulfilled, in which he said,%vn~
%si~
Lord, who believed our report?%vp~
And to whom has the Lord’s capabilities and actions%u@[%u@p%u@] been revealed?%vp~
%si~
%u@3%u@9They weren’t able to believe because of what Isaiah said in addition to that,%nn~
%si~
%u@4%u@0He has blinded their eyes%vp~
And hardened their hearts%vp~
So that they won’t be able to see with their eyes%vp~
And intelligently think things through in the heart%vp~
And turn %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@%vp~
And be healed by Me%u@[%u@q%u@]%vp~
%si~
%u@4%u@1Isaiah said these things because he saw His glory and spoke about Him. %u@4%u@2Nevertheless, many of the rulers believed in him in spite of %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@a%i@i%i@a%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@e%i@d, but wouldn’t profess %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@ because of the Pharisees, lest they get excommunicated. %u@4%u@3The fact is, they loved and cherished the pride and joy that mankind revels in more than the pride and joy which God revels in.%u@[%u@r%u@]%nn~
          %u@4%u@4Jesus cried out, %r@“%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@
