%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@n…Lit: %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d. Some liberties taken.%fn~
%i@%sb~
John Chapter 18%hb~
          %u@1After saying these things, Jesus, together with his disciples, departed to the other side of Kidron Creek, to where there was a garden, into which he and his disciples entered. %u@2Judas, the one who’ll facilitate his arrest, was familiar with the place, since Jesus and his disciples had gathered there often, %u@3so Judas took the platoon of soldiers %i@t%i@a%i@s%i@k%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t and some of the high priests’ and Pharisees’ attendants and gets there with lamps, torches, and weapons. %u@4Jesus, knowing everything that was about to befall him, left %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@ and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says to them,%vn~
      %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@5They replied, “Jesus of Nazareth.”%vn~
      He %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@’%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%R@I%r@@%R@O%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@-%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@-%r@%%R@I%r@@%R@O%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@-%r@%%R@I%r@@%R@O%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@.%r@”%vn~
      His betrayer Judas stood there among them.%vn~
          %u@6As he said, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@,%r@”%r@ they thereupon retreated backwards and fell on the ground%u@[%U@A%u@]. %u@7So again he asked them,%vn~
      %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
      So they said, “Jesus of Nazareth.”%vn~
          %u@8Jesus answered, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %R@S%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@9%I@H%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ in order that the remark, %r@“%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@”%r@ would be fulfilled.%vn~
          %u@1%u@0Simon Peter, in possession of a sword, hauled it out and struck the Chief Priest’s slave, slicing off his right ear (the name of the slave was Malchus). %u@1%u@1So Jesus said to Peter, %r@“%R@P%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@—%r@s%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@g%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@1%u@2So the platoon, the captain, and the Judean attendants arrested Jesus and tied him up. %u@1%u@3They went over to Annas first, as, you see, he was Caiaphas’s father-in-law, who was High Priest that year. %u@1%u@4Now it was Caiaphas who was the one who advised the Judeans that it’s beneficial that one person die on behalf of the folk people.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5Simon Peter and another disciple followed Jesus%i@.%i@ Now the Chief Priest’s %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@f%i@f%u@[%U@B%u@] was familiar with that disciple, and he entered into the Chief Priest’s courtyard together with Jesus. %u@1%u@6But Peter stood outside at the doorway. So the other disciple, the one whom the Chief Priest’s %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@f%i@f was familiar with, spoke to the doorman and he let Peter in. %u@1%u@7The doorman’s girl-servant said to Peter,%vn~
      “Aren’t you one of this man’s disciples too?”%vn~
      That fellow said, “No I’m not.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@8Now the servants and attendants made a charcoal fire and were standing there keeping warm. It was cold, you see. Peter was standing there with them keeping warm too.%vn~
          %u@1%u@9The Chief Priest asked Jesus about his disciples and about his teaching. %u@2%u@0Jesus answered, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@o%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@b%r@l%r@i%r@c%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@y%r@n%r@a%r@g%r@o%r@g%r@u%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %R@J%r@u%r@d%r@e%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@m%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@c%r@l%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@b%r@l%r@i%r@c%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@W%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@?%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@d%r@i%r@e%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@o%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@.%r@ %R@C%r@h%r@e%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@2%u@2After he said these things, one of the attendants who was standing there slapped Jesus in the face and said, “Is this any way to address the High Priest?” %u@2%u@3Jesus replied, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@r%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@f%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@%%R@I%r@@%R@I%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@r%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@ %R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%R@I%r@@%R@I%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@’%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@?%r@” %u@2%u@4Annas sent him tied up to the High Priest Caiaphas.%vn~
          %u@2%u@5Now Simon Peter was standing there keeping warm. They said to him, “You’re one of his disciples too, aren’t you?” That guy put out a denial and said, “No I’m not.” %u@2%u@6One of the high priest’s servants, a relative of the one Peter cut the ear off, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says, “Didn’t I see you in the garden with him?” %u@2%u@7Again Peter denied it, and without delay a rooster crowed.%vn~
          %u@2%u@8They took Jesus away, %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ from Caiaphas to the governor’s palace complex. Now it was early morning %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@x%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y, and they didn’t enter the palace complex, so that they wouldn’t be defiled %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %I@G%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ but instead could partake of the Passover meal. %u@2%u@9So Pilate %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@x%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ went outside to them, and they conversed:%vn~
      “What charge do you bring against this man?”%vn~
          %u@3%u@0Mustering a response, they told him, “If this guy hadn’t done anything wrong, we wouldn’t have brought him to you.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@1So Pilate told them, “Take him and prosecute him according to your code of law.”%vn~
      The Judeans told him, “It’s forbidden for us to sentence anyone to death.” %u@3%u@2%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@R%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ in order that Jesus’s statement which he made be fulfilled, in which he indicated what kind of death he was going to die. %u@3%u@3So Pilate went back into the complex, called for Jesus, and told him,%vn~
      “Are you the king of the Jews?”%vn~
          %u@3%u@4Jesus replied, %r@“%R@A%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@?%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@5Pilate replied, “I’m not a Jew, now, am I? Your own people and the high priests have handed you over to me. What have you done?”%vn~
          %u@3%u@6Jesus answered, %r@“%R@M%r@y%r@ %R@K%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@H%r@a%r@d%r@ %R@M%r@y%r@ %R@K%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@J%r@u%r@d%r@e%r@a%r@n%r@s%r@.%r@ %R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@y%r@ %R@K%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@3%u@7So Pilate said to him, “So you’re not a king?”%vn~
      Jesus replied, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@—%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@.%r@ %R@A%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@v%r@o%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@3%u@8Pilate %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says, “What is truth?”%vn~
      After saying this, he once again left %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@x%i@ to %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ the Judeans and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tells them, “I find nothing to charge him with. %u@3%u@9Now, by custom I free one person on the Passover, handing him back over to you. So have you decided that I should free the King of the Jews?” %u@4%u@0They yelled out again %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n, “Not this guy—Barabbas instead!” (Barabbas was a thug).%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@n%i@e%i@-%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@-%I@O%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@-%I@O%i@n%i@e…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@a%i@m. Ref note of Mark 13:6.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@e…O: %I@I%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@n%i@e%i@-%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@-%I@O%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@-%I@O%i@n%i@e…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@.%i@ Same words from v. 5.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d…Ref. John 17:12. Probably is itself a quotation from the OT.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o?…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@:%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@i%i@t? The cup-metaphor is used throughout the Bible.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g…%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t…Lit: %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@d%i@l%i@y…%i@i%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y…Lit: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y. Same expression used in Matt. 26:64 (ref. note there); also used in Matt. 27:11; Mark 15:2; Luke 23:3.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@b%i@o%i@r%i@n…Or: %i@b%i@e%i@g%i@o%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@A%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@“%I@I%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@,%i@”%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d…The glory and holiness of God could not be contained when Jesus spoke the words %I@I%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@,%i@ the implication, %I@I%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@n%i@e%i@-%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@-%I@O%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@-%I@O%i@n%i@e, having just come from an intense time of prayer with the Father. These two words, the revelation of the holiness of God, caused the mob to fall to the ground.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@C%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@ %I@P%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@f%i@f…Lit: %I@C%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@ %I@P%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t. The Chief Priest is a synecdoche for the Chief Priest’s staff of servants and attendants.%fn~
%i@%sb~
John Chapter 19%hb~
          %u@1Then Pilate took Jesus and had him whipped, %u@2plus the soldiers weaved a crown out of thorns and placed it on his head and clothed him in clothing one finds on a nobleman%u@[%u@a%u@]. %u@3They proceeded to go up to him and say again and again, “Pleased %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@, King of the Jews,” and slap him. %u@4Once more Pilate left %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@x%i@ and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says to them, “Hey, I’m taking him outside, %i@r%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@x%i@,%i@ so that you understand that I haven’t found anything to charge him with.” %u@5Jesus came out wearing the crown of thorns and the nobleman’s clothing. He %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tells them, “Here he is%u@[%u@c%u@]—the man %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@r.” %u@6When the chief priests and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ attendants saw him, they yelled out,%vn~
      “Crucify! Crucify!”%vn~
      Pilate %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says, “Take him and crucify him yourselves; the fact is, I haven’t found anything to charge him with.”%vn~
          %u@7The Judeans answered, “We have a code of law, and according to this code he has to die, since he made himself %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ a son of God.”%vn~
          %u@8So when Pilate heard this remark, he feared all the more, %u@9reentered the complex, and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says to Jesus, “Are you out of your mind%u@[%u@d%u@]?”%vn~
      Jesus didn’t reply.%vn~
          %u@1%u@0Pilate %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says, “You won’t talk to me? Don’t you know that I have the authority to acquit you or the authority to crucify you?”%vn~
          %u@1%u@1Jesus replied, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@c%r@e%r@p%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@B%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@2As a result of this, Pilate proceeded to try to find a way to release him.%vn~
      The Judeans yelled out, “If you set this guy free, you’re not Caesar’s friend. Everything ‘the king’ himself has done is in defiance to Caesar.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@3Pilate heard these words, brought Jesus out, and seated himself upon the judgment seat at a place called the Stone Pavement (which is Gabbatha in Aramaic). %u@1%u@4Now it was around noon on%i@ the preparation day %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@c%i@c%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e the Passover. He %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says to the Judeans,%vn~
      “Here he is%u@[%u@c%u@]—your king.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@5Those people yelled out, “Away! Away! Crucify him!”%vn~
      Pilate %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says, “Shall I crucify your king?”%vn~
      The chief priests replied, “Apart from Caesar we have no king,”%vn~
          %u@1%u@6So he then handed him over to be crucified.%vn~
      They laid hold of Jesus %u@1%u@7and, lugging his own cross, departed for something called Skull Place (which in Aramaic is Golgotha), %u@1%u@8where they crucified him, and two others with him, one here and one there, with Jesus in the middle. %u@1%u@9In addition, Pilate wrote a sign and put it on the cross; on it was written, “Jesus the Nazarene, King of the Jews.” %u@2%u@0It was written in Aramaic, Latin, and Greek, so that many of the Judeans who were near the city where Jesus was crucified could read what was written on it. %u@2%u@1The Judean chief priests proceeded to tell Pilate, “Don’t write ‘The king of the Jews,’ but instead %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@, ‘This guy said, “I’m the king of the Jews.”’” %u@2%u@2Pilate replied, “What I’ve written, I’ve written.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@3When the soldiers crucified Jesus, they took his clothing, divided them into four parts, one part for each soldier, and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e undergarment%u@[%u@e%u@]. Now the undergarment was seamless, woven in one piece from the top down, %u@2%u@4so they said to one another, “Let’s not rip it %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ but we’ll play a game of chance for it instead and one person will win it,” in order that the verse of Scripture be fulfilled:%vn~
%si~
They divvied up my outer garments among themselves%vp~
And they tossed dice%u@[%u@f%u@] for my inner garment%vp~
%si~
So—yes—the soldiers did this.%nn~
          %u@2%u@5Now Jesus’s mother stood there next to Jesus’s cross; so did his mother’s sister, as well as Mary wife of Clopas and Mary Magdalene. %u@2%u@6So Jesus, seeing %i@h%i@i%i@s mother and the disciple whom he loved standing next to her, close at hand, %i@a%i@v%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n says to %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ mother, %r@“%R@L%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@7Then he said to the disciple, %r@“%R@T%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@” And from that time onwards, the disciple took her into his household as one of his own.%vn~
          %u@2%u@8After these things %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ Jesus saw that everything had already arrived at the finishing point. In order to fulfill the Scriptures, he %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@y%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@9A container full of wine was lying there, so a sponge-full of wine was put on a stick and put to %i@h%i@i%i@s mouth. %u@3%u@0When he took the wine, Jesus said, %r@“%R@I%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@” leaned his head %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e and passed away%u@[%u@g%u@].%vn~
          %u@3%u@1Since it was the day of preparation %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@P%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r, the Judeans asked Pilate if they could break their bones into tiny pieces and take them away, so that the bodies wouldn’t remain on the crosses on the Sabbath, since that Sabbath was a high day, %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@P%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r. %u@3%u@2So the soldiers came and fragmented the bones of the first man and the bones of the other man, those crucified with him. %u@3%u@3But when they came for Jesus, as they saw that he’d already died, they didn’t fragment his bones; %u@3%u@4instead one of the solders pierced the side of his rib cage with a spear, and blood and water came out right away. %u@3%u@5One person who had seen this went on record to verify %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%u@[%u@h%u@], and his testimony is trustworthy, and that fellow knows that he’s telling the truth, so that you all too would believe %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d. %u@3%u@6In fact, these things happened so that the %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ Scripture would be fulfilled, “Not a %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e of his bones will be broken,” %u@3%u@7and not only that but another verse which says, “They will look at the one they pierced.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@8After these things %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d, Joseph of Arimathea, a disciple of Jesus who but for fear of the Judeans concealed the fact, asked Pilate if he could take Jesus’s body away, and Pilate permitted it. %u@3%u@9And Nicodemus—he who came to him at night—came too bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about 75 lbs. (33 kg.)%u@[%U@A%u@]. %u@4%u@0So they took Jesus’s body and wrapped it in fine linen with the aromas, according to the Jewish burial custom.%vn~
          %u@4%u@1Now there was a garden in the place where he was crucified, and in the garden was a new tomb in which no one had ever been laid. %u@4%u@2So on account of the Jewish day of preparation %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ because the tomb was nearby, they then put Jesus %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@.%vn~

%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@7%i@5%i@ %i@l%i@b%i@s%i@ %i@(%i@3%i@3%i@ %i@k%i@g%i@.%i@)…Lit: %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@b%i@r%i@a%i@s. 1 libra = 0.73 lbs, = 0.33 kg%fn~
%i@%sb~
John Chapter 20%hb~
          %u@1Now on Sunday%u@[%u@a%u@], while still dark, Mary Magdalene comes early to the tomb and sees that the stone had been taken away from the tomb. %u@2So she runs and comes to Simon Peter and the other disciple whom Jesus had, throughout, a close friendship with and tells them, “They took the Lord from the tomb, and we don’t know where they put him.”%vn~
          %u@3So Peter and the other disciple left and started towards the tomb. %u@4The two were running neck-and-neck, but the other disciple got out ahead of Peter and arrived at the tomb first, %u@5peered in, and sees that the linen cloth lying there, but he didn’t enter, however. %u@6%I@R%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t behind him, Simon Peter arrives too and entered the tomb and sees the linen cloth lying there %u@7along with the face cloth, which was on his head, and which was not lying with the linen cloth but was folded up separately instead and was in its own%u@[%u@b%u@] spot. %u@8Then the other disciple, the one who arrived at the tomb first, entered, saw %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e, and believed; %u@9the fact is, they still had not acquired an experience-based understanding of the %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ Scripture %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ that he must arise from the dead. %u@1%u@0So they left once more %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ to the other disciples.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1Now Mary stood crying just%i@ outside the tomb. As she cried and cried, she peered into the tomb %u@1%u@2and beholds two angels in white sitting there where Jesus’s body was lying, one at his head and one at his feet. %u@1%u@3Those %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@s%i@ tell her,%vn~
      “Lady, why are you crying?”%vn~
      She %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says, “They took my Lord away and I don’t know where they put him.” %u@1%u@4After saying these %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@,%i@ she turned around and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ sees Jesus standing there, but didn’t know that it was Jesus.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5Jesus %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tells her, %r@“%R@L%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@?%r@ %R@W%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
      That woman%i@ thought that he was the gardener and tells him, “Sir, if you hauled him off, tell me where you put him, and I’ll take him away.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@6Jesus %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says, %r@“%R@M%r@a%r@r%r@y%r@!%r@”%r@%vn~
      That woman turned to him%i@ and says in Aramaic, “Rabbi!” (i.e. “Teacher”). %vn~
          %u@1%u@7Jesus %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says to her, %r@“%R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@;%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@c%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@e%r@t%r@.%r@ %R@N%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@r%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@c%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@’%r@” %u@1%u@8Mary Magdalene goes and announces to the disciples, “I have seen the Lord,” and %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ he told her these things.%vn~
          %u@1%u@9While it was early that Sunday, and while the doors where the disciples were at had been shut %i@t%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t due to the fear of the Judeans, Jesus came and stood in their midst and tells them, %r@“%R@P%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@0After saying this, he showed them%i@ his hands and the side of his rib cage. So the disciples rejoiced, seeing the Lord. %u@2%u@1Jesus told them once more, %r@“%R@P%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@ %R@J%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@2After saying this, he breathed on them and tells them, %r@“%R@R%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@H%r@o%r@l%r@y%r@ %R@S%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@i%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@-%r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@’%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@;%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@2%u@4Now Thomas (i.e. Twin%u@[%u@d%u@]), one of the Twelve, wasn’t with them when Jesus came %i@b%i@y%i@.%i@ %u@2%u@5So the other disciples proceeded to tell him, “We have seen the Lord.” But he told them, “If I don’t get to see the nail holes in his hands and poke my finger into the holes and reach my hand into his rib cage, there’s no way I’m going to believe %i@i%i@t.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@6Eight days later his disciples once again were %i@g%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ inside, and Thomas was with them %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e. While the doors were shut %i@t%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t, Jesus %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ comes, stood in their midst, and says, %r@“%R@P%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@7Then he tells Thomas, %r@“%R@B%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@b%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@u%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@f%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@8In response to it all, Thomas said to him, “My Lord and my God.” %u@2%u@9Jesus %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tells him, %r@“%R@B%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@-%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@?%r@ %R@B%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@3%u@0So, yes, Jesus performed many miracles%u@[%u@g%u@] and a variety of them in front of his disciples, ones that aren’t recorded in this book %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@B%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%u@[%U@A%u@]. %u@3%u@1But these %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@s have been recorded so that you all would acquire faith that Jesus is the Messiah—the Christ—the Son of God, and so that, while faith is being acquired, you would have %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ life through the authority vested in him%u@[%u@h%u@].%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%I@S%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@y…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t [%i@d%i@a%i@y] %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@s [%i@w%i@e%i@e%i@k]. The NT in various places refers to days of the week this way. Ref. note of Matt. 28:1.%fn~

%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%I@T%i@w%i@i%i@n…Lit. Gk: %I@D%i@i%i@d%i@y%i@m%i@u%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@b%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g…In the Gk. text, the polite form of the imperative for %i@b%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ is used%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@f%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e…%i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@s…Or: %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s…%i@r%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@s%i@%fn~

%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@b%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@B%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@o%i@o%i@k. This refers to the Gospel of John only. Liberties taken.%fn~
%i@%sb~
John Chapter 21%hb~
          %u@1After these things Jesus manifested himself once more to the disciples at the Sea of Tiberias. Now this is the way he made his appearance: %u@2Simon Peter; Thomas (i.e. “Twin”); Nathanael, who was from Cana, Galilee; the sons of Zebedee; and two of his other disciples were together. %u@3Simon Peter %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tells them, “I’m going fishing.” They %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ say, “We’re coming with you.” They left, boarded the boat %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ and caught nothing that night.%vn~
          %u@4Now it had already become early %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g. Jesus stood on the shore; the disciples however didn’t know it was him. %u@5So Jesus says, %r@“%R@B%r@o%r@y%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@A%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@d%r@i%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@—%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@—%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@?%r@” They replied, “No.” %u@6So he said, %r@“%R@C%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@r%r@b%r@o%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@.%r@” So they cast %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@t%i@ and could barely haul it in due to the huge number of fish. %u@7That disciple whom Jesus loved and loved %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says to Peter, “It’s the Lord!” Simon Peter, after he heard that it’s the Lord, took off the coat which was wrapped around him (he was naked %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h, you see) and dove into the sea. %u@8But the other disciples came in%i@ with the boat, seeing that they were not far from land, no, %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l, %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y about 100 yards/90 meters%u@[%U@C%u@] away, dragging the net %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@ of%i@ fish.%vn~
          %u@9As they got out onto the dry ground, they see a charcoal fire spread out %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ and grilled fish laid on top of%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@,%i@ plus bread. %u@1%u@0Jesus %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tells them, %r@“%R@P%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@1So Simon Peter went over and dragged the net full of enormous fish onto the land, 153 %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l. The net didn’t tear, even though there were so many %i@f%i@i%i@s%i@h.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2Jesus %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tells them, %r@“%R@C%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@f%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@.%r@” Now none of the disciples dared to question who he was—they knew he was the Lord. %u@1%u@3Jesus %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ comes and takes the bread and passes it out to them, and the grilled fish likewise. %u@1%u@4This is the third time Jesus appeared to the disciples after he was raised from the dead.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5When they finished with breakfast, Jesus %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n says to Simon Peter, %r@“%R@S%r@i%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@J%r@o%r@h%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@D%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
      He tells him, “Yes, Lord, you know I love you as a close friend does.”%vn~
      He %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tells him, %r@“%R@F%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@m%r@b%r@s%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@6He %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says a second time, “Simon son of John, do you love me?”%vn~
      He %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tells him, “%R@Y%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
      He %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tells him, “Be a shepherd%u@[%u@b%u@] to my sheep.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@7He %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says a third time, %r@“%R@S%r@i%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@J%r@o%r@h%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
      Peter was grieved that he said to him a third time, %r@“%R@D%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@?%r@” He %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says to him, “Lord, you know all things; you understand that I love you as a close friend.”%vn~
      Jesus %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says to him, %r@“%R@F%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@”%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@—%R@I%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@:%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@o%r@l%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@r%r@e%r@t%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@E%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@”%r@ %u@1%u@9He said this signifying and insinuating what sort of death he will glorify God %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h. After he said this, he %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tells him, %r@“%R@F%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@2%u@0Peter turns to face and look at the disciple who was following %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@,%i@ the one whom Jesus loved and loved, the person who also was the one leaning against him at the dinner%u@[%u@e%u@] %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ and said, “Lord, who’s your betrayer?” %u@2%u@1Looking at this fellow, Peter %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says to Jesus, “Lord, now what about this fellow?” %u@2%u@2Jesus %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tells him, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@m%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@?%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@3So this statement circulated among the comrades%u@[%u@f%u@], that that disciple won’t %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ die. Now Jesus didn’t tell him that he wouldn’t die, rather, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@ %R@W%R@E%R@R%R@E%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@W%R@A%R@N%R@T%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@m%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@F%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@…%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@2%u@4This is the disciple, the one who’s going on record and giving an official account%u@[%u@g%u@] about these things and the one who’s writing%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@B%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@.%i@ And we know that his official account is trustworthy.%vn~
          %u@2%u@5Now there’s a lot of other things that Jesus did, %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@ that if every detail were to be written down one-by-one, my hunch is that there wouldn’t be enough room in the world to store all the scrolls that would be written.%vn~

%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e…It’s unclear what the antecedent of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ is. It’s could either refer to fish or refer to the other disciples.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@d…Or: %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d; %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r%fn~

%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~

%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@b%i@o%i@y%i@s…Not unusual in a lot of cultures to address grown men who are at work as %i@b%i@o%i@y%i@s%i@.%i@ This is done in the Deep South; in France, waiters are called garcon (boy).%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@d%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e—%i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@s%i@h…The Gk. word here for %i@e%i@d%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ occurs once in the NT and the lexicon is sparse on detail. The word is derived from %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d, and I’m guessing the prefix changes its meaning to %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@y%i@-%i@t%i@o%i@-%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@.%i@ The Gk. experts say that the word means %i@f%i@i%i@s%i@h, but they probably deduce this from the context.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@1%i@0%i@0%i@ %i@y%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@/%i@9%i@0%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@2%i@0%i@0%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@b%i@i%i@t%i@s. 1 cubit = 18 inches.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%I@S%i@i%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@J%i@o%i@h%i@n…Jesus speaking to him formally, somewhat like a mother talking to a misbehaving son using the full form of his first name, plus the middle and last names (for example: %I@W%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@a%i@m%i@ %I@P%i@a%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@ %I@S%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@h instead of just %I@B%i@i%i@l%i@l).%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@y [Lit: %i@g%i@i%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u] %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@o…Church tradition says that Peter was crucified in his old age, and that this statement refers to his crucifixion. %I@S%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ refers to Peter stretching his hands out to have them nailed to a cross, and %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ refers to taking the cross and posting it in the ground.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@i%i@f%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@i%i@n…The point John’s making is that Jesus is speaking hypothetically; he didn’t really intend for John to stay on the earth until his second coming.%fn~
%fn~
%i@
Acts%ha~
       Luke writes another long treatise for Theophilus, who may have been his former master, a sequel to his Gospel. He picks up the story as he left off in his Gospel, and by the time he reaches Acts 16:10 the narrative switches from %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ to %i@w%i@e, as Luke joins Paul on his journeys.%nv~
       The book is named Acts of the Apostles, but it might be better named Acts of the Early Church.%nv~
       Luke at times will break into long sentences, like Acts 2:30,31. Of course, this long sentence is a quotation from Peter, and in that passage Luke captures a side of Peter which is unseen in the Gospels. In that spontaneous oration of Acts 2—which is one of the high points of the entire book—Peter follows a train of thought through a few quotations from the Old Testament with remarkable clarity and agility, to the point that even his opponents marveled at his newly-found rhetorical abilities (Acts 4:13). These came from the Holy Spirit which came upon him on Pentecost.%nv~
       More so than the other Gospel writers, Luke’s command of Greek allows him to pepper the text with a word here or there, broadening the meaning with nuanced implications, some of which take an entire half-sentence to convey to the English reader. An example this is in Luke 2:39, where he adds an additional word (%i@a%i@n%i@d).%nv~
       Luke has a knack for finding imaginative metaphors. For example, in Acts 1:17 he compares Judas’s misfortune of being the one who betrays Jesus to someone who casts lots and loses. In Acts 2:1, the counting of days until Pentecost uses a term commonly used by ship captains as they fill their quota of cargo or tackle or whatnot before setting sail. In Acts 9:1, Paul is “still huffing [lit: breathing] murderous threats at the Lord’s disciples.” Interspersing hyperbole with metaphor, Acts 17:21 says, “Now all Athenians and foreigners who reside in Athens have no time for anything other than talking about or hearing about something novel.”%nv~
       Luke quietly introduces Paul (Saul)—who after Jesus is the most influential figure in Christianity—in Acts 7:58 by showing him in the backdrop of the stoning of Stephen, letting the circumstances describe who Paul was rather than a description itself. Luke uses this introduction to transition from Stephen’s stoning at the end of the seventh chapter into Paul’s zealous persecution at the beginning of the eighth, eventually culminating in Saul’s conversion. In his deft use of indirection, in Acts 12:18, instead of directly saying “…a lot of commotion took place..,” he says instead, “When daylight came, no small amount of commotion took place among the soldiers.”%nv~
       An additional benefit gleaned from Luke’s narrative here is that it sheds light on expressions and idioms used throughout the NT. There are several occurrences of the expression “name of Jesus” where a character is doing this or that in the name of Jesus. The student of the Bible deduces the underlying meaning of the name of Jesus by its preponderance in Acts. Another example is “enter God’s kingdom” (Acts 14:22): the context of this verse indicates that this is an idiom, and one should keep that in mind when Jesus says how difficult it is for a rich man to enter God’s kingdom.%nv~
       In the earlier chapters of Acts, much of the dialog and wording sheds light on certain NT concepts. The fourth chapter specifies what the name of Jesus is; in Acts 4:9, we have captured in writing an incident of testing the Lord, and this expanded understanding of what it is to test the Lord sheds light on other NT verses, in this case for example, Matt. 4:7, 1 Cor. 10:9.%nv~
       To top it off, a pattern emerges in the story line, and it goes like this: a miracle occurs, the miracles draws the undivided attention of those who witness it, as their attention is captured, the message of the Gospel is delivered, and those who hear it are converted. Treats like that are found by those who look for them.%nv~
%i@%sb~
Acts Chapter 1%hb~
          %u@1Indeed now—the previous composition which I drafted about everything, oh Theophilus, about what Jesus proceeded to do and do and teach and teach %u@2up until the day he was taken up %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ having left orders with the apostles through the Holy Spirit—apostles whom he had %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ hand-picked. %u@3After his suffering, he also appeared to them alive using many demonstrations and proofs, making himself visible to them over the course of forty days and discussing matters related to God’s kingdom. %u@4While they were assembled, he commanded them not to leave Jerusalem %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e, but instead to wait for the Father’s promise (%i@q%i@u%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s),%vn~
      %r@“%r@…%R@W%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@W%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@—%r@y%r@e%r@s%r@—%R@J%r@o%r@h%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@p%r@t%r@i%r@z%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@p%r@t%r@i%r@z%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@H%r@o%r@l%r@y%r@ %R@S%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@6Indeed now—when they were gathered together, they kept asking him over and over, “Lord, is this the moment in time you’re going to reinstate Israel as its own sovereign nation%u@[%u@a%u@]?”%vn~
          %u@7He told them, %r@“%R@I%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@o%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@—%r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@-%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@H%r@o%r@l%r@y%r@ %R@S%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@f%r@u%r@l%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %R@J%r@e%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@a%r@l%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@J%r@u%r@d%r@e%r@a%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@S%r@a%r@m%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@a%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@l%r@s%r@e%r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@—%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@e%r@t%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@9After he said these things, while they were still looking at him he was taken up: a cloud took him away out of their sight. %u@1%u@0As they were staring up into the sky while he was travelling %i@u%i@p%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s, two men dressed in white appeared out of nowhere and stood next to them, %u@1%u@1and they said, “Gentlemen, %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ Galileans%u@[%u@d%u@], why are you just standing there looking up into the sky? This Jesus who was taken away from you up into the sky will come in the same manner which you’ve observed him travelling into the sky.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@2They then returned to Jerusalem from what’s known as the Mount of Olives, which is near Jerusalem, about a half-mile/1 km%u@[%u@e%u@] down the road. %u@1%u@3When they entered %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ to the top floor of where they were staying, they being%i@ Peter, John, James, Andrew, Philip, Thomas, Bartholomew, Matthew, James son of Alphaeus, Simon the Zealot, and Judas son of James. %u@1%u@4All of these fellows were in one accord and single-mindedly sticking to it—not getting side-tracked—in prayer, accompanied by women%u@[%u@f%u@] and by Mary the mother of Jesus and his brothers.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5During the span of time %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e, Peter stood up in the midst of the comrades (and there was a group consisting of 120 grown men, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@g%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t %i@i%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n) and said, %u@1%u@6”Gentlemen, %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ comrades%u@[%u@d%u@], the verses in the Bible%u@[%u@g%u@] had to be fulfilled which the Holy Spirit spoke beforehand through David’s mouth about Judas, who became ringleader to those who apprehended Jesus, %u@1%u@7that he was considered to be one of us and that he wound up being the unfortunate one who performed this duty%u@[%u@h%u@].”%vn~
          %u@1%u@8To recap, that guy used some or all of the payment he received for his wrong-doing and acquired a plot of property with it, and got himself in a head-first direction and %i@k%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ his torso ruptured%u@[%U@A%u@] and all of his intestines spilled out. %u@1%u@9This became known to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, resulting in that plot of land being called Akeldama in their language, which is %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ “Plot of Blood,” %vn~
          %u@2%u@0%I@R%i@e%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@P%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@,%i@ ”Seeing that the Book of Psalms has recorded in it,%vn~
%si~
“Let his domicile go from occupied to unoccupied,%vp~
And %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@%vp~
Let there be no one who occupies it%vp~
%si~
“And,%nn~
%si~
“Let someone else assume his leadership position%vp~
%si~
%u@2%u@1”So it has to be one of the men who accompanied us the entire time that the Lord Jesus was acquainted with us%u@[%u@i%u@], %u@2%u@2starting from John’s baptism up until the day which he was taken from us (%i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ a witness of his resurrection), in order for one of these men to become one of us.”%nn~
          %u@2%u@3Two %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@d%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@ were put forward, Joseph who’s called Barsabbas, who’s also known as Justus, and Matthias. %u@2%u@4They prayed and said, “You, Lord, are intimately%i@ familiar with the hearts of everyone; point out the one you’ve selected from among these two %u@2%u@5to assume the position of this ministry and apostleship, which Judas usurped for his own purpose%u@[%u@i%u@].” %u@2%u@6They flipped a coin, and Matthias won the toss%u@[%u@k%u@], and he was henceforth considered to be an apostle along with the eleven others.%vn~
