%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@e%i@x%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@o%i@w%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s. Likely an expression; therefore, it’s meaning is more expansive than the literal rendering. The expansive meaning would include: sequences of events, prerequisites—things such as these.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%I@G%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %I@G%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@s…%I@G%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %I@M%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ %I@G%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@s…%I@M%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s. This rhetorical form is the opening to a public speech, as though one will attempt to persuade the audience.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@-%i@m%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@/%i@1%i@ %i@k%i@m…Lit: %i@a%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ [%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e %i@j%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@y]%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n…Or: %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@B%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e. Some liberties taken.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@u%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@u%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@t%i@-%i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@i%i@c%i@e. A metaphor is used whereby Judas competed in the casting of lots (a game of chance) and was the loser. We might say, “he would up being the one who drew the last stick and got stuck with performing this duty.”%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@q%i@u%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@u%i@s…Lit: %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@s.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@r%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %I@O%i@w%i@n%i@ %I@P%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@i%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@s%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@g%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@t%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@a%i@s. Some liberties taken.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@g%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@-%i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d %i@k%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@p%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@-%i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ [%i@t%i@h%i@e]%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@d%i@d%i@l%i@e. The verb form for %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@-%i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t (πρηνής/Strong’s 4248) from verb %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@z%i@ō/no Strong’s number) means to throw oneself head-first or to fall headlong, so other translations say that he dove head-first and that the impact of the fall caused his body to split open and his intestines to come out. But the word %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@-%i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ also refers to the prone position, so the phrase %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@-%i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ could mean %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ instead. There’s not enough content and enough clarity to conclude with certainty that he dove head-first off a high cliff or off some other precipice—not to mention the practicalities of what that entails. Suffice to say that there remains ambiguity and uncertainty of what exactly Luke was talking about in this verse. %fn~
%i@%sb~
Acts Chapter 2%hb~
          %u@1When all the days had been checked off until fifty were reached%u@[%U@A%u@]—the Day of Pentecost—everyone was together and on the same page%u@[%u@a%u@]. %u@2From out of the sky a noise suddenly occurred, one which seemed like a violent wind was being swept in%u@[%u@b%u@], and it filled the entire building in which they were sitting. %u@3Tongues like %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ from a%i@ fire were seen being distributed to them, and %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@e sat upon each and every one of them, %u@4and every one of them was filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in various tongues (other languages) as the Spirit kept on giving them %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ to be uttering %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@e%i@s.%vn~
          %u@5Now there were Jews staying in Jerusalem, devout men, who were from every nation across the globe%u@[%u@c%u@]. %u@6So when this sound happened, a bunch of them, confused, gathered together, because each person kept hearing them speaking in his own dialect of his own language. %u@7They were non-stop confused and kept on wondering saying, “Don’t look %i@n%i@o%i@w—%i@b%i@u%i@t aren’t all of these folks who are speaking Galileans? %u@8And how %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t each of us %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@ hear %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@n in his own native dialect of his own native language?— %u@9Parthians, Medes, Elamites; those who live in Mesopotamia, Judea and not only there but in Cappadocia, Pontus, the province of Asia, %u@1%u@0Phrygia, and not only there but Pamphylia, Egypt and the parts of Libya around Cyrene; visitors from Rome, %u@1%u@1both Jews and Gentiles who’ve converted to Judaism; Cretans and Arabs—we all hear them in our own languages saying things which magnify God.” %u@1%u@2Now everyone kept on being amazed, confused and perplexed, telling one another, “What in the world’s going on%u@[%u@d%u@]?” %u@1%u@3But others, jeering, kept on saying %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@c%i@t, “They %i@w%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ got drunk on sweet wine%u@[%U@B%u@], %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@n%i@o%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@4Peter along with the eleven others stood %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@d, raised his voice, and announced, “Men, Judeans%u@[%u@l%u@], and everyone who’s staying in Jerusalem: may you listen to what I have to say and may this become understood to you. %u@1%u@5The fact of the matter is, it’s not what you think, that is that these people are drinking, seeing that it’s %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ nine in the morning, %u@1%u@6but instead this is what’s spoken through the prophet Joel,%vn~
%si~
%u@1%u@7”’In the Last Days, things will turn out this way,’%vp~
God says:%vp~
‘I’ll pour out My Spirit onto all flesh.%vp~
Your sons and daughters will prophesy,%vp~
Your young men will see visions,%vp~
Your elderly men will dream dreams.%vp~
%u@1%u@8In those days I will pour out My Spirit%vp~
Upon My male and female servants—%vp~
Indeed I will—%vp~
And they will prophesy.%vp~
%u@1%u@9I will grant that wonders occur in the sky above%vp~
And signs upon the earth below:%vp~
Blood, fire, and smoke trails.%vp~
%u@2%u@0The sun will change into darkness%vp~
And the moon into blood%vp~
Prior to the coming%vp~
Of the Great and Marvelous Day of the Lord.%vp~
%u@2%u@1And things will turn out this way:%vp~
All who choose to call for the Lord %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@%vp~
In the way He is reputed to act%u@[%u@e%u@]%vp~
Will be spared calamity%u@[%u@f%u@].’%vp~
%si~
          %u@2%u@2”Men, Israelites%u@[%u@l%u@], listen to what I’m telling you. Jesus of Nazareth was a man who had been appointed by God to %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ our behalf, and God performed miracles, wonders, and signs for us through him in your midst, as you all know. %u@2%u@3By the specific determination of God, one which He decided ahead of time, this man was apprehended and taken into custody by bad, out-of-control men, fastened to a cross, and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ hoisted up %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@e%i@c%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n. %u@2%u@4God resurrected this man, having broken the travail of death, on account of the fact that it wasn’t possible for him to be overpowered and constrained by %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h, %u@2%u@5seeing that %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@ David told him,%vn~
%si~
“Throughout it all, I kept on seeing the Lord ahead of time%vp~
In the area that I was most concerned about%u@[%u@g%u@]%vp~
Because He is right where I need Him%u@[%u@h%u@]%vp~
So that I don’t get rattled.%vp~
%u@2%u@6Because of this, I rejoiced in heart and uttered exultations,%vp~
And, what’s more, my physical well-being%vp~
Will occupy the spot where hope exists%u@[%u@i%u@],%vp~
%u@2%u@7Because You have not left the essence of my life-being%vp~
In the graveyard%u@[%u@j%u@],%vp~
Nor will You allow your Holy One to undergo decay.%vp~
%u@2%u@8Having familiarized me with the way of life,%vp~
You will fill me with gladness%vp~
With Your undivided attention%u@[%u@k%u@].%vp~
%si~
          %u@2%u@9”Men, comrades%u@[%u@l%u@], it’s appropriate to address you with confidence concerning our patriarch David, %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ that he too passed away and was buried, and that his tomb has been right nearby %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ up until the present time. %u@3%u@0So being a prophet and knowing that God made an oath and ‘swore to him that from out of the collection of those whom he would sire and their offspring, one of them would sit on his throne,’ %u@3%u@1while seeing into the future, he spoke about the resurrection of Jesus; the fact is,%vn~
%si~
“He has neither been left to the graveyard,%vp~
Nor has his flesh undergone decay%vp~
%si~
%u@3%u@2”God resurrected this Jesus%i@-%i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w, of which we all are witnesses, %u@3%u@3and thereupon promoted him to the position of God’s Chief Executive%u@[%u@m%u@]—not only that but having received the promise of the Holy Spirit from the Father, he’s poured out %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ this that you see and hear. %u@3%u@4You see, David didn’t ascend into heaven, but it was he specifically who said,%nn~
%si~
“The Lord said to my Lord,%vp~
‘Assume the role of being My right-hand man%vp~
%u@3%u@5Until such time I choose%vp~
To subjugate your enemies in obeisance to you%u@[%u@n%u@]’%vp~
%si~
%u@3%u@6”Let it be known with certainty to the entire Israeli ethnicity-nation%u@[%u@o%u@] that God made him both Lord and Messiah (Christ), this Jesus-%i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w whom you crucified.”%nn~
          %u@3%u@7Now, after they heard this, it caused their hearts to melt%u@[%u@p%u@], and they told Peter and the rest of the apostles, “What should we do about it, men, comrades?” %u@3%u@8Peter told%i@ them, “Have a change of heart and of ways%u@[%u@q%u@] and %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d have each of you be baptized by the authority of%u@[%u@r%u@] Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit. %u@3%u@9You see, the promise is for you, for your children and for everyone who’s far away—it is just as much given to the one as to the other%u@[%U@C%u@]; %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@,%i@ it is for %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ those whom the Lord God happens to or chooses to summon.” %vn~
          %u@4%u@0He kept on stating%u@[%U@D%u@] a lot of other declarations, and kept on appealing to them %i@s%i@u%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ saying, “May you escape%u@[%u@s%u@] from this twisted contemporary Zeitgeist%u@[%u@t%u@].” %u@4%u@1So those who took to heart and acted upon%u@[%u@u%u@] his message were baptized, and on that day around three-thousand individuals were added. %u@4%u@2They were faithful to keep %i@l%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ the apostles’ instruction, to keep having fellowship-dinners together, dinners culminating in a communion memorial%u@[%u@v%u@], and to keep attending the prayer meetings.%vn~
          %u@4%u@3Now a deep reverence was continually maintained, and many signs and wonders kept on occurring through the apostles. %u@4%u@4Now all of those believing were on the same page in regard to the previously mentioned things and shared everything, %u@4%u@5and properties and possessions kept on being sold%u@[%u@w%u@], and that which was sold kept on being distributed to every person according to whoever happened to have a need%u@[%U@E%u@]. %vn~
          %u@4%u@6Not only that but day by day they continued to be faithful to be in one accord in the temple, and furthermore they continued to attend %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ dinners %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y%i@ from house to house, sharing food with great joy and simplicity of heart, %u@4%u@7praising God and having favor with the entirety of the folk-people—and the Lord kept adding those being saved day by day while the previously mentioned things were going on.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@g%i@e…Lit: %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@w%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@b%i@e…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@k%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%I@W%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@?…Lit: %I@W%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@? Likely an idiom.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t…Lit: %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%I@I%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%I@H%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@j%i@o%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@h%i@y%i@s%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@-%i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@c%i@c%i@u%i@p%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@p%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@s…Lit: %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@j%i@o%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@p%i@e. A mixed figure of speech, a mixture of synecdoche and personification. %fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@-%i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@y%i@a%i@r%i@d…Lit: %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@H%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%I@M%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ %I@J%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@s…%I@M%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@s…%I@M%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Ref. note of Acts. 1:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@ %I@E%i@x%i@e%i@c%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%I@A%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@M%i@y%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@-%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@o%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@j%i@u%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@e%i@m%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@b%i@e%i@i%i@s%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %I@M%i@y%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t [%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d] %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@e%i@m%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@e%i@t.%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@ %i@e%i@t%i@h%i@n%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@-%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@l%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@q%u@]%I@H%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@s…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@r%u@]%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%fn~
%u@[%u@s%u@]%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@a%i@p%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@d. The rendering of the Gk. word %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ or %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ is context-specific. This rendering is the same as that of Matt. 19:25.%fn~
%u@[%u@t%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@r%i@y%i@ %I@Z%i@e%i@i%i@t%i@g%i@e%i@i%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@u%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@v%u@]%i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p%i@-%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@l%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@u%i@n%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@a%i@l…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@B%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@o%i@f%i@-%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@-%I@B%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@-%I@F%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p%fn~
%u@[%u@w%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@l%i@d…Lit: %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g. The GT uses the active voice instead of the passive, perhaps an expression similar to what we use in English.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@W%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@e%i@c%i@k%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r. The Gk. word for %i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ refers to manning a ship with a full complement of sailors. In other words, %i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ is a metaphor which compares the counting of the days until fifty is reached to a ship captain who desires to set sail but needs a nominal number of sailors, and sailors with a list of essential skills. The captain cannot depart until he fills out his quota, so he searches the harbor looking to recruit sailors needed to staff his ship. He sets sail immediately once the quota has been filled.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@s%i@w%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@n%i@e…This is a young, sweet wine, the wine known as %i@m%i@u%i@s%i@t. It’s likely a wine that’s drunk undiluted, a wine which has a higher alcohol content, is less expensive, or both: the beverage-of-choice when the goal of is to get drunk as easily and as cheaply as possible.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r…This phrase is not an interpolation but is justified by the insertion of the word %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ before the word %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n, an %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ which is in addition the %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ between %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@ and %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@.%i@ In v. 39 here, Luke says that the promise is for those closest to you and that you have the closest human bonds to—your children—and for those who are furthest from you geographically and for whom you have no human bond whatsoever. The point he’s making (and he clears this up immediately after) is that if the promise is for both extremes relationally and physically, then certainly it is for everyone else.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g. The Gk. word %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ is used throughout Acts, John’s Gospel and his epistles, and elsewhere in the NT. This usage in v. 40 here is about as good a definition of what is meant by witnessing as can be found anywhere in the NT. First, begin with an understanding of the usage of %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ in the OT, which is a person testifying in a court of law. After that, study the context of v. 40 here, and the definition of %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ becomes apparent. Apply this understanding to other places in the NT where %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ is used (Acts 1:8 for example).%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@d%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d…Some have said that this (and Acts 4:35) rings of Karl Marx’s quotation, “From each according to his ability, to each according to his need.” Keep in mind the following, however. First, Luke states this as a fact and does not say that it was a command, confirmed by what Peter said in Acts 5:4. Second, the apostles were convinced that Jesus would return to earth any day now—certainly no more than a few weeks hence—so what’s the use of owning property? Third, Acts 8:1 said that there was a great persecution against the church in Jerusalem. In such a persecution, those persecuted would surely have had their property confiscated, so they might’ve anticipated this and sold what they owned preemptively. Fourth, not everyone sold what they owned; otherwise they wouldn’t have been able to meet from house to house (v. 46), as there wouldn’t have been any houses to meet at. Fifth, this was an extraordinary period of revival, and extraordinary things happen in extraordinary revivals, things that don’t otherwise happen.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Acts Chapter 3%hb~
          %u@1Now Peter and John went over to the temple at the Three-in-the-Afternoon-Prayer-Time, %u@2and a certain man who was lame from the time he was born, having to be carried around %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@,%i@ was there, whom %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e day after day kept on placing at the temple gate known as %i@t%i@h%i@e Beautiful %I@G%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@,%i@ so that he could beg for handouts from those entering the temple %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@x. %u@3Seeing that Peter and John were about to go into the temple %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@x, he asked for a handout. %u@4Peter stared at him, and John joined in with him, and Peter said, “Look at us!” %u@5He proceeded to give heed to them, looking at them and paying attention to them, waiting to—expecting to—get something from them. %u@6Peter said, “I don’t have any cash on me%u@[%U@A%u@], but I’ll give you what I’ve got%u@[%u@a%u@]: by the authority vested in me by Jesus Christ of Nazareth%u@[%u@b%u@], get up and walk around%u@[%U@B%u@]!”— %u@7And he grabbed him by his right hand and pulled him up—And immediately his feet and ankles were strengthened and made sturdy— %u@8And with a leap he stood up and started walking around and entered the temple %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@x together with them, walking around, jumping, and praising God. %u@9All the folk-people saw him walking around and praising God, %u@1%u@0and they recognized him as the same beggar who used to%i@ sit %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@g%i@g%i@a%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@ at the temple’s Beautiful Gate, and they were filled with amazement and exhilaration at how things had turned out for him.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1While %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ was clutching Peter and John, folks everywhere%u@[%u@c%u@] at the colonnade known as Solomon’s Colonnade ran towards them, utterly amazed. %u@1%u@2Seeing this, Peter responded to the crowd, “Men, Israelites%u@[%u@d%u@], why are you amazed at this? Why are you staring at us as though we enabled him to walk by our own power or piety? %u@1%u@3The God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob—the God of our patriarchal ancestors—glorified His servant%u@[%u@e%u@] Jesus, whom you all had arrested and whom you all rejected in the very presence of Pilate, after that guy delivered a verdict that %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e set him free. %u@1%u@4You rejected the holy and righteous one and asked for a homicidal man—a murderer—to be let off the hook and given back to you. %u@1%u@5You killed the Prince of Life, whom God raised from the dead, of which we are witnesses. %u@1%u@6And %i@b%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ on%u@[%u@f%u@] the faith %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s %i@d%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d from %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@’%i@s%i@ authorization to act%u@[%u@g%u@], this person whom you see and know first-hand—%I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@’%i@s authorization to act strengthened %i@h%i@i%i@m and made %i@h%i@i%i@m sturdy, and right in front of you all, the through-him-faith%u@[%u@h%u@] gave him this perfect health %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e. %u@1%u@7Yes indeed comrades, I know that you conducted your lives in %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s consistent with ignorance, just like your predecessors and ancestors did, %u@1%u@8but the God that made the suffering of His Messiah known ahead of time through the mouth of all the prophets %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e fulfilled in this manner.%vn~
          %u@1%u@9”So now, have a change of ways%u@[%u@i%u@] and turn %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@s to the obliteration of your sins, %u@2%u@0in order that episodes%u@[%u@j%u@] of refreshing would issue forth from the Lord’s totally-focused attention%u@[%u@k%u@], and He would send you the one who’s already been appointed %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y, Christ Jesus, %u@2%u@1whom the spiritual world%u@[%u@l%u@] will most definitely embrace up to the times of the establishment of everything that God has spoken through the mouth of His saints—%i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@y the prophets—from day-one. %u@2%u@2Yes, %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ Moses said that,%vn~
%si~
“The Lord our God will bring to prominence a prophet%vp~
And send him your way,%vp~
%I@A%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@t%i@ from among our fellow men—%vp~
%I@O%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ like me.%vp~
You shall listen %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ out of him%vp~
%I@A%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t in accordance to everything%vp~
That he happens to say to you.%vp~
%u@2%u@3What will happen to any individual%vp~
Who chooses not to listen to that prophet%vp~
Is that he will be absolutely annihilated,%vp~
Never seen or heard from again%u@[%u@m%u@].%vp~
%si~
          %u@2%u@4”Indeed, all the prophets starting with Samuel, including those who came afterwards, talked about and announced these days %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n. %u@2%u@5You all are the beneficiaries%u@[%u@n%u@] of the prophets and of the covenant which God entered into with our ancestors, saying to Abraham, ‘All of the nationalities%u@[%u@o%u@] of the earth will be blessed by one of your descendants%u@[%u@p%u@].’ %u@2%u@6God first and foremost brought to prominence his servant%u@[%u@e%u@] and sent him your way blessing you when each person turns away from your evil ways.”%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@t…Lit: %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@N%i@a%i@z%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@N%i@a%i@z%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@t%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@f%i@o%i@l%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%I@M%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@s…Ref. note of Acts. 1:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t…Or: %i@b%i@o%i@y. The other Gk. word rendered %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ is alternatively rendered %i@s%i@l%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@.%i@ This is not; this is more of a household servant.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@b%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@a%i@t or %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@z%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t…Lit: %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@-%i@h%i@i%i@m%i@-%i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h…Or: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@-%i@m%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@-%i@o%i@f%i@-%i@h%i@i%i@m%i@-%i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@s…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@e%i@p%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s or %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@f%i@o%i@c%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@a%i@b%i@s%i@o%i@l%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@n%i@i%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@a%i@n%i@n%i@i%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d [or %i@o%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d] %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e. An expression used throughout the OT.%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@p%i@a%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@a%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@s [%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@s]. The idea is that every person on the earth is a descendant from some ancient patriarchy, and, though these lineages can no longer be traced, they still exist.%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@s…Lit: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@d [%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@m]. Metonymy for a descendant who will come later.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@e. This sounds like an expression, as one would expect Peter to say he has no silver, as the word silver itself is a synonym for money. Furthermore, one doesn’t usually give a gold coin to a beggar.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d…The manuscripts are divided on this; the best manuscripts simply say %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ instead.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Acts Chapter 4%hb~
          %u@1While they were talking to the folk-people, the priests, the temple guards, and the Sadducees showed up, %u@2exasperated because of them teaching the people and proclaiming Jesus’s resurrection from the dead, %u@3and they arrested them and put them in jail until the next day; you see, it was evening already. %u@4Many of those who heard the message became believers, and the number of men (%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n) %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@ reached five thousand.%vn~
          %u@5Now what happened the next day is that the rulers, the councilmen, and the designated teachers%u@[%u@a%u@] convened in Jerusalem— %u@6and Annas the High Priest %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m, and Caiaphas, John, and Alexander, and any person at all who was born into and, as a result, belonged to the high priests’ caste. %u@7They %i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m stand in the center for questioning,%vn~
      “By what %i@g%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@l power have you done this, or who authorized you to do this in their agency%u@[%U@A%u@]?”%vn~
          %u@8Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, told them, “Rulers of the people and councilmen: %u@9If we’re being questioned in court today in reference to a good deed done to a feeble man, %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ just how %i@e%i@x%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@l%i@y%i@ this fellow has been pulled out of his miserable condition%u@[%u@b%u@]: %u@1%u@0Let it be known to every one of you and to all of the folk-people of Israel that at the behest of and by the authority of Jesus%u@[%u@c%u@] of Nazareth, whom you all crucified, whom God raised from the dead—by using this %i@d%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@, this fellow stands before you completely well. %u@1%u@1That is,%vn~
%si~
“The stone treated with contempt by you, the builders%vp~
Has become the principal cornerstone%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@2”There is no security and protection for our natural and spiritual lives%u@[%u@d%u@] in anyone else; the fact of the matter is, there is no other person of impeccable reputation and of authority%u@[%u@e%u@] among the breadth of the varieties of peoples everywhere%u@[%u@f%u@] that the human race has %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ produced and put forward as a candidate of such%u@[%u@g%u@] in whom it is absolutely necessary to be rescued from our deplorable spiritual, mental, and physical condition%u@[%u@h%u@].”%nn~
          %u@1%u@3Gawking at the boldness and confidence with which Peter and John were speaking, and floored by the fact that the men were uneducated and untrained, they were flabbergasted and began to notice that they had a close connection with Jesus, %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@y. %u@1%u@4Furthermore, seeing the man standing there in unison with them—the one who had been healed—they couldn’t come up with anything to say against the whole affair. %u@1%u@5Ordering them to leave the council %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@,%i@ they huddled together %u@1%u@6saying,%vn~
      “What should we do about these people, since it certainly has become apparent to everyone who’s visiting or living in Jerusalem that a recognizable miracle%u@[%u@i%u@] has occurred through them, and we can’t deny it? %u@1%u@7%I@W%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@;%i@ instead, so that this won’t continue to spread more and more among the folk-people, we’ll threaten them telling them to no longer speak to any person using this authority as the basis for their speaking%u@[%u@j%u@].”%vn~
          %u@1%u@8They summoned them and ordered them not to teach—not even to utter a peep%u@[%u@k%u@]—acting on the basis of Jesus’s authority%u@[%u@j%u@]. %u@1%u@9Responding %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@r Peter and John told them, “You make the call whether God considers heeding you more than heeding Him the right thing to do; %u@2%u@0you see, as far as we’re concerned, we can’t NOT talk about what we’ve seen and heard.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@1After they were threatened, they released them, not being able to figure out a way they could punish them on account of the folk-people, because everyone glorified God over what had happened; %u@2%u@2you see, the man whom this miraculous healing happened to was more than forty years old.%vn~
          %u@2%u@3After they were released, they went to their own particular group of people%u@[%u@l%u@] and reported what the chief priests and the councilmen told them. %u@2%u@4After they heard this, everyone single-mindedly and in unison raised their voices %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@ towards God and said, “Master, You who made the sky, the earth, the sea, and everything in it, %u@2%u@5who, by means of the Holy Spirit, spoke from the mouth of our ancestor, Your servant%u@[%u@m%u@] David,%vn~
%si~
“Just why, now, did the people%vp~
In all the various nations become insolent%u@[%u@n%u@]?%vp~
The folk-people carefully planned%vp~
Things which are useless, %u@2%u@6for which%vp~
The kings of the land stood nearby %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t,%vp~
And the rulers were assembled for the same purpose:%vp~
To oppose the Lord and to oppose His Messiah (Christ).%vp~
%si~
%u@2%u@7”The fact is, they actually were assembled in this city for the purpose of %i@o%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ Your holy servant%u@[%u@m%u@] Jesus, whom You singled out to be specially chosen and to be given special, supernatural abilities%u@[%u@o%u@]—%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ Herod and Pontius Pilate joined by the Gentiles and the Israeli people— %u@2%u@8to do what Your situational control%u@[%u@p%u@] and Your well-thought-through plan decided ahead of time would happen. %u@2%u@9And now, Lord, take a good, hard look at their threats and grant that Your servant speak Your message time after time with total boldness and confidence, %u@3%u@0while at the same time You supernaturally intervene%u@[%u@q%u@], the intervention resulting in healings, miracles, and supernatural portents occurring through the authority placed in%u@[%u@j%u@] your holy servant%u@[%u@m%u@] Jesus.”%nn~
          %u@3%u@1After they were done praying, the place they were gathered was shaken, and everyone %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ was filled with the Holy Spirit and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ began to speak God’s message with boldness and confidence %i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s.%vn~
          %u@3%u@2Now the sizable group of believers was %i@o%i@f one heart, mind, and soul, and not a single person was saying that anything that he owned belonged to him %i@e%i@x%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@y, but instead everything was kept in common between them. %u@3%u@3The apostles kept on putting the account%u@[%u@r%u@] of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus out there by means of tremendous miracles, and tremendous grace (%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@v%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m) was upon them. %u@3%u@4In fact, not a person among them was in need. You see, those who owned properties or houses and other buildings kept on selling them and selling them and bringing the proceeds of the sales %u@3%u@5to the apostles, placing the proceeds in under their care and ownership%u@[%u@s%u@]. %I@M%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e were continuously being distributed to each person in proportion to what a given person happened to need%u@[%U@B%u@].%vn~
          %u@3%u@6Joseph, whom the apostles called Barnabas (which translated means “the epitome of one who fills the role of%u@[%u@t%u@] assistant, advocate, counselor, and encourager%u@[%U@C%u@]”), a clergyman%u@[%u@u%u@], Cyprian by birth, %u@3%u@7being the owner of a field, sold it and gave the money to the apostles, putting it in their custody.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@l%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@p%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@d%fn~

%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@c%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@v%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@.%i@ Also see Luke 1:69%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@c%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y …Lit: %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@k%i@y. An expression, one similar to the expression %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@n%i@,%i@ found in Ecclesiastes 1:9.%fn~
