%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@m%i@u%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@r. A hendiadys. Ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@,%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %I@I%i@,%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@w…The best manuscripts are divided here; the others say, %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@w%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n…Lit: %I@I%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@-%i@a%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@-%i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e…Or: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@v%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e…%i@i%i@n%i@v%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e…%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r…%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e…Lit: %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@o%i@f [%i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m]%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@a%i@l%i@m%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%I@S%i@i%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@ %I@T%i@a%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@r…Or: %I@S%i@i%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@r%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]”%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@W%i@a%i@y”…The sect or movement that believed in Jesus was called %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@W%i@a%i@y%i@.%i@ One had to be Jewish to join the Way. It wasn’t until Acts 11:26 that those who believe in Jesus are called Christians, where one believes in Jesus without first being Jewish, coming to God while circumventing Judaism altogether.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d…Lit: %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l. The assumption is that this refers to the Hellenistic Jews scattered throughout the Roman Empire.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r. Saul had become a brother in the Lord before Ananias prayed for him to receive the baptism in the Holy Spirit; being baptized in the Holy Spirit almost always occurs at a time after believing in Jesus. Therefore, Saul was a believer already, when he was baptized in the Holy Spirit. Since the Holy Spirit comes to live in every believer at the time they receive Christ, the baptism in the Holy Spirit must be something different.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@b%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g…From the sounds of it, Tabitha used to make clothing and donate it to the needy. Those whom she showed the most generosity to in life (i.e. the widows) wept the hardest when she died.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Acts Chapter 10%hb~
          %u@1In Caesarea a certain man named Cornelius, a centurion in a battalion%u@[%u@a%u@] named “From (%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@R%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@)%i@ Italia%u@[%U@A%u@],” %u@2a devout Gentile who, together with his entire household, was a sympathizer and near-convert to Judaism%u@[%U@B%u@], often giving contributions to the poor-folk and constantly praying to God%u@[%u@b%u@], %u@3around three o’clock in the afternoon distinctly saw an angel in a vision enter %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d%i@ and go to him and say, %vn~
      “Cornelius.”%vn~
          %u@4Once he stared at him, he became afraid and said, “What is it, sir?”%vn~
      He told him, “Your prayers and donations have percolated upwards to where they’ve garnered God’s attention, and He’s quite pleased by what He sees%u@[%U@C%u@]. %u@5Send %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@w%i@ men to Joppa right now and summon Simon, who goes by ‘Peter.’ %u@6This fellow’s being boarded by one Simon Tanner, whose house is next to the sea.” %u@7As the angel who was speaking to him left, he called for two %i@m%i@e%i@n from his household staff and a pious soldier from among those who waited on him. %u@8He explained everything to them and dispatched them to Joppa.%vn~
          %u@9During the next day, while those men were on the road and getting near to the city, Peter went out on the back deck%u@[%U@D%u@] around noon to pray. %u@1%u@0He got hungry and had a hankering to eat. While they were getting the noon meal ready, what happened is that he fell into a trance %u@1%u@1and sees that the sky had been opened up and sees an object something like a huge, four-cornered cloth sheet coming down, being lowered to the ground, %u@1%u@2on top of which%u@[%u@c%u@] was every %i@t%i@y%i@p%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f four-footed animal, were reptiles%u@[%u@d%u@], and were birds from the sky—%I@I%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@w%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@k%i@o%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@w%i@s%i@,%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@w%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@b%i@i%i@d%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t%i@. %u@1%u@3%I@O%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ a voice addressed him, “Get to it, Peter: slaughter and eat %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m.” %u@1%u@4But Peter said, “No way, sir, since I’ve never eaten anything which isn’t kosher%u@[%u@e%u@].” %u@1%u@5Again a second time a voice from the sky spoke to him, “The item which God has purged of its non-kosher-ness is %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r you %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t%u@[%U@E%u@].” %u@1%u@6This happened a third time and immediately %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t the object was taken up into the sky.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7While Peter was turning things over in his head, being stumped at what the vision he’d witnessed could possibly mean, out of nowhere the men who were sent by Cornelius stopped at the gate asking around about Simon’s house, %u@1%u@8and in their conversation proceeded to inquire if Simon who goes by Peter was staying at this place. %u@1%u@9While Peter was thinking over the vision, the Spirit told him, “Take a look—three men are looking for you. %u@2%u@0Enough %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d—go down, go over, and introduce yourself to them; I’ve sent them, no doubt.” %u@2%u@1So Peter went over to the men and said, “Hey, I’m the one you’re looking for. What’s the reason you’ve come?” %u@2%u@2They said, “Cornelius, a centurion, a righteous man and a Jewish-sympathizer—plus well-spoken-of and respected by the whole Jewish race—was divinely instructed by an angel to have you sent to his house and to listen to a message by you.” %u@2%u@3As a result he invited them in and entertained them, letting them stay at his place.%vn~
      The next day, he got ready and departed with them, and some of the comrades%u@[%u@f%u@] from Joppa came with him. %u@2%u@4The following day, they arrived in Caesarea; Cornelius was waiting for them %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ and gathered together his close friends and relatives. %u@2%u@5Now just as Peter arrived, Cornelius went up to him and prostrated himself before him in worship%u@[%u@g%u@]. %u@2%u@6Peter got him up %i@b%i@y saying, “Get up: me—I’m %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t a human being.” %u@2%u@7Conversing with him, he entered %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ and discovered that a lot of people had gathered there %u@2%u@8and said to them, “You understand that it’s forbidden for a Jewish man to associate with or visit someone of another race. But God showed me that the item which has been purged of its non-kosher-ness (talking about a person %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@e) is to be permitted. %u@2%u@9Therefore, I had no objection to coming when you sent for me. So let me ask: what reason have you summoned me?”%vn~
          %u@3%u@0Cornelius said, “Starting four days ago up until this very moment we were praying %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ the Three-in-the-Afternoon-Prayer-Time%u@[%u@h%u@] in my house, and—just like that—a man dressed in white %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ stood in front of me %u@3%u@1and said, ‘Cornelius, your prayers and donations have percolated upwards to where they’ve garnered God’s attention, and He’s quite pleased by what He sees. %u@3%u@2So now, send %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@ to Joppa and send for Simon who goes by Peter. This fellow’s being boarded in Simon Tanner’s house next to the sea.’ %u@3%u@3So without delay I dispatched %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n your way, and you’ve kindly acquiesced to being brought here. So at this time all of us are on the edge of our seats waiting%u@[%U@F%u@] to hear %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@b%i@e%i@y%i@ everything that you’ve been directed and commanded by the Lord.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@4Peter opened his mouth and said, “I’m really, really floored%u@[%u@i%u@] %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@t that God doesn’t show partiality, %u@3%u@5but instead those in every race, culture, and nationality who reverence Him and go about doing right are acceptable to Him%u@[%u@j%u@]. %u@3%u@6He sent the word out to the Israeli descendants issuing a good-news proclamation of peace through Jesus Christ—this person is everyone’s Lord— %u@3%u@7you know %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t: the affair that happened all throughout Judea, starting in Galilee after the baptism that John preached: %u@3%u@8That God singled out and specially chose Jesus of Nazareth and put on him%u@[%u@k%u@] an oh-so-powerful-dose of the miracle-working power of the Holy Spirit%u@[%u@l%u@], who %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ since God was with him, went throughout %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@f%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l%i@ doing good works and healing all who were being oppressed by the devil%u@[%U@G%u@]. %u@3%u@9We ourselves are eyewitnesses to all that he did in the country occupied by the Jews and in Jerusalem—he that they hung on a wooden %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@-%i@b%i@e%i@a%i@m%u@[%u@m%u@] and killed. %u@4%u@0God resurrected this fellow on the third day and caused him to be seen by the naked eye and appear before people, %u@4%u@1but%u@ not to be seen by any-old person but instead to provide evidence to those hand-picked beforehand by God—%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ us—the very people who ate and drank together with him after his resurrection from the dead. %u@4%u@2He commanded us to preach to the folk-people and to solemnly testify that this fellow is the one who’s been promised by God; %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ a judge of the living and the dead. %u@4%u@3To this %i@e%i@n%i@d, all of the prophets affirm the receiving of forgiveness of sins through his authority and what he stands for%u@[%u@n%u@]…”%vn~
          %u@4%u@4While Peter was still in the middle of saying this, the Holy Spirit fell (%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@d%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s)%i@ on everyone who was listening to the message. %u@4%u@5The believers who were dedicated to a strict form of Judaism%u@[%u@o%u@] who accompanied Peter were flabbergasted because the offering—the gift%u@[%u@p%u@]—of the %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Holy Spirit was poured out on the Gentiles, %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@w%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@i%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n: %u@4%u@6for they heard them speaking in tongues and magnifying God. Then Peter reacted %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d, %u@4%u@7“Surely water for someone to be baptized in can’t be denied to%u@[%u@q%u@] these people, particularly those who received the Holy Spirit just like we did?” %u@4%u@8He commanded that they be baptized by the authority of%u@[%u@r%u@] Jesus Christ. After that, they asked him to stay for several days.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@c%i@o%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d…Lit: %i@a%i@s%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f [or %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m] %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@a%i@w%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@i%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@k%i@o%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@f%i@a%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@. A hendiadys. %I@P%i@r%i@o%i@f%i@a%i@n%i@e%i@ is something which one should never indulge in; %i@u%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@ is something which you shouldn’t indulge in until it flips back to %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@ (assuming it can or ever does). Also, ref. Rom. 14:14.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p…Lit: %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@T%i@h%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@-%i@i%i@n%i@-%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@-%I@A%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@o%i@o%i@n%i@-%I@P%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r%i@-%I@T%i@i%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@n%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@h[-%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r]. %I@N%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@h%i@ refers to %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@o%i@o%i@n. Ref. Acts 3:1.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@n. %I@U%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@ is an expression. %I@O%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ is the same word rendered John 1:5 %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m. Also, %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m%i@ means %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m%i@,%i@ meaning that He accepts them if they were to ask.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@N%i@a%i@z%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m…Lit: God %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@N%i@a%i@z%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@h%i@-%i@s%i@o%i@-%i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@-%i@d%i@o%i@s%i@e of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@-%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r. A hendiadys similar to the one in Matt. 3:11; ref. note there.%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@w%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@-%i@b%i@e%i@a%i@m…Lit: %i@w%i@o%i@o%i@d [%i@b%i@e%i@a%i@m]. This is a synecdoche for crucifixion. Ref. 5:30.%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@J%i@u%i@d%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@m…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@r%i@c%i@u%i@m%i@c%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@.%i@ This phrase is an expression which wraps a metonymy. Circumcision is the metonymy; the expression is Jews who believe one must adhere strictly to edicts of the Law of Moses. Similar wording as Acts 11:2.%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@—%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t…Ref. note of 8:20.%fn~
%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@w%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@n%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o…A figure of speech; water here is a synecdoche for baptism itself. What he means is, %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@n%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o…%fn~
%u@[%u@r%u@]%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@F%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@(%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@R%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %I@P%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@) %I@I%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@a…Lit: [%i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m] %I@I%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@a. The Gk. word %I@I%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@a%i@ in the ablative case; hence the insertion of %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@. Just like Waffen-SS divisions had names given to them, and some American divisions have nicknames, in the same way this battalion was given a name. It’s reasonable to assume that all the soldiers in this battalion were conscripted from the Roman province of Italia.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@v%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %I@G%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@y%i@m%i@p%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@-%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@J%i@u%i@d%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@m…Lit: %i@p%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d [%i@a%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@-%i@f%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@r]. God-fearers were Gentiles who followed Jewish practices but weren’t converts to Judaism.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@o%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d. This literal wording is taken from Lev. 2:2; Therefore, OT offerings such as the gift offerings of Lev. 2 are a metaphor for Cornelius’s prayers and alms. The metaphor made a few times in the NT (2 Cor. 2:15; Eph. 5:2; Heb. 13:15; etc.) compares Christian duty to the aroma that went up in the smoke in the burning of OT offerings. The way it is presented, God left commandments in the OT for His people to burn offerings, then way up in the sky sniffs the air for the smell of the sacrifices being burned as He commanded, and is pleased when He smells them.%fn~
Also, the fact that this angel spoke to Cornelius using an OT metaphor means that Cornelius must’ve known the OT pretty well, or he wouldn’t have understood what the angel was saying.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@k…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@o%i@f%i@t%i@o%i@p. Some liberties taken. Houses in that time and in that part of the world used their rooftops the same way we use back decks, and they had ladders or stairways which led up to them. A rooftop provided privacy from the confines of the house (ref. Prov. 25:24), and one presumes that Peter sought such privacy for prayer. Peter got a whiff of the smoke from the midday meal, he was hungry already, and it distracted him. God used this distraction as a vehicle to teach him something new.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@n%i@-%i@k%i@o%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@-%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@f%i@a%i@n%i@e [%i@f%i@o%i@r] %i@y%i@o%i@u. The kosher laws are listed in the Law Moses in chapters such as Lev. 11. Various creatures are specified to be clean or not clean, and if clean, permissible to eat. However, there are other passages in the Law of Moses where a person, for example, will be unclean for a while, but then can purge the uncleanness from himself and thereby become clean again. Verse 14 here alludes to this concept.%fn~
The vision came to Peter when he was hungry and the vision was concerning food—at least superficially. In a broader sense, it was redefining what is and isn’t permissible for Peter to do, according to Jewish beliefs, and the lifting of the ban on non-kosher foods is applicable to the lifting of the ban on Gentiles themselves. And—incidentally—this is one of a few NT passages which teaches that Christians are not subject to certain taboos enumerated in the Law of Moses.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d. This appears to be an idiom; it’s not entirely certain if this rendering is correct. In fact, some manuscripts have been redacted to change the wording here so this verse reads, %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%U@G%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l…The Gk. word used for %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ here %i@i%i@a%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@i (ἰάομαι/Strong’s 2390%i@) refers specifically to physical healing; Luke selected this word over the all-encompassing Gk. word for healing %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@p%i@e%i@u%i@ō%i@ (θεραπεύω /Strong’s 2323), which generally means %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ and can and often does encompass more than physical healing; in the NT, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@p%i@e%i@u%i@ō%i@ is generally preferred over %i@i%i@a%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@i%i@ when describing the treating of a person who’s demon-possessed (i.e., casting the demon out). The point being made is that this is another instance in the NT where physical sickness is said to be an oppression of the devil. If this is so, how can sickness be a means which God uses to teach people something?%fn~
%i@%sb~
Acts Chapter 11%hb~
          %u@1Now the apostles and comrades%u@[%u@a%u@] over in Judea heard that the Gentiles too %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@w%i@s%i@ had whole-heartedly embraced and acted upon%u@[%u@b%u@] God's word, God’s system of logic. %u@2When Peter went over to Jerusalem, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s who adhered to Judaism strictly%u@[%u@c%u@] proceeded to show that they had misgivings about what he did and questioned what he did: %u@3“You went into %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ that has those outside of Judaism%u@[%u@d%u@] %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ and shared a meal with them.”%vn~
          %u@4Peter proceeded to explain to them %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d, explaining it in sequential order: %u@5“I was in Joppa praying and had a vision %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e in a trance: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ an object something like a huge, four-cornered cloth sheet descending out of the sky, and it came as far as me and stopped. %u@6I stared at it and started to notice %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e: I saw the %i@g%i@a%i@m%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f four-footed animals, wild beasts, reptiles, and birds from the sky. %u@7Along with it, I heard a voice telling me, ‘Get to it, Peter: slaughter and eat %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@.’ %u@8But I said, ‘No way, sir, since nothing which isn’t kosher has ever entered my mouth.’ %u@9A second time a voice from the sky spoke in reply, ‘That which God has purged of its non-kosher-ness is %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r you %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t.’ %u@1%u@0This happened a third time, and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@b%i@j%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n were taken back up into the sky again. %u@1%u@1Just like that, three men stopped at the house which I was %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ men sent as messengers%u@[%U@A%u@] from Cornelius to me. %u@1%u@2The Spirit told me to have no doubts or reservations and go introduce myself to them. Some of the comrades—these fellows %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e—also accompanied me, and we entered the man’s house.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3”He reported how he saw an angel in his house, and the angel stood there and said, ‘Send messengers to Joppa and send for Simon who goes by Peter, %u@1%u@4who’ll speak to you and tell you things by which you will be rescued from your spiritual malaise%u@[%u@e%u@], you and your entire household%u@[%U@B%u@].’ %u@1%u@5While I was just getting started talking, the %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e Holy Spirit fell on them just like it did on us too way-back-when. %u@1%u@6But I remembered the Lord’s sayings, as he kept on telling us, %r@‘%R@S%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@,%r@ %R@J%r@o%r@h%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@p%r@t%r@i%r@z%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@p%r@t%r@i%r@z%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@H%r@o%r@l%r@y%r@ %R@S%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@.%r@’ %u@1%u@7So now, if God gave the same exact offering—gift—to them as He gave to us too, to believe in%u@[%u@f%u@] the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I to stand in God’s way%u@[%u@g%u@]?” %u@1%u@8After hearing this, they fell silent and glorified God saying, “Then %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ God also granted the Gentiles the Complete-Changeover which leads to%u@[%u@h%u@] %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ life.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@9So now, those who were scattered because of the pressure due to the persecution that occurred upon Stephen’s %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ spread out as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus, and Antioch telling the Concept to Jews alone. %u@2%u@0Among them were some men from Cyprus and Cyrene, men in particular who went to Antioch and were talking and talking to the Greek-speaking Jews, telling them the good news—the Gospel—of the Lord Jesus. %u@2%u@1The Lord was supernaturally and spectacularly working behind the scenes in conjunction with them%u@[%u@i%u@], and %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@l%i@y%i@ there were many people who believed and turned to the Lord.%vn~
          %u@2%u@2The whole story was heard by the ears of the church in Jerusalem, and they dispatched Barnabas, who %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ through %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@g%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ until he got to Antioch. %u@2%u@3Once he got there and got to see %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ God’s grace, rejoiced. Because he was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit, and faithful, he advised, encouraged, and in every way helped%u@[%U@C%u@] them all with a heartfelt determination to stick with it until the Lord comes %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k. %u@2%u@4%u@[%u@j%u@] —And a good-many people were added to the Lord. %u@2%u@5He left for Tarsus to hunt Saul down, %u@2%u@6and once he found him brought him to Antioch. As things turned out in their case, they got together in the church for a whole year and taught a good number of people, and %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@ the disciples were first referred to as “Christians%u@[%U@D%u@]” in Antioch.%vn~
          %u@2%u@7During this timeframe, prophets went from Jerusalem to Antioch. %u@2%u@8One of them by the name of Agabus stood up and through the Spirit portended that a huge famine over the entire civilized world%u@[%U@E%u@]%u@ was going to occur, which happened during %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@R%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %I@E%i@m%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@o%i@r Claudius’s %i@r%i@e%i@i%i@g%i@n. %u@2%u@9The disciples %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y that what came out of them was that each one of them, as far as he had the means to do so, determined to send a ministry%i@-%i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t to the comrades living in Judea. %u@3%u@0They did %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t and sent %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ to the presiding board, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@m%u@[%U@F%u@], using Barnabas and Saul as couriers%u@[%u@k%u@].%vn~

%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@-%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@e%i@m%i@b%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@J%i@u%i@d%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@l%i@y…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@r%i@c%i@u%i@m%i@c%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n. The phrase %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@r%i@c%i@u%i@m%i@c%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ is an abbreviated form of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@r%i@c%i@u%i@m%i@c%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ which appears in Acts 10:45.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@J%i@u%i@d%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@m…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@r%i@c%i@u%i@m%i@c%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y…Lit: %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d?%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%I@C%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@-%I@C%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@a%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@j%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m. An expression found throughout the Bible.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]first part of v. 24 moved to v. 23.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@B%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@b%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@B%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@b%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@u%i@l%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@r%i@s…The participle used here is the root word for apostle. The usage here provides insight into what an apostle is.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d…Some have taken this (along with Acts 16:15,31,33; Acts 18:8) to be a promise that God will cause your immediate family to become believers if you simply have faith in that promise. This is a principle, not a promise. The principle is that those who submit to and follow you in natural affairs will do the same with spiritual affairs; if a person submits his will to another, it will carry over into spiritual things also. Cornelius was the head of his household, which included his family, his relatives that were living with him, and his servants, and his household were following his spiritual lead (Acts 10:27) before Peter arrived. The literal wording of Acts 16:33b confirms this; the entire half-verse says, “He himself was baptized and all they of his immediately”; the confirming phrase is “all they of his.”%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@a%i@d%i@v%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@l%i@p%i@e%i@d…This is the verb from which the well-known Gk. word %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@k%i@l%i@ā%i@t%i@o%i@s%i@ (παράκλητος/Strong’s 3875) is derived%i@. Ref. note of Acts 4:36. This passage demonstrates what the “the Son of Encouragement” (Acts 4:36, NASB) is all about. In the role of Son of Encouragement , Barnabas had a knack for knowing who was needed, where and when they were needed, and this urged him to bring Paul to Antioch (v. 26). In the rift between Barnabas and Paul in Acts 16:36–41, Barnabas’s instincts derived from his gift of Encouragement caused him to stand against Paul on John-Mark’s behalf. His instincts were later vindicated as some of Paul’s last words, spoken in 2 Tim. 4:11, attested to Mark’s faithfulness.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@n%i@s…It’s insinuated that the renaming of the disciples as %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@ was a result of Barnabas’s and Paul’s teaching, just after Cornelius’s conversion, who was the first Gentile to become a believer. We can deduce that Paul at this time was teaching that a non-Jew could become a believer, and this new teaching was the crux of this new movement called “Christianity.” Therefore, technically-speaking, a Christian is one who circumvented Judaism and became a believer directly, as opposed to a person who’s a part of “the Way,” which is a Jew who becomes a believer in Jesus (ref. Acts 9:2). Consequently, in terms of technicalities, it is not possible for a Jew to become a Christian; a Jew who believes in Jesus the same way that a Christian does becomes a part of the Way, and not a Christian. A Jew can be a genuine believer in Jesus and not renounce his Judaism.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d…Or: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@a%i@b%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d. Assumption is that Luke was principally speaking of the Roman Empire.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@m…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s. In the early days of Christianity, passages such as these indicate that the churches were led similar to the way synagogues were: they were led by a board of elders. To claim that, according to the Bible, the only true and proper model for governing a church is that the church be headed by one and only one person fails to reconcile verses like this.%i@%fn~
%i@%sb~
Acts Chapter 12%hb~
          %u@1About that time, King Herod seized%u@[%u@a%u@] a few people who belonged to the church in order to mistreat them badly. %u@2He killed John’s brother James with a sword. %u@3Seeing how pleasing this was to the Judeans, he proceeded to take it a step further and apprehend Peter too (it was around Passover), %u@4whom he arrested and put in jail, putting him in the custody of four squads (a squad consisting of four men) of soldiers who would guard him, intending to haul him up before the folk-people%u@[%u@b%u@] after the Passover. %u@5So now, Peter was being kept in jail; the church continued praying fervently to God for him.%vn~
          %u@6When Herod was about to lead him forth %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h, Peter was sleeping that night between two soldiers, chained up with two chains%u@[%U@A%u@]. In addition to that, two soldiers were guarding the door. %u@7Out of nowhere, an angel went up to him and a light shined in the cell. He tapped Peter’s chest and woke him up saying,%vn~
      “Get up—quickly now!”%vn~
      His chains fell from his arms.%vn~
          %u@8The angel told him, “Put your shirt and pants on%u@[%u@c%u@] and put your sandals on.” He did just that.%vn~
      He %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says to him, “Put your jacket%u@[%u@d%u@] on and follow me.”%vn~
          %u@9Once he left %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ he followed him, but because of the angel he didn’t know that what was happening was for real; he kept on thinking that he was having a dream. %u@1%u@0After passing through the night watchmen’s first checkpoint and through the second%u@[%u@e%u@], they went to the Iron Gate, the gate %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ when carrying things into the city. %I@T%i@h%i@a%i@t very gate opened automatically itself for them, and after they left %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@,%i@ they went down one narrow street and immediately the angel left him. %u@1%u@1Peter came to his senses and said, “Now I know for certain that the Lord sent one of his angels and delivered me from Herod’s clutches and from all that awaited me from the Judean folk-people.” %u@1%u@2Realising %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s, he went to Mary’s house (Mary the mother of John, who goes by “Mark%u@[%U@B%u@]”), where a good number of people were gathered praying.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3He knocked on the outer courtyard door and a girl%u@[%u@f%u@] named Rhoda went to answer it. %u@1%u@4Recognizing Peter’s voice, out of joy she didn’t open the door but ran in and announced that Peter’s standing at the door. %u@1%u@5They told her, “You’re crazy,” but she kept on insisting that it’s so. They kept on telling her, “It’s his messenger%u@[%u@g%u@],” %u@1%u@6but Peter stayed there knocking, so they opened %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@o%i@r, saw him, and just lost it. %u@1%u@7He motioned with his hand to get them to quiet down and began to explain how the Lord led him out of the prison; in addition, he told them, “Go out and tell these things to James and his brothers.” He left and went to some other place.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8When daylight came, no small amount of commotion took place among the soldiers: what exactly%u@[%u@h%u@] happened to Peter? %u@1%u@9Herod looked for him and upon not finding him interrogated the guards and ordered that they be taken away %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@e%i@c%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@d and left Judea for Caesarea and proceeded to spend time there.%vn~
          %u@2%u@0Now he was furious with Tyre and Sidon; but in %i@t%i@h%i@e solidarity %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@, they approached him and, once they won the king’s chamberlain Blastus over to their side, kept begging for peace on account of their country being fed out of the king’s %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@n %i@s%i@i%i@l%i@o%i@s. %u@2%u@1On a prearranged date, Herod, fully clothed in his regal apparel and presiding in his official capacity as judge%u@[%u@i%u@], proceeded to address them. %u@2%u@2The populace kept shouting out, “%I@W%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ a god’s voice and not a human voice!” %u@2%u@3Immediately an angel struck him in retaliation for not coming clean and telling the truth%u@[%u@j%u@]%u@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@r%i@k%i@ %i@s%i@l%i@i%i@d%i@e, and he wound up%u@[%U@B%u@] being eaten by worms and breathed his last.%vn~
          %u@2%u@4The Word of God kept on growing and multiplying. %u@2%u@5Having fulfilled their mission, Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem and took along with them John who goes by Mark%u@[%U@C%u@]. %vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@k%i@-%i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%I@P%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@i%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n…Or perhaps: %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@g%i@a%i@r%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s [or %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@w%i@e%i@a%i@r] %i@o%i@n. Lit: %i@g%i@i%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@s. Some liberties taken. Also, g%i@i%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@ is a biblical idiom which means “get ready to roll” or “get ready for action.”%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@j%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@e%i@t…Lit: %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@a%i@k. Some liberties taken.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@n%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@e%i@c%i@k%i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d…Or: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@n%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@g%i@i%i@r%i@l…Or: %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@-%i@g%i@i%i@r%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@r…Or perhaps: %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l. The text is ambiguous. If it is %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l, that would be facetious, and in this case we would instead say %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@l%i@y…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@p%i@a%i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@e…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y. An idiom; ref. note of John 9:24.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@w%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s…Probably chained to both guards%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@w%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e. It’s unlikely that he was eaten by worms immediately, the moment he was still in the middle of speaking, but, while the wording in the GT indicates that this was his fate, it doesn’t say that it happened instantly.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%I@M%i@a%i@r%i@k…The same Mark who wrote the Gospel of Mark. Also referred to as John-Mark. Also, some scholars believe that this house was the same building where the upper room was used for both the Last Supper and where the 120 were gathered on Pentecost.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Acts Chapter 13%hb~
          %u@1Now there were prophets and teachers interspersed throughout the church in Antioch: Barnabas, Simeon who goes by Niger, and Lucius the Cyrenian; Manaen a close, boyhood friend (might’ve even been a foster brother) of the tetrarch Herod, and Saul. %u@2While worshipping the Lord in worship services and while fasting, the Holy Spirit told them, “Consecrate Barnabas and Saul to the work that I have called them.” %u@3Then, after fasting, praying, and laying hands on them, they turned them loose.%vn~
          %u@4So then they, having been dispatched by the Holy Spirit, went over to Seleucia, and from there sailed out to Cyprus. %u@5When they wound up in Salamis, they proclaimed God’s word in the Jews’ synagogues. Now he had Mark%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d to run errands for him and to help with odds-and-ends.%vn~
          %u@6After they went through the entire island all the way to Paphos, they ran across a particular man, a sorcerer/false-prophet Jew who adopted the name “Joshua-2.0%u@[%U@A%u@],” %u@7an associate of the intelligent, quick-witted %I@R%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ proconsul Sergius Paulus. This fellow %I@S%i@e%i@r%i@g%i@i%i@u%i@s%i@ %I@P%i@a%i@u%i@l%i@u%i@s%u@[%U@B%u@] summoned Barnabas and Saul, seeking to hear all about God’s word. %u@8The sorcerer Elymas (that’s the way his name—%I@J%i@o%i@s%i@h%i@u%i@a%i@-%i@2%i@.%i@0%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%u@[%U@B%u@]—is translated), though, opposed them, trying to distort the message, steering the proconsul away from the faith. %u@9But Saul (%i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ also%i@ “Paul”%u@[%U@C%u@]), being full of the Holy Spirit, glared at him %u@1%u@0and said, “Oh, aren’t you full of all kinds of deception, trickery, and unscrupulousness, you spitting image of the devil, you enemy of any shape or form of righteousness?%u@[%u@b%u@]—You won’t pause for a moment in your turning people away by your distortion of the Lord’s Straightforward Ways. %u@1%u@1See here: a supernatural working of the Lord’s power %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l %i@a%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@i%i@l you%u@[%u@c%u@] right this moment, and you’ll become blind—not %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ see the sun—for a duration of time”—and immediately a total loss of sight to where everything went completely dark%u@[%u@d%u@] was imposed upon him%u@[%u@e%u@], and he began to go around trying to find a blind-man’s guide to lead him about by the hand. %u@1%u@2Upon seeing what had happened, the proconsul then believed, astonished at the lesson %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t the Lord %i@t%i@a%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %I@E%i@l%i@y%i@m%i@a%i@s.%i@%vn~
          %u@1%u@3Paul and the band which surrounded him put out to sea at Paphos and went to Perga, Pamphylia. Mark, however, left them and returned to Jerusalem. %u@1%u@4For their part, though, starting at Perga, they cut across and arrived in Antioch-Pasidia, and attended a synagogue meeting on the Sabbath, introduced themselves, and took a seat. %u@1%u@5After the bringing-out of the Old Testament scrolls%u@[%u@f%u@], the synagogue heads sent them%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e, “Men, comrades, if any one of you has an encouraging word%u@[%U@D%u@] for the folk-people, speak up.” %u@1%u@6Paul stood up, gestured with his hand, and said:%vn~
      “Men, Israelites, and Gentile sympathizers to Judaism%u@[%u@g%u@], listen %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y. %u@1%u@7The God of this people Israel chose our ancestors and brought them to prominence%u@[%u@h%u@] in the temporary stay in Egypt, and by a supernatural intervention in the affairs of mankind%u@[%u@i%u@] brought them out of there %u@1%u@8and tolerated them for about forty years in the wilderness. %u@1%u@9After destroying seven nations in Canaan, he took possession of their land, %u@2%u@0occupying it for about 450 years. After this, He designated ad-hoc rulers%u@[%u@j%u@] until the prophet Samuel %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@e. %u@2%u@1And then they asked for a king, and God gave them Saul son of Kish, a man from the clan%u@[%u@k%u@] of Benjamin, for forty years. %u@2%u@2Once he was removed, He brought David to prominence, making him their king. He went on record and said about him, ‘I found David son of Jesse, a man after My heart, one who does everything I ever wanted.’ %u@2%u@3From out of this fellow’s lineal descendants God brought Israel to a savior %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@d Jesus, according to what had been promised, %u@2%u@4John having preached ahead of time, before %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@ came on the scene, a baptism, an initiation ceremony of a change of heart and of ways%u@[%u@l%u@], to all the people of Israel. %u@2%u@5But as John crossed the finish line%u@[%u@m%u@] %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g, he kept on saying, ‘What do you all suppose that I am? I am not %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@n%i@e—No—get ahold of this: he who comes after me—I am not worthy to take his sandal off.’%vn~
          %u@2%u@6”Men, comrades, descendants of Abraham’s line, and those Gentiles among you who are Jewish sympathizers: the message of this rescue-plan %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@e%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@ has been sent out to you. %u@2%u@7The fact is, those who live in Jerusalem along with their rulers, not acknowledging this and the voices of the prophets which are read aloud every Sabbath, finished coming to a verdict, %u@2%u@8and—without a single one of them finding a reason for the death penalty—asked Pilate to kill %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s. %u@2%u@9%I@J%i@u%i@s%i@t as all the things noted about him in the Scriptures were fulfilled, they took him down off the wooden %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@-%i@b%i@e%i@a%i@m%u@[%u@o%u@] and put him in a tomb— %u@3%u@0But God resurrected him from the dead, %u@3%u@1the one who for many days was seen by those who accompanied him from Galilee to Jerusalem, by the very people who are declaring to the folk-people that this is indeed factual. %u@3%u@2And we are delivering the good news to you all, that what was promised to the forefathers has occurred, %u@3%u@3because God has fulfilled this among us the descendants, having resurrected Jesus, as there is also a verse in the second Psalms which reads:%vn~
%si~
“You are My son:%vp~
I have begotten you today%vp~
%si~
%u@3%u@4”Since He resurrected him from the dead, he’s not going to be%i@ returning to bodily decomposition%u@[%u@p%u@] ever again. This has resulted in the following being the case:%nn~
%si~
“I will give you David’s holy things%u@[%u@q%u@], his guaranteed things%vp~
%si~
%u@3%u@5”Consequently, there’s another place where it says:%nn~
%si~
“You will not destine%u@[%u@r%u@] Your Holy%i@-%I@O%i@n%i@e%u@[%u@q%u@]%vp~
To undergo bodily decomposition%vp~
%si~
%u@3%u@6”Indeed, when his own generation %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@, David attended to the will of God and expired%u@[%u@s%u@] and went to be with his ancestors and underwent decomposition, %u@3%u@7but the one whom God raised %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ didn’t undergo decomposition. %u@3%u@8So now, let it be known, men, comrades, that through this %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ forgiveness of sins is being proclaimed to you—%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s of everything which you have not been justified in doing%i@ by the Law of Moses. %u@3%u@9By this %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ everyone who believes is justified. %u@4%u@0So see to it that what’s been spoken by the %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ prophets not get the better of you%u@[%u@t%u@]:%nn~
%si~
%u@4%u@1”Here they are, the cynics and the scoffers:%vp~
Gape %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n vanish,%vp~
Because I’m doing something special in your lifetime%u@[%u@u%u@].%vp~
There’s no way at all that you would believe what I’m up to,%vp~
Even if someone were to describe it to you.”%vp~
%si~
          %u@4%u@2While they were saying goodbye, they kept pleading with him to speak to them on the following Sabbath, to talk %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ about what was said. %u@4%u@3Once they were dismissed from the synagogue %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@i%i@c%i@e, many of the Jews and the devout proselytes %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@J%i@u%i@d%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@m followed Paul and Barnabas. While certain ones of them in particular were speaking face-to-face with them, %I@P%i@a%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@B%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@b%i@a%i@s kept on persuading them to continue in the grace of God.%vn~
          %u@4%u@4On the following Sabbath, almost the entire city gathered together to hear the Word of the Lord. %u@4%u@5Seeing how many were in the crowd, the Jews were filled with envy and proceeded to say things in opposition to what was spoken by Paul, contradicting him and blaspheming %i@h%i@i%i@m, %u@4%u@6and so Paul and Barnabas, speaking to the wider audience, said, “It was necessary to speak the Word of God to you first, %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ since you reject it and render yourselves unworthy of that special fullness of life%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@ (eternal life), take note: I’m turning to the Gentiles. %u@4%u@7You see, the Lord has given you commands to follow like this:%vn~
%si~
“I have positioned you %I@J%i@e%i@w%i@s%vp~
%I@T%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e a light for Gentile nations,%vp~
In order that you be a means of rescue and refuge%vp~
To the furthest reaches of the planet.”%vp~
%si~
%u@4%u@8Hearing this, the Gentiles proceeded to rejoice and to glorify the Word of the Lord, and the very ones who were appointed to eternal life believed%u@[%U@E%u@].%nn~
          %u@4%u@9Now the Word of the Lord kept on being spread throughout the whole country. %u@5%u@0The Jews incited the pious women, the ones who were prominent and who were leaders in the city, fomented a persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and kicked them out of their district. %u@5%u@1They wiped their hands of it%u@[%u@v%u@] and went to Iconium, %u@5%u@2and the disciples kept on being filled with a Holy-Spirit-fueled-joy%u@[%u@w%u@].%vn~

%u@[%u@a%u@]%I@M%i@a%i@r%i@k…Lit: %I@J%i@o%i@h%i@n. Some liberties taken.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%I@O%i@h%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@s%i@c%i@r%i@u%i@p%i@u%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@,%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@e%i@m%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@p%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@?…Lit: %I@O%i@h%i@,%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@s%i@c%i@r%i@u%i@p%i@u%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@e%i@m%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s? %I@F%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@t, etc. is a figure of speech (ref. Matt. 4:23).%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@r%i@k…Lit: %i@d%i@i%i@m%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@r%i@k%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s. A hendiadys; ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m…Lit: %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@r%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@t%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%I@G%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@y%i@m%i@p%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@J%i@u%i@d%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@m…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d. Ref. note of Acts 10:2.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@b%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e…Lit: %i@e%i@x%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@f%i@a%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@m. A well-known biblical expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@-%i@h%i@o%i@c%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@s. Ref. note of Matt. 19:28.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@c%i@l%i@a%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@s…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@c%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e…Lit: %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@e%i@-%i@p%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@…Lit: %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@v%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@-%i@b%i@e%i@a%i@m…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@o%i@d. A synecdoche for the cross; ref. note of Acts 5:30.%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@b%i@o%i@d%i@i%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Or: %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@y. A synecdoche for death, one taken from the OT in the quotation in v. 35. When Paul uses this word in v. 34, he’s thinking ahead about the OT verse which he quotes in v. 35.%fn~
%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s…%I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@-%I@O%i@n%i@e…Plural and singular forms of the same word. Since the word itself is uncommon, Paul appears to be associating the two OT quotations, and that’s why he begins v. 35 with the word %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@.%i@ In other words, one of the things referred to by “David’s holy things” in v. 34 is the “Holy-One” (Jesus) in v. 35.%fn~
%u@[%u@r%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@e…Lit: %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@t [or perhaps, %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w]%fn~
%u@[%u@s%u@]%i@e%i@x%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@l%i@e%i@e%i@p. A NT expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@t%u@]%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u. A well-known biblical expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@u%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@s. %I@W%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k is a figure of speech, emphasizing that the work is something special, unusual, and to be anticipated.%u@%fn~
%u@[%u@v%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@p%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@…Lit: %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@.%i@ This is an expression; it’s questionable—doubtful—whether Paul and Barnabas actually did this. Ref. Matt. 10:14; Mark 6:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@w%u@]%i@a%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@-%I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@-%i@f%i@u%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@-%i@j%i@o%i@y…Lit: %i@j%i@o%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t. A hendiadys; ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%i@%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@J%i@o%i@s%i@h%i@u%i@a%i@-%i@2%i@.%i@0…[%i@2%i@.%i@0 is %i@t%i@w%i@o%i@-%i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@-%i@o%i@h%i@,%i@ a remake of the original]…Lit: %I@B%i@a%i@r%i@-%I@J%i@o%i@s%i@h%i@u%i@a [which some render %I@B%i@a%i@r%i@-%I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s]. %I@B%i@a%i@r%i@ is the Hebrew prefix for %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@.%i@ It’s unlikely that he knew anything about Jesus, so %I@B%i@a%i@r%i@-%I@J%i@o%i@s%i@h%i@u%i@a%i@ is the logical choice over %I@B%i@a%i@r%i@-%I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@.%i@ By the sounds of his name, he fancied himself as another Joshua, one who assumes the leadership of the people and takes them into the Promised Land.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %I@S%i@e%i@r%i@g%i@i%i@u%i@s%i@ %I@P%i@a%i@u%i@l%i@u%i@s…Lit: %I@T%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w. The context suggests that %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ refers to Sergius Paulus, not Bar-Joshua, as the grammatical inflections more strongly suggests it refers to Bar-Joshua. The conclusion is that Luke should’ve done a better job at resolving this ambiguity and should’ve avoided any insinuation that %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ refers to Bar-Joshua. Along these same lines, in v. 8 the interpolation “Joshua-2.0’s name, that is”%i@ was added to clarify that Luke means that Bar-Joshau and Elymas are not two different people.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@o%i@ %i@“%I@P%i@a%i@u%i@l%i@”…From here out, Saul is mostly referred to as %I@P%i@a%i@u%i@l. Notice how the spelling of %I@S%i@a%i@u%i@l%i@ and %I@P%i@a%i@u%i@l%i@ differ only by a single consonant; %I@P%i@a%i@u%i@l%i@ is the Gentile-equivalent of the Jewish name Saul. To give an analogy, let’s say there’s a man from Central America with the Spanish name %I@J%i@a%i@i%i@m%i@e who’s working in an English-speaking company in the U.S. Among his coworkers, he goes by %I@J%i@i%i@m%i@m%i@y, an English-equivalent of %I@J%i@a%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@. But in the Spanish conversation among his family and friends, he’s still %I@J%i@a%i@i%i@m%i@e.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@i%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d…Paul and Barnabas were strangers attending the synagogue for the first time and were asked if they wanted to stand up and speak to the audience, which Paul proceeded to do for a few minutes. This was standard practice back then; nowadays, churches won’t even invite those who itinerate in their denomination (if there’s any still around) to speak at their church for the weekend that the pastor’s on vacation. Pastors these days completely monopolize the pulpit only, occasionally throwing out a bone to their obsequious staff underlings, and only so they don’t get discouraged and quit…and—after all—who’s going to speak when the pastor’s on vacation anyways? Churches claim to faithfully adhere to the practices of the Bible. They do not. In this day and age of the abundant availability of information, over the years they have further restricted what is spoken in their church instead.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@j%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e…Lit: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@j%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ [%i@o%i@n]%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ [%i@a%i@s]%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@.%i@ From v. 48, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@.%i@ In the debate between free will and predestination, the two sides of the coin are presented in these two verses. Rejecting Christ, an act of their free will, made them unworthy of eternal life. Those who rejected Christ were not appointed to eternal life (v. 48). Free will and predestination are in harmony with one another, not in opposition.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Acts Chapter 14%hb~
          %u@1In Iconium events occurred along the same lines: they introduced themselves to the members of the synagogue and affiliated themselves with it in order to speak %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@y%i@n%i@a%i@g%i@o%i@g%i@u%i@e%i@ so that a great many Jews, and not only they but Greek%i@-%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@w%i@s%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@, would become believers. %u@2The Jews who weren’t converted %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h went on the offensive against them and polluted the minds of the Gentiles, pitting them against the comrades%u@[%u@a%u@]. %u@3So then they stayed a good deal of time speaking openly about the Lord, testifying about the message of his grace, allowing miracles%u@[%u@b%u@] to take place through their hands. %vn~
          %u@4The majority of the population was divided: on the one hand there were those of the Jews’ camp; on the other hand there were those of the apostles’ camp. %u@5Spontaneously and impulsively, both the Gentiles and the Jews were joined by their rulers and decided to attack them and stone them. %u@6Realizing what was going on, they got out of there and fled to the cities of Lycaonian, Lystra and Derbe %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ and to the surrounding area. %u@7There they continually shared the good news, the good news of the Gospel.%vn~
          %u@8%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s a certain helpless man in Lystra—unable to use his legs—who kept on sitting %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e, lame from the time he was born, one who hadn’t walked around %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e. %u@9This fellow heard Paul speaking; after %I@P%i@a%i@u%i@l stared at him, and while staring sees that he has %i@t%i@h%i@e faith to escape his affliction%u@[%u@c%u@], %u@1%u@0he said in a loud voice, “Get up on your feet and stand straight up!”—and he proceeded to do just that: he sprung up and walked around, %u@1%u@1and seeing what Paul did the crowd raised their voices in the Lycaonian %i@l%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ saying, “The gods came down to us in the form of these men!”— %u@1%u@2and they proceeded to call Barnabas “Zeus” and Paul “Hermes,” since Paul did most of the talking%u@[%u@d%u@]— %u@1%u@3and the priest of Zeus, %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e %i@t%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ is situated %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t before %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o the city, brought bulls and %i@t%i@h%i@e garlands %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h to the city gates and, joined by the crowds, was itching%i@ to perform sacrifices.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4When the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard this, they tore their garments%u@[%u@e%u@] %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ and rushed out into the crowd yelling, %u@1%u@5“Men, why are you doing this? We too are men who experience passion and pain the same way you do, while %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e telling you the good news of turning away from these worthless things to a living God, who made the sky, the earth, the sea, and everything along with them, %u@1%u@6who in the bygone generations permitted people everywhere to go their %i@o%i@w%i@n way %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g—%i@ %u@1%u@7and yet He didn’t leave them void of evidence%u@[%u@f%u@] %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o Him %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g up in heaven doing good things and being kind, giving you that sweet rain which makes for productive growing seasons%u@[%u@g%u@], the food injecting gladness into your hearts until your hearts are filled to the brim%u@[%u@h%u@].” %u@1%u@8Saying these things just barely caused the crowd to stop performing sacrifices.%vn~
          %u@1%u@9Now Jews from Antioch and Iconium arrived, talked the crowd into stoning Paul, did just that, and dragged him and dragged him %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@t outside the city, thinking he was dead. %u@2%u@0While his disciples were standing around him in a circle, he got up and went %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ into the city. The next day he left for Derbe accompanied by Barnabas, %u@2%u@1and after he proclaimed the good news %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@l%i@ to that city and made a decent number of disciples there, returned to Lystra, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ to Iconium, and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ to Antioch, %u@2%u@2getting the life-being%u@[%u@i%u@] of the disciples to rely%u@[%u@j%u@] %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d, encouraging them to stick with the faith and advising them %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ that a lot of difficulties and intense pressure%u@[%u@k%u@] %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@c%i@c%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ must %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@d%u@[%u@l%u@] in order to succeed in their life of faith (enter God’s kingdom)%u@[%U@B%u@].%vn~
          %u@2%u@3Now having prayed, combining fasting with the prayer, he went church by church and appointed presiding boards%u@[%U@C%u@], and the Lord kept on adding %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ to those who had already come to believe. %u@2%u@4They passed through Pisidia and came to Pamphylia, %u@2%u@5and after speaking the Word %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ in Perga, they went down to Attalia. %u@2%u@6From there they sailed to Antioch, from where they started the trip, and were commended for the mission they accomplished by the grace of God. %u@2%u@7After getting there and gathering the church together, they proceeded to report what God did, %i@a%i@s%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ with them %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@,%i@ and to report that He opened a door of faith for the Gentiles (i.e. He created an opportunity for the Gentiles to join the faith). %u@2%u@8They continued to spend time—and no small amount of it—with the disciples.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g [%i@g%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g] %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@a%i@p%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@f%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%I@P%i@a%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %I@P%i@a%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d [or %I@W%i@o%i@r%i@d]%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@g%i@a%i@r%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s…Ref. Matt. 26:65; Mark 14:63%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@v%i@o%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e…Lit: %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@-%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s. The double-negative is a figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@w%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s…Lit: %i@r%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@u%i@i%i@t%i@-%i@b%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s. A hendiadys; ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@j%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@a%i@d%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@i%i@m…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@-%i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@y. A hendiadys; ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@-%i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g… Also: %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@m%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s …Lit: %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g …%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@n…Or: %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n; %i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@d%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@m%i@u%i@s%i@t. The GT’s omission interpolated text is a figure of speech.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@G%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@k%i@-%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@w%i@s…Lit: %I@G%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@k%i@s. The assumption (which is not certain) is that these are Jews, not Gentiles, as is the case in John 7:35; John 12:20.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@s%i@u%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@(%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@)…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@-%i@g%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@[%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@]%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m. This verse is key in the assertion that the NT phrase %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@ is an idiom. (Being an idiom, perhaps this explains the double-use of the word %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ in the phrase.) In the context here of Acts 14:22, Paul is giving advice to those who are already disciples, telling them what they must do to “enter God’s kingdom.” If one takes %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@ literally, then this makes no sense, since they are already in God’s kingdom. It only makes sense if %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@ is taken as an idiom.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s…Lit: %i@e%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s. Paul did not appoint pastors to rule these churches but committees of elders. Though bishops would eventually replace the elders, both forms of church government are legitimate, not one or the other. Ref. note of 11:30.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Acts Chapter 15%hb~
