We—the very people who died (i.e., were transformed into a state of spiritual death, resulting in our lives becoming a stagnation of waste, joylessness, futility, and destruction) in the sin%u@[%u@c%u@] %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@s—how will we live in it still? %u@3Or are you ignorant %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ that any person at all who was baptized into Christ Jesus (i.e., was initiated into a total dedication to Christ Jesus) was baptized (i.e. was initiated) into his death? %u@4So we were buried together with him through the baptism %i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@y%i@m%i@b%i@o%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ resulting in death, in order that, just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, we too in like fashion would go about in a brand-newness of life. %u@5You see, if we’ve become united together in a way which replicates his death%u@[%u@d%u@], then certainly we will also be %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@ of the resurrection, %u@6knowing this: that our old-self%u@[%u@e%u@] was jointly-crucified, so that the body of sin (i.e., the sinful propensity incumbent to our human nature%u@[%U@A%u@]) would be done away with, done away with in respect to us slaving in the sin%u@[%u@c%u@] %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@s: %u@7for he who’s died has been justified from (i.e., cleared of; absolved of) the sin.%vn~
          %u@8Now if we jointly-died with Christ, we believe that we’ll also jointly-live with him, %u@9knowing for a fact that, now that he’s been raised from the dead, Christ won’t die anymore%u@[%u@f%u@]: death no longer has control over him. %u@1%u@0The fact is, what%u@[%u@g%u@] died died once and for all in the sin %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@s; what lives lives in God. %u@1%u@1In the same way we also consider ourselves to be, on the one hand, dead in the sin, but on the other hand living in Christ Jesus.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2So don’t keep on letting sin reign in your mortal bodies (i.e., the part of you which hosts carnal desires during your life here on Earth) to where you obey its %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@f%i@u%i@l desire, %u@1%u@3nor put your body parts (i.e., your physical body parts, each part being a metonymy for various activities one engages in. In this case, each part is a metonymy for this or that sin, the whole comprising your personal carnal signature) in a place where they’re available to be used as tools, mechanisms, or weapons of unrighteousness in the sin %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@s, but instead put yourselves in a place where you’re made available in God as alive from the dead and your body parts as tools, mechanisms, and weapons of righteousness in God. %u@1%u@4To this point, sin will not control you; you see, you’re not under %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@d%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ law (i.e., your life is decided by a list of do’s-and-dont’s) but under %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@d%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ grace instead.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5So now%u@[%u@h%u@]…shall we sin since we’re not under %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@d%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ law but under %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@d%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ grace instead?—Don’t even think about it%u@[%u@i%u@]. %u@1%u@6You ought to know%u@[%u@j%u@] that whatever thing you make yourself available to be used by—used to the point of being obedient to—you’re enslaved to, %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@l%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ of either sin culminating in death or obedience culminating in righteousness. %u@1%u@7God is so good%u@[%u@k%u@]:%i@ you were slaves of sin, but you whole-heartedly obeyed what was presented to you in a clear, orderly, and systematic way%u@[%u@l%u@]: the %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r kind of instruction %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@s; %u@1%u@8having been freed from the sin %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@s, you were enslaved by righteousness.%vn~
          %u@1%u@9The subject I’m talking about is the human condition and human experience on account of the weakness of your flesh (i.e., of your lack of self-ability apart from God; of that part of you which has carnal desires; of that part of you which fails to live up to God’s standards). You see, just as you made your %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ parts available to be used as slaves in the filth and degradation%u@[%u@m%u@] %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ and in %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@,%i@ namely the refusal to be restrained by any laws, rules, or codes of conduct, which leads to even more of the same%u@[%u@n%u@], in like fashion make your %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ parts available at this time to be used as slaves by the righteousness %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ which leads to holiness%u@[%u@o%u@]. %u@2%u@0The fact is, when you were yet slaves of sin, you were free %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ in righteousness.%vn~
          %u@2%u@1So what final result did you obtain back then, based on the things which you’re now ashamed of? The fact of the matter is that those things end in death. %u@2%u@2But as things stand now, %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ having been freed from the sin %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@ but %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ having become slaves in God, you’re getting holiness as your final result %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d, but you end up with eternal life (i.e., that special fullness of life) %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r. %u@2%u@3For the wages of the sin %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s death, but the gift of God %i@i%i@s%i@ that special fullness of life (eternal life) in Christ Jesus our Lord.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@m%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n…Or: %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n. Literal rendering is %i@i%i@n%i@ [or perhaps%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ or %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h]%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@ not %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@-%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f…Lit: %i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@w%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%I@S%i@o%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w…Lit: %I@S%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@? Or: %I@W%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@?%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@D%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@m%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w…Lit: %I@D%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d…Lit: %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e [%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s, %i@m%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@y, %i@b%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@v%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e] %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h [also %i@t%i@o] %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@l%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@y%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y…Lit: %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@d%i@y. A metaphor of a sort which compares the communication of a teaching to the transfer of the custody of a prisoner from one party to another.%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@f%i@i%i@l%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@g%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s. Rooted in the uncleanness defined by the Law of Moses.%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@f%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@w%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@w%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@w%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s. This is a parallel construct to the previous phrase %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@w%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@w%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@c%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n. The perspective which comes out of the NT is that the carnal nature present in all people is a component of the physical body; therefore, the words %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ and %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@ can or will, depending on the context, refer to the carnal nature, rather than the physical body itself. The words %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ and %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@ are used this way throughout the chapter.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Romans Chapter 7%hb~
          %u@1Or are you unaware, comrades%u@[%u@a%u@] (%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ I’m speaking to those %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ who’re familiar with the operative details of a law-code), that the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ exercises control over a person %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ during that person’s lifetime? %u@2To this point, a married woman%u@[%U@A%u@] (%i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@w%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@s%i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@v%i@o%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@—%i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@e) is legally bound to her husband while he’s alive. If the husband were to die, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@-%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@-%i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ will she be released%u@[%u@b%u@] from her legal constraint to her%i@ husband. %u@3So then, while her husband’s still alive, she’d be officially labeled an adulteress if she were to get %i@m%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@(%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@)%i@ to%i@ another man%u@[%u@c%u@].%vn~
          %u@4In the same way, my %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ comrades, through the body of Christ you too have been put to death in relation to the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ resulting in you having come into being %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ to another—to him who’s been raised from the dead—in order that you would produce aftereffects%u@[%u@d%u@] in God. %u@5You see, when you were in the flesh (i.e., trying in and of yourself to live up to God’s rules while at the same time beholden to your carnal nature), the passions of the sins %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d, those things that, on account of the Law, were repeatedly at work in our body parts (i.e., your personal carnal signature) resulting in the production of aftereffects in death (i.e., in a stagnation of waste, joylessness, futility, and destruction).%vn~
          %u@6But as things stand now, we’ve been released%u@[%u@e%u@] from the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s, having died to that which kept holding us down, so that we serve in newness of spirit%u@[%U@B%u@] (i.e. walking in line with and dominated by a regenerated human spirit, which is in communion with the Holy Spirit) and not oldness of letter (i.e., a strict, literal, exacting interpretation of the verbatim Law of Moses, along with a grueling, rigid adherence done the “old way”—out of a person’s self-ability).%vn~
          %u@7So what’s there to say about this%u@[%u@f%u@]? %I@A%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ sin?—Don’t even think about it%u@[%u@g%u@]—on the contrary I would not have come to know, recognize, and understand the sin %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ if not through law (i.e., by conducting my life under the weight of a long list of God-ordained rules); for indeed I would’ve come to know %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ first-hand had not the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ kept on telling %i@m%i@e over and over%u@[%U@C%u@], “Thou shalt not covet %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@-%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@-%i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%u@[%U@D%u@].” %u@8Sin took advantage of the situation through the commandment “%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@t” and worked utterly in me every sort of coveting imaginable%u@[%u@h%u@]: you see, apart from law (i.e., being forced to obey a list of rules) sin %i@i%i@s%i@ dead. %u@9In the past I was alive and living apart from law; but the commandment came and the sin %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ sprang to life; %u@1%u@0I died. It became evident in me that the commandment—the same one %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g to life—%i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g to death. %u@1%u@1To be more specific, the sin %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ through the commandment took advantage of the situation, fooled me completely, and killed me (i.e., caused me to die spiritually) by this. %u@1%u@2Consequently, the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s indeed holy, and the commandment “%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@t” %i@i%i@s%i@ holy and just and good.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3So the thing which is good became %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ death in me, %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t?%u@[%U@E%u@]—Don’t even think about it%u@[%u@g%u@]; on the contrary, in order that %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@v%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ sin would become apparent, sin utterly worked death through the good in me, so that the sin %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ would reach its maximal efficacy%u@[%u@i%u@] through the commandment “%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@t%i@.” %u@1%u@4You see, we know for a fact that the Law is intrinsically spiritual; I am fleshly (i.e., the nature of my physical body is that it is susceptible to carnal temptations, and that part of me does not want to serve God), having been sold by the sin %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d: %u@1%u@5I don’t understand nor do I recognize what it is that I’m getting done; the fact of the matter is, I’m not putting into practice what I want—I’m doing what I hate instead. %u@1%u@6But if I’m doing what I don’t want to, I concur with the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ concurring that it’s good. %u@1%u@7At this point, though, it’s no longer me personally accomplishing this but rather the sin which inhabits me.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8You see, I know for a fact that good does not inhabit me, that is, in my flesh (i.e. in my human, carnal nature); for the wanting is present in me, at hand ready to jump in, but getting the good done is not happening. %u@1%u@9In fact, I’m not doing the good that I want to do, but instead, I’m doing the bad which I don’t want to do and doing it on a day-to-day basis. %u@2%u@0Now if what I don’t want to do is the thing that I’m doing, It’s no longer me producing the finished product but the sin which inhabits me %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ instead. %u@2%u@1I’m discovering the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ (i.e., the principle that one should do right and live according to God’s will), then, with the wanting in me to do the good, because the bad is present in me, %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@g%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d; %u@2%u@2you see, I delight in the Law of God with respect to the inner-person, %u@2%u@3but I see another law (i.e., a different principle) in my body parts (i.e., in my unique carnal signature) waging war against the law of my mind (i.e. against the principles by which my mind operate), %i@d%i@e%i@f%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ and making me a prisoner of the sin which exists in my body parts. %u@2%u@4%I@W%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ a miserable person I am: who’ll rescue me from this body %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ death?— %u@2%u@5God is so good%u@[%u@j%u@] through Jesus Christ our Lord!—So then me—on the one hand I’m enslaved in mind to a law of God (i.e., to a principle set in place by God), but on the other hand %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@s%i@l%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ in flesh to a law of sin (i.e., to a principle of sin caused by carnality).%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@-%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@-%i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@d. The perfect tense is the reason for the extrapolation %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@-%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@-%i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n…Lit: [%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h] %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n. The dative case of %i@d%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ is same case as %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@s%i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ in v. 2, and refers to the same thing; hence the interpolation.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@u%i@i%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@d…As this is the same word used in v. 2, Paul is connecting the analogy of a wife who’s released from her marriage to us being released from the Law.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@m%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@.%i@ Ref. note of Rom. 3:4.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@a%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s. A figure of speech. %fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@x%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@e%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@c%i@y…Lit: %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@c%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@f%i@u%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d…Lit: %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e [%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s, %i@m%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@y, %i@b%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@v%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e] %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h [also %i@t%i@o] %I@G%i@o%i@d%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@-%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n. The GT is saying that she’s under the power of a man. According to the Law of Moses, only a man could initiate a divorce. Ref. note of Matt. 5:31.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@n%i@e%i@w%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…Paul’s intentional omission of the definite article before %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ (and for that matter, before %i@l%i@a%i@w) refers to the way in which a believer conducts his life. It does not specifically refer to the Holy Spirit per se, but instead refers to a lifestyle where one walks with the Holy Spirit. Some translations assume that the definite article is implied (which there are plenty of examples of such implied definite articles in other NT prepositional phrases), and therefore %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ here refers to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ [%I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y]%i@ Spirit. They point to 2 Cor. 3:6 as corroborating evidence. I disagree; Paul is consistent and precise in his inclusion or exclusion of definite articles in the preceding chapters of Romans, and he would’ve explicitly added one to specify Holy Spirit for the purpose of resolving the ambiguity he most certainly would’ve foreseen.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@(where%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ is an imperfect verb tense%i@). Unlike other NT writers (Mark comes to mind), and also because his epistles are treatises and not story-narratives like the Gospels, Paul uses the imperfect tense sparingly. This usage here feels as though Paul is being reminded of this over and over in his head, rather than seeing it appear over and over again in the Law.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@-%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@-%i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h…Lit: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r. The word %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ comes straight out of Exod. 20:17 in the LXX, so a reader in ancient times who was familiar with the LXX OT would immediately recognize this reference to the Ten Commandments.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%I@S%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@?…Or: %I@S%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@e, %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@?…Lit: %I@S%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n [or: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h; %i@t%i@o] %i@m%i@e. The word %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ is in the nominative case and %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ is either nominative or accusative, and for the GT to fit into a strict grammar parsing, the English translation must put %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ as the subject and assume %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ is accusative rather than nominative, meaning that %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ takes the predicate rather than the subject. The rendering with %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ as the subject and %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ as the predicate doesn’t make sense, hence other translations (NASB translates this, “that which is %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ became a cause of death for me”), change this according to the context. This means Paul made a mistake when he wrote this—a single-letter slipup, as %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@o%i@s%i@ (death, θάνατος/Strong’s 2288) need only be changed to %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@ (θάνατόν). On a side note, J.B. Phillips believed that Paul made a mistake in 1 Cor. 14:22a (ref. note).%fn~
%i@%sb~
Romans Chapter 8%hb~
          %u@1Therefore, there’s nothing %i@o%i@f condemnation now with those in Christ Jesus: %u@2The law of the spirit of life (i.e., the principle of living a spiritual life in communion with the Holy Spirit) set you free from the law of the sin %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@f%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ and the %i@e%i@n%i@s%i@u%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ death (i.e. the principle of sin coming about due to our human nature and the resulting stagnation of waste, joylessness, futility, and destruction). %u@3You see, the inability of the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ in that it was continually weak through the flesh (i.e., through human ability alone apart from God and aggravated by human carnality), God sent His very-own son in sinful-flesh form and, in regard to sin, condemned the sin in the flesh, %u@4so that the decrees of the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ would be fulfilled in us, in those who’re not going about their day-to-day business according to flesh (i.e., according to their own ability apart from God and according to their carnal nature) but rather according to spirit (i.e., according to a spiritual life, a life in communion with the Holy Spirit). %u@5For those whose existence is in accordance with the nature of the flesh think about the things of the flesh; those %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ spirit (i.e. with living a spiritual life) %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ the things of the Spirit. %u@6The fact of the matter is that the flesh-mindset%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ death; the mindset of the spirit %i@i%i@s%i@ life and peace. %u@7Therefore, the mindset of the flesh is an enemy to God; for it doesn’t submit to the Law of God; in fact, it can’t do so: %u@8Those existing in flesh can’t please God.%vn~
          %u@9You aren’t in flesh (i.e., live out of your natural ability and through your carnal nature) but in spirit (i.e., live out of a regenerated human spirit in communion with the Holy Spirit), if God’s Spirit in fact dwells in you. (If a given person doesn’t have Christ’s Spirit, that person’s not %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ from him%u@[%U@A%u@].) %u@1%u@0Now if Christ is in you—yes—the body is dead through sin, but the spirit has life and is alive through righteousness. %u@1%u@1If the Spirit of the One who raised Jesus from the dead dwells in you all, He who raised Jesus from the dead will also invigorate%u@[%u@a%u@] your mortal bodies through the Indwelling Spirit in you.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2So then, comrades%u@[%u@b%u@], we have an obligation—%i@b%i@u%i@t not to the flesh—%i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t to live according to flesh. %u@1%u@3If you live according to flesh, you’re going to die (i.e., experience spiritual death), you see; but if by spirit you put to death the practices of the body, you’re going to live. %u@1%u@4The fact is, any people—any people at all—who’re led by the Spirit of God: these %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e are sons of God. %u@1%u@5In fact, you have not received a spirit (i.e., a prevailing disposition) of slavery resulting in fear again; instead, you’ve received a spirit of adoption, one with which we cry out, “Papa%u@[%u@c%u@]! Father!” %u@1%u@6The Spirit himself in conjunction with our spirit%u@[%U@B%u@] jointly declares that we are children of God. %u@1%u@7If children, heirs too—heirs of God indeed; joint-heirs of Christ’s %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e, if indeed we jointly-suffer %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ in order that we too would be jointly-glorified.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8Regarding this point, I figure that the present-day sufferings aren’t even in the same ballpark as the glory that’s going to be revealed to us. %u@1%u@9In fact, the creation is in suspense waiting for the sons of God to break onto the scene%u@[%u@d%u@]. %u@2%u@0You see, the creation was subjected to futility—not willingly %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e—no—it %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@j%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d on account of whoever or whatever subjected it, %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ upon hope%u@[%u@e%u@] %u@2%u@1that the creation itself will be set free from the slavery of corruption (a corruption like decomposing organic matter) over to the freedom of the sons of God. %u@2%u@2Regarding this, we know from first-hand experience that every bit of the creation moans and groans in unison and is in agony in unison %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@r%i@r%i@u%i@p%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ up to now. %u@2%u@3Not only %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@a%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@a%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@ but so do those who have a token sample of celebration%u@[%U@C%u@] of the Spirit—namely us—we too moan and groan within ourselves in suspense waiting for an adoption, the redemption of our body (i.e., the restoration of the body to its original purpose and function and the elimination of the carnal nature). %u@2%u@4In fact, we were saved by hope; hope which is seen (i.e., is of something which verifiably exists in the physical world) isn’t hope—just who hopes for what he sees? %u@2%u@5Now if we hope for what we don’t see, we’re in suspense awaiting it, exercising perseverance throughout.%vn~
          %u@2%u@6In the same way, the Spirit helps us (i.e., he gets ahold of something in unison with us against that something) with our weakness: you see, we don’t know how we must pray or what we must pray; instead %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n, when he intercedes on behalf of others%u@[%U@D%u@], the Spirit himself intercedes (i.e., he personally acts on another’s behalf by joining up with him in order to obtain a goal, to hit the mark like an arrow hitting its target, %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@b%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@l%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@n) with moans and groans which can’t be put into speech. %u@2%u@7The one who searches the hearts knows for a fact the thoughts, opinions, and intentions of the Spirit, since he intercedes on behalf of%u@[%U@D%u@] people set apart for God%u@[%u@f%u@]. %u@2%u@8We know for a fact that God works all things in unison%u@[%U@E%u@] towards a good goal for them who love God, those who exist as the according-to-purpose called-ones, %u@2%u@9since they whom He foreknew (i.e., knew one’s individual personality, nature, and spiritual acuity before it became apparent), he foreordained%u@[%U@F%u@] to conform to the image of His son, resulting in him being firstborn among many comrades and brothers. %u@3%u@0Those whom He foreordained, He also called (i.e., summoned to believe in Him). And those He called, He also justified (i.e., declared “not guilty”); those He justified, He also glorified.%vn~
          %u@3%u@1So what’s the takeaway?%u@[%u@g%u@]—If God’s on our side%u@[%u@h%u@], who’s on the opposing team? %u@3%u@2He who certainly didn’t spare His own son, but surrendered him %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@x%i@i%i@o%i@n on behalf of us all, how will He not freely and willingly give us all things? %u@3%u@3Who will press charges against those chosen by God, those in God’s church? God’s doing the justifying (i.e., God’s the one Who’s issuing the “not guilty” verdicts); %u@3%u@4who’s issuing the guilty verdicts? %I@I%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@u%i@i%i@l%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@s%i@ Christ Jesus, the %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ who died, but—beyond that—was resurrected? %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ who’s also God’s chief executive%u@[%u@i%u@], %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w who also intercedes on our behalf? %u@3%u@5What%u@[%U@G%u@] will separate us from the love of Christ—tribulation…distress…persecution…famine…nakedness…danger…sword (i.e., another’s imposition of brute force upon you even to the threat of death)? %u@3%u@6Just as it’s written:%vn~
%si~
We’re being put to death all day long for Your sake%vp~
We’ve been slated %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@l%i@a%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ as though %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ sheep of slaughter%vp~
%si~
%u@3%u@7No—in all these things we come out on top conquering through the one who loved us. %u@3%u@8In fact, I’ve reached the point where I’m persuaded that neither death nor life nor %I@S%i@a%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@’%i@s agents nor %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n-chieftains%u@[%U@H%u@] nor present-events nor future-events nor unexplainable, supernatural, or miraculous powers%u@[%U@H%u@], %u@3%u@9nor heights (i.e., high highs) nor depths (i.e., depths of despair) nor some other creature will be able to separate us from the love of God, love which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.%nn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@v%i@i%i@g%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e…Lit: %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%I@P%i@a%i@p%i@a…Lit: %I@A%i@b%i@b%i@a. The Aramaic word for %i@f%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r. The Roman Gentiles, the audience of this epistle, must’ve not only known this word but appreciated the intimacy it conveyed.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%I@I%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@e…Lit: %I@F%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@r%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@p%i@e…Lit: %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@p%i@e. Repetition of %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@p%i@e%i@ in Rom 4:18, %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@p%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@p%i@e%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d…Lit: %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@s. %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ is what %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ means literally. %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ also means %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@.%i@ The saints are God’s people, those who obey Him, those who walk in His ways.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%I@S%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@?…Lit: %I@S%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@?%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@e%i@c%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d. Ref. notes of Matt. 22:24, 26:64.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m…Lit: %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m. Any person who has the Holy Spirit in them is a believer.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@j%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…A clear summary of Paul’s usage of the word spirit in this chapter and in his other epistles. As the GT doesn’t use capital letters, it isn’t always obvious whether Paul is referring to the Holy Spirit or to the regenerated human spirit—or to both. The context in addition to the inclusion or omission of the definite article (in line with rules for definite articles) is the only way of deciding.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@b%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@-%i@f%i@r%i@u%i@i%i@t%i@s. The Gk. word %i@a%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@ā%i@ (ἀπαρχή/Strong’s 536). Also used in Jam. 1:18. While the word %i@a%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@ā%i@ refers to the classical Gk. pagan offering of the first produce of the harvest, we assume Paul and James are referring to the wave offering of Lev. 23:9–11. In both cases, a first-fruit offering is a small sample of the year’s harvest—the most excellent sample obtainable—a token which is offered at harvest time to God (or the god) from whom is credited for causing the bountiful harvest. The first-fruits is the following: (a) a recognition and remembrance that God’s blessing, and not simply man’s labor, is the reason the crops grew and that there is a harvest; (b) a celebration of the harvest; (c) a time of thankfulness like the Thanksgiving holiday in the US; (d) a holiday which marks a change in the calendar year; (e) the end of a season of work and an acknowledgement of the work done during that season; (f) the very best of the best. When the word %i@a%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@ā%i@ is used in the NT, it refers to one, to several, or to all of these.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s…%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@f…In the GT, the word %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@ in v.26 begins with the preposition %i@h%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@ (ὑπέρ/Strong’s 5228) used as a prefix. In v. 27, %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@ does not begin with %i@h%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r; instead %i@h%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r is used right after %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@ as an ordinary preposition, rendered %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@f. This is why %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s was added to v. 26: it captures the differences between %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@ as they appear in vv. 27,28.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@n…Or: %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@n. The principal manuscripts are split fairly evenly between these two renderings, with the two oldest ones favoring %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@.%i@ Some claim that this verse says that God is the instigator of bad things, causing them to happen so that He can work them to do good; this may have been the reason why manuscripts were altered centuries ago. This verse does not say what the cause of bad things is; it simply says that if and when things occur—bad things included—God then works them for good. Since v. 31 says “if God’s on our side,” then it stands to reason that God is not the cause of bringing bad things into believers’ lives, otherwise, that would constitute Him being against them rather than for them.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d…The word’s Gk. root means: to mark out the boundaries; to lay down; to mark out; to determine; to appoint; to settle; to assign. The prefix means %i@a%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@.%i@ Concatenating the meanings of the prefix and the root gives one a clearer idea of what %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ means. %fn~
%u@[%U@G%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@o. Paul’s using a figure of speech, a personification, to refer to the items which he proceeds to list, as though each item is a person. The items listed are delimited by ellipses in an effort to convey this figure of speech to the reader.%fn~
%u@[%U@H%u@]%I@S%i@a%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@-%i@c%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s…%i@u%i@n%i@e%i@x%i@p%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@s [%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@r%i@s; %i@a%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s] %i@n%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@r%i@s…%i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@s. All the items in the list are of incorporeal things. It can be understood with no doubt that the word %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@ here refers to demonic agents; ref. 2 Cor. 12:7 for confirmation. As the introductory word %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@ speaks of demonic forces, it’s safe to assume that %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@r%i@s refers to demonic forces as well. This is also confirmed by the word’s usage in Eph. 6:12 and Col. 2:15. The justification of adding the descriptive words %i@u%i@n%i@e%i@x%i@p%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@s before the word %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ is (in addition to the other items being incorporeal) the way %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ is used in Matt. 4:12; Mark 6:2; 9:39 to refer to miracles, and in Matt. 24:29 to refer to the stars. %fn~
%i@%sb~
Romans Chapter 9%hb~
          %u@1Truthfully, I’m telling you in Christ—I’m not lying—my conscience attests %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@t in conjunction with the Holy Spirit %u@2that I have tremendous sorrow and incessant pain in my heart: %u@3%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@,%i@ that I would be granted this request%u@[%u@a%u@], that I—even I—be accursed and shunned by the Messiah, the Christ, for the sake of my brethren%u@[%u@b%u@], my flesh & blood relatives %u@4(the ones %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ referring to%i@ are the Israelites), they who have the Lineal Descent Selection%u@[%u@c%u@]; the %I@S%i@h%i@e%i@k%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@h-Glory%u@[%U@A%u@] (i.e., God manifesting Himself in His glory, such as in the burning bush); the Covenants (i.e., the Abrahamic, Mosaic, and Davidic covenants); the Enactment of the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%u@[%u@d%u@]; the Religious Service (i.e., the temple rituals, sacrificial system, priestly traditions, etc.); the Promises— %u@5who are %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@s of the patriarchs, and from whom the Messiah %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e, physically speaking, who is over all, God %i@b%i@e%i@ blessed forevermore. Let us pause a moment for that to sink in.%u@[%u@e%u@]%vn~
          %u@6It’s not as though the word of God has been ineffectual. The fact of the matter is, Israel doesn’t consist solely of everyone who was spawned from the nation of Israel%u@[%u@f%u@], %u@7nor are all of Abraham’s children (i.e., his sons, grandsons, etc.) his seed (i.e., his true father-to-son lineal descendants and progeny); rather, “Your seed shall be in %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h Isaac.” %u@8In other words%u@[%u@g%u@], the children of the flesh (i.e., the biological offsprings) are not the ones who’re the children of God%u@[%U@B%u@], rather the children of promise are regarded as being the seed. %u@9In fact, this statement %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ is based on promise, “I’ll come at the right time%u@[%u@h%u@], and Sarah will have a son%u@[%u@i%u@].”%vn~
          %u@1%u@0Not just that but Rebekah too, while doing on the marriage bed what married couples do, %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%u@[%u@j%u@] from %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e out of one man, from Isaac, one of our patriarchs. %u@1%u@1You see, while they had not been born yet and committed any good or bad deed, in order that freedom of choice in God’s purpose would persist— %u@1%u@2not as a works-outcome but rather as a calling%i@-outcome, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@o%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ the One Who calls%u@[%U@C%u@]—she was told that, “the %i@o%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ superior%i@ one shall serve the younger,” %u@1%u@3as it’s written:%vn~
%si~
I loved Isaac;%vp~
I hated (i.e., despised; had contempt for; loathed) Esau%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@4What’s the takeaway%u@[%u@k%u@]? Not that God’s unfair, right?—Don’t even think about it.%u@[%u@l%u@] %u@1%u@5Furthermore, he tells Moses:%nn~
%si~
I’ll have mercy on whom I so happen to show mercy to%vp~
And have pity on whom I so happen to have pity on%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@6So then it’s not %i@b%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ the person desiring this or that or the one pursuing this or that, but rather it’s a product of the mercy of God. %u@1%u@7In fact, in regard to Pharaoh the Old Testament%u@[%u@m%u@] says:%nn~
%si~
I brought you to prominence for this:%vp~
In order to demonstrate in you My power%vp~
And in order to make My reputation%u@[%u@n%u@] known%vp~
To everyone throughout all the land %vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@8So then, He shows mercy to whom He pleases; He hardens %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ whom He pleases.%nn~
          %u@1%u@9I know what you’re going to say now%u@[%u@o%u@]: how %i@c%i@a%i@n He blame %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ anymore? In this regard, who has arrived at a point where he’s%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ resisted His will? %u@2%u@0Wow—aren’t you something?%u@[%u@p%u@]—no, on the contrary who do you think you are%u@[%u@q%u@], you who responds to %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ God%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ with a contradictory reply? Shall the thing created tell %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ creator, “Why’d you make me this way?” %u@2%u@1Doesn’t the potter have the right to make vessels from the same lump of clay that are intended for dishonorable %i@u%i@s%i@e (i.e., dirty water basins or chamber pots) on the one hand but for honorable %i@u%i@s%i@e (i.e., best dinnerware pieces or decorative pots) on the other%u@[%u@r%u@]? %u@2%u@2%I@W%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ if God, wanting to demonstrate His wrath in a particular situation and make His capabilities known %i@n%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@r%i@ in the same%i@, while exercising a good deal of patience took vessels of wrath along for a ride%u@[%u@s%u@], preparing %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m for an ends of destruction? %u@2%u@3And %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@e, in order that the riches of His glory be made known, %i@w%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ upon vessels of mercy, ones that have been prepared beforehand for an ends of glory, %u@2%u@4even us, whom He called, not only from among the Jews but from among the Gentiles as well? %u@2%u@5Also, like in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@B%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ Hosea:%vn~
%si~
I will call the people who aren’t My people “My people,”%vp~
And %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ unloved %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n “beloved.”%vp~
%u@2%u@6And it will come to pass that in the place%vp~
Where they were told “You are not My people,”%vp~
There they’ll be called “sons of the Living God.”%vp~
%si~
%u@2%u@7Now while representing Israel, Isaiah cried out, %nn~
%si~
Even if the descendants of Israel happened to be%vp~
As numerous%i@ as the grains of sand on the seashore,%vp~
%I@O%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ a select few will be spared from calamity%u@[%U@D%u@]%vp~
%si~
%u@2%u@8Furthermore %I@I%i@s%i@a%i@i%i@a%i@h%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d:%nn~
%si~
Wrap it up lickety-split%u@[%U@E%u@]—%vp~
%I@T%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ the Lord will do upon the earth%vp~
%si~
%u@2%u@9And just as Isaiah said before the fact:%nn~
%si~
Had not the Army Commander-in-Chief%u@[%u@t%u@]%vp~
Left behind seed (i.e., progeny; heirs) for us,%vp~
We would’ve become like Sodom,%vp~
And we would’ve duplicated Gomorrah.%vp~
%si~
          %u@3%u@0So what’s the takeaway%u@[%u@u%u@]? That the Gentiles—they who aren’t pursuing righteousness—cornered and subdued righteousness (a righteousness which came out of faith)? %u@3%u@1But Israel, pursuing a law of righteousness (i.e., a system of rules of right conduct), didn’t attain law (i.e., didn’t live up to the standards of those rules)? %u@3%u@2Because of what? Because %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@u%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s wasn’t from %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ faith but was %i@p%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@u%i@e%i@d%i@ as though %i@i%i@t %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d from %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f works. They crashed into the collision-stone, %u@3%u@3just like it’s written:%vn~
%si~
Look here! I’m laying a collision-stone%vp~
In Zion%u@[%u@v%u@] (i.e., in My yet-to-come relationship with mankind)%vp~
And a problem-causing rock%u@[%U@F%u@]%vp~
And he who believes and trusts in it/him%u@[%U@G%u@]%vp~
Won’t have any regrets%vp~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@t…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y. Quoting Max & Mary, “in Hellenistic Greek, the imperfect verb tense takes the place of potential optative”; this is the case here.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@b%i@r%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@r%i@e%i@n…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@ %I@D%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %I@S%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@o%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@E%i@n%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@g%i@i%i@s%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%I@L%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n. Ref. Rom. 1:25; Rev. 19:4.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@a%i@w%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l…Lit: %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%I@I%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@S%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h [or %i@i%i@n] %I@S%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@h%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@, %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d …Lit: [%i@s%i@h%i@e] %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@d. The bed is a synecdoche for having ongoing sexual relations (ref. Heb. 13:4). That she conceived as a result is a synecdoche.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%I@D%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@m%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %I@S%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w…Lit: %I@S%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%I@W%i@o%i@w%i@—%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@o%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%fn~
%u@[%u@r%u@]%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@u%i@m%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@o%i@n%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@(%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@r%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@t%i@s%i@)%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@n%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@(%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@t%i@s%i@)%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@,%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@n%i@o%i@r%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@o%i@n%i@o%i@r. Same wording used in. 2 Tim. 2:20,21.%fn~
%u@[%u@s%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@o%i@k…%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t; %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@d . Somewhat of a figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@t%u@]%I@A%i@r%i@m%i@y%i@ %I@C%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@-%i@i%i@n%i@-%I@C%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f…Lit: %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@b%i@a%i@o%i@t%i@h [%I@H%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@s]. %I@S%i@a%i@b%i@a%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@ is Hebrew for HeH%I@H%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@s.%fn~
%u@[%u@u%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@v%u@]%I@Z%i@i%i@o%i@n…Ref. note of John 12:14%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@h%i@e%i@k%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@h%i@-%I@G%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y. Episodes in the OT where God’s glory was present: Moses and the burning bush; the cloud on Mt. Sinai; Solomon’s dedication of the temple; etc.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d…Lit: %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e [%i@a%i@r%i@e] %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d. The phrase %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ is a parallel construct to the literal rendering in v. 6, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l%i@.%i@ The use of the word %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ or %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ in this way is a figure of speech (also appears in John 1:2/%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n), one which is also used in English with the near and far demonstrative pronouns. In the NT, the use of %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ or %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ as a figure of speech, like in %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n or %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e means that the writer is spotlighting a person while presenting him to the reader; is emphasizing the distinction between one person and another (this is the case in chapter nine here).%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@s%i@-%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@o%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@n%i@e%i@ %I@W%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@s…(Ref. note of Acts 13:46 also.)This verse and the surrounding passage was a bedrock of Calvin’s teaching on predestination, and along with him most who taught and teach predestination. The question is not whether God chooses ahead of time or capriciously (or both), but how He so chooses. Although God reserves the right to choose irrespective of what man does, on the other hand He has given us promises whereby a person can be sure that if he acts on such a promise, God will fulfill his promise. There are thousands of promises in the Bible, and these are given for our benefit, to know that God has guaranteed something. On the other extreme is 1 Cor. 12:18, where God places each believer in Christ’s body capriciously. In the case of Jacob and Esau, where God chose Jacob and rejected Esau, reading into the story, God’s choice was not arbitrary, but was based on the heart of Jacob and of Esau. Furthermore, Jacob’s and Esau’s hearts were fixated while they were still in Rebekah’s womb—which is unusual. While, certainly, God chose Jacob over Esau before they were born and had “committed any good or bad deed” (v. 11), God saw their hearts before they were born and decided based on what was in them. When says in v. 15 that God will have mercy on whomever He chooses, it implies that no one is in a position to come to God and demand something by means of justice (ref. 3:19,20); this excludes God from being “unfair” (v. 14). %fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@w%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@m%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@d. The concept of the remnant is understood by studying its usage in the OT.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@w%i@r%i@a%i@p%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@e%i@t%i@y%i@-%i@s%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@t…Also: %i@s%i@h%i@u%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@l%i@y…Lit: %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@f%i@a%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@t. [very Lit: %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g]. The two Gk. words for %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ and %i@c%i@u%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ rhyme; this is likely a paronomasia (pun) of a sort. The use of this figure of speech explains the abrupt transition to the sentence which follows.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@m%i@-%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@c%i@k…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g [%I@S%i@k%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ (σκάνδαλον/Strong’s 4625)]. The word %i@s%i@k%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@ is used in the LXX to refer to the hostile nations which surrounded Israel and harassed her; its meaning is based on this usage. Ref. note of Matt. 18:6.%fn~
%u@[%U@G%u@]%i@i%i@t%i@/%i@h%i@i%i@m…It can mean either or both, as the GT is ambiguous. Perhaps when the OT was written, it was taken to mean %i@i%i@t, as the antecedent %i@i%i@t%i@ is %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@e, an inanimate object. But as Paul’s writing in the time of fulfillment of this prophecy, it’s known that the rock is a %i@h%i@e%i@,%i@ namely Christ. So Paul may have been intentionally putting this ambiguity to good use.%i@%fn~
%i@%sb~
Romans Chapter 10%hb~
          %u@1Comrades%u@[%u@a%u@], my heart’s good intentions %i@t%i@o%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@ and my prayer to God when I pray for them are targeted towards %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ salvation (i.e., their being rescued from spiritual, moral, mental, and physical calamity). %u@2Furthermore, I do declare that they have a zeal for God, but not %i@a%i@ %i@z%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@ in which they arrive at an understanding of what they’re doing%u@[%u@b%u@]. %u@3For while being ignorant of the righteousness of God and while seeking to erect their own righteousness, they didn’t put themselves in subjection to the righteousness of God. %u@4You see, for all those who have faith and believe, Christ puts an end to%u@[%u@c%u@] law (i.e., the method of living by God’s list of rules) whose end-goal is righteousness.%vn~
          %u@5In fact, Moses writes %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ the righteousness which comes out of law, %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g that, “Those things which a person has done, he’ll stake his life on them%u@[%u@d%u@].” %u@6But the righteousness which comes from %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ faith puts things this way: Don’t say in your heart, “Who will ascend into heaven” (that is, to bring Christ down), or, %u@7“Who will descend into the abyss (i.e., the world of the dead; the place of eternal identity-loss)” (that is, to bring Christ up out of the world of the dead)%u@[%U@A%u@]; %u@8Rather, what %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t say? %I@I%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@s:%vn~
%si~
The spoken-word%u@[%U@B%u@] is near you,%vp~
In your mouth and in your heart%vp~
%si~
…That is, %i@t%i@h%i@e “%i@s%i@p%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@-%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@”%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ the word of faith%u@[%U@C%u@] which we preach, %u@9that if you were to confess with your mouth %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord Jesus and believe with your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved (i.e., rescued from spiritual, moral, mental, and physical calamity). %u@1%u@0You see, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ is believed with %i@t%i@h%i@e heart, and the end-result is righteousness; %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ is confessed with %i@t%i@h%i@e mouth, and the end-result is salvation (i.e., the state of being saved). %u@1%u@1To this point, the Old Testament%u@[%u@e%u@] says:%nn~
%si~
He who trusts and believes in it%u@[%u@f%u@]%vp~
Won’t have any regrets%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@2In fact, there’s no distinction made between Jews and non-Jewish Westerners%u@[%u@g%u@]; for the same %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ is everyone’s Lord, enriching all who call upon him: %u@1%u@3“Everyone who ventures to call upon the Lord’s authority and reputation %i@f%i@o%i@r %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@v%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@ will be saved.”%nn~
          %u@1%u@4So how could they call upon him whom they haven’t believed in? How could they believe in a person they haven’t heard of? Apart from %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ preaching %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m, how could they hear %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m? %u@1%u@5How could %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e preach if they haven’t been sent out? As it’s written:%vn~
%si~
Oh, how beautiful are the feet (i.e., the course and direction of the lives)%vp~
Of those%u@[%U@D%u@] evangelizing the good things %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@6No, not everyone obeyed the Good News, the Gospel. You see, Isaiah says, “Lord who believed our message?” %u@1%u@7Therefore, the faith %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ comes out of hearing a message (i.e., listening intently to a message and letting it sink into your heart and not just pass through your head); the hearing %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ through a spoken-word of Christ%u@[%U@E%u@].%nn~
          %u@1%u@8That aside, I’ll tell %i@y%i@o%i@u %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s: It’s not as though they haven’t heard %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@e%i@t, is it? On the contrary:%vn~
%si~
The sound of their voice went out to the entire earth%vp~
And to the far reaches of the civilized world%u@[%u@i%u@]%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@9No, I’ll%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@-%i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ say %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s:%i@ It’s not that Israel hasn’t understood %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e, is it? Right out of the gate Moses says,%nn~
%si~
I’ll make you jealous over%u@[%u@j%u@] a people;%vp~
I’ll enrage you over a people who are clueless%vp~
%si~
%u@2%u@0And Isaiah takes it to another level and says:%nn~
%si~
I was discovered by those not seeking Me;%vp~
I became manifest to those not inquiring of Me%vp~
%si~
%u@2%u@1But to Israel it says:%nn~
%si~
All day long I’ve had My arms stretched out%vp~
To a disobedient and contrary folk%vp~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@-%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o…Lit: %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m…Or: %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@b%i@e%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m; %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m. Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m. An idiom, the meaning of which isn’t entirely certain.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %I@S%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t…Or: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m. Ref. note of 9:33.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@n%i@-%I@J%i@e%i@w%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@ %I@W%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@s…Lit: %I@G%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@k%i@s. Ref. note of 2:9.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@v%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d …Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d. The “name of the Lord” is a biblical idiom.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@c%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@a%i@b%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@a%i@t%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@D%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@“%I@W%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@”%i@ %i@(%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@)%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@,%i@ %i@“%I@W%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@y%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@(%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@;%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@-%i@l%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@)%i@”%i@ %i@(%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@)…This summarizes the two principal heresies of Christ: the first is “who will ascend into heaven to bring Christ down.” This is the view that Christ never became flesh and blood; that he is God’s son, but he’s always been up in heaven and always will be. Though he’s the son of God, he’s inaccessible to us; too high up for us; not able to and never has come down to our level. The second is “who will descend into the abyss to bring Christ up out of it.” This view says that Jesus was a man, but was subject to the same demise of any other human being. Although he lived an inspiring life, he’s dead now like any other person is. Essentially, he’s no use to anyone anymore since he was mortal like us, but now he’s dead and can’t help anyone anymore.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@-%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d…Gk: %i@r%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@ (ῥῆμα/Strong’s 4487). %I@R%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@ is a form of the Gk. word %i@l%i@o%i@g%i@o%i@s%i@ (λόγος/Strong’s 3056)%i@;%i@ it appears to be derived from an aorist participle from the verb form of %i@l%i@o%i@g%i@o%i@s%i@,%i@ which is %i@l%i@e%i@g%i@ō%i@ (λέγω/Strong’s 3004)%i@.%i@ The lexicon definition of %i@r%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@ is “that which is or has been uttered by the living voice; the thing spoken” (Thayer’s); “that which is said, word, statement, expression, or statement of any kind” (Danker & Bauer). To add to the note of John 1:1, a note which explains the meaning of %i@l%i@o%i@g%i@o%i@s%i@,%i@ it can be viewed as the comprehensive body of thought on a subject matter the ancient Greeks captured in a book (a scroll). Thus, the great philosophers wrote treatises on everything from science to politics. These treatises were the logos for a subject, the written word on that subject. On the other hand, a rhema is a spoken word on a subject, as indicated by its usage in Heb. 12:20. Since it’s spoken and not written, one infers a few things about it. First, it isn’t a comprehensive erudition on a subject. For this reason, John called Jesus the Logos and not the Rhema. Second, since it’s spoken, it’s applied to a particular situation at a particular point in time; it’s the logos applied in real-time; it’s a specific application of the logos. Third, the rhema spoken about in v. 8 the “word of faith” is the word which is “in your mouth and in your heart” and is spoken out “of faith.” Rhema is the logos, the written word, planted in one’s heart and spoken out of one’s mouth. The promise given in v. 9 is that anyone who speaks such a rhema about Jesus being Lord and God raising him from the dead is guaranteed to receive the promise, in this passage, to be saved.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h…This phrase in v. 8 is where the Word of Faith movement gets its name from. The Word of Faith movement says that this passage here in Rom. 10 is a general principle of faith—an important one—one which applies not only to being saved (v. 9), but to any and all promise in the Bible.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%I@O%i@h%i@,%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@a%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@(%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@)%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e…Feet in the Bible are a metonymy for the direction one’s life is headed in; his decision to follow a certain path; his tendency to do so; his consistency in sticking to it.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t…The Textus Receptus and other manuscripts say %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d, but the manuscript support for %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ is stronger than for %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@.%i@ The Gk. word %i@r%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@ (ῥῆμα/Strong’s 4487)is used for %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ here and throughout the chapter. By using %i@r%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@ repeatedly, Paul refers to the same concept throughout the chapter. Also, Paul writes %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ at the beginning of v. 17 rather than simply %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ (no definite article). The use of the definite article before %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ means that Paul’s continuing his train of thought and referring to the same principle of faith and the word that he started in v. 8.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Romans Chapter 11%hb~
          %u@1So, I’ll say %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s: God hasn’t rejected His people, has He?—Not a chance.%u@[%u@a%u@] The fact of the matter is that I myself am an Israelite, from Abraham’s seed (i.e. lineal descent; progeny; great-great-etc. grandson), the tribe of Benjamin— %u@2God hasn’t rejected His people, those whom He foreknew (i.e., knew their individual personalities, nature, and spiritual acuity before it became apparent). Or don’t you know what the Old Testament%u@[%u@b%u@] says about Elijah? As he intercedes with God against Israel:%vn~
%si~
%u@3Lord, they killed Your prophets, they tore down Your altars,%vp~
And I’m the only survivor, and they’re out to get me%u@[%u@c%u@]%vp~
%si~
%u@4What does %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s Divine Answer%u@[%u@d%u@] tell him instead?%nn~
%si~
I’ve kept at My disposal seven-thousand men,%vp~
Those individuals in particular%vp~
Who haven’t kowtowed%u@[%u@e%u@] to Baal%vp~
%si~
%u@5So in the same way in this day-and-age also, a remnant (i.e., the select few who’ve stayed the course) freely chosen by grace has emerged. %u@6Now if %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@o%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@ is by grace, it’s no longer a product of works, since grace %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t would no longer qualify as being grace. %u@7What then? What Israel sought after, that’s what it didn’t obtain; it obtained the free choice %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e, but the rest %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@m%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ were hardened %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e %u@8just as it’s written:%nn~
%si~
God gave them a deep, intense mindset%u@[%u@f%u@] of stupefaction,%vp~
Eyes incapable of sight and ears incapable of hearing,%vp~
Continuing%i@ up to the present day%vp~
%si~
%u@9And %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ David says:%nn~
%si~
Let their sustenance, provision, relaxation, and merriment%u@[%u@g%u@]%vp~
Turn into a snare and into a net%vp~
And into a cause of vexation%u@[%u@h%u@]%vp~
And into a tit-for-tat payback meted out to them.%vp~
%u@1%u@0Let their vision deteriorate to the point where they can’t see,%vp~
And throughout all of this %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ their back %i@b%i@e%i@%vp~
Thrown out and mangled up, leaving them hunched over.%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@1I’m saying that they haven’t careened off the road to where they’re stuck in a ditch%u@[%u@i%u@], have they?—Don’t even think about it.%u@[%u@j%u@] Instead, by their transgressions the salvation %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@w%i@o%i@o%i@p%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@v%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ in order to provoke %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@y%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@ to imitation because of envy%u@[%U@A%u@]. %u@1%u@2Now if their transgression is a bonanza for the world, and their failure a bonanza for the Gentiles, how much more %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@z%i@a%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ their saturation %i@i%i@n %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@b%i@e?%nn~
