          %u@1%u@3I’m addressing you Gentiles. Insofar as I have indeed been sent as a missionary—an apostle—to the Gentiles—I’m putting my ministry on center stage%u@[%u@l%u@], %u@1%u@4if somehow I might provoke my kinsmen to imitation because of envy and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@b%i@y%i@ save (i.e., rescue) some of them. %u@1%u@5You see, if their rejection %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s %i@b%i@e%i@ the world’s reconciliation, what can %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r acceptance %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s %i@b%i@e if not life from the dead? %u@1%u@6If the early sample%u@[%u@m%u@] of the harvest is consecrated %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d, the bulk of the harvest is consecrated as well; if the root’s consecrated, the branches are too.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7Now if some of the branches were chopped off, you—the wild olive branch—were grafted into them and became joint-partakers of the Olive Tree’s Root of Faith, %u@1%u@8no boasting from the %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@ branches %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@p%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@s. But if you intend to adopt a condescending attitude, %i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ you don’t support the root, but the root supports you. %u@1%u@9So if you’re going to say, “Branches were chopped off so that I could be grafted in”… %u@2%u@0that’s all well and good: they were broken off due to their refusal to believe%u@[%u@n%u@]; you’ve come to stand due to faith. Don’t think highly %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s, but %i@a%i@d%i@o%i@p%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ fear: %u@2%u@1if God didn’t spare the natural branches, I don’t see any way around Him not sparing you either.%vn~
          %u@2%u@2Ah%u@[%u@o%u@], God’s kindness and severity. On the one hand, severity %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ upon those who’ve wound up in a ditch by their own doing%u@[%u@p%u@], but on the other hand God’s kindness %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ upon you, if you were to continue doing what you’re doing in%u@[%u@q%u@] %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ kindness; otherwise, you’ll be “chopped off” %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k too. %u@2%u@3And they too—if they were to not continue in their refusal to believe, they’ll be grafted in: the fact is, God is able to graft them back in again. %u@2%u@4You see, if you were chopped off a wild olive tree and grafted into a cultivated olive tree, how much more will these natural branches be grafted back into their own olive tree?%vn~
          %u@2%u@5The fact of the matter is that I don’t want you to continue in ignorance, comrades%u@[%u@r%u@], over this mystery, so that you wouldn’t be forming within yourselves thoughts and ideas which haven’t been carefully considered or well thought-through, since, to a large extent a hardness has occurred to Israel until the fullness of the Gentiles enters in, %u@2%u@6and in this way all Israel shall be saved (i.e., rescued from spiritual, moral, mental, and physical calamity), just like it’s been recorded in Scripture:%vn~
%si~
The Deliverer will come out of Zion%vp~
(i.e., out of the manifestation of God’s ultimate plan)—%vp~
He’ll repel ungodliness from Israel.%vp~
%u@2%u@7And this is the Covenant from Me to them,%vp~
That I’ll take away their sins%u@[%u@s%u@].%vp~
%si~
%u@2%u@8Yes, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e enemies of the Good News, the Gospel, on account of you, but %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ beloved according to the Selection on account of the patriarchs %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l: %u@2%u@9the gifts %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d, %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@p%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@, and the calling of God (i.e., God’s selection to be one of His people) are irrevocable, you see. %u@3%u@0Just as you were disobedient %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ and unconvinced %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m a while ago, you have now received mercy on account of their disobedience and unbelief. %u@3%u@1In the same way, at the present moment these people too are disobedient to and unconvinced by your mercy to the effect that they would receive mercy. %u@3%u@2For God consigned them all%u@[%u@t%u@] to disobedience so that they all would receive mercy.%nn~
          %u@3%u@3Oh, the depth of the riches, the wisdom, and the understanding of God—as His decisions evade analysis and the path that He’s taken cannot be traced%u@[%u@u%u@]!…%vn~
%si~
%u@3%u@4In fact, who knew what was on the Lord’s mind?%vp~
Or who became His decision-making advisor?%vp~
%u@3%u@5Or who’s loaned him anything%vp~
That He’ll have to pay back?%vp~
%si~
%u@3%u@6…Because from Him and through Him and to Him are all things—to Him %i@b%i@e%i@ the Glory forever and ever. And let us pause for a moment to let that sink in%u@[%u@v%u@].%nn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%I@N%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e…Lit: %i@m%i@a%i@y [%i@i%i@t] %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %I@D%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@ %I@A%i@n%i@s%i@w%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@k%i@o%i@w%i@t%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@e%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@e%i@t…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@l%i@a%i@x%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e. %I@T%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ is a biblical synecdoche.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@x%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@c%i@k. Ref. note of Matt. 18:6.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@t%i@c%i@h…Lit: %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@l. The words %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@d%i@ and %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ refer to the word stumbling block in v. 9. The implication is that they’ve fallen into sin.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%I@D%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@m%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@-%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@-%i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@w%i@o%i@o%i@p…This interpolation is an insinuation of the aorist tense of the Gk. verb %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@(%i@e%i@t%i@c%i@.%i@).%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@g%i@e…Lit: %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@u%i@i%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@f%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@f%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@a%i@h…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@w%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@n. Refers to the word %i@d%i@i%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@ used in v. 11, which refers to the stumbling block. In the NT, stumbling blocks are often the result of hard-headed recalcitrance.%fn~
%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@i%i@n…Or: %i@b%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@r%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@s%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@s…Lit: %I@W%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@s. A figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@t%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l…Lit: %i@s%i@h%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@u%u@]%I@A%i@s%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@y%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@c%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@s. The Gk. words for %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@c%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ and %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ are %i@a%i@n%i@e%i@k%i@s%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@u%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@a%i@ (ἀνεξεραύνητος /Strong’s 419)and %i@a%i@n%i@e%i@k%i@s%i@i%i@x%i@n%i@i%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@i%i@ (ἀνεξιχνίαστος/Strong’s 421). These two words appear to be an alliteration/assonance; perhaps Paul was using an expression here.%fn~
%u@[%u@v%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@.%i@ Ref. note of Rev. 19:4.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@g%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@v%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@w%i@o%i@o%i@p%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@v%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@y%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@v%i@y…Or: %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@g%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@w%i@o%i@o%i@p%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@v%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@m%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t. Whichever of the two rendering is the correct rendering is ambiguous, hinging on what the antecedent of the word %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ is and compounded by Paul’s insistence that the reader supply the interpolated words%i@.%i@ The ambiguity of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ is resolved by the way that the same verb %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@j%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@y%i@ is used again in v. 14.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Romans Chapter 12%hb~
          %u@1On account of the mercies of God, I beseech you, comrades%u@[%u@a%u@], to present your bodies an alive, holy, and acceptable (“%i@a%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@”%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@g%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@d) sacrifice (%i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@l) to God, performing your religious ritual, one which constitutes worship. %u@2And be not conformed to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@y%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ this age, but be transformed on the outside by what’s on the inside by the renewing of the mind instead, resulting in you continuously approving as the result of examination what the will of God is, the good %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d, the acceptable%u@[%U@A%u@] %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d, and the perfect %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d.%vn~
          %u@3In addition, through the grace given to me I’m telling every one of you all not to let your minds stray and be thinking loftier thoughts, thoughts where you think more highly of yourself, than you ought be thinking%u@[%u@b%u@], but be sound-minded (i.e., come down to earth, straighten your head out, and get rid of those lofty thoughts) instead, as God has allocated an area of responsibility for every person%u@[%U@B%u@]. %u@4You see, just as there’re many parts to any given body, but all the parts don’t serve the same purpose, %u@5similarly, we the many %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ are one body in Christ, and a member of one another from an individual perspective.%vn~
          %u@6Now having gifts%u@[%U@C%u@] according to the grace (i.e., the giver giving not based on the receiver meriting it but based on the giver’s generosity; giving with no expectation of receiving anything in return; giving something freely and therefore irrevocably) given to us diversely, whether %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ prophecy (i.e., speaking the utterances of God) %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ according to the allocation of responsibility%u@[%u@c%u@]; %u@7whether being in charge of a particular area of ministry%i@ and serving in that area%u@[%u@d%u@], %i@l%i@e%i@t %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ to the service; whether teaching, %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ to the teaching; %u@8whether assistance, advocacy, counseling, and encouraging%u@[%u@e%u@], %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ to the assistance, etc.; whether giving%u@[%u@f%u@], %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ in singleness (i.e., in simplicity: straightforward, without hesitancy, hidden agendas, or internal conflicts); whether taking the lead, %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@d with pep, diligence, and self-motivation; whether being merciful, %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@d in cheerfulness.%vn~
          %u@9%I@L%i@e%i@t%i@ the love %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e genuine and without hypocrisy.%vn~
      Hate the evil %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d, adhere to the good.%vn~
          %u@1%u@0With a close comradeship, %i@e%i@n%i@g%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n close friendships formed out of natural affection.%vn~
      In the high value %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s, put each other ahead of yourselves.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1Using pep, diligence, and self-motivation, don’t be lazy.%vn~
      In the Spirit %i@b%i@e zealous%u@[%u@g%u@].%vn~
      Serve in the Lord.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2In good times, rejoice; in bad times, persevere%u@[%u@h%u@].%vn~
      Pray constantly—continuously.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3Be intimately familiar with the needs of the saints, your fellow believers.%vn~
      Reach out to those who are new or who are different—make this your pastime.%u@[%u@i%u@]%vn~
          %u@1%u@4Have a good word to say about those who persecute %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s.%u@[%u@j%u@]%vn~
      Bless and don’t curse.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5Rejoice with those who’re rejoicing.%vn~
      Weep with those who’re weeping.%vn~
          %u@1%u@6Maintain the same mindset towards each individual: don’t think you’re better than anyone else%u@[%u@k%u@] but associate with those who’ve been humbled by circumstances or by their station in life (i.e., those on the lowest wrungs of society; those who aren’t the brightest and best). Don’t become too big for your britches/too big for your boots%u@[%u@l%u@].%vn~
          %u@1%u@7%I@W%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@,%i@ don’t do something bad to them in return.%vn~
      Have respect for what people generally regard as beautiful and what they hold in high esteem.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8If at all possible, for your own part, be at peace with everyone.%vn~
          %u@1%u@9Don’t take your own revenge, beloved, but leave room for the wrath %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d. You see, it’s written:%vn~
%si~
“Vengeance is for Me %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o, I’ll pay %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ back,” says the Lord%vp~
%si~
%u@2%u@0Instead %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@g%i@e:%nn~
%si~
If your enemy happens to be hungry, give him something to eat.%vp~
If he happens to be thirsty, give him some water.%vp~
You see, by doing this you make him stew in his own juice%u@[%u@m%u@].%vp~
%si~
%u@2%u@1Don’t be defeated by the bad %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u, but defeat bad things with good things.%nn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@f%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y….The same Gk. word %i@p%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@ (πίστις/Strong’s 4102) as was used in v. 3. It has the same meaning as its usage in v. 3 (ref. note of v. 3).%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@a…The Gk. word used here is from the same root as the word %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@;%i@ %i@ref. note of Acts 6:3.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@v%i@o%i@c%i@a%i@c%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g…Same word used in Acts 11:36; ref. note there.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@g%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%I@I%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@z%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@s…Or: %I@W%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t [%i@d%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@,%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@o%i@r] %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@z%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@s. The word %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ used here is somewhat ambiguous.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%I@I%i@n%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@j%i@o%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@;%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@e…Lit: %I@I%i@n [%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f] %i@h%i@o%i@p%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@j%i@o%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n [%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f] %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@e. Note that %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ is an interpolation.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@R%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@w%i@—%i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@p%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@s%i@p%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%I@H%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@c%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@c%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g [%i@y%i@o%i@u]. The word %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ appears in some of the principle manuscripts but does not appear in the others.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@l%i@s%i@e…Lit: %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s. This appears to be an idiom. Also, the word %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ in this context (and it’s used three times in v. 16) refers to thoughts and attitudes you have towards other people.%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%I@D%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@i%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@/%i@t%i@o%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@i%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@o%i@t%i@s…Lit: %I@D%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s. This appears to be an idiom. The word %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ refers to the opinion you have of others (see previous note).The phrase %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s is also used in Rom. 11:25.%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@w%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@i%i@c%i@e…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@p%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d. An idiom.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@a%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e…Since the same Gk. word for %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ is used in here in v. 2 as was used in v. 1, the meaning of %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ as it appears in v. 2 takes on the same meaning as was used in v. 1, where in that verse it refers to the requirements specified in the Law of Moses for the sacrificial animal to be offered at the temple. The acceptable will of God is therefore one which meets the set of minimum requirements.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n…Lit: %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@t. The Gk. word for %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h [%i@p%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@s, (πίστις/Strong’s 4102)] also means %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@t. A similar word %i@p%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@s%i@ means %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ or %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@y%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@s…There’s more than one NT Gk. word rendered %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t;%i@ the one used in this verse is %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@a%i@,%i@ which is obviously derived from the word %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@ [%i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@,(χάρις/Strong’s 5485)]; Paul uses both here, exemplifying and reinforcing the relationship between the two. To quote Max & Mary, a %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@a%i@ is “a gift of God’s grace, for the benefit of the community.” A charisma is a gift that’s given by the grace of the giver (also, ref. note of Acts 8:20). It’s given irrevocably. The recipient did not and cannot earn it. The Greek word %i@d%i@ō%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@ (δῶρον/Strong’s 1435)%i@,%i@ which in general means %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@ as we know the word in English%i@,%i@ is also used when describing the gift offerings given to God; the implication is that the gift is given based on the worthiness of the recipient; the obligation to give.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Romans Chapter 13%hb~
          %u@1Let all people from all walks of life%u@[%u@a%u@] submit to the overarching authorities%u@[%U@A%u@]; the fact is, there’s no authority-structure except %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ by God, and those that exist have been arranged, organized, and put into place by God into the state in which they exist, %u@2so that any given person who opposes the authority %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ has taken a stand against the way that God decides to organize and arrange things; the ones who’ve taken a stand in opposition %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ will be judged (i.e., arrested, prosecuted, convicted, and incarcerated by the criminal justice system) for doing so. %u@3You see, those who do good have no need to be afraid of rulers; but those who do bad %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@d. Do you want to have no fear of the authorities?—do good,%i@ and you’ll be applauded by them: %u@4the %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ is God’s servant for you in a positive way. But if you were to live the life of crime, be afraid: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s have the wherewithal to forcibly and violently impose their will upon you—and won’t hesitate to use it%u@[%U@B%u@]. In fact, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ are God’s servants to dole out wrath upon the %i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@o%i@t%i@y%i@p%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ criminal.%vn~
          %u@5Putting it all together, you’ve got to submit %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ not just because of the wrath %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@f%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@ but also because %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e %i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n conscience%u@[%u@b%u@]. %u@6In fact, this is also a reason why you pay taxes: they’re ministers (i.e., officers, constables, judges, etc.) of God employed full-time at this, %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@x%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@u%i@e. %u@7Pay all %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@x%i@e%i@s%i@ that you’re on the hook to pay: tax to the taxman, tolls at the tollgate, customs at the customhouse, reverence—fear even—to the one who instills fear, honor to the one who should be honored.%vn~
          %u@8Don’t owe anyone anything%u@[%u@c%u@] except to love one another: he who loves another person has fulfilled law (i.e., has satisfied the mandates of any list of godly rules). %u@9To this end, the %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s, “Thou shalt not commit adultery,” “Thou shalt not murder,” “Thou shalt not steal,” “Thou shalt not covet,” and if there’s any other commandment %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@d, it’s summed up by one statement, “Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.” %u@1%u@0The love %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ to the typical neighbor doesn’t do anything bad; so then, love is a fulfillment of law.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1%I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ add%i@ this %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d. You know what time it is, that it’s time for us to wake up, for now our salvation is closer than when we %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ became believers. %u@1%u@2The night wanes, daylight approaches, so put away the deeds of darkness; put on the armor of the light. %u@1%u@3Like %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ during the day, go about behaving appropriately and properly, not with loud partying, drunkenness, or sleeping around and unrestrained indulgence in immoral, physical pleasures, nor strife, discord, contention and the ensuing passions. %u@1%u@4Instead, clothe yourselves in the Lord Jesus Christ and make no provision to indulge the desires of the flesh (i.e., one’s carnal nature).%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e…Lit: %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l. In the NT, %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@ is used from time to time as a synecdoche for %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n, emphasizing what’s in the mind of that person, the uniqueness and individuality of him.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e…Lit: %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g…Similar to %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g, the GT here also has an alliteration/assonance, %i@m%i@ā%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@i%i@ %i@m%i@ā%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@ (Μηδενὶ μηδὲν).%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s…The overarching authorities are a synecdoche for the entire authority structure from the top on down.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@c%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@—%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@i%i@n. %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d is a metonymy for the arms that the law enforcement agencies use, and also includes their coordinated efforts when using them. This is not only the use of violence to arrest criminals but to imprison them as well. Furthermore, that the violence is deadly violence: this verse says that law enforcement agents and the criminal justice system have the right, the ability, and the responsibility to inflict deadly violence up to the point of killing a criminal, not only while arresting him but as the sentence for the crime committed. %fn~
%i@%sb~
Romans Chapter 14%hb~
          %u@1Accept the person who’s struggling in the Faith %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s without resolving the disagreements %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e. %u@2On the one hand a given person who believes %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ eats every %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d, but on the other hand a given person who’s struggling%u@[%u@a%u@] with his faith is a vegetarian. %u@3Don’t let the one who %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ to eat anything%i@ despise the one who doesn’t, and don’t let the one who won’t eat everything judge the one who does; you see, God has accepted %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n.%vn~
          %u@4Who %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k you are, you who judges another man’s butler?—%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@r%i@ will stand or fall (i.e., get the nod of approval to continue doing what he’s doing or be reprimanded and forced to amend his behavior) by his own boss. And stand he will, for the boss—the Lord—is able to %i@p%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d stand him %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@e%i@t%u@[%u@b%u@].%vn~
          %u@5In fact, one person decides that one day stands out above the other days %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y; another person decides that all days are the same %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s—let each person work it all out in his own mind. %u@6The one who thinks %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@y thinks the day %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ to the Lord; the one who’ll eat %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g eats to the Lord; you see %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@ he’s giving thanksgiving to God; and the one who won’t eat %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g abstains from eating %i@c%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@s to the Lord, and %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@ he’s thanking God. %vn~
          %u@7The fact of the matter is that not a one of us lives for himself, and not a one %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ dies for himself. %u@8If we so happen to live, we live in the Lord; and if we so happen to die, we die in the Lord. And so, if we so happen to live and so happen to die, we are of the Lord (i.e., we are a part of, are derived from, the Lord). %u@9You see, Christ died and came back to life again%u@[%u@c%u@] to arrive at this point: in order to assume lordship over both %i@t%i@h%i@e dead and %i@t%i@h%i@e living.%vn~
          %u@1%u@0Who %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ you%i@ are,%i@ you who judges your fellow comrade%u@[%u@d%u@]? Or %I@I%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@n also say, who %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k you are to despise your comrade? You see, we’ll all have to stand in the courtroom before God the judge, %u@1%u@1seeing that it’s written:%vn~
%si~
“%I@A%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ I live,” says the Lord, “%I@I%i@ %i@s%i@w%i@e%i@a%i@r%vp~
That everyone %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%vp~
Will be on their knees before Me %i@p%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@,%vp~
And %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t every tongue will confess out loud%vp~
%I@I%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ to God.”%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@2So then each of you will deliver a %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ report%u@[%u@e%u@] to God concerning himself %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m.%nn~
          %u@1%u@3So no longer judge one another, but become all the more determined to not do something in particular that your fellow comrade believes is sinful or that causes your fellow comrade to regress into sin%u@[%u@f%u@]— %u@1%u@4I know for a fact and have reached the point where I’m persuaded in the Lord Jesus that nothing %I@I%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ is forbidden to partake of, participant in, or consume%u@[%U@A%u@] in %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f itself, except by someone who reckons that it’s forbidden—to that person, it’s forbidden. %u@1%u@5In fact, if your comrade is being hurt %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ because of food, you’re no longer walking in love. Don’t destroy he whom Christ died for with your food %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@v%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s.%vn~
          %u@1%u@6So don’t let your good %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@o%i@r%i@ be spoken of disparagingly. %u@1%u@7The kingdom of God (i.e., God’s involvement with mankind) does not %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ food and drink%u@[%u@g%u@] you see, but rather %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ righteousness, peace, and joy in the Holy Spirit. %u@1%u@8In fact, the one who’s serving—slaving away—in Christ in %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g this is well-pleasing to God and spoken well of by the people around him%u@[%u@h%u@]. %u@1%u@9So then pursue those things pertaining to peace and to each other’s edification. %u@2%u@0Don’t dismantle the work of God because of an issue over food. Yes, all %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@s can be consumed%u@[%u@i%u@], but’s it’s wrong for the person who sees %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d as an item of temptation and as something that is sinful to eat%u@[%u@j%u@]. %u@2%u@1The practice of not eating meat, drinking wine, or indulging in something which your fellow comrade believes to be sinful is laudable. %u@2%u@2Keep your personal beliefs between you and God. Blessed is he who’s not having to decide for himself one way or the other %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ what he’s OK with. %u@2%u@3But he who’s weighing point and counterpoint deciding if he’d chance eating %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ has already reached the point where he’s condemned (i.e., objectively guilty of wrong-doing), since that’s not a product of faith. Anything which is not a product of faith is a sin.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@g%i@g%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@k%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@e%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d. The interpolation is suggested by the aorist tense of the infinitive %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t…Lit: %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d. The interpolation %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ is implied by the use of the Gk. word %i@l%i@o%i@g%i@o%i@s%i@ (λόγος/Strong’s 3056)instead of %i@r%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@ (ῥῆμα/Strong’s 4487)%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@g%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@c%i@c%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@c%i@k. Ref. note of Matt. 18:6.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k…Lit: %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k. The Gk. words for %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d and %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k (%i@b%i@r%i@ō%i@s%i@i%i@s and %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@,%i@ (βρῶσις/Strong’s 1035), (πόσις/Strong’s 4213)) rhyme, making them a figure of speech (alliteration/assonance).%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m…Lit: %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@d…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n. This is the opposite of %i@u%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@ used in v. 14.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@c%i@c%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g. %I@O%i@c%i@c%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g is the same word used in v. 13; ref. note there, and ultimately Matt. 18:6. Also, the interpolations %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ and %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ are simple inferences, as without them, Paul would be permitting everything.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@b%i@i%i@d%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@,%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@p%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g [%i@i%i@s] %i@u%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n. The word %i@u%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@ is the Gk. word %i@k%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@o%i@s%i@ (κοινός/Strong’s 2839)%i@,%i@ which, incidentally, is also the root from which we get the word %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p%i@.%i@ Ref. Acts 10:14 with regard to %i@k%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@o%i@s%i@.%i@%fn~
%i@%sb~
Romans Chapter 15%hb~
          %u@1We who are capable ought to bear the struggles%u@[%u@a%u@] of those who are incapable and not %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ please ourselves (i.e., not just make ourselves happy). %u@2Let each of us please the neighbor %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ for his betterment. %u@3You see, Christ didn’t go around pleasing himself either, but %i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e according to this verse instead:%vn~
%si~
The reproaches of those who reproach You fell upon me%vp~
%si~
%u@4To this point, all the many things which were written %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t were put there ahead of time for our instruction, so that we would have hope through the endurance (i.e., never-failing consistency and persistency in spite of all things to the contrary—in this case, the consistency and persistency of the Old Testament’s themes) and through the advice, encouragement, and guidance of the Scriptures. %u@5May the God of endurance and of advice, encouragement, and guidance grant that you think along the same lines %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ among one another %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ consistent with Christ Jesus, %u@6so that speaking the same thing in unison%u@[%u@b%u@] you would glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.%nn~
          %u@7Therefore take each other into your circles%u@[%u@c%u@], just as, to God’s glory, Christ also took us in. %u@8In fact, I’m saying that Christ has %i@a%i@l%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@y become a minister of circumcision (i.e., a minister to those following the Law of Moses) on behalf of the truth of God arriving at a place where he proved that the promises of the patriarchs are reliable, %u@9but %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ the Gentiles on behalf of mercies which glorified God, as it’s written:%vn~
%si~
On account of this, %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ among Gentiles%vp~
I will confess %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ to%i@ You out loud,%vp~
And I’ll sing as one authorized by You to do so%u@[%u@d%u@]%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@0And another %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e says:%nn~
%si~
Rejoice, Gentiles, with His folk-people%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@1And another:%nn~
%si~
All you Gentiles praise the Lord,%vp~
And have all the folk-people praise Him%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@2And another verse from Isaiah says:%nn~
%si~
There’ll be a root %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ from out of%i@ %I@D%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ Jesse,%vp~
And the offshoot %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ ruling Gentiles.%vp~
The Gentiles will %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ hope upon it.%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@3Would that the God of hope fill you with every kind of joy and peace imaginable%u@[%u@e%u@] in the Faith to the point of you overflowing in the hope—in the power—of the Holy Spirit.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4Concerning you, I’ve been convinced, my %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ comrades%u@[%u@f%u@]—even I personally %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n—that you—yes, you—are full of goodness, having reached a point where you’re filled with knowledge of all sorts %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e able to admonish one another too. %u@1%u@5But occasionally I didn’t hold back any punches when I wrote to you, as I would remind you through the God-given grace that was given to me %u@1%u@6for me to be a minister of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles, treating %i@m%i@y %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ the good news, the Gospel, of God as a holy, priestly duty, in order that the sacrificial offering %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ of the Gentiles would become %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ acceptable, being made holy by the Holy Spirit.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7I have something I’m excited to tell you about%u@[%u@g%u@], something that has to do with the things of%u@[%u@h%u@] God in Christ Jesus. %u@1%u@8You see, I dare not talk about something which Christ didn’t accomplish through me towards the goal of the Gentile’s obedience in word and deed, %u@1%u@9%i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ by the %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@l power of the miraculous%u@[%u@i%u@], %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ by the %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@ power of the Spirit of God, so much so that the fulfillment of the spreading of the good news of Christ %i@t%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@ me from Jerusalem and its surrounding area all the way to Illyricum, %u@2%u@0but %i@t%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ in such a way %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@I%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@r%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@m %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h the aspiration of evangelizing in places where nobody knows for certain what Christ is all about%u@[%u@j%u@], in order that I not build a building upon someone else’s foundation, %u@2%u@1but instead that %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@z%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ according to what%i@ was%i@ written %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t,%vn~
%si~
The announcement about Him will be%vp~
To those who haven’t seen Him,%vp~
And they who haven’t heard will understand%vp~
%si~
          %u@2%u@2For reasons which are obvious, there’ve been so many obstacles in getting to go and visit you, %u@2%u@3but as things stand now I no longer have any options left%u@[%u@k%u@] in these regions and have been having a desire for a good many years now to go visit you, %u@2%u@4as I might walk to Spain. Specifically, while walking through %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@m%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@, I hope to see you up close and have you send me on my way from there %i@r%i@e%i@f%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@p%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@y, if I %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ first of all %i@a%i@s%i@k%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ to take care of some of my provisions. %vn~
          %u@2%u@5But I’m going to Jerusalem now %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@y serving the saints, our fellow-believers. %u@2%u@6The fact of the matter is that Macedonia and Achaia have been enthusiastic about making a tangible contribution to the saints in Jerusalem who are poor. %u@2%u@7They have been enthusiastic, you see, and are indebted to them: for if %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@m made tangible contributions to the Gentiles by means of their Holy Spirit-generated gifts, ministries, and manifestations of the Holy Spirit%u@[%u@l%u@], %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@s too ought to serve them in the form of offerings made by means of their own physical abilities. %u@2%u@8So now that I’m finished with this %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g, signed, sealed, and delivered,%u@[%u@m%u@] I’ll depart and cross through your area on my way to Spain. %u@2%u@9I know for a fact that I’m headed your way, going in the fullness of the blessings of Christ.%vn~
          %u@3%u@0I beseech you, comrades, through our Lord Jesus Christ and through the love of the Spirit, %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ to come together and help me out in your prayers to God for me, %u@3%u@1so that I’d be protected from and delivered out of the disobedience and incredulity %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ among the Judeans, and that my ministry inside of Jerusalem would be accepted by the saints %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e, %u@3%u@2so that I could head your way with joy through the will of God to take some time off and relax when you and I are together. %u@3%u@3%I@M%i@a%i@y the God of peace %i@b%i@e%i@ with you all. So be it.%u@[%u@n%u@]%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@g%i@g%i@l%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s. Ref. 14:1.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@…%I@L%i@i%i@t%i@:%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@h. %I@M%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@ is a synecdoche.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@r%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s [%i@a%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t] %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@o…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@a%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@e. A figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@c%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@a%i@g%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@s…Lit: [%i@t%i@h%i@e]%i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s. Signs and wonders is a biblical expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t…Lit: %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@d. Note that %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@d%i@ refers to knowing one’s reputation.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t…Also: %i@o%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@u%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e. Usage for the word %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ is same as in Eph. 4:27.%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@-%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@s. Same Gk. word %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@ used in 1 Cor. 12:1; ref. note there.%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%I@S%i@o%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d…Lit: %I@S%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@u%i@i%i@t. The phrase %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@u%i@i%i@t appears to be a metaphor, an expression, or something along those lines.%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%I@S%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t…Lit: %I@A%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@.%i@ Ref. note of Rev. 19:4.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Romans Chapter 16%hb~
          %u@1I endorse our sister-comrade%u@[%u@a%u@] Phoebe, who’s in charge of an area of ministry%u@[%u@b%u@] at the church in Cenchreae, %u@2%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ so that you’ll make her a part of your inner circle in the Lord, as she’s earned respect among her fellow-believers the saints%u@[%u@c%u@]. Extend a helping-hand to her in whatever ways she needs; she’s been a great help to many people—including me—you see.%vn~
          %u@3Say hello to Priscilla and Aquila for me, my coworkers in Christ Jesus, %u@4the very people who stuck their necks out for me, putting their life on the line—It’s not just me who’s thankful for them but all the Gentile churches are too. %u@5Say hello to everyone who attends her house-church too.%vn~
      Say hello to my good friend Epenetus, who was the first one to receive Christ in the %I@R%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ province of Asia. %u@6Say hello to Mary, who worked her tail off for you. %u@7Say hello to my fellow-Israelis Andronicus and Junia, who did time in prison with me. They’re outstanding missionaries%u@[%u@d%u@], and they became %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ in Christ before I did. %u@8Say hello to Ampliatus, my dear %i@f%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@d in the Lord. %u@9Say hello to Urbanus, our co-worker in Christ, and my dear friend Stachys. %u@1%u@0Say hello to Apelles, who in Christ has withstood everything thrown at him. Say hello to Aristobulus’s household (i.e., his family and his household servants). %u@1%u@1Say hello to Herodion, my distant relative. Say hello to those in the Narcissus‘s household who are in the Lord (i.e., who are Christians). %u@1%u@2Say hello to Tryphena and Tryphosa, who work their tails off in the Lord. Say hello to my dear friend Persis, another woman who’s a hard worker in the Lord. %u@1%u@3Say hello to Rufus, a person chosen in the Lord (i.e., a person who’s special or unusual in his relationship with the Lord), and to his mother—and who’s my mother too. %u@1%u@4Say hello to Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermes, Patrobas, Hermas and the comrades who hang out with them. %u@1%u@5Say hello to Philologus, Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas and all the saints who hang out with them. %u@1%u@6Greet each other with a holy hug%u@[%u@e%u@]. All the churches of Christ send their greetings.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7Comrades, I beg you to keep an eye out for those who cause dissensions and cause problems by introducing specific items that oppose the instruction you’ve learned. Stay away from them; %u@1%u@8you see, those sort of people don’t serve our Lord Christ, but %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@e%i@ their own appetite%u@[%u@f%u@] instead. By smooth, believable talk and by their positivity%u@[%u@g%u@], they deceive the hearts of the naive. %u@1%u@9Your reputation for obedience has spread far and wide to where everyone has heard about it—I’m thrilled about you—but I want you to be wise to %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@d%i@o the good, and innocent to %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@o the evil. %u@2%u@0Soon now, the God of peace will crush Satan and subjugate him to you%u@[%u@h%u@]. The grace of our Lord Jesus be with you.%vn~
          %u@2%u@1My coworker Timothy sends his greetings to you, and so do my distant relatives Lucius, Jason, and Sosipater. %u@2%u@2I, Tertius, who did the actual writing of this letter %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %I@P%i@a%i@u%i@l, personally extend my greetings in the Lord. %u@2%u@3Gaius, who’s outgoing and welcoming and who’s congenial to me and to the entire church, sends his greetings. The city treasurer Erastus and our comrade Quartus send you their greetings too. %u@2%u@4%u@[%U@A%u@]%vn~
          %u@2%u@5Now to Him who is able to stand you up and keep you standing consistent with and in relation to%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f my Gospel, my good-news message of Jesus Christ, consistent with the revelation of the mystery which has been kept silent for ages and ages, %u@2%u@6but has now been made manifest %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@c%i@l%i@a%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@l%i@ and through the prophetic Scriptures by the command of the eternal God, with the goal of being made known to the Gentiles resulting in their obedience, the consequence of their faith, %u@2%u@7to the One Wise God be glory through Jesus Christ forever. And with that I conclude%u@[%u@i%u@].%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@-%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@o%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@y…Lit: %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@o%i@n. Ref. note of Acts 6:3.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@-%i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@g…Lit: %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@s%i@s. Liberties taken.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@e…Lit: %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@s. Both a synecdoche and a metaphor.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@t%i@y…Also: %i@f%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@.%i@ The Gk. word used here is the word usually rendered %i@b%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g, and the root literally means %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@-%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@s%i@u%i@b%i@j%i@u%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@e%i@t. A biblical expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@.%i@ Ref. note of Rev. 19:4.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]Verse 24 omitted from the best manuscripts%fn~

1 Corinthians%ha~
       The inhabitants of the Greek city of Corinth were better educated and more affluent than most of Paul’s other churches, and the contents of his letters to the Corinthians show a church which is a mixture of polar extremes, of extremes in spirituality and carnality; extremes in maturity and immaturity; extremes in fervency and apathy. The list goes on. But perhaps more than any other NT church, the church at Corinth was most like the church in the modern West, and for this reason when one reads the epistle, it’s as though Paul had us in mind specifically when he wrote it.%nv~
       Paul’s many talents are on display in this letter. He’s not just a lofty theologian, but he can handle difficult people, doing so with a mixture of encouragement, rebuke, and reasoning. He appeals to their best side, he chastises them when their bad side dominates. But he never forgets to remind them that they’re specially chosen people.%nv~
       The rich variety of content in this letter, and the great chapter on love, the chapters on the gifts of the Spirits, the chapter on death and resurrection are simply the highlights, reflects the breadth of the Corinthians’ spirituality. If we today are Corinth, then by proxy we are the recipients of a rich epistle, and this should give us hope.%nv~
%i@%sb~
1 Cor. Chapter 1%hb~
          %u@1%I@F%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ Paul, who has the calling of an apostle (a missionary) of Christ Jesus through the will of God, and his comrade%u@[%u@a%u@] Sosthenes—%vn~
          %u@2To God’s church which exists in Corinth, those set apart by Christ Jesus %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d, those called to be holy in unison with those everywhere who are calling upon the name of our Lord Jesus Christ (i.e., those invoking Jesus’s promises, his authority, and his favorable disposition)—%vn~
          %u@3Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.%vn~
          %u@4When it comes to you, I’m always thanking my God for%u@[%u@b%u@] the grace He’s given you in Christ Jesus, %u@5because in him you’ve been enriched in all things, in every concept %i@i%i@m%i@a%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@ and in all %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ knowledge and understanding, %u@6just as the testimony of Christ (i.e., the official statement about Christ) has been both made firm and has been confirmed in you, %u@7so that you’re not lacking in any Holy Spirit-generated gift, ministry, or manifestation of the Holy Spirit%u@[%u@d%u@], eagerly awaiting the revelation of Christ Jesus our Lord, %u@8who will also establish us until the end of time %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e blameless in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ. %u@9Faithful is the God through whom we’ve been called into the fellowship of His son Jesus Christ our Lord.%vn~
          %u@1%u@0I appeal to you, comrades, through the name (i.e., the authority) of our Lord Jesus Christ, %i@p%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u that you would always be on the same page%u@[%u@e%u@] and that there not be divisions among you, but that you’d be fitted and mended together with the same mind and with the same knowledge and understanding. %u@1%u@1In this regard and concerning you, it’s been made clear to me by Chloe’s family and her servants, my %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ comrades, that there’s strife going on between you. %u@1%u@2I’ll say this: some of you say “I’m Paul’s devotee %i@e%i@x%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@y” while others say “I’m Apollos’s devotee %i@e%i@x%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@y” or “I’m Peter’s%u@[%U@A%u@] devotee %i@e%i@x%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@y”, or “I’m Christ’s devotee %i@e%i@x%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@.” %u@1%u@3Has Christ been divided up %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@s? Paul wasn’t crucified on your behalf, was he? Or, were you baptized (i.e., initiated into the Christian faith) on Paul’s sole authority to be a member of Paul’s camp? %u@1%u@4Thank God%u@[%u@g%u@] I didn’t baptize any of you except Crispus and Gaius, %u@1%u@5lest anyone say that they were baptized on my sole authority to be a member of my camp. %u@1%u@6Now I did baptize Stephanas’s family and servants, but as far as the rest of you, I’m not absolutely sure%u@[%U@B%u@] if I baptized anyone else. %u@1%u@7You see, Christ didn’t send me to go about baptizing %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ but to go about evangelizing instead%u@[%U@C%u@], not in wisdom which comes out of a message, so that the cross of Christ wouldn’t be rendered ineffectual.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8The message of the cross, you see, is stupidity to those who are lost and dying on the one hand, but to those who are being saved (i.e., being rescued from spiritual, moral, and physical calamity), it’s the power of God. %u@1%u@9For it’s written %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t:%vn~
%si~
I’ll destroy the wisdom of the wise,%vp~
And I’ll annul the understanding of those who understand%vp~
%si~
%u@2%u@0Where’s the wise man? Where’s the scholar? Where’s this generation’s %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@i%i@e%i@r debater? Hasn’t God turned this world’s wisdom into stupidity?%nn~
          %u@2%u@1You see, by the wisdom of God, since the world through %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ wisdom didn’t come to recognize, discern, understand, or know God,%i@ God was more than happy through the stupidity of what was preached to save those who made the decision to believe. %u@2%u@2Forasmuch as Jews chase after stupendous miracles%u@[%u@h%u@] and Westerners%u@[%u@i%u@] chase after wisdom, %u@2%u@3we, on the other hand, preach a crucified-Christ; for Jews it’s the root-cause of the failure caused by disobedience%u@[%u@j%u@] on the one end of the stick, on the other end of the stick, for Westerners it’s stupidity, %u@2%u@4but to them who are “the Called” (i.e., those whom God has summoned to be His people and who have heeded the summons), Jews and Westerners alike, Christ %i@i%i@s%i@ God’s power and God’s wisdom, %u@2%u@5since the “stupidity” of God is wiser than %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@s%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ mankind, and the “weakness” of God is stronger than %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@g%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ mankind.%vn~
          %u@2%u@6To this point, consider your %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@p “the Called”: if one looks at their backgrounds only%u@[%u@k%u@], not very many of them are wise, not many powerful, not many from high-society families or nobility. %u@2%u@7No, God’s chosen the stupid things of the world to put to shame the wise %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s, and the weak things of the world to put to shame the strong, %u@2%u@8and God’s chosen the lowly born and those things which are contemptuous—%I@H%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@ the things that don’t exist to abolish what does, %u@2%u@9so that any and every human endeavor or accomplishment apart from God can’t be presented proudly before Him in the statement, “See—look what I did!”%u@[%u@l%u@] %u@3%u@0But %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t of Him is that you’re melded%u@[%u@m%u@] with Christ Jesus, who became to us wisdom from God, righteousness, and likewise holiness and redemption (i.e., the recovery of what you once had), %u@3%u@1so it’d turn out just like it’s written %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@,%i@ “Let the one who brags about his accomplishments brag in the Lord.”%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@f%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@a%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@a%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e…Or: %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@c%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@a%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d. The meaning is ambiguous and must therefore be decided by context (v. 17, for one). For the choice of %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t, ref. note of John 1:1.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@-%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l, where it refers to the Holy Spirit and not a human or spirit in the sense of attitude. Ref. 1 Cor. 12:1.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@g%i@e…Lit: %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@ %I@P%i@a%i@u%i@l%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@P%i@a%i@u%i@l%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@p…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@P%i@a%i@u%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@W%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@s…Lit: %I@G%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@k%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@o%i@t%i@-%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@b%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@c%i@k [%i@s%i@k%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@n, (σκάνδαλον/Strong’s 4625)]. Ref. note of Matt. 18:6.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@i%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@g%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y…Lit: %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o [%i@t%i@h%i@e] %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h. This conclusion is drawn after a study of all the usages in the NT of the words %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@ and %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@d%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@“%I@S%i@e%i@e%i@—%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@!%i@”…Lit: %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@i%i@n%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@P%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@’%i@s…Lit: %I@C%i@e%i@p%i@h%i@a%i@s%i@’%i@s. %I@C%i@e%i@p%i@h%i@a%i@s is the Aramaic word for %I@R%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@;%i@ the Gk. translation of %I@C%i@e%i@p%i@h%i@a%i@s is %I@P%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r. John makes a point of quoting Jesus when he gave Peter his new name (John 1:42). Paul’s preference of the Aramaic name %I@C%i@e%i@p%i@h%i@a%i@s over the Gk. name %I@P%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r shows his respect for Peter, a respect rooted in Jesus having named him, which is determining who he is and what he’s about.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@a%i@b%i@s%i@o%i@l%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w. The Gk. word for %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@ used here means knowing something to be a fact by observing that it’s so; therefore, Paul’s talking about knowing something for certain. He apparently can’t recall for certain who he baptized and who he didn’t. One can infer that he baptized a lot of people.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@z%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@z%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@a%i@d…Lit: %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@z%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@z%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@a%i@d. An example of the necessity of adding select interpolations; in this case the phrase %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ is not in the GT. One surmises from the context that Paul assumed that the reader would supply these words. Not adding this phrase makes Paul’s statement oxymoronic at face value. Evangelization, when successful, results in people receiving Christ, and those who receive Christ should be baptized. Therefore, successful evangelization results in baptism; you cannot have the one without the other. Since Paul was sent as an apostle to evangelize the Gospel, he must’ve been sent to baptize (either himself personally or someone working with him) them as well.%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Cor. Chapter 2%hb~
          %u@1When I went and visited you, comrades%u@[%u@a%u@], I didn’t go %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ heady, intellectual language and sublime speech while telling you about the mystery of God. %u@2You see, I decided that when among you I’d %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ I knew no %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@s%i@o%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ except %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t Jesus Christ and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ this fellow was crucified. %u@3I appeared to you%i@ as one lacking vigor and strength and as downright fearful, and was frequently trembling%u@[%U@A%u@], %u@4and my message and my preaching weren’t in words that were wise and persuasive but %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ by a powerful demonstration of %i@t%i@h%i@e Spirit %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%u@[%u@b%u@], %u@5so that your faith wouldn’t be %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ in human wisdom but would be in the power of God instead.%vn~
          %u@6Now we speak %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f wisdom among those who are mature, a wisdom, however, not of this age nor of the rulers of this age (i.e., the demon spirits which have controlling influence over this world), rulers who are being rendered ineffective and brought to nothing— %u@7instead we speak %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ God’s wisdom in a mystery, a wisdom which has been hidden %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t, a wisdom which God knew beforehand in eternity past and intended for our glory, %u@8a wisdom which none of the rulers of this age knew, understood, or recognized, for if they had, they wouldn’t have crucified the Lord of Glory. %u@9No, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@s%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@,%i@ it’s like it’s written %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@a%i@d:%vn~
%si~
That which eye hasn’t seen and ear hasn’t heard%vp~
And hasn’t arisen %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t upon any human heart—%vp~
That which God prepared for those who love Him%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@0God revealed it to us through the Spirit: for the Spirit thoroughly searches and investigates everything, even the deep things of God. %u@1%u@1For what person knows firsthand the intimate details and intentions%u@[%u@c%u@] of a given person except for that person’s spirit that’s in him? In the same way, no one has known, understood, or recognized the intimate details and intentions of God except the Spirit of God.%nn~
