          %u@1%u@2Now we have not received the spirit of the world but rather the Spirit who %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@c%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@s out of God, so that we would know firsthand what God has given to us as an expression of His grace— %u@1%u@3%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s also that which we speak, not speaking in human teachings %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f words of wisdom but rather in teachings of the Spirit %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e fitting together nicely of Holy Spirit-related content with %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r Holy Spirit-related content%u@[%U@B%u@]. %u@1%u@4A person who’s dominated by his mind, intellect, or emotions %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%u@[%U@C%u@] won’t receive the things of the Spirit of God; in fact, to him such things are stupid, and he cannot know, understand, or recognize them because such things are spiritually examined and decided as a result. %u@1%u@5But the spiritual person examines and decides all things, but he himself isn’t examined and %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ decided by anyone.%vn~
%si~
%u@1%u@6Who has known, understood, or recognized the Lord’s mind?%vp~
Who mentors Him?%vp~
%si~
We, however, have a mind which is of Christ.%nn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ [or %i@i%i@n]%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r. A hendiadys. Ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s. As “those things” is vague, it means a number of different things.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@g%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@g%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g. Judging based on the context, Paul was exhibiting weakness and fear when speaking to the Corinthians—not when preaching publicly. The reason he was in weakness and fear was out of reverence for the message of Christ crucified accompanied by a strong presence of the Holy Spirit, which presence was manifesting itself (“demonstration of the Spirit”) in the gifts and miracles (the “power of God”) listed in the twelfth chapter. Paul made himself smaller so as to not quench the Holy Spirit (1 Thess. 5:19), so as to give the Holy Spirit greater license to manifest his power. As we know from the NT, Paul was not naturally like this; on the contrary, he was the opposite. But the Corinthians put such a high premium on speakers with great oratory skills, those who speak persuasively and compellingly and who have great charisma and flamboyant personalities, that they viewed Paul with disdain.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@-%i@r%i@e%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@-%i@r%i@e%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@…%I@L%i@i%i@t%i@:%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@b%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g…Literal Gk: %i@p%i@n%i@e%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@o%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@n%i@e%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@k%i@o%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@n%i@e%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@k%i@a%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@n%i@k%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@ [πνεύματος, πνευματικοῖς πνευματικὰ συγκρίνοντες, (πνεύματος/Strong’s 4151), (πνευματικοῖς/Strong’s 4152), (πνευματικὰ/Strong’s 4152), (συγκρίνοντες/Strong’s 4793)]. Note that the word %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ refers to the Holy Spirit. The successive words %i@p%i@n%i@e%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@o%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@n%i@e%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@k%i@o%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@n%i@e%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@k%i@a comprise an alliteration, rhyme, assonance, or pun of a sort, and it’s possible that Paul personally coined it. The word %i@s%i@u%i@n%i@k%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@ means %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@b%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@;%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@;%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@a%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g. Now, there is ambiguity as to whether %i@p%i@n%i@e%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@o%i@s%i@ and%i@ %i@p%i@n%i@e%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@k%i@o%i@i%i@s%i@,%i@ which are different forms of the same word %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@s, means %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ or %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@.%i@ The ambiguity permits the following renderings to be defensible: %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@b%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@;%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@b%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@; %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@b%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@;%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@s%i@;%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@s%i@;%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@.%i@ Such cases of ambiguity are resolved by the context and by how the words or phrases in question are used elsewhere, particularly if by the same author.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%I@A%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@m%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@-%i@m%i@a%i@n. The word %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@ is derivative of the word %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@ [%i@p%i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ā, (ψυχή/Strong’s 5590)], where we get the word %i@p%i@s%i@y%i@c%i@h%i@e. It refers to the mind, intellect, and emotions. The psyche and the spirit are two distinct and different parts of a person (ref. 1 Thess. 5:23; Heb. 4:12). Translations usually render %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@ as %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@l, referring to a person who goes about life looking and acting as though the spiritual world doesn’t exist, as though there’s no existence after death, etc. Also, ref. note of 1 Thess. 2:8.%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Cor. Chapter 3%hb~
          %u@1But I, comrades%u@[%u@a%u@], wasn’t able to speak to you like I would to people attuned to and dominated by spiritual things but rather like I would to people attuned to and dominated by fleshly things (i.e., things that have to do with our lives in the natural, even touching our carnal appetites), same as I would to those who are babies in Christ. %u@2I fed you milk, not solid%i@ food,%i@ as you were not yet able %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@g%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@l%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@l%i@k—but even now you still can’t %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@l%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@;%i@ %u@3You’re still fleshly, you see: where there’s jealousy and strife still %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d among you, are you not fleshly, and do you not leads lives dictated by the %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e human tendencies%u@[%u@b%u@]?%vn~
          %u@4For example, when one %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u says, “I’m Paul’s devotee %i@e%i@x%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@y,” and another %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u says, “I’m Apollos’s devotee %i@e%i@x%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@y,” are you not being dominated by your %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e human tendencies%u@[%u@c%u@]? %u@5So who is Apollos? Who is Paul—they’re ministers, and you came to believe %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ through their ministries, and %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@e%i@p%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@v%i@o%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ to each person as the Lord granted %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n. %u@6I planted %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@d, Apollos watered %i@i%i@t, but it was God who made it grow, %u@7so that neither the one doing the planting nor the one doing the watering is %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@s, but God who makes things grow %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@t. %u@8The one who does the planting and the one who does the watering are on the same team%u@[%u@d%u@], and each will receive an individual-specific wage according to his own individual labor%u@[%u@e%u@].%vn~
          %u@9We’re God’s coworkers, you see, %i@l%i@a%i@b%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@n God’s field, %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@ you’re the building-project which God’s constructing, %u@1%u@0%i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d according to the grace of God which was given to me as a judicious chief architect and principal contractor. Accordingly, I laid the foundation, and another %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@o%i@r %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d built %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n, but let each %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@ look over what%u@[%u@f%u@] he built, %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@l%i@y. %u@1%u@1The fact of the matter is that no one can lay any other foundation other than the one which has been laid, which foundation is Jesus Christ. %u@1%u@2Now if some %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@o%i@r builds upon the foundation %i@b%i@y %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ gold, silver, gemstones (i.e., the subcontractor did a high-quality job), wood, hay, or straw (i.e., the subcontractor did a low-quality job) %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@s %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n, %u@1%u@3the %i@q%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e work that that particular%u@[%u@g%u@] %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@o%i@r did will become apparent to everyone, since some cataclysmic event will eventually occur that is enormously stressful%u@[%u@h%u@] %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e, making%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@g%i@t%i@h%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ abundantly clear to everyone, since %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@g%i@t%i@h%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ are revealed by fire (i.e., intense stress), and the fire will determine what kind of%i@ job was done by putting it through the wringer. %u@1%u@4If any of the built-up construction remains, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@o%i@r will get paid; %u@1%u@5if any of the built-up construction is burned up, he’ll lose money on %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@j%i@e%i@c%i@t, but he’ll be spared %i@o%i@f%i@ personal %i@r%i@u%i@i%i@n, but he’ll lose his entire investment through the ordeal%u@[%u@i%u@].%vn~
          %u@1%u@6Don’t you know that you are a temple of God and that the Spirit of God has taken up residence in you? %u@1%u@7If someone trashes, ruins, or destroys the temple of God, God will trash that guy. The temple of God—the very thing that you are—is holy, you see.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8Let no one fool himself utterly %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@r%i@d: if any of you considers himself to be wise in this age, let him become stupid, so that he would become wise; %u@1%u@9for the wisdom of this world is stupidity to%u@[%u@j%u@] God. In fact, it’s written %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t:%vn~
%si~
He’s catching the wise in their subtle trickery%vp~
%si~
%u@2%u@0And another %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@s,%nn~
%si~
The Lord understands the arguments of the wise—%vp~
%I@H%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@s that they’re futile%vp~
%si~
%u@2%u@1So then, let no one be charged up and beam with pride over%u@[%u@k%u@] people %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@v%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@. The fact of the matter is, all of you— %u@2%u@2whether %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o Paul, Apollos, or Peter%u@[%u@l%u@]—or whether %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ life, death, the past, or the future— %u@2%u@3are Christ’s %i@d%i@e%i@v%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@e%i@s%u@[%u@m%u@], and Christ is %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@v%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@e of God.%nn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@m…Lit: %i@o%i@n%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@l%i@a%i@b%i@o%i@r…Also: %i@t%i@o%i@i%i@l. This word is commonly used in the context of hard labor in a wheat field, etc. and is part of the metaphor for planting and watering.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t…Lit: %i@h%i@o%i@w%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r…Lit: %i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h. Paul apparently didn’t word this very well.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@t%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@y%i@s%i@m%i@i%i@c%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@c%i@c%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@f%i@u%i@l…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y. Assume interpolation “of testing,” to make this “the day of testing.” %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ is an idiom used throughout the NT, similar to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@i%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@l…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@e. %I@T%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@e is apparently an idiom; the precise meaning is not entirely certain.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@t%i@o…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@a%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@b%i@o%i@a%i@s%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%I@P%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r…Lit: %I@C%i@e%i@p%i@h%i@a%i@s. Ref. note of 1 Cor. 1:12.%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@v%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t. Same wording as 1 Cor. 1:12 “of Paul, of Apollos,” etc.%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Cor. Chapter 4%hb~
          %u@1Let a person frame his perception of us this way: that we’re attendants of Christ and stewards of the mystery of God. %u@2In regard to %i@s%i@t%i@e%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p%i@,%i@ it’s a minimum requirement that a person who’s a steward be found faithful. %u@3But it’s not a big deal for me to be examined and then judged by you or by any human tribunal %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r, nor do I judge myself in self-examination. %u@4In fact, I’m not self-conscious %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ anything %I@I%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g, but—no—I haven’t been exonerated of all wrong-doing in this %i@s%i@t%i@e%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@e, but the Lord is the one who examines and judges me, %u@5so that you won’t judge me before the timeframe %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t, %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ until the Lord happens to come, who %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g will also will illuminate the hidden things of darkness and will put the plans, strategies, intentions, and collaborations of the hearts out in the open, and at that time the praise from God to each person %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ will appear.%vn~
          %u@6But because of you, comrades%u@[%u@a%u@], I made the change and applied these things to Apollos and me, so that through our%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@a%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e you would learn the %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f “Don’t be so high-and-mighty that the stuff that’s written %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@B%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e somehow doesn’t apply to you%u@[%u@b%u@],” so that your egos don’t become overly-inflated, with one person %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ superior %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ to the one %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@ opposed to someone who has a different %i@o%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@o%i@n%u@[%U@A%u@]. %u@7Furthermore, who determines what all the different %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@e%i@w%i@ are among you and sorts you into categories%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@e%i@w%i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t?%vn~
      What do you have that you didn’t go out and get%u@[%u@c%u@]? And if you got %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t, why do you carry on%u@[%u@d%u@] like you never got %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m? %u@8You’ve already gotten plenty enough—%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e already rich—you live like kings%u@[%u@e%u@] %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ apart from us—it sure would be great if you %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ became kings, so that we could live like kings together with you. %u@9You see, I’m thinking that God made an exhibit out of us—the apostles, %i@t%i@h%i@e lowliest%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e—putting us on display, making us appear to everyone as though we’re men who’re condemned to death, since we became a spectacle to the world, to angels, and to %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ mankind. %u@1%u@0We are idiots on account of Christ, but you are logical and sensible in Christ; we are weak, you are strong; we are glorious, you are dishonored. %u@1%u@1Up until this very moment in time, we went hungry and thirsty, had no clothes to wear, were beaten, were homeless, %u@1%u@2and toiled doing hard manual labor. While being abused, we bless; while being persecuted, we endure; %u@1%u@3while being slandered, we speak softly%u@[%u@f%u@]. Up until now, we%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ like %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ the scum of the world; %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ everyone’s garbage.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4I’m not writing these things to shame you or to put you on a guilt trip, rather I’m writing to you as though you’re my children, ones who are dear to me, and I’m admonishing, warning, and instructing you as such. %u@1%u@5You see, even if you had a million tutors in Christ, you still wouldn’t have%i@ many fathers (i.e., those who were instrumental in your conversion) %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%u@[%u@g%u@], seeing that I begot you in Christ Jesus through the Gospel. %u@1%u@6So I’m pleading with you: get to where you imitate me%u@[%u@h%u@]. %u@1%u@7Because of this %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@,%i@ I sent you Timothy, who is my dear child %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ and who’s faithful in the Lord, who’ll remind you %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ the way I do things in Christ Jesus, just like I teach everyone in churches everywhere.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8As I’m not heading in your direction to visit you %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t, some %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u have acquired inflated egos. %u@1%u@9But if it was the Lord’s will, I’d leave immediately and travel as quickly as possible to visit you%u@[%u@i%u@], and I’ll recognize and discern not the message%u@[%u@j%u@] of those who’ve reached the point where their egos are inflated but rather %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r power; %u@2%u@0for the kingdom of God (i.e., God’s interaction with mankind) is not in a message but in power. %u@2%u@1Which would you rather have? That I’d take a staff with me %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ when I go visit you, or that %I@I%i@’%i@d%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ in%i@ a%i@ love-spirit and with soft-spoken gentleness?%vn~
%sf~

%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@f%i@t%i@l%i@y…Also: %i@e%i@x%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@;%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@;%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@l%i@p%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@u%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s %i@(%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@)%i@i%i@n%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@u%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s. Paul didn’t word this well; taking what he meant to say and not what he actually did say. Also, the ten thousand is a hyperbole.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@I%i@’%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@m%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e…Also: %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@g%i@o%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@i%i@n%i@f%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@t. Several translators (me included) are not sure what Paul was saying here. In cases like these, there may be an idiom present. Also, the appearance of the definite article in %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ is emphatic, as many times such an article is dropped after a preposition.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t. Paul sees himself as the lowliest in regard to how comfortable his life is and because of his guilt over persecuting the church in his past life. The NT names 24 apostles, and he certainly was not the least of all of them.%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Cor. Chapter 5%hb~
          %u@1News is going around that there’s actually fornication (i.e., sexual immorality) among you, the sort of fornication that you don’t even%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@d among the heathens, to the effect that someone’s having %i@s%i@e%i@x%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h his stepmother%u@[%u@a%u@]. %u@2You’ve become smug over this and what’s the more haven’t mourned (i.e., prayed deep, heart-felt prayers of grieving and sorrow) in order that the one who’s committed this atrocity be removed from your midst. %u@3To address this topic, although away physically-speaking but present spiritually-speaking%u@[%U@A%u@], I have already judged the one who’s doing this as if I was present %u@4by the authority vested in me by our Lord Jesus Christ%u@[%u@b%u@], my spirit%u@[%u@c%u@] having gathered together with you all in the power of the our Lord Jesus %u@5to hand a person such as him over to Satan (and to hand him over once and be done with it%u@[%u@d%u@]) for the destruction of the flesh, so that the spirit will avoid utter calamity when the Lord “settles all Family business” so-to-speak%u@[%U@B%u@].%vn~
          %u@6You talking a big talk%u@[%u@e%u@] doesn’t make you look good—Don’t you know that a tiny pinch of yeast %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ will spread to the entire batch, %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t? %u@7Scrub %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@w%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ the old yeast thoroughly, so that you’d be a fresh batch of dough the way that you %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y are: yeast-free %i@d%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h. Add to this the fact that Christ was slaughtered and offered as our Passover lamb sacrifice, %u@8so that we would not partake of the %I@P%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r meal%u@[%U@C%u@] with %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ yeast %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@t%i@c%i@h%u@[%u@f%u@] nor %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ the yeast of unfathomably-wicked evil%u@[%u@g%u@], but with the yeast-free %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ of sincerity and truth instead.%vn~
          %u@9In the %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ letter I wrote that you shouldn’t associate with fornicators, %u@1%u@0%i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@s%i@o%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ with%i@ any fornicator who’s a part of this %i@c%i@o%i@r%i@r%i@u%i@p%i@t%i@ society %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n, or with the greedy and rapacious%u@[%U@D%u@] or with idolaters; otherwise, if that were the case, you’d have to leave %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@r%i@r%i@u%i@p%i@t%i@ society %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@u%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@.%i@ %u@1%u@1I wrote to you just now%u@[%U@E%u@] not to associate %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e if %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t someone who goes by the name “comrade%u@[%u@h%u@]” were to be a fornicator, or someone who’s greedy, or an idolater, or someone who cusses or uses abusive language, or a drunkard, or someone who’s rapacious—don’t share a meal%u@[%u@i%u@] with them either. %u@1%u@2Furthermore, why should I care about%u@[%u@j%u@] judging those on the outside? Aren’t you the ones who judge those on the inside? %u@1%u@3God judges those on the outside. %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@,%i@ “Get rid of%u@[%u@k%u@] your evil person.”%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@p%i@m%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@f%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@f%i@e. Assume this is %i@s%i@t%i@e%i@p%i@m%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r and not %i@m%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r; Paul would’ve simply said %i@m%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ if that were the case.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@m%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@t…The verb tense of %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ implies %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@i%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k…Also: %i@b%i@o%i@a%i@s%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ yeast %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@…Lit: %i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@t. Since this is a repeat of the words %i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ used in v. 7, Paul is referring to the same thing from that verse. %fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@u%i@n%i@f%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@w%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l…Lit: %i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@e%i@d. A hendiadys. Ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@s%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@l…Lit: %i@e%i@a%i@t. This insinuates having fellowship over a meal.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f. Similar wording as the word %i@r%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ used in v. 2. This OT quotation is likely where Paul based the instruction of v. 2 upon.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@p%i@h%i@y%i@s%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t, or, %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t. The ambiguity of whether it’s %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ or %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ is rendered %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ because of the parallelism of %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@,%i@ and also the phrase %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@ in v.4. The argument on the flip side of the coin, to mean %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ with the explicit inclusion of the definite article the majority of the time refers to the Holy Spirit.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@v%i@o%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@“%i@s%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@”%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@-%i@t%i@o%i@-%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@D%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d. The %I@D%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ is the same as when Michael Corleone tells Carlo “Today I settled all Family business” in %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@f%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r—but of course, the Lord judges in righteousness, but the Don did not. The Day of the Lord is the swift, sudden, violent, decisive judgment upon those who obviously deserve it, who, from a human perspective, should’ve received it earlier. Paul refers to the Day of the Lord in 1 Thess. 5:2, the concept originating foremost from Joel (Joel 1:15; 2:1,11,31; 3:14) but occurs in other OT books as well (Amos 5:20; Zeph. 1:7; Zech. 14:1).%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@P%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@l…Lit: %i@c%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@b%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e. The Gk. word %i@c%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@b%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e is a verb form of the Gk. word rendered %i@f%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@a%i@l, which in addition to meaning %i@f%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@a%i@l%i@ refers to religious observances which aren’t accompanied by festivity, including simple meals like the Passover meal. But this verse demonstrates the metaphor Paul draws comparing Christians to the unleavened bread used in the Passover unleavened bread (matzah). Starting with Moses commanding the Israelites to purge every spec of yeast from the entire nation and eat matzah instead of real bread for the Passover, yeast and bread infected by it symbolize sin, impurity, and the tendency for attitudes—sinful ones in particular—to spread.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@g%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@p%i@a%i@c%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s…A hendiadys perhaps. The Gk. word for %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@y%i@ means %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e; the Gk. word for %i@r%i@a%i@p%i@a%i@c%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ means %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@i%i@n%i@g %i@o%i@r %i@s%i@e%i@i%i@z%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s. Also, Paul associates greed, fornication, and idolatry in this verse and in Eph. 5:3,5; there are more references in the NT as well. These sins are interrelated.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w. Paul says %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@ instead of %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@,%i@ using the past tense instead of the present to refer to what he’s about to write at the end of the sentence. This would make sense if one were to assume that Paul first wrote a draft of this epistle, perhaps on wax tablets, made corrections, then copied the edited version onto the scroll which was sent to Corinth.%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Cor. Chapter 6%hb~
          %u@1Does any one of you have the audacity to have a civil dispute which you’re having with another %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ arbitrated by those who are unrighteous, and not by the saints (i.e., your fellow-believers)? %u@2Or are you %i@s%i@i%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@y%i@ unaware of the fact that the saints will judge the world? If the world is to be judged by you, you’re capable %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g arbitration panels for %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ petty %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@s. %u@3Don’t you know that we’ll judge angels?—We’re that much more %i@c%i@a%i@p%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ then %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g day-to-day affairs.%vn~
          %u@4So when you do happen to form a panel %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@b%i@i%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ day-to-day affairs, you put those in the church who are despised and lowly-esteemed on the panel. %u@5Shame on you%u@[%u@a%u@]—Isn’t there even one of you who has wisdom when it comes to this sort of thing, someone who can straighten out a situation his comrade is in%u@[%u@b%u@]? %u@6Instead, a comrade takes another comrade to court, and the court consists of unbelievers%u@[%u@c%u@]. %u@7You’re already undergoing a complete moral breakdown indeed by taking each other to court: why don’t you just be wronged? Why don’t you just be cheated? %u@8Instead %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@d, you’re wronging and cheating others, and %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ this %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w comrades. %vn~
          %u@9Don’t you know that those who wrong others won’t inherit the kingdom of God (i.e., won’t have a relationship with God; have Him involved with their lives)? Don’t be fooled: neither fornicators nor idolaters nor adulterers nor catamites%u@[%U@A%u@] nor homosexuals %u@1%u@0nor thieves nor the greedy—%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ no drunkards, none of those who cuss and use abusive language, none of those who are rapacious—%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e won’t inherit the kingdom of God. %u@1%u@1And that’s what some of you were—but no more: you were washed, you were sanctified (i.e., separated, set apart, and declared holy), you were justified (i.e. examined by a judge and cleared of any charges) by the authority%u@[%u@d%u@] of our Lord Jesus Christ and in the Spirit of our God.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2To me, everything is permissible but not everything is beneficial.%u@[%U@B%u@] To me, everything’s permissible, but I’ll not be put under the control of anything. %u@1%u@3Food is %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ for the stomach, and the stomach is %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ for food, but God will do away with %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ and %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ both. The body’s not %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ for fornication but for the Lord, and the Lord %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ for the body. %u@1%u@4God both raised the Lord %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ and will raise us %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ through His power.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5Don’t you know that our bodies are a piece of Christ%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y? Shall I take these things—%i@s%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ a piece of Christ%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ and make it a piece %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t of a prostitute?—Don’t even think about it%u@[%u@e%u@]. %u@1%u@6Don’t you know that he who unites with a prostitute or a woman who’s a fornicator becomes%u@[%u@f%u@] a single body %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@x? “For,” He says, “the two %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ into one flesh.” %u@1%u@7The one who unites with the Lord becomes a single spirit with him%u@[%u@g%u@]. %u@1%u@8Run as fast as you can away from fornication (i.e., sexual acts which are immoral): all sins that a person happens to commit are %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ outside the body, but the fornicator commits a sin %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ to (or even into) his own body%u@[%U@C%u@]. %u@1%u@9Don’t you know that our collective-body is a temple which is a dwelling-place for the Holy Spirit to dwell in, thereby living%i@ among us%u@[%U@D%u@], the %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ which you have from God, and that you don’t own yourselves%u@[%u@h%u@]? %u@2%u@0You’ve been bought at a high price; therefore, glorify%u@[%u@i%u@] God with your collective-body.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%I@S%i@h%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@-%i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@-%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@-%i@m%i@i%i@d%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@s%i@ [also%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n]%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s. Some liberties taken.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@-%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@-%i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g. Ref. note of Rom. 3:4.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@i%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m…A mirror of the wording in v. 16, %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@y…Paul choice of verb tense to make this a harsh command%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@s…Also%i@:%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e…Lit: %i@s%i@o%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@.%i@ The commentators aren’t exactly sure what this refers to; some say it refers to a man who lives a soft life—which is reasonable. But considering that the context is egregious sexual sin, and that the other sins listed in this verse are severe, this word here might refer to men who dress like and behave as though they’re women.%u@ %u@%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@T%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l…Though Paul said that everything is permissible, it’s impossible to accept this statement at face-value, as he lists a few things in this chapter which are not permissible for anyone to do, stealing and being covetous for example. How is this logical dilemma to be solved? Paul is stating his perspective—his philosophy—on whether he will engage in an activity or not. Rather than looking at some deed as permissible or forbidden, he changes the perspective to look at whether said deed is beneficial or non-beneficial. The understanding is that whether it’s permissible or not will logically align with whether it’s beneficial or not. The examples of greed and covetousness Paul categorizes as non-beneficial, so it’s irrelevant whether they’re permissible or not, since Paul’s not going to do them anyways because they’re non-beneficial. By this reasoning, whether something is permissible or not is moot. Adopting this perspective goes a long way to resolving the issue of legalism which inevitably arises in the pursuit of religion.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@(%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@)%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y…The reason why fornication differs from all other sins, being a sin done to your body, is given in the previous verses: a fornicator unites his body with the person he commits the act with, and the two become a single body. When a couple is united sexually, their bodies merge into one body. Merging your body with someone who’s trash causes your body to be corrupted by the trash from the other body.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@s…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ [%i@t%i@h%i@e]%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t. According to Gk. grammar, the placement of %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ between the two phrases %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ and %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ indicates the tight coupling of the phrase %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ to the other two phrases. So Paul’s saying that our bodies form a temple and within this temple the Holy Spirit dwells. The analogy is the temple of Jerusalem in which God’s presence dwelled in the Holy of Holies.%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Cor. Chapter 7%hb~
          %u@1To elaborate on what I wrote to you %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r, it’s good for a man not to go about touching a woman for the purpose of instigating%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@x%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@.%i@ %u@2But because %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e %i@v%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@v%i@o%i@l%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@ of%i@ the fornications (i.e., sexual acts which are immoral) %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@,%i@ let each man%i@ have his own woman to be his wife, and likewise let each woman have her own man to be her husband. %u@3Let the husband fulfill his obligation %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@x%i@ with his wife; likewise, let the wife do the same with her husband. %u@4The wife doesn’t get to dictate what goes on with her own body%u@[%u@a%u@], but the husband does; likewise, the husband doesn’t get to dictate what goes on with his own body, but the wife does. %u@5Don’t deprive each other %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@x, unless it’s for an agreed-upon time in order to devote yourselves to prayer, and get back at it%u@[%u@b%u@] (i.e., back to having sex) so that Satan not tempt you because of your lack of self-control. %u@6In saying this, I’m offering you a concession and not giving you a command. %u@7I want all men to be like me, but each has his own gift from God instead, one person this way, the other person that way.%vn~
          %u@8I’m telling those who aren’t married or who are widows that it would be good if they would stay the way I am. %u@9But if they can’t control themselves, have them get married; it’s better to marry than to burn %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@x%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@,%i@ you see%i@.%i@ %u@1%u@0To those who are already married, I’m having the wives take a command (not me %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@d but the Lord) for them not to leave %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r husbands. %u@1%u@1Now if she happens to leave%u@[%U@B%u@] him %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@s, have her remain single or be reconciled with her husband. And %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ the husbands %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ to not divorce%u@[%U@B%u@] their wives. %u@1%u@2I’m telling the rest of you (%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ not the Lord) %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@:%i@ if some man has a wife who’s an unbeliever, and she consents to live with him, don’t have him divorce her; %u@1%u@3if %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ wife has a husband who’s an unbeliever, and this fellow consents to live with her, don’t have her divorce him. %u@1%u@4You see, the unbelieving-husband is set apart to God as holy and specially protected by Him%u@[%u@c%u@] by the %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ wife, and the unbelieving-wife is set apart as holy and specially protected by the comrade%u@[%u@d%u@] %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@s%i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d; if that were not the case, their children would be unholy, spiritually contaminated, and not set apart to God%u@[%u@c%u@], but now %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@,%i@ they’re holy and specially protected. %u@1%u@5Now if an unbelieving %i@h%i@u%i@s%i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@f%i@e leaves %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e, let him or her part ways: the comrade, whether man or woman, isn’t under any obligation%u@[%u@e%u@] in such case. God has called us %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e in peace (%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@f%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@f%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s) %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%u@[%U@C%u@]; %u@1%u@6in this regard, how do you know, wives, if you’ll %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ rescuing your %i@u%i@n%i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ husbands from spiritual and moral calamity%u@[%u@f%u@]? Or how do you know, husbands, if you’ll %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n rescuing your %i@u%i@n%i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ wives from spiritual and moral calamity?%vn~
          %u@1%u@7Moving on %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@p%i@i%i@c%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ to every person…Have each person lead his life in the way that the Lord deems appropriate for the particular situation he was in when he became a believer%u@[%U@D%u@]. I’m giving the same command to all the churches %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@e%i@d. %u@1%u@8Had you already been circumcised when called (i.e., had you made a vow to obey the Law of Moses prior to becoming a believer )?—Don’t obliterate the effects of circumcision%u@[%U@E%u@] (i.e., don’t obliterate the effects of this vow). Was anyone called when they were uncircumcised (i.e., did anyone become a believer but at no time ever made a vow to obey the Law of Moses)?—Don’t get circumcised (i.e., don’t make such a vow). %u@1%u@9The circumcision %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@r%i@c%i@u%i@m%i@c%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@y is irrelevant and not an issue whatsoever, and the uncircumcision %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@r%i@c%i@u%i@m%i@c%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@y%i@ is irrelevant and not an issue whatsoever, but the keeping of God’s commandments %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@e%i@ instead. %u@2%u@0Whatever situation or set of circumstances a person was in when he was called (i.e., when he became a believer), he should stay in that situation or set of circumstances. %u@2%u@1Were you called %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ a slave?—Don’t worry about it; instead, if you get the chance to gain your freedom, by all means take advantage of the opportunity. %u@2%u@2Furthermore, the person who was called by the Lord (i.e., became a believer) while a slave is the Lord’s freeman; in the same way, he who was called while free is Christ’s slave. %u@2%u@3You’ve been bought at a high price: don’t become other peoples’ slaves. %u@2%u@4%I@W%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ situation and circumstances each person was in when he was called, comrades, have him remain in %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@s with God.%vn~
          %u@2%u@5About the young ladies who have never been married%u@[%u@g%u@]: I don’t have a command from the Lord, but I’ll give an opinion as one who’s been shown mercy by the Lord %i@e%i@n%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ to be reliable. %u@2%u@6These are my thoughts about living through the difficulties of the present time, %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ that it’s good for a person %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e the following way: %u@2%u@7Are you bound %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ to a wife?—Don’t try to separate from her. Separated from a wife?—Don’t go looking for %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ woman. %u@2%u@8But if you do happen to get married, you haven’t sinned. And if the %i@t%i@y%i@p%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l young lady%u@[%u@g%u@] %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@ happens to get married, she hasn’t sinned. %I@F%i@o%i@l%i@k%i@s such as these will face hard times in their natural lives%u@[%u@h%u@]; I’m trying to spare you %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@f.%vn~
          %u@2%u@9%I@L%i@e%i@t me tell you what, comrades, a compressed window of time is %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t remains %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s, so that those who have wives should live as though they don’t %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s, %u@3%u@0and those who weep as though they don’t weep, and those who rejoice as though they don’t rejoice, and those who deal in business as though they’ve halted trading, %u@3%u@1and those using the world as though they don’t use it; when you get right down to it, the world we live in in its present form is passing away. %u@3%u@2I don’t want you to be consumed by or worry about the trivial day-to-day affairs of life. He who’s not married is consumed by and worries about the things of the Lord, how he might be pleasing to him, %u@3%u@3but he who’s married is consumed by and worries about things of the world we live in and the people we live around, how he might %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ be pleasing to the wife %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s, %u@3%u@4and he reaches the point where he’s constantly consumed by these and worries about them continually. Both the woman who’s single and the young lady who’s never been married are consumed by and worry about the things of the Lord, so they would be holy both in body and in spirit. But she who’s married is consumed by and worries about the things of the world, how she’s going to please her husband. %u@3%u@5I’m telling you this for your own benefit—not so I can put you on a leash, but so it would result in a seemly, undistracted devotion to the Lord.%vn~
          %u@3%u@6Now if someone’s behaving inappropriately towards the young lady he’s in a relationship with, and he thinks she might be “overly-ripe%u@[%U@F%u@]” in such a way that he’s obliged to %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g happen (i.e., she’s pregnant, he thinks it might be too hard to hide anymore, and he’ll have to do something about it), let him do what he wants to do—he’s not committing a sin %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@o—let them get married. %u@3%u@7But he who has taken a firm stand in his heart, not having %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ necessity but has the upper-hand over%u@[%u@i%u@] his individual %i@s%i@e%i@x%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ desire, and has decided in his own heart to stay a virgin%u@[%u@j%u@] %i@r%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@l%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@r%i@l%i@f%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@é%i@e, does well, %u@3%u@8with the result that both he %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l marriage handles his virginity well, but he who remains single will do better, %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e.%vn~
          %u@3%u@9The wife is %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ bound %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@s%i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ as long as her husband lives, but if her husband were to pass away, she’s free to marry whom she wants, only %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@y%i@ in the Lord (i.e., marry in such a way that’s pleasing to the Lord; marry another believer). %u@4%u@0But in my opinion she’d be happier if she were to stay the way she is (i.e., stay unmarried after becoming a widow), and I think I have %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ the Spirit of God too.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y…Lit: %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m…%i@u%i@n%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d…Lit: %i@s%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@e%i@d…%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n. The words sanctified and unclean used together in this verse originate in the OT usage of holy and unclean, which carries into the NT.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@s%i@l%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@s%i@u%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@s%i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@s%i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@…%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@d%i@y…Lit: %i@v%i@i%i@r%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@…%i@v%i@i%i@r%i@g%i@i%i@n. Ref. note of Matt. 25:1.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r…Also: %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@v%i@i%i@r%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@-%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@r%i@g%i@i%i@n. Paul uses the word %i@v%i@i%i@r%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@ a few times in this passage, but his use of the reflexive pronoun %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ inserted between the definite article and the word %i@v%i@i%i@r%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@ selects %i@v%i@i%i@r%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@,%i@ a secondary meaning of the Gk. word for %i@v%i@i%i@r%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@.%i@ Note Paul’s careful insertion of the reflexive pronoun both here and in v. 38.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@r%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g…First, the Gk. verb for%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ [%i@h%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@ō, (ἅπτω/Strong’s 681)] appears in the present tense, insinuating continuous action rather than a one-time act—hence the added phrase %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g. Second, this verb is unusual in that it has one meaning when used in the active voice (%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@)%i@ and another meaning when used in the middle voice (%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@u%i@c%i@h). Since the active voice is the primary tense, the meaning in the middle voice influenced by a hint of the meaning from the active voice. Most of the NT occurrences of this verb are in the middle voice, and they not only mean %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ but also acquire some of the active voice’s definition to more specifically mean %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@r%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@.%i@ This verb is used when Jesus touches someone to heal them; he touched the person but did so for a purpose. What is “lit on fire” so-to-speak is determined by the context, and the context of v. 1 here insinuates touching sexually. To further reinforce the point that %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@ō%i@ means more than a simple touch, take a close look at Col. 2:21. Note how %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@ō%i@ appears in that passage with %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@g%i@g%i@a%i@n%i@ō%i@ (θιγγάνω/Strong’s 2345)%i@.%i@ They both mean %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ but thigganō%i@ means touching without instigating anything; to touch lightly; to brush up against something. Had they meant the same thing, Paul wouldn’t have used two different verbs.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e…%i@d%i@i%i@v%i@o%i@r%i@c%i@e…Different Gk. words are used for %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ and %i@d%i@i%i@v%i@o%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@ here; we infer from this verse here and from other NT references (such as Matt. 5:31) that, in ancient times, only the husband had the right to instigate a legal divorce. A wife, however, would at times simply leave her husband without fulfilling the legalities of a divorce. This might explain the two different words used here.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@(%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@f%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@f%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@) %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e…Lit: %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n [or: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h; %i@b%i@y] %i@p%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@e. Apparently, “God has called us to live in peace” means that it’s not God’s will for a Christian to be married to a person who’s violent, who’s abusive, who’s reckless, who’s irresponsible to the point of it causing harm to the family, etc. Notice that it says “God has called us to live in peace,” and not “God has called us to be happy” (Christians shouldn’t necessarily be “happy” but they should have joy). In other words, this isn’t a license for a person to divorce simply because he’s unhappy. But it is a license for a Christian who was married before he became a Christian to divorce an unbelieving spouse if that spouse is causing trouble.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@r%i@i%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@d [%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e] %i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d…Or: %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@d [%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e] %i@a%i@s%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h. Some guesswork as to what exactly Paul was saying. He seems to be making a comparison to dividing an inheritance, the inheritance being a biblical theme that refers to the specific plans God has for an individual or a particular group, plans which are bespoke for that person or group.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%I@D%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@r%i@c%i@u%i@m%i@c%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n…What Paul meant by this can be seen in his own life. Paul used the fact that he was circumcised to his advantage from time to time, as he writes later in 9:22, “I am made all things to all men, that I might by all means save some.” Examples are found in Acts 18:18, 21:23–29.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@e…Or: %i@b%i@e%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k. The passage of vv. 36–38 has puzzled translators, and every rendering is not without criticism. To a large extent it hinges on what %i@b%i@e%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ means in this context. Some believe it means that the virgin woman is %i@b%i@e%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ in age, but the meaning of %i@b%i@e%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ which best fits the context is a woman who’s pregnant and beginning to show or perhaps or is a woman who’s late in her monthly cycle.%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Cor. Chapter 8%hb~
          %u@1Now about %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g meat sacrificed to idols, every one of us has %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ understanding %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@l%i@e%i@d. The understanding %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@e%i@ makes him rather full of himself, but the love %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@e%i@ edifies. %u@2If any given person thinks he’s reached the point where he’s acquired some %i@l%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f understanding, he has not yet understood %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ as it must be understood. %u@3If someone loves God, this individual has been known and understood by Him.%vn~
          %u@4So now, about the consumption of food offered to idols: we know for a fact that %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ idols in the world don’t amount to a hill of beans%u@[%u@a%u@], and no person or thing is God except for One %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%u@[%u@b%u@]. %u@5Now, granted, there are those who claim there are gods, whether %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ in the sky, in the atmosphere, among the stars, in a spiritual world beyond that, or on the earth, so that there’re many gods and many lords, %u@6but from our point of view there’s one God the Father, out of Whom %i@a%i@r%i@e all things, and we %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d to Him and to the Lord Jesus Christ, through whom %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ all things, and we %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ through him.%vn~
          %u@7That aside, we are not %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@ in every %i@a%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ understanding. Up until now some people have been in the habit of eating food sacrificed to idols, and since their consciences are weak%u@[%U@A%u@] (i.e., their consciences prod them with pangs of guilt over matters they have a deficient understanding of, in this case in regard to food sacrificed to idols), they violate%u@[%u@c%u@] their consciences. %u@8%I@E%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ food doesn’t get us anywhere%u@[%u@d%u@] with God: we’re neither worse off if we were to not eat %i@i%i@t%i@ nor are we better off if we were to eat %i@i%i@t.%vn~
          %u@9See to it that the right you have %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ doesn’t somehow in and of itself become a stumbling block%u@[%u@e%u@] (i.e., an influence for causing sin) for those who have a weak%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e. %u@1%u@0You see, if someone %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ were to watch you, a person who has %i@t%i@h%i@e %i@c%i@o%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ understanding %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@e%i@,%i@ sitting at the dinner table%u@[%u@f%u@] with food sacrificed to idols %i@l%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u, wouldn’t his conscience, because it’s in a state of weakness, being built up in regard to the eating of foods sacrificed to idols (i.e., because of an incorrect understanding in regard to this issue of food sacrificed to idols, his conscience has been conditioned to respond with guilt when it ought not)? %u@1%u@1You see, he who’s weak—the comrade%u@[%u@g%u@] whom Christ died for—is being destroyed by your %i@c%i@o%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ understanding. %u@1%u@2In the way that you sin against the comrades and beat on their weak consciences, you sin against Christ. %u@1%u@3That’s why if food causes my comrade to stumble, there’s no way whatsoever that I’ll ever eat sacrificial meat again, so that I won’t be a stumbling block to my brother.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@s…Lit: %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y…Lit: %i@o%i@n%i@e. Alludes to the statement “God is One”; ref. James 2:19.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@v%i@i%i@o%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e…Lit: %i@d%i@e%i@f%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@c%i@k…Ref. note of Matt. 18:6.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g. Ref. note of Matt. 9:10.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@k. In his epistles, Paul talks about four types of consciences: a good conscience, an evil conscience, a weak conscience, and a seared conscience. A person’s conscience is something that affirms when he’s doing right but condemns when he does wrong. From this context, we can deduce that a weak conscience is one which has been programmed with an incorrect understanding of the truth and therefore misfires, sending the wrong signals for the wrong reasons, causing a person to experience guilt over something he shouldn’t and not experience it over something he should. %i@%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Cor. Chapter 9%hb~
          %u@1Am I not a freeman? Am I not an apostle (i.e., have I not been sent by God to pioneer the spread of Christianity)? Have I not seen our Lord Jesus with my own eyes? Are you not my accomplishment in the Lord? %u@2If I’m not an apostle %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ to %i@r%i@o%i@o%i@t%i@ others %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@y, at least I’m %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ to %i@r%i@o%i@o%i@t%i@ you; in fact, you’re my certificate of authenticity of my having been sent by the Lord. %u@3My rebuttal to those examining me for the purpose of judging and condemning me is the same.%vn~
          %u@4Do we not have the right to %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ eat and drink %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@e%i@e? %u@5Do we not have the right to have a fellow-comrade-wife accompany us as she follows our lead%u@[%u@a%u@] %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l, as all the other apostles of the Lord and Peter%u@[%u@b%u@] %i@d%i@o?— %u@6Or is it just Barnabas and I who don’t have the right to not %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o work %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s? %u@7When did any soldier ever serve %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@m%i@y%i@ and%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o pay for his own rations? Who plants a vineyard and doesn’t feed off what it produces? Or who cares for a ewe and doesn’t feed off the sheep’s milk?%vn~
          %u@8I’m not talking from a human perspective%u@[%u@c%u@], or talking %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@s%i@ that the Law does not also talk about. %u@9The fact of the matter is, in the Law of Moses it’s written, “Don’t put a muzzle on an oxen while it’s threshing %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@t.” You don’t think God cares about %i@t%i@h%i@e %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ the oxen %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g, do you? %u@1%u@0Or is %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@’%i@s%i@ addressing %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@p%i@i%i@c%i@ for our benefit?
