Furthermore, it’s written %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w for our benefit that the sower ought to sow and the thresher to thresh with the hope of getting a percentage of the harvest. %u@1%u@1If we sowed into you the Holy Spirit-related things%u@[%u@d%u@] %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@b%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s, is it a big deal if we reap the physical things %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ from you? %u@1%u@2If others have the right of taking a percentage from you, don’t we all the more so?%vn~
      No, we’re not asserting this right; instead we put up with all %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ things so that nothing would hinder the Gospel, the good-news message of Christ. %u@1%u@3Don’t you know that they who work the sacred %i@d%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ feed on %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t the temple; %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ they who attend to the altar divide %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@i%i@l%i@s%i@ of the altar among themselves? %u@1%u@4In the same way the Lord planned for and commanded those who proclaim the Gospel to make their living from the Gospel. %u@1%u@5I have not used any of these %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@s. I didn’t write about these things to make them happen to me; in fact, I’d rather die than have someone invalidate the proud assertions which I openly pride myself in. %u@1%u@6Should I proclaim the Gospel, it’s not my place to make proud assertions, you see: by necessity they’re imposed on me. I’ll be in deep trouble%u@[%u@e%u@], you see, should I not proclaim the Gospel. %u@1%u@7If I put this into practice voluntarily, you see, I’ll earn my pay%u@[%u@f%u@]. If %I@I%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s voluntarily, I’ve reached the point where I can be entrusted with a managerial position. %u@1%u@8So what’s my pay rate? %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@n%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@so that I can present the Gospel free of charge with a view towards me not exercising my right %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t %i@a%i@s %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@c%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@m%i@s%i@ the Gospel.%vn~
          %u@1%u@9Being a freeman, freed from all things, in all things I made myself a slave, so that I’d win over the many. %u@2%u@0I became a Jew to the Jews so that I would win over Jews: to those who live under the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s, I %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@e under the Law (%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h as far as my own personal life is concerned, I’m not under the Law), so that I would win over those under the Law. %u@2%u@1I became lawless (i.e., not living under the Law of Moses or under any God-based set of rules for that matter) to the lawless (%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ not living lawlessly apart from God, but being law-bound as a part of Christ) in order to win over the lawless. %u@2%u@2I became powerless to control my own circumstances%u@[%u@g%u@] to those who are powerless over their circumstances so that I would win over the powerless. I became all things to all people so I’d save (i.e., rescue from calamity, spiritual, moral, and otherwise) some. %u@2%u@3But everything%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@,%i@ I do for the sake of %i@t%i@h%i@e %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@c%i@l%i@a%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ the Gospel so I’d become a workman who specializes in it.%vn~
          %u@2%u@4Don’t you know that those who compete in track & field run races but only one of them gets the first-place trophy%u@[%U@A%u@]? Play to win—that’s the way you compete.%u@[%u@h%u@] %u@2%u@5Everyone who competes in athletics trains, and those folks do so in order to get a trophy which can %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@o%i@u%i@b%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l lose its prestige over time%u@[%u@i%u@], but we %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@y%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ will always remain prestigious; %u@2%u@6hence, as far as I’m concerned, I don’t %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r the race without setting any specific personal goals to meet%u@[%u@k%u@]. I %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ box in such a way that %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ I’ll land punches and not wind up with fistfuls of air%u@[%u@l%u@]. %u@2%u@7Uh-uh—I apply strict, punishing disciple to my body (i.e., to my carnal nature in particular), treating it roughly and wearing it down; I subdue it and make it my slave, lest I, having proclaimed %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@,%i@ should somehow or someway fail to live up to the standard it sets.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@-%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@-%i@w%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d…Lit: %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@-%i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%I@P%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r…Lit: %I@C%i@e%i@p%i@h%i@a%i@s. Ref. note of 1:12.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n. Same phrase used elsewhere%i@:%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s (Rom. 3:5); %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@s (1 Cor. 3:3).%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@-%i@r%i@e%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@.%i@ Ref. 1 Cor. 12:1.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@b%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@w%i@o%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@y…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@g%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@r%i@c%i@u%i@m%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@k%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%I@P%i@l%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@e%i@t%i@e…Lit: %I@R%i@u%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@o%i@u%i@b%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@r%i@r%i@u%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@y…Lit: %i@r%i@u%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@e%i@t…Lit: %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@i%i@m%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@l%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@x%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@i%i@r…Or: %I@I [%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o] %i@b%i@o%i@x%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@s [%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@l%i@y] %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@d%i@o%i@w%i@-%i@b%i@o%i@x%i@i%i@n%i@g …Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@x%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@i%i@r%i@%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@-%i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@y…In ancient Greek culture, there was no second or third place, etc. You either win or lose. There’s no distinction if you were to barely come in second place or if you were to come in last place.%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Cor. Chapter 10%hb~
          %u@1I don’t want you to fail to understand this, comrades%u@[%u@a%u@], %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ that our forefathers—all of them—were %i@a%i@l%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ under the cloud %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@E%i@g%i@y%i@p%i@t%i@,%i@ and all of them passed through the %I@R%i@e%i@d%i@ Sea, %u@2and every one of them was initiated into and joined up with Moses in totality%u@[%U@A%u@] by virtue of the cloud and the sea%u@[%u@b%u@], %u@3and every one of them was fed from the same spiritual food, %u@4and every one of them drank from the same spiritual source: they drank out of the Spiritual Trailing Rock (and the rock was Christ).%vn~
          %u@5But God was not pleased with many of them; %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ were strewn about the wilderness as we see. %u@6Now the lives these people led is an example, a pattern, a parallel of our own lives, so that we not have strong yearnings bordering on sensual passions for evil, just as some of them had. %u@7Neither become idolaters, just as some of them did, as it’s written %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t,%vn~
%si~
The folk-people sat down to eat and drink%vp~
And %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ got up to play%u@[%U@B%u@]%vp~
%si~
          %u@8Nor commit fornication (i.e., behave in a sexually immoral way), just as some of them committed fornication, and %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@ twenty-three thousand dropped dead in one day. %u@9Nor test Christ (i.e., use a circumstance as a test to see if Christ will pass from your point of view), just as some of them tested him and %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@ were destroyed by serpents. %u@1%u@0Nor grumble, murmur, or complain just as some of them grumbled and %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@ were destroyed by the Destroyer.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1Now those things %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ turned out to be an example, a pattern, a parallel of our own lives, and it was recorded %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@B%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e to make us aware %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@u%i@s, whom the ends of the ages%u@[%U@C%u@] have arrived at and are staring us in the face, %u@1%u@2so that the one who thinks he stands (i.e., the one who thinks he’s immune to sin) should see to it that he doesn’t fall (i.e., fall to sin). %u@1%u@3No temptation has been taken hold of %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ if it were not for the fact that humans are susceptible to it. But God is faithful, Who won’t permit us to be tempted beyond what we’re capable of. No, He’ll make an exit %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@g%i@y%i@ consisting of the ability to bear %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n while under the weight of it.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4Therefore, my dear %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s, get as far away from the idolatry %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@r%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ as fast as you can%i@. %u@1%u@5I’m talking %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ as %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g to sensible people. You decide %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ what I’m saying. %u@1%u@6The cup of blessing (i.e., the cup of communion wine) which we pronounce a blessing %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h, is it not an intimate association with the blood of Christ? The loaf of bread which we break %i@d%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@u%i@n%i@i%i@o%i@n, is it not an intimate association with the body of Christ%u@[%U@D%u@]? %u@1%u@7Because %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ loaf is a single entity, %i@w%i@e%i@ the many are one body; we all partake %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ out of the one %i@l%i@o%i@a%i@f,%i@ you see. %vn~
          %u@1%u@8Take a look at Israel, physically speaking: don’t they who feed themselves with the meat of the sacrificial animals have an intimate association with the altar and share in the work which goes on there? %u@1%u@9So what exactly am I trying to tell you%u@[%u@c%u@]? That idolatry is something %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y%u@[%u@d%u@]? Or that food sacrificed to an idol is something %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y? %u@2%u@0Uh-uh—What they sacrifice they sacrifice to demons and not to God; I don’t want an intimate association between you and demons to form. %u@2%u@1You can’t be drinking from the Lord’s cup (i.e., following the Lord’s plan for your lives%u@[%u@e%u@]) and from demons’ cup; you can’t be partaking of the Lord’s table (i.e., receiving the Lord’s provision for your nourishment%u@[%u@f%u@], and for all of your needs for that matter) and of the demons’ table. %u@2%u@2Or do you %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o provoke the Lord to wrath%u@[%u@g%u@]? We aren’t more powerful than he, are we?%vn~
          %u@2%u@3Everything is permissible, but not everything is beneficial.%u@[%u@h%u@] Everything is permissible, but not everything edifies. %u@2%u@4Let no one pursue his own interests %i@e%i@x%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@y%u@[%u@i%u@] but the next person’s %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l. %u@2%u@5Eat any sort of meat which is sold at the marketplace without any qualms%u@[%u@j%u@]; %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@B%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@, %u@2%u@6“The abundant, splendid variety of things that the earth contains was put there by the Lord’s doing%u@[%u@k%u@],” you see. %u@2%u@7If someone who’s an unbeliever invites you over %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ and you want to go, eat everything that’s laid out on the table or put on your plate without having any qualms about eating any of it. %u@2%u@8If someone were to tell you, “This is meat which was sacrificed %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@g%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l,” don’t eat it on account of that person who pointed it out and because of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ misgivings %i@s%i@u%i@r%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@t—%u@2%u@9I don’t mean because of your own misgivings but because of the other person’s. Now just why is what I’m free to do or not do decided by another person’s misgivings? %u@3%u@0If I partake %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@s%i@ by means of grace (i.e., using the license I’ve been given), why are terrible things said about me in connection with He Whom I offer up thanksgiving to? %u@3%u@1So whether you eat %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ or whether you drink %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ or whether you do %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@e%i@l%i@s%i@e, everything %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g, do to God’s glory. %u@3%u@2Get to where you’re not inadvertently causing a Jew or Westerner%u@[%u@l%u@] or %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ God’s church to get offended or to fall to temptation, %u@3%u@3just as I too try to fit in with everyone %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m, not pursuing my own interests but rather %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ of the%i@ majority, so that they might be saved.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@r%i@t%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a…Also: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@i%i@d%i@o%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y…Lit: %i@i%i@d%i@o%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g. Same expression used in Gal. 6:3; the meaning of it can be inferred from that passage.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@d%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@p%i@ %i@(%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@)…The metonymy of the cup is best understood from its usage in Matt. 20:22; Mark 10:38 and in others.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@(%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@)…The metonymy of the table is best understood from its usage in 2 Sam. 9:7–13; 1 Kings 4:27; Neh. 5:17; Psalm 23:5; 69:22; 78:19 and in others.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@o%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@h [also, %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@j%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@y].%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%I@E%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l…Paul repeats what he said in earlier in 6:12; Ref. note there.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@y…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@q%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@m%i@s…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s [%i@a%i@r%i@e] %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d. %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s is a hendiadys; ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@a%i@ %I@W%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@a%i@ %I@G%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@k%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s. The usage of %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@ here anchors its definition in the NT. In my opinion, the most complete definition of %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@d%i@z%i@ō%i@ (βαπτίζω/Strong’s 907), the Gk. word for %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@z%i@e, is the definition that James H. Strong gives: %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@l%i@m%i@.%i@ Ref. Luke 12:50. The Israelites passing through the Red Sea is symbolic of baptism.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@k%i@-%i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@y…At first, this quotation seems irrelevant with respect to idolatry, that other verses from Exod. would’ve been better suited to highlight the golden calve story, but the opposite is true: it is an accurate description. Idolatry is attributing care, provision, and protection (in Bible terms, the saving and the salvation) to a false god, to worship that god as being the provider, celebrating the fact that he cares and provides for you. The eating, drinking, and playing points to this celebration.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@e%i@s…This expression is similar to “Last Days” (ref. note of John 6:39), and both lend support to the idea of there being different ages of mankind. Furthermore, God’s dealings with man change from age to age, and there’s a progression as mankind passes through the ages. Quoting Wikipedia, “At the core of dispensationalism is the concept that God has acted in different ways in dealing with his chosen people throughout human history.” The %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@e%i@s%i@ is the age in which God makes available the ability to come to Him through Christ directly. The %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ (plural) is not only the singular command to accept Christ but also includes outpourings of the Holy Spirit.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@s%i@o%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p [also %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y] %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t. This verse adds clarification to what Jesus meant when he held up the bread and said “This is my body” (Luke 22:19). Partaking in the communion bread is fellowship with the body of Christ, but Jesus didn’t literally mean that the bread becomes his body.%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Cor. Chapter 11%hb~
          %u@1Imitate me, just as I too imitate Christ.%u@[%u@a%u@]%vn~
          %u@2I applaud you since you keep in the front of your mind my entire collection of teaching%u@[%u@b%u@] and you firmly adhere to the instruction as I presented and entrusted it to you. %u@3I want you to know for certain that Christ is the head of every man%u@[%U@A%u@]; the man %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ is the head of woman; God is the head of Christ. %u@4Any man who has %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ down over his head while praying or prophesying disgraces his head.%u@[%U@B%u@] %u@5Any woman who’s praying or prophesying with her head unveiled disgraces her head: it’s the same thing as having her hair cut off, in fact; %u@6for if a woman isn’t veiled, have her cut her hair off too. If it’s disgraceful for a woman to have her hair cut off or her head shaved, have her put a veil on.%vn~
          %u@7In regard to this topic, a man certainly doesn’t have to put a veil over his head, as his very existence is as God’s image and glory%u@[%u@c%u@] (i.e., His crowning achievement in creation; His pride and joy; what He treasures the most; His complement), but the woman is man’s glory (i.e., man’s pride and joy; what he treasures above all else; the reflection of the finest in him; his complement). %u@8You see, man isn’t derived from woman%u@[%u@d%u@], but %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d: woman is derived from man. %u@9Also, taking a closer look at this, man wasn’t created because of the woman, but rather woman %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ because of the man. %u@1%u@0Because of this the woman ought to have control over %i@h%i@e%i@r head because of the angels.%u@[%U@C%u@] %u@1%u@1Nevertheless in the Lord neither %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s woman %i@e%i@x%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ apart from man nor does man %i@e%i@x%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ apart from woman; %u@1%u@2for just as the woman %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ out of the man, in the same way as that the man too %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@i%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ through the woman, and all the things %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ out of God.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3Decide among yourselves: is it fitting for a woman to pray to God while unveiled? %u@1%u@4Doesn’t even nature itself teach you that if a man were to wear his hair long, it would surely be dishonorable for him %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@o? %u@1%u@5But if a woman were to wear her hair long, it would be glory to her (i.e., it would magnify her, highlighting and complementing her; it would be a point of pride for her)? Because the long hair has been given to her as a substitute for an article of clothing she would wrap around herself. %u@1%u@6But in case someone’s thinking about starting an argument over this, we don’t have such a custom, nor do %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ of God’s churches.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7While preparing the command %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u, I didn’t have anything good to say about you, since your getting together as a group is not for the better but for the worse. %u@1%u@8More to the point, at the head of the list is the reports that I hear that there are divisions which constantly exist among you when you get together as a church, and I believe that at least some of it is true. %u@1%u@9Furthermore, there has got to be factions among you, where each faction consists of the people who share the same opinion about something, so that it’s become evident that those who decide what does or doesn’t fly have come to the forefront among you.%vn~
          %u@2%u@0So your coming together at the same %i@g%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s isn’t to partake of the Lord’s meal, %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@? %u@2%u@1At the meal %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ each person in fact gets a head-start on his eating with the idea of getting more than the next guy, and %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@ one %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w goes hungry on the one hand, while one %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w gets drunk on the other. %u@2%u@2Furthermore, don’t you have pubs and restaurants%u@[%u@e%u@] for eating and drinking %i@a%i@t? Or do you have contempt for the church of God and humiliate those who don’t have %i@e%i@n%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@n? What was I %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o tell you? Was I %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o applaud you %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s? I don’t have any applause in this particular case.%vn~
          %u@2%u@3Delving into this topic more deeply, I received from the Lord and took to heart that which I also presented and entrusted to you, that the night the Lord Jesus was betrayed and arrested, he took a loaf, %u@2%u@4prayed, broke it, and said,%vn~

%r@%%R@I%r@@%R@L%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@,%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@k%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@,%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@b%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@D%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@%vp~
%R@D%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@r%r@p%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@f%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@m%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@%vp~

%u@2%u@5In the same fashion he also took the cup while dining, saying,%nn~
%si~
%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@p%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@w%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@a%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@%vp~
%R@A%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@o%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@,%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@%vp~
%R@D%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@r%r@p%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@f%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@m%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@%vp~
%si~
%u@2%u@6For as often as you happen to or choose to eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the death of the Lord until whatever %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ he ends up coming, %u@2%u@7so that he who perchance eats the bread or drinks the cup of the Lord unworthily will be culpable of the body and the blood of the Lord. %u@2%u@8Have a person examine and test himself and prove to himself and approve of himself, and have him eat from the loaf and drink from the cup in this manner; %u@2%u@9you see, he who eats and drinks %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@u%i@n%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@y%i@ eats and drinks judgment (i.e., a guilty verdict) upon himself %i@b%i@y%i@ not evaluating the body. %u@3%u@0For this reason many of you are weak and frail (i.e., are run down with a long-running illness or have maladies%u@[%u@f%u@]), and a good number of you are in the process of dying%u@[%u@g%u@]. %u@3%u@1If we were to examine and judge ourselves (i.e., examine ourselves and acknowledge our own guilt), we would not be judged and pronounced guilty. %u@3%u@2Being judged by the Lord, you are disciplined, trained, and corrected, so that you won’t be condemned together with the world (i.e., with the unbelievers and the entire ungodly system they created). %u@3%u@3%I@R%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%u@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s, my comrades%u@[%u@h%u@], so that when gathering together for the purpose of eating, wait for one another %i@r%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@-%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g. %u@3%u@4If someone’s famished, have him eat in a pub or restaurant, so that he won’t join in on %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@g%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ in such a way that it results in him being judged and pronounced guilty.%nn~
      Now %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ the other %i@i%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@e%i@s %I@I%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@, I’ll settle these whenever I happen to come visit.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%I@I%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t…This appears to be a dangling sentence that should’ve been appended to the end of the previous chapter.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@m%i@y%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l [%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g]%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y…This may be a hendiadys; ref. note of Matt. 3:11. If this is the case, it would be rendered %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n…Lit: %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@p%i@u%i@b%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@s…Lit: %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@s. The Gk. word for %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ also means %i@b%i@u%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g in a generic sense, a building which is not a residence. In this context, Paul seems to be referring to establishments and not homes per se.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@r%i@u%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@r%i@u%i@n%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@l%i@l%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@l%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@e%i@s…Ref. note of Matt. 4:23%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@d%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@s%i@l%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g. Ref. 1 Cor. 7:39.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@.%i@ The Gk. words for %i@m%i@a%i@n and %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n used here are used in some of Paul’s other writings (1 Cor. 7:1–3; Eph. 5:22–23; 1 Tim. 2) and elsewhere in the NT to refer to %i@h%i@u%i@s%i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ and %i@w%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@,%i@ introducing the potential for ambiguity. Paul was cognizant of this as he was committing his words to paper (parchment, actually) and explicitly selected %i@w%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ or %i@h%i@u%i@s%i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ by saying %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ and %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ in 1 Cor. 7:2 and %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ in Eph. 5:22. Since %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ or %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ doesn’t appear in the 1 Cor. 11 passage referenced here, Paul means %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ and %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@.%i@ The context favors this conclusion as well.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@A%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d…One can only speculate as to what exactly Paul is talking about in this passage. Having said that, cultural traditions stretch back for millennia, traditions where women wear head covering. It appears that Paul is talking about a tradition which was peculiar to the Corinthians, where it was shameful for a man to have something over his head in a public forum of some sort, while it was shameful for a woman to not have something over her head in the same forum. There’s a parallel between one’s head which is a body part and one’s head which is the next level up in the submission chain (Paul speaks of the “head” in Eph. 5:23 the same way). So the woman not having a covering over her head would be seen as a sign of disrespect to her head, to man.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%I@B%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@s…Speculation again due to the ambiguity in this verse. The Gk. words for %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ can also be rendered %i@b%i@e %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@.%i@ The phrase %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@s%i@ can be rendered in a couple of variations such as %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@,%i@ or %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@s%i@.%i@ The question is whether %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d (lit., %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d)%i@ in this verse refers to the woman’s physical head or to her higher-up (man). Assuming that the latter is the case and that %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ here doesn’t refer to her physical head, then this would mean that the woman exercises power, authority, and control over the man, but it is done by means of the angels. This agrees with Paul’s previous observation that woman came out of man, but man is birthed by woman; both woman comes from man, and man comes from woman; neither is superior; both are dependent on the other. This is simply a restatement of v. 12. In keeping with this, the woman has authority (has control over) the man, a control which is accomplished on a spiritual level by the employment of angels.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@s…Lit: %I@T%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f. What Jesus was did with the bread at the Last Supper is what was done to his body: it was lifted up, broken, and distributed to everyone around the table.%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Cor. Chapter 12%hb~
          %u@1Concerning The Spirituals%u@[%U@A%u@] (things which are of nature related to the Holy Spirit: i.e., spiritual gifts, ministries, and extraordinary manifestations of the Holy Spirit), comrades%u@[%u@a%u@], I don’t want you to fail to understand this. %u@2You know for a fact that when you were pagans in close contact with%u@[%u@b%u@] the %i@m%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ dumb idols, as long as%u@[%u@c%u@] you kept on being led%u@[%u@d%u@] %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@d%i@o%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ you were being led astray. %u@3This is why I’m making you understand that no one while speaking by means of the Spirit of God says “Jesus %i@i%i@s%i@ accursed,” and no one %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@f%i@l%i@u%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ can say “Jesus %i@i%i@s Lord” except %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@f%i@l%i@u%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ by the Holy Spirit.%vn~
          %u@4Now there’s a variety of gifts, gifts which are freely given by God as an act of grace and not as something which have been earned by the recipient, but the same Spirit. %u@5And there are a variety of ministries, but the same Spirit still. %u@6And there are a variety of effects %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t, but the same God Who works every little piece of everything%u@[%u@e%u@]. %u@7To each is given the manifestation of the Spirit for the common good. %u@8In this regard, through the Spirit is given to one person%u@[%U@B%u@] %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ word of wisdom, but on the other hand to another person %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ word of knowledge according to the same Spirit, %u@9to another %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ faith by the same Spirit, but to another gifts of healings%u@[%U@C%u@] by the same Spirit, %u@1%u@0but to another the working of miracles, but to another prophecy, but to another the discerning of spirits, but to another a %i@d%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ kind of tongue, to another the interpretation of tongues. %u@1%u@1The one-in-the-same Spirit works all of these %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@s, divvying them up and parceling them out to each individual just the way He wants.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2In fact, just as the body is a single unit and has many parts, and all the parts, %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h there’s many of them, comprise one body, it’s the same way with Christ. %u@1%u@3You see, every one of us was inducted%u@[%u@f%u@] into one body by one Spirit, whether %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ was Jewish, was a Westerner%u@[%u@g%u@], whether a slave or freeman—all of us have been made to drink %i@o%i@f %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ one Spirit; %u@1%u@4for the body %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ of one part %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ but of many parts. %u@1%u@5If the foot were to say, “I’m not a hand—I’m not one of the parts the body has,” then because of this %i@c%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@m%i@ it’s not a constituent body part? %u@1%u@6And if the ear were to say, “I’m not an eye, I’m not part of the body,” because of %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ this, it’s not part of the body? %u@1%u@7If the entire body was %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ eye, how would you hear? If the entire body was %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ ear, how could you smell anything?%vn~
          %u@1%u@8So as it turns out God put every one of the parts into position just the way He wanted. %u@1%u@9If every little piece%u@[%u@h%u@] was one %i@t%i@y%i@p%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ part %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y, where would that leave the body? %u@2%u@0It turns out that while there’re many parts indeed, there’s but one body. %u@2%u@1The eye can’t %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ telling the hand “I don’t need you”; furthermore, the head can’t tell the feet “I don’t need you” either. %u@2%u@2No—the parts of the body which seem to be weaker are more necessary %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e. %u@2%u@3We assign a greater value to the parts of the body we deem to be of little value%u@[%U@D%u@], and we put a greater amount of clothing over our private parts %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@-%i@h%i@i%i@d%i@d%i@e%i@n, %u@2%u@4but the valuable parts have no need %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t. No—God composed—He blended together and mixed—the body by having given more value to those parts lacking it %u@2%u@5so there wouldn’t be division in the body, but that the members would care for each other %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r the same way. %u@2%u@6If a %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@l%i@e member happens to suffer, all the members suffer along with it. If a %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@l%i@e%i@ member is glorified, all the members are glorified along with it.%vn~
          %u@2%u@7Now you all are Christ’s body, and you as the individual members populate the various body parts%u@[%u@i%u@]. %u@2%u@8God has indeed placed in the church first apostles (i.e., missionaries sent out to pioneer new Christian works), second prophets, third teachers, %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@ miracles, gifts of healings, %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ help in any of a multitude of ways%u@[%u@j%u@], administrations (i.e., guidance, governorship: literally the one who steers the ship), various tongues. %u@2%u@9Not everyone’s an apostle, %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y? Not everyone’s a prophet, %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y? Not everyone’s a teacher, %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y? Not everyone performs miracles, %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y? %u@3%u@0Not everyone has %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s gifts of healings, %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y? Not everyone speaks in tongues, %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y? Not everyone interprets %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%u@[%U@E%u@]? %u@3%u@1But maintain a burning desire for the greater gifts.%vn~
      Yet I’ll show you a road %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e which is superior %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%u@[%U@F%u@]…%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h. Same usage of the word %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h as John used in the phrase %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@C%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ (John 1:1).%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@s…A minor definition of the Gk. word %i@h%i@ō%i@s (ὡς/Strong’s 5613)used here (a definition found in Thayer’s concordance). Justified by the context.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@k%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@d….According to Max & Mary, the Gk. particle %i@a%i@n%i@ inserted here emphasizes the continuous action insinuated by the imperfect tense of the verb %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@d%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l. Same expression used 1 Cor. 15:28; Eph. 1:23%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%I@W%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@r…Lit: %I@G%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@k%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@e%i@c%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@s. Used in v. 6 also.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@d%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@p%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@s…Lit: [%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e] %i@m%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f [%i@t%i@h%i@e] %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@l%i@p%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@s…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@l%i@p%i@s. The Gk. word for %i@h%i@e%i@l%i@p%i@ literally means one who %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@. Also, ref. note concerning %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ in v. 28.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@s…The plural form of the Gk. word %i@p%i@n%i@e%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@k%i@o%i@s%i@ (πνευματικός/Strong’s 4152) with the definite article, which isn’t ordinarily needed in this case (this creates emphasis).%i@ The Gk. noun %i@p%i@n%i@e%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@ (spirit, πνεῦμα/Strong’s 4151) terminated with the adjective ending %i@t%i@i%i@k%i@o%i@s%i@,%i@ a suffix%i@ which “marks ability or fitness” of the verb it appends according to Bullinger. The adjective, having been formed, is used substantively as a noun in this verse, forming a new noun. This new Gk. noun means “belonging to or of pneuma; of the pneuma.” As pneuma has multiple meanings—a spiritual being (the Holy Spirit, a human spirit, a demonic spirit); related to things of the spirit; prevailing attitude—pneumatikos acquires these flavors of meaning: related to or of the Holy Spirit; related to or of a human spirit; or simply the word %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l as it’s understood in English. Though Paul didn’t invent this word, he coined the usage of it in the NT. The meaning of pneumatikos in Paul’s writings is best understood from the way Paul uses it and from firsthand Christian experience—not from what’s written in the lexicons. When pneumatikos appears in the NT, the context will guide you as to which of these various definitions to use. In v. 1 here, the context suggests things related to or pertaining to the Holy Spirit, where %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ is a synecdoche which refers to his workings, similar to the way Holy Spirit is used a synecdoche to refer to the baptism in the Holy Spirit (an example being Acts 8:15). So pneumatikos as used here refers to things that the Holy Spirit does and not the Holy Spirit himself per se. This is not the case in other NT usages of pneumatikos, as pneumatikos’s meaning is context-dependent.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n…The nine items listed in this passage, the Gifts of the Spirit, are all supernatural workings of the Holy Spirit, in spite of some of these item’s titles, titles which suggest that they are personal qualities. Among such titles is the first, the %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@s%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@;%i@ the Gk. word for %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ in this context means a piece of information. The word %i@w%i@i%i@s%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@,%i@ apart from meaning wisdom, also means sophistication, cleverness, highly-skilled in a specific area, and even cunning. For the second item, the %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@g%i@e, the Gk. word for %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@ means knowledge or understanding which isn’t obtained through the physical senses. %I@F%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ , the third item, must be talking about faith of a supernatural type, not to be confused with personal faith, which all believers must have and are encouraged to grow in.%fn~
Pentecostal tradition (and the Pentecostals have studied this passage the most) defines the spiritual gifts as follows:%fn~
Word of wisdom—supernatural understanding of some future event%fn~
Word of knowledge—supernatural knowledge of a current or past event%fn~
Special faith—supernatural faith to receive a miracle%fn~
Gifts of healings— spectacular healings, usually instantaneous%fn~
Working of miracles—just like it sounds%fn~
Prophecy—Holy Spirit-inspired utterance%fn~
Discerning of spirits—the ability to see into the spiritual world; seeing angels or demons%fn~
Tongues—Holy Spirit-inspired utterance in an unknown language%fn~
Interpretation of tongues—Holy Spirit-inspired interpretation of an utterance in tongues%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s…This is %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ (plural) not %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ (singular). There is no single, generic gift of healing, rather there are a multitude of specialty healing gifts just like there’s a multitude of doctors who are specialists. Those who have a healing gift will usually excel at healing certain types or categories of disorders more than others. Similarly, when this same verse mentions %i@h%i@e%i@l%i@p%i@s, it does so in the plural instead of singular because there’s a wide variety of helps ministries, and therefore people tend to specialize in one specific type of helps ministry.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@l%i@u%i@e…Also: %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s…Lit: %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@o%i@n%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e. Paul may be referring to hair: it has little functional value and serves little function, but gets dressed, clothed, and is something which is of value to us.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%I@N%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@?%i@ %I@N%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y…Lit: %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@;%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@t. Keep in mind that what’s spoken about in vv. 27–31 are ministries, a subset of the “spirituals” specified in v. 1. Ministry gifts are full-time callings, such as an apostle or teacher, a vocation that the Holy Spirit calls a person to and enables him to do on a regular basis. A ministry is done for the benefit of the body and not for a personal edification. As such, the tongues listed in v. 30 is a vocation, a ministry, something done for the edification of the body. Not everyone has this ministry. But there is another kind of tongues described in 14:4 which is for personal edification. The restriction of “not everyone speaks in tongues” doesn’t apply to the speaking in tongues done for personal edification.%i@%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%I@Y%i@e%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s…Lit: %I@A%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@e%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y…The introduction to the 13%u@t%u@h chapter. What is written about in the 12%u@t%u@h chapter is a good way: miraculous manifestations by the Holy Spirit; the entire body of Christ working together in harmony. But it gets better.%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Cor. Chapter 13%hb~
          %u@1If I were to speak in tongues of men and of angels but not have love, I will have become a blaring brass instrument%u@[%u@a%u@] or clanging cymbal. %u@2If I were to have a prophecy and %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@c%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@s%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ know for certain%u@[%U@A%u@] all the mysteries and all the knowledge and understanding, or%u@[%u@b%u@] if I were to have all the faith so as to move mountains %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e, but not have love, I am nothing. %u@3And if I were to sell everything I own and tender my body to be burned, but not have love, it is helping me nothing.%vn~
          %u@4The love %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ is patient, the love is kind, isn’t jealous and doesn’t cause rivalry, doesn’t vaunt itself and act as a show-off, isn’t full of itself, %u@5doesn’t act unseemly or indecently, doesn’t seek its self-interest%u@[%u@c%u@], doesn’t gaslight others, doesn’t keep a mental scorecard of the bad things %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@t, %u@6doesn’t rejoice at the wrongdoing %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s but joins in the rejoicing in the truth; %u@7%i@i%i@t%i@ endures all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.%vn~
          %u@8The love %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ never breaks down%u@[%u@d%u@]. Should there be prophecies, they’ll be done away with; should there be tongues, they’ll cease; should there be knowledge and understanding, it’ll be done away with.%u@[%U@B%u@]%u@[%U@C%u@] %u@9The fact of the matter is that we know and understand from %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ of a part %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@ and we prophecy%i@ from %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ of a part, %u@1%u@0but when the Complete comes, the Partial will be done away with. %u@1%u@1When I was a child, I was talking like a child, was thinking like a child, was reasoning like a child—when I became a man, I did away with the things of childhood. %u@1%u@2Furthermore, at the moment %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ we’re looking at the vague reflection %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ by a mirror, but some time in the future %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@l%i@l %i@l%i@o%i@o%i@k %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ looking %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ face-to-face; at the moment my knowing and understanding comes out of a %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@l%i@e%i@ part %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@,%i@ but some time in the future I’ll know and understand %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ exactly just as I have been known and understood %i@b%i@y%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ exactly.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3At the present time faith, hope, and love remain—these three—but the greatest of them is love.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: a copper%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@a%i@n%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@-%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n…Lit: %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@s%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n…The Gk. verb %i@o%i@i%i@d%i@a%i@ (οἶδα/Strong’s 1492)%i@,%i@ in contrast to the Gk. root verb %i@g%i@i%i@n%i@ō%i@s%i@k%i@ō%i@ (γινώσκω/Strong’s 1097)used for %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ in this verse. %I@O%i@i%i@d%i@a%i@ is knowing by seeing (by physical sense); %i@g%i@i%i@n%i@ō%i@s%i@k%i@ō%i@ is understanding something which is abstract. This difference is exemplified in 2 Cor. 5:16, where both %i@g%i@i%i@n%i@ō%i@s%i@k%i@ō%i@ and oida are used in the same verse. Furthermore, in this verse Paul said “if I were to have a prophecy” and not “if I were to prophesy.” In other words, Paul said “if I were to possess a prophecy” and not “if I were to prophesy [i.e. speak a prophetic utterance].” He goes on to insinuate that the prophecy would contain the answers to the mysteries of life—hence the choice of the word %i@o%i@i%i@d%i@a%i@ instead of %i@g%i@i%i@n%i@ō%i@s%i@k%i@ō%i@ when he said “know all the mysteries, etc.”%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@S%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@;%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@;%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h…Some have used this verse as a basis to argue that prophecies and tongues have ceased because the time for it to cease has come already. But notice that Paul mentions three things: prophecy, tongues, and knowledge. All three of these will cease at the same time, and not just two of three. It’s obvious that the third item knowledge hasn’t ceased yet, therefore the other two haven’t either.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@…There is a time coming, as specified in the v. 10, when the “perfect” will come, and the “partial” will be done away with. Has this time come yet? No, it couldn’t have. Verse 8 lists three things that will cease when this time arrives: prophecy, tongues, and knowledge. Not one, not two, but all three will cease. Some have taught in the past that this time arrived when the last book of the Bible was written, therefore tongues and prophecy have ceased. But what about knowledge? Paul tells us in a few other places in his epistles that he desires for Christians to increase in knowledge-certainly it has not ceased, and therefore the fulfillment cannot have been the completion of the NT canon.%fn~
But there is coming a time—probably after death—when all three will cease, including knowledge. One might see why tongues and prophecy will cease, but what about knowledge? Does this mean that when we get to heaven, we’ll forget everything we knew on the earth? I should think not. The answer lies a bit deeper, specifically in an understanding of the Gk. word used for %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w. NT Gk. has two principle verbs for “to know,” and from the verbs all the other forms, in this case the nouns, are derived. The first word is %i@o%i@i%i@d%i@a, and it's actually an awkward form of another verb which means “to see.” The other word is %i@g%i@n%i@ō%i@s%i@k%i@ō. Oida and %i@g%i@i%i@n%i@ō%i@s%i@k%i@ō, although both translated "to know", have distinct meanings. Oida means to know because a fact or thing is obvious, it’s something one knows because one has seen it, hence the connection to the verb “to see.” Ginōskō, on the other hand, refers to knowledge that one has obtained without the use of the senses. Ginōskō involves a level of abstraction, or reasoning, to arrive at the thing known, since it’s not directly discernable. For example, I “oida” that the shirt I’m wearing is red, but I “%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@ō%i@s%i@k%i@ō%i@ “ that the spare-penny dish at the checkout line at the convenience store is usually empty, because people are more apt to reach for a penny when they’re two or three cents short of the next dollar than they are to remember to put their spare pennies in the dish. Ginōskō is also a root used to derive other words, but in every case the meaning still involves some thought process. Hence, ginōskō or its derivatives are, among others, translated “understand,” “discern,” or “recognize.” In the NT, ginōskō is sometimes used in reference to spiritual knowledge, because spiritual things cannot be seen, and faith, by nature, believes in what one cannot see, and therefore is always abstract.%fn~
But there’s coming a day when the faith necessary to believe in God won’t be necessary, because we won’t be living on this earth anymore. All ginōskō knowledge will be replaced with oida knowledge, which will not cease—only ginōskō knowledge will. Questions and mysteries will be done away with too, at that time. But while we’re still here on earth, there are certain things we must know without having seen, or having conclusive proofs demonstrated to us. There’s things that also happen to us, or to others we know, that are a mystery. Why did this tragedy occur? Many ask, was it God’s will? Where was God in all of this? A lot of things we don’t—nor ever will—know the answer to, not here on this earth. This doesn’t mean that there’s not a good explanation for it; what it does mean is that the explanation is beyond our reach. Often when people don’t have the answer, they must fill that unknowing in them and produce their own explanation, and often this results in speculations about God’s will. This has become the source of a lot of poor doctrine. Just accept the fact that there are certain things that we’ll never understand in this lifetime until the perfect comes, but that there’s probably a good explanation for these things.%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Cor. Chapter 14%hb~
          %u@1Pursue love and have a burning desire for the spirituals (i.e., spiritual gifts and manifestations of the Holy Spirit), but more so that you would prophesy %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@e%i@s. %u@2You see, the one who speaks in tongues isn’t talking to people %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@ but is talking to God instead. In fact no one hears %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@g%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@y: he speaks mysteries by %i@h%i@i%i@s spirit%u@[%u@a%u@]. %u@3Converseley, the one who prophesies speaks edification; exhortation, encouragement, comfort, advice; and consolation to people. %u@4The one who speaks in tongues edifies himself (i.e., builds himself up); the one who prophesies edifies the church. %u@5I want all of you to speak in tongues and speak in tongues, but more so that you would prophesy and prophesy. The one who prophesies is more important%u@[%u@b%u@] than the one who speaks in tongues, unless he were to interpret %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ so that the church would receive edification.%vn~
          %u@6So now, comrades%u@[%u@c%u@], if I were to go up to you and proceed to speak%u@[%u@d%u@] in tongues, how would it benefit you, except if I were to convey a revelation, an understanding, a prophecy, or a teaching%u@[%u@e%u@]? %u@7Nevertheless the inanimate objects which are designed to produce specific, coherent sound patterns, whether %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ flute or %i@a%i@ harp%u@[%u@f%u@]—if %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m were to not put out distinct musical notes, how will the flute-playing or harp-playing be comprehensible? %u@8Furthermore, if a bugle were to play an indistinguishable tune, who would get into position for battle? %u@9Similarly, if you were to not form intelligible words in whatever language you speak in, how would what’s spoken be comprehensible? The fact of the matter is that you would just be wasting your breath%u@[%u@g%u@]. %u@1%u@0Who knows just how many different languages there are worldwide, and none of them consists of a set of incomprehensible sounds. %u@1%u@1So if I were to not have the voice-control %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@u%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@a%i@g%i@e, from the perspective of the person I’m speaking to, I’ll appear to whomever I’m speaking to as though I’m a person from another country who can’t speak the native language%u@[%u@h%u@], and he’ll appear the same way to me. %u@1%u@2Likewise, you too, since you are zealous of spirituals (i.e., manifestations of the Holy Spirit), seek that which furthers the edification of the church.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3In light of this, let the one speaking in tongues pray that he would interpret %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g. %u@1%u@4You see, if I were to pray in tongues, my spirit would be%i@ praying but my mind wouldn’t be involved in the production of the words%u@[%u@i%u@]. %u@1%u@5So what’s %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n? I will pray in the Spirit%u@[%u@j%u@], but I will pray also with the mind. I will sing a song%u@[%U@A%u@] %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ in the Spirit, but I will also sing a song with the mind. %u@1%u@6Otherwise, if you were to give a praise, blessing, or consecration with %i@t%i@h%i@e spirit, a person who isn’t versed in the things of the Spirit and doesn’t speak in tongues%u@[%U@B%u@]—how will he say “amen” (i.e., speak a verbal affirmation) upon %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ Your Blessing%u@[%u@k%u@], since he doesn’t know what you’re saying? %u@1%u@7For you certainly give thanks well, but the other %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ doesn’t get anything out of it. %u@1%u@8I give God thanks that I speak in tongues more than you all, %u@1%u@9but putting that to the side, %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m in a church I want to speak five words %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@o using my mind so that I would pass on instruction to others, rather than a million words in an %i@u%i@n%i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ language.%vn~
          %u@2%u@0Comrades, don’t become children in %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r thought processes, but instead, act like toddlers with the evil %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h and become adults in %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r thought processes. %u@2%u@1It’s written in the Old Testament%u@[%u@l%u@]:%vn~
%si~
“In different tongues%vp~
And by the lips of different people%vp~
I will speak to this folk,%vp~
And they won’t even hear and obey Me%vp~
%I@A%i@s%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ in this way,” says the Lord%vp~
%si~
%u@2%u@2%I@T%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@e so much so that the tongues %i@r%i@e%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ are intended to be a sign (i.e., a miracle God performed, done in such a way to demonstrate beyond any doubt that He did it) not to those who believe but rather to those who refuse to believe%u@[%U@C%u@]. %u@2%u@3So if the entire church were to gather together in one place and everyone were to speak in tongues and a person who isn’t versed in the things of the Spirit or speak in tongues or an unbeliever were to enter, they’d come to the conclusion that you all are insane, wouldn’t they? %u@2%u@4But if everyone were to prophecy and some unbeliever or someone who’s not versed in the Spirit were to enter, everything %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m will be exposed by everyone, he’ll be examined by everyone, %u@2%u@5the secrets of his heart will get to where they’re out in the open for everyone to see, so that he’ll worship God as he falls on his face, telling everyone that God really is among you.%nn~
          %u@2%u@6What’s the bottom line%u@[%u@m%u@], comrades? When you get together as a group, each has a hymn, %i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h has a teaching, %i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h has a revelation, %i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h has a %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ tongues, %i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h has an interpretation %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@.%i@ Let everything that happens serve the purpose of edification— %u@2%u@7Should someone speak in tongues, %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ two or at the most three %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ at a time one after the other and let one %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ interpret %i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e.%u@[%U@D%u@] %u@2%u@8Now if there’s no interpreter, have him remain silent in church, but let him speak %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@ to himself and to God%u@[%U@E%u@].%vn~
          %u@2%u@9Let a handful%u@[%u@n%u@] of prophets speak, and let the others go through %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@y and judge it piece by piece. %u@3%u@0Now if %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ were to be revealed to another person%i@ seated %i@n%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@r%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n, have the first one silence himself. %u@3%u@1The fact is all of you can prophecy one after another, so that everyone would learn and be exhorted, comforted, counseled, and advised; %u@3%u@2the spirits of prophets are subordinate to and take directions from prophets.%u@[%U@F%u@] %u@3%u@3You see, God is not a product of confusion but of peace.%vn~
      As in all the congregations of those who believe in Christ, %u@3%u@4have the women in the churches keep silent. The fact of the matter is, I don’t allow them to speak %i@a%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@d %i@a%i@d%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@r%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%u@[%U@G%u@], but have them submit instead, just as the Old Testament concurs. %u@3%u@5If they want to learn something in particular, let them ask their husbands at home; it’s disgraceful for a woman to speak %i@a%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@r%i@u%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ in church you see— %u@3%u@6Or%u@ did the word of God issue forth from you? Or are you the only ones it came down and met%u@[%u@o%u@]?%vn~
          %u@3%u@7If someone is considered to be a prophet or spiritual (i.e., the Holy Spirit manifests spiritual gifts through him), let him come to recognize and understand that what I’m writing to you is a commandment from the Lord. %u@3%u@8But if someone will not understand, let him remain without understanding. %u@3%u@9So then, my comrades, seek to prophesy and prophesy and to speak and speak in tongues, not preventing speaking%i@ in tongues— %u@4%u@0But let everything be done properly and orderly.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@b%i@y %i@h%i@i%i@s %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…Or: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@b%i@y [or %i@i%i@n; %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h] [%i@t%i@h%i@e] %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@c%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k…Lit: %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@c%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g…The Gk. wording insinuates that this is a comprehensive list%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@p…The usage of the Gk. word for %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ in this verse implies that Paul’s referring to the flute or the harp only to the exclusion of all other instruments. Ref. note of Rev. 18:22%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@w%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@i%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@a%i@g%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@r%i@b%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@a%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@v%i@o%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@s…Lit: %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@f%i@r%i@u%i@i%i@t%i@f%i@u%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…Or: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t. Some ambiguity exists.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %I@B%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g…The Gk. construct insinuates that the message is the speaker’s own peculiar message%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@t%i@t%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e…Lit: %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@f%i@u%i@l…Lit: %i@t%i@w%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@e%i@e. An expression; also used in Matt. 18:20.%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@t…Also: %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@u%i@c%i@k [%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@p%i@;%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@;%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@c%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@p]. Weak as it may be, this is one of the few pieces of evidence in the Bible of post-resurrection believers using musical instruments in worship.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@r. The phrase %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ is an expression, and what deeper meaning or further nuance that this expression communicates, I don’t know . The Gk. word for %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ is contingent on the context.
