%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@v%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@,%i@ or, %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e. The picture is of a person presenting himself before a king, or someone presenting an offering at a temple. The implication is that the person or thing presented will leave a good impression.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@d%i@a%i@y%i@-%i@i%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@-%i@o%i@u%i@t…Lit: %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%fn~
%i@%sb~
2 Cor. Chapter 5%hb~
          %u@1In fact, we know for certain that if our Earth-suit%u@[%u@a%u@] were to be demolished%u@[%u@b%u@], we have a building from God—an eternal building, one that’s not of human construction—way up in the sky%u@[%u@c%u@]. %u@2In connection to this we do groan, longing to put on (i.e., as though putting on a piece of clothing) our home—our cozy cottage%u@[%u@d%u@]—%i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ from heaven. %u@3If we really have put on %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%u@[%U@A%u@], we won’t be caught naked. %u@4Furthermore, we whose %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ existence is with the Earth-suit do groan, being encumbered%u@[%u@e%u@], the crux of which is that we don’t want to be stripped of our garments but to be clothed instead, so that the death %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ would be thoroughly dowsed by the life. %u@5Now He Who did the necessary work in us to make this very thing happen to us is God, the One Who gave us the down payment%u@[%u@f%u@] of the Spirit.%vn~
          %u@6So keep your chin up—always—and know for certain that making yourselves at home in the body will leave you far from home%u@[%u@g%u@] with the Lord %u@7(we go about our lives%u@[%u@h%u@] by faith and not by sight, you see), %u@8but with our chins held high and thinking positively, we’d rather be far from home in regard to the body but make ourselves at home with the Lord. %u@9And so whether at home or away from home, we aspire to be pleasing to him: %u@1%u@0the fact of the matter is that every one of us must appear before the Judge, Christ the Judge, so that each individual’s deeds, deeds which were committed by the body, whether they were good or bad—%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m—would be brought %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@J%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1Now that we’ve acquired a firm understanding of the fear of the Lord, we convince %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r people %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e. We’ve been made manifest%u@[%u@i%u@] to God (i.e., we’ve presented ourselves before God), and I hope to reach the point where we’ve been made manifest to your consciences as well— %u@1%u@2Not that we’re trying to promote ourselves again%u@[%u@j%u@], but are giving you the chance to talk proudly about us instead, so that you would have %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ to those who take pride in and talk big about peoples’ behavior on the surface, or the masks people present to others, and not what’s in the heart. %u@1%u@3The fact of the matter is that if it’s the case that I’ve lost my mind, %I@I%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ for God; if it’s the case that I’m sane, %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@n%i@e%i@ for you. %u@1%u@4The love of Christ has a tight grip on us, you see, and has determined %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ this %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@e: that one %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ died in everyone’s place%u@[%u@k%u@] (therefore everyone died), %u@1%u@5and he died in everyone’s place so that the living would no longer live for themselves but that they would instead live for him who died and was raised in their place.%vn~
          %u@1%u@6An outcome of all this is that, from now on, there’s nobody we form a perception of according to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ flesh (i.e., according to a person’s physical body and outward appearance; his limited ability in and of himself), even if we had come to know and understand Christ according to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ flesh—but, no, we no longer know and understand %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7An outcome of all this is that if someone is in Christ (melded with him: in him, with him, and living life by means of him), he’s a new type of species, a new kind of creature, a new creation: the old has come and gone%u@[%u@l%u@] %i@a%i@n%i@d—get this—the new has come into being%u@[%U@B%u@]. %u@1%u@8Now all %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@w%i@ things %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ from God, Who by Christ reconciled us with Himself and gave us the Reconciliation Ministry, %u@1%u@9that is that God was in Christ reconciling %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ world (i.e., those who don’t know and live for God) to Himself, not holding all the times they crossed over the line in doing wrong as strikes against them%u@[%u@m%u@], and assigning to us %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@s%i@k%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ the message of reconciliation. %u@2%u@0So we’re ambassadors of Christ as we’re encouraging, exhorting, and advising %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ in matters pertaining to God. %I@A%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@:%i@ “As a representative of Christ I ask you—I beg you—to be reconciled to God. %u@2%u@1He who had never consummated sin was made%u@[%u@n%u@] sin on our behalf so that we would become righteous of a nature of God’s righteousness%u@[%U@C%u@] in him (melded with him: in him, with him, and living life by means of him).”%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%I@E%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@-%i@s%i@u%i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@o%i@n%i@-%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t. Some liberties taken.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@s. The word describes breaking a stone edifice apart, as it’s the same root word Jesus used to describe the dispersal of the stones of the Temple.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@k%i@y…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@—%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@z%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@t%i@t%i@a%i@g%i@e…The Gk. word here is a diminutive form of %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e, and as such acquires a connotation of coziness%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@w%i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@y%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t…Ref. note of 1:22%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@m%i@e…Lit (inserting a couple of key Gk. words): %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ā%i@m%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@s%i@ (ἐνδημέω/Strong’s 1736)%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@e%i@k%i@d%i@ā%i@m%i@o%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@ (ἐκδημέω/Strong’s 1553). These two Gk. words forms a rhyme, assonance, or pun, making this a figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@g%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@s%i@t…The same Gk. verb is rendered %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@r in v. 10, and assuming that the reuse in v. 11 here links the two thoughts together, then what Paul means by “manifest” in v. 11 is similar to its usage in v. 10, i.e. of appearing before a judge to have your deeds reviewed and judged.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%I@N%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n…Same wording as 3:1%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e…Also: %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@n%i@e…Lit: %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m…Lit: %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@k%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@I%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@…Or: %I@I%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g….The UBS Greek NT, 3%u@r%u@d Edition reads%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g (also, %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ or %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@d);%i@ the photocopies of both Codex Vaticanus and Codex Sinaiticus read %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ instead (and a translation of the Latin Vulgate agrees), therefore most of the translators render this %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ and not %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@.%i@ One can only speculate if the UBS made a mistake here or if they changed the reading based on “internal” considerations and didn’t footnote with a citation of the various manuscripts. The UBS reading makes sense: assuming such a reading, the “undressing” referred to would be the same as “if our Earth-suit were to be demolished” (v. 1). When the physical body is destroyed, we’ll be clothed with a heavenly body, rather than being “found naked.”%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@w%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g…The KJV says “all things are become new.” The words “all things” are not found in the better manuscripts.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s…Lit: [%i@a] %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d. Noteworthy is that, in the GT, there’s no definite article preceding %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@.%i@ This verse does not say we would become the righteousness of God (insertion of definite article before %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s), but that we would become righteous in a way that our righteousness is of the same nature as God’s righteousness. This is a far cry from becoming equivalent to God in His righteousness—which is an absurd proposition.%fn~
%i@%sb~
2 Cor. Chapter 6%hb~
          %u@1Being those who work together %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%u@[%u@a%u@], we do plead with you to not take in God’s grace and have nothing to show for it. %u@2In fact, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ says,%vn~
%si~
I heard you just in time%vp~
And I helped you%vp~
That time you needed to be rescued%u@[%u@b%u@]%vp~
%si~
Hey! “Just in time” is now—Hey! “The time you needed to be rescued” is now.%nn~
          %u@3Don’t give anyone any reason to be seriously offended%u@[%u@c%u@] %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g, so that the ministry %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e won’t be criticized— %u@4Uh-uh—leaving others with an impression that’s expected of%i@ God’s ministers, %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ with a good deal of perseverance, %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ in%i@ times of distress, in times of privation, while in anguish, %u@5while being whipped or beaten, while in prison, during riots, while doing hard, grueling work, in sleepless nights, while going hungry; %u@6%i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ with purity, with understanding, with patience, with kindness; %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ in the Holy Spirit, in sincere love, %u@7with a message of truth%u@[%u@d%u@], in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ power of God, by being armed with the armor and weapons of righteousness that the left and right hands are accustomed to handle%u@[%u@e%u@]; %u@8through glory and disgrace, through a bad reputation and a good reputation; as though we’re deceived and as though we know the truth, %u@9as though we’re not known or understood and as though we’re known and understood, as though we’re dying but—hey—we’re %i@s%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ alive; as though we’re being reprimanded but not sentenced to death, %u@1%u@0as though we’re in pain but ever rejoicing, as though we’re poor but becoming quite wealthy, as though we own nothing but own everything.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1We haven’t stopped engaging you in dialogue%u@[%u@f%u@], Corinthians; our heart is fixed%i@ wide open %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u. %u@1%u@2Don’t be closed off to us—but %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f “closed off” %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@s in your tender affections. %u@1%u@3When it’s your turn to reciprocate (I’m talking to you like I would to a child), open yourselves up %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@u%i@s.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4Don’t get unevenly yoked (i.e., like an ox and a donkey yoked together on the same plow harness) with unbelievers. What partnership is there between righteousness and lawlessness (i.e., the refusal to be restrained by the rules of God or of man)? What do light and darkness have in common? %u@1%u@5What harmony is there between Christ and the Devil%u@[%u@g%u@]? How does a believer partake in joint ventures with an unbeliever? %u@1%u@6How does God’s temple approve of or validate %i@a%i@n idol’s %i@t%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e? You are a temple of the Living God, in fact, just as God said,%vn~
%si~
“I will dwell and move among them,%vp~
And I will be their God,%vp~
And they will be my folk-people.%vp~
%u@1%u@7In light of this come out from their midst%vp~
And be separate,” Says the Lord,%vp~
“And don’t touch things which%vp~
Are vile, disgusting, and forbidden to touch%u@[%u@h%u@],%vp~
And I will receive you and take you in,%vp~
%u@1%u@8And I will be a Father to you,%vp~
And you will be sons and daughters to Me,”%vp~
Says the Lord Almighty.%vp~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@v%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g. Ref. note of Matt. 18:6.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h…Or: [%i@t%i@h%i@e] %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h [with the definite article before %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d inferred]%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@m%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@s. A metaphor.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%I@W%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@g%i@a%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@g%i@u%i@e…Lit: %I@O%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@D%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l…Lit: %I@B%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@a%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@g%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@b%i@i%i@d%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@u%i@c%i@h…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%fn~
%i@%sb~
2 Cor. Chapter 7%hb~
          %u@1So having these promises %I@I%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w, beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all defilement of flesh (i.e., of carnality) and spirit%u@[%U@A%u@], while bringing holiness to perfection in the deep reverence—downright fear—of God.%vn~
          %u@2Accomodate us: we haven’t wronged anyone, ruined anyone, or taken advantage of anyone. %u@3I’m not pointing any fingers%u@[%u@a%u@]; in fact I’ve stated before that you are in our hearts for the rest of our lives, until death do us part. %u@4It’s a lot for me to be blunt with you, a lot for me to talk about you with pride. I’ve reached the point where I’m full of encouragement and comfort; I’m way overjoyed every time we’re faced with a really bad situation.%vn~
          %u@5In fact, not once after arriving in Macedonia did our %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@y%i@ bodies get a chance to rest, uh-uh…all kinds of pressure…on the%i@ outside %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@ conflict, on the inside fear. %u@6In contrast, God was the One Who encouraged us the abased by %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ Titus show up. %u@7Not just %i@b%i@y%i@ him showing up, but by the encouragement, comfort, and advise he %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d on us, relaying to us your longing, your grieving, your fervency you have regarding me, resulting in it giving me all the more joy.%vn~
          %u@8Even if I hurt you %i@b%i@y %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ in the %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ letter, I have no regrets; even if I had regrets (for I see that that letter did cause you pain for %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e time), %u@9I’m glad now, not because you were %i@s%i@i%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@y%i@ hurt, but rather that the pain that you suffered resulted in a change of heart and of actions%u@[%u@b%u@]. In fact, you were hurt God’s way, so you suffered no loss %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e. %u@1%u@0You see, being hurt (hurt intentionally in a way that you suffer pain) God’s way effects a change of heart and actions working towards the end goal of dodging a bullet%u@[%u@c%u@] and having no regrets about %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ to accomplish that; the pain that the world (i.e., those outside of Christ) experiences works in a way that, when it’s run its course, results in death (i.e., a stagnation of waste, joylessness, futility, destruction, and ultimately physical death).%vn~
          %u@1%u@1While I’m on this topic, this very thing—being%u@[%u@d%u@] hurt God’s way—look how much it accomplished in you and what a priority you made it. %I@F%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ instead is a rebuttal—instead %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ indignation, fear, longing, fervency, and self-vindication. In everything you demonstrated to everyone that you’re cleared of these matters%u@[%u@e%u@]. %u@1%u@2So now, that I’m even writing to you %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l, %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@o because of %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ did wrong or because of %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ wrong done %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@u%i@s, rather because of the priority and urgency at which you’ve made the things %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@f%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ you with before God materialize. %u@1%u@3We’ve been encouraged by this.%vn~
      On the subject of what’s been an encouragement to us, %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@w%i@s%i@ that Titus is happy gave me even more joy, since his spirit was refreshed by you all. %u@1%u@4I had told him a thing or two about you, telling him how proud I am of you, and I wasn’t disappointed or embarrassed. On the contrary—as we’ve always been truthful with you when we’ve talked to you, in the same vein our speaking with pride %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u to Titus turned out to be true as well. %u@1%u@5The tender affection he has for you is that much more when recalling every time you did as you were told, as you received him with fear and trembling%u@[%u@f%u@]. %u@1%u@6I rejoice since I have confidence in you in every respect.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@r%i@s…Lit: %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@m%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@d%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@t…Or: %i@e%i@s%i@c%i@a%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@v%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@n%i@o%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@f%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g…A biblical expression (Ps. 55:5; Eph. 6:5; Phil 2:12 for example)%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@f%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@(%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@)%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…A metaphor which compares the water purification rituals specified by the Law of Moses which the Jews had to do on a regular basis to a self-cleansing of the things inside a person which are not holy.%fn~
%i@%sb~
2 Cor. Chapter 8%hb~
          %u@1Just wanted you to know%u@[%u@a%u@], comrades%u@[%u@b%u@], %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ the grace of God that’s been granted to the churches in Macedonia, %u@2that in such a severe trial brought on by distress, the abundance of their joy and the vast extent of their poverty%u@[%u@c%u@]%u@[%U@A%u@] amplified the richness of their generosity— %u@3that according to their means—I swear—even beyond their means—%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ of their own free accord— %u@4with a good deal of explanations, assurances, and exhortation %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ asking us to do them a favor and %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ participate in ministering to the saints (i.e., their fellow believers).%vn~
          %u@5And %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ just %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ the way%i@ we expected%u@[%u@d%u@] %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d—no—by the will of God they first dedicated themselves to the Lord and to us, %u@6resulting in us having encouraged Titus to finish off this favor, which is being done for you in a consistent manner to how he started it. %u@7That aside, just as you continuously take everything to a new level%u@[%u@e%u@]—faith, attestation%u@[%u@f%u@], knowledge and understanding, eager diligence, and the love which came out of us %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ in you%u@[%u@g%u@]—%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ so that you would take this act of charity to the next level as well.%vn~
          %u@8What I’m saying shouldn’t be construed as an order, but certainly as a test%u@[%u@h%u@] of the authenticity of your love by the zeal which motivates others. %u@9In fact you know the act of charity of our Lord Jesus Christ, that he, being rich, became poor for your sake so that by that impoverishment you would become rich. %u@1%u@0I’ll give you my opinion on this %i@t%i@o%i@p%i@i%i@c: this benefits you, you the very ones who, beginning last year %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@u%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@h, didn’t just begin to tackle this but maintained the desire to do it.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1But now complete the doing-part as well, so that just as the enthusiasm of the wanting-part %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ so the completion %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ from the what-do-we-possess-part is the %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@l consequence %i@o%i@f %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@. %u@1%u@2For if the enthusiasm’s in place, %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ is acceptable according to whatever wealth and belongings that person happens to possess, not according to what he doesn’t possess. %u@1%u@3You see, this isn’t so that others can take it easy while you’re subjected to hardship, but %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ out of equality. %u@1%u@4The way things stand at the moment, your abundance %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ towards their lack so that equality would take shape, %u@1%u@5just as it’s written,%vn~
%si~
He who has much didn’t have a surplus%vp~
And he who has a little didn’t lack%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@6But God is so kind%u@[%u@i%u@]: for our sake He’s putting the same eagerness %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@b%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e in Titus’s heart, %u@1%u@7since, while—yes—he took the counsel, advise, and encouragement that was given to him to heart, but, being more eager than ever, of his own volition he left on a trip to visit you. %u@1%u@8We sent someone to go with him, the comrade who’s praised throughout all the churches in%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ the Gospel— %u@1%u@9not just %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@d%i@e but to be our travelling companion as well, hand-picked to be the churches’ attaché with respect to this act of charity, which is the service %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ by us to the glory of the Lord and %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ our enthusiasm.%vn~
          %u@2%u@0The intention is that no one would find fault with us in our handling of this generous %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t. %u@2%u@1In fact, we considered ahead of time what the decent thing to do would be, not just from the Lord’s perspective but also from the perspective of the average person. %u@2%u@2We sent our comrade along with the others, he who at many times and in many ways has proven to be eager, diligent, and to get things done without dragging his feet, but now is even more eager because of the tremendous confidence %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ in you.%vn~
          %u@2%u@3Whether %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ on behalf of Titus, my fellow worker and a mentor and assistant%u@[%U@B%u@] for you, or whether %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ our comrades the apostles of churches (i.e., those who are pioneers in founding churches; missionaries who establish churches), %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ glory %i@g%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ Christ. %u@2%u@4So the pointed demonstration of your love and of the tremendous things we tell them about you is taking place in full view of the churches.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w…Lit: %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@f%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@e%i@x%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@h%i@o%i@p%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@w%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@l…Lit: %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…The principle manuscripts are split here, with the others reading %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@u%i@s.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t…Or: %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n; %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@o%i@f%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d…Lit: %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h [or %i@t%i@o] %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@y…There is some ambiguity whether %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ refers to the Macedonians or to those whom they’re taking up a collection for.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@e%i@r. The two Gk. words for %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@e%i@r%i@,%i@ namely %i@k%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@o%i@n%i@o%i@s%i@ (κοινωνός /Strong’s 2844)and %i@s%i@u%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@g%i@o%i@s%i@ (συνεργός/Strong’s 4904), are both used in this verse, and the distinction between these words is apparent by the usage here. This distinction is not found in the lexicons.%fn~
%i@%sb~
2 Cor. Chapter 9%hb~
          %u@1As a matter of fact, I sure do have more to write to you concerning this ministry-drive for the saints (i.e., our fellow believers). %u@2You see, having observed you, I know your enthusiasm, an enthusiasm I speak proudly about to the Macedonians, %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@y that Achaia started making preparations a year ago and that your passion %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@j%i@e%i@c%i@t motivated a great many people%u@[%u@a%u@]%u@ there. %u@3I dispatched the comrades%u@[%u@b%u@] so that the tremendous things we say about you regarding this matter would not be for nothing, so that %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ just like I kept saying over and over again that you were making preparations— %u@4%i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s not as though the Macedonians and I were going to somehow get together and go and catch you unprepared%u@[%u@c%u@] and we—dare I say you too%u@[%u@d%u@]—would be embarrassed at what’s behind it all%u@[%u@e%u@].%vn~
          %u@5Anyways, to give the comrades encouragement was the most important thing to do, so that they would arrive in your locale ahead of time and put in order your pledged blessing (i.e., charitable contribution) ahead of time. These arrangements are %i@t%i@h%i@u%i@s %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@f%i@a%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e the way a blessing %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e and not the way a shakedown for money %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e.%vn~
          %u@6Now %i@o%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ this: he who sows parsimoniously also reaps parsimoniously and he who sows with a mindset of blessing %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ also reaps a blessing because of that mindset%u@[%u@f%u@]. %u@7%I@L%i@e%i@t %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g from each person %i@b%i@e%i@ according to what he decided in his heart beforehand, not out of an inner pain %i@o%i@f %i@r%i@e%i@g%i@r%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@y%i@ or out of compulsion, for God loves a cheerful, glad, happy, prompt-to-do giver. %u@8In fact God is able to proliferate all %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ grace (i.e., good things, in terms of money and material goods) to us, so that in all %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s always having enough of everything you would exude any and every good work%u@[%u@g%u@], %u@9just as it’s written:%vn~
%si~
He scattered, he gave to the needy%vp~
His righteousness remains %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ forever%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@0Now He who supplies seed to the sower and bread for the food that you eat%u@[%U@A%u@] will provide and multiply your seed and will cause the crop of your righteous endeavor to grow%u@[%u@h%u@], %u@1%u@1being made rich in all %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@s%i@, towards an ends of complete simplicity (i.e., a heart which has the single, simple motive of giving, and therefore has no ulterior motive, attaches no strings, and gives without any of the complications of guilt, remorse, etc.; does so under no threat, no compulsion, nor because of any rule, religious or otherwise), which through us works God’s praise to the nth degree, %u@1%u@2because the ministry %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@s of this religious ritual, this act of worship, this service to God, is not simply the supplying of the saints’ needs but also the causing of a multiplication-effect through much praise to God— %u@1%u@3Through the proof of this ministry, God has been glorified in the compliance with what you said you were going to do%u@[%u@i%u@] for the Good News of Christ, the Gospel, and the simplicity of the act of sharing with them and with everyone, %u@1%u@4and their prayer for you, longing for you on account of the exceeding grace of God %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s upon you.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5God is so kind%u@[%u@j%u@] with this indescribable gift of His!%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@y [%i@m%i@a%i@j%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y]%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@u%i@n%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@d…Or: %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@-%i@g%i@u%i@a%i@r%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@d%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@o…Lit: %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@“%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@”. The NASB renders this: %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e [or %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@g%i@i%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g; %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n; %i@c%i@o%i@r%i@e]. Appears to be an expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@w%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@s%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@p%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@e%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@t [i.e., %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@;%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f] %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@p%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@e%i@x%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k…Lit: %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@w…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s. A metaphor comparing the doing of a righteous deed to growing a crop.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o…Lit: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@f%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s…Lit: %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h [or %i@t%i@o] %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@d. the majority of one’s calories were derived from eating bread in ancient times. In the context of the writing of this epistle, therefore, bread was what people survived on (ref. Matt. 6:11). So saying that God will supply bread for food means that God will supply what you need to eat.%fn~
%i@%sb~
2 Cor. Chapter 10%hb~
          %u@1I, Paul, through the gentle restraint and kindness of Christ, who, %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %I@E%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h face-to-face with you was humble indeed, but audacious when away from you, beg you personally— %u@2but with the infusion of audacity which comes from not being present—I ask with confidence, which I figure makes me brash enough to confront some people who suppose that we live day in, day out%u@[%u@a%u@] according to the flesh (i.e. of our own ability apart from God; as though God doesn’t work through us). %u@3You see, %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h living day in, day out in flesh (i.e., in a physical body, one subject to human weaknesses), we don’t wage war according to the flesh: %u@4our battle-gear isn’t fleshly (i.e., of a physical nature; of our own ability apart from God)—uh-uh, it’s quite capable in God of leveling heavily-fortified defenses—leveling schemes, machinations, detailed plans, %u@5and every erected fortification or entrenched high-ground%u@[%u@b%u@] which opposes the knowledge and understanding of God, and capturing every thought and making it a prisoner of the obedience of Christ%u@[%U@A%u@], %u@6and of being prepared to avenge every disobedience, when your obedience happens to reach the tipping point.%vn~
          %u@7You’re seeing things as they appear on the surface%u@[%u@c%u@]. If a given person has convinced himself that he’s derived from Christ, let this fellow rethink the logic again as it applies to himself %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ that, just as he himself is derived from Christ, we also are %i@d%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ in the same way %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e. %u@8So now, if I venture to say something even more cocky about our authority (an authority which the Lord gave for building you up and not for tearing you down, %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y), I won’t embarrass myself and have to eat my words because I’ve failed in this regard%u@[%u@d%u@], %u@9%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ so that I not revel in delight%u@[%u@e%u@], as you might be scared out of your wits by %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ the letters. %u@1%u@0Since a few people say, “Sure—the letters cut to the bone and pack a punch%u@[%u@f%u@], but he comes across as weak when you see him in person and his speaking ability and rhetoric%u@[%u@g%u@] is contemptuous,” %u@1%u@1Let any such person %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ think this over: what we are in writing through the mail when absent, such we are in what we do when present as well.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2Furthermore, we dare not put ourselves in the same category as some of the self-promoters or compare ourselves to them—no—they get off to the side by themselves and rank themselves and do self-endorsements to one another%u@[%u@h%u@]—they just don’t get it. %u@1%u@3We’re not going to speak proudly or say tremendous things%u@[%u@i%u@] about the things outside our sphere %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@y%u@[%U@B%u@]—no—%i@w%i@e%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@d%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ within the sphere which the God of a limit %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@s assigned to us to envelop even you %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e. %u@1%u@4In fact, it’s not as though we don’t envelop you while extending our reach out to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ our%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ and beyond; you see, in the course of enveloping you %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@, we were the first to arrive in your locale with the Good News, the Gospel of Christ— %u@1%u@5%I@N%i@o%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ don’t speak proudly about things%i@ outside our sphere, %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ about the toils of others, but %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ hoping, as your faith which is among you is being grown, to vastly enlarge our sphere, %u@1%u@6%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ for places beyond you to be evangelized—%i@a%i@n%i@d not to speak proudly about %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@u%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f somebody else’s long-term plans%u@[%u@j%u@] taking place in his sphere, %u@1%u@7but %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@,%i@ ”He who speaks proudly, let him speak proudly %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ in the Lord.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@8You see, the person who promotes himself—that’s not the individual who obtains the approval %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d, rather the one whom the Lord speaks well of %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@a%i@l%i@ instead.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t…Lit: %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@-%i@g%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@r%i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e…Lit: %I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e. Note that the phrase %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ is used in v. 1 (%i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@-%i@t%i@o%i@-%i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e), although the meaning there appears to be different.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@r%i@d…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t…Lit: %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@c%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@h…Lit: %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g. The word %i@w%i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@y also appears in Matt. 23:23, being used the same way there.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@h%i@e%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@c…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@-%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s. The repetition of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ is a figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@d%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s…Also: %i@b%i@o%i@a%i@s%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@u%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@…%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@b%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t…The passage of vv. 3–6 is a metaphor comparing the Christian struggles in their faith to the mechanics of waging war.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@y…Lit: %i@s%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e. It’s not exactly clear to me what Paul is talking about in this passage, the passage consisting of vv. 13–16. Certain words have vague definitions and aren’t clarified by usage in other parts of the NT.%fn~
%i@%sb~
2 Cor. Chapter 11%hb~
          %u@1If you would bear with me a bit while I act stupid—scratch that: you are%i@ bearing with me. %u@2You see, I dote over you zealously%u@[%u@a%u@] with a zealous doting that’s of God, for I’ve betrothed you to %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ one man%u@[%u@b%u@] %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ to present %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ a chaste virgin in Christ. %u@3I fear that somehow that’s not the case—as the serpent deceived Eve with his cunning trickery, he would somehow seduce your minds %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ away from the simplicity%u@[%u@c%u@] (i.e., straightforward, without conniving, ulterior motives, hidden agendas, or religious quid-pro-quo) and the purity which has Christ as its goal.%vn~
          %u@4For indeed, if a passerby stops over and preaches %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ another %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@ Jesus, a person whom we didn’t preach %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s, or you receive (i.e., take to heart and wholeheartedly embrace) a different spirit which you didn’t receive %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e, or you wholeheartedly embrace%i@ a different good-news-%i@t%i@y%i@p%i@e message that you didn’t receive%u@[%u@d%u@], you tolerate it with no qualms. %u@5You see, the way I figure, we’re not inferior to these %i@s%i@o%i@-%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d super-apostles in any category. %u@6But even if I’m an amateur when it comes to speaking ability and rhetoric%u@[%u@e%u@], put that aside—%I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@u%i@r when it comes to knowledge and understanding—no—I’ve made that apparent to you in every possible way%u@[%u@f%u@].%vn~
          %u@7Is it that I committed a sin in humbling and debasing myself so that you would be made to stand on two legs%u@[%u@g%u@], since I evangelized the good news of the Gospel to you sacrificially on my part and delivered it to you free of charge? %u@8Scratch that—I robbed %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ churches by drawing a wage %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ and applying it to your ministry. %u@9Not only that, when I was staying with you and was in need, I wasn’t a burden to anyone: the comrades%u@[%u@h%u@] who came from Macedonia provided what I needed. My living expenses weren’t a burden in any way to you, nor will they be. %u@1%u@0Christ in me unequivocally indicates that this is true%u@[%u@i%u@]: I won’t be denied the opportunity to speak with pride %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ in the region of Achaia%u@[%u@j%u@]. %u@1%u@1Why would %I@I%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@n%i@i%i@e%i@d? Because I don’t love you? God knows for a fact %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@d%i@o.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2What I’m doing I’ll continue to do in order to nix the occasion %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@-%i@f%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ by those who are wanting %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ an occasion, so that in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@ that they’re boasting of, everyone will come to the conclusion%u@[%u@k%u@] that they’re also like us. %u@1%u@3In fact, false apostles such as they, workers of deceit, are disguising themselves as apostles of Christ— %u@1%u@4And it’s not surprising: Satan himself disguises himself as an angel of light. %u@1%u@5So there’s not a huge %i@d%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e if his servants %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@s also disguise themselves as servants of righteousness. The way it ends for %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ will be in step with their deeds.%u@[%u@l%u@]%vn~
          %u@1%u@6Moving on to another topic.%u@[%u@m%u@] Nobody should take me for a fool, but should it be otherwise, accept me even as a fool, so that even %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@l%i@ I have some little thing %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@w%i@o to say about my tremendous %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s. %u@1%u@7What I’m about to say isn’t in line with how the Lord speaks, but are words you’d expect to come out of one in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ folly—the essence of the boasting %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8Since many are talking up great things they’ve done according to flesh (i.e., from their own ability apart from God; taking credit for it personally and not giving God the credit), I’ll talk up my tremendous accomplishments too. %u@1%u@9The fact of the matter is, you’re more than happy to tolerate what the fools spout off,%i@ treating them like they’re%i@ sensible and wise%u@[%U@A%u@]. %u@2%u@0You put up with someone if he subjugates and oppresses you, if he cheats you out of house and home, if he sets you up to take advantage of you, if he lifts %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ up %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@r%i@o%i@g%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e, if he slaps you upside the head%u@[%U@B%u@]. %u@2%u@1I’m ashamed to say it, %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ as though %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@d%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@s because we’ve become weak in what someone %i@e%i@l%i@s%i@e might dare %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@d%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t.%vn~
      I’m talking foolishly, but I’ll dare speak %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@s. %u@2%u@2Are they native-Hebrew speakers and live by the ancient Jewish culture?—So do I. Are they Israelites?—So am I. Are they father-to-son direct descendants and heirs of%u@[%u@n%u@] Abraham?—So am I. %u@2%u@3Are they Christ’s servants (I’m talking like a mad man)?—I’ll up them one: as far as hard labor goes, I’ve done more. I’ve spent more time in prison. I’ve received more beatings. I’ve had more near-death experiences: %u@2%u@4I’ve received the thirty-nine lash %i@p%i@u%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ by the Jews five times; %u@2%u@5I’ve been beaten with staffs three times; I was stoned %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ once; I was shipwrecked three times; I spent twenty-four straight hours floundering out in the ocean%u@[%u@o%u@]. %u@2%u@6I’ve been on the road many a time %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@s; I’ve been in danger while travelling by river; in danger from robbers; in danger by my fellow countrymen; in danger by those in faraway countries; in danger in the city; in danger in the countryside; in danger on the high seas; in danger from phony comrades; %u@2%u@7I worked hard, long hours and did heavy manual labor; had many a sleepless night; went long stretches with nothing to eat or nothing to drink; fasted many times; was cold because I had nothing to wear%u@[%u@p%u@]— %u@2%u@8Besides those external %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@s, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ the %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ the day-to-day responsibility for all the churches, worrying over them. %u@2%u@9Who’s weak (i.e., sickly, frail, or simply unable to muster the strength to face life’s challenges), and I’m not weak %i@a%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m? Who stumbles%u@[%u@q%u@] (i.e. falls away from the walk of faith; falls into sin; is overcome by temptation; stops following God), and I’m not raving %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@t?%vn~
          %u@3%u@0If there has to be proud talk %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e, I’ll speak proudly about things that have to do with my weakness (i.e., circumstances in which I lacked the power in my own self to overcome the difficulties I faced). %u@3%u@1The God and Father of our Lord Jesus—He Who’s blessed forevermore—knows for a fact that I’m not lying— %u@3%u@2In Damascus the governor under King Aretas kept the %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ city of Damascus on alert searching for me in order to arrest me, %u@3%u@3and I was %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ through%i@ a window in the %i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ wall and lowered to the ground in a basket and slipped out of his hands.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@z%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y…Also%i@:%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@j%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@n…Also: %i@h%i@u%i@s%i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@s%i@i%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y…Same word used in 9:11; ref. back to that usage%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e…Paul uses two different Gk. words for %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ [%i@l%i@a%i@m%i@b%i@a%i@n%i@ō%i@,%i@ (λαμβάνω/Strong’s 2983) and %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@h%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@i, (δέχομαι/Strong’s 1209)] in this clause; the subtle distinction between the two can be gleaned from the usage here.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@h%i@e%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@c…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%fn~

%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@i%i@v%i@o%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e…Lit: %I@I%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@n%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@u%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@g%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@A%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@i%i@a…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@g%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@A%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@i%i@a. Assumption is that the boasting Paul speaks of refers to 10:17.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@e%i@p%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@s…Lit: %I@T%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%I@M%i@o%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@p%i@i%i@c…Lit: %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k [%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k so as to convey reasoning and logic]%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@f%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@-%i@t%i@o%i@-%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@f%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@c%i@e%i@a%i@n…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@e%i@p%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@r…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@d%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s. A hendiadys; ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@s…Ref. note of Matt. 18:9%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@s%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e. There’s ambiguity as to what the antecedent of the participle phrase %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ refers to. Who’s Paul saying is sensible, the Corinthians or the fools (the false apostles)? It appears the latter is the case. But this is not an isolated case in the NT where there’s such antecedent-ambiguity with a participle phrase (and participle phrases dangle by nature). English has this problem also, but it’s more acute in Gk.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@s%i@u%i@b%i@j%i@u%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@r%i@o%i@g%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@l%i@a%i@p%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d…Lit: %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@s%i@l%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@;%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@v%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@ [%i@r%i@e%i@f%i@.%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@r%i@k%i@ %i@1%i@2%i@:%i@4%i@0]%i@;%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@ [%i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r]%i@;%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@;%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e. These are hyperboles to a greater or lesser extent.%fn~
%i@%sb~
2 Cor. Chapter 12%hb~
          %u@1To talk with pride about %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ spectacular things %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@ must %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e. While this won’t help anyone, I’ll jump into%u@[%u@b%u@] visions and revelations of the Lord anyways. %u@2From firsthand experience, I know %i@o%i@f%i@ a man in Christ fourteen years earlier, and said-person was seized and carried off (whether %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ outside of the body %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@,%i@ I don’t know—%i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ God knows) until %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@d the third heaven%u@[%U@A%u@] (i.e., went through the first and second heavens, which are the sky, the upper atmosphere, and outer space, into the spirit world: “paradise”). %u@3And I know said-person (whether in the body or apart from the body, I don’t know—%i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ God knows), %u@4that he was seized and carried off into paradise and heard remarks that must not be told, that are not allowed to be spoken to a person.%vn~
          %u@5I’ll talk big on behalf of said-man and talk about the spectacular things %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@,%i@ but I won’t talk big about myself except in the weaknesses %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h. %u@6You see, if I were to want to talk big, I won’t be acting like a fool %i@a%i@s%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k: in fact, I’d be telling the truth. But I’ll spare you, lest someone make %i@i%i@n%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ assumptions%u@[%u@c%u@] based on what he sees or hears that comes from me %u@7and by means of the extraordinary nature of the revelations.%vn~
      With this in mind, so that I not be lifted up and over%u@[%U@B%u@] (i.e., leap over the hurdles of life), a “thorn in the flesh”%u@[%U@C%u@] (%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@d%i@i%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@g%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@x%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@u%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y) was given to me, an agent%u@[%u@d%u@] of Satan, so that he would buffet me (i.e., strike me repeatedly and non-stop), so that I not be lifted up and over. %u@8Because of this I begged the Lord three times that it be taken away from me, %u@9and he told me,%vn~
%si~
%R@M%r@y%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%R@I%r@@%R@I%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@g%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@f%r@f%r@i%r@c%r@i%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@%vp~
%R@F%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@c%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@%vp~
%R@I%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@D%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@0In light of this, I’m content in weakness, with insults, in dire need, with persecutions, and in distress on behalf of Christ: for when I’m weak, then I’m powerful and capable.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1I’ve turned into a fool; you drove me to it. The fact of the matter is that you ought to have a high opinion of me%u@[%u@e%u@]. I’m not deficient in any category when compared to the apostles as a whole, you see, even though I’m nothing. %u@1%u@2Indeed, the defining characteristics of an apostle%u@[%U@E%u@] were thoroughly put into action among you with steadfastness and perseverance at every turn, and with signs and wonders (i.e., spectacular, attention-getting miracles) and %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@ power. %u@1%u@3In fact how have you been treated worse than any of the other churches, except that I didn’t wear out my welcome%u@[%u@f%u@] with you? Excuse this bad behavior on my part.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4Hey, this is the third time I’ve made preparations to go visit you, and I’ll not wear out my welcome: I’m not trying to get your %i@m%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s, I’m trying to get you instead. You see, the children %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@l%i@y%i@ aren’t obligated to pay for%u@[%u@g%u@] their parents %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@o%i@m%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@e%i@t%i@c%i@., but the parents are for their children. %u@1%u@5I will most gladly spend on you—you who are vivacious in thought and emotion%u@[%u@h%u@]—and be spent for you…although the more I love you, the less I’m loved.%vn~
          %u@1%u@6But %I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ let %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t be. I wasn’t a burden to you; instead—the clever fellow that I am—I pulled a fast one on you%u@[%u@i%u@]. %u@1%u@7Of all the people I sent you, whom did %I@I%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ to take advantage of you with and milk you for gain? %u@1%u@8I asked Titus %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ and the comrade %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ to accompany him—did Titus take advantage of you? Have we not conducted our lives in the same spirit (i.e., in the same attitude, led by the same prevailing demeanor)? Have we not followed in the same footsteps?%vn~
          %u@1%u@9So far you think we’ve %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ been telling you one excuse after another. %I@B%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@,%i@ we speak before God in Christ (i.e., knowing that God is listening closely, while relying on Christ to mediate); every last thing we do is for your edification, my dear %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s. %u@2%u@0The fact of the matters is that I’m afraid that somehow I’ll come %i@v%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ and find that you’re not the way that I want and expect you to be, and vice-versa; that somehow %I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@d there’s rivalry, jealousy, uncontrolled tempers, selfish ambition, bad-mouthing, gossip, arrogance, or havoc being wreaked. %u@2%u@1%I@I%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ go there again and %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e God humiliate me with you and %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ to mourn much%u@[%u@j%u@] (i.e., to pray deep, heart-felt prayers of grieving and sorrow; to be in a melancholy state of grief, pain, and sorrow) over sins you have previously committed and have no intention of asking God to forgive you of these things and quitting them—you have no intention of doing anything about them—when it comes to the uncleanness (i.e., lewd, crude, disgusting behavior), fornication (i.e., loose sexual morals), and licentiousness (i.e., unrestrained indulgence in immoral, physical pleasures) which you have practiced.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%I@T%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@a%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@m%i@p%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o…Lit: %I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@o [or %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o]. Appears to be an expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s…Lit: %i@f%i@i%i@g%i@u%i@r%i@e; %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@k%i@o%i@n%i@;%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@t…Also: %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l. See usage in Luke 9:52; Rev. 2:1.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@w%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@;%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s. Like storing provisions in anticipation of winter.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@—%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@v%i@a%i@c%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@m%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@—%I@I%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@n%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@m%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@…Ref. Matt. 5:4; 1 Cor. 5:2%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n…The ancients had a different view of the universe than we do, and they assumed that the spiritual world, which includes heaven itself, is simply a layer on top of another layer. So the Gk. word%i@ for %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ conflates a couple of concepts we do not. The first of the “heavens” is the sky above. The second heaven-layer, being above that of course, is where the sun, the moon, and the stars exist. We call it outer-space, but they assumed that these astronomical objects were closer to the earth than they actually are. They assumed that the sun travelled across the sky each day in the second “heaven.” So the third heaven is the layer above the second, but since the second includes all physical objects (and from our perspective extends to the far reaches of the universe), the third layer steps into the spirit-world. Now, is this spirit-world heaven as we know it? Paul calls it %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@ in v.4, so it may be. Ref. notes of John 3:3; 1 Pet. 1:5.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r…This is rendered word-for-word. It’s used as a metaphor.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]”%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h”…This is an idiom from the OT, appearing in Num. 23:55; Josh. 23:13; Judg. 2:3; Ezek. 28:24. Since it is an idiom, it should not be taken literally; and indeed, it is not used literally in any of the aforementioned references. This idiom was originally used to describe the vexation which came from the enemy nations which surrounded Israel. In fact, Paul goes on to state exactly what this idiom refers to in an appositive phrase a few words after: it is an “agent of Satan.” Furthermore, this verse doesn’t say that God gave Paul a thorn in the flesh, rather the passive voice of “was given” is used, thereby not specifying the subject, the one doing the giving.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@w%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s…Lit: %i@a%i@s%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@i%i@a (the Gk. word for %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s).%i@ %I@A%i@s%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@i%i@a%i@ (ἀσθένεια/Strong’s 769)at times means sickness (Luke 10:9 for example), but at other times means weakness as the English word suggests. When asthenia is used to mean sickness, it refers to a prolonged, undiagnosed ailment which lasts for a long time and causes a person to become weak. The context determines whether this refers to a physical ailment or not. In addition, asthenia is used a few times starting from the 10%u@t%u@h chapter until this verse, and nowhere in those occurrences does it conclusively refer to a sickness of some sort. To cap it off, v. 10 says “for when I’m weak,” where “weak” summarizes the words before it, which are “insults, dire need, persecutions, and circumstances of distress”—none of which are a sickness of any sort. This implies that the insults, dire need, persecutions, and circumstances of distress are Paul’s weakness.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@f%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e. Although this translation often renders %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@ as %i@m%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@r%i@y, the complete definition of an apostle also includes what Paul says here, namely that a true apostle performs signs and wonders. Likewise, to be considered an evangelist according to the strictest biblical definition, one must perform miracles, healings, or something of a supernatural nature. This is because Philip (Acts 21:8) is the only evangelist that the NT identifies by name, so his example must serve as the archetype for all evangelists. In other words, since Philip performed miracles, and Philip is the only evangelist in the Bible, all evangelists must perform miracles in order to conform to the strictest definition laid down by Acts 21.%fn~
%i@%sb~
2 Cor. Chapter 13%hb~
          %u@1This’ll be the third time I’ll visit you.%vn~
%si~
%I@B%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ upon %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m the mouth%vp~
Of two or%u@[%u@a%u@] %i@b%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@e%i@t three witnesses%vp~
Will every affair %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n be settled%u@[%u@b%u@]%vp~
%si~
          %u@2I have said earlier and am telling those who’ve sinned up to now and everyone else for future reference (%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ as though %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ present for the second time and leaving just now) that if I were to go %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ another time, I won’t hold anything back, %u@3since you’re looking for proof of Christ speaking in me—%I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ who isn’t weak when it comes to you%u@[%u@c%u@], but rather is able, capable, and powerful in you. %u@4The fact of the matter is, he was crucified out of weakness, but he lives out of power from God. The fact of the matter is, even we are weak in him, but we shall live jointly with him out of %i@t%i@h%i@e power of God %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ to you.%vn~
          %u@5If you are in the Faith, test for yourselves—prove to yourselves %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s: don’t you recognize as far as your own selves are concerned—don’t you know full-well that Christ Jesus %i@i%i@s%i@ in you and among you?—Unless of course you fail the test. %u@6But I hope you’ll come to recognize that we don’t fail the test.%vn~
