          %u@7We pray to God for you to no longer do %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s bad—not so that everyone would see that we were right all along, but that you would do what’s good instead. %u@8You see, we don’t have the strength to do a thing contrary to the truth, but instead %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@g%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ for the truth. %u@9You see, we rejoice when we happen to be weak, but you happen to have strength. This is what we pray in addition: %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@ for you to reach maturity.%vn~
          %u@1%u@0Because of this, I write these words while absent, so that when I get there and am staying with you, I won’t be using the authority which the Lord assigned to me in a harsh manner, %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ for edification and not %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d destructively.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1One last thing, comrades%u@[%u@d%u@]: rejoice, mend your ways, be comforted and encouraged, stay in agreement%u@[%u@e%u@], live in peace, and the God of that wonderful, peaceful love%u@[%u@f%u@] will be with you.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2Give each other a holy hug%u@[%u@g%u@] from me.%vn~
      All the saints (i.e., your fellow believers in all the churches) greet you.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, the love of God, and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit %i@b%i@e%i@ with you all.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@a%i@n%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@i%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@,%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@v%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@e. A hendiadys; ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@g…Lit: %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@s%i@s. Liberties taken.%fn~

Galatians%ha~
       After Paul’s usual long-winded introduction, he curtly states the reason he’s writing, namely that the Galatians have abandoned the Gospel for some other gospel. This is the subject of the book. The issue at hand was whether a person could believe in Jesus directly without the additional constraint of becoming Jewish and following all the requirements found in the Law of Moses. An important aspect of Paul’s message was that one could believe in Jesus and remain a Gentile. This in fact is the definition of Christianity as qualified by the New Testament, and equipped with this teaching, Paul went about spreading Christianity throughout the Roman Empire.%nv~
       But there remained a faction of Jews who, though they accepted Jesus as the Messiah and believed in him, insisted that adherence to the practices of Judaism was necessary, and therefore rejected Christianity as defined as believing in Jesus without having to follow Jewish practices. The Book of Galatians is Paul refuting and thwarting this heresy. Had he not done so, Christianity as we know it might have died off in the first century.%nv~
       Galatians is Paul’s thesis of why the Gentiles have access to the promises of God, and not just the Jews. Paul demonstrates that this was God’s plan all along, that the Old Testament promises that this will one day take place, that faith is—and always was—the key to accessing justification, that the Law of Moses is just one step in God’s long-term plan for mankind, that it was at best a stop-gap anyways and at worst an obstacle if approached apart from faith. If Judaism were a house, then Christianity would be an addition built on top of it.%nv~
       Most of the Greek text is simpler than—say—2 Corinthians, about on par with Romans, but there a few passages which are tricky (4:12–16 for one). The subject material can be difficult to grasp, but once understood, it comes together into a nice, logical framework.%nv~
%i@%sb~
Galatians Chapter 1%hb~
          %u@1%I@F%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ the Apostle (i.e., missionary; pioneer of new churches; worker of miracles%u@[%u@a%u@]) Paul, who’s not an apostle %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ from human agency nor %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ through human agency but through Jesus Christ and God, the Father Who raised him from the dead, %u@2and %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m those who are together with me—not just physically but are joint participants in my endeavors—%i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@y all %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ comrades%u@[%u@b%u@]:%vn~
      To the churches of Galatia:%vn~
          %u@3Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ, %u@4who gave his own self for our sins, and gave himself so he could yank us out of this evil day-and-age we live in, according to the will of our God and Father: %u@5to Him %i@b%i@e%i@ the glory forever and ever (and let us pause a moment for that to sink in%u@[%u@c%u@]):%vn~
          %u@6I’m astounded that you’re setting aside and replacing %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@l%i@ %i@(%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@-%i@n%i@e%i@w%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@)%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ from the One Who called us (i.e., summoned us to believe) by %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ grace of Christ in exchange for another %i@s%i@o%i@-%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ gospel— %u@7not that there’s another gospel %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d—%i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@ except %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ there are certain individuals among you who are trouble-makers, wanting to distort the Gospel, the message of what Christ did. %u@8Never mind that for a moment: if even we or an angel %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n from heaven were to evangelize to you something different than what we evangelized to you, let him be accursed. %u@9I said it before and I’ll say it again: if someone evangelizes you with something different than what you received and took to heart already, let him be accursed.%vn~
          %u@1%u@0Furthermore, am I trying to win people or God over to my side now? Or am I %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ trying to please people? If I was still going about pleasing people, I wouldn’t be a slave of Christ.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1Just to let you know, comrades, the Gospel which was evangelized by me: it’s not a man-made contrivance%u@[%u@d%u@], %u@1%u@2nor were we taught it %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e, but rather %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ through a Jesus Christ-revelation.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3In fact, you heard about the way I used to live back then when I lived as a %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@ Jew, that I was caught up in persecuting God’s church to an inordinate degree and in wreaking havoc on it, %u@1%u@4and I was getting deeper and deeper%u@[%u@e%u@] into %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f Judaism, well beyond many of my peers, as I had become even more fanatical about all the man-made rules and regulations that were passed down to me from my ancestors. %u@1%u@5But when God, Who set me apart from the time I was in my mother’s womb and called me through His grace, was pleased %u@1%u@6to reveal His son in me so I’d evangelize him to the Gentiles, I didn’t drop everything I was doing and see what the experts had to say about it%u@[%u@f%u@], %u@1%u@7nor did I go down%u@[%u@g%u@] to Jerusalem to %i@s%i@e%i@c%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ the founding apostles%u@[%U@A%u@], %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@f%i@a%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@, but went over to Arabia instead and returned to Damascus.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8Then after three years I went down to Jerusalem to visit Peter and stayed with him for fifteen days. %u@1%u@9But I didn’t see the other apostles except for the Lord’s brother James. %u@2%u@0(What I’m writing here for you—look—I swear to God I’m not lying.) %u@2%u@1Then I went to the districts of Syria and Cilicia. %u@2%u@2But I had no direct interaction or encounter with%u@[%u@h%u@] the special assemblies%u@[%u@i%u@] of Judea who are in Christ, %u@2%u@3and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ only %i@i%i@n%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t they kept hearing that the guy who was persecuting them before is now evangelizing the Faith which he was wreaking havoc on, %u@2%u@4and they glorified the God %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@s with me.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@s…Ref. 2 Cor. 12:12%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@.%i@ Ref. note of Rev. 19:4.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@-%i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@d. %I@F%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@d is a NT idiom (ref. Matt. 16:17; 1 Cor. 15:50), and it refers to the best that human reasoning, ability, etc. can bring to bear on the issue at hand.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n…Lit: %i@u%i@p%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@c%i@h%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@s. Using the literal meaning of %i@c%i@h%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@,%i@ which is those who are called out, as Paul seems to think there are other “special congregations” of those who aren’t believers in Christ.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e. In ancient Jewish culture, the default leadership structure was one of seniority, hence the elders of the Sanhedrin. In keeping with this, the original apostles would outrank Paul in seniority, and by this human reasoning, Paul should’ve submitted to them. But that wasn’t God’s plan.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Galatians Chapter 2%hb~
          %u@1Then after spending fourteen years %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y, I went back down to Jerusalem with Barnabas, taking Titus along as well. %u@2I went down there %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@s%i@s %i@m%i@y conformance %i@t%i@o a revelation, and laid out in front of them the glad-tidings message—the Gospel—which I preach among the Gentiles. But %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s in private to those who’re considered to be the leading figures %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t, lest somehow all of this be a huge waste of time on my part%u@[%u@a%u@]—and has been all along. %u@3No, uh-uh—not even my companion Titus was required to be circumcised (%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@r%i@c%i@u%i@m%i@c%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@o%i@p%i@t%i@s%i@ %I@J%i@u%i@d%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@g%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@r%i@i%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s), seeing that he’s Greek (i.e., a Westerner, far from being Jewish).%vn~
          %u@4But because of the bogus comrades%u@[%u@b%u@] who infiltrated %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t, those in particular who slipped in under the radar to gain intelligence about the freedom which we possess in Christ Jesus, those whose aim is to enslave us— %u@5We didn’t knuckle under%u@[%u@c%u@] to them for even a moment%u@[%u@d%u@], so that the truth of the Gospel remain in effect with us. %u@6But %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ from those who are considered to be of some importance—just how important they were makes no difference to me: God doesn’t give a hoot about a person’s status, outward appearance, or public persona%u@[%u@e%u@]—in fact, the important people don’t score any points with me %i@s%i@i%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@“%i@i%i@m%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@”%i@…%vn~
          %u@7—Enough of that.%vn~
      On the contrary seeing that I had been entrusted with the Gospel of uncircumcision (i.e., the glad-tidings message that one can come to God through Christ as a Gentile without converting to Judaism and without following the Jewish rules and traditions) just as Peter%u@[%U@A%u@] %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@l%i@ of circumcision (i.e., the glad-tidings message to the Jews that the Messiah promised by the Old Testament has come in the person of Jesus Christ), %u@8%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ in this regard he who’s been active in Peter for %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e an apostle of the circumcised is also active for %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ to the Gentiles. %u@9Recognizing and understanding the grace (i.e., the special gift and calling given to me, and not earned by me) that was given to me, James, Peter, and John (those considered to be the key players and head honchos%u@[%u@f%u@]) were in total agreement with us giving their unequivocal endorsement and full support%u@[%u@g%u@] to me and Barnabas, so that we %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ to the Gentile and they to the circumcised (i.e., the Jews). %u@1%u@0They only %i@a%i@s%i@k%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ remember the poor, the very same thing I too had been eager to get done.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1Now when Peter came to Antioch, I confronted him point-blank because he was in the wrong. %u@1%u@2You see, prior to when select individuals from %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ James’s %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ arrived, he partook of meals with the Gentiles, but when they arrived, he withdrew %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@s and kept himself at a distance %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%u@[%U@B%u@], fearing those from the circumcision (i.e., those who believe that one must obey the Law of Moses and adopt Jewish rules and restrictions in order to be accepted by God; those who say that believing in Christ but not following the Law is not acceptable to God). %u@1%u@3The other Jews joined him in his hypocrisy, so that even Barnabas was caught up%u@[%u@h%u@] in the hypocrisy…%vn~
          %u@1%u@4—Not a chance.%vn~
      When I saw that he was disingenuous about the truth of the Gospel, I told Peter in front of everybody, “If you being a Jew live as a Gentile and not as a Jew, how can you get away with%u@[%u@i%u@] requiring that the Gentiles be Jewish?”%vn~
          %u@1%u@5”We ourselves are Jews by nature and not sinners from%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@r%i@-%i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y, Gentile nations%u@[%U@C%u@], %u@1%u@6having reached the point where we know for certain that a person isn’t justified (i.e., God examining a person’s righteousness like a judge would and declaring them to be righteous) as a result of works of law (i.e., obeying the commandments of the Law of Moses, or following the do’s and don’ts of any godly list of rules for that matter) if it happens to not be through Christ Jesus-faith. We believed in Christ Jesus so that we would be justified as a result of Christ-faith and not as a result of works of law, since all flesh (i.e., any human endeavor and all human effort apart from God) won’t be justified as a result of works of law. %u@1%u@7But if in the process of seeking justification in Christ, it’s been determined that even we are sinners, you can’t seriously believe that Christ has been delegated the responsibility of caring for and promoting sin%u@[%U@D%u@]?—No way%u@[%u@j%u@].%vn~
          %u@1%u@8”Furthermore, if I rebuild the things that I demolished, I demonstrate conclusively that I’m a transgressor. %u@1%u@9You see, because of law I died to law (i.e., because of the failure in trying to live up to the requirements of the Law of Moses—which can be said of any set of rules and not just the Law of Moses—and thereby earning righteousness, I ceased all attempts and completely severed myself from earning righteousness through the Law), so that I would live to God. I’ve been crucified in unison, in joint participation, with Christ; %u@2%u@0I no longer live, but Christ lives in me. What I now live in flesh (i.e., in my physical body, with my human ability, and in contention with my carnal nature), I live by faith for the son of God who loved me and gave himself for me. %u@2%u@1I’m not nullifying the grace of God: if %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ is justified through law, Christ really did die for nothing.“%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@n%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@i%i@n. An expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@b%i@o%i@g%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@k%i@n%i@u%i@c%i@k%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@y%i@i%i@e%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@j%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@;%i@ %i@y%i@i%i@e%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@e%i@k%i@l%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@r. Ref. note of Matt. 26:40.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@a…Lit: %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e [%i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t] %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@k%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@h%i@o%i@s…Lit: %i@p%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@i%i@v%i@o%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t…Lit: %i@g%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p. An idiom.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@p…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y…Lit: %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@P%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r…Note that in the GT Paul refers to him as %I@C%i@e%i@p%i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ in 1:18, but here and in v. 8 also he’s referred to as %I@P%i@e%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@ (Peter); in vv. 9,11 he’s %I@C%i@e%i@p%i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ again. Paul’s use of the name %I@P%i@e%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@ over %I@C%i@e%i@p%i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ is his acknowledgement of the authority given to him by Jesus himself, as he’s using the name Jesus gave to him. Paul’s use of %I@C%i@e%i@p%i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ is the recognition that Peter is a human like everyone else.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@w%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m…Jews were forbidden to mingle with Gentiles. He was a hypocrite because he had been sharing meals with the Gentiles prior to that.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@r%i@-%i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@,%i@ %I@G%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s…The assumption among Jews was that anyone who wasn’t Jewish was a de facto sinner, was unclean (despicable), and had no relationship with God—nor could they. Of course, the latter assertion, that a Gentile couldn’t have a relationship with God, is refuted by the OT itself in the persons of Rahab and Ruth. What Jesus said in Matt. 15:26 summarizes this preconception—but at the same time Jesus makes an exception for the Gentile Canaanite woman on account of her faith.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n. Note the Gk. word for %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@ is used here and not the Gk. word for %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t or %i@s%i@l%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@.%i@ A survey of the NT shows that a deacon is one who’s been entrusted with an area of responsibility. A servant or slave, on the other hand, follows orders.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Galatians Chapter 3%hb~
          %u@1Oh, brainless, short-sighted Galatians, who cast an evil spell over you%u@[%u@a%u@], you whom eye-witness accounts of Jesus Christ were previously written for, %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ being crucified? %u@2The only thing I want to ascertain from you is %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s: Did you receive the Spirit%u@[%U@A%u@] from the works of law (i.e., following the do’s and don’ts of the Law of Moses, or any other list of rules for that matter) or from hearing a particular message %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t of faith?%vn~
          %u@3You’re brainless this way. Having begun in spirit%u@[%u@b%u@] (i.e., living a spiritual life; a life where your regenerate, human spirit, one filled with fruit, dominates your carnal nature), are you now continuously improving yourselves%u@[%u@c%u@] in flesh (i.e., by your own ability apart from God; not living a spiritual life; trying to please God by adhering to the Law of Moses, Jewish tradition, or other rules)? %u@4%I@A%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ so far %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@ that you suffered %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ for nothing?—If you really was for nothing. %u@5So does he who supplies you with the Spirit and makes power (including supernatural power and the miraculous) happen in you do so from works of law or from a particular message you heard %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t of faith? %u@6It’s just like %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@, “Abraham had faith in God, and it was credited to him as righteousness.”%vn~
          %u@7You really need to understand that they %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ from %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f faith—those are the ones who are sons of Abraham (i.e., imitate and duplicate Abraham; carry on Abraham’s legacy). %u@8Now the Scriptures anticipated the justification (i.e. clearing of one’s record so he’s considered to be righteous) of the Gentiles %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ from %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ faith—Before it was made widely known, God announced the good news to Abraham, %i@t%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ that, “In you a blessing will be imparted to all the Gentiles,” %u@9so that they %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ from %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ faith are jointly blessed with Abraham by means of faith. %u@1%u@0You see, every last person without exception%u@[%u@d%u@] who %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n from works of law is subject to a curse because of what is written %i@i%i@n %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s:%i@ %i@%vn~
%si~
Cursed is everyone who doesn’t carry through%vp~
With accomplishing the doing of everything%vp~
Which has been written in the official, authoritative%vp~
Version of the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%u@[%U@B%u@]%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@1That no one is justified with God (i.e., has had God officially clear their record of wrong-doing and declared them to be righteous) by law (i.e., by an attempt to strictly follow the Law of Moses or by any list or rules, code of ethics, etc. for that matter) is obvious%u@[%u@e%u@], since %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@, “The righteous individual will live from %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t %i@o%i@f faith.” %u@1%u@2But the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ isn’t from %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ faith, but instead, “He who does the very things %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e shall live in them (i.e., shall live with the consequences one way or another).” %u@1%u@3Christ redeemed us from (i.e., got us out from under) the curse of the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ having become a curse for us (because it’s written, “Everyone who’s hung on a tree is accursed”) %u@1%u@4so that the blessing of Abraham would appear to the Gentiles in Christ Jesus, so that we’d receive the promise of the Spirit through the faith %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5Comrades%u@[%u@f%u@], let me state this in terms of human %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@w. If a person has gone ahead and had a will drawn up and has had it signed, witnessed, and notarized%u@[%u@g%u@], %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@e%i@,%i@ no one can void it, disregard it, or amend it by tacking an addendum onto it. %u@1%u@6Now the promises were given to Abraham and to his father-to-son direct descendant%u@[%u@h%u@]. %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t doesn’t say “and to his direct descendants” (in the plural) but “to his direct descendant” (in the singular) instead.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7What I’m getting at is this%u@[%u@i%u@]: A will was drafted, signed, witnessed, and notarized by God, one that can’t be invalidated by a law-code which came into being 430 years after %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d resulting in cancelling the promise. %u@1%u@8Along these same lines, if the %i@b%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@‘ inheritance were to be based on a law-code, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ it would no longer be based on a promise. But God, in an act of mercy and kindness, has granted %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ to Abraham by staking it on%i@ a promise.%vn~
          %u@1%u@9So where does the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ fit in %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s? It was added as an agency of grace and mercy which overlooks the transgressions %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@c%i@c%i@u%i@r, until the time when the father-to-son direct descendant happens to arrive, the one whom the promise was given to. %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ ordained, established, and set in order through angels %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@h%i@y%i@s%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ by the%i@ hand of a %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ intermediary %i@b%i@e%i@t%i@w%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@. %u@2%u@0But the intermediary is not one, but God is One%u@[%u@j%u@] (i.e., the intermediary isn’t an incomparable, all-wise, all-encompassing, single-minded being, one who is the end-all of everything, but God is just that).%vn~
          %u@2%u@1So is the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ compatible with the promises?—Don’t even think such a thought%u@[%u@k%u@]. You see, if a law-code which has the power to make a person alive was given, the righteousness %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ would actually be from a law-code. %u@2%u@2Not a chance—the Scripture locked every last thing%u@[%u@l%u@] down tight under sin so that the promise would be given from %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ faith to those who believe in Jesus Christ.%vn~
          %u@2%u@3Before the Faith came, we were kept under guard, locked down with the end-goal in mind of the revealing of faith which was on its way, %u@2%u@4done in a way that the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ has become our tutor with the end-goal of Christ in mind, so that we would be justified from %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ faith. %u@2%u@5%I@N%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ the Faith has come, we are no longer %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g under a tutor.%vn~
          %u@2%u@6The fact is that all of you are sons of God through the Faith %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s in Christ Jesus. %u@2%u@7In fact, without exception every last one of you%u@[%u@d%u@] who’s been baptized into Christ (i.e., has fully accepted and been initiated into Christ and the Christian faith) has put on Christ like they’ve put on a piece of clothing. %u@2%u@8There is neither Jew nor Westerner%u@[%u@m%u@], there is neither slave nor person freed from slavery, there is neither male nor female, for all of you are in Christ Jesus (i.e., are melded with Christ). %vn~
          %u@2%u@9Now if you %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ derived from%u@[%u@n%u@] Christ, you certainly are father-to-son direct descendants of Abraham, heirs according to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@u%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ promise %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@s.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…A metaphor%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…This doesn’t refer to the Holy Spirit per se, as the definite article is missing from %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t here but precedes %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ in vv. 2,5. (Nor is there a preceding preposition which might hide the article).%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@u%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@f%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@…%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@o%i@b%i@v%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s…Lit: %i@e%i@v%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d…Some liberties taken%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@f%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@-%i@t%i@o%i@-%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@W%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s…Lit: %I@N%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %I@O%i@n%i@e…Ref. note of James 2:19%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%I@D%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t…Lit: %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@s [%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s]. Common expression, used as a figure of speech, encompassing not just people but things%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%I@W%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@r…Lit: %I@G%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@k%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m…Lit: %i@o%i@f%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…Same wording used in John 20:22; Acts 8:15, 19; 19:2. Since what Jesus did in John 20:22 is a one-off where his disciples were born again at that moment, what Paul’s referring to here in Galatians is the baptism in the Holy Spirit, what’s in Acts 8:15, etc. This verse gives insight into how one receives the baptism of the Holy Spirit: it’s by “a particular message you heard from the vantage point of faith.”%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@o%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@r%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w. An expression used throughout the Bible (Josh. 1:8, 8:34; Heb. 10:7; 2 Kings 22:8,11; Deut. 31:26, etc.). This refers to the master scroll, the agreed-upon definitive copy, the original scroll of an ancient book, in this case the Law of Moses. It’s probable that, at least some of the time, it refers to the entire set of the Torah, not just one of its five scrolls. There was originally only one copy of the Torah, and as time went by, more copies were made, but there was only one copy (the “control copy”) which was considered the authoritative one, as the others were potentially flawed to a small degree. In addition to this meaning, %i@b%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w (scroll of the Law) also serves as a figure of speech which emphasizes the accuracy of a verse or passage which has been quoted and its authority as having come directly from the hand of God.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Galatians Chapter 4%hb~
          %u@1This is what I have to say: The heir %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e is a minor for a long but fixed time interval, %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ he’s %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ no differently than a %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ slave, while %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e being an owner of the estate. %u@2Anyways, he’s %i@k%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ a governess%u@[%u@a%u@] and a butler until the predetermined-date set by the %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@o%i@r%i@’%i@s%i@ father. %u@3The same thing applies to us: When we were minors, we were subject to the elementary principles of the world (i.e., subject to the premise of God accepting you based on how well you follow the list of do’s and don’ts%u@[%U@A%u@]), having reached the point where we were enslaved. %u@4But when the interval was up, God sent His son forth and from out of a woman he appeared %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d, and once he appeared he was subjected to a set of dictates in the form of the Law of Moses, %u@5so that he would redeem those (i.e., get them out from under) who are subjected to the Law, so that he would assume%u@[%u@b%u@] the authority and privileges entailed upon a son when he reaches adulthood. %u@6Since you’re sons, God sent forth the Spirit of his son into our hearts crying, “Papa%u@[%u@c%u@], Father!”, %u@7so that one%u@[%u@d%u@] is no longer a slave but a son; and if %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@s a son, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n %i@h%i@e%i@ too is an heir through God.%vn~
          %u@8Anyways, having not reached the point back then where you had a first-hand knowledge of God, as slaves you served things that don’t have God-like characteristics by nature. %u@9But knowing God now (or more %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@,%i@ being known by God) how is that you’re once again directing your main focus to the weak and poor elementary principles which you want to serve again from the top down? %u@1%u@0You observe %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@g%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ days, seasons, and years%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@y. %u@1%u@1I’m worried%u@[%u@e%u@] that all the hard work I invested%i@ in you was somehow for nothing.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2Put yourselves in my shoes, since I’m putting myself in your shoes, comrades%u@[%U@C%u@]; I’m asking you to do this. You didn’t do me any wrong or cause me any harm. %u@1%u@3But you know for a fact that I evangelized the Gospel to you a while back through %i@t%i@h%i@e weakness of the flesh (i.e., engulfed in the limitations inherent in all humans), %u@1%u@4and you didn’t despise nor disdain your testing%u@[%U@D%u@] in my flesh (i.e., it wasn’t beneath you to see if I would break under pressure while being pushed to the limits of my human abilities). That aside, you received me as though %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ an angel of God, as though %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e Christ Jesus. %u@1%u@5So where %i@i%i@s%i@ your blessing (i.e., why aren’t you wishing us well anymore)? In fact, I swear I’m telling you the truth, because, if possible, you plucked out your eyes and gave them to me%u@[%U@E%u@] (i.e., because, had it been possible, you would’ve forced me to agree with your point of view). %u@1%u@6So this means that I’ve become your enemy by telling you the truth?%vn~
          %u@1%u@7%I@T%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ are eager %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@t you, %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ they’re up to no good. Forget that—they wish to prevent you from%u@[%u@f%u@] %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h, so that you would be their devotees, their fan-boys. %u@1%u@8But it’s always good to be eagerly sought after %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@e%i@d in a positive way, and not just when I’m with you in person, %u@1%u@9my children, concerning whom I suffer labor pains again until such time that Christ be formed in you. %u@2%u@0I kept wanting just now to be with you in person and %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ to change my tone of voice %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u, since I don’t know what to make of you.%vn~
          %u@2%u@1Tell me, you who are wanting to follow the dictates of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s: haven’t you heard what the Law teaches%u@[%u@g%u@]? %u@2%u@2You see, it’s recorded %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ that Abraham had two sons, one from the female-slave and one from the free woman. %u@2%u@3Anyways, on the one hand he%u@[%u@h%u@] who was birthed from the female-slave was according to flesh (i.e., was brought into the world through Abraham’s human ability apart from God), but on the other hand he who was birthed from the free woman was %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d%i@ through %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@u%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ promise %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@s.%vn~
          %u@2%u@4These women are allegories: these %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@ are two covenants. One%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@i%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ from Mt. Sinai was born into slavery and is personified by Hagar. %u@2%u@5But Hagar/Mt. Sinai is in Arabia and corresponds to the present-day Jerusalem; she—Jerusalem—is serving as a slave along with the carbon-copies of herself which she’s spawned%u@[%u@i%u@].%vn~
          %u@2%u@6Now the Jerusalem above%u@[%U@F%u@], who’s our mother, the one who’s spawned us%u@[%u@j%u@], is free. %u@2%u@7In this regard, it’s written,%vn~
%si~
Rejoice, barren woman, who isn’t birthing children—%vp~
Let loose and cry out,%vp~
You woman who isn’t suffering labor pains,%vp~
Since the children of the free woman%vp~
%I@A%i@r%i@e more numerous%vp~
Than the one who%i@ has%vp~
%I@G%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ the husband%vp~
%si~
          %u@2%u@8But you, comrades, are children derived from promise according to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h Isaac. %u@2%u@9That aside, just as it was back then, that he who was born into this world according to flesh (i.e., according to a human attempt to accomplish something apart from God) persecuted he who was %i@b%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d%i@ according to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Spirit, it’s the same way now. %u@3%u@0Anyways, what does the Bible %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ say %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s?%vn~
%si~
Kick the female-servant and her son to the curb.%vp~
Fact is, there’s not a chance at all%vp~
That the son of the female-servant%vp~
Will split the inheritance%vp~
With the son of the free woman.%vp~
%si~
          %u@3%u@1In light of this, comrades, we are not the female-servant’s children but the free woman’s children instead.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@g%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s…Lit: %i@g%i@u%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@a%i@n. Some liberties taken.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%I@P%i@a%i@p%i@a…Lit: %I@A%i@b%i@b%i@a. Ref. note of Rom. 8:15.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@e…Lit: %i@y%i@o%i@u (singular). Paul always uses the plural form (an example is in v.6) of you in his letters when referring to the Galatians, Corinthians, etc. And also, Paul sometimes uses %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ (singular) as %i@o%i@n%i@e, as it is in this case.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@f%i@e%i@a%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u …Lit: %i@l%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@h%i@e…Lit: %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t. It’s commonplace for nouns describing children or infants to be neuter rather than masculine.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@b%i@o%i@n%i@-%i@c%i@o%i@p%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@a%i@w%i@n%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@a%i@w%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@s%i@u%i@b%i@j%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@s…This phrase %i@e%i@l%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ is used here and also in Col 2:8,20. The meaning of %i@e%i@l%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@s should be determined by the context of its appearances in the NT.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@g%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@o%i@d…The Gk. word for this is usually translated %i@a%i@d%i@o%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ but literally means %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@-%i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@.%i@ In this context, it’s referring to Jesus coming into the rights and privileges which were reserved for him. This passage starting from v. 1 draws an analogy between a child who is born the son of the lord of a great estate but is raised no differently than a household slave. Once he reaches an age of maturity, he joins his father and becomes a joint-owner of the estate. Jesus underwent this process by being born into this world and having to live under the dictates of the Law—but only for a fixed time interval. The interval expired when he was raised from the dead. At that time he assumed his full privileges as Son of God. This is also what Heb. 1:5 refers to.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%I@P%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s. I’m guessing that this is what Paul meant. Same applies for the next few verses.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g…Or: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n. Though some manuscripts read %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g instead, the consensus favors the former over the latter. The redacting of the manuscripts in this area goes to show how difficult vv. 12–16 are to make sense of.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@u%i@c%i@k%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@y%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e…Some claim that the “weakness of the flesh” Paul spoke about in v. 13 was a seeing disorder, and that the Galatians wanted to pluck out their eyes and give them to Paul out of sympathy. As difficult as the passage of vv. 12–16 is to interpret, a healthy skepticism is in order. But the context of this passage doesn’t confirm this dubious claim. Verse 15 begins, “why aren’t you happy anymore?”, while verse 16 begins, “So this means I’ve become your enemy…?” No concurrence is found ; the context suggests that this is an idiom.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%I@J%i@e%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@v%i@e…Paul refers to a concept, also called the New Jerusalem, which has its origins in the OT, in Ezekiel, Jeremiah, and Isaiah, and appears in the NT in Rev. 21:12. In the Bible, cities are metonymies for a concentration of those who intensely believe and put into practice a particular doctrine, religion, etc. The present-day Jerusalem of v. 25 is a metonymy for those who expect to obtain righteousness by adhering to the Law, whereas the Jerusalem above represents righteousness through faith in Christ.%i@%fn~
%i@%sb~
Galatians Chapter 5%hb~
          %u@1Christ set us free by means of the freedom %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t, so make your stand and don’t be subject to a yoke of bondage again. %u@2See here: I—Paul—tell you, if you were to be circumcised (i.e., if you were to commit yourselves to following the Law of Moses and seek righteousness from God based on your adherence to it), Christ won’t benefit you in any way. %u@3Again, I swear I’m telling the truth as I solemnly declare to every circumcised person (i.e., every person who’s attempting to earn righteousness by following the Law) that there’s an obligation to put into practice every aspect, every mandate, every requirement, and every last proscription of the Law. %u@4You’ve been split off from Christ and have had all ties with him severed, you the very people who expect justification%u@[%u@a%u@] by %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ law; you fell out of grace. %u@5You see, we in spirit%u@[%u@b%u@] (i.e., our human spirit in communion with the Holy Spirit) from a perspective of faith eagerly await a hope of righteousness. %u@6You see, in Christ Jesus circumcision (i.e., committed to following the Law) isn’t a factor that carries any weight%u@[%u@c%u@] nor is uncircumcision (i.e., not committed to following the Law), but rather faith in action through love.%vn~
          %u@7You were on the right track—who derailed you to where you became unconvinced of and disobedient to the truth? %u@8Whatever form of persuasion this manifested itself as%u@[%u@d%u@] is not from Him Who called you (i.e., from God who summoned you to believe in Him). %u@9%I@J%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ a tiny amount of yeast will spread to the entire batch of dough, converting all the dough to yeast. %u@1%u@0I’m satisfied in the Lord that you won’t arrive at any other conclusion %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h, but the troublemaker who’s causing you problems will suffer the consequences%u@[%u@e%u@], whoever he happens to be. %u@1%u@1But in my case, comrades—if I %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o still %i@b%i@e%i@ preaching circumcision (i.e., preaching that one must obey the Law of Moses and seek righteousness by following it), why %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d I continue to be persecuted? Has the point of contention and the offensiveness%u@[%u@f%u@] of the cross really been abolished? %u@1%u@2Would that those who are agitating you go on to be castrated!%u@[%U@A%u@]%vn~
          %u@1%u@3The fact of the matter is that you were called (i.e., became believers) %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ at a place of freedom, comrades: just don’t %i@t%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@ the freedom %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t into a pretext for flesh (i.e., a pretext to act apart from God or to indulge your carnal nature), but serve one another as slaves through the love %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ instead. %u@1%u@4You see, the entirety of %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t the Law %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@s is summarized in one sentence: “You shall love your neighbor as yourself”; %u@1%u@5but if you’re vicious towards one another, aggressive, and take advantage of each other or have total disregard for each other, be careful that you don’t rip each other to shreds.%vn~
          %u@1%u@6I’ll say this: conduct your lives%u@[%u@h%u@] in a spiritual manner%u@[%u@b%u@] (i.e., by your spirit in communion with the Holy Spirit) and you won’t carry out the desires of the flesh (i.e., the carnal nature)—not a chance. %u@1%u@7The flesh, you see, has intense, sexual-like desires contrary to the Spirit, and the Spirit %i@i%i@s%i@ contrary to the flesh: in fact these %i@t%i@w%i@o are pitted against each other, so that that which you happen to be wanting, those are the things you won’t be doing. %u@1%u@8But if you are led in a spiritual manner%u@[%u@b%u@], you are not under law (i.e., you’re not subordinated to a set of rules to how to run your life, in particular to the Law).%vn~
          %u@1%u@9Now the works of the flesh are obvious as they’re out in the open and plain for everyone to see: in particular there is fornication (i.e., sexual immorality of any sort); uncleanness (i.e., filthy, nasty, disgusting behavior of any sort; lewd, crude, crass, foul-mouthed, disgusting untidiness, abject neglect of personal hygiene; disgusting references to or treatment of bodily functions); licentiousness (i.e., strong, out-of-control desire which drives you to do that which is immoral); %u@2%u@0idolatry (i.e., replacing God with something else; looking for something else to do what God promised He’d do for you; taking what God did for you and attributing it to something else); recreational drug use, drug abuse, drug dealing, dabbling in the occult, or extreme types of manipulation and control%u@[%U@B%u@]; enmity (i.e., animosity; mutual hatred; continual hostility); quarrelling and strife; emulation (i.e., rivalry driven by jealousy; envy; competing in an unhealthy way to outdo someone else); wrath (i.e., a hot, out-of-control temper; unwarranted outbursts of anger); selfish ambition, playing politics, or manipulating those around you for your own selfish ends; seditions (i.e., dissensions, unresolved disputes); factions (i.e., the formation and perpetuation of groups hostile to each other); %u@2%u@1jealousy (i.e., envious of someone else who does well; hatred of someone simply because they’re doing well or are good at doing something); drunkenness and out-of-control drinking; carousing (i.e., loud partying; hell-raising for the fun of it); etc., etc.—I told you before and I’ll tell you again%u@[%u@i%u@]: those who do such things will not inherit the kingdom of God (i.e., they will have no interaction with God; God will not be involved in their lives).%vn~
          %u@2%u@2But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness and mercy and forgiveness, inner-goodness, faithfulness, %u@2%u@3meekness (i.e., a gentleness which comes from restraint); no law (i.e., no list of do’s and don’ts) is against such things. %u@2%u@4But those %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ of Christ Jesus crucified the flesh (i.e., the carnal nature) together with its passions and desires. %u@2%u@5If we aspire to live in a spiritual manner%u@[%u@b%u@], let us also adhere to standards of a human spirit in communion with the Holy Spirit. %u@2%u@6Let us not acquire an overrated opinion of ourselves, become conceited, or become filled with hubris, provoking one another, envying one another.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@e%i@x%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@r…Or: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t. Although there is ambiguity, the lack of the definite article tilts in favor of this not referring to the Holy Spirit exclusively%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t…Lit: %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@u%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@u%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@s%i@u%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@c%i@k. Ref. note of Matt. 18:6.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@v%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@g%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@r%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@b%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@v%i@o%i@u%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@W%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d…Perhaps Paul is wishing that those who are advocating circumcision would, while being circumcised themselves, have an accident and cut off more than just the foreskin.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@u%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@u%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@u%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@c%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@y%i@p%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@p%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@l…The Gk. word used here is %i@p%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@i%i@a%i@ (φαρμακεία/Strong’s 5331), from where the words %i@p%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@m%i@a%i@c%i@y%i@ and %i@p%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@m%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ are derived. This comes from ancient practices of making potions from exotic plants and using such potions in occult-like practices, often to control others. The ancients didn’t understand drugs per-se, the only understood that certain plants had magical powers. They were effectively using these plants for the drugs found in them. Also ref. Rev. 22:15.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Galatians Chapter 6%hb~
          %u@1Comrades%u@[%u@a%u@], if a person happens to inadvertently be caught in some transgression, you the spiritual ones put such a person back on his feet in a prevailing attitude%u@[%u@b%u@] of gentleness, taking a good, hard look at yourself lest you too be tempted. %u@2Bear each other’s burdens; this is the way you meet the requirements of the Law of Christ. %u@3Furthermore, if someone thinks he’s something when he’s nothing, he’s full of baloney%u@[%u@c%u@]. %u@4But let each person decide if his own personal conduct is up to a satisfactory level, and then he’ll be entitled to speak proudly%u@[%u@d%u@], %i@b%i@u%i@t only to himself and not to somebody else. %u@5In this regard, each person will bear his own load.%vn~
          %u@6Now have the person who’s having the Word taught to him in a classroom environment share all %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ good things%u@[%u@e%u@] (%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g) with the teacher. %u@7Don’t kid yourselves, God won’t let anyone get away with turning his nose up at Him or sneering at Him; in this context, what a person sows, this he also reaps, %u@8since the one who sows into his flesh will reap corruption from the flesh %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o, but he who sows into the Spirit will reap eternal life (i.e., that special fullness of life) from the Spirit %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o. %u@9But %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@,%i@ the one who continues to do good %i@m%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@n%i@’%i@t lose heart, for when the time’s right%u@[%u@f%u@] we will reap %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ if we don’t grow weary %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@i%i@t. %u@1%u@0So then, while we still have a chance%u@[%u@g%u@], let us continue to do good things for everyone, but most of all %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ for the households of %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ the Faith.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1Pay attention to the capital letters%u@[%U@A%u@] I’m using here as I write this in my own handwriting:%vn~
          %u@1%u@2THE VERY PEOPLE WHO WANT TO MAKE THEMSELVES APPEAR ON THE OUTSIDE AS THOUGH THEY’RE GOOD—THEY’RE THE ONES WHO REQUIRE YOU TO BE CIRCUMCISED (i.e., to formally adopt the Law of Moses in the rite of circumcision, thereby committing to following it) FOR THE SOLE REASON THAT THEY WON’T BE PERSECUTED FOR%u@[%u@h%u@] THE CROSS OF CHRIST. %u@1%u@3IN FACT, THOSE WHO PROMOTE CIRCUMCISION DON’T EVEN KEEP LAW (i.e., keep the Law of Moses or any code of conduct for that matter) THEMSELVES. ON THE CONTRARY, THEY WANT YOU TO BE CIRCUMCISED SO THEY CAN BRAG IN YOUR FLESH (i.e., can brag about the amount of personal effort you’re putting into following the Law).%vn~
          %u@1%u@4But far be it for me to brag or beam with pride except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom the world is crucified to me and I to the world (i.e., the ungodly established order of mankind has completely disavowed and shunned me, wanting nothing to do with me, and I have done the same to it). %u@1%u@5Neither circumcision nor uncircumcision is of any significance, but a new creation %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@n%i@t. %u@1%u@6And whosever conforms to this standard: peace %i@b%i@e%i@ upon him and mercy, and %i@m%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@s%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ upon God’s %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ Israel.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7Henceforth, let no one try to hassle me%u@[%u@i%u@], for I bear the marks of Jesus in my body%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ %i@b%i@e%i@ with your spirit, comrades.%vn~
      Amen (%i@s%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t).%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@y…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@-%i@d%i@e%i@l%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@d%i@l%i@y…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@a%i@s%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@w%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e…Lit: %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@f%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@i%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@t%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@b%i@l%i@e. A figure of speech.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@p%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@i%i@g%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@s. Some liberties taken; ancient manuscripts were only written with capital letters, so Paul actually wrote this in larger-than-normal letters, but the effect is the same. Also, ref. Acts 15:23.
Ephesians%ha~
       This letter Paul wrote to the Ephesians has become a universal favorite of all Christians from all denominations who have a genuine relationship with Christ. Reading the first half of the first chapter, one immediately sees why Bible studies—in fact, entire seminary courses—are set on this Paul’s letter, as, reading it, one is swept away in a whirlwind of the extend of what God did for us in Christ. The structure is simple, the same word is often repeated, but it communicates profound thoughts—one after another.%nv~
       Ephesians runs the gamut of spiritual life. The first couple of chapters of the book are about how believers were taken out of sin and given grace beyond their wildest imagination, and will be given even more in the ages to come. The last few chapters are advice on living day by day in our present lives, followed by the war we wage against the devil. All of it is like a sweet pastry which is best consumed a nibble at a time due to its richness.%nv~
%i@%sb~
Ephesians Chapter 1%hb~
          %u@1Paul, apostle (i.e., missionary) of Christ Jesus through the will of God—%vn~
      To the saints (i.e., God’s people) who are in Ephesus and to those who are faithful%u@[%U@A%u@] in Christ Jesus:%vn~
          %u@2Grace and peace to you from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.%vn~
          %u@3Blessed %i@i%i@s%i@ the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, He Who blessed us with every spiritual blessing %i@i%i@m%i@a%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ in the spiritual domain%u@[%u@a%u@] in Christ, %u@4just as in love He chose us in him before the foundation of the world to be holy and unblemished when subjected to His scrutiny%u@[%u@b%u@], %u@5having determined beforehand that He would adopt us, making us His sons through Jesus Christ, according to the benevolent thought-process of His will, %u@6resulting in praising %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ glory of His grace, which in an act of mercy and kindness He gave us by means of the Beloved-One, %u@7in whom we have the Redemption (i.e., the master-plan to put our lives back to the way they were supposed to be) through his blood, the forgiveness of the trespasses %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e, according to the riches of His grace, %u@8which He copiously showered on us with every %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f wisdom and thought-process %i@i%i@m%i@a%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e, %u@9having made known and understood to us the mystery of His will, according to His benevolent thoughts which He purposed and put forth openly in him %u@1%u@0for %i@t%i@h%i@e management of when the eras %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@y%i@ come to a head%u@[%u@c%u@], resulting in the redefinition%u@[%u@d%u@] of every last thing%u@[%u@e%u@] in the Messiah, the Christ, every last thing that resides in the spiritual domain and on the Earth—all things in him, %u@1%u@1in whom we also received an inheritance (i.e., things which have been parceled out and reserved specifically for us, and for us only, to receive or walk, spiritual or otherwise. The plan for us to have such things is immutable. ) which has been predestined (i.e., decided upon ahead of time) according to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ plan and purpose of the One who works every last thing according to the deliberation of His will, %u@1%u@2resulting in us being %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ to praise His glory, we who have set our hope in Christ beforehand, %u@1%u@3%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ in whom we also, having heard the %i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ message%u@[%u@f%u@] of truth, the Gospel of our salvation (i.e., the good news that there is a program in place to rescue us and protect us from calamity), in which, now that we have believed %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@, we were sealed (i.e., identified as belonging to someone or intended for some purpose and labeled and marked as genuine as such) by the guaranteed-by-promise Holy Spirit%u@[%u@g%u@], %u@1%u@4who is%u@[%U@B%u@] the down payment of our inheritance up until we take delivery of what was purchased, resulting in praising His glory.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5On account of this, having heard about your expression of the Faith%u@[%u@h%u@], a faith which is in the Lord Jesus, and the love which %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ to all the saints, %u@1%u@6I also haven’t stopped offering thanksgiving for you, bringing you up in my prayers%u@[%u@i%u@], %u@1%u@7so that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of Glory, will give you a spirit (i.e., a prevailing attitude; an all-encompassing mindset that reaches down deep into the heart, into your own human spirit) of wisdom and revelation in a recognition and an arrived-at, more precise knowledge and understanding of Him, %u@1%u@8%i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ the eyes of your heart having reached the point where they’re enlightened resulting in us knowing for a fact what%u@[%u@j%u@] is the hope of our calling (i.e., what the full potential and ramifications are of us being chosen and accepted by God), what is the wealth of the glory of His inheritance %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@d among the saints, %u@1%u@9and what %i@i%i@s%i@ the over-the-top greatness of His power %i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@v%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ to us, we who believe in accordance with the actuation of the might of His strength (i.e., the sheer amount of force He’s able to bring to bear when He unleashes his power), %u@2%u@0which he actuated in the Messiah, the Christ, having raised him from the dead and having seated him at his right hand (i.e., having taken his position of God’s chief executive officer) in the spiritual domain%u@[%u@a%u@], %u@2%u@1superseding by far%u@[%u@k%u@] all rule and authority and power and dominion%u@[%U@C%u@] and every name which has been named (i.e., every authority which has ever been established; every person or being who’s ever been given or has otherwise assumed a position of authority) not just in this age—no—in the %I@A%i@g%i@e%i@ to%i@ Come as well. %u@2%u@2And He subjected all things under his feet (i.e. God made all things absolutely subservient to Christ, to be forcefully dominated by him), and gave him—%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ head over all things—to the church, %u@2%u@3which is his body, the maximum amount which every little bit of everything is filled to%u@[%U@D%u@].%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@s. Ref. note of 2 Cor. 12:2.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@j%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@y…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@r%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@f%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Also: %i@s%i@u%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@z%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n; %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@p%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@u%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@-%i@b%i@y%i@-%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@t%i@o%i@-%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@b%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t…Or: %i@w%i@h%i@o%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@s%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@r…Lit: %i@f%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@v%i@e%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@E%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@f%i@u%i@l…Or: %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ . Some of the oldest and most important manuscripts omit the words %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@E%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s, which changes the translation to what’s noted here. It’s uncertain whether these words were added later or not.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@o…Or: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s. The latter appears in some of the principal manuscripts.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@o%i@n…These are both earthly rulers and spiritual beings. Ref. note of 1 Cor. 15:24.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@x%i@i%i@m%i@u%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d. %I@A%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ (the preferable rendering being %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l) is an idiom which also appears in 1 Cor. 12:6; 15:28; Col. 3:11. The meaning of this idiom is understood by context.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Ephesians Chapter 2%hb~
          %u@1And while you were dead (i.e., dead spiritually: in a stagnation of waste, joylessness, futility, and destruction) in your trespasses and sins, %u@2in which you went about day in, day out%u@[%u@a%u@] back then according to the age (era) of this world (i.e., according to the philosophies, attitudes, and beliefs that are in vogue in this particular era of human history), according to the ruler of the authority of the air%u@[%U@A%u@] (i.e., according to the being who determines the underlying unseen power that influences and guides human society), the spirit who now works in those who take it upon themselves to be disobedient%u@[%u@b%u@], %u@3you also conducted your lives this way among them back then, living by the desires of your flesh (i.e., your carnal nature), acting out the wants of the flesh and of the thoughts %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d, and you were by nature characterized by indulgence in%u@[%u@c%u@] violent emotions just like everyone else.%vn~
