          %u@4But God, rich in mercy because of the great amount of love %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s, loved us, %u@5and we, dead in the trespasses %I@I%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@r, were made alive in Christ—by grace you have been saved— %u@6and were raised in conjunction %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ and seated jointly %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m (i.e., given joint authority with him) in the spiritual domain%u@[%u@d%u@] in Christ Jesus, %u@7so that the over-the-top riches of His grace in goodness in Christ Jesus would be showcased %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ upon us in the coming ages. %u@8You see, by grace you have been saved through faith, and this %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e—the gift of God—%i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ originate from yourselves%u@[%U@B%u@], %u@9%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ originate from works, so that no one would have bragging-rights. %u@1%u@0You see, we are His handiwork, created in Christ Jesus in a position %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@l%i@e %i@t%i@h%i@e good works which God has waiting in the wings for us to occupy our day-to-day lives with%u@[%u@e%u@].%vn~
          %u@1%u@1In light of this, recall that in flesh (i.e., according to your physical bodies which indicate the method and means by which you approach God) you were “the Gentile Nations” back then, those called uncircumcised (i.e., not God’s people) by those called circumcised in flesh by hand (i.e., God’s people according to a ritual performed by humans), %u@1%u@2because in that phase of your life%u@[%u@f%u@] you were apart from Christ, excluded%u@[%u@g%u@] from the political and social community of Israel and strangers to the covenants of promise, hopeless and godless in the world. %u@1%u@3But now you %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ melded with%u@[%u@h%u@] Christ Jesus; you being far away back then became close by the blood of Christ.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4The fact is, He personally is our peace, who made both %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@s into one and by means of his flesh tore down the dividing wall—the animus—%u@1%u@5having abolished %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@,%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ of the commandments %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d in decrees, so that by means of him He would merge%u@[%u@i%u@] the two %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ into one new entity%u@[%u@j%u@], making peace %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@o, %u@1%u@6and by means of one body would reconcile both to God through the cross, having killed the animus by means of him. %u@1%u@7And he went and proclaimed the glad-tidings message of peace to us who are afar and peace to those who are near, %u@1%u@8%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e that through him both %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s have the access %I@I%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t in one Spirit to the Father.%vn~
          %u@1%u@9So %I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ emphatically:%i@ you’re no longer strangers and foreign-residents, but fellow-citizens of the saints and households of God (i.e., God’s people, historically speaking) instead, %u@2%u@0built on top of the foundation of the apostles and the prophets, Christ Jesus being the foundation’s main anchor point%u@[%u@k%u@], %u@2%u@1in whom you too are being custom-built into a dwelling place of God in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Spirit.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@w%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t…Lit: %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@b%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@b%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@d%i@u%i@l%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@s. Ref. 1:3.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@c%i@c%i@u%i@p%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@-%i@t%i@o%i@-%i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@h%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@e%i@x%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@d…Or: %i@e%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@d. The context suggest %i@e%i@x%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@;%i@ the lexicon says %i@e%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@d%i@.%i@ There’s not much information on this word.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@i%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@m%i@e%i@r%i@g%i@e…Lit: %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@m%i@a%i@n [%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n]%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@c%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@e%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@i%i@r…Up until modern times, it was a commonly held belief that the large masses of air which blow from place to place bring with them not only plagues but unseen, spiritual forces which influence and control the minds of the collective.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@—%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@—%i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@i%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d. The gender of the word %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ is neuter, agreeing with the gender of %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@.%i@ The genders of %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ and %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ are both feminine, which means that in the strictest sense %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ does not refer to %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ because of the gender disagreement. Many assume that it does and use this verse as proof that faith is a gift and that God must give us this gift to “boot us up” so to speak as Christians. Faith is not a gift, nowhere in the Bible does it say that faith is a gift, and neither does this verse.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Ephesians Chapter 3%hb~
          %u@1%I@N%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t grace of this %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t: I Paul the prisoner of Christ Jesus on behalf of you who are%i@ the Gentiles %u@2(assuming you’ve actually heard about the responsibility assigned to me to manage the grace of God, grace which was conveyed by me to you), %u@3%i@a%i@m %i@t%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ that through the agency of%u@[%u@a%u@] revelation the mystery %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ was made known to me just as I briefly wrote about before %u@4for the purpose of you being able to think through my understanding of%u@[%u@b%u@] the mystery of Christ by reading %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@e, %u@5%i@a%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ which in other decades and centuries%u@[%u@c%u@] wasn’t made known to the average person%u@[%u@d%u@] like it’s now been revealed to his holy apostles and prophets by means of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Spirit, %u@6%i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ the Gentiles are to be joint-heirs, to share the same body with, and to be joint-partakers of the promise by means of Christ Jesus through the Gospel, %u@7which I became a minister of according to the gift of the grace of God which was given to me reflective of the actuation of His power.%vn~
          %u@8This very grace was given to me, the least %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@y%i@ of any of the saints (i.e., those who believe in Christ) to evangelize to the Gentiles the unfathomable riches of Christ—riches which cannot be tracked like a predator tracks its prey— %u@9and to make visible and apparent to anyone and everyone %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ the program%u@[%u@e%u@] by which the mystery of what has been hidden away in God Who created all things from %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ the %i@v%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ ages, %u@1%u@0so that at the present time the multi-faceted wisdom of God would be made known and understood to the %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@c%i@ rulers and the %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@c%i@ authorities in the spiritual domain%u@[%u@f%u@] through the church, %u@1%u@1according to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ plan and purpose%i@ of%i@ the ages, which He executed by means of Christ Jesus our Lord, %u@1%u@2in whom we have the open, bold, and confident means of access%u@[%u@g%u@] in %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ having reached the point where %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ fully convinced through the faith %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ in him. %u@1%u@3In light of this I ask that you not lose heart in the deluge of%u@[%u@h%u@] the severe difficulties I face for your sake, a thing in particular which focuses on you%u@[%u@i%u@].%vn~
          %u@1%u@4%I@N%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t grace of this %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t: I genuflect before the Father, %u@1%u@5out of Whom every lineage, be it race, tribe, clan, family, %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@, in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ heavens (i.e., the sky above, heaven, and the spiritual domain) and on %i@t%i@h%i@e earth are named (i.e. are assigned their role and authorities), %u@1%u@6that, according to the riches of His glory, He would grant you to be strengthened with power in the inner-self%u@[%u@j%u@] through His Spirit, %u@1%u@7for Christ to take up residence through the faith in your hearts, while being rooted and anchored%u@[%u@k%u@] in love, %u@1%u@8so that you, joined by all the saints, would be equal to the task of grasping the sheer magnitude of%u@[%u@l%u@] the width, length, height, and depth %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@, %u@1%u@9and to comprehend what’s beyond comprehension—the love of Christ—so that you would be filled with the goal of reaching%u@[%u@m%u@] all the fullness of God.%vn~
          %u@2%u@0Now to the One Who’s able to do far above and beyond all that we ask or think, %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ in lockstep with the power which works in us— %u@2%u@1to Him %i@b%i@e%i@ the glory in the church and in Christ Jesus extending out to all the generations that will forevermore come. And let us pause a moment for that to sink in%u@[%u@n%u@].%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f…Also: %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@i%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@.%i@ Ref. note of Matt. 8:20.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@g%i@r%i@a%i@m…Or: %i@a%i@d%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n; %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@f%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@s. An hendiadys; ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@l%i@u%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@c%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s. The form of the word for %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@ is feminine singular, whose antecedent is presumed to be %i@s%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s. Though the gender matches, it is mismatched in singular vs. plural.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f…Lit: %i@m%i@a%i@n [%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n]%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d; %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@g%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: [%i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t] %i@h%i@o%i@w%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@t%i@o%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@.%i@ Ref. note of Rev. 19:4.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Ephesians Chapter 4%hb~
          %u@1I ask you with all sincerity—I the prisoner in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord—to go about your day-to-day lives in a worthy manner, %u@2with every kind of and the utmost extent of humility, gentleness, and self-restraint there is%u@[%u@a%u@], with patience, putting up with one another in love, %u@3while being eager to maintain the unity of the Spirit by means of the bond of peace— %u@4%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ one body %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s and one Spirit %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d, just like the fact that you were called in one hope of your calling (i.e., you were summoned by God to be believers in a summoning that has one and only one hope in mind)— %u@5One Lord, one faith, one baptism (i.e. there is only one way to become a Christian, and it is done once only)— %u@6One God who occupies the role of Father%u@[%U@A%u@] of all things: %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ the One Who’s on the top of the heap%u@[%u@b%u@]; Who all things exist on account of Him, by means of Him, and through Him; and Who is in, with, and among all things.%vn~
          %u@7Now the unearned gift which God gives out of His kindness%u@[%U@B%u@] was given to each individual according to the specific amount %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@i%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@s%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@ of the gift of Christ. %u@8In light of this %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@B%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@P%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@m%i@s says,%vn~
%si~
Once he ascended to a high %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@,%vp~
He bedazzled the captives%u@[%u@d%u@]—%vp~
He gave gifts to the people %i@o%i@n%i@ %I@E%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@%vp~
%si~
%u@9Now %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@,%i@ how can he who ascended (i.e., the person referred to by this quotation from Psalms)%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@y be anyone other than the%i@ person who descended into the lower part of the Earth (i.e., the world beneath the Earth, the underworld, the place where the dead go and where hell is)? %u@1%u@0The person who descended is the same person %i@r%i@e%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@P%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@m%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ who ascended far above all the heavens (i.e., to a position which completely supersedes and has complete dominion over the entire spiritual domain, including all spiritual creatures and all activity in the spiritual world) in order to fully take ownership of%u@[%u@e%u@] all the things %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m.%nn~
          %u@1%u@1And %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ this same person—%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d—granted that, %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@,%i@ there be the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, and the %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@l%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f pastor%u@[%u@f%u@] and instructor%u@[%U@D%u@] (i.e., those who do one or more of the following: leading the congregation; instructing the congregation as to what the rules are; laying down rules when needed; explaining the Scriptures and the Christian faith)— %u@1%u@2for the equipping of the saints (i.e., the believers) towards the goal of %i@t%i@h%i@e work of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ ministry, towards the goal of the building up of the body of Christ, %u@1%u@3until—should the time ever come%u@[%U@E%u@]—we all attain the unity of the Faith and the recognition and the arrived-at knowledge and understanding of the Son of God, with the goal %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g a full-grown man (i.e., getting our act together) to the point where we reach Christ’s height and body-weight%u@[%U@F%u@], %u@1%u@4so that we’d no longer be young children, jostled and carried about by every wind of teaching among the cheap hustles that pool sharks dream up to con people%u@[%u@g%u@]; %u@1%u@5but, while being straight-up about the truth%u@[%u@h%u@] in %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ love, we would grow to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s him in all respects, who is the head, %u@1%u@6from whom the entire body is being assembled into a single, cohesive unit by examining each part, seeing how it logically fits into the big picture, then putting the entire unit together—%i@a%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d through every supporting ligament according to a %i@p%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f operation where each one of the members does its share%u@[%u@i%u@] to cause the growth of the body towards the goal of the building up of itself in love.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7What I’m telling you—and I swear by it in the Lord—is this: No longer go about your day-to-day lives as the Gentiles (i.e., the random people out yonder who have no relationship with God; the nations which populate the earth) do in the futile, foolish, senseless, and worthless state of their minds, %u@1%u@8being darkened in their end-to-end thought process, estranged from the life of God on account of the ignorance which exists in them %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ on account of the state of hardness, dullness, and insensitivity of their hearts, %u@1%u@9people in particular who, having reached the point where they’re so callous that they’re not bothered by the implications of what they do, have relinquished control of themselves in their giving of themselves over to an unrestrained indulgence in lewd and immoral physical pleasures towards the end-result of practicing all %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%u@[%u@j%u@] filthy, disgusting things%u@[%u@k%u@] in a yearning for more and more of the same.%vn~
          %u@2%u@0But you did not learn (i.e., successively come to appreciate and build an understanding of) Christ this way, %u@2%u@1if you really heard him and were taught by him (according to the premise that truth is in Jesus) %u@2%u@2to %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@l%i@y%i@ put aside the old-self%u@[%u@l%u@] in regard to the former lifestyle %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e, the old-self who’s degenerating as a consequence of the carnal desires of “the delusion” %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@-%i@t%i@o%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@—%i@ %u@2%u@3but %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ while being renewed in the prevailing attitude and disposition%u@[%u@m%u@] of your mind— %u@2%u@4and to put on %i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%u@[%U@G%u@] the new-self, who, as directed by God, was created in righteousness and holiness—without fault both from a human and from a divine perspective—derived from%u@[%u@n%u@] the truth.%vn~
          %u@2%u@5In light of this, now that you’ve put aside the mendacity %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@, %i@a%i@s%i@ %I@Z%i@e%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@a%i@h%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@s, “Each person %i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ speak truthfully %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ with his neighbor%u@[%u@o%u@],” since you belong to one another%u@[%u@p%u@]. %I@P%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@m%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@,%i@ %u@2%u@6“Be angry and don’t sin %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e”—don’t let the sun set on your wrath (i.e., be angry but don’t be consumed by the emotion, not putting the anger away when you should), %u@2%u@7nor give place to the devil (i.e., close off any opportunities for the devil; don’t allow him to gain a foothold anywhere). %u@2%u@8Let the person who steals no longer steal, but rather %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ toil, working %i@f%i@o%i@r the %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@ good using his own hands, so that he would have %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@ to give to the one in need. %u@2%u@9Don’t let any rotten word (including ideas and topics of conversation) come out of your mouth, but rather %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ something %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@ that contributes positively to the problem at hand%u@[%u@q%u@], so that it would give grace (i.e., it would be a gift of kindness, graciousness, and goodwill to those who don’t deserve the same) to those who hear. %u@3%u@0And do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God or cause him pain, in whom you were sealed (i.e., certified and labeled as genuine or as belonging to someone) for a day of redemption (i.e. to a point in time where things are made to be what they’re supposed to be or restored to what they used to be). %u@3%u@1Let any sort of bitterness, rage, anger, shouting, or blasphemy (i.e., swearing at someone, trash-talking about someone, smearing or slandering the reputation of someone) be removed from you together with any sort of malice. %u@3%u@2In the same %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s, become kind to one another, tender-hearted and compassionate, and gracious, forgiving, and extending goodwill just as God in Christ was gracious, forgiving, and extended goodwill to you as well.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@-%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@e%i@k%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@p…Lit: %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l [%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s]%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@i%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@s…Lit: %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@d%i@a%i@z%i@z%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s. A repetition of the same root, first the verb then the noun with not article is a figure of speech, likely an idiom also. This figure of speech originates in the Hebrew text of Ps. 68:18 and was simply copied to the LXX, from where it was copied to this epistle.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@p%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@d. Ref. note of 1 Pet. 5:2.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@p%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@o%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@m%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@n%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g [from %i@d%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@-%i@p%i@l%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g; %i@s%i@l%i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t] %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@e%i@r%i@y [lit: %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g] %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g [from the root %i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@y%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@;%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@;%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@;%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@a%i@f%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h] %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@.%i@ %I@P%i@o%i@o%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@k%i@s%i@ is actually %i@d%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@-%i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@s (liberties taken).%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@-%i@u%i@p%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@-%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g. Of note is that this is a single Gk. word and not a multi-word phrase. Since it is a single word, it has a more specific definition.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@a%i@l%i@l. Same idiom used in 1 Tim. 6:10.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@f%i@i%i@l%i@t%i@h%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@g%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@-%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f…Lit: %i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n [%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n]%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m…Lit: %i@o%i@f%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%I@E%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@b%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@b%i@o%i@r. %I@S%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h is a figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d…Lit: %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@d%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@O%i@n%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@c%i@c%i@u%i@p%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r…Lit: %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r. An hendiadys; ref. note of Matt. 3:11. In this case, the hendiadys emphasizes the fact that God is the Supreme Father, and as the Father is the One Who is over everything, plans, originates, directs, and gives purpose to everything. This very thing is elaborated in the words which follow.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s…Also: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e. The definite article precedes the word %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ when it refers to grace in a Christian context, and not one of the other meanings the Gk. word might convey. This is sort-of idiomatic.%fn~
The context suggests that this is talking about the special abilities God gives to select individuals to be used in the ministry. Note that the word %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ in this verse is the root for the word %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@ (%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@a%i@)%i@ used in 1 Cor. 12,14. Now, the word %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@ used in v. 7 here in %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t uses the generic word for %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@ (%i@d%i@ō%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ δῶρον/Strong’s 1435) %i@,%i@ which, unlike %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@a%i@, has no sense of grace attached to it (ref. note of Rom. 12:6). But this was probably because %i@d%i@ō%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@ was used in Ps. 68:18 in the LXX, which is quoted in v. 8, so Paul uses it in reference to this quotation, not because there’s no grace associated with this %i@d%i@ō%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@a%i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@g%i@h. A few verses later (v. 10) Paul clarifies what %i@h%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@ means: %i@f%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@.%i@ This is not so much a physical location as a position of authority.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@o%i@r…Also: %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r. Ref. note of Acts 15:1. Also note that there is only one definite article before %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@o%i@r, whereas apostle, prophet, and evangelist each have their own definite articles. The missing definite article before %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ binds it to %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e…This seems to be insinuated by the verb tense of %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@,%i@ but others (in this case, the %I@E%i@x%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@’%i@s%i@ %I@G%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@k%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t) claim that the tense of %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ “…points to the event [of attaining the unity of the faith] as expected, and not as a mere hypothetical possibility.” According to this reasoning, %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ would be rendered %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e instead.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@-%i@g%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@(%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@)%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@-%i@w%i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t …Lit: %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t. %I@C%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ is the same idiom/metaphor used in James 3:2. The metaphorical sense of this is signaled by the use of the more specific Gk. word for %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@,%i@ which is%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ā%i@r%i@ (ἀνήρ/Strong’s 435), over the more general %i@a%i@n%i@t%i@h%i@r%i@ō%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@ (ἄνθρωπος/Strong’s 444). Also, choosing %i@a%i@n%i@ā%i@r%i@ over %i@a%i@n%i@t%i@h%i@r%i@ō%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@ refers to the physical size of a grown-man’s body. The comparison to a full-grown body continues in the phrase %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@.%i@ Furthermore%i@, %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ also refers to a man’s physical body size. A “complete man” is one who has a full-grown body. The metaphor is that, when our body is fully grown, we will have attained the same height and weight as Christ. The reference to children in v. 14 continues this stature-metaphor.%fn~
%u@[%U@G%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n %i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@…There is a noteworthy change in verb tense between the verb %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ in v. 23 (Gk. present tense) and the verb %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ in v. 24 (Gk. aorist tense); the words %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@l%i@y%i@ and %i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ are insinuated by these tenses. Also, as these two verbs are imperatives, a present-tense imperative is softer than an aorist-imperative. So the command %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ is like an order that an army captain would give to one of his soldiers or that a lord would give to one of his slaves. So the command to put on the new-self is more urgent, abrupt, and forceful than the command to put off the old-self.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Ephesians Chapter 5%hb~
          %u@1Become imitators of God as children who are loved, %u@2and go about your day-to-day lives in love, just as Christ loved you and handed himself over %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ for your sakes %i@a%i@s%i@ a sacrificial offering%u@[%u@a%u@] with the goal %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ an aromatic aroma %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g. %u@3But fornication (i.e., sexual immorality) and uncleanness (i.e., any immoral practice which is filthy and disgusting) of any sort or greed—don’t even mention it%u@[%u@b%u@] among yourselves, as %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ is what’s appropriate for the saints (i.e., those who believe in Christ). %u@4And things you ought to be ashamed of saying because they’re morally unacceptable or they’re obscene; and stupid, foolish babbling or %i@s%i@e%i@x%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ innuendos—that which ought not %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@—%i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s, but rather %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ words of gratitude all the more. %u@5In fact, wrap your head around this%u@[%u@c%u@]: All fornicators, those who practice uncleanness, or those who are greedy (which is idolatry) don’t have an inheritance (i.e., don’t have a piece carved out for them) in the kingdom of Christ and God.%vn~
          %u@6Let no one deceive you with empty words: the wrath of God comes upon the sons of disobedience (i.e., those who take it upon themselves to be disobedient) because of these things, %u@7so don’t partner up with them. %u@8You see, you were darkness back then, but now you are light in %i@t%i@h%i@e Lord: go about your day-to-day lives as children of light %u@9(As a side-note, the fruit (i.e., the byproduct) of light %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d in any kind of and all sorts of%u@[%u@d%u@] goodness, righteousness, and truth), %u@1%u@0giving your approval to what is pleasing to the Lord. %u@1%u@1And don’t take part in the fruitless (i.e., no long-term benefit) works of darkness, but expose %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m instead; %u@1%u@2for the things which take place in secret %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ by them are embarrassing to even talk about. %u@1%u@3Now everything which is exposed by the light gets brought out in the open, plain for all to see. %u@1%u@4In fact, anything which itself brings things out in the open and makes them plain to see is light%u@[%U@A%u@]. Therefore it says,%vn~
%si~
You %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ who’s sleeping: get up%vp~
And arise from the dead%vp~
And Christ will shine on you (i.e., he’ll appear to you)%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@5So see to it that you go about your day-to-day lives monitoring whether your lives are up to standard %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t, not %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ as an unwise person but as a shrewd and wise one, %u@1%u@6making the most of the time and taking advantage of every opportunity, because it’s bad out there%u@[%u@e%u@]. %u@1%u@7Because of this, don’t get to where you’re careless, reckless, thoughtless, or stupid, but rather constantly understand what the will of the Lord %i@i%i@s. %u@1%u@8And don’t get drunk on wine—in which is a reckless disregard for your own self-preservation—but be continuously filled %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Spirit%u@[%u@f%u@] instead, %u@1%u@9speaking among yourselves or to yourselves in popular songs accompanied by instruments, songs of praise%u@[%U@B%u@], and spiritual songs%u@[%U@C%u@] (i.e., prophetic manifestations of the Holy Spirit put to song, including singing in tongues), singing in general%i@ and singing popular tunes—tunes which may be accompanied by musical instruments%u@[%u@g%u@]—with the heart to the Lord, %u@2%u@0always offering thanksgiving for everything%u@[%u@h%u@] in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ name of our Lord Jesus Christ to God the Father%u@[%u@i%u@], %u@2%u@1submitting to one another in a reverence of Christ bordering on fear.%vn~
          %u@2%u@2Wives %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@m%i@i%i@t%u@[%U@D%u@] to their husbands as %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ to the Lord, %u@2%u@3since %i@t%i@h%i@e husband is %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ head%u@[%u@j%u@] of the wife as Christ is %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ head of the church, he personally %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e savior of the body. %u@2%u@4Anyways, as the church submits to Christ, this is the same way that wives %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@ to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r husbands in all aspects.%vn~
          %u@2%u@5Husbands, love %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r wives just as Christ loved the church and surrendered himself and was taken into custody for her sake, %u@2%u@6so that he would set her apart and make her holy after cleaning %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ up in the bathtub with the word %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d, %u@2%u@7so that he personally could present to himself the church imbued with glory, having no spot, wrinkle, or anything of that sort, but instead %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ she would be holy and blameless %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d. %u@2%u@8The way that husbands ought to love their wives is as if they were their own bodies. He who loves his wife loves himself; %u@2%u@9the fact of the matter is that no one ever hated his own flesh, rather cherishes and nourishes it%u@[%u@k%u@], just as Christ %i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@ the church, %u@3%u@0because we are a part of his body. %vn~
%si~
%u@3%u@1Because of this%vp~
A man shall leave %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ father and mother%vp~
And adhere to his wife,%vp~
And the two will be %i@m%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ into a single flesh%vp~
%si~
%u@3%u@2This mystery—and I’m referring to Christ and to the church—is deep%u@[%u@l%u@]. %u@3%u@3But in any case, make sure every one of you down to the last man love his wife as %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ himself, but make sure wives have a deep reverence and respect for their husbands, one which borders on fear.%nn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@e. A figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@w%i@r%i@a%i@p%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s…Lit: %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w [%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@t] %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g [%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t]. This appears to be an expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@a%i@l%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l. The word %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ as used here is a personification.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e %i@i%i@n %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Spirit …Lit: %i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n [%i@t%i@h%i@e] %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t. Note that this phrase in the GT for %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ is the same one found 1 Cor. 12:3; Rev. 1:10. It means the same thing. Ref. notes there.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@p%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@u%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@—%i@t%i@u%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@m%i@-%i@i%i@n%i@g. Ref. note of previous verse.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g…Or: %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d…See 1 Cor. 11 for usage of the word %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ in this context%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@i%i@t…Also: %i@h%i@e%i@r. This has a dual-meaning, since the Gk. word for %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h is feminine, it can—and does—refer to both “it” (the flesh) and “she” (the wife).%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@e%i@p…Lit: %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t…Or: %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t. Interpreting the Gk. verb tense of %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ as a middle voice instead of passive, in order to make sense of this and fit it into the context. Usage of the middle voice like this is extremely rare in the NT (this is skating on thin ice).%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@p%i@o%i@p%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@e…Lit: %i@p%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@m%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@y%i@m%i@n%i@s. The Gk. word for %i@p%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@m%i@ means, “to vibrate by touching” (Thayer); “song of praise accompanied on the harp” (Max & Mary); the Gk. word for %i@h%i@y%i@m%i@n%i@ means, “a song in praise of gods, heroes, and conquerors” (Thayer). Thayer goes on to say (with a quotation from Synesius? embedded), “[the Gk. word for] %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ is the generic term; [the Gk. words for] %i@p%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@m%i@ and %i@h%i@y%i@m%i@n%i@ are the specific, the former designating a song which took its general character from the OT Psalms (although not restricted to them, see 1 Cor. 14:15,26), the latter a song of praise. ‘While the leading idea of %i@p%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@m%i@ is a musical accompaniment, and that of %i@h%i@y%i@m%i@n%i@ praise to God, %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ is the general word for a song, whether accompanied or unaccompanied, whether of praise or on any other subject. Thus it was quite possible for the same song to be at once %i@p%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@m%i@,%i@ %i@h%i@y%i@m%i@n%i@,%i@ and %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@.%i@’%i@ The words occur together in Col. 3:16 and Eph. 5:19.” Also, ref. note of 1 Cor. 14:15.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@s…The word for %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ here is the same word used in 1 Cor. 12:1 “concerning spirituals” (see note there) and is also found in 1 Cor. 14:15,37. In both v. 19 here and 1 Cor. 14:15:37, this phrase means a prophetic utterance or the equivalent of a prophetic utterance in the form of tongues and interpretation. A %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@g is a prophetic utterance which is put to song.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@s%i@u%i@b%i@m%i@i%i@t…Ref. note of 1 Pet. 2:18, which explains the Gk. words for %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@ and %i@o%i@b%i@e%i@y%i@.%i@ A case in point is the usage of %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@ here, but the usage of %i@o%i@b%i@e%i@y%i@ in 6:1. Wives are told to submit, but children are told to obey.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Ephesians Chapter 6%hb~
          %u@1Children, obey your parents as part of your walk with the Lord%u@[%u@a%u@]; this is the right thing to do, you see. %u@2”Honor your father and mother,” which is the foremost%u@[%u@b%u@] commandment %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ with a promise %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@: %u@3”…So that it would go well with you and you would be blessed %i@d%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@y%i@ on the planet.” %u@4And, parents, don’t exasperate your children but raise them in the discipline, coaching, mentoring, and instruction of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord instead.%vn~
          %u@5Slaves and menial servants, obey those who are your masters or bosses in the natural with the utmost reverence and respect%u@[%u@c%u@] in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ simplicity of your heart (i.e., without making something bigger out of it) as %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ to Christ, %u@6not just making the boss think you’re doing a good job when he’s looking and acting up when he’s not%u@[%u@d%u@] but %i@o%i@b%i@e%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g as though you’re Christ’s slave instead, doing the will of God from %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ soul, %u@7serving with a good attitude%u@[%u@e%u@] as %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ to the Lord and not to humans, %u@8knowing for a fact that each person, if he were to do something in particular which is good, he’ll get this %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ back from %i@t%i@h%i@e Lord, whether slave or free. %u@9And masters and bosses, treat them the same way%u@[%u@f%u@], giving up the %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ threat %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@l%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@s, knowing for a fact that in the spiritual domain%u@[%u@g%u@] the Lord is master and boss of both them and you, and there is no favoritism based on position in society or such with him.%vn~
          %u@1%u@0In conclusion, be strong in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord and %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ the vastness of his power. %u@1%u@1Put on%u@[%u@h%u@] all the components of God’s complete suit of armor%u@[%u@i%u@] so you’ll have the ability to stand against the schemes of the devil, %u@1%u@2because the fight we’re in isn’t against flesh and blood, but against the rulers (i.e., the evil spirits who have dominion at the top of a hierarchy, presumably over other evil spirits), against the authorities (i.e., the evil spirits with power over a specific area), against the world-dominators of this darkness (i.e., the evil spirits who dominate the ungodly human system and society that is the darkness we’re surrounded by), against the spirit-forces of wickedness in the spiritual domain%u@[%u@g%u@].%vn~
          %u@1%u@3On account of this, take up God’s complete suit of armor, so that you’ll be able to withstand %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l in the day of evil and—after you’ve accomplished everything %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y—to stand. %u@1%u@4So stand, %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r having fastened the belt of truth around your waist%u@[%u@j%u@], and having put on the breastplate of righteousness, %u@1%u@5and having put on your feet the preparation of the good-news message of the Gospel of peace, %u@1%u@6in all %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%u@[%u@k%u@] having taken up the shield of faith, by which you’ll be able to extinguish and knock out all the Evil One’s flaming projectiles, %u@1%u@7and having received the helmet of salvation and the sword of the Spirit (which is %i@t%i@h%i@e word of God), %u@1%u@8with every sort of%u@[%u@l%u@] prayer and supplication (i.e., an urgent request put into prayer) praying in every season%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Spirit, and while at it with maximum perseverance and prayer be on the lookout looking around to see how all the saints (i.e., believers) are doing, %u@1%u@9and for me, so that a message may be given %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e when I open my mouth to boldly make known the mystery of the Gospel %u@2%u@0(for which I’m an ambassador kept on a short leash%u@[%u@m%u@]) so that with the same I will speak out freely, boldly, and confidently as it is incumbent on me to speak.%vn~
          %u@2%u@1Now, so that you too would know what’s going on with me %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ how I’m doing%u@[%u@n%u@], Tychicus, a dear brother and a faithful assistant%u@[%u@o%u@] in the Lord, will fill you in on everything, %u@2%u@2whom I sent to you with that very goal in mind, so you’d know what I’m up to and that he’d give your hearts encouragement and comfort.%vn~
          %u@2%u@3%I@E%i@x%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ peace to the brothers and love with faith from God %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Father and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord Jesus Christ%u@[%u@p%u@]. %u@2%u@4Grace be with them who love our Lord Jesus Christ with sincerity.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@s%i@t…Also: %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@t%i@m%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t…Lit: %i@f%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g. An idiom; also found in 1 Cor. 2:3; 2 Cor. 7:15; Phil 2:12.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@b%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t…Lit: %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@y%i@e%i@-%i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@-%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@d%i@e…Also: %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y…Lit: %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n…The Gk. verb tense used for this imperative is a strong command, like one an officer gives to a soldier, something he should snap to attention and get done immediately.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@m%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d. The Gk. word %i@p%i@a%i@n%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@a (πανοπλία/Strong’s 3833), where we get the English word %i@p%i@a%i@n%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@y, is used here for %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h. A reference to Is. 11:5; 59:17.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l. Older commentaries (and one would assume they’re based on Textus Receptus) read %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ (rendered %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l) instead; Codex Vaticanus/UBS NT read %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l.%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@a%i@l%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@k%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@h…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@i%i@n. Some liberties taken.%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g…Or: %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@o%i@n. Ref. note of Rom. 12:7.%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t. A good example of how the definite article is assumed in prepositional phrases and therefore omitted. In the GT, the word %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ is normally preceded by the definite article.
Philippians%ha~
       The church at Philippi is introduced in Acts 16, where Paul is diverted to Macedonia, where Philippi is, by an angel which told him, “Cut across the Aegean Sea to Macedonia and help us out.” Shortly after, he meets women in Philippi who gathered outside the city by the river, and these women were the basis for the church at Philippi. In fact, of the names mentioned in this letter to the Philippians, only women are found. Scholars speculate whether this church consisted entirely of women at the time Paul wrote this epistle.%nv~
       By the tone and content of the letter, the church in Philippi is one of the stronger, more spiritual churches that Paul founded. Because of this, it’s fitting that they be all women, since the low-profile dedication of women such as these has carried Christianity—even before that, going back to Jesus’s ministry—since the beginning, an oft overlooked and seldom noted cause for the strength, vigor, and propagation of Christianity through the millennia.%nv~
       The letter to this spiritual church contains few rebukes, few corrections concerning doctrine, and is salted with Paul’s tender affections. The lack of quotations from the OT indicates that those whom the letter was addressed to had no affiliation with Judaism, no knowledge of the OT. They were Gentiles through and through.%nv~
        The GT is smooth, easily converted into another language, but draws on a deep vocabulary.%nv~
%i@%sb~
Philippians Chapter 1%hb~
          %u@1%I@F%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ Paul and Timothy, slaves of Christ Jesus,%vn~
      To all the saints (i.e., believers) in Christ Jesus who live in Philippi together with %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ bishops (i.e., head pastors; overseers) and deacons (i.e., assistant pastors; assistants entrusted with significant responsibilities; heads of ministry departments):%vn~
          %u@2Grace to you and peace from God our Father and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord Jesus Christ.%vn~
          %u@3I give thanks to my God every time I think about you while reminiscing, %u@4always making every one of my requests put into prayer for you all with joy, %u@5%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@s%i@ for your working closely %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@e in %i@t%i@h%i@e %i@s%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ the Gospel (i.e., the good-news message of Christ) from the first day until the present. %u@6I’ve reached the point where I’m convinced of this very thing, that He who began a good work in you will complete it, %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@s until %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ day of Christ Jesus, %u@7just as it’s right for me to be thinking about all of you this way, on account of me having you both in my heart and in my chains and in the verbal defense and confirmation of the certainty of the Gospel—you all being my fellow-workers of %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ grace.%vn~
          %u@8In this regard, God is my witness to the fact that I long for all you with the deep, inner affections of Christ Jesus. %u@9And I pray this, that your love would proliferate even more and more in recognition, in more precise knowledge, and in every %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f insight gained from perception, %u@1%u@0resulting in your continual testing and approving of those things which excel, so that you would be sincere and won’t get tripped up %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ day of Christ, %u@1%u@1having reached the point where you’ve been filled from the byproduct%u@[%u@a%u@] of righteousness which %i@i%i@s%i@ through Jesus Christ to %i@t%i@h%i@e glory and praise of God.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2I want you to know, comrades%u@[%u@b%u@], that the situation I find myself in has further advanced the Gospel, %u@1%u@3in that an awareness and understanding of my bonds in Christ has been made known among the entire palace guard detachment and among everyone else, %u@1%u@4and many of the comrades in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord, urged on by my bonds, are much more daring about %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ speaking the word %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ without fear.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5While %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t some preach Christ because %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y jealousy and strife, on the other hand some %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ by good intentions. %u@1%u@6While they who %i@s%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@l%i@ out of love know for a fact that I’ve been appointed to give a verbal defense of the Gospel, %u@1%u@7on the other hand they who proclaim Christ%i@ out of ambition and not with sincerity expect to stir up vexation %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ while I’m in jail%u@[%u@c%u@]. %u@1%u@8So what?—except %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s: that Christ is proclaimed in all respects, whether with ulterior motives or with no hidden agenda%u@[%u@d%u@], and in this I rejoice—and %i@i%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ I will rejoice, %u@1%u@9for I know for a fact that this will result in deliverance for me through your prayer and the support of the Spirit of Christ Jesus, %u@2%u@0in line with my eager expectation and hope that I won’t be embarrassed or humiliated in any way, but rather with every %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f frankness, forthrightness, and openness %i@i%i@m%i@a%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e Christ will be magnified now—as always—in my body, whether through life or through death.%vn~
          %u@2%u@1You see, the way I see it%u@[%u@e%u@], to live %i@i%i@s%i@ Christ and to die is gain (i.e., is advantageous; is a desirable option). %u@2%u@2If I live on in %i@t%i@h%i@e flesh, this %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@i%i@e%i@l%i@d%i@ tangible results from %i@m%i@y%i@ work%u@[%u@f%u@]. And what will I choose?—I can’t tell; %u@2%u@3I’m caught between the two, having the desire to be set free again%i@ and to be together with Christ, for %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ much, much better%u@[%u@g%u@]. %u@2%u@4But to remain in the flesh is more necessary for your sakes. %u@2%u@5And convinced of this I know that I will remain %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %I@E%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h and stay by your side—with all of you—for your progress and for %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ joy %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ from faith, %u@2%u@6so that your grounds for speaking proudly would proliferate in Christ Jesus by my doing, on account of me visiting you again.%vn~
          %u@2%u@7Only let your life in society be worthy of the Gospel of Christ, so that, whether I come and see you or am away, I hear what you’re up to, that you stand %i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r in one spirit%u@[%u@h%u@], one soul, joined together by the Faith of the Gospel %u@2%u@8and are not frightened and intimidated by anything %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ by %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r adversaries, which in particular is indicative of their ruin, but of your salvation (i.e., your being kept from ruin); and this %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@i%i@d%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@-%i@r%i@u%i@i%i@n%i@-%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@v%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@s from God, %u@2%u@9since the thing given—undeservedly so%u@[%u@i%u@]—to you on Christ’s behalf is to not only to believe in him but to suffer on his behalf, %u@3%u@0having the same anguish and conflict %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d, the very thing you saw %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ to and in me and now hear reports %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ to and in me.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@b%i@y%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@t…Lit: %i@f%i@r%i@u%i@i%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@x%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@j%i@a%i@i%i@l…Lit: %i@r%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@d%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@a…Lit: %i@i%i@n [%i@t%i@h%i@e] %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@i%i@e%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n [or %i@b%i@y] %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@u%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k. Paul didn’t word this clearly.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@m%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@,%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@m%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…Or: [%I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y] %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t. The GT is ambiguous. One should not exclude the possibility that it means both.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@—%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@o…The Gk. word used for %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ [%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@d%i@z%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@i%i@,(χαρίζομαι/Strong’s 5483)] here is not what one would expect. %I@C%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@d%i@z%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@i%i@ also means %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e, but has emphasizes the magnanimousness of the person doing the giving, and/or insinuating that the person receiving the gift didn’t earn it.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Philippians Chapter 2%hb~
          %u@1%U@SSo now, if %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@’%i@s any comfort or exhortation in Christ, if any consolation offered by love, if any commonality and fellowship of spirit%u@[%u@a%u@], if any deep, inner affection— %u@2you’ll make me overjoyed if you would adopt that way of thinking%u@[%u@b%u@], having the same love, being harmonious and on the same page%u@[%u@c%u@], %u@3%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ no one motivated by ambition or by conceit but by humility instead, considering each other to be better than yourselves, %u@4not paying careful attention to your own affairs %i@e%i@x%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ but instead %i@p%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ to each other’s affairs as well.%vn~
          %u@5Maintain in you the way of thinking that was also in Christ Jesus, %u@6who, while existing in %i@t%i@h%i@e form of God, didn’t think being equal to God was %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ to be held onto with everything you’ve got%u@[%u@d%u@], %u@7but instead depleted himself and assumed the form of a slave, having turned into something similar to humans, and, unveiled to the public%u@[%u@e%u@] having the appearance of that of a human being, %u@8he humbled himself and became obedient until %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@b%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ death, %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@-%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ but %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ death of %i@c%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@x%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n a cross. %u@9And in light of this, God%u@[%U@A%u@] exalted him (i.e., promoted him to a high position) and %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ gave%u@[%U@B%u@] him the name which is above all names (i.e., gave him the ultimate top rank, outranking every other rank), %u@1%u@0so that in the name of Jesus (i.e. when Jesus’s authority is invoked) every knee would bow of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e heavens (i.e., in heaven; in the spiritual domain) and of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s on the Earth and of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s under the earth (i.e., the world of the dead, including hell) %u@1%u@1and every tongue %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ confess out loud that Jesus Christ is Lord to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ glory of God %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Father.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2So now, my dear %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s, just as you have always obeyed, not just when I was there in person but even more in my absence, work at the salvation where your own selves are concerned with the utmost reverence and respect%u@[%u@f%u@]; %u@1%u@3you see, God is the One Who’s working in you both the wanting and the working-on of what pleases Him%u@[%u@g%u@].%vn~
          %u@1%u@4Do all things while distancing yourselves from grumbling and scheming or plotting, %u@1%u@5so that you would become blameless and innocent, children of God in the midst of a crooked and perverted Zeitgeist%u@[%u@h%u@], in which you shine as lights in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ world, %u@1%u@6holding fast to a message of life, resulting in me having proud words to tell others %i@u%i@p to the day of Christ, since you haven’t run %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ or toiled for nothing.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7Anyways, if I’m being poured out %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n upon the altar and %i@d%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e liturgy of your faith, I will rejoice and will rejoice together%u@[%u@i%u@] with you all— %u@1%u@8And the same %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u: you will rejoice and will rejoice together with me.%vn~
          %u@1%u@9Now I hope in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you posthaste, so that once I know what you’re up to, it’ll put me at ease. %u@2%u@0I have no one, you see, who sees things the way I do, a certain someone who’ll truly care for you. %u@2%u@1In fact, everyone %I@I%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ is pursuing their own self-interests, not the interests of Jesus Christ. %u@2%u@2But you’re familiar with how he qualified %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@t, that he served me in the Gospel like a son serves a father. %u@2%u@3So I certainly hope to send this %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w as I could immediately turn my attention to my affairs %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t. %u@2%u@4I’m convinced in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord of the same, that I too will come posthaste.%vn~
          %u@2%u@5I deemed it necessary that I send you Epaphroditus, my comrade%u@[%u@j%u@], coworker, and fellow soldier-in-arms—your missionary%u@[%u@k%u@] and my personal attendant— %u@2%u@6since he was longing %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ all of you and was quite distressed because you heard that he was rundown with some sort of sickness%u@[%u@l%u@]. %u@2%u@7You see, he was weakened by sickness to the point of death, but instead %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@d%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ God had mercy on him, and not just on him but on me too so that I wouldn’t be wrenched with pain upon pain. %u@2%u@8So with even more urgency I sent him %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ so that after seeing him again you would rejoice and I would be relieved of my pain. %u@2%u@9So receive him in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord with all %i@t%i@h%i@e joy %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@, and honor%u@[%u@m%u@] individuals like him, %u@3%u@0since he came close to death on account of Christ’s work, risking %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ very life so that he would fill in the gap caused by your drop-off in serving me.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…Or: %i@o%i@f [%i@t%i@h%i@e]%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t. Ref. note of 1:27.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@j%i@o%i@y%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@o%i@p%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@g%i@e…Lit: %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@t…Lit: %i@s%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@t%i@o. Here’s a mental picture: a football player (American football) who has a fumbled football and is holding onto it, with a pile of other players on top of him trying to pull it out of his hands, before the referee comes over.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@u%i@n%i@v%i@e%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@c…Lit: %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@u%i@t%i@m%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t…Lit: %i@f%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g. Ref. note of Eph. 6:5.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m…Lit: %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g [%i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m]. The definite article before %i@p%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ is put there as a short way to imply %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%I@Z%i@e%i@i%i@t%i@g%i@e%i@i%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@j%i@o%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@j%i@o%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r…Or: %i@r%i@e%i@j%i@o%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@j%i@o%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r. The GT is ambiguous, as the present and future forms in this case are identical. Since this is the apodosis of a conditional sentence, it doesn’t matter so much.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@r%i@y…Lit: %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@r%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@k%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@h%i@o%i@n%i@o%i@r…Also insinuates that they should pay his room and board when he’s there%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@A%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@,%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d. The word %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ is associated to %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e. In NT Gk., It’s common to have %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ come after a word such as %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@.%i@ This means that %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ is not associated to %I@G%i@o%i@d; some translations err in this manner and render these words “Wherefore God also” or “Therefore God, even God” (%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ appearing as %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ in this case).%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@g%i@a%i@v%i@e…Same word %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ as is used in 1:29; see note there. It was generous for God to hand over the keys to His kingdom to Jesus, but on the other hand, Jesus earned this by his obedience. Though the word %i@g%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ as used here points to God’s generosity, it does not negate the fact that Jesus earned a name above every name. God’s generosity was in the fact that He is willing to bestow an enormous amount of power on another person of the Trinity, not holding it for Himself. This is a reason why the three persons in the Trinity are one instead of three. Islam denies the Trinity because it says that the three persons in the Trinity would compete for power, but the insinuation in the word %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ here is that God the Father out of His generosity won’t vie for power but instead hands it over to the Son.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Philippians Chapter 3%hb~
          %u@1In conclusion%i@,%i@ my %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ comrades%u@[%u@a%u@], rejoice in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord. It’s no problem at all for me to write this over and over, and it’ll keep you from careening into a ditch.%vn~
          %u@2Look at the dogs (i.e., those who are worthless, contemptuous people who live like animals; those who are excluded from having a covenant with God) %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@p%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m, look at those who do evil, look at the anti-circumcision (i.e., those who think they have a covenant with God but the opposite is true). %u@3The fact of the matter is that we are the circumcision%u@[%U@A%u@] (i.e., you’re the ones who actually have a covenant with God), the ones who have a service of worship in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Spirit of God and make audacious remarks in Christ Jesus and have no confidence in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ flesh (i.e., in your own selves; in your abilities apart from God to please God; in your ability to gain God’s favor by simply following a list of rules; in your human credentials), %u@4although I have confidence in %i@t%i@h%i@e flesh. If some other person has confidence in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ flesh, I have more. %u@5Circumcised on the eighth day; an Israeli by race, of the tribe of Benjamin, a Hebrew %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ out %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e Hebrews; a Pharisee who %i@w%i@a%i@s %i@t%i@o%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g according to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s; %u@6as far as the intensity of his zeal%u@[%u@b%u@], %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s persecuting the church; as far as his pursuit of a righteousness (i.e., a means of standing before God and telling Him why He should approve of your life) which is generated by means of %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Law, faultless.%vn~
