          %u@7Never mind all that—whatever gain (i.e., advantages) I had, I consider it to be lost (i.e., to have been forfeited) on account of Christ. %u@8Oh, no, no—even I consider everything forfeited on account of the surpassing greatness and excellence of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord, on account of whom everything has been forfeited, and I consider %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ to be garbage and crap so that I may gain Christ %u@9and that I would be found in him not having my own righteousness, one which is derived%i@ from %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Law but instead one which is through %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ faith of Christ, which is a righteousness from God on the basis of the Faith— %u@1%u@0to come to know him and the power of his resurrection and the sharing of and participation in his sufferings, while being conformed to his death, %u@1%u@1if somehow I might attain the breaking free from and rising from the dead.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2Not that I’ve already attained %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t or have reached the point of perfection, but I’m chasing after %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ in the hope that I just might put %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ under my thumb, on the basis of me having been put under the thumb by Christ Jesus. %u@1%u@3Comrades, I don’t figure that I’ve reached the point where I’ve put these things under my thumb, but %I@I%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s one %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g: I forget about what’s behind me and press on to what lies ahead of me. %u@1%u@4I keep my eye on the ball%u@[%u@c%u@] and chase after the prize of God’s high calling in Christ Jesus. %u@1%u@5So any person at all who’s mature%u@[%u@d%u@], may we be of this opinion; and if you are of a different opinion, God will reveal this to you. %u@1%u@6In any event, %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ be diligent about maintaining what we’ve %i@a%i@l%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@y attained.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7Become people who imitate me, comrades, and pay careful attention to those who live their day to day lives using us as role-models. %u@1%u@8You see, many live their day to day lives %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@r, people whom I was constantly writing to you about, but now—even while crying—I’m telling you are the enemies of the cross of Christ, %u@1%u@9people whose destination %i@i%i@s%i@ destruction, whose god is their belly and who take delightful pride%u@[%u@e%u@] in their shame, who %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h thinking about earthly things. %u@2%u@0As far as we’re concerned, though, the country that we’re citizens of exists in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ heavens (i.e., in the spiritual domain and in heaven itself), from which we also eagerly await a savior, %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord Jesus Christ, to come out of, %u@2%u@1who will transform our humble, lowly, abased bodies into %i@a%u@[%u@f%u@] body of his glory done in a way which is consistent with him operating in what he’s capable of and with him making all things subject to himself.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@z%i@e%i@a%i@l…Lit: %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@z%i@e%i@a%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@e%i@y%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@l%i@l…Lit: %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o [%i@t%i@h%i@e] %i@g%i@o%i@a%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e…Or: %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@f%i@e%i@c%i@t. Max & Mary say this means %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@f%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ based on the occurrence of the same word in v. 12; Meyers says it means morally mature. This is due to Paul including himself in saying %i@m%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e a couple words later, when he said he’s not perfect in v. 12.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y [%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s]%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@a…Or: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@%fn~
%no~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@r%i@c%i@u%i@m%i@c%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n…Many biblical scholars believe that the Philippian church consisted of all women. If this is the case, then Paul is calling women “the circumcision,” which, physically speaking, only applies to men. This supports the notion that there are words in the Bible which, on the surface only apply to men, but in fact apply to both men and women.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Philippians Chapter 4%hb~
          %u@1…So%u@[%u@a%u@] my dear%i@ comrades%u@[%u@b%u@] whom I miss very much, my joy and my crowning achievement%u@[%u@c%u@], make your stand in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord this way, my beloved.%vn~
          %u@2I ask that Euodia and Syntyche compromise and live harmoniously%u@[%u@d%u@] in the Lord. %u@3Yes, and I ask you too, %i@m%i@y%i@ honest-to-goodness business partners%u@[%u@e%u@], help them, they who are the very ones who came and joined me in %i@h%i@e%i@l%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ the Gospel (i.e., the message I’m spreading), which includes Clement and the rest of my other fellow workers whose names are in %i@t%i@h%i@e Book of Life.%vn~
          %u@4Always rejoice in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord. I’ll say it again: rejoice. %u@5Let your courteous, generous, mild, gentle, kind, tolerant demeanor be made known to all people: the Lord is nearby.%vn~
          %u@6Don’t worry, be anxious, or have angst about anything, but instead in every situation and concerning everything %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d make your requests known to God by means of prayer and supplication with thanksgiving%u@[%u@f%u@], %u@7and the peace of God which transcends everything %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ mind and transcends all mental activity%u@[%u@g%u@] will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.%vn~
          %u@8In conclusion, comrades, whatsoever is true, whatsoever is honorable, whatsoever is right, whatsoever is pure, whatsoever is admirable, whatsoever is laudable—let %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s turn over in your head—let your mind crunch these thoughts—figure these things out—meditate on them. %u@9And what you learned, embraced%u@[%u@h%u@], heard, and saw in me, put these things into practice, and the God of peace will be with you.%vn~
          %u@1%u@0I was just thrilled in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord that your consideration for %i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@-%i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ I am has finally improved%u@[%u@i%u@], in the respect that you considered%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@f%i@a%i@i%i@r%i@s over and over again but time and again lacked the opportunity %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@l%i@p%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y. %u@1%u@1Not that I’m forced to speak this way out of lack, seeing that I’ve learned to be self-sufficient regardless of the situation I’m in. %u@1%u@2I know from firsthand experience both how it is to be humbled (i.e., live in a financially bankrupted or impoverished condition) and how it is to be prosperous: in each and every circumstance I’ve learned the secret of%u@[%u@j%u@] every one of these: %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@y filled, going hungry, prospering, and having a lack %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n: %u@1%u@3I can do anything by him who gives me the power. %u@1%u@4Nevertheless it was a good thing that you did in commiserating with, sharing in, and partaking of my difficulties.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5Now also, you know for a fact, Philippians, that in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ early days of the Gospel when I left Macedonia, no church participated in regard to this matter of giving and receiving except for you only, %u@1%u@6that once and again a second time %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ in Thessalonica you sent me %i@a %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@l%i@p%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ my needs. %u@1%u@7Not that I’m fishing for handouts%u@[%u@k%u@]—no—I’m seeking the Fruit which is being multiplied %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ to your account%u@[%U@A%u@]. %u@1%u@8But I have everything I need and then some, having been resupplied by Epaphroditus by those things %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ from you, a pleasant odor, an acceptable sacrifice, pleasing to God %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@. %u@1%u@9My God shall supply all your needs reflective of His riches in glory in Christ Jesus. %u@2%u@0But the glory %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ to our God and Father forever and ever. Amen (i.e., let us pause a moment for that finishing remark to sink in).%vn~
          %u@2%u@1Say hello to all the saints in Christ Jesus (i.e., those who believe in Christ) for me. The comrades with me extend their greetings to you %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l. %u@2%u@2All the saints say hello, especially those who belong to Caesar’s household.%vn~
          %u@2%u@3The grace of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%I@S%i@o…Thought continued from previous chapter%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@c%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@m%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@-%i@t%i@o%i@-%i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@-%i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w. Some scholars believe that %i@y%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@-%i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ is actually someone’s name (perhaps nickname?). Of note is that the word in the GT is singular and not plural as expected.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@s%i@g%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g…ref. note of 1 Tim. 2:1%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@s%i@u%i@r%i@p%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d. Emphasis is on taking it into you.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@i%i@m%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@c%i@r%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%I@N%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@s…Lit: %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@f%i@t%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@e%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@F%i@r%i@u%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t…This refers to the Scriptures (Prov. 11:24; Luke 6:38; 2 Cor. 9:8) which say that God gives material things back to those who are generous in giving material things.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m…There are several verses in the OT that use this language, and it’s used figuratively in the NT as well. Examples are Lev. 1:4,13, 17; 2:2,9,12; 3:5; 4:20,26, 35; 26:31; Rom. 12:1,2; 2 Cor. 2:15.
Colossians%ha~
       As mature, committed, and faithful that the churches in Ephesus and Philippi were, judging by the introductory part of Paul’s letter, the church in Colossae was on par with them, and one might argue more so. The entire first chapter is a discourse on who Jesus is and what he received by means of his death and resurrection. This knowledge is not revealed in the Gospels but is reserved for the epistles and forms a bedrock on the question of who Jesus was and is.%nv~
       But by the second chapter, Paul is dropping hints that there are a few, persuasive people among them who are steering them in the wrong direction. We find out that this is in regard to practices of the Law, but the warnings Paul gives are not as severe as what he told the Galatians.%nv~
       And Paul repeats the admonishments he gave to wives, husbands, children, and slaves same as what he gave the Ephesian church. He probably told all of his churches this.%nv~
       There’s nothing out of the ordinary to be found in the Greek text. A good depth of vocabulary, but Paul doesn’t get into heady points of philosophy one finds in some of his other epistles, which removes that difficulty from the translator’s plate.%nv~
%i@%sb~
Colossians Chapter 1%hb~
          %u@1%I@F%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ Paul %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ apostle of Christ Jesus through %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ will of God and %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ Comrade%u@[%u@a%u@] Timothy,%vn~
          %u@2To the saints (i.e., the believers in Christ)—what faithful comrades!%u@[%u@b%u@]—in Colossae,%vn~
      Grace and peace to you from our Father-God:%vn~
          %u@3While praying, we’re constantly thanking the Father-God of our Lord Jesus Christ for you, %u@4having heard about your faith in Christ Jesus and about the love you have for all the saints %u@5on account of the hope which is stashed away%u@[%u@c%u@] for you in the heavens (i.e., in the spiritual domain or in heaven itself), which you previously heard %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ in the Message of Truth %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s from the Gospel (i.e., the glad-tidings message of Christ), %u@6which is close by at our disposal, just as it is producing positive results and spreading%u@[%u@d%u@] in every %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ the world just as it is also %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ in us as well from the days you heard about it and came to recognize the grace of God %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ in %i@t%i@h%i@e truth, %u@7which is consistent with the way you were taught it by our dear servant Epaphras, who is a faithful deacon (i.e., servant entrusted with significant responsibilities) of Christ for matters pertaining to you, %u@8who also told us about your love in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Spirit.%vn~
          %u@9On account of this, since the days %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n you %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ heard %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@l%i@, we haven’t quit asking in prayer%u@[%u@e%u@] that you would be filled with a recognition and an arrived-at knowledge and understanding of His will in every sort of spiritual or Holy Spirit-related wisdom and understanding, %u@1%u@0%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@i%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ go about your lives in a totally pleasing manner worthy of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord, being productive in every good work and growing in a recognition and a more-precise knowledge and understanding of God, %u@1%u@1being powered with every kind of power imaginable%u@[%u@f%u@] reflective of the strength of His glory which He can bring to bear%u@[%u@g%u@] towards the goal of attaining every degree of steadfastness, perseverance, and patience imaginable, with joy %u@1%u@2thanking the Father %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n who caused%i@ us%i@ to be fit for and adequate %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e the portion of the inheritance of the saints in the light (i.e., the things which God has planned and intended specifically for His people who exist in the light)— %u@1%u@3He Who rescued us out of the authority of the darkness and transferred us to the kingdom of His beloved son, %u@1%u@4in whom we have the Redemption (i.e., God’s plan of restoring out lives), which is the forgiveness of sins— %u@1%u@5He who is a reflection%u@[%u@h%u@] of the Unseen God, the first-born who has the right of primogeniture%i@ over all creation, %u@1%u@6since in him all things were created in the heavens (i.e., the astronomical objects; things in the spiritual world; things in heaven itself) and upon the earth, the seen and the unseen, whether %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ thrones, lordships, rulers, or authorities%u@[%U@A%u@]—all things have been created through him, because of him, for him, and to him, %u@1%u@7and he’s before all things (i.e., takes the lead over, has priority over all things) and everything is banded together in him.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8And he’s the head of the body, %i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ of the church, %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n who is a ruler, a firstborn %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ out of the dead so that he himself would become a first born-primogeniture for everything, %u@1%u@9since it pleased %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ to have all fullness (i.e., the totality of power, of control, of judgment) take up residence and dwell in him, %u@2%u@0and through him to reconcile all things to Himself, having made peace through the blood of his cross, whether those things %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ on the Earth or those things are in the heavens.%vn~
          %u@2%u@1You, back then, were alienated and hostile in your thoughts and opinions%u@[%u@i%u@] %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ in the Evil Deeds, %u@2%u@2but now he has reconciled %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ in his body of plain, ordinary flesh%u@[%u@j%u@] through the death %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@w%i@e%i@n%i@t to present us holy, blameless, and irreproachable before Him (i.e., when scrutinized by Him), %u@2%u@3if you truly remain in the Faith grounded, stable, and unperturbed from the hope of the good message (the Gospel) you heard, which was preached to any warm body to be found anywhere%u@[%U@B%u@], %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ for which I Paul became a minister.%vn~
          %u@2%u@4At the present time I rejoice in the sufferings %I@I%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@u%i@r%i@e for your sakes, and contribute my fair share%u@[%u@k%u@] of Christ’s ordeal of hardship%u@[%u@l%u@] in my flesh for the sake of his body, which is the Church, %u@2%u@5which I became a servant%u@[%u@m%u@] of, entrusted with responsibilities reflective of the stewardship of God that was given to me, a stewardship given with the goal of you becoming fully developed%u@[%u@n%u@] %i@i%i@n the word of God, %u@2%u@6%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g the mystery which has been hidden from the ages (i.e., the different eras of history) and from the generations (i.e., the coming and going of a multitude of prevailing Zeitgeists), but now has been made manifest to His saints (i.e., His people), %u@2%u@7the people to whom God desired to make known and understood what the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles %i@i%i@s—which is Christ in you, the hope of glory— %u@2%u@8%i@a%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@y which%u@[%u@o%u@] we proclaim, warning, admonishing, and advising everyone to take heed and instructing everyone with every sort of wisdom (and a bit of craftiness) imaginable, so that we could make everyone into a final product of a person who’s%u@[%u@p%u@] fully developed in Christ. %u@2%u@9I’m also doing hard work towards that end, striving according to His working, a working which works in me in a powerful way.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%I@C%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@(%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@)%i@—%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@!%i@—%i@i%i@n%i@ %I@C%i@o%i@l%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s. A hendiadys; ref. Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y…Also: %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@l%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@u%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@a%i@s%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@a%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@g%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@a%i@r…Also: %i@m%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@f%i@l%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@a%i@g%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h. A figure of speech (an antimereia)%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@p. An expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p…Lit: %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@o%i@n. Ref. note of 1 Cor. 15:24.%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@o%i@p%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d; %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h…Or: %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@m. The GT is ambiguous%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@’%i@s…Lit: %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e. The picture here is of a person being presented before a figure in power (perhaps even God Himself) for inspection. The person presented is made ready for the big day.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s…These are defined in note of 1 Cor. 15:24. One infers from this passage and other passages that Paul’s talking about both human and angelic (more specifically, demonic) positions, as we know from Eph. 1:21; 6:12 that “rulers and authorities” refers to demonic beings.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@r%i@m%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n [%i@s%i@k%i@y]. Liberties taken. %I@H%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ is singular here (plural elsewhere in this chapter) and it has a definite article, so heaven refers to the sky here and not any of the other meanings for the Gk. word for heaven. Like in Mark 16:15, 2 Cor. 5:17 %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ is a metonymy which refers to people and not to the actual creation. This phrase “to all creation under the sky” is an idiom. “Under the sky” and smacks of “under the sun” as used in Eccl. 1:9. The entire idiom means that the Gospel was preached to every sort of person there is and every in every kind of place there is.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Colossians Chapter 2%hb~
          %u@1The fact of the matter is that I want you to know how great a conflict I have on your behalf and on the behalf of those in Laodicea and whoever hasn’t met me face-to-face, %u@2so that their hearts would be encouraged and comforted, having been united by love and with the goal of %i@a%i@c%i@q%i@u%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g all %i@t%i@h%i@e riches %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e from a maturity%u@[%u@a%u@] of understanding, with the goal of %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ a recognition and a more precise understanding of God’s mystery Christ, %u@3in whom all the repositories and treasures of wisdom and understanding are hidden away. %u@4This I say so that no one would reason otherwise and beguile you using clever arguments. %u@5Though I’m physically absent, I’m with you by means of the Spirit, rejoicing and seeing the discipline and steadfastness%u@[%u@b%u@] of your faith in Christ.%vn~
          %u@6So as you received (i.e., whole-heartedly embraced and drawn into your heart) Christ Jesus the Lord, go about your daily lives in him (i.e., melded with him), %u@7rooted and built up in him and established in the Faith consistent with the way you were taught, all the while brimming with thankfulness. %u@8See to it that not a one of you gets captivated through the use of the philosophy and worthlessness of cunning deception, delusion, and deceit in line with human tradition, in line with elementary principles of the world (i.e., the prevalent idea of God accepting you based on how well you follow the list of do’s and don’ts) and not in line with Christ%u@9—Because in him dwells all the fullness of the Being Who is God in a bodily form, %u@1%u@0and you’ve been brought to your fullness in him, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e who is the head of every person or being who is a ruler or who has a position of delegated power%u@[%u@c%u@], %u@1%u@1%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e in whom you have been circumcised (i.e., inaugurated into a covenant) into a circumcision (i.e., a covenant) that wasn’t performed by a human hand (i.e., in a ritual that wasn’t performed by a human being like actual circumcision is) by the removal of that flesh-infested body%u@[%u@d%u@] (i.e., the removal of that carnal, I-can-do-it-myself-without-God human nature locked up in the body) by the circumcision of Christ (i.e., by analogy removing the carnality and do-it-yourself nature like removing the foreskin in circumcision), %u@1%u@2having been buried with him in the %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@n%i@ baptism, %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@ in which you were also co-resurrected through the Belief which believes in the work that God does, Who raised him from the dead. %vn~
          %u@1%u@3And while you were %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ being dead in the trespasses and the uncircumcision (i.e., the absence of a covenant with God) of your flesh, He made you alive together with him, forgiving you all the trespasses %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n, %u@1%u@4after he completely erased the promissory note %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t the decrees which were against us, he personally took it out of the picture and nailed it to the cross. %u@1%u@5Having publicly stripped rulers and authorities clean %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@—%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@s, he made an example out of them and made them a public spectacle.%vn~
          %u@1%u@6So let no one decide for you%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ eat or drink, or decide %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ on the topic of %i@r%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@g%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ festivals, start of a new month %i@c%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@b%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s, or holidays%u@[%U@A%u@], %u@1%u@7that which is a shadow of what’s to come but the body %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@d%i@o%i@w%i@ is Christ’s%u@[%U@B%u@]. %u@1%u@8Let no one rob you of what’s rightfully yours%i@ by pushing an unassuming, self-abasing demeanor and a cult-like worship of the angelic beings%u@[%u@e%u@], getting off into tangents about what he’s seen %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@y%i@e%i@s, exaggerated for no reason by his carnality-riddled mind%u@[%u@f%u@], %u@1%u@9and not staying attached to%u@[%u@g%u@] the head, from which every %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ the body, replenished and joined together by means of the joints and ligaments, grows in a way that’s God’s kind of growth%u@[%u@h%u@].%vn~
          %u@2%u@0If you died with Christ to%u@[%u@i%u@] the elementary principles of the world, why is it—as though you’re still living in the world %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@i%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@l%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@s—that you subject yourselves to codified rules… %u@2%u@1”Don’t touch with intent of use, don’t eat, don’t have any physical contact with whatsoever%u@[%u@j%u@] %u@2%u@2(%i@r%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g everything that wears out with use, %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s)”…reflective of human commandments and teachings? %u@2%u@3These things are in a category of things which—yes—contain wisdom in %i@r%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o do-it-yourself cult-worship and in maintaining an unassuming, self-abasing demeanor and in treating the body harshly, but are of no value %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@f%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ to conciliate the flesh. %i@%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@d%i@i%i@s%i@c%i@i%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@f%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s…Lit: %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@l%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@t. These are military terms which describe the formation of soldiers in a phalanx, for example.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y. Ref. note of 1 Cor. 15:24.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@-%i@i%i@n%i@f%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h. A figure of speech (an antimereia). Ref. Col. 1:22.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s…What we know as “angels” are often called “angels of God” in the NT to distinguish them from other angelic beings. This has no such a qualifier.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@-%i@r%i@i%i@d%i@d%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h. A figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o…Lit: %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@g%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d. A figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@t%i@o…Lit: %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%I@D%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@h%i@y%i@s%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@s%i@o%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r…Ref. note of 1 Cor. 7:1%i@%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@g%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@w%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@c%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@b%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@i%i@d%i@a%i@y%i@s…Lit: %i@f%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@w%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@s. These are festivities prescribed by the Law of Moses and are mentioned several times in the OT. An example is the prophet Hosea in Hos. 2:11, “I will also cause all her mirth to cease, her feast days, her new moons, and her Sabbaths, and all her solemn feasts” (KJV). Just as Hosea described these with the word “mirth,” these are all holidays and celebrations, but celebrations and holidays which are commanded by the Law.%u@%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@d%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@d%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@’%i@s…Much of the Law of Moses was arcane rules that only makes sense in light of this clarification, that they were hints, symbols, and foreshadowings of what was to come, but the essence is in Christ. This reinforces what Paul said in Gal. 3:24. %fn~
%i@%sb~
Colossians Chapter 3%hb~
          %u@1So if you were raised together with Christ, continually seek the things above where Christ is seated (i.e., occupying a position of authority), %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ at the right hand of God (i.e., God’s chief executive). %u@2Think on the things above, not on the things on Earth (i.e., think about things which have spiritual virtue and not things which are carnal). %u@3The fact of the matter is that you died and your life has been hidden together with Christ in God. %u@4When Christ—our life—is manifested, at that time we too will be manifested together with him in glory.%vn~
          %u@5So put to death the on-Earth members (i.e., the parts of you which are prone to carnality)…fornication (i.e., sexual immorality of any sort); uncleanness (i.e., filthy, nasty, disgusting behavior of any sort; lewd, crude, crass, foul-mouthed, disgusting untidiness, abject neglect of personal hygiene; disgusting references to or treatment of bodily functions); passion (i.e., strong, out-of-control emotion or passionate desire which takes ascendency over logical thinking); bad, wrong, or evil desire; and greed, which is a thing in particular which amounts to%u@[%u@a%u@] idolatry. %u@6Because of these things the wrath of God comes upon the sons of disobedience%u@[%u@b%u@] (i.e., those who make it their job to be disobedient). %u@7Back then you too went about your daily lives %i@e%i@n%i@g%i@a%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s when you were continually seeking %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@d%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f these things. %u@8But lay aside every one of these things right now…vindictiveness (i.e., heightened anger in regard to punishment; a focus on retribution; a strong desire to make someone pay for what they did or to get even); wrath (i.e., a hot, out-of-control temper; unwarranted outburst of anger); malice (ill-will; desire to injure; being just plain bad); blasphemy (i.e., swearing at someone, trash-talking someone, smearing or slandering the reputation of someone); potty-mouth (i.e., speaking obscenities; cursing; swearing);%vn~
       %u@9Don’t lie to each other, now that you’ve renounced the old-self%u@[%u@c%u@] along with its practices %u@1%u@0and have put on the new-%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@, which is constantly being renewed to a recognition and a more precise knowledge and understanding reflective of the image of the One who created %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@w%i@-%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f, %u@1%u@1where there’s not Greek (i.e., one who’s view of life was shaped by the philosophies and lifestyles of the ancient western civilizations) and Jew, circumcised (i.e., those who follow the Law of Moses and expect to have a relationship with God because of this) and uncircumcised (i.e., those who have no relationship with God), barbarian (i.e., the foreign, uncivilized, uneducated, uncultured), Scythian (i.e., the wild, savage, ferocious), slave (i.e., who are also the menial servants, the lowest of the low, the bottommost caste), freeman (i.e., working or middle-class)—uh-uh, every little bit of everything%u@[%u@d%u@] %i@i%i@s%i@ Christ.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2So as %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ chosen of God, saints and beloved, put on (%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@!%u@[%u@e%u@]) deep-down pity, kindness, humility, a gentleness which comes from restraint, patience, %u@1%u@3putting up with one another and forgiving each other if anyone happens to have an issue with somebody. %u@1%u@4But on top of all these things, %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ the love %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d, which ties everything up into a tidy package%u@[%u@f%u@].%vn~
          %u@1%u@5Let the peace of Christ rule in your hearts, peace for the purpose of you having been called %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ in one body—and get to where you’re thankful also. %u@1%u@6Let Christ’s message%u@[%u@g%u@] dwell on the inside of you richly, with all %i@t%i@h%i@e wisdom %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r instructing and admonishing yourselves %i@i%i@n %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs%u@[%u@h%u@] (i.e., popular songs accompanied by instruments, songs of praise, and songs which consist of prophetic manifestations of the Holy Spirit, including singing in tongues), singing to God with joy in your hearts. %u@1%u@7And every one of the things you so happen to do, %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@d%i@o in speech or in action, do everything in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ name of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord Jesus (i.e., do it as though Jesus told you to do it; do it as though it’s part of your Christian duty; do it knowing you have blessing of Jesus to do it), giving thanks to the Father-God through him.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8Wives, submit%u@[%u@i%u@] to %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r husbands as is proper in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord.%vn~
          %u@1%u@9Husbands, love %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r wives and don’t be cruel, harsh, hateful, or severe with them.%vn~
          %u@2%u@0Children, obey your parents in all respects; this is pleasing to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord, you see.%vn~
          %u@2%u@1Fathers, do not exasperate your children, so that they not grow despondent.%vn~
          %u@2%u@2Slaves, obey those who are your bosses, physically-speaking, in all respects, not just making the boss think you’re doing a good job when he’s looking and acting up when he’s not%u@[%u@j%u@], but rather in a simplicity of heart (i.e., a heart which doesn’t rely on convoluted justifications; has no ulterior motives; attaches no strings; isn’t driven by fear, guilt, remorse, etc.), having a deep reverence%u@[%u@k%u@] of the Lord. %u@2%u@3That which you happen to be doing, work it from %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ soul as to the Lord and not to humans, %u@2%u@4knowing for a fact that you will receive from %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord the reward of the inheritance (i.e., of what God has intended specifically for you)—You serve by means of the Lord Christ. %u@2%u@5Furthermore, %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ the wrong-doer %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d: what he did wrong will come back to haunt him%u@[%u@l%u@], irrespective of who the wrong-doer is%u@[%u@m%u@].%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@b%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e…There’s doubt whether this was in the autograph or added later, as some of the best manuscripts omit it.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@-%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f…Lit: %i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l. An idiom, also used in Eph. 1:23.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@!…Insinuated by the verb tense of %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@a%i@g%i@e…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e…Also: %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@h%i@y%i@m%i@n%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@s…Ref. note of Eph. 5:19%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@s%i@u%i@b%i@m%i@i%i@t…Ref. note of Eph. 5:22%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@b%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t…Lit: %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@y%i@e%i@-%i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@-%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e…Also: %i@f%i@e%i@a%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@i%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@d%i@o%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@s…Lit: %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@v%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%fn~
%i@%sb~
Colossians Chapter 4%hb~
          %u@1Bosses, maintain a level of treatment for %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r slaves and menial servants which is fair, consistent, and impartial%u@[%u@a%u@], knowing full-well that you have a boss too, a boss in heaven.%vn~
          %u@2Give constant attention to prayer, staying focused in it%i@ with thanksgiving, %u@3while at the same time praying for us, so that God would create an opportunity for us for the word%u@[%u@b%u@], %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ to speak the mystery of Christ (and also on account of which I’ve been bound) %u@4so that I’d put out there the same as what I have to say.%vn~
          %u@5Go about your day to day lives with wisdom towards those on the outside, squeezing every drop out of the %i@l%i@i%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@d time you have%u@[%u@c%u@]. %u@6%I@L%i@e%i@t%i@ your statements always %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ in grace which is flavored with salt (i.e., given in an air of mercy, generosity, and forgiveness but not without getting your point across), being acutely aware just how much%u@[%u@d%u@] you must answer for each and every %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t.%vn~
          %u@7My dear comrade%u@[%u@e%u@], faithful deacon (i.e., assistant trusted with significant responsibilities), and fellow-worker in the Lord Tychicus will fill you in on everything that’s going on with me, %u@8whom I sent to you for that %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n, so that you would know what we’re up to and that he could encourage, advise, and comfort your hearts, %u@9together with the faithful and dear comrade Onesimus, who’s one of your people. They’ll fill you in on everything that’s going on here.%vn~
          %u@1%u@0Aristarchus extends his greetings, as does Barnabas’s cousin Mark, whom you’ve received instructions about: if he happens to come your way, welcome him and take him in wholeheartedly. %vn~
          %u@1%u@1Jesus, who goes by “Justus,” also says hello. These alone are the only ones who are from the circumcision (i.e., who are from the group who are Jews and are committed to live by their rules) who are my coworkers in the kingdom of God—people in particular who’ve consoled me.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2Epaphras says hello, who’s one of your people, a servant of Christ Jesus, always vying for you in %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ prayers so that you would stand mature%u@[%u@f%u@] and absolutely convinced of the will of God in all aspects. %u@1%u@3Take my word when I tell you he has %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@g%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ much toil and drudgery for you, for those in Laodicea, and for those in Hierapolis.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4Luke the Dear Physician and Demas extend their greetings. %u@1%u@5Say hello to the comrades in Laodicea and to Nympha and the church which is at her house. %u@1%u@6And when you’re all gathered and%i@ the letter’s read aloud to you, do %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@r%i@y%i@ so that it’s also read in the church in Laodicea; and %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@o%i@d%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@a%i@,%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ from Laodicea so that you read %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@ as well.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7Tell Archippus, “Keep your eye on%u@[%u@g%u@] the ministry which you received in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord, so that it’ll be carried out to completion.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@8%I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ the greeting-%i@s%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ in my own handwriting, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ of Paul.%vn~
      Remember my%i@ bonds.%vn~
      %I@M%i@a%i@y%i@ the grace %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e with you.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@l…Lit: %i@e%i@q%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@u%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d…Lit: %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@s%i@q%i@u%i@e%i@e%i@z%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@e%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g [%i@b%i@u%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k] %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e. An idiom.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@c%i@h…Lit: %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@w%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@y%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@%fn~

1 Thessalonians%ha~
       Scholars believe that this epistle here is the first of Paul’s. There are both praises and admonishments, but not as severe as what the Corinthians received.%nv~
       The longing Paul has to see those “dear to us” (2:8), his “pride and joy” (2:20), the steps he took so that he “wouldn’t a burden on any of you” (2:9) permeate this letter. The longing is reiterated this way: “How can we possibly thank God enough for you for all the joy we’ve been elated with in the presence of God because of you” (3:9).%nv~
       This longing of one Christian to see another Christian has withered and died in the church in America, another indication of her decline.%nv~
       But towards the end of the book, a couple of things which seem out of place leap out at the reader. The first is Paul having to address a problem of sexual immorality—and it appears to have been adultery—in the church. Though a spiritual church, it was not without its glaring, peculiar faults. Second is an answer to one of their questions, namely how will they known when the end will come. Perhaps the mystery is not why this church asked this question but why few if any of Paul’s other churches didn’t. %nv~
       The underlying text is consistent with what he sent to the Colossians, as the two churches are similar, and Paul’s writing style is likewise similar.%nv~
%i@%sb~
1 Thess. Chapter 1%hb~
          %u@1%I@F%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ Paul, Silas, and Timothy:%vn~
      To the church of Thessalonica in the Father-God and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord Jesus Christ:%vn~
      Grace to you and peace.%vn~
          %u@2We’re always thanking God for all of you, bringing you up in prayer%u@[%u@a%u@], continuously %u@3remembering your work of the Faith, your toil of the Love %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d, and your steadfastness of the hope of our Lord Jesus Christ in the sight of%u@[%u@b%u@] our God and Father, %u@4knowing full-well, comrades loved by God, your selection (i.e., God’s selection of you to be His), %u@5that our Gospel, the glad-tidings message %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@e%i@w%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r, did not present itself to us in word only but also in %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@ power and in the Holy Spirit and with much conviction, just as you know full-well what sort of men we turned out to be %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ among you throughout %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h you.%vn~
          %u@6And you became %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e who imitate us and the Lord, having received (i.e., having fully embraced) the word in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@d%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ a good deal of tribulation %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ with %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ joy of the Holy Spirit, %u@7so much so that you turned out to be a role-model for all the believers in Macedonia and in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@R%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ Asia.%vn~
          %u@8In fact the word of the Lord sounded forth from you (i.e., you loudly and thoroughly announced, advertised, and disseminated the word of the Lord) not just in Macedonia and in Asia but in every place your faith in%u@[%u@c%u@] God went out, so much so that there’s no need for us to be doing any more talking. %u@9Furthermore, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@A%i@s%i@i%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@ personally are letting everyone know what an impact we’ve had on you%u@[%u@d%u@], and how you turned to God, %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ from the idols %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g to serve %i@a%i@ living and true God %u@1%u@0and to wait for His son %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ out of heaven%u@[%u@e%u@], whom He raised from the dead, Jesus who’s rescuing us from the coming wrath.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@b%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u. A bit of a stretch for the definition.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@s%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Thess. Chapter 2%hb~
          %u@1In fact you yourselves know full-well, comrades%u@[%u@a%u@], that the impact we had on you wasn’t a waste of time, %u@2rather, having suffered before and having been treated with insolence (as you’re well aware), in Philippi we were emboldened in our God to tell you God’s good-news message, the Gospel, while in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f a lot of opposition. %u@3In fact, our encouragement was not from %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ error or from an uncleanness (i.e., something dirty, impure, or something one should stay away from), nor did it exist in deceit or guile, %u@4but instead it’s in line with the way we’ve been granted by God to be entrusted with the Gospel—that’s the way we speak, not like we’re speaking to people in a way where we’re trying to make them happy but like we’re speaking to God %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@y instead, Who approves or disapproves %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n our hearts. %u@5For there was never a time when we showed up with a flattering message (as you’re well aware), nor %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g a pretext for covetousness—so help me God%u@[%u@b%u@]— %u@6nor %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ seeking prestige or fame%u@[%u@c%u@], not from you or from anyone else, %u@7%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h, as Christ’s apostles,%i@ we’re capable of throwing our weight around%u@[%u@d%u@]. Instead, we became infants %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ in your midst. The way a nursing mother cherishes her own children %u@8is the same way that we, having a strong yearning for you, thought it well to share not only the Gospel of God but also the things that make %i@u%i@s live and breathe%u@[%U@A%u@] themselves. Therefore, you became dear to us.%vn~
          %u@9Furthermore, recollect, comrades, our back-breaking labor and toil: we worked day and night%u@[%u@e%u@] so that we wouldn’t be a burden on any of you. %I@U%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@r%i@c%i@u%i@m%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@s we preached the Gospel of God to you. %u@1%u@0You—and God—can attest to just how pious, correct, and faultless the demeanor was that we presented to you who are believers. %u@1%u@1Just as you know from experience that %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ each one of you like a father %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@s his own children, %u@1%u@2%i@w%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ comforting, exhorting, advising, consoling, cheering, and issuing statements%u@[%u@f%u@] for you to conduct your day to day lives in a manner worthy of God, Who calls us to His Own kingdom and glory.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3And we thank God continuously because of this as well, since, having received (i.e., wholeheartedly embraced) God’s message (His systematic reasoning; His word) verbally communicated%u@[%u@g%u@] from us %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u, you didn’t receive a man-made message but instead %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ just as %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@s: God’s true message, %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ which is%u@[%u@h%u@] also at work in you who believe.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4You see comrades, you followed the pattern set by the churches of God in Christ Jesus which are in Judea, in that you too suffered the same things %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ by your own countrymen like %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ by %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ Judeans, %u@1%u@5who also killed the Lord Jesus and the %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ prophets and persecuted us. %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@y%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ are not pleasing to God; they are against all of humanity%u@[%u@i%u@], %u@1%u@6hindering us from getting to speak to the Gentiles so that they could be saved (i.e., receive Christ as savior), the end-result being that every time they commit sin, they do it to the maximum extent%u@[%u@j%u@]; the wrath %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ came upon them to the utmost.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7But we, comrades, bereft of you for a short while%u@[%u@k%u@]—bereft from being there in person with you and not bereft of heart—with tremendous desire we all the more hastened to see your faces. %u@1%u@8Therefore we wanted to visit you—certainly %I@I%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d, Paul—%I@I%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s once or twice but Satan thwarted us.%vn~
          %u@1%u@9The fact of the matter is this: Who is our hope, our joy, or trophy%u@[%u@l%u@] which we beam with pride over—if not you—yes you—%i@j%i@o%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ in the presence of%u@[%u@m%u@] our Lord with his coming? %u@2%u@0You are our pride and joy%u@[%u@n%u@], you see.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@s%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@l%i@p%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d…Lit: %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@n. Max & Mary claim the former.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t…Lit: %i@n%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y. Jewish reckoning inverts the ordering.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s…Also: %i@a%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@r%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@;%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@b%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@u%i@n%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d…Or: %i@a%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@b%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ which is…Or possibly: %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %I@W%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@s. There’s some ambiguity whether the antecedent of %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ or %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ is %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ or %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@.%i@ Ambiguity is resolved by proximity.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n [%i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e]%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@x%i@i%i@m%i@u%i@m%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@a%i@l%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@p. This is an idiom, also appearing in Gen. 15:16; Dan. 8:23; Matt. 23:32.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s. The GT is more poetic.%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@y…Lit: %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@y…Lit: %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@y%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e…Also: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s [Gk. %i@p%i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ā, (ψυχή/Strong’s 5590)]. This verse sheds light on the meaning of %i@p%i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ā%i@,%i@ from which the English words %i@p%i@s%i@y%i@c%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@o%i@g%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@p%i@s%i@y%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@,%i@ etc. are derived. %I@P%i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ā%i@ means “mind, soul, and emotions”. It is also is surrogate used to refer to a person. This carries over into English if, for example, a ship sank, we might say, “there were 25 souls that perished.” Using %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@ instead of %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ emphasizes the fact that the people mentioned had a life-essence to them. They had families, friends; they had interesting aspects to their personality; they had a will; they had a thirst for life which manifested itself in various way; they were real people. Also, ref. not of 1 Cor. 2:14.%i@%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Thess. Chapter 3%hb~
          %u@1In light of this, as we could no longer stand it, we thought it best to stay behind in Athens by ourselves, %u@2and %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ sent Timothy, our comrade%u@[%u@a%u@] and fellow-worker of God in the Gospel (i.e. the good-news message) of Christ, for the purpose of getting you to stand on your own two feet and encouraging, advising, and comforting you in regard to your faith %u@3so as to not be agitated or emotionally upset in these times of distress; in fact, you yourselves know full-well that this is our fate in life. %u@4Furthermore, when we were with you, we kept telling you ahead of the fact that hard times are coming, just as it both happened and you know for a fact %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d. %u@5Because of this and because I couldn’t stand it any longer, I made inquiries to ascertain%u@[%u@b%u@] your faith, lest somehow the Temptor tempted you and our labor turned out to be for nothing.%vn~
          %u@6Just now Timothy arrived here at our place coming from your place and gave us good news %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o your faith and your love and %i@g%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@w%i@s that you always remember us in a good way, longing to see us just we %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ to see you. %u@7Because of this we were encouraged and comforted, comrades, in %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t you on account of your faith %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@-%i@b%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@k at%u@[%u@c%u@] all our needs and afflictions, %u@8because we’re infused with life and vitality now%u@[%u@d%u@] if it is the case that you stand in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord. %u@9In fact, how can we possibly thank God enough%u@[%u@e%u@] for you for all the joy we’ve been elated with in the presence of%u@[%u@f%u@] God because of you, %u@1%u@0day and night begging %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r over and beyond the point of excess to see your face and repair the deficiencies of your faith?%vn~
          %u@1%u@1%I@M%i@a%i@y%i@ our God and our Father and our Lord Jesus set us on a straight course to %i@s%i@e%i@e you.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2May the Lord %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ to abound and increase in the love %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ to one another and to all people, just as we also %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@w to you, %u@1%u@3with the end-goal of establishing your hearts blameless in holiness under the scrutiny of%u@[%u@f%u@] our God and Father in the coming of our Lord Jesus with all his saints (i.e., his followers).%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@q%i@u%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@c%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@t…Lit: %i@a%i@t; %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@f%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w…Lit: %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f…%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Thess. Chapter 4%hb~
          %u@1In conclusion, comrades%u@[%u@a%u@], we ask you in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord—plead with you—that you go to higher and higher levels%u@[%u@b%u@] in your being pleasing to God in your day to day lives in a way which is consistent with %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ you received from us (which is consistent with the way you are %i@c%i@u%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@l%i@y%i@ living your lives). %u@2The fact of the matter is that you know some %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ instructions we gave you through the Lord Jesus. %u@3In fact, this is %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ will of God (your holiness %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d!): %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ for you to abstain from the fornication %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@r%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ (i.e., by the loose sexual morals we all know about);%i@ %u@4for each of you to know how to gain possession and keep possession of his own personal container%u@[%u@c%u@] (i.e., his body, the container for his soul and spirit) in holiness and dignity%u@[%u@d%u@], %u@5not in an intense, all-consuming feeling of lust%u@[%U@A%u@] (just like the Gentiles who don’t know God) %u@6%i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ in not stepping out of line%u@[%u@e%u@] and taking advantage of or defrauding his %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@-comrade in the matter%u@[%U@B%u@] %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@x%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y. Because of this the Lord %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@ vengeance %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@ pertaining to these %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@g%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s, consistent with the way we told you previously, telling it in a dead-serious manner. %u@7The fact of the matter is that God has not called you to uncleanness (i.e., God’s intention for your life in His kingdom was not to commit filthy, disgusting deeds) but rather %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ in holiness. %u@8Consequently, he who disregards %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@d isn’t disregarding a human being but %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@r%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ God instead, Who gives His Holy Spirit to you.%vn~
          %u@9Now about brotherly-love (i.e., having strong likings for other comrades%u@[%U@C%u@]): you don’t need to have %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@v%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@ written to you %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@j%i@e%i@c%i@t, seeing that you yourselves are God-instructed in the love one %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ another. %u@1%u@0In fact, you also %i@e%i@x%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@d the same practices to all the comrades all over Macedonia. We beg you, comrades, to do even more %u@1%u@1and make it a goal to be still (i.e., not be stirred by loud, negative emotions), to do your own things (i.e., concentrate on your own lives), and to work with your own hands (i.e., don’t rely on others to do your work), %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s in line with the way we recommended, %u@1%u@2so that the way you conduct your lives would leave a good impression on those on the outside and so that you won’t need anything.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3We don’t want you to be kept in the dark, comrades, about those who sleep (i.e., the believers who are already dead), so that you won’t grieve like the others, the ones who have no hope. %u@1%u@4To this point, if we believe that Jesus died and rose %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ also%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ God will take those who sleep through Jesus (i.e., those who died trusting in Jesus) along together with him the same way. %u@1%u@5In fact, we’re telling you this in %i@a%i@ word of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord (i.e., in a prophetic message from the Lord): you the living who remain %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@E%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h until%u@[%u@f%u@] the coming of the Lord will absolutely not arrive %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ before those who sleep, %u@1%u@6because the Lord himself—with the shout of a command%u@[%u@g%u@] by the voice of an archangel and by God’s bugle call—will come down from heaven, and first the dead in Christ will be resurrected (i.e., brought back to life), %u@1%u@7then you who are alive who remain %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@E%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@ will be taken together with them %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@i%i@t into %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ clouds to a meeting with the Lord in the air—And that’s the way we’ll always be with %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8The bottom line is that we should comfort and exhort each other with these words.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@g%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@s…Lit: %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@r…Also: %i@v%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@l. Like the way it’s used in 2 Cor. 4:7, this refers to our body.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@d%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@y…Also: %i@h%i@o%i@n%i@o%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@p%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l…Lit: %i@t%i@o. As though heading towards a destination.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@d…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@-%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@l%i@u%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@r%i@e [%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@t]. It’s normal for a person to have sexual desire, even a strong desire, but Paul’s talking about a desire that’s been amplified beyond normal amounts of sexual desire (strong as that may be). The Gk. word %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ is also used to describe the passion of the pain and suffering of death, like the passion of Christ when he was crucified—this is how strong of a word it is. Sexual predators and sex offenders reach this point, the point where their passion of desire takes control of them and they commit criminal acts. A couple notches down, it will also cause the ordinary person to conduct immoral acts.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@e%i@p%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@f%i@r%i@a%i@u%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@-%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r…Applying logic to this statement here from v. 6 in relationship to the passage as a whole, Paul is telling those in the church not to “defraud” their fellow brother in Christ, and this in relationship to sexual morals. There are two possibilities: first, Paul could be talking about a man having an affair with another man’s wife. Second, Paul could be talking about a man sleeping with the young, unmarried daughter of another man. I believe it’s more likely that Paul is talking about the former than the latter. Therefore, the definition of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ (v. 3) is adulterous liaisons. This added with the additional evidence from 1 Cor. 5:1 suggest that the word %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ as used in the NT is talking about grossly immoral sexual acts. Or, put another way, when Paul addresses the issue here and in 1 Cor. 5:1, he’s talking about something which is grossly immoral. The church, however, makes no distinction between sexual acts which are grossly immoral and those which are mildly immoral when applying the word %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@.%i@ They should.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@l%i@o%i@v%i@e. This Gk. word is a compound where the second word %i@l%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@ is the Gk. word %i@p%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@o%i@s (φίλος /Strong’s 5384) and not %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@p%i@ā%i@ (ἀγάπη/Strong’s 26). Philos differs from agapā in that philos is a love for a person because of how likeable they are, whereas agapā sees value in a person sometimes in spite of how unlikeable they are. Note that the word for %i@l%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@ at the end of v. 10 is agapā, not philos.%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Thess. Chapter 5%hb~
          %u@1Concerning the times (i.e., the year, day, or month significant events will occur) and the seasons (i.e., the atmosphere that defines the era events occur in; the climate the events occur in), comrades%u@[%u@a%u@], you don’t need %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ to write to you %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g; %u@2the fact is that you know full well in yourselves and to a tee that %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e day of the Lord is that it comes in the same way as a thief in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ night %i@h%i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@n%i@s. %u@3When they (i.e., everybody out there) are saying, “Peace and security,” then suddenly and unexpectedly destruction and ruin are perched on top of them %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m just like labor pains %i@s%i@u%i@d%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ a pregnant woman and there’s no way she can run away %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ and escape %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m. %u@4But you, comrades, aren’t in darkness (i.e., you aren’t being kept in the dark about this) so that %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t day would overwhelm you%u@[%u@b%u@] like a thief %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d; %u@5for you all %i@a%i@r%i@e sons of (i.e., you adopt the characteristics of) light and sons of day—We aren’t %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ of night or %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ of darkness.%vn~
          %u@6So then don’t sleep (i.e., becoming spiritually dormant) like everyone else, but be watchful (i.e., stay focused) and sober (i.e., don’t let anything degrade your heightened state of alertness) instead. %u@7You see, those who sleep do their sleeping at night, and those who are drunkards do their drinking at night. %u@8But you’re in a state where you’re sober during the day, now that you’ve put on a breast-plate of faith and love and a helmet %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ hope of salvation (i.e., of escaping destruction, in this context the wrath of God), %u@9because God didn’t put us in a position that’s towards wrath%u@[%u@c%u@] but %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s acquiring salvation (i.e., acquiring a means of escape, in this context from the wrath of God) through our Lord Jesus Christ, %u@1%u@0who died for us so that whether we happen to watch (i.e., remain alive and stay focused) or whether we happen to sleep (i.e., die) we would live together %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e with him. %u@1%u@1In light of this, comfort one another and edify each other one-on-one just like you’re already doing.%vn~
