The children that God gave me and I %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@4So since the children have flesh and blood%u@[%u@h%u@] in common and share in it, just the same he also partook of the same%u@[%u@i%u@] %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@d so that by the death %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@s he would render him who has the power of death (the devil, that is) powerless %u@1%u@5and would set them free, %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ every and anybody who was subject to slavery throughout his entire life by the fear of death.%vn~
          %u@1%u@6Furthermore, angels of course didn’t take it upon themselves %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@s, but instead the seed (i.e., the direct-descendant) of Abraham took it upon himself. %u@1%u@7The reason he had to be made into a person who’s just like all of %i@h%i@i%i@s brothers is so that he would become a merciful, faithful, and reliable high priest in things that are relevant to or which involve God, leading to atoning%u@[%u@j%u@] for the sins of the folk-people. %u@1%u@8In this regard, by the thing in which he has suffered, being subjected to a trial %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@s, he is able to come to the rescue of those who, on an ongoing basis, are subjected to trials, tests, and temptations.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@s%i@l%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@s…Lit: %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e [%i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e] %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@c%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@f%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@o%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Also: %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@g%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@c%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@t…This is the same verb %i@e%i@n%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@ used in v. 2, and usage here in v. 3 has the same meaning as the usage in v. 2.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@e%i@t…Appears in 1:13 also. An expression used throughout the Bible. Picture a hunter who shot a large game animal standing with one foot on top of the animal as he holds his gun in the other hand.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t; %i@d%i@e%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@c%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@t%i@l%i@e…Lit: %I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@d…Lit: %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e…As the Gk. uses a plural form, it must refer to flesh and blood%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@a%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@i%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g; %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n…Ref. Matt. 8:20 for note on %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@.%i@ The sentence, “What is man that you would remember him, or the son of man that you would visit him?” is a figure of speech called an epexegesis. In this figure of speech, a fact is stated then is restated with more detail added in the restatement. The initial statement is incomplete; the restatement completes it. Therefore, the one spoken of in this passage is the “son of man,” not mankind in general. Some have taken this passage (and also Psalm 8, where it’s quoted from) and have taught that mankind in Christ has been crowned with glory and honor and has had all things subordinated to him. That’s not the case; this passage is talking about the son of man, which in this passage specifically refers to Jesus. Verse 9 makes this even more clear by saying that it was Jesus who was “demoted somewhat lower than the angels” and was “crowned in glory and honor.”%fn~
%i@%sb~
Hebrews Chapter 3%hb~
          %u@1For this reason, brothers (i.e., fellow comrades), saints (i.e., those God has separated to Himself), partakers of a heaven-calling (i.e., those summoned from heaven to be Christians), consider %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%u@[%u@a%u@] the apostle (i.e., the trail-blazer) and high priest (i.e., our primary representative to God; the one who stands between us and God) of our confession %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h, Jesus, %u@2being faithful to Him who appointed him as %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ also Moses %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ among%u@[%u@b%u@] his entire house (i.e., all his kinsmen). %u@3Furthermore, this fellow %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s is worthy of even more glory (i.e., praise, esteem, honor, and adulation) than Moses consistent with how much more value and honor the one who built, landscaped, and furnished a house has %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f. %u@4You see, every house has a person who builds, landscapes, and furnishes it, but God is the builder, landscaper, and furnisher of everything. %u@5And while, yes, Moses, was faithful to his entire house as a servant (more specifically, an earthly servant who waited for God to speak then obeyed)%u@[%U@A%u@] resulting in %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@ being an attestation to the truthfulness of the things which will be spoken of, %u@6but Christ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ as a son over his house, a house we are %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f, should we adhere to hope’s confidence and to its boasting (i.e., what we beam with pride over when we talk).%vn~
          %u@7In light of this, %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ just like the Holy Spirit says %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t,%vn~
%si~
If you happen to hear His voice today,%vp~
%u@8Don’t harden your hearts like %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@ in the%vp~
Went-Over-the-Edge-and-Rebelled episode,%vp~
%I@L%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ according to the time%u@[%u@c%u@]%vp~
When they put Me through a test%vp~
In the wilderness %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@S%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@i,%vp~
%u@9%I@A%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ which your predecessors%u@[%u@d%u@]%vp~
Put Me through to see if I would pass.%vp~
And they saw the things I did %u@1%u@0%I@O%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a forty year %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@d.%vp~
In light of this, I was provoked to anger%i@%vp~
By that generation and said,%vp~
“They always wander off the %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e path%vp~
By w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ heart;%vp~
They did not know, recognize or understand My ways.”%vp~
%u@1%u@1As I swore %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ in My %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@b%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ wrath:%vp~
“There’s not a chance that they’ll enter My rest”.%vp~
%i@%si~
          %u@1%u@2Be on the lookout, comrades, lest there be an evil, unbelieving (i.e., stubbornly refusing to believe) heart in any of you which revolts against and departs from%u@[%u@e%u@] %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Living God, %u@1%u@3no—instead%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@s%i@y%i@, encourage yourselves day in, day out, as long as %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d “today” (%i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@o%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n)%i@ still applies, so that none of you would be hardened by the tendency of sin to cause a person to become delusional%u@[%u@f%u@]. %u@1%u@4The fact of the matter is that we have become partakers of Christ if we happen to firmly adhere%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ beginning to end %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s of the undergirding reality %u@1%u@5by what we’re being told:%vn~
%si~
If you happen to hear His voice today,%vp~
Don’t harden your hearts like %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@ in the%vp~
Went-Over-the-Edge-and-Rebelled episode%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@6In this regard, which of the people who heard %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s went over the edge and rebelled?—It wasn’t everyone who left Egypt via Moses, was it? %u@1%u@7Whom was He angry with %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ forty years? Was it not with those who sinned, who dropped dead in the wilderness %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e corpses %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e? %u@1%u@8Whom did He swear wouldn’t “enter into His rest”?—It was none other than the disobedient. %u@1%u@9We see that they were not able to enter because of unbelief (i.e., their stubborn refusal to believe what God said).%nn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@r %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t…the verb tense insinuates that this is a one-time action%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g…Or: %i@i%i@n%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@o%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@f%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@o%i@l%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m…Same root from which %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@s%i@y%i@ is derived in 2 Thess. 2:3%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@l…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@t%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n. Ref. note of Mark 4:19.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@(%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@b%i@e%i@y%i@e%i@d%i@)…Lit: %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@n%i@t. The Gk. word %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@p%i@ō%i@n%i@ (θεράπων/Strong’s 2324). A therapōn is someone who attends to the needs of another by waiting on them. It applies to either a bedside nurse who attends to a sick person (hence its connection with healing) or serving somebody in a general sense where the servant waits for the person to say something then obeys it. This latter meaning is the case. In fact, therapōn is the word used in the phrase “Moses My servant” which appears in the LXX in Exod. 4:10; 14:31; Num. 12:7. As the writer of Hebrews is mimicking the exact word that the LXX uses to refer to Moses as God’s servant, it indicates that whoever wrote Hebrews had read the LXX extensively.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Hebrews Chapter 4%hb~
          %u@1So let us fear lest any one of you seem to come up short while there lingers a promise to enter His rest. %u@2You see, we too were given a good news message (the Gospel) just as those people were, but no—the verbally-given message%u@[%u@a%u@] %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d did not benefit those people, not having been blended with faith by those who heard it. %u@3The fact of the matter is that those who believed %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ enter into the rest %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e indicated by what He has stated:%vn~
%si~
As I swore %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ in My %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@b%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ wrath: %vp~
“There’s not a chance that they’ll enter My rest.”%vp~
%si~
%i@…%I@R%i@e%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ even though %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@ of the things which were done %i@d%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ has been in existence since the world was initially created%u@[%u@b%u@]. %u@4To elaborate on this point, somewhere %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@(%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@) He made a statement about Saturday%u@[%u@c%u@] that goes like this:%nn~
%si~
And God rested on the seventh day from all of His works%vp~
%si~
%u@5Plus %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ in this %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e:%nn~
%si~
There’s not a chance that they’ll enter My rest%vp~
%si~
%u@6So since what’s left over %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ (%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h) is for some people to enter %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t, and %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ the previous group of people who were told about the good things %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m didn’t enter %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t because of disobedience, %u@7%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@p%i@i%i@c%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ again %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t: After this huge gap in time, a specific day %i@r%i@e%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ “today” is defined by David according to the way it’s spoken of %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@P%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@m%i@s:%nn~
%si~
If you happen to hear His voice today,%vp~
Don’t harden your hearts%vp~
%si~
%u@8You see, if Joshua gave them a rest %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t, he wouldn’t have been talking about another time after this period of time. %u@9Therefore, what’s %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%u@[%u@d%u@] is a Sabbath observance%u@[%U@A%u@] for God’s people. %u@1%u@0The fact is, he who entered into%u@[%u@e%u@] (i.e., joined in body, mind, and spirit) His rest %i@i%i@s%i@ also the same person who rested from his works just as God %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ from His own %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n. %u@1%u@1So let’s be eager and in a hurry to enter into that rest, so that no one will fail by the same pattern of disobedience.%nn~
          %u@1%u@2You see, the word of God %i@i%i@s%i@ living, active and effective, and sharper%u@[%U@B%u@] than any double-edged sword and is able to penetrate to the extent of separating soul (i.e., the mind, will, and emotions) and spirit into different parts, and of separating%i@ joint and marrow, and is able to judge, deciding between right and wrong, the thoughts, reflections, and thinking processes of a heart. %u@1%u@3There’s no kind of person, no person anywhere%u@[%u@f%u@], who’s invisible or undetectable when subjected to His intense gaze%u@[%u@g%u@], but everyone is stripped naked and cracked wide open under His scrutiny%u@[%u@h%u@], with which %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ statement %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ to us%u@[%u@i%u@].%vn~
          %u@1%u@4So having a great high priest who has traversed the sky and outer space and reached heaven%u@[%u@j%u@], Jesus the son of God, let us adhere %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ of the confession. %u@1%u@5You see, we don’t have a high priest who’s unable to sympathize with our weaknesses, but one who has been tested, tempted, and pushed to the breaking point in every category%u@[%u@k%u@] and in identical ways apart from sin. %u@1%u@6So let us approach the throne of grace with boldness to receive mercy and find grace, the end result being help at the right time.%vn~

%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@b%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@o%i@i%i@c%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d. A biblical expression; ref. note of 1 Pet. 1:20.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%I@S%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@d%i@a%i@y…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@h [%i@d%i@a%i@y]. Ref. note of John 2:1.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o…A biblical expression, also used in Matt. 19:17; 25:21. Implies joining something with a gladness, not under compulsion.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e. A figure of speech; also used in Mark 16:15; 2 Cor. 5:17; see usage there.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@j%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@a%i@z%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@y…Lit: %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@y%i@e%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@u%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d [or, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r; %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t] %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@u%i@s. %fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@k%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@s. Ref. note of 2 Cor. 12:2.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@g%i@o%i@r%i@y…Lit: %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@a%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@b%i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e…The Gk. noun %i@s%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@o%i@s%i@ (σαββατισμός/Strong’s 4520), which comes from the verb %i@s%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@d%i@z%i@ō%i@ (αββατιζω/no Strong’s number), which means %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@.%i@ The noun-converting suffix %i@m%i@o%i@s%i@ at the end of %i@s%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@o%i@s%i@ in conjunction with the lack (and the lack is prominent) of the definite article implies that sabbatismos is a type of Sabbath keeping. Sabbatismos is only found this one time in the NT. Had the writer of Hebrews intended to mean %I@S%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ explicitly, he would’ve used the word %i@s%i@a%i@b%i@b%i@a%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@ (σάββατον/Strong’s 4521), which is common, and would’ve included the definite article.%fn~
This Sabbath observance that’s the subject of discourse in this chapter and the previous is not the same as the Sabbath which God instituted in Genesis. That’s the point which is made in vv. 8–10. The “rest” spoken of here is a rest where one ceases to work (v. 10) but receives the promises of God.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@s%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@p%i@e%i@r…Roman soldiers kept their swords razor sharp and in combat used their short, nimble swords to slice their opponents in the small gaps in their armor where unprotected flesh was exposed, causing wounds with little exertion of force. This is what this verse refers to.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Hebrews Chapter 5%hb~
          %u@1The fact of the matter is that every high priest drawn from the pool of human beings for the benefit of mankind is appointed to a position %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o those things pertaining to God in order to offer offerings, plus sacrifices on top of that, on behalf of sinners, %u@2being able to moderate his feelings, restrain himself, and be gentle to the ignorant, to those who lack understanding, to those who are mistaken, and to those who’ve gone astray, since he too is engulfed in %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n frailty%u@[%u@a%u@], %u@3and because of %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s same frailty, just like what affects the folk-people, he’s obliged just the same to offer up offerings over and over again in matters where his own sins are involved.%vn~
          %u@4Furthermore,%i@ any-old person can’t do the honor and appoint himself to the position %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t, but instead the one called by God %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ gets %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d just like Aaron was %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d. %u@5In the same way Christ didn’t become a high priest in a self-aggrandizing manner—uh-uh—%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h what was spoken%i@ to him:%vn~
%si~
You are My son%vp~
Today I have begotten you%vp~
%si~
%u@6%I@T%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s also consistent with what a different %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e says:%nn~
%si~
You are a priest %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ forevermore%vp~
According to the order of Melchizedek%vp~
%si~
%u@7Who, during the time when he had a human body%u@[%u@b%u@], offered up %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ prayers plus humble, earnest, urgent requests for protection%u@[%U@A%u@] on top of that to the One having the power to continually rescue and protect him from death, %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g with loud%u@[%u@c%u@] crying and tears, and he was listened to and heeded because of the reverent awe he had in the presence of God. %u@8Although he was a son, he learned the obedience %i@r%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ from the things he suffered, %u@9and once the items of obedience %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f him%i@ were finished, he became a source of eternal salvation%u@[%u@d%u@], %u@1%u@0designated by God %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ a high priest after the order of Melchizedek.%nn~
          %u@1%u@1There’s a lot %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u on this topic, and it’s difficult to explain %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g to you since you’ve gotten to where you don’t listen very well. %u@1%u@2In fact, you should be teachers by this time, %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ you need to have someone %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ teach you the fundamentals%u@[%u@e%u@]%u@[%U@B%u@] of the word%u@[%u@f%u@] of God all over again, and have gotten to where you require milk and can’t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@l%i@e%i@ solid food. %u@1%u@3You see, anyone who’s on a milk-only diet has not demonstrated competency%u@[%u@g%u@] in those things which have their origin in the subject of righteousness: he’s an infant, you see. %u@1%u@4But solid food is for grown-ups, who in the course of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ maturity have developed and trained %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r faculties of perception to distinguish both good and bad%u@[%U@C%u@].%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@d%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@d…Also: %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@v%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…This does not mean that he was one of many sources of eternal salvation%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@f%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@s…Lit: %i@e%i@l%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d…Lit: %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@y…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d; %i@u%i@n%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@n%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@h%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@u%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…The only occurrence of the Gk. word %i@h%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@t%i@ā%i@r%i@i%i@a (ἱκετηρία/Strong’s 2428)in the NT. Hiketāria, and the words it’s surrounded by here appear in a phrase from Job 40:22 in the LXX. As the writer of Hebrews was quite familiar with the LXX (ref. note of 3:5), he must have borrowed the phrase from there. Hiketāria refers to “the olive branch which a supplicant held in his hand” (Liddell & Scott). Also see Gen. 8:11. Meyer in his commentary says that hiketāria “denotes the olive branch which the supplicant pleading for protection bore in his hand…It implies thus the prostate or urgent entreaty of one seeking refuge.”%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@s…There’s an odd word [Gk. %i@t%i@i%i@n%i@a, a form of %i@t%i@i%i@s, (τίς/Strong’s 5100)] tossed in here which is dropped from most translations because it’s difficult to make sense of. Adding %i@t%i@i%i@n%i@a back in, the new rendering would be something like: “teach you some things which are the fundamentals” or “teach you some fundamentals.”%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@o%i@p%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@d…The %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ is the Gk. word %i@a%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@h%i@ā%i@t%i@ā%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ (αἰσθητήριον/Strong’s 145), which means the perception formed from external stimuli. In this context, it refers to the capacity to understand, to gain insight, and to exercise discernment based on information which one obtains through all sources that a person obtains information from. This is additionally confirmed by the choice of the Gk. word used for %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ in this verse [%i@k%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@s, (καλῶς /Strong’s 2773)], as this word refers to goodness perceived from the outside, as opposed to goodness which exists on the inside of someone. The goodness is perceived from the outside through the faculties of perception spoken of here. But in practical terms, what the writer of Hebrews is referring to is a person who through practice and experience is able to observe a given situation and through little pieces of information gleaned here and there is able to see the good and the evil in that situation, and distinguish between the two. One example is this: years ago my brother-in-law used to top by my mother-in-law’s apartment briefly, bring friends occasionally, and after listening to these guys talk casually a bit could tell if they were no good or not. She was always right. Another example: I’m thinking of a well-known evangelist who had a huge ministry who died a few years ago. Just about everyone in the city in which he lived either praised him as a great saint who could do no wrong or condemned him as a horrible sinner who could do no right. The truth is that he was a mixture of both good and bad, but hardly anyone in the city would say that that was the case. The problem, you see, is that they couldn’t distinguish good from bad.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Hebrews Chapter 6%hb~
          %u@1In light of this, putting aside the subject material of the fundamental %i@d%i@o%i@c%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@s of Christ, let us forge ahead%u@[%u@a%u@], not again laying a foundation %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ of repentance (i.e., a change in practice in moving away from one thing to another) from dead works and%u@[%U@A%u@] of faith in God; %u@2%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ doctrine of baptisms%u@[%U@B%u@], %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@c%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@ of the laying on of hands, and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@c%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@ of the resurrection of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ dead (i.e., life after death) and eternal judgment%u@[%U@C%u@]. %u@3We will do this if indeed we secure God’s permission.%vn~
          %u@4But the fact is, those who were enlightened at one time and tasted (i.e., experienced) of the Heaven-Gift and became partakers of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Holy Spirit%u@[%u@b%u@] %u@5and tasted that %i@t%i@h%i@e word of God%u@[%u@c%u@] %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n is splendid and tasted%i@ of the powers of the coming age, %u@6and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ fall to the side (i.e., fail to follow through with the commitment) are unable to %i@e%i@n%i@g%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ again %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@s of renewing themselves with the goal of repentance in mind%u@[%U@D%u@], deciding, as far as their own lives are concerned, to have absolutely nothing to do with%u@[%u@d%u@] the son of God and to expose him to public ridicule. %u@7You see, a piece of soil which drinks the rain which frequently comes %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ on it and generates%u@[%u@e%u@] food useful to those who farm it receives for itself blessing and praise from God; %u@8but %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@i%i@l that bears thorns and thistles %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@s%i@ rejected and a curse looms over it%u@[%u@f%u@], %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@i%i@l%i@ that what eventually ends up happening to it is that %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s burned %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d.%vn~
          %u@9But in your case, beloved, we’re convinced %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@e things which are better and are in sync%u@[%u@g%u@] with salvation, in spite of us talking like this. %u@1%u@0The fact is that God is not unfair in that He’ll not overlook your accomplishments and the love you demonstrated, %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@ directed towards who He is%u@[%u@h%u@], %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ having served the saints (i.e., the people of God) and %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r serving %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e. %u@1%u@1We strongly desire that each of you demonstrate the same eagerness and intensity towards the certitude of hope until %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ ends %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@b%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d %u@1%u@2so that you won’t become lazy, but %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ imitators of those who through faith and patience inherit the promises.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3You see, God made a promise to Abraham, and since He didn’t have anyone better to swear by swore by Himself %u@1%u@4saying,%vn~
%si~
I’m absolutely going to bless your socks off%vp~
And grow your numbers in spades%u@[%u@i%u@]%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@5The way he obtained what was promised to him is that he patiently and persistently endured. %u@1%u@6Along these lines, people swear by someone who’s great, and the oath %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@ for the purpose of confirming %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e puts an end to any disagreement %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ between %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@v%i@o%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@d. %u@1%u@7In this regard God, wanting all the more to demonstrate to the recipients of the promise the immutability %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@o%i@l%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s of His will, intervened with an oath, %u@1%u@8so that through two immutable matters of business (%i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@y %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@a%i@t%i@h), in %i@b%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@f which it is impossible for God to lie, we would have tremendous encouragement, we who have run for cover by taking hold of the hope set before us, %u@1%u@9%i@a%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@p%i@e which is like an anchor to the soul, both secure and firm, and which enters the inside room, the one behind the curtain%u@[%u@j%u@] (i.e., enters into the most secret and holiest room in the temple, the Holy of Holies), %u@2%u@0where a trailblazer%u@[%u@k%u@] entered on our behalf—Jesus—now that he forever became a high priest in the %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@y%i@ order of Melchizedek.%nn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d…Also: %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…This may be a synecdoche for the baptism in the Holy Spirit%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d…The Gk. word %i@r%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@ (ῥῆμα/Strong’s 4487) is used in place of the normally used %i@l%i@o%i@g%i@o%i@s%i@ (λόγος/Strong’s 3056). Rhema insinuates a spoken word, which insinuates the usage of it.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@s%i@o%i@l%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@c%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@i%i@f%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d. This is a NT idiom; it is also used in Gal. 6:14.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@i%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@o%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@m%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@t…Lit: [%i@i%i@s] %i@n%i@e%i@a%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@y%i@n%i@c…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s…Lit: %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@p%i@l%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@p%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u. Saying %i@b%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s and %i@m%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@p%i@l%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@p%i@l%i@y is a figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@o%i@m%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@b%i@l%i@a%i@z%i@e%i@r…Also: %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@r%i@u%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@r%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@d…The Gk. words %i@k%i@a%i@i (καί/Strong’s 2532)and %i@t%i@e%i@ (τέ/Strong’s 5037), which are the two primary words for %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@,%i@ are interspersed in vv. 1–3 in such a way that repentance from dead works and faith in God are coupled together, and the resurrection from the dead and eternal judgment are coupled together. Also, the usage insinuates that not only is baptism a doctrine, but so is the laying on of hands and the resurrection of the dead coupled with eternal judgment.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@s…The Gk. word %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@o%i@s%i@ (βαπτισμός/Strong’s 909), derived from the verb %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@z%i@ō%i@ (βαπτίζω/Strong’s 907). The connection to the word %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@ is obvious; nearly every (perhaps every) rendering of %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@ in English comes from these words. Some translations like the NASB render this “instructions about washings,” which is incorrect. First, the words “instructions about” are an interpolation (that is to say, they don’t exist in the GT and were added to make sense of the text). Second, “instructions about washings” are covered in “repentance from dead works”; no need to cover it again. Third, the context decides any ambiguity. This word %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@o%i@s appears four times in the NT, here and in 2 Cor. 2:12; Mark 7:4; Heb. 9:10. The times in which it means a dipping in water or ceremonial washings are obvious by the context. As this passage is about “fundamental doctrines,” is not baptism a fundamental doctrine? Have their not been entire denominational splits over this issue? Is it not a pillar of the Christian faith? Fourth, although %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@o%i@s%i@ as used in the NT is context-variable, the verb %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@z%i@ō%i@ is mostly used to refer to baptism. Fifth, those who render %i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@o%i@s as “instructions about washings” do so primarily to avoid the obvious fact that this word is plural (baptisms) not singular (baptism). They do so because they believe there is only one type of baptism relevant to the church today, namely water baptism, and if they were to render this word literally as what it obviously is—baptisms—they would they would be forced to acknowledge that there is a second baptism, the baptism in the Holy Spirit, and that this baptism wasn’t just for the early church but is for believers today.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t…The “fundamental doctrines of Christ” should be understood as the essential doctrines of Christianity. A brief description: “repentance from dead works” is the abandonment of the notion that obeying the Law of Moses or any other list of rules is your ticket to obtaining righteousness. This is coupled with “faith in God”: that we obtain righteousness by faith. As these are the crux of Paul’s message, the writer of Hebrews was at a minimum a disciple of Paul. Next are the “doctrines”: baptisms, laying on of hands, the resurrection of the dead coupled with eternal judgment. The doctrine of baptisms is that a person who accepts Christ as Savior should be immediately baptized in water without delay. Also, there is a second baptism which occurs after accepting Christ, that is the baptism in the Holy Spirit. It is accompanied by speaking in tongues. The doctrine of the laying on of hands institutes a holy ordinance for the church to practice in the form of one or several believers placing their hands on another believer while at the same time praying. This was done in the Bible for praying for the sick, for the baptism of the Holy Spirit, and for ordination into the ministry. The next doctrine is the resurrection of the dead, which in the NT refers to life after death. The doctrine asserts that we don’t cease to exist when we die, but that we live on eternally in another life, in another body, be it eternal bliss or eternal damnation. The final doctrine, one which connect s to the previous, is eternal judgment: that when our lives are over, we will stand before God in judgment, the outcome for which will be rewards and punishments.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@u%i@n%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@g%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d…The verb tense in the infinitive %i@r%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@w%i@ speaks of the process of renewing and not of a renewal as a whole. This person has reached the point where he’s lost the capability of changing. His will is altered to where he will not change again. It’s not that God cannot forgive him, it’s that he will never, ever change. The once-saved-always-saved teaching should be reconsidered in light of this passage.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Hebrews Chapter 7%hb~
          %u@1You see, this Melchizedek, king of Jerusalem%u@[%u@a%u@], priest of God the Highest, who met with Abraham when he was returning from the Battle of Siddim%u@[%u@b%u@] and blessed him, %u@2to whom Abraham gave ten percent of everything he owned, %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ first and foremost translated “King of Righteousness” then subsequent to that “King of Salem” (that is King of Peace), %u@3%i@w%i@h%i@o%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@B%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g fatherless, motherless, %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g no genealogy, having no period of time which was early-on for him nor an end-of-life period but made to resemble the son of God, remains a priest into perpetuity.%vn~
          %u@4Observe how great this fellow is whom the patriarch Abraham gave ten percent of the spoils %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@ to. %u@5Those who are %i@i%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@ of the sons of Levi%u@[%U@A%u@], being endowed with the priesthood%i@,%i@ indeed possess a commandment from the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s to receive %i@t%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@(%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@)%i@ from the folk-people%i@ (their kinsmen%u@[%u@c%u@] in other words), although they had %i@y%i@e%i@t%i@ to leave the loins of Abraham (i.e., they had yet to be born). %u@6But he who’s not descended from them or is included in their genealogy collected a tithe from Abraham and blessed the one in possession of the promises. %u@7Indisputably, the inferior person was blessed by the superior. %u@8In this case people who die receive tithe payments, but in that case a statement of fact is on record that he %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@y%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s is alive and continues to live. %u@9A comment can be made along these lines that %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ tithe-receiving %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ Levi pay a tithe through Abraham. %u@1%u@0You see %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ in the loins of the patriarch yet %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@ when Melchizedek met him.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1So if the Levitical priesthood really was the end-all (the folk-people, you see, based their system of religious regulations on it), why was there a need for another priest to come to prominence, one who’s described as belonging to the order of Melchizedek and not to Aaron’s order? %u@1%u@2The fact is, a changing of the priesthood necessitates a change in law (i.e., a change to the rules which govern religious observance and as part of that the establishment a priesthood). %u@1%u@3You see, the person whom these things address belongs to another tribe, a tribe%i@ for which there is no%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ attending to the altar (i.e., of any priestly duties). %u@1%u@4In this regard, it’s clear that our Lord broke through like the sun peering over the horizon in the morning in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ Judah, a tribe for which %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ Moses has no mention of priesthood. %u@1%u@5It’s even more clear that that there’s another priest coming to prominence, one who resembles Melchizedek, %u@1%u@6%i@a%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ who has not come into being according to %i@a%i@ law of commandment of flesh (i.e., according to rules which require you to be of a certain lineage) but rather according to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ power of an indestructible life. %u@1%u@7In this regard, %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ statement of truth is declared %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@:%vn~
%si~
You are a priest %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ forevermore%vp~
According to the order of Melchizedek%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@8The cancellation of a previously-instituted commandment %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ certainly occurs on account of said-commandment’s frailty and uselessness. %u@1%u@9You see, the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ isn’t the end-all but is a gateway to a better hope, a hope by which we draw near to God. %u@2%u@0To the extent that %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ apart from there being any oath…%nn~
      And the fact is, those who are %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ priests have become %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ apart from there being an oath%u@[%U@B%u@], %u@2%u@1but on the other hand, the %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d with an oath by means of what was spoken to him, “The Lord %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ swore %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ and won’t rescind %i@i%i@t: ‘You are a priest %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ forevermore’.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2…To that extent Jesus has become a guarantee of a better covenant. %u@2%u@3And while there have been many priests who have come %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@s%i@,%i@ death preventing them from continuing on %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t, %u@2%u@4on the other hand, because he’ll stay unchanged forever%u@[%u@d%u@], he retains the %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e priesthood %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@p%i@e%i@t%i@u%i@i%i@t%i@y. %u@2%u@5As a result, he’s also able to totally, completely, and continually save (i.e., to protect, preserve, and prevent from harm) those who come to God through him, always alive and ready to intercede%u@[%u@e%u@] for them.%vn~
          %u@2%u@6You see, such %i@a%i@s%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@d%i@ is what we have: a fitting, appropriate, relevant high priest, one who is holy, innocent, and unsullied, separated from the sinners %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r and situated higher than the sky, the spiritual world, and heaven itself; %u@2%u@7one who doesn’t need (like the high priests need) to offer up a sacrifice each day for his own sins first, then and only then to offer %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@s for the sins %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e, since he did this one time when he offered up himself %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@ and is done with it%i@. %u@2%u@8You see, the Law put men who have a weakness (i.e., limitations; shortcomings) in place as high priests; but the message contained in the oath%u@[%u@f%u@], %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e after the Law %i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@o%i@d, forevermore %i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ a%i@ son who has been made to be the end-all and who has been made complete ad-infinitum.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%I@J%i@e%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@m…Lit: %I@S%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@m. Some liberties taken. Jerusalem gets its name from Salem, which is the old city that Jerusalem was built over.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@B%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@S%i@i%i@d%i@d%i@i%i@m…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@l%i@a%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@m%i@e%i@n…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@e…Also: %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g. The word used for %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@d%i@e is the same word used in 1 Tim. 2:1; ref. note there.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@a%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@a%i@t%i@h%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@L%i@e%i@v%i@i…Both Moses and his brother Aaron belonged to the tribe of Levi. When God spoke to Moses in the wilderness and instituted the Law of Moses, He designated the tribe of Levi and all their descendants to forevermore be ministers for the new religion, dispersed among the other tribes to assist in the religious service and regulations. The Levites didn’t work but lived off tithes. Now God appointed Aaron (who was of the tribe of Levi, hence himself a Levite) and his sons and their descendants perpetually to be the priests, and there are different terms used in this passage to refer to this order, some of which are synecdoches. Terms such as Levi, Aaron, the sons of Levi, and the sons of Aaron all mean the same thing.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@a%i@t%i@h…Apparently, every oath referred to in this chapter is an oath which promises that the priesthood established will last eternally, like the first oath in v. 7 (“you are a priest forevermore”).%i@%fn~
%i@%sb~
Hebrews Chapter 8%hb~
          %u@1The crux of the argument given here is this: we have such a high priest, a priest who sat down at the right hand (i.e., was appointed chief executive) of the throne of the Majesty in heaven%u@[%u@a%u@], %u@2one who’s a servant who performs the rituals that involve the holy things, places, and observances and the rituals of the True Tabernacle, a tabernacle which the Lord erected, and not a human being. %u@3You see, every high priest is appointed to go about offering offerings plus sacrifices on top of that; as a result, it’s necessary for this person to have some %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ to offer. %u@4So if he were on the Earth, he would not be a priest %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t, there being %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s whose %i@j%i@o%i@b%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ offer offerings according to law (i.e., in accordance with the rules that had been laid down, specifically rules in the Law of Moses), %u@5those in particular who serve as copies and representations%u@[%u@b%u@] of what goes on in the spiritual world and in heaven, like in the word of caution Moses had been given when he was intending to erect the tabernacle %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@S%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@i,%vn~
%si~
See to it that all things are made to reflect%vp~
The blueprint shown to you on the mountain%vp~
%si~
%u@6But now he’s at the point where he’s obtained a ritualistic-service which is a quantum leap improvement, which is in proportion to him being the mediator of a better covenant, one which has been enacted on the basis of better promises.%nn~
          %u@7You see, if the first covenant had no defects or problems, there would be no basis for going about seeking a second %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@t. %u@8In this regard, in pointing out problems He tells them,%vn~
%si~
Here now—“A time is coming,” says %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord,%vp~
“%I@A%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ I will cause a new covenant%vp~
To take shape and assume its final form%vp~
Where the nations%u@[%u@c%u@] of Israel and Judah are concerned—%vp~
%u@9%I@A%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ that isn’t modeled after %vp~
The covenant I made with your ancestors%u@[%u@d%u@]%vp~
During the time I put My hand on them%vp~
(i.e., supernaturally intervened in their lives)%vp~
In order to lead them out of Egypt.%vp~
Since they wouldn’t remain in My covenant,%vp~
I paid no more attention to them,” says %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Lord.%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@0”Because the very covenant I will enter into%vp~
With the nation of Israel after that period of time,”%vp~
Says the Lord,%vp~
“Is a covenant where I will go about delivering%vp~
My laws to their minds.%vp~
I will write them upon their hearts.%vp~
I will assume the role of being their God,%vp~
And they will assume the role of being my people.%vp~
%u@1%u@1There is no conceivable scenario where each person%vp~
%I@W%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ teach his fellow citizen or his comrade%u@[%u@e%u@]%vp~
Telling them %i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@t%i@o know the Lord,%vp~
Since everyone will know Me directly%vp~
From those of them who are insignificant%vp~
To those who of them who are great,%vp~
%u@1%u@2Because I will treat their wrong-doings with mercy%u@[%u@f%u@],%vp~
And I will absolutely not remember their sins anymore.”%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@3By saying %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ “new” %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@j%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@, He obsoleted the first %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@t. But whatever thing is growing old and becoming obsolete has nearly faded into obscurity%u@[%u@g%u@].%nn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@d%i@o%i@w%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s…Lit: %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@f%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@y…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@i%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s. A figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@n%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@b%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@n%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%i@%sb~
Hebrews Chapter 9%hb~
          %u@1Now the first %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ regulated and maintained a service of religious rituals and the systematic order %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@d holy%u@[%u@a%u@]. %u@2You see, the outer sanctuary%u@[%u@b%u@] was prepared %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d the menorah and the Table of Showbread. %I@T%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@r%i@y%i@ is called the Holy Place. %u@3But behind a curtain is the second sanctuary, which is called %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Holy of Holies, %u@4having %i@a golden incense altar and the ark of the covenant, the ark being completely wrapped in a gold covering. Inside %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@k is a golden vase which contained the %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ manna %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s, Aaron’s rod which budded, and the %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ tablets of the %I@T%i@e%i@n%i@ Commandments%u@[%u@c%u@], %u@5and %i@s%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ above the ark overshadowing the mercy seat were cherubim of %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ glory—things we won’t go into a piece-by-piece description of at this time.%vn~
          %u@6Now things were set up this way: throughout the year, the priests %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@d%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y entered the outer sanctuary in order to make sure the required rituals were done, %u@7but just one time a year the high priest entered the inner sanctuary, but not without %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ blood %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m, blood%i@ that he offered on behalf of himself and on behalf of the sins that the folk-people unknowingly committed. %u@8This is what the Holy Spirit is signifying: while the outer sanctuary still exists and is being actively used%u@[%u@d%u@], the way %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ the Holy of Holies has not yet been revealed, %u@9a particular %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t which is analogous to%u@[%u@e%u@] the period of time which has arrived and is presently in operation, which according to %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@g%i@y%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ the offering up of offerings and sacrifices is powerless to bring those performing the rituals to completeness along the lines of conscience; %u@1%u@0the regulations involved with eating, drinking, various kinds of ceremonial washings %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e physical and self-originated acts%u@[%u@f%u@] only, imposed until a period of reform %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1Christ showed up as a high priest of the good things which came into being because of the greater and more perfect tabernacle, %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s not hand-made (in other words, not of this planet%u@[%u@g%u@]). %u@1%u@2It was not by the blood of goats and calves but by his own blood that he entered once and for all into the Holy of Holies and obtained%u@[%u@h%u@] eternal release and deliverance %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n. %u@1%u@3You see, if the blood of bulls and goats and the sprinkling of %i@t%i@h%i@e ashes of an %i@i%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d heifer make those who’ve been defiled pristine and undefiled %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ the purity of the flesh, %u@1%u@4how much more will the blood of Christ, who through %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Eternal Spirit offered himself without blemish to God, cleanse your conscience from dead works resulting in %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ serving the Living God?%vn~
          %u@1%u@5Because of this, he’s the mediator of a new covenant, so that, considering that a death occurred for the redemption (i.e., the settling of something; fixing what’s broken) of the transgressions %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ under the first covenant, those who’ve been called %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ would partake of the eternal inheritance (i.e., the things God has immutably and irrevocably reserved for them and intended for them to have). %u@1%u@6The fact of the matter is that where a last will and testament%u@[%U@A%u@] %i@(%i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@)%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d, it’s necessary that %i@t%i@h%i@e death of the %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@’%i@s%i@ testator be proven legally. %u@1%u@7You see, upon %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ death %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@o%i@r %i@t%i@h%i@e will is frozen as-is and can no longer be amended in any way; it never has that %i@i%i@m%i@m%i@u%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y-strength while the testator is%i@ still%i@ alive %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@.%i@ %u@1%u@8Hence, the first %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@t was not instituted apart from %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f blood. %u@1%u@9In fact, once every commandment in the Law was spoken to all the people by Moses, taking the blood of calves and goats %i@m%i@i%i@x%i@e%i@d%i@ with water, red wool, and hyssop, he sprinkled the scroll %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ itself and all the people %u@2%u@0%i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ saying, “This %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ blood of the covenant which God commanded you to keep%u@[%u@i%u@]." %u@2%u@1In addition he sprinkled the tabernacle and all the serving vessels used in the rituals in blood the same way. %u@2%u@2%I@I%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ almost %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %I@O%i@l%i@d%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@x%i@i%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ according to the Law %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s everything is purified and cleansed by blood, and apart from the shedding of blood %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ forgiveness %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n doesn’t happen.%vn~
          %u@2%u@3While the copies of the things in the spirit-world%u@[%u@j%u@] (i.e., the copies being the earthly tabernacle and items in it) need to be cleansed by these things (i.e., by the blood of calves, of goats, etc.), but the actual things in the spirit-world %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@p%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ better sacrifices than %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h. %u@2%u@4You see, Christ didn’t enter a Holy of Holies that was created by human hands, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@-%i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ symbolic representations and mirror-copies of the real things, but instead %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ into the same thing (i.e., the thing which the symbolic representations are based on) which is in the spirit-world, to be seen by, to be known by, and to be subjected to God’s intense scrutiny%u@[%u@k%u@] on our behalf. %u@2%u@5Nor is it the case that he repetitively%u@[%u@l%u@] brings himself %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@-%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d just like the high priest enters the %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@l%i@y%i@ Holy of Holies each year with another %i@b%i@a%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ blood %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@l%i@e%i@d. %u@2%u@6If that were the case, he would have to suffer %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@s many times starting the moment the human race began%u@[%u@m%u@]; but at this this critical moment in the annuls of history%u@[%u@n%u@], he appeared this once for the obliteration of the sin %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ because of his sacrifice having been disclosed and made known to everyone. %u@2%u@7And reflective of the fact that it’s been allocated that %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ in the human race undergo death once %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e and after this %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@g%i@o%i@ judgment, %u@2%u@8in the same way as this, Christ, having been brought forth one time %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ for the purpose of being offered up for the sins of the many, will be seen a second time apart from sin (i.e., he’ll make a second appearance, and this appearance will have nothing to do with atoning for sins) by those who assiduously and eagerly look to him for salvation (i.e., look to him to protect them from potential harm, whatever that might be).%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@y%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@y…Or: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@y…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d%i@l%i@y [or %i@s%i@y%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@c] %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@r%i@y…Lit: %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@T%i@e%i@n%i@ %I@C%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@g%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o…Lit: %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@p%i@h%i@y%i@s%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@-%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@s…Lit: %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@p%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@e%i@t…Lit: %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@o%i@b%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d; %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p…Lit: %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@-%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@j%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@y…Lit: %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@y…Lit: %i@o%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@n …Lit: %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m [%i@t%i@h%i@e] %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d. Ref. note of 4:3.%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@n%i@u%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@y…Lit: %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@e%i@s%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@t. The word %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ appears in a few places in this chapter (most notably in v. 15). The covenant of v. 15 apparently is also the will of v. 16, but the context of v. 16 is such that it refers to a will.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Hebrews Chapter 10%hb~
          %u@1You see, the Law, containing a shadow of the good things to come and not itself the form %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ things’ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@d%i@o%i@w, by the same sacrifices that are continuously being offered year after year can never complete or perfect those who approach %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y; %u@2otherwise, wouldn’t %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ ceased to have been offered because those performing the rituals would have no more sins on their consciences once they had been cleansed? %u@3No—in %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ those things year after year, there’s a reminder of sins %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@.%i@ %u@4The fact of the matter is that it’s impossible for the blood of bulls and goats to take away sins. %u@5In this light, while entering the world %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s said%u@[%u@a%u@],%vn~
%si~
“Sacrifice and offering was not what You wanted;%vp~
Instead, You prepared a body for me.%vp~
%u@6You were not pleased%vp~
With %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ burnt offerings%vp~
And%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e surrounding sin.”%vp~
%u@7Then I said, “Hey, I have come—%i@%vp~
If you rummage through %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ scroll%u@[%U@A%u@]%vp~
You’ll find this written about me—%vp~
‘%I@I%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ to do%u@[%u@b%u@] Your will, O God.’”%vp~
%si~
%u@8%I@H%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s saying in the above %i@q%i@u%i@o%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n that “sacrifice and offering” and “%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@u%i@a%i@l burnt offerings and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ surrounding sin” %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ “not what You wanted” nor%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@ “pleased” %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m, the very %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s which are offered as prescribed by %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Law; %u@9Then he said, “‘Hey, I have come…to do Your will.” He gets the first (i.e., the sacrifices, offerings, and burnt offerings) out of the way so that the second (i.e., Jesus’s coming to do God’s will) would stand %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e. %u@1%u@0By the will %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@, we will be sanctified (i.e., set apart from sin and made holy) through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once and for all.%nn~
          %u@1%u@1Day after day every priest has taken a stand performing the ritualistic service of worship, serving the same sacrifices which have been offered many a time, things in particular which can never remove sins. %u@1%u@2But after this fellow %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s offered one %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@e for sins that would last ad infinitum, he sat down at the right hand of God (i.e., assumed the position of God’s chief executive), %u@1%u@3from that point onwards waiting until %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ his enemies be placed under his feet (i.e., that they be completely squashed and enslaved). %u@1%u@4You see, by %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ one offering he has perpetually completed, finished, and perfected those being sanctified.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5But %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@p%i@i%i@c the Holy Spirit also gives us supporting evidence; you see, he has stated afterwards,%vn~
%si~
%u@1%u@6”This %i@i%i@s the very covenant%vp~
Which I will make with them after that period of time,”%vp~
Says the Lord,%vp~
“Granting My laws %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e upon their heart and upon their mind,%vp~
%I@A%i@s%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@ will I write them%i@.%i@%vp~
%u@1%u@7And as far as their sins and of their lawlessness%vp~
(i.e., things that have their origin in the refusal to%vp~
Be restrained by the rules of God and of man)%vp~
And things that have their origin in the same:%vp~
By no means will I remember %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ any further.”%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@8Where %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ these %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@s removed, %i@a%i@n%i@y offering pertaining to sin %i@i%i@s%i@ no longer %i@r%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t.%nn~
          %u@1%u@9So comrades%u@[%u@c%u@], %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g boldness by the blood of Jesus to enter the Holy of Holies%u@[%U@B%u@], %u@2%u@0an entrance which he newly made available to us, a way through the curtain which is brand-new and living (in other words, %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h his flesh), %u@2%u@1and %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ a%i@ great priest %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ over the house of God, %u@2%u@2let us approach %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ with a true heart %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ in %i@a%i@n assurance %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ of faith, %i@o%i@u%i@r hearts having been sprinkled (%i@a%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@g%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@x%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@y%i@s%i@s%i@o%i@p%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e)%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@r%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ from a conscience haunted by evil deeds%u@[%u@d%u@] and our body washed (%i@a%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@g%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@w) in clean water. %u@2%u@3Let us resolutely hold on to hope’s confession, for He Who promised is faithful. %u@2%u@4And let us consider, take notice of, and study one another for the purpose of agitating or provoking love and good works, %u@2%u@5not abandoning the %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ gathering ourselves at one place, like some people are in the habit of doing—no, %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ encouraging %i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ instead, even more so seeing the day %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d fast approaching.%vn~
          %u@2%u@6In fact, for those of us who deliberately sin after obtaining the recognition of or the precise understanding of the truth, there’s no longer a sacrifice pertaining to sin left in place %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n, %u@2%u@7but there’s an air of a dreadful expectation of judgment and of a raging fire which are coming to consume those who %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s in opposition. %u@2%u@8Anyone who remorselessly%u@[%u@e%u@] set aside an individual law in the Law of Moses would be killed upon the testimony of two or three witnesses. %u@2%u@9How much worse of a punishment do you think the one who tramples under foot (i.e., completely trashes, treats with utter contempt, and completely disavows himself from) the son of God, and deems the blood of the covenant which we were sanctified with unclean (i.e., vile and dirty), and insults the Spirit of Grace will deserve? %u@3%u@0In this regard, we’re quite familiar with the verse which says, “Vengeance is mine, I will repay,” plus %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@, “%I@T%i@h%i@e Lord will judge His people.” %u@3%u@1It’s dreadful to fall into the hands of the Living God (i.e., to reach the point where God will act in judgment and cause something to happen to you).%vn~
          %u@3%u@2Think back over the early days, when you were first enlightened. Back then you endured a huge bout of sufferings. %u@3%u@3While the vilification, vituperation, and reviling plus persecution made you a public spectacle, you became fellow participants of those who are regularly made to live their lives this way. %u@3%u@4In this regard, you shared in the same sufferings%u@[%u@f%u@] of those who are in jail%u@[%u@g%u@], and you took the looting of your possessions with joy, knowing that you own a possession which is better, one that can’t be taken away from you. %u@3%u@5So don’t get rattled or lose your nerve%u@[%u@h%u@]; there’s a huge benefit of having %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ confidence, %u@3%u@6seeing that you need endurance, so that, having done the will of God, you would get ahold of the promise for yourself.%vn~
%si~
%u@3%u@7The fact of the matter is that%vp~
In just a little, little while now%vp~
He who’s coming will come and won’t delay %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@.%i@%vp~
%u@3%u@8But the person I deem righteous%u@[%u@i%u@]%vp~
Will live out of faith,%vp~
But if he shirks %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%u@[%u@j%u@],%vp~
My soul %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e no pleasure in him.%vp~
%si~
%u@3%u@9But you don’t %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@s of a shirker %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s result in destruction, but rather %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f faith %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s result in the acquisition and securing of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ soul (i.e., the part of you that makes you unique).%nn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d…Lit: %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@s. Present tense used for past tense. Ref. note of Luke 17:37.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@d%i@o…The verb tense used in the GT insinuates that this is a one-time action. It appears that this refers to Jesus’s death on the cross.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@s…Lit: %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e. A figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@l%i@y…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@t%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@s%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s…Or%i@:%i@ %i@s%i@y%i@m%i@p%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%fn~
