Coincidentally (or perhaps not), the word %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ in the NT sometimes means %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@.%i@ Putting this together, like bridling a horse a person who can control his tongue will be able to bring his carnal nature under control.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@r%i@k%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@o%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s. The word %i@b%i@o%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ [%i@a%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@o, (αὐχέω/Strong’s 850a)] is used here instead of the commonly-used NT word %i@k%i@a%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@i%i@ (καυχάομαι/Strong’s 2744). This verse is the only place in the NT that %i@a%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@o%i@ is found, and the lexicon says that in a general sense it means %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@e.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@e%i@r%i@r%i@y%i@-%i@g%i@o%i@-%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@L%i@i%i@f%i@e…Or: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@E%i@n%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@L%i@i%i@f%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@W%i@h%i@e%i@e%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@O%i@r%i@i%i@g%i@i%i@n. James is using the well-known metaphorical concept of a wheel, where a wheel represents cycles which keep on repeating themselves. This metaphorical use predates James by centuries, having its roots in astrology and mythology. For example, the term “Wheel of Fortune (Rota Fortunae)” is derived from this same concept.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@g%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@,%i@ %i@p%i@s%i@y%i@c%i@h%i@o%i@p%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@a%i@b%i@o%i@l%i@i%i@c…Lit: %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@l%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@c. %I@E%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@l%i@y%i@ refers to a Machiavellian-sort of cunning. Keep in mind that the Gk. word for %i@w%i@i%i@s%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@ means both wisdom and cunning. %I@M%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@ means a wisdom which is mental and emotional in contradiction to being spiritual; is concerned with this life only. It is mental thought which like an animal has, where, for example, an ape can tear apart another ape or eat another ape’s baby and have no remorse for it. %I@D%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@c%i@ (%i@d%i@i%i@a%i@b%i@o%i@l%i@i%i@c)%i@ patterns itself after an evil imp which goes around harassing people.%fn~
%i@%sb~
James Chapter 4%hb~
          %u@1Where do the long, drawn-out quarrels%u@[%u@a%u@] and fights among you come from? Is it not from the pleasurable %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@u%i@l%i@s%i@e%i@s%u@[%U@A%u@] which are a component of your human nature%u@[%U@B%u@], enlisted in a war against you? %u@2You desire but don’t have %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@t—murder and covet but don’t attain—fight and have long, drawn-out quarrels—You don’t have on account of you not asking. %u@3You ask and don’t receive because you ask %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h bad %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s, %i@a%i@s%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ for the purpose of spending it on your carnal impulses%u@[%u@b%u@]. %u@4%I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l adulterers, don’t you know that a close friend of the world (%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@g%i@o%i@d%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d) is pitted against God? So now, he who wishes he were the world’s close friend puts himself in a position%u@[%u@c%u@] where he’s God’s enemy. %u@5Or do you think that the verse of Scripture which says “The Spirit that has taken up residence in us and among us jealously longs and desires %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m%u@[%U@C%u@]” is a waste of time?%vn~
          %u@6Now the Bible lets us off the hook all the more%u@[%u@d%u@]; owing to%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ it says,%vn~
%si~
God takes a stance against the arrogant, proud, and haughty%vp~
But He lets the humble and abased off the hook%u@[%u@d%u@]%vp~
%si~
          %u@7So submit to God.%u@[%U@D%u@] Take a stand against the devil and he’ll run away from you. %u@8Draw closer to God, and He’ll draw closer to you. Purge your life from wrong-doing%u@[%u@e%u@], sinners, and set your hearts apart %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y and make them holy, %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ double-minded. %u@9%I@R%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@g%i@n%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@p%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ become wretched and miserable %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@t; become deeply sorrowful similar to the way you would mourn the death of a loved one, and weep. Have your laughter turn into deep sorrow and your joy into gloom. %u@1%u@0Humble and abase yourself before the Lord, and he will uplift and exalt you.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1Don’t put others down%u@[%u@f%u@] while talking, comrades. He who puts a comrade down or draws conclusions about his comrade so as to write him off%u@[%u@g%u@] trashes the rules that govern us and writes them off by his speech%u@[%U@E%u@]. Now if you write a set of rules off, you’re not a practitioner of the rule-set but instead are a person who decides if the rules themselves are right or wrong%u@[%u@h%u@]. %u@1%u@2There’s only One who’s lawgiver and decider%u@[%u@h%u@], He who’s able to preserve%u@[%u@i%u@] and destroy. Who do you think you are, you who writes off those around you regularly?%vn~
          %u@1%u@3Come on now, those %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ who say “Today or %i@m%i@a%i@y%i@b%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ tomorrow we’ll go to such-and-such town, spend a year there engaged in business, and turn a profit.” %u@1%u@4You all are the very people who don’t understand how your lives will turn out given the ups and downs that tomorrow brings%u@[%u@j%u@]. You see, you’re a wisp of steam that appears for a little while then vanishes. %u@1%u@5Instead, the statement you should make is, “If it happens to be the Lord’s will, and if we’re still alive, we’ll do this-or-that.” %u@1%u@6You’re vaunting at the present time by your pretentious, ostentatious swagger. All such vaunting is evil%u@[%u@k%u@]. %u@1%u@7So it’s a sin for him who knows to do good not to do it.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@a%i@w%i@n%i@-%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@l%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@a%i@r%i@s. A hyperbole.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@u%i@l%i@s%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@p%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@s. Same word used in v. 1.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@s. Same word is translated %i@o%i@c%i@c%i@u%i@p%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n in James 3:6.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e [%i@m%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@y]%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@p%i@u%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n [%i@t%i@h%i@e] %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s. An expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n…Or: %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n [%i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t] %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@;%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@d%i@r%i@a%i@w%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f…Lit: %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r. Ref. note of Matt. 7:1.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g…%i@d%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@e [%i@o%i@f%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@w]%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@e…Lit: %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e. This does lend itself to a literal translation.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l…Or: %i@a%i@b%i@s%i@o%i@l%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@f%i@u%i@l. The word %i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@ here is a bit of a hyperbole.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@u%i@l%i@s%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@p%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@s. This is the Gk. word which %i@h%i@e%i@d%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@ is derived from. James is talking about the pleasure one gets from indulging in one’s carnal nature. For example, the pleasure it gives you to fly off the handle and scream at someone; the pleasure when you stab someone in the back whom you dislike; the pleasure of lusting after a scantily-clad woman.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@s. The word %i@m%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ is short for %i@m%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@.%i@ The theory held by the writers of the NT is that a person’s carnal nature is a part of their body (Rom. 7:18,23). This carnal nature is referred to as the flesh, the body, or simply “members.” This is another reason why a believer receives a new body in the afterlife: the new body has no carnal component.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@j%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@s %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m…Lit: %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@j%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@s. The last part %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m%i@ is an interpolation, as it’s my best-guess as to what James meant. All theories on this verse have logical holes in them, but I assume that he’s paraphrasing (there is no exact OT quote) Exod. 20:5, “I the Lord thy God am a jealous God.” The OT says that He’s jealous for the affections of His people. James combines with this the OT concept of God dwelling among Israel. Like the other theories, there are contradictions to this one. Keep in mind that James is not writing a science textbook.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%I@S%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d…James uses an out-of-place verb tense (aorist imperative) throughout this paragraph for the purpose of jarring the reader even harder. It also insinuates that he means for the reader to do what he’s telling them to do in the paragraph one time and be done with, as opposed to doing it over and over.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@e%i@c%i@h…Lit: %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@w. Note the missing definite articles before the word %i@l%i@a%i@w in three places in this verse. Though the word %i@l%i@a%i@w%i@ here might insinuate %I@L%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s, the missing articles skew the meaning to a broader, conceptual use of the word %i@l%i@a%i@w%i@.%i@%fn~
%i@%sb~
James Chapter 5%hb~
          %u@1Come on now, %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ rich people %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@o%i@t%i@y%i@p%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@c%i@h%u@[%U@A%u@], weep and wail%u@[%u@a%u@] over the miseries that assail you%u@[%u@b%u@]. %u@2Your wealth has rotted and your %i@f%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@y%i@ clothes have been eaten by moths. %u@3Your %i@h%i@o%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f gold and silver has corroded, and its corrosion will show you just how guilty you are%u@[%u@c%u@] and eat you alive%u@[%u@d%u@] as though being burned %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e: you’ve stashed valuables away in this era in which God is doing the great things He promised He’d do%u@[%U@B%u@]. %u@4Take a look—the wages which you’ve withheld from the workers scything your grain fields cry out, and these outcries have secured the attention of the %I@G%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@U%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ Army Chief of Staff%u@[%U@C%u@], %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@v%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@’%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f. %u@5You have lived the life of luxury in the midst of the going-ons of this life%u@[%u@e%u@] and have indulged in %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y pleasure. You fattened your hearts in a day of slaughter (%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@l%i@a%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@-%i@p%i@r%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@l%i@a%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@-%i@s%i@l%i@a%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n). %u@6You condemned—you MURDERED—the righteous. They don’t %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o fight you off%u@[%u@f%u@].%vn~
          %u@7So be patient, comrades, until the Lord appears on the scene. Take a look at how your typical farmer awaits the valuable crop that the soil produces, %i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ applies patience through the course of it all%u@[%u@g%u@], ultimately getting%u@[%u@h%u@] the Planting Rains and the Harvesting Rains. %u@8You too be patient, make your hearts resolute, because the Lord is getting closer and closer to coming. %u@9Don’t groan at each other %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@a%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n, comrades, so that you not be judged. Take a look—the judge is waiting for someone to give him the nod to take action%u@[%u@i%u@]. %u@1%u@0For example, comrades, take a look at the suffering of the prophets, who spoke with the mouth of the Lord. %u@1%u@1There you have it: blessed are they who endure. You heard about the endurance of Job and saw how the Lord’s %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ turned out, that He was full of pity and was compassionate too.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2Now first and foremost, my %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ comrades, don’t swear oaths: don’t pledge any oath by the sky%u@[%U@D%u@] (including heaven itself) nor by the earth. Let a simple “yes” be your yes-answer, and simple “no” be your no-answer, in order not to incur a tremendous burden of guilt%u@[%u@j%u@].%vn~
          %u@1%u@3Is anyone among you enduring hardship?—Have him pray. Anyone cheerful?—Have him sing %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@y. %u@1%u@4Anyone run-down with a malady of some sort%u@[%u@k%u@]?—Have him summon the church governing board%u@[%u@l%u@], have them pray over him after rubbing oil on him (or coating him in oil) acting under the authority of the Lord%u@[%u@m%u@], %u@1%u@5and the prayer of faith will restore the health of the one who’s ill, and the Lord will get him back on his feet and going%u@[%u@n%u@]. And if he has committed sins, he’ll be forgiven.%vn~
          %u@1%u@6Confess your sins out loud to each other, comrades, and pray for each other, in order to be healed. The prayer of a righteous man is capable of accomplishing a lot. %u@1%u@7Elijah was a person who experienced the same emotions that we do and prayed a%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ prayer%u@[%u@o%u@] that it wouldn’t rain, and it didn’t rain all over the place%u@[%u@p%u@] for three and a half years. %u@1%u@8He prayed again and the sky issued forth rain, and out of the ground sprouted the plants that the Earth produces.%vn~
          %u@1%u@9My %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ comrades: if any person should wander from the truth and someone were to get him back on track, %u@2%u@0let him know that the person who gets a sinner back on track and away from a path of wandering %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@ will rescue his psychological well-being (and perhaps even his very life) from waste, ruin, destruction, and worthlessness%u@[%u@q%u@] and covers a multitude of sins.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@w%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@i%i@l…Lit: %i@w%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g. A figure of speech that adds intensity.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u. This is an expression used throughout the Bible that means something which assaults you and likely overcomes you.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@s%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@g%i@u%i@i%i@l%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e…Or: %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@g%i@u%i@i%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: be a witness to you%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e…Lit: %i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@d%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e…Lit: %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ [%i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e] %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h. A biblical metonymy (ref. Gen 1:2 (%i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r); Gen. 7:23; Gen. 11:8 (%i@w%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h); Gen. 11:8; Luke 21:35. The face of the earth stands in for the affairs of those who dwell on it.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@e [or:%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@;%i@ lit:%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@p%i@l%i@o%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t] %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@.%i@ The change from singular to plural of %i@h%i@e%i@ to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ is a result of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ (a figure of speech) being singular in form but plural in meaning.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l…Lit: %i@p%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@o%i@r%i@s. %I@S%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@o%i@r%i@ is an idiom; also used in Acts 5:9; Rev. 3:20.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@c%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@g%i@u%i@i%i@l%i@t…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@r%i@u%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@l%i@a%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t…Lit: %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@k. Ref. note of Matt. 4:23.%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@g%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@a%i@r%i@d…Lit: %i@e%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@r%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@u%i@p%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r. The repetition is a figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e…Lit: %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h. An idiom used throughout the Bible.%fn~
%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@s%i@y%i@c%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@o%i@g%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@-%i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g %i@(%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@h%i@a%i@p%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@)%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@i%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@o%i@t%i@y%i@p%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@c%i@h…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@c%i@h. The usage of the definite article %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ means that James is referring to a stereotype. Not all rich people behave the way James describes, but plenty of them do.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@r%i@a%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@’%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %I@D%i@a%i@y%i@s. The %I@L%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %I@D%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ is an expression used throughout the Bible. In the OT it’s the era in which God’s promises come to pass. This usually is not eschatological.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@c%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@U%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %I@A%i@r%i@m%i@y%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@S%i@t%i@a%i@f%i@f…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f [%i@t%i@h%i@e] %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@s. The common expression %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ paints a picture of gaining the attention of a person who’s difficult to reach because of his limited accessibility due to his high position—but it implies that this high-ranking person is disposed to deliberate in a favorable manner. The title %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ [%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@m%i@y] appears throughout the OT and naturally refers to God heading his army of angels. Angels in this case symbolize the exercise of God’s supreme power in judgment, and this often takes place when the longsuffering patience of God has been exhausted.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@k%i@y…Swearing by something was a common practice in Israel at the time, one which Jesus spoke against in Matt. 23:16,17 and other places. This is like the oath Don Corleone made, “I swear on the souls of my grandchildren that I will not be the one to break the peace that we have made here today.”%fn~
%i@
1 Peter%ha~
       The final one of the multiple faces we see of Peter is contained in his epistle, and it’s hard to imagine them being the same person. The Peter of the Gospels is impulsive; the Peter of Acts is the first church leader; the Peter of Galatians is called out for wrong-doing—but the Peter of this epistle is gracious and mature.%nv~
       Peter the pastor admonishes the readers in a positive manner, steering them in the right direction, calling them to a higher walk with the Lord, encouraging them, reminding them of who they now are.%nv~
       Like other epistles, the Greek text is choppy, as one expects in a letter. A translator finds himself gleaning the gist of what Peter writes and wording it in his native language, deviating from the word-for-word methodology. Sometimes the letter appears to have grammatical errors or the literal reading isn’t so logical (an example is 2:5). The novice reader may have trouble following all of Peter’s OT references. In spite of the fact that what Peter says isn’t written in a straightforward manner, Peter’s message is clear. Case in point is the beginning of the third chapter, when Peter is talking about what women wear. Logical?—not exactly. But the point is clear.%nv~
       Peter’s epistle is tender and commends what some would categorize as feminine virtues (3:8), and he has obviously been transformed from the impetuous fisherman of the Gospels. But his epistles hops about from here to there, randomly redirected to apocalyptic insights and symbolism found in the Old Testament a few verses later (3:19–22). The speed at which Peter makes points, but then hops to another topic, is breathtaking. He never lets the foot off the gas pedal, covering a lot of ground in a short letter. Upon reading the epistle in one sitting, the reader will likely affirm that everything which could have been said was said and that nothing more need be added.%nv~
%i@%sb~
1 Peter Chapter 1%hb~
          %u@1Peter, missionary%u@[%u@a%u@] of Jesus Christ:%vn~
      To %i@t%i@h%i@e %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ chosen temporary residents%u@[%u@b%u@] (%i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@,%i@ the scattered %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s of Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia) %u@2%i@c%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@ by the Holy Spirit according to the foreknowledge of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Father-God and directed towards obedience and towards a %i@c%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@-%i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ (%i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@x%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%u@[%u@c%u@]):%vn~
      Grace to you, and peace %i@t%i@o%i@o, and may they come to you in wave after wave%u@[%u@d%u@].%vn~
          %u@3The blessed God and Father%u@[%u@e%u@] of our Lord Jesus Christ, who, according to the enormous amount of mercy He has, has rebirthed us to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead %u@4and to an imperishable, unsullied, non-deteriorating Customized Allocation%u@[%U@A%u@] tucked away for us in both the spiritual domain and heaven itself%u@[%U@B%u@]— %u@5we who by God’s power are being protected through faith and directed towards a rescue program%u@[%u@f%u@] to be revealed in the thick of it all%u@[%u@g%u@]— %u@6and in the thick of it all we are jubilant, if %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t at the moment we must undergo the distress caused by various trials, %u@7so that the passing grade earned by our faith—a passing grade many times more precious than perishable-gold%u@[%u@h%u@] (but is verified %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e %i@p%i@u%i@r%i@e by %i@m%i@e%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n a furnace%u@[%U@C%u@])—would be found to result in praise, glory, and honor in an unveiling of %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ Jesus Christ %i@i%i@s. %u@8You love him whom you don’t see; you believe in him whom at the moment you’re not familiar with through direct sensory contact, and you exuberate with inexpressible, glorious joy, %u@9taking possession of the end-result of your faith: a rescue and preservation program for your mind and emotions and for your very lives as well%u@[%u@i%u@].%vn~
          %u@1%u@0About this “rescue and preservation program”…prophets researched and examined aspects of the grace that was prophesied into%u@[%u@j%u@] you, %u@1%u@1looking into which individuals or which particular timeframe the Spirit of Christ in them was specifying over and over, going on record before it happened stating the circumstances of the Messiah’s suffering and the glory which followed. %u@1%u@2It was revealed to them that the %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@e%i@s which were %i@u%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ through their ministries weren’t given for%u@[%u@k%u@] themselves but for you, %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@y the things you’ve been told already by the evangelizations of the Gospel to you by the Holy Spirit sent from heaven—things which the angels long to peer into.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3Therefore, having poised your minds for action%u@[%u@l%u@], being clear and level-headed%u@[%u@m%u@] to the utmost extent, hope for the grace delivered to you in an unveiling of %i@w%i@h%i@o Jesus Christ %i@i%i@s. %u@1%u@4As obedient children, don’t be molded by the %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ desires you had in your previous life of ignorance, %u@1%u@5but in pace with your holy calling %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h, get to where%u@[%u@n%u@] you’re holy in all of your conduct as well, %u@1%u@6because it’s written, “Be holy since I Myself am holy.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@7And if you call on a Father who judges each person impartiality on the basis of their actions, live out the time you spend on this planet%u@[%u@o%u@] in fear, %u@1%u@8knowing that you were not bought back with perishable silver or gold from your pointless, useless lifestyle handed down from your ancestors, %u@1%u@9but with precious blood like %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@s%i@ from a %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ lamb without defects or spots, %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@y Christ. %u@2%u@0While, yes, he was known beforehand starting from day-one%u@[%u@p%u@], but aside from that he’s made an appearance at a critical point in time%u@[%u@q%u@] for your sakes: %u@2%u@1you who through him believe in God, who raised him from the dead and glorified him, so that our faith and hope %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ be set on God.%vn~
          %u@2%u@2Now that our mind and emotions and our very lives as well have been purified by the obedience of truth to a genuine enjoyment of and close friendship to our fellow man, love one another fervently out of pure hearts, %u@2%u@3having been rebirthed not from perishable seed but from imperishable, through the living Word of God—and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@W%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ remains %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@u%i@s. %u@2%u@4Therefore %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@B%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@s:%vn~
%si~
Every physical body%vp~
And man’s attempts to live righteously apart from God%vp~
—And let’s throw in the carnal nature%u@[%u@r%u@]—%vp~
Is like grass%vp~
And when the flesh is at its finest moment,%vp~
At the pinnacle of its beauty and achievement%u@[%u@s%u@],%vp~
Is like the blossoming of the grass’s flowers.%vp~
The grass %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ withers,%vp~
And the blossoms fall off,%vp~
%u@2%u@5But the Word of the Lord remains forever.%vp~
%si~
This %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@“%I@W%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@”%i@ is the evangelized-message which was put to you.%nn~

%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@o%i@j%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@x%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@…Ref. Exod. 24:7,8%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@v%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r…An hendiadys in some respects. Ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@g%i@r%i@a%i@m…Lit: %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@v%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@t %i@a%i@l%i@l…Lit: %i@i%i@n [%i@t%i@h%i@e] %i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e. %I@L%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e, %i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y, %i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@r are expressions.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@l%i@d…An expression or perhaps an idiom; used here, in 1:18, in Acts 8:20. Not sure what it exactly means.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@m%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l…Lit: %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o…Or: %i@i%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@f%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@t%i@o%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@s. A metaphor. Ref. Luke 12:37.%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@-%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@s%i@o%i@b%i@e%i@r. Somewhat of a metaphor.%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@e%i@t…Lit: %i@s%i@o%i@j%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@n (like in a foreign country)%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@-%i@o%i@n%i@e…Lit: %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d. A biblical expression; also used in Matt. 13:35, 25:34.%fn~
%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@s. %I@L%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ is a biblical expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@r%u@]%I@E%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@h%i@y%i@s%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@e%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@—%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@s%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@n%i@n%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@a%i@u%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@C%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d%i@ %I@A%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Or: %I@S%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %I@P%i@a%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@l…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e. The word %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ as used in the NT leverages the concept of an inheritance from the OT (ref. note of Luke 10:25), then applies this to the covenant of the NT. To recap, just as God in the OT had a specific piece of land for His people to dwell in, He has a specific place where He wants His NT people to “dwell.” This NT “land” is not a physical land but is a place, spiritually speaking, where God has allocated for his people and has tailored it specifically for each Christian denomination and even each Christian individually, just like the land of Israel in the time of Joshua was partitioned by tribe, by clan, and finally by family. This spiritual “land” consists of promises given in the Bible; of the movement of the Holy Spirit collectively in a denomination, a church, and even customized down to the individual: a special gift or calling for each person.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n. The Gk. word %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ has multiple meanings depending on the context. Paul mentioned that there are at least three “heavens” (2 Cor. 12:2); these include the sky above, the spiritual domain, and heaven itself.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@c%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@d. The word %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ here is a synecdoche for a furnace used for melting and reforming gold.%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Peter Chapter 2%hb~
          %u@1So putting aside all malice, all guile or deceitful trickery, hypocrisy, envy, and the bad-mouthing of others, %u@2%i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t like a newborn baby yearns for milk, yearn for the (logical %i@a%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@g%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%u@[%U@A%u@]) pure milk%u@[%U@B%u@], in order that by it you would grow into the rescue program, the program which keeps you from calamity%u@[%u@a%u@], %u@3since—surely now%u@[%U@C%u@]—you’ve tasted that the Lord is exceedingly proficient and kind.%vn~
          %u@4Coming to him—a living stone—who failed inspection and was rejected by humans on the one hand but with God %i@i%i@s chosen and precious on the other. %u@5And you as living stones—%i@l%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@m a spiritual edifice—you yourselves are being constructed into a holy priesthood to offer up%u@[%u@b%u@] spiritual sacrifices (analogous to animal sacrifices) acceptable to God through Jesus Christ. %u@6Therefore the Bible%u@[%u@c%u@] contains this:%vn~
%si~
See here now: I’m putting a stone in place%vp~
In %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@y%i@m%i@b%i@o%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y Zion—%vp~
A chosen, precious cornerstone.%vp~
There’s no way at all %vp~
That the one who believes and trusts in him%vp~
Will be disappointed or put to shame—%vp~
Not a chance.%vp~
%si~
%u@7So honor and value %i@g%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o you believers. But to those who refuse to believe:%nn~
%si~
A stone which the builders%vp~
Failed during inspection and rejected—%vp~
That’s the one which became%vp~
The main corner %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n.%vp~
%si~
%u@8…And:%nn~
%si~
A stone which causes one to veer off into a ditch%vp~
Resulting in wrong-doing%vp~
And %i@a%i@l%i@s%i@o%i@ a rock which offends%u@[%U@D%u@]%vp~
%si~
Those who veer off into a ditch by not believing in the Word:%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@Z%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@, they too have been “put in place%u@[%u@d%u@]” to that ends.%nn~
          %u@9But you are “A select generation, a royal priesthood, a holy people sharing the same heritage and culture, a people for safe keeping, so that you all would proclaim the awesomeness%u@[%u@e%u@]” of the One who’s called you out of darkness to His marvelous light.%vn~
%si~
%u@1%u@0Back then they were not a people%vp~
But now %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ a people of God.%vp~
They had not been shown mercy%vp~
But now are being shown mercy.%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@1Beloved, I urge you as foreigners and temporary residents to stay away from carnal desires, the very things which wage war against the psyche. %u@1%u@2Maintain a lifestyle of good behavior among those who aren’t Christians%u@[%u@f%u@], so that in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@a in which they slander you as being a bad person%u@[%U@E%u@], out of observing the good things which you do, upon close, careful examination%u@[%u@g%u@] they would come clean and tell the truth%u@[%u@h%u@] %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@o%i@r%i@.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3Submit%u@[%U@F%u@] to every man-made %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%u@[%u@i%u@] %i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ through the Lord%u@[%u@j%u@], whether %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@f a supreme leader—a king— %u@1%u@4or whether %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ his appointees—governors—appointed to punish evildoers %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d but on the other praise those who do good. %u@1%u@5%I@O%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@s because this is the way the will of God works: you shut the ignorance of stupid people up by doing good %u@1%u@6as those who have freedom—but not the sort of freedom which, under the surface, a bad person is concealed but %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@ slaves of God instead. %u@1%u@7Honor everyone, love the band of fellow believers%u@[%u@k%u@], have reverence (fear even) for God, honor the king.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8The household servants: %I@I%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e submitting%u@[%u@l%u@] with utmost reverence to every master, not only to the good-natured and considerate ones but to the corrupt ones as well. %u@1%u@9You see, this %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f grace (i.e. forbearance, benevolence, and forgiveness): if by a godly conscience someone endures the pains of unfair suffering. %u@2%u@0When you get right down to it, what sort of congratulations %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t if you endure the abuse and reprimands—even getting slapped around%u@[%u@m%u@]—for wrong-doing? But if you do good and endure suffering, this %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ grace from%u@[%u@n%u@] God.%vn~
          %u@2%u@1You’ve been summoned to this ends: that Christ also suffered, suffered on behalf of everyone, leaving behind an example so that you would follow in the footsteps %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m…%vn~
%si~
%u@2%u@2…Who committed no sin%vp~
Nor was guile found in his mouth%vp~
%si~
%u@2%u@3He who was reviled, while he was being reviled did not revile and abuse in return; while suffering, refrained from issuing threats; but kept handing %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e over to Him who judges fairly— %u@2%u@4Who personally offered up our sins in his body upon the wooden %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@-%i@b%i@e%i@a%i@m%u@[%u@o%u@] so that having been separated from the sins, we would live in righteousness—Who with his wounds you were healed. %u@2%u@5You see, you were wandering astray like sheep, but now—now you’ve returned to the Great Leader, Overseer, and Protector%u@[%u@p%u@] of our minds, emotions, of our very beings%u@[%u@q%u@].%nn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@g%i@r%i@a%i@m%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@g%i@r%i@a%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@v%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@u%i@p…The Gk. verb tense is aorist and not present, which implies that it’s a one-time offering. This is unexpected.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@B%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e…Lit: %I@S%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e…This is the same word used in v.6 and refers to that verse%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@a%i@w%i@e%i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s…Lit: %i@e%i@x%i@c%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@n%i@s…Lit: %I@G%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a [or perhaps %i@t%i@h%i@e] %i@d%i@a%i@y %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n. Note that %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ is a biblical expression. Note that many translations use the word %i@v%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ [from %i@e%i@p%i@i%i@s%i@k%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@i, (ἐπισκέπτομαι/Strong’s 1980)] and not %i@e%i@x%i@a%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ [from %i@e%i@p%i@i%i@s%i@k%i@o%i@p%i@e%i@ō, (ἐπισκοπέω/Strong’s 1983)]%i@.%i@ The Gk. word used here is %i@e%i@p%i@i%i@s%i@k%i@o%i@p%i@a%i@s%i@ (ἐπισκοπῆς), which is a noun form of episkopeō —not a form of episkeptomai (although episkopeō and episkeptomai are similar and are related etymologically).%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@y%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d. An idiom; ref. note of John 9:24.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@-%i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e. An idiom apparently.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d. It’s not clear whether this phrase means to submit through the Lord or that the positions of authority were created through the Lord. I’m guessing it’s the latter, and that this somehow extends the idiom.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@h%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g. For the next several verses and into chapter 3, Peter uses participles in place of imperative verb forms, while the reader understands that the imperative form is meant. By using the participle, Peter takes on a less accusatory posture.%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@a%i@b%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@r%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@—%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@l%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ [more literally %i@b%i@u%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ or%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@f%i@f%i@s:%i@ multiple hits with a fist or with the palm of one’s hand]. The picture here is of a slave being punched or slapped by his master because of displeasure or disobedience.%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m…Or: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@w%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@-%i@b%i@e%i@a%i@m…Lit: %i@w%i@o%i@o%i@d. Ref. note of Acts 5:30.%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@L%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@,%i@ %I@O%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@e%i@r%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@P%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@d%i@ [%i@p%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r]%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@e%i@r%i@ [%i@b%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@o%i@p]. A hendiadys; ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@e%i@m%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@l%i@o%i@g%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@g%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o…Lit: %i@l%i@o%i@g%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l. Or: %I@W%i@o%i@r%i@d [%i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d]-%i@r%i@e%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d. There’s some ambiguity in what Peter means by the Gk. word %i@l%i@o%i@g%i@i%i@k%i@o%i@s%i@ (λογικός/Strong’s 3050)%i@,%i@ the adjective that most other translations render %I@W%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@.%i@ One could put up a substantial argument for either. Perhaps it means both.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@w%i@b%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@y%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@l%i@k%i@,%i@ %i@y%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@(%i@l%i@o%i@g%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@g%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@)%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@l%i@k…Lit: %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@w%i@b%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@b%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@y%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@g%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ [or%i@ %I@W%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@-%i@r%i@e%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d]%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@l%i@k%i@ This is a hybrid simile and metaphor, one of the most excellent metaphors in the NT. The most tremendous growth spurt that a human being experiences is when a one is a newborn baby between the ages of three and seven weeks. During this time, a baby is continuously hungry for milk, crying around the clock to be fed. A baby grows substantially during this four week period. Peter is telling Christians to mimic the hunger which a newborn baby has; he is not telling them to imitate babies in any other respect. Just as this baby hungers, is fed, and grows enormously, is the same way should Christians hunger for the Word. Their growth will be like the baby’s.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@—%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@w%i@—…Lit: %i@i%i@f. The rendering of this word [%i@e%i@i%i@,%i@ (εἰ/Strong’s 1487)] has caused confusion to the point that several ancient manuscripts have altered this word from %i@e%i@i%i@ to %i@e%i@i%i@p%i@e%i@r (εἰπερ/no Strong’s word) forcing it to say %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ instead of %i@i%i@f%i@.%i@ There are secondary meanings to the word %i@e%i@i%i@ that Peter is likely drawing on here, but nevertheless some ambiguity remains.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%I@A%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@s%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@…%I@L%i@i%i@t%i@:%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g [or, %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@e]. Liberties taken. The word %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g is an idiom; ref. note of Matt. 11:6.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n (etc.)…What Peter is saying here in v. 12 is that although non-Christians will slander you simply because of prejudice, stereotypes, rumors, lies, misunderstandings, etc., when they’re pressed to get down to the brass tacks and look at the specific circumstances about someone they know who’s a Christian, they’ll have to (or perhaps will reluctantly) admit that, based on that Christian’s good behavior in the specific situations he was observed in, he is a decent person after all.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@s%i@u%i@b%i@m%i@i%i@t…The Gk. word here for submit [%i@h%i@u%i@p%i@o%i@t%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@ō, (ὑποτάσσω/Strong’s 5293)] literally means %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r. There are multiple words in the NT which essentially mean %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@,%i@ etc. The stem from which the word %i@a%i@r%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@ comes means to given an order, and it was a military term used when a commander issued orders to deploy units of phalanxes, etc. on a battlefield. A good arrangement of the units, and one which was carried out successfully, was crucial to victory on the battlefield. So %i@h%i@u%i@p%i@o%i@t%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@ō means to allow oneself to be “arranged” by the person in command, knowing that the one in command has the overall view of what needs to be put and where and is placing you in position according to a master plan—a plan which you might not even be familiar with. This shade of meaning to the word %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@ differs from a shade of meaning of an underling being crushed by an oppressive overlord.%i@%fn~
In this regard, the Gk. word %i@h%i@y%i@p%i@a%i@k%i@o%i@u%i@ō (ὑπακούω/Strong’s 5219), which corresponds %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@b%i@e%i@y, literally means %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@-%i@t%i@o%i@.%i@ This refers to being under the audible sound—the voice commands—of another person. The nature of the word is that one person is to simply obey the spoken-orders (and this would apply to any order, not just a spoken one) of the one above him. The emphasis is on simple obedience to the order, without questions asked and without an expectation that the one obeying will understand the big-picture. And this is where submit and obey diverge. The one who submits understands that his submission is necessary to accomplish the overall goal; that he should understand the overall goal and understand that he is one of multiple parties, all of whom must do his part and comply with his specific command for the sake of the overall strategy, vision, or long-term plan, which is planned and executed by the one in charge. Therefore, a child or a slave is expected to obey, not submit, but an adult, one who has heavy responsibilities, such as a soldier, is told to submit, not obey.%fn~
Throughout history, there have been two methods whereby the common soldier takes orders from a superior: the soldier can submit or he can obey. Generally speaking, armies where the soldiers submit are more effective than armies where the soldiers obey. Those who submit are encouraged to think beyond their individual contribution, and because of that, a person who submits may at times improvise according to the need of the moment, not doing what he was directly ordered to do for the sake of the overarching plan. Soldiers who simply obey will fear potential retribution due to improvisation and not exploit opportunities or adapt to changing conditions on the battlefield.%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Peter Chapter 3%hb~
          %u@1Along the same lines, wives, %I@I%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e submitting%u@[%u@a%u@] to your husbands, so that even if any one of them are disobedient, don’t believe, or simply aren’t convinced%u@[%U@A%u@] that the Word %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@b%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@,%i@ they’ll be won over by their wives’ behavior%u@[%u@b%u@] without %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ a word %u@2after they observe your holy%u@[%u@c%u@] conduct %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t in reverence bordering on fear. %u@3Your %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@a%i@u%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u: let it not be what’s on the outside (getting your hair done%u@[%u@d%u@] and putting on expensive jewelry%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@ or wearing %i@s%i@t%i@y%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@r %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g clothing%u@[%u@d%u@]—what you put on to make yourself look good%u@[%U@B%u@])— %u@4but instead %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@a%i@u%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e the heart’s hidden person—%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ in the indestructible %i@q%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s%u@[%u@e%u@] of a gentle, restrained, quiet (in the sense of being at-rest and at-peace)%u@[%U@C%u@] disposition and prevailing attitude%u@[%u@f%u@], which is dear and precious in God’s mind when He focuses His attention on it%u@[%u@g%u@]. %u@5This is the same way that, %i@y%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@o, the holy women back then who hoped in God used to make themselves look good%u@[%u@h%u@], submitting to their husbands, %u@6as Sarah submitted to Abraham calling him “Sir%u@[%u@i%u@].” You have become her protégés%u@[%u@j%u@] %i@b%i@y doing good and %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e not fearing any threats.%vn~
          %u@7Along the same lines, husbands, %I@I%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ cohabitating %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ in an understanding way, as with a weaker “vessel” (%i@a%i@ %i@“%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@”%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e%u@[%U@D%u@])—the female-type—assigning honor and worth to her, as %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@ too %i@i%i@s%i@ a joint-recipient of life’s grace, so that your prayers not be impeded.%vn~
          %u@8Now in conclusion, everyone, be harmonious (i.e. everyone be on the same page), sympathetic (i.e. share the pain of others), enjoy the companionship of your fellow-comrades, compassionate (i.e. have a tender sense of goodwill towards one another deep inside), and have a humble attitude, %u@9not paying back those who mistreat you by mistreating them, nor repaying an insult with an insult but blessing them (i.e. wishing them well) instead, because you were inaugurated into the Christian faith for this outcome%u@[%u@k%u@]: so that a blessing would be yours for the keeping%u@[%u@l%u@].%i@%vn~
%si~
%u@1%u@0For he who wishes to love life%vp~
And see good days:%vp~
Have him halt his tongue from bad%vp~
And %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ lips from the utterance of guile.%vp~
%u@1%u@1Let him turn away from bad and do good,%vp~
Search for peace and pursue it.%vp~
%u@1%u@2Because the Lord’s eyes are upon the righteous,%vp~
And His ears %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ to their prayers,%vp~
But the full attention%u@[%u@m%u@] of the Lord %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%vp~
At those who do bad.%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@3And who’ll mistreat you if you’ve become a fanatic for doing good? %u@1%u@4But even if you were to suffer on account of doing right, you’re blessed. Don’t be afraid of their intimidation nor be troubled by them— %u@1%u@5Instead, put Christ the Lord in a hallowed place in your hearts, a place away from everything else, ever ready to give a reply in defense to everyone who asks you about the hope in you. %u@1%u@6%I@D%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@f%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@g%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n but with gentleness and reverence instead, maintaining a good conscience, so that in the area in which they badmouthed you, they would be put to shame upon observing your good conduct in Christ. %u@1%u@7The fact of the matter is, it’s better to suffer for doing good (if it’s God’s will) than for doing bad.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8%I@T%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ because Christ suffered with respect to sin also, the just on behalf of the unjust, so that he would bring us to God, having died in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ flesh on the one hand but having been made alive in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Spirit%u@[%u@n%u@] on the other.%vn~
          %u@1%u@9Also, he preached in the %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t to the spirits in prison%u@[%U@E%u@], %u@2%u@0the people back then who were disobedient and couldn’t be convinced %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ back when God’s longsuffering kept on pushing out%u@[%U@F%u@] %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@t%i@e %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@d in Noah’s time while he was building and provisioning the ark, an ark into which %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t a few—namely eight people—were saved (i.e. rescued from impending destruction) %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@t through %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d %i@o%i@f the%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@l%i@u%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ water, %u@2%u@1which is a symbolic representation of %i@h%i@o%i@w baptism saves %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ in the here-and-now—not %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@“%i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@”%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@r%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o remove dirt from the body, but instead %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@“%i@b%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@s%i@m%i@”%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ a good conscience’s appeal to God through the resurrection of Jesus Christ, %u@2%u@2who is God’s chief executive%u@[%u@o%u@], now that he’s gone up into heaven, after %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@c%i@ agents, %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@c%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h authority %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@s, and %i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@ forces%u@[%U@G%u@] were made subordinate to him.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g. Ref. note of 2:18.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@’%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@y…Also: %i@p%i@u%i@r%i@e; %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e…%i@e%i@x%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@e%i@w%i@e%i@l%i@r%i@y…%i@s%i@t%i@y%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@i%i@r…%i@g%i@o%i@l%i@d…%i@c%i@l%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g [%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@w%i@e%i@a%i@r]%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@d%i@i%i@s%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@c%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d. An expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d…Lit: %i@a%i@d%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s. Same word used in v. 3.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@s%i@i%i@r…Lit: %i@l%i@o%i@r%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@é%i@g%i@é%i@s…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n. A figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@a%i@u%i@g%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d. The word %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ in the Epistles is an expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…Or: %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t; %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t. The ambiguity decided by the context.%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@e%i@c%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t [%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d]. An expression.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@d%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@b%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@d….The Gk. word %i@a%i@p%i@e%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ō%i@ (ἀπειθέω/Strong’s 544)means all three of these: %i@t%i@o %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@u%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@;%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@;%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@b%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@.%i@ The more common word for %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@ is %i@p%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@u%i@ō%i@ (πιστεύω/Strong’s 4100)%i@;%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e is %i@a%i@p%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@u%i@ō%i@ (ἀπιστέω/Strong’s 569). %I@A%i@p%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@u%i@ō has connotations of stubbornly refusing to believe out of hard-hearted disobedience . Acts 28:24 shows by example the difference between these two Gk. words. But the point of the matter is that Peter said that those husbands who are %i@a%i@p%i@e%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ō%i@ will be won over—he did not say that the %i@a%i@p%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@u%i@ō%i@-husbands can or will be won.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@j%i@e%i@w%i@e%i@l%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@y%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g…%i@s%i@t%i@y%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@—%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d…Lit: Gk. %i@k%i@o%i@s%i@m%i@o%i@s%i@ for %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d. %I@K%i@o%i@s%i@m%i@o%i@s (κόσμος/Strong’s 2889)%i@ in this context uses a secondary meaning, which is %i@a%i@d%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@.%i@ It’s hard to imagine that this secondary definition of %i@k%i@o%i@s%i@m%i@o%i@s%i@ doesn’t acquire overtones from its primary definition (world/worldly), which, assuming that is the case, justifies the rendering %i@s%i@t%i@y%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@,%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@s%i@m%i@o%i@p%i@o%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@,%i@ and even %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@.%i@ In addition to this use of %i@k%i@o%i@s%i@m%i@o%i@s…Years ago, Christians who were part of the holiness movement (which includes Pentecostals) interpreted verses to mean that Christian women shouldn’t braid their hair, wear jewelry or wear nice clothing. This is not the point Peter is making. (And as Jeanne Wilkerson used to say in rebuttal to this flaky teaching, “If the barn needs painting, why then: paint it.”) Peter is saying that a woman shouldn’t consider herself to be a beautiful person because of her outward appearance but because of her inward nature.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@q%i@u%i@i%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@(%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@-%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@-%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@)…The Gk. word used here for %i@q%i@u%i@i%i@e%i@t%i@ appears nowhere else in the NT. Had Peter meant a woman who doesn’t talk a lot, he would’ve used a different, more commonly used word which means quiet. But this verse is referring to a woman who isn’t consumed with drama; playing games; false suspicions of the motives of others; easily angered; prone to jealousy; etc.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]a %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e…Lit: %i@v%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@l. In the NT, the word %i@v%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@ when referring to a person and not to an actual container is a figure of speech, a metonymy and an idiom. Ref. Acts 9:15; Rom. 9:21; 1 Cor. 4:7; 1 Thess. 4:4; 2 Tim. 2:20. A vessel is a container that holds something which is worth storing; the vessel’s ability to hold and store that thing is what gives the vessel value. Our physical bodies are containers which hold our spirits and the Holy Spirit, and this is what gives our bodies value, as our bodies are animated by the Spirit inside of us. But vessels are not only bodies but human beings.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@n…According to the context, these are all the people on the earth except for Noah and his family, those who didn’t make it into the ark. The assumption is that the “prison” referred to here is hell and that Jesus “preached” to them when he was in hell after his death and before his resurrection. Perhaps Jesus was preaching to them about the fact that he was going to be rescued from that place in the same way that, when they were alive, Noah preached to them that he was going to be rescued from the flood coming on the earth. This is speculation of course.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@k%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t…Also: %i@k%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@.%i@ Peter is saying that God was doing His best to get the people on the earth to repent so He wouldn’t have to send a flood, and kept on postponing the time of the flood to give them yet another opportunity to repent. The oldest living person recorded in the Bible is Methuselah, whose name means “his death shall send.” His name itself is a prophecy of the coming flood, and the prophecy is that when he dies the flood will come (and upon correlating the dates, the flood occurred the year Methuselah died). In God’s longsuffering, He postponed the date of flood, but also had to lengthen Methuselah’s life because of the prophecy. Methuselah’s long life is a testimony to God’s longsuffering.%fn~
%u@[%U@G%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@c%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@s [%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s] %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@s. Based on a preponderance of NT teachings, this verse is talking about demonic spirits and not about humans. The word %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@s%i@ here means %i@m%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ (which is %i@a%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s)%i@ instead of fallen angels. These agents are demonic spirits (“messengers of Satan”, 2 Cor. 12:7, NASB) which Satan sends to fulfill a specific mission. The word %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ refers to demons which are given authority over other demons, and the same word is used this way in Eph. 6:12. The word %i@p%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ refers to demons that are simply a force for evil. Before Jesus ascended into heaven, these wicked spirits were made subordinate to him.%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Peter Chapter 4%hb~
          %u@1So %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ Christ suffered in the flesh, you too arm yourselves (mentally speaking) for the same, since he who’s suffered in the flesh has stopped sins %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g. %u@2No longer live out the remaining days of your life for the carnal passions of human nature but rather %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ in the will of God. %u@3The fact of the matter is, there’s been plenty of time to have acted out the yearnings of the heathen nations to the nth degree, having followed a course of unrestrained indulgence in immoral, physical pleasures (especially sexual ones)%u@[%u@a%u@]; heated, passionate, over-the-top lusts and desires; drunkenness; wild partying; parties centered around getting drunk; and idolatry—which is absolutely forbidden. %u@4In regard to this, they think it’s weird that you don’t join them in rushing to the very same spigot which is pouring out a shameless, wasted lifestyle%u@[%u@b%u@], and you’re vilified for it— %u@5They’ll have to cough up an answer for this and give it%u@[%u@c%u@] to Him who’s primed and ready%u@[%u@d%u@] to judge %i@b%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@,%i@ those who are %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y alive and those who are %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y dead%u@[%U@A%u@]. %u@6With this in mind, you see%u@[%u@e%u@], a good-news message was evangelized to those who are %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ dead, so that while—sure—in their natural lives they’re held to a standard in accordance to human %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%u@[%u@f%u@], but on the other hand in their spiritual lives would live in accordance to God’s %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s.%vn~
          %u@7%I@P%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@m%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t among all things is that the end is near, so keep your head screwed on tightly and control yourselves so you’ll stay in the mode of offering up prayers. %u@8The number-one priority is that you maintain a fervent love for the others among you, because love covers over a good number of sins.%vn~
          %u@9Be hospitable (i.e., be open to those who are different than yourselves) to one another without complaint. %u@1%u@0Just as each of you received a gift %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d, as competent and dependable stewards of the multi-faceted%u@[%u@g%u@] grace of God,%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e it to serve the others among you. %u@1%u@1If someone speaks, %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ as though%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ a word %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@c%i@y%i@ from God; if someone serves, %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@e out of strength which God provides, so that in everything God would be glorified through Jesus Christ, with whom is the Glory and the Might forever and ever—Amen (no more need be said).%vn~
