          %u@1%u@2Beloved, don’t consider the trial that is happening to you—a pressure-cooker%u@[%u@h%u@] of an ordeal—to be abnormal, as though a stranger is meeting you to join up with you, %u@1%u@3but instead, insofar as you are familiar with the sufferings of Christ, being a joint-sharer with him, rejoice, so that you too would jump for joy in the revelation of his glory. %u@1%u@4If you’re chewed out, scorned, discredited, or disgraced%u@[%u@i%u@] because you’re affiliated with and follow the precepts of Christ%u@[%u@j%u@], %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ blessed, because %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@k of the glory and of the Spirit of God rests upon you. %u@1%u@5But upon closer examination, make sure it’s not the case that any of you%u@[%u@k%u@] are suffering as a murderer, a thief, a villain, or as a subversive%u@[%u@l%u@]. %u@1%u@6But if %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@s as a Christian, let him not think to himself that he’s guilty of wrongdoing%u@[%u@m%u@], but let him glorify God as one authorized by this %I@G%i@o%i@d%u@[%u@n%u@].%vn~
          %u@1%u@7%I@T%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s because the timeframe%u@[%u@o%u@] %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@r for the Judgment to begin, a judgment starting from God’s house %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s. And if it starts with us first, how will things turn out for those who don’t believe in the Gospel? %u@1%u@8And…%vn~
%si~
If the righteous man just barely squeaks by%u@[%u@p%u@]%vp~
The rank-sinner%u@[%u@q%u@]—what’s to come of him%u@[%u@r%u@]?%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@9%I@K%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d so that even those suffering according to the will of God would, by doing good, entrust their life-beings%u@[%u@s%u@] to a faithful Creator.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@u%i@n%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@d%i@u%i@l%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@,%i@ %i@p%i@h%i@y%i@s%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@(%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@x%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@)…Also: %i@l%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s; %i@d%i@e%i@b%i@a%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@s%i@h%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@y%i@l%i@e…Also: %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@p%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@s%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d [%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t]%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@y…Also: %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%I@W%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e…Lit: %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@…Lit: %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@m%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@-%i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@d…Also: %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@f%i@o%i@l%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@-%i@c%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@f%i@i%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@.%i@ Some liberties taken.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@w%i@e%i@d%i@-%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@c%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@a%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@s%i@u%i@b%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e…Also: %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@g%i@u%i@e%i@;%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@v%i@o%i@l%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@r%i@y%i@;%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@;%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@p%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@y…Lit: %i@m%i@e%i@d%i@d%i@l%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@u%i@i%i@l%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g…Also: %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@h%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s. An expression; ref. note of Acts 4:17%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@f%i@r%i@a%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@p%u@]%i@s%i@q%i@u%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@y…Lit: %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@q%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@-%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@g%i@o%i@d%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@r. A hendiadys; ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@r%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@?…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@? Assumed to be an expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@s%u@]%i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@-%i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@s%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@b%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d…Lit: %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d. The lack of definite articles before %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ and %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ emphasizes the nature of the people. The context is steered by the next verse, which refers to the dead who are spiritually dead rather than physically; therefore this verse refers to those who are spiritually alive and those who are spiritually dead. One assumes that the living and the dead are people who are physically dead, as NT judgment occurs after one dies—and this may or may not be true—but it’s not something Peter is saying explicitly.%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 Peter Chapter 5%hb~
          %u@1So those among you who are on the church governing board%u@[%u@a%u@]: as your fellow board member and witness of Christ’s sufferings and joint sharer of the coming glory to be revealed, I entreat you: %u@2Pastor (i.e. lead; be a shepherd to)%u@[%U@A%u@] God’s sheep among you %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@y%i@l%i@e%u@[%U@B%u@] that doesn’t force people into doing things but instead one which has them doing things God’s way%u@[%u@b%u@]: willingly. And don’t %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ greedily and dishonestly increase your wealth but %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ with a well-disposed, willing, and eager attitude instead— %u@3Not %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g those assigned to you%u@[%u@c%u@] as a domineering, micro-managing dictator%u@[%u@d%u@], but %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ becoming an example of %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ a sheep %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ instead. %u@4And when the Chief Pastor appears, he’ll bring %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ the unfading victor’s wreath of glory.%vn~
          %u@5In the same vein, younger men: submit to the board members; and to everyone else: wrap around yourselves the clothing of a humble attitude, since…%vn~
%si~
God opposes the arrogant%vp~
But gives grace to the humble%vp~
%si~
          %u@6So humble yourselves under God’s mighty hand—His mighty ability to intervene in the affairs of mankind—so that He would cause things to turn out well for you%u@[%u@e%u@] when the time’s right%u@[%u@f%u@], %u@7casting all of your cares, anxieties, and worries upon Him, since He’s concerned about you.%vn~
          %u@8Be level-headed and stay focused%u@[%u@g%u@]. Your adversary the devil saunters about like a roaring lion, looking for someone to devour— %u@9Firmly stand against him—firmly resist him—in the faith, knowing first-hand that the same thing is being perpetrated on your fellow comrades%u@[%u@h%u@] in the world, in this ungodly human society. %u@1%u@0But the God of every and all grace, He who called you to His eternal glory in Christ, after suffering a bit, He’ll rehabilitate, restore, mend, stabilize, make you resolute, strengthen you, establish you, and put you on a firm foundation— %u@1%u@1To Him be the Power forever—Amen (no more need by said).%vn~
          %u@1%u@2By means of Silvanus, a comrade%u@[%u@i%u@] who is faithful to you (that’s what I figure), I wrote over the course of a few paragraphs%u@[%u@j%u@], encouraging, counseling, entreating, and declaring these things to be God’s true grace—stand in and stick to the grace!%u@[%U@C%u@]. %u@1%u@3The sister-church in %i@m%i@e%i@t%i@a%i@p%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ Babylon (%i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %I@R%i@o%i@m%i@e)%u@[%U@D%u@], greets you, and %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ Mark my son%u@[%U@E%u@]. %u@1%u@4Greet one another with hearty handshakes and warm hugs of love%u@[%U@F%u@].%vn~
      Peace to you all in Christ.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@a%i@r%i@d…Lit: %i@e%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s. Some liberties taken; ref. note of Acts 11:30.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y…Lit: %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@c%i@r%i@o%i@-%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@a%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@c%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r. The Gk. word for %i@l%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ literally means %i@l%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ or %i@l%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@t%i@m%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@e%i@x%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u. An expression; also used in Is. 14:13,14; 2 Cor. 12:7.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%I@B%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@-%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@c%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d…Lit: %I@B%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@c%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@p%i@e%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Or: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@j%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@w%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@g%i@r%i@a%i@p%i@h%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h [%i@t%i@h%i@e] %i@f%i@e%i@w%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@s. Similar wording used in Eph. 3:3.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@P%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@(%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@;%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@)%i@…Lit: shepherd. The word %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r only appears in a couple of places in the NT (in this verse and in Eph. 4:11); the word for %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@ is the same as %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@d%i@.%i@ The word %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@d%i@ in the OT refers to a leader (Ez. 37:24 is one example). The implication is that people are difficult to lead like sheep are difficult to lead, so the word %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@ is one who faces the difficulties in leading people, who are by nature difficult to lead.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@y%i@l%i@e…Some of the older manuscripts include a variation of this interpolation explicitly in a single Gk. word [%i@e%i@p%i@i%i@s%i@k%i@o%i@p%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ (ἐπισκοποῦντεσ/Strong’s 1983)]%i@ rendered %i@e%i@x%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@;%i@ the word %i@b%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@o%i@p%i@ [%i@e%i@p%i@i%i@s%i@k%i@o%i@p%i@o%i@s, (ἐπίσκοπος/Strong’s 1985)] is obviously the noun form of this verb. As the two principal Alexandrian manuscripts omit the word %i@e%i@p%i@i%i@s%i@k%i@o%i@p%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@s, it is my opinion that this word is a spurious addition—although it fits nicely in the context. As Christianity evolved into the late first and early second centuries, churches governed by elder bodies were replaced by churches governed by a single person—a bishop. They sought to stamp out any suggestion in the NT that churches can or should be governed by elder boards and not by bishops; hence, the addition of the word %i@e%i@p%i@i%i@s%i@k%i@o%i@p%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@ to some of the manuscripts. This controversy persists to the present day.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@!…Lit: %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@t [%i@“%i@i%i@t%i@”%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@“%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@”]%i@!…Or: %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ [%i@“%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@”]%i@!. The words %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ are a clarification for the reader, and this interpolation is justified by matching a pronoun with its antecedents by gender. The GT literally reads %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@t, but scholars argue that Peter actually meant %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@. Some guesswork was used to come up with “stand in and stick to.”%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@-%i@c%i@h%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@t%i@a%i@p%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %I@B%i@a%i@b%i@y%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@(%i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %I@R%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@)…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@-%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ [%i@c%i@h%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@h]%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@B%i@a%i@b%i@y%i@l%i@o%i@n. The word %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ in %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@-%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ shares the same root word for %i@c%i@h%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@h, so %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@-%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ is %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@-%i@c%i@h%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@ or %i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@-%i@c%i@h%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@.%i@ Some Bible “experts” incorrectly render this verse %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@B%i@a%i@b%i@y%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@(%i@e%i@t%i@c%i@)%i@.%i@ This is an incorrect understanding of Gk. grammar, as the prepositional phrase %i@i%i@n%i@ %I@B%i@a%i@b%i@y%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@ , inserted between the definite article and the noun, must be moved, leaving the definite article to couple tightly with the noun, rendering it %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@-%i@c%i@h%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@ instead of the dangling word %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@ etc%i@.%i@ Moving along…many scholars agree that Peter is speaking metaphorically when he speaks of Babylon. In the same verse, he refers to Mark as his son, and as this is metaphorical, it lends credence to assuming that Babylon is metaphorical as well.%fn~
%u@[%U@E%u@]%I@M%i@a%i@r%i@k%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n…Peter is referring to John-Mark, the same Mark who wrote the Gospel of Mark. Mark was not Peter’s actual son, but was Peter’s close companion and son in the faith. Church tradition tells us that Mark served as Peter’s translator, and that Mark wrote the Gospel of Mark shortly after Peter was executed. This Gospel is essentially a compilation of all the stories which Mark translated for Peter time and time again throughout the years.%fn~
%u@[%U@F%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@h%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@r%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@v%i@e…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@v%i@e. Liberties taken. Kisses were normal greetings, and were exchanged irrespective of gender. Judas greeted Jesus with a kiss in the Garden of Gethsemane.%fn~
%i@
2 Peter%ha~
       2 Peter is a long, brilliantly-written diatribe against evil people and has a different flavor than 1 Peter, and this is one reason why the authenticity of its authorship is in question. 2 Peter and Jude are similar books and both faced opposition when the canon was first formalized, with several dissenters who wanted to exclude it.%nv~
       The Greek writing style is a bit choppy in parts, but fluid overall. There is a beauty to the prose as it keeps on a subject while moving from point to point. The transitions are smooth, the verses are sprinkled with metaphors. Overall, the book is as enjoyable to translate as it is to read. It’s a pity that this translation squashes beautiful figures of speech such as found in 2:9 which in the Greek text literally reads, “the Lord knows to rescue the pious”; the figure of speech means that the Lord has a long history of rescuing the pious and will certainly continue to do so.%nv~
       This epistle has many vocabulary words not found elsewhere in the NT. Between this and the fact that it has not received the attention and scholarship that the more popular NT books have received makes it more difficult to resolve the meaning of certain words, an example being 2:17 where the word “mist” is assumed to be “drizzle.”%nv~
       The assertion that the author makes in 3:16, namely that he considers Paul’s epistles to be on par with Scripture, is a view which didn’t evolve until later; when writing his epistles, Paul didn’t believe he was penning Scripture.%nv~
       The author goes out of his way to assure us that this letter is in fact the second epistle (3:1), but giving that assurance is not reassuring: the letter smells like a fraud—howbeit, a well-written one. The epistle expends too much vitriol railing against the corrupt and too little encouraging believers, which doesn’t help its case. And perhaps it is this vitriol which caused a writer other than Peter to lie and claim to be him. We’ll never know.%nv~
%i@%sb~
2 Peter Chapter 1%hb~
          %u@1Simon Peter, servant and missionary%u@[%u@a%u@] of Jesus Christ:%vn~
      To you who received (%i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@u%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@m%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u)%i@ an equivalent-status faith as ours in the righteousness of our God and savior Jesus Christ:%vn~
          %u@2May grace and peace flourish in the recognition and precise understanding of our God and of Jesus our Lord, %u@3as all things having their origin in His divine power, the things associated with life and piety, have been bestowed upon us all through the recognition and understanding of Him who called us by means of His own glory and virtue. %u@4Through %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@v%i@i%i@r%i@t%i@u%i@e%i@ He has given the valuable, absolute-greatest promises to us, so that through them you shoulder-to-shoulder participants would become %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ of %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ divine nature, having escaped the corruption which is with the strong desires and lustful passions in the world-system which humans created.%vn~
          %u@5And for this very reason, get all over it%u@[%u@b%u@] and supply the moral virtue %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@d in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f your faith, and the knowledge %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ in the moral virtue, %u@6and the self-control %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ in the knowledge, and the endurance %i@n%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ in the self-control, and the piety in the endurance, %u@7and the close friendship with your fellow man%u@[%u@c%u@] in the piety, and the love in the close friendship with your fellow man. %u@8In fact, while these things exist in you and increase—as opposed to being idle or unproductive—they constitute coming to the knowledge and understanding of our Lord Jesus Christ.%vn~
          %u@9When you get right down to it, the one who hasn’t gotten this%u@[%u@d%u@] is blind, not being able to see the big picture, oblivious to%u@[%u@e%u@] the cleansing of the sins that he committed long ago. %u@1%u@0All the more reason, comrades%u@[%u@f%u@], to get on it and make sure your Christian walk is tied down%u@[%u@g%u@]; you see, by doing this, there’s no way at all that you’ll ever get off-track. %u@1%u@1The fact is, this is the way that the access into the eternal kingdom (%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@,%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@v%i@o%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s) of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ will be abundantly supplied to you.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2Therefore I intend to constantly remind you of these things, although you’ve reached the point where you have firsthand knowledge and are established in the truth which is right in front of you. %u@1%u@3But I consider it to be the right thing to do, to stir you up by giving you %i@c%i@o%i@p%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ reminders for as long as I’m in this physical container of a body%u@[%u@h%u@], %u@1%u@4seeing that the laying aside of my body is imminent, just as our Lord Jesus Christ made clear to me. %u@1%u@5Now I’ll urgently be about the business of%u@[%u@i%u@] having you constantly keep these memories %i@a%i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e after I depart %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@.%vn~
          %u@1%u@6You see, we weren’t copying crafty, cunning myths when we made known to you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but we happened to be eye-witnesses of that magnificence instead, %u@1%u@7seeing that he received honor and glory from God the Father in such %i@m%i@a%i@j%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@c-sounding words delivered to him by the Magnificent Glory, “This is My Beloved Son, with whom I’ve been very pleased.” %u@1%u@8From out of the sky we heard the sounds of those words, after being brought up the holy mountain with him. %vn~
          %u@1%u@9We have the prophetic word which is more definite. You’d better pay attention %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@t like using a lamp to shine in a dark place until daylight shines through at daybreak and the morning star rises in your hearts. %u@2%u@0Understand this first and foremost: every prophecy of Scripture did not come into being from a single individual’s explanation %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@d%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g; %u@2%u@1the fact of the matter is, no prophecy is ever delivered by a person’s will but instead, while being delivered by the Holy Spirit, men spoke %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@s %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e from God.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@r%i@y…Lit: %i@a%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@e. The author uses the word %i@h%i@u%i@r%i@r%i@y%i@ as an expression, here and also in vv. 10, 15.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@c%i@l%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n…Also: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@v%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@o%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n…Lit: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@c%i@u%i@r%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@p%i@h%i@y%i@s%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y…Lit: %i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t; %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e. The NT uses the word %i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ to mean %i@p%i@h%i@y%i@s%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ as an expression.%u@%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@u%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@e. Ref. note in v. 5.%fn~
%i@%sb~
2 Peter Chapter 2%hb~
          %u@1Now just as false prophets appeared out of nowhere from among the %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@ folk-people, there’ll also be false teachers %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ among you, ones in particular who subtly introduce destructive philosophies%u@[%u@a%u@] along with factions who adhere to them, even denying the Lord who bought them, bringing swift-and-sure destruction upon themselves. %u@2Many will subscribe and adhere to their debauchery, %i@s%i@u%i@b%i@s%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e through whom the Way of Truth will be smeared%u@[%u@b%u@]. %u@3They’ll engage%u@[%u@c%u@] you in a voraciousness of fabricated suppositions—their verdict has been decided for a long time now, and their destruction isn’t snoozing.%vn~
          %u@4The fact of the matter is, if God didn’t spare angels who sinned%u@[%U@A%u@], but instead consigned them to the torture chamber in the pit of hell%u@[%U@B%u@], %i@b%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ in%i@ chains of gloom, to be held in custody %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ until their sentence is handed down; %u@5and %i@i%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@e didn’t spare %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n the antediluvian world%u@[%u@d%u@], but instead %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ spared eight (He guarded over and protected Noah, a preacher of righteousness), having sent a flood to the debauchery-permeated civilization%u@[%u@e%u@]; %u@6and %i@i%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ condemned the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah to ruin and scorched them to the ground, having put an example in place%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@,%i@ of what He intends to do to the ungodly; %u@7and %i@i%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ rescued Lot-the-righteous who was worn out by the lifestyle of the ungodly, %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d by licentiousness— %u@8Speaking of which, the sights and sounds that %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t righteous man %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ day in, day out; a righteous soul living among them, having to put up with %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ out-of-control, immoral freak-show%u@[%u@g%u@]— %u@9The Lord has a long, consistent track record of%u@[%u@h%u@] rescuing the godly from difficulties%u@[%u@i%u@], but %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ locking up and punishing the unrighteous until judgment day is reached— %u@1%u@0but most of all %i@l%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ those who walk in such a way that they follow the lead set by the carnal nature%u@[%u@j%u@] with its polluted desires and %i@l%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ those who despise things pertaining to authority structures.%vn~
      Insolent, arrogant—they don’t tremble with fear while trash-talking%u@[%u@k%u@] the sacrosanct%u@[%u@l%u@], %u@1%u@1whereas angels, which are stronger and have more capabilities, don’t rain an invective judgment from the Lord down on them %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@-%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s. %u@1%u@2But these people, as though they have a nature like they’ve been spawned from ridiculous creatures resulting in their being enthralled to decadence%u@[%u@m%u@], with their ignorant trash-talking—And in their decadence they’ll experience the destructive ends brought on by their decadence; %u@1%u@3acting the wrong way, they’ll pay for their wrong-doing—They consider it a pleasure to revel in daylight, stains and pimples delighting in their tricks and deceptions while they join you in feasts, %u@1%u@4their attention fixated on nothing but%u@[%u@n%u@] adultery and a non-stop list of sins, luring unstable souls, having a heart that’s been conditioned to be covetousness, accursed children— %u@1%u@5Forsaking the straight-and-narrow, they were led astray, imitating the way of Balaam son of Bezer, who loved unrighteousness’s wage. %u@1%u@6He got a rebuke for his wrong-doing: a donkey who can’t talk uttered something in a human voice and brought the prophet’s insanity to a halt.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7These people are springs which have dried up and are drizzle driven by a hurricane, in whom the gloom of darkness has been retained. %u@1%u@8You see, uttering vanity’s arrogance, using the carnal nature’s licentious desires, they lure those who barely escape from those who live a lifestyle of deception— %u@1%u@9they are promised freedom, %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ they exist as slaves of decadence: the fact of the matter is, whatever thing a person’s been defeated by, he’s enslaved to. %u@2%u@0For if they escape the world’s corruption by means of a recognition and precise understanding of the Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, but have become entangled and defeated again by these things %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t, they wind up in the situation where their final condition is worse than their original. %u@2%u@1In fact, they would be better off to have never recognized and understood the way of righteousness than, after recognizing and understanding it, to %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n, out of their betrayal, turn their back on the holy commandments. %u@2%u@2In their case, all the pieces in the oh-so-true proverb fit together snugly%u@[%u@o%u@]: “A dog goes back to its own vomit,” and, “a pig that’s been washed down %i@g%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ to rolling in the mud.”%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@p%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@o%i@s%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@i%i@e%i@s…Also: %i@s%i@y%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@s%i@m%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@b%i@l%i@a%i@s%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@e%i@n%i@g%i@a%i@g%i@e…Lit: %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h. A metaphor.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@l%i@u%i@v%i@i%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d…Lit: %i@o%i@f [%i@t%i@h%i@e] %i@a%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d. Refers to the world as it existed before the flood in Noah’s time.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@b%i@a%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@-%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@z%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@b%i@a%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s. A figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t. The Gk. verb tense insinuates the addition of the words %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@.%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@-%i@o%i@f%i@-%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@l%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@m%i@o%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@-%i@s%i@h%i@o%i@w…Lit: %i@l%i@a%i@w%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@s [%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@-%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@/%i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@t] %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@u%i@e. A figure of speech: saying that the Lord knows to do something instead of saying that He definitely will.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@d%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@s; %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e…Lit: [%i@t%i@h%i@e] %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@-%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@b%i@l%i@a%i@s%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@t…Lit: %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s. Assuming that %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ refers to what Moses said in Exod. 33:18.%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@h%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e…Lit: %i@c%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e. A hendiadys; ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@x%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@e%i@y%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@o%u@]%I@I%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@h%i@-%i@s%i@o%i@-%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@b%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@n%i@u%i@g%i@l%i@y…Lit: %I@I%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@b%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@d…This statement is a pillar in the teaching of “fallen angels,” that some angels rebelled against God and were cast into hell. The notion that demons are fallen angels isn’t supported by what’s written in this passage since these fallen angels were incarcerated.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@l%i@l…Lit: %I@T%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@u%i@s. A deep abyss of torment in Greek mythology.%fn~
%i@%sb~
2 Peter Chapter 3%hb~
          %u@1At this time I’m writing this second letter to you, beloved, in which %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@s I thoroughly rouse your pure mind by %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ reminders, %u@2to remember the collection of previously-spoken statements made by the holy prophets and to remember our %i@p%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ the apostles’ commandment %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ from the Lord and Savior.%vn~
          %u@3Firstmost, understand this: those who get a tremendous kick out of ridiculing%u@[%u@a%u@] will come at a critical juncture in time%u@[%u@b%u@], going about according to their whims %u@4saying:%vn~
      “Where is %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f the promise of His coming%u@[%U@A%u@]? The fact is, starting from when it all began in ancient times, our ancestors have died %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e, and everything’s continued following this same pattern %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@r%i@u%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n from ancient times onwards.%u@[%u@c%u@]”%vn~
          %u@5You see, what the ones who’re deliberately ignoring this are just not getting is that the sky, the upper atmosphere, and outer-space%u@[%u@d%u@] have existed for a long time now, and that the landmasses were assembled out of water and by means of water through the word of God, %u@6through which the world-back-then was flooded and destroyed. %u@7At the present time, the sky, the upper atmosphere, outer-space, and the earth have been kept in a holding pattern%u@[%u@e%u@] by the same word %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ with an end-goal of a judgment day and a %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ destruction of %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ the ungodly people.%vn~
          %u@8Now, make sure you get this, beloved: to the Lord, one day is like a thousand years and a thousand years is like one day. %u@9The Lord isn’t procrastinating in keeping His word%u@[%u@f%u@], like some consider Him to be procrastinating, but He’s exercising patience in regard to you instead, not wishing anyone to be destroyed but leaving space for everyone to have a change of heart and of ways%u@[%u@g%u@] instead.%vn~
          %u@1%u@0The day that the Lord will arrive like a thief %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@e%i@a%i@l, in which %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ the sky, the upper atmosphere, and outer-space as we know them will end%u@[%u@h%u@] in a rushing sound, but the elements%u@[%U@B%u@], as they are heated to an extremely high temperature, will be shattered into pieces, and the earth and what was created from it will be %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@,%i@ discovered, %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@y%i@e%i@d%u@[%U@C%u@]. %u@1%u@1While all these things are shattered into pieces this way, the sort of lifestyle you must maintain is one of holiness and piety, %u@1%u@2eagerly awaiting for and hastening the Day of God, by means of which the sky, the upper atmosphere, and outer-space will be shattered into pieces while burning, and the elements will be melted while being heated to an extremely high temperature. %u@1%u@3We eagerly await a new sky, upper atmosphere, and outer-space, and a new earth according to His promise, %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@w%i@ things righteousness dwells.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4Therefore, beloved, while eagerly awaiting these things, accelerate being found spotless and blameless in him in peace. %u@1%u@5Consider our Lord %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ the patient savior, just as our beloved comrade Paul wrote to you too, according to the wisdom that’s been bestowed on him, %u@1%u@6as he too talks about all these things in his letters, in which %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ some things are difficult to understand, things that the unlearned and unstable distort to their own self-destruction, like they do with the rest of the Scriptures. %u@1%u@7So you, beloved, aware of this beforehand, protect yourselves so that you won’t be deceived by unprincipled men, to be led away from and %i@u%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y fall from your individual steadfastness.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8Now grow in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. To him %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ glory from this moment to the eternal day. Amen (i.e., and with that I rest my case).%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@d%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@m%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@-%i@i%i@n%i@-%i@m%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g. A figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@s. Ref. note of John 6:39.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@u%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@r%i@u%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@s…Lit: %I@F%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@i%i@t [%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@-%i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n] %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@l%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@u%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@-%i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@k%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@m%i@o%i@s%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@-%i@s%i@p%i@a%i@c%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@s. Ref. note of Luke 10:18.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@k%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@n…Lit: %i@l%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p; %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@i%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@c%i@r%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d…Lit: %i@i%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@s…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d…Lit: %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@y; %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g…This refers to OT promises of the coming of the Messiah in power and glory and not necessarily to Jesus’s second coming. %fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@l%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s…Not sure what this refers to%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@y%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d. Assumed this is a figure of speech, as the literal meaning makes little sense. Since it makes little sense, the principal manuscripts disagree as to the exact wording, seeing that some manuscripts have been altered to make sense of this snippet.%fn~
%i@
1 John%ha~
       The epistle of 1 John repeats several phrases from the talks Jesus had at the Last Supper and shortly after, chapters 14–17. Since a large percentage of the Gospel of John consists of the last couple of weeks of Jesus’s life, namely the Last Supper, John was profoundly moved by it and repeated it in 1 John.%nv~
       1 John is enigmatic, and appears at times to contradict itself. John presents things in binary form, in diametrically opposed qualities: love vs. hate, light vs. darkness, sin vs. righteousness. Like his Gospel, many of the words he prefers take on their own peculiar meanings, words such as %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e, %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s, %i@d%i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l, %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n, %i@f%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s. To appreciate this epistle, the reader must approach it from a different perspective than the other epistles, one that’s less cerebral and more spiritual. Naturally, this is the very aspect which many have come to love, as this epistle has endeared itself into their hearts.%nv~
       The Greek text is perhaps the simplest in the NT; this is the preferred first non-textbook reading assignment for the novice Greek student. John intentionally uses a small set of words and simple grammatical constructs. It comes across the same way in the rendered text.%nv~
       %nv~
      %vn~
1 John Chapter 1%hb~
          %u@1That which was from day-one, that which we’ve heard, that which we’ve seen with our eyes, that which we’ve beheld and our hands handled concerning the word of life— %u@2And the life was manifested, and we have beheld %i@i%i@t%i@ and give an official report%u@[%u@a%u@] %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@:%i@ we announce to you the Eternal Life (%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e) which was with the Father and was manifested to us. %u@3That which we’ve beheld and heard, we announce even to you, so that you would have fellowship with us, but also that Our Fellowship %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d %i@b%i@e%i@ with the Father and with His Son Jesus Christ. %u@4We’re writing these things to you so that your joy would attain its greatest extent.%vn~
          %u@5This is the very announcement which we heard from him and announce to you, that God is light and there is not a single bit of darkness in Him. %u@6If we were to say that we have fellowship with Him and conduct our lives%u@[%u@b%u@] in the darkness, we %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ lying and not practicing the truth. %u@7But if we were to conduct our lives in the light %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t as He is in the light, we would have fellowship with one another, and the blood of His son Jesus would cleanse%u@[%u@c%u@] us from all sins. %u@8If we were to say on a given occasion that we don’t have sin, we would be fooling ourselves and the truth would not be%u@[%u@d%u@] in us. %u@9If we were to confess our sins, He’s faithful and always does the right thing so that He would forgive us of our sins and would cleanse us from all unrighteousness. %u@1%u@0If we were to say on a given occasion that we’ve reached the point where we haven’t sinned, we’re making Him out to be a liar and His word (His system of thought) is not in us.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@e…Lit: %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 John Chapter 2%hb~
          %u@1My children, I’m writing these things to you so that you wouldn’t sin. But if someone were to sin, we have a Helper with the Father, righteous Jesus Christ. %u@2And he is, by nature, the means of appeasement where our sin is concerned; not just where our sin is concerned only but also where the sin of the entire world, the established order of humans, is concerned. %u@3If we were to keep His commandments, by this know that we have come to know and understand Him. %u@4The one who says, “I’ve come to know and understand Him,” but isn’t keeping His commandments: he’s a liar, and the truth is not in him. %u@5But %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d, if one were to keep His word, His system of thought, by %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ this the love of God has truly been brought to perfection. By this we know and understand that we are in Him. %u@6The one who’s making statements %i@c%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ to be dwelling in Him—that person is obligated to go through a tour of conduct%u@[%u@a%u@] accordingly and that very person is obligated to be conducting his life%u@[%u@a%u@] in that manner.%vn~
          %u@7Beloved, I’m not writing to you a new, never-heard-of-before commandment, but rather an old commandment, one which you’ve had continually from day-one. The Old Commandment is the train of thought which you’ve heard. %u@8But that being said, I’m writing to you a new, never-heard-of-before commandment, one which is true in Him and in you, that the darkness is waning%u@[%u@b%u@] and the True Light is already shining. %u@9The one who’s making statements %i@c%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g to be in the light but hates his comrade%u@[%u@c%u@] has been in the darkness all this time. %u@1%u@0The one who loves his comrade dwells in the light, and there’s no cause for him to do wrong, be it intentional or unintentional. %u@1%u@1The one who hates his comrade is in the darkness, and he conducts his life%u@[%u@a%u@] in the darkness and with it too. He has no direct knowledge of where he’s headed, since the darkness has made him go blind.%vn~
%si~
%u@1%u@2I’m writing to you, children,%vp~
Because your sins have been forgiven%vp~
On account of His reputation and everything He stands for%u@[%u@d%u@].%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@3I’m writing to you, fathers, because, since day-one,%vp~
You’ve arrived at the point%vp~
Where you know and understand Him.%vp~
%si~
I’m writing to you, aspiring young adults,%vp~
Because you’ve defeated the Evil %I@O%i@n%i@e%i@.%i@%vp~
%i@%si~
%u@1%u@4I wrote to you, you boys %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%u@[%U@A%u@],%vp~
Because you’ve come to know the Father.%vp~
%si~
I wrote to you, fathers, because, since day-one,%vp~
You’ve arrived at the point where%vp~
You know and understand Him%u@[%U@B%u@].%vp~
%si~
I wrote to you, aspiring young adults,%vp~
Because you’re strong,%vp~
And the word of God dwells in you,%vp~
And you’ve defeated the Evil %I@O%i@n%i@e%u@[%U@B%u@].%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@5Do not love the world, the established order of humans, nor those things in the world. If someone were to love the world, the Father’s love is not in him, %u@1%u@6because everything that is in the world—the desires of the body’s carnal nature%u@[%u@e%u@], the desires of what one longs for but doesn’t have%u@[%u@f%u@], and the boastful, ostentatious swagger %i@r%i@o%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s of life—isn’t from the Father but instead is from the world. %u@1%u@7And the world-system is waning%u@[%u@b%u@], but he who’s doing the will of God abides forever.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8You boys who work%u@[%U@A%u@]: it’s the endgame%u@[%u@g%u@], and just as you heard that one who’s nature is of an antichrist is coming, by now many antichrists have come into being. Coming from that perspective, we know and understand that it’s the endgame. %u@1%u@9They left our crowd, but—no—they weren’t a part of us. You see, if they were a part of us, they would’ve remained with us. But—no—%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ in order that it would be made apparent that not everyone is one of us.%vn~
          %u@2%u@0You have a special dispensation bestowed on you%u@[%U@C%u@] from the Holy %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t, and you know everything directly. %u@2%u@1I didn’t write to you because you don’t have a first-hand knowledge of the truth, but rather because you have a first-hand knowledge of the truth, and because every single lie does not originate from the truth. %u@2%u@2Who is the quintessential liar, except for the denier who denies that Jesus is the Messiah, the Christ? This guy is the Antichrist, the denier who denies the Father and the son. %u@2%u@3All deniers who deny the son don’t have the Father either. %u@2%u@4Let what you’ve heard from day-one dwell in you. If what you’ve heard from day-one were to dwell in you, you too will dwell in the son and in the Father. %u@2%u@5And this very thing is the promise which was promised to us: that special fullness of life, Eternal Life.%vn~
          %u@2%u@6I wrote these things to you about those who are deceiving you and thereby leading you astray. %u@2%u@7And you—the special dispensation%u@[%U@C%u@] that you received from Him dwells in you, and you have no need that someone instruct you—no, as the very same special dispensation%u@[%U@C%u@] instructs you about everything and anything, and is true and—%i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@r—is not a lie%u@[%u@h%u@], dwell in Him in the same way that it, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n, has instructed you.%vn~
          %u@2%u@8At this time, children, dwell in him, so that if he were to appear, we would have bold confidence and would not be put to shame at his public appearance. %u@2%u@9If you’ve come to know for a fact that he’s righteous, you know and understand that everyone who practices righteousness also has been begotten from Him and by Him.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@g%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@t…%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t [%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@c%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n]…%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@w%i@a%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r…Lit: %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e…Lit: %i@e%i@y%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@g%i@a%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@—%i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@—%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@e. Adding %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@e%i@,%i@ which is deduced from %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e%i@ is a figure of speech%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k…Lit: %i@b%i@o%i@y%i@s. John uses a different word in 1 John 1:2 for children than this word here. The word %i@b%i@o%i@y%i@ means %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@e%i@r%i@ or %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@.%i@ Ref. note of John 21:5.%u@%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m…%i@a%i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@f%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@E%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@ %I@O%i@n%i@e…The repetition of these two statements just a couple verses before is a figure of speech.%u@%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@w%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g. Also, ref. note of Luke 4:18. The word %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ refers to pouring oil over someone (ex: John 11:2). Throughout the Bible, anointing a person marks that person with extraordinary abilities, abilities which originate from God and are actuated by means of the Holy Spirit (are a manifestation of the Holy Spirit). These special abilities are specific to that one person and are for a particular purpose. In this context of 1 John 2, John’s usage of the word %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ is an extraordinary ability bestowed on each believer, but like any anointing, the extraordinary ability is unique to that person; no other person receives the same anointing. The 1 John 2 anointing is the ability to understand how exactly one should conduct himself in a godly manner on a day-to-day basis. The 1 John 2 anointing gives a person the ability to discern for himself what the correct thing is for him to do in life. Incidentally, this passage here refutes the notion that any church leader (especially a cult leader) should be deciding what an individual church member should do in their circumstances of life, especially to a fine detail.%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 John Chapter 3%hb~
          %u@1Look at the kind of love that the Father has given us, that we would be called God’s children—and we are. Because of this, the world, the established order of humans, doesn’t know and understand us, since it didn’t know and understand Him. %u@2Beloved, at the present time we are God’s children, and it hasn’t yet been made apparent what we’ll be. We know that if he were to be manifested, we would be just like him, because we would%u@[%u@a%u@] see him the way he is. %u@3And everyone who has this hope, a hope which is focused on him, purges himself from defilement%u@[%U@A%u@] in the same way that he has no defilement.%vn~
          %u@4Everyone who practices archetypical sin%u@[%u@b%u@] also practices archetypical lawlessness, that is, the refusal to be restrained by the rules of God or of man. and the archetypical sin IS the archetypical lawlessness. %u@5And we know for a fact that that person appeared in order to take away the archetypical sins, and there is no sin in him. %u@6Everyone who’s dwelling in him isn’t sinning%u@[%u@c%u@]; everyone who’s sinning has not seen him nor has come to know and understand him. %u@7Children, let no one deceive you and lead you astray: the one who practices righteousness is righteous, in the same way that That Person is righteous. %u@8The one who practices sin is from the devil, since he’s been sinning%u@[%u@d%u@] from day-one. The Son of God appeared for this reason, so that he would break up and disperse the works of the devil. %u@9Everyone who’s begotten from and by God doesn’t practice sin, since His DNA%u@[%u@e%u@] dwells in him, and he can’t sin on an ongoing basis%u@[%u@f%u@], since he’s begotten from and by God. %u@1%u@0God’s children and the devil’s children are apparent by this: everyone who’s not practicing righteousness is not from God, and %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ the one who isn’t loving his comrades%u@[%u@g%u@], %u@1%u@1because this is the very announcement which you heard from day-one: that you would love one another— %u@1%u@2%i@a%i@n%i@d not %i@a%i@c%i@t in in the same manner as Cain, who was from the Evil One, and slew his brother. And what satisfaction and delight did he get by slaying him? %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ because his works were evil whereas his brother’s were righteous. %u@1%u@3Don’t be amazed, comrades, if the world hates you. %u@1%u@4We know for a fact that we have been relocated out of the %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f death into the %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ life, because we love the comrades. He who doesn’t love dwells in the %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ death. %u@1%u@5Everyone who hates his comrade on an ongoing basis is a murderer, and you know for a fact that all murderers don’t have that special fullness of life—eternal life—dwelling in him. %u@1%u@6By this we have come to know and understand the love %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d, because that person put his life on the line and, indeed, laid it down%u@[%u@h%u@], and we are obligated to put our lives on the line on behalf of the comrades. %u@1%u@7But if said person were to be in possession of life-sustaining goods and see his comrade in need and were to close off his inner, heart-felt compassion from him, how does God’s love dwell in him? %u@1%u@8Children, let us not love in concept%u@[%u@i%u@] nor in speech but rather in activity and in truth.%vn~
          %u@1%u@9By this we know and understand that we are part of the truth, and reassure our hearts before Him in His very presence, %u@2%u@0that if our heart were to condemn us by the guilt of introspection%u@[%U@B%u@], since God is greater than our heart and knows and understands everything. %u@2%u@1Beloved, if %i@o%i@u%i@r heart were to not condemn us by the guilt of introspection, we have confidence towards God, %u@2%u@2and that which we were to ask for we receive from Him, because we keep His commandments and we do those things before Him, in His very presence, which are pleasing to Him. %u@2%u@3And this very thing is His commandment, that we would believe in the reputation and vested authority%u@[%u@j%u@] of His son Jesus Christ and that we would love one another, in the same way He commanded us to do so. %u@2%u@4And the keeper of His commandments dwells in him and he in him. And by this we know and understand that he dwells in us: %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@ from the Spirit he gave us.%i@%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@a%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@t%i@y%i@p%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n. Same article-plus-word-pair used in John 8:34.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@i%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g…Or: %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n; %i@w%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@;%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t. The Gk. text is ambiguous.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%I@D%I@N%I@A…Lit: %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@m%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@n. The verb tense for %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@ implies continuous action, as opposed to one-time action.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n…Same expression used in John 10:11; ref. note there.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t…Lit: %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d. Ref. note of John 1:1.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@r%i@e%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@p%i@u%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@f%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t…A metaphor comparing a NT believer’s purging of sin with the mandates in the OT Law of Moses concerning clean and unclean%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@m%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@u%i@i%i@l%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@m%i@n. The Gk. word %i@k%i@a%i@t%i@a%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@ō%i@s%i@k%i@ō%i@ (καταγινώσκω/Strong’s 2607) used for %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@m%i@n%i@ here (and is only used three times in the NT, two of them in this passage) is different than %i@k%i@a%i@t%i@a%i@k%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@ō%i@ (κατακρίνω/Strong’s 2632), the Gk. word normally used for %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@m%i@n. The meaning derived from kataginōskō’s%i@ roots%i@ is %i@t%i@o %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w %i@b%i@y %i@i%i@n%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ +%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ [where %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ means %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o; %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t; %i@a%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n]%i@.%i@ Compare this to katakrinō, which is condemnation rendered as a verdict by a deliberative body, that is, an impartial, external party.%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 John Chapter 4%hb~
          %u@1Beloved, don’t believe in every spirit, but instead examine the spirits %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ if they are from God and accept or reject them %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@l%i@y, because many false prophets have ventured out into the world, the established order of humans. %u@2You’ll know %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h the Spirit of God %i@o%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ by this: all spirits who confess that Jesus Christ has come %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@ in actual flesh and blood%u@[%u@a%u@] are from God, %u@3and all spirits not confessing Jesus Christ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@ are not from God. And this is the %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t of the archetypical antichrist, that which you’ve heard is coming %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d, and by this time is already in the world. %u@4You are from God, children, and have defeated them, since greater is the one in you than the one in the world. %u@5They are from the world; for this reason they speak as belonging to the world, and the world listens to them. %u@6You are from God. He who knows and understands God listens to portions of the things we say; said person who is not from God won’t listen to any part of what we have to say. By this we know, understand, and recognize the pervasive aura%u@[%U@A%u@] of truth and the pervasive aura of error.%vn~
          %u@7Beloved, let us love one another, since the %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@n%i@ love is from God, and all who love have been begotten by and from God and know and understand God. %u@8The one who isn’t in the habit of loving didn’t %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ know and understand God, since God is love. %u@9The love of God has been made apparent in us by this, that God has sent his Only Begotten Son into the world in order that we could live through him. %u@1%u@0The %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@n love is %i@i%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ by this: not that we have arrived at the point where we love God, but that He loved us and sent His son as the means of appeasement where our sin is concerned. %u@1%u@1Beloved, if God loved us in this manner, we too are obligated to %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r love one another. %u@1%u@2Nobody has reached the point where they’ve seen God entirely. If we were to love one another, God dwells in us and His love is in a state of completion.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3We know and understand that we are abiding in Him and He in us by this: %i@w%i@e%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ from the Spirit He’s given us. %u@1%u@4We have seen and we go on record%u@[%u@b%u@] that the Father has sent the son, the savior of the world. %u@1%u@5If said person were to confess that Jesus is the Son of God, God dwells in him and He in God. %u@1%u@6And we have come to know, to understand, and to believe the love which God has in us.%vn~
      God is love, and the one dwelling in the %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@a%i@n%i@ love dwells in God, and God dwells in him; %u@1%u@7by this, the love has been brought to perfection among us. This is so that we would have confidence on judgment day, since just as That One is, we too are %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ in this world. %u@1%u@8Fear is not in or by the love %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d, but rather the perfected love %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ expels fear, since fear involves%u@[%u@c%u@] punishment; and the one who fears has not reached a state of perfection in the love %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d. %u@1%u@9We love because He first and foremost loved us. %u@2%u@0If someone were to say on a given occasion “I love God” and were to hate his comrade%u@[%u@d%u@], he’s a liar; you see, the one who doesn’t love his comrade is a liar. The fact is, the one who doesn’t love his comrade whom he’s seen can’t love the God whom he hasn’t seen. %u@2%u@1And we possess this commandment, that the one who loves God would love his comrade too.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@d…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@g%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d…Lit: %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@y%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@v%i@o%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@a%i@s%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@r%i@a…Lit: %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t. In the Bible, the word %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ at times refers to an actual spirit-being and at other times refers to dominant inner attitude or a group attitude (in addition to this verse, 2 Tim. 1:7, for example), similar to the English phrase “team spirit%i@.%i@”%fn~
%i@%sb~
1 John Chapter 5%hb~
          %u@1Everyone who believes that Jesus is the Messiah, the Christ, has been begotten from God, and everyone who loves the One who does the begetting also loves the one who has been begotten from Him. %u@2By this we know and understand that we love God’s children: %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ when we love God and we practice His commandments. %u@3You see, God’s love is this very thing, that we would keep His commandments. And His commandments aren’t burdensome, %u@4since all those who’ve been begotten from God defeat the world-system. And this very thing is the victory which defeated the world: our faith.%vn~
          %u@5So, who is the one who defeats the world, if not the one who believes that Jesus is the Son of God? %u@6This person—Jesus Christ—is the one who has come through water and blood; not by water alone but by water and by blood. And the Spirit is the one who testifies, because the Spirit is the truth. %u@7For there are three who testify: %u@8the Spirit, the water, and the blood%u@[%U@A%u@], and the three are contained in the One%u@[%u@a%u@]. %u@9If we receive testimony from mankind, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n God’s testimony is superior, because it is God’s very own testimony, because He has gone on record and testified about His son. %u@1%u@0The one who believes in the Son of God has the testimony in himself. The one who won’t believe in God makes Him %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e a liar, because he has not arrived at a point where he has believed in the testimony which God has testified concerning His son. %u@1%u@1And this very thing is the testimony, that God gave us that special fullness of life, eternal life, and the life itself is in His son. %u@1%u@2Whoever has the son has the Father; he who doesn’t have the Son of God doesn’t have the life %I@I%i@’%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3I wrote these things to you so that you’d know for a fact that you have eternal life; %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@“%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@”%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@ those who believe in all that the Son of God stands for%u@[%u@b%u@]. %u@1%u@4And this very thing is the confidence which we have with Him, that if we were to ask for something in accordance with His will, He listens to us. %u@1%u@5And if we know for sure that He listens to us in regard to the thing we asked for, we know for a fact that we %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@u%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ have the requests that we have asked of Him.%vn~
          %u@1%u@6If someone were to see in its entirety his comrade%u@[%u@c%u@] while he’s committing a sin, he shall ask %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@ and He will give him life, with %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ those who are committing sins not resulting in %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ death. There is a sin leading to %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ death: I’m not talking about that, that he should ask %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@e. %u@1%u@7All wrong-doing is sin, but there is sin the nature of which does not result in %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ death.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8We know for a fact that everyone who’s been begotten from God doesn’t sin; rather, the one begotten from God keeps him, and the Evil One won’t touch him. %u@1%u@9We know for a fact that we are from God, and the entire world—the established order of humans—lies in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ the Evil One. %u@2%u@0Now we know for a fact that the Son of God has come and has given to us an intellect so that we could know and understand the truth. And we are in the truth %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ in His son Jesus Christ. This person is the true God and he is that special fullness of life, eternal life.%vn~
          %u@2%u@1Children, get yourselves as far away %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ from the idols %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p%i@s%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@.%i@%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@n%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o [unlikely, but perhaps: %i@f%i@o%i@r; %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@o] %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@d%i@o%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@p%i@s…Lit: %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@d%i@o%i@l%i@s%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@d…The Spirit (the Holy Spirit) comes and lives inside of a believer and breathes new life.
