The water is the water of baptism, when coming out of it, after being totally immersed in it, a person is changed. The blood is what Jesus shed for the remission of our sins.%fn~

2 John%ha~
       In 2 John, John continues to speak in a similar way as 1 John, again confirming the supposition that John spoke this way all the time. John’s writing style from his first is not a one-off. But as the epistle is directed to a specific person and as the goal is to thwart false teaching, he breaks from his normal style at times to address a pressing issue.%nv~
       But the fact that he had to address false teaching reminds us of how severe the challenge of heresy was in the early church and how good we have it today in that respect.%nv~
%i@%sb~
2 John%hb~
          %u@1%I@F%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ the%i@ distinguished, respected gentleman%u@[%u@a%u@]:%vn~
      To the Lady%u@[%u@b%u@] chosen %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ and to her children, whom I love in truth, and not just me but all who’ve come to know and understand the truth, %u@2because of the truth which dwells in us and with us forevermore:%vn~
          %u@3Joy, mercy, %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ peace will be with us from %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ Father-God and from the Father’s son Jesus Christ, in truth and in love.%vn~
          %u@4I rejoiced tremendously because I discovered that your children are conducting their lives%u@[%u@c%u@] in truth, in accordance with a%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@-%i@g%i@u%i@i%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g commandment that we received from the Father. %u@5And at this time I’m asking you, Madame%u@[%u@b%u@]—not like I’m writing a new, never-heard-of-before commandment but rather one which we’ve had from day-one—that we love one another. %u@6And love is this very thing, that we conduct our lives according to His commandment. This very thing is the commandment. Just as you heard it %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@l%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u from day-one, so conduct your lives accordingly, %u@7because many deceivers have dispersed themselves throughout the world, deceivers who don’t confess Jesus Christ as having come in %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l flesh %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@d%u@[%u@d%u@]: this is the archetypical deceiver and antichrist. %u@8Watch yourselves now, that you don’t ruin what we’ve accomplished but get paid every cent you’ve earned%u@[%u@e%u@] instead. %u@9All who are venturing beyond %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@e%i@d %i@t%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ and are not remaining in the doctrine of Christ do not have God. The one who remains in the teaching: this person has both the Father and the son. %u@1%u@0If someone comes to you and doesn’t bring this doctrine %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@C%i@h%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m, don’t take him into a home and don’t extend a greeting to him which makes him welcome. %u@1%u@1You see, the one who expresses a greeting to him which makes him welcome aids, abets, and is a fellow-participant in his deeds, which are evil.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2I have a lot to write to you about but decided not to on account of %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h pen and paper%u@[%u@f%u@], but rather hope to appear to you in person and speak face-to-face, so that our joy would be filled to the fullest.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3The children %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ of your fellow-chosen-%i@o%i@f%i@-%I@G%i@o%i@d-woman%u@[%u@g%u@] greet you.%i@%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@d%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@n…Lit: %i@e%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%I@L%i@a%i@d%i@y%i@…%I@M%i@a%i@d%i@a%i@m%i@e…The Gk. word is the female form of %i@l%i@o%i@r%i@d; a woman who has authority%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@d…Lit: %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@g%i@e. An expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%u@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@p%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@p%i@a%i@p%i@y%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@k. An expression; guessing as to what it means exactly.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@-%i@c%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@-%i@o%i@f%i@-%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@-%i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n…Lit: %i@c%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%fn~

3 John%ha~
       In the epistle of 3 John, there is much less resemblance to John’s Gospel and his other two epistles. It’s as though it’s an off-the-cuff letter, one captured at random and preserved for posterity. John, the Apostle of Love, must deal with a rotten apple named Diotrephes, and he does not dodge the confrontation. This is an alternative glimpse into the life of love. And we are again reminded how good we have it in modern times in this respect, not having to deal with such trouble-makers.%nv~
       Verse 2 is one of the pillar scriptures of the prosperity message (a.k.a. the prosperity gospel). Oral Robert in his poverty stumbled across this verse in this oft-neglected epistle and from that moment taught it until he died.%nv~
%i@%sb~
3 John%hb~
          %u@1%I@F%i@r%i@o%i@m the distinguished, respected gentleman%u@[%u@a%u@] to the beloved Gaius, whom I love in truth.%vn~
          %u@2Beloved, I’m praying that you prosper, be successful, and be healthy in the same way that your mind and emotions%u@[%u@b%u@] prosper. %u@3You see, I rejoiced tremendously with the coming of the comrades%u@[%u@c%u@] and in their giving an account of you, %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ truthful insofar as you conduct your lives%u@[%u@d%u@] in truth. %u@4I have no joy greater than hearing that my own %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ children%i@ conduct their lives with the truth.%vn~
          %u@5Beloved, you’d be acting in a faithful manner if you were to do something for the comrades—especially %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e strangers— %u@6the ones who gave an account of your love in front of %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ churches, which you’ll do well by sending them forth %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@j%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@f%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@-%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y worthy of God. %u@7You see, for the sake of reputation%u@[%u@e%u@], they left taking nothing from the Gentiles. %u@8So we are obligated to receive (i.e., heartily welcome, provide room and board, and attend to their needs while they visit) people such as this in order that we might become fellow-workers in the truth.%vn~
          %u@9I wrote something to the church; instead %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@, Diotrephes, who relishes being the number-one among them, didn’t receive (i.e., welcome; embrace) %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ we%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r. %u@1%u@0Because of this, if I do come, I’ll remind you of the things he did, shooting his mouth off saying nasty%u@[%u@f%u@] things about us. And if that wasn’t enough, he didn’t receive the comrades either, and he prevented those who were planning to receive them %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ and kicked them out of the church.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1Beloved, don’t imitate the bad %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ but imitate the good instead. He who does good is from God. He who does bad has not seen God.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2Demetrius gave a glowing report about everyone and spoke the very truth%u@[%u@g%u@]; we too give a %i@g%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ report, and you know for a fact that our report is right-on.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3I have lots of things to write to you about, but don’t want to write on account of %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ pen and paper%u@[%u@h%u@]. %u@1%u@4Now I hope to see you soon and speak to you face-to-face.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5Peace %i@b%i@e%i@ to you. The close friends greet you. Go down the list of names and greet the close friends.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@d%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@n…Lit: %i@e%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@m%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@a%i@l%i@k%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Or: %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f [%i@h%i@i%i@s] %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@n%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@g%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@p%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@p%i@a%i@p%i@y%i@r%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@k. An expression; guessing as to what it means exactly.
The Epistle of Jude%ha~
       This epistle written in an unambiguous, fluid, textbook-like style not only demonstrates the writer’s command of Greek but also shows his clarity of mind and ability to express himself throughout a long warning about “certain people who have infiltrated our community.” But at the bottom of the epistle, there is some meat for Christians to feed on, and most gravitate towards this.%nv~
       The author of this epistle writes in a style which is similar to that of 2 Peter, and the subject-matter of both epistles is the same. In fact, some uncommon words—and even phrases—are common to both 2 Peter and Jude. For example: %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@o%i@m%i@ (v. 6); %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ (v. 8 & 2 Pet. 2:10); the specific usage of %i@b%i@l%i@a%i@s%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@y%i@ (v. 9); %i@r%i@i%i@d%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ (v. 10 & 2 Pet. 2:12); plus several more. Is it plausible that the same author wrote both epistles? The commonality of words and phrases means that, at a minimum, both authors were members of the same tight circle of associates.%nv~
       Verses 6 and 7 build on a theory about fallen angels which scholars believe comes from the Book of Enoch, which the epistle quotes in vv. 14,15, treating the source material as though it’s canonical. And in v. 9 he draws from an account about Moses which comes from a writing other than the OT, but at the same time assumes the reader is familiar with the story.%nv~
       It’s no surprise, then, that when the church fathers gathered to settle the NT canon, these two books were heavily contested.%nv~
%i@%sb~
Jude%hb~
          %u@1Jude, the servant of Jesus Christ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ brother of James:%vn~
      To the beloved in the Father-God and in Jesus Christ, those who have been preserved as God’s elect:%vn~
          %u@2Mercy, peace, and love to you many times over.%vn~
          %u@3Beloved, I’ve got to write to you—and I’m writing as quickly as possible—about our mutual salvation, to plead with you to contend this once for the holy faith that was delivered to you. %u@4You see, certain%u@[%u@a%u@] people have infiltrated %i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@m%i@u%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@,%i@ all of whom have already been described in Scripture as %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ result in judgment; ungodly men, transforming our God’s grace into debauchery and denying the one master, our Lord Jesus Christ.%vn~
          %u@5Now I wish to remind you…A %i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e ago, %i@a%i@s%i@ you’re well-aware, the Lord rescued a people from Egypt—the second %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@s%i@,%i@ He wiped out those who refused to have faith and believe; %u@6not only that but He’s imprisoned angels who didn’t stick to the domain which was their right to exercise authority over%i@ but instead abandoned their habitat, which resulted in a verdict being delivered against them when the scores were settled%u@[%u@b%u@], %i@l%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ to everlasting bonds %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ oppressed by gloom. %u@7Like Sodom and Gomorrah and those in the surrounding cities, they were put on exhibit as an example of undergoing the punishment of eternal fire for having committed gross acts of sexual immorality in having pursued %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@x%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ a different kind of physical body %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%u@[%u@c%u@] the same way those other guys (%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@s) did. %u@8Nevertheless—sure—those %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e who also dream about %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@x%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ physical bodies defile %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s, but %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ they %i@a%i@l%i@s%i@o reject things pertaining to authority structures, and %i@y%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ bad-mouth the sacrosanct%u@[%u@d%u@].%vn~
          %u@9Now when the archangel Michael was in the middle of an argument with the devil over Moses’s body%u@[%U@A%u@], he didn’t dare rain an invective judgment down on him, but instead said, “May you be rebuked by the Lord!” %u@1%u@0Now those people indeed bad-mouth things which they have no direct knowledge of, those whose understanding has a nature like ridiculous creatures; they’re being destroyed in these matters by their decadence.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1Woe to them because they’ve followed the same trajectory as Cain; and %i@b%i@y %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ in%i@ the deception of Balaam, Balaam’s reward has been poured out on them; and %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@o%i@g%i@y%i@ in the ridiculousness of Korah’s %i@r%i@e%i@b%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ they were destroyed.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2These are the ones who are stains in your love-feasts, irreverently%u@[%u@e%u@] joining you in festive merry-making—self-guided, self-directed; moisture-less clouds that get driven past by the wind%u@[%U@B%u@]; trees which yield nothing at harvest-season%u@[%u@f%u@], absolutely and completely dead%u@[%u@g%u@] and uprooted; %u@1%u@3savage ocean waves, their shame causing the foam %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e; wandering stars for whom the gloom of darkness has been forevermore reserved.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4Now Enoch, the seventh %i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n from Adam, prophesied about them, saying:%vn~
       “Look at this now—the Lord came with his holy myriads %u@1%u@5to enact judgment against everyone and convict every living being in regard to all their ungodly works which they did in an ungodly way and about all the harsh%u@[%u@h%u@] things which ungodly sinners spoke against Him.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@6Those guys are grumblers, fault-finders, going here and there following their intense, personal desires, and their mouths speak condescendingly, flattering others in order to gain favors.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7Now you, beloved, remember the words spoken beforehand by the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ, %u@1%u@8that they kept on telling us, “At a critical juncture in time%u@[%u@i%u@], from among the ungodly there will be mockers going around following their intense, personal desires.” %u@1%u@9These are the ones who cause division; they are naturally-minded and dominated by the mental facilities, not possessing the Spirit.%vn~
          %u@2%u@0But you, beloved, edifying yourselves—building yourselves up—in your most holy faith, praying in the Holy Spirit, %u@2%u@1keep%u@[%u@j%u@] yourself in the love of God while awaiting the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ resulting in that special fullness of life, eternal life.%vn~
          %u@2%u@2On the one hand, have mercy on some, %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ those who are in doubt, %u@2%u@3but on the other hand, grab some others and jerk them out of the fire. Now have mercy on %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e reverently and with trepidation, hating even the shirt%u@[%u@k%u@] dirtied by the flesh.%vn~
          %u@2%u@4Now to the One who’s able to guard over you keeping you from falling prey to temptation or making a mistake and to present you before His glory without blemish with exultation, %u@2%u@5to our One Savior-God %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ through Jesus Christ our Lord %i@b%i@e%i@ glory, majesty, power, and authority in the forefront of the entire age, in the present moment, and extending to all the ages %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e. Amen (i.e., and with that I rest my case).%i@%vn~

%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@c%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n…Also: %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@w%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@p%i@h%i@y%i@s%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n…Lit: %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@t…Lit: %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s. Ref. 2 Pet. 2:10.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@i%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@l%i@y…Also: %i@f%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@l%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@-%i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@a%i@b%i@s%i@o%i@l%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d…Lit: %i@d%i@o%i@u%i@b%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@s%i@h…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@k%i@e%i@e%i@p…The verb form insinuates a stronger command than a simple imperative%fn~

%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@a%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@ %I@M%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@e%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@d%i@d%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@g%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y…Scholars say that this refers to a story in the %I@A%i@s%i@s%i@u%i@m%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@M%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@s, a 1%u@s%u@t-century Jewish work. The Assumption of Moses is not part of the Bible.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@m%i@o%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@-%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@n%i@d…Generally speaking, a farmer hopes that any cloud which pass overhead will sprinkle some rain on his crops. These pass by but deliver no rain.%fn~

%fn~

Revelation%ha~
       The final piece of John’s portfolio of writings differs from the others. Revelation is a continuation of the prophesies in Genesis, Ezekiel, Daniel, and Zechariah, and the novice reader, lacking an overall view of the Bible, jumps into Revelation without first getting up to speed on those other books. This is explained in the author’s book %I@A%i@ %I@P%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@ %I@R%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@.%nv~
       There are, however, numerous grammatical mistakes in Revelation, and this leaves one to wonder what the cause of these mistakes is. Can we assume that John wrote the book with the help of a scribe?— Scribes normally edit out such errors. In addition, it appears that John jumbles verb tenses throughout. This might be him seeing a vision in the present of something that will happen in the future as though it happened already but as though he witnessed it in real-time. Some of these mistakes are probably John not remembering the form of a particular verb. He does have a mastery of what the forms do, but Greek is convoluted. Some of the “mistakes” can be chalked up to John’s writing style, his peculiar figures of speech. The long note in Rev. 8:3 captures an example of such grammatical errors.%nv~
       Revelation does follow John’s propensity to utilize a smaller vocabulary than the likes of Paul, but the Greek text is both simple and complex at the same time. When translating it, one finds himself not so much following the literal meaning of the words and the nuances of the forms, but standing back and getting the gist of what’s being said and then putting that down. It’s as though one is listening closely to someone speaking to the broken-Greek, then putting the pieces together. At times, this becomes difficult because Revelation is so bizarre, and one doesn’t know if he’s encountering weirdness or John’s weakness in describing something. For example, Rev. 13:18, “it’s a man’s number”—not quite sure if that’s something ordinary that’s not explained well or if it’s yet another mystery of Revelation.%nv~
       John’s final book complements his other writings since it differs in style from his gospel and his epistles. After a close reading of the Greek text, he appears to be a strong-willed person who does things his own way. He’s not as loud as Mark (and Peter by extension), but isn’t one who submits to accepted conventions of writing like Luke. To read John’s books is to enter his world and to go to him, for he will not go to you.%nv~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 1%hb~
          %u@1A revelation—a revealing—by Jesus Christ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@d%i@d%i@e%i@n, %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n which God gave to him, to show his servants what must come to pass post-haste%u@[%u@a%u@]. He transmitted what he saw through His angel to his servant John, %u@2who gave an official account of God’s discourse and of the statement%u@[%u@b%u@] of Jesus Christ. %u@3Blessed be the one reading %i@a%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@r%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ and the listeners %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@r%i@e%i@g%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ who hear the words of the prophecy and who keep what’s been written therein, for the time is near.%vn~
          %u@4%I@F%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ John to the seven churches in the %I@R%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ Asia: grace be to you and peace from He Who was, Who is, and Who is to come, and from the seven spirits that are right in front of His throne, %u@5and from Jesus Christ, the Faithful Witness, the first-born from the dead, and the ruler of the kings of the earth.%vn~
      To him who loved us and who by his blood detached us from our sins, %u@6and who made us %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o a kingdom, %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ personal attendants%u@[%U@A%u@] to his Father-figure-God%u@[%u@c%u@]—to him be the glory and the power forevermore. So be it%u@[%u@d%u@].%vn~
%si~
%u@7Look!—he’s breaking through%u@[%u@e%u@] the clouds%vp~
And every %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ eyes will see him,%vp~
Even those who pierced him,%vp~
And all the tribes of the earth%u@[%U@B%u@]%vp~
Upon %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g him will thump %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@s %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%vp~
%si~
…Yes, indeed. Let it be so%u@[%u@d%u@].%nn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@”%R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@A%r@l%r@p%r@h%r@a%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@m%r@e%r@g%r@a%r@…%r@,%r@”%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@“%r@…%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@n%r@e%r@ %R@W%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@n%r@e%r@ %R@W%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@n%r@e%r@ %R@W%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@A%r@l%r@m%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@y%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@9I, John, your comrade%u@[%u@f%u@] and co-worker in the tribulation, kingdom, and perseverance in Jesus, wound up on the island%u@[%u@g%u@] of Patmos because of the word of God and the solemn declaration of %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o Jesus. %u@1%u@0I found myself in the Spirit%u@[%U@C%u@] on a Sunday%u@[%u@h%u@] and heard behind me a loud voice like a trumpet %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@s %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@ %u@1%u@1saying, %r@“%R@W%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@c%r@r%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@u%r@r%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@:%r@ %R@E%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@s%r@,%r@ %R@S%r@m%r@y%r@r%r@n%r@a%r@,%r@ %R@P%r@e%r@r%r@g%r@a%r@m%r@u%r@m%r@,%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@y%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@r%r@a%r@,%r@ %R@S%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %R@P%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@l%r@p%r@h%r@i%r@a%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@L%r@a%r@o%r@d%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@a%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@2I turned %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ so I could be facing the voice while it was speaking to me. Once I turned %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d I saw seven golden lamps, %u@1%u@3and in the middle of the lamps I saw something equivalent to the ideal embodiment of a human being%u@[%u@i%u@], wearing a long robe that went down to his feet and wearing a golden sash around his chest. %u@1%u@4His head and his hair were as white as white wool—as %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ snow—and his eyes were like wheels of fire %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@.%i@ %u@1%u@5His feet were the same as copper or bronze as it’s being melted in a furnace, and his voice is like a voice composed of a large volume of rushing water%u@[%u@j%u@]. %u@1%u@6He had seven stars in his right hand, and from his mouth was a sharp, protruding, two-edged sword (a 4 foot/120cm long Thracian sword), and his face shined like the sun when it’s at its maximum intensity.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7When I saw him, I fell at his feet as though I was dead. He put his right hand on me while saying, %r@“%R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@r%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@—%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@—%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@D%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%r@%%R@I%r@@%R@A%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@m%r@p%r@s%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@w%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@u%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@p%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@l%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@i%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@v%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@s%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@(%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@)%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@u%r@r%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@m%r@p%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@u%r@r%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@”%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@-%i@h%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@e…Lit: %i@q%i@u%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@l%i@y. This doesn’t necessarily mean that he’s coming soon; it means that he’ll travel quickly when he does come, like a thief in the night. Ref. usage of %i@q%i@u%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@l%i@y%i@ with regard to travelling in 1 Cor. 4:19.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@.%i@ This phrase is repeated throughout Revelation.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@-%i@f%i@i%i@g%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@-%I@G%i@o%i@d…Lit: %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r. This is a hendiadys; ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@s%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t…%I@L%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@…Lit: %i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@.%i@ Ref. note of Rev. 19:4.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h…Lit: %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@d…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %I@S%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@y…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@-%i@d%i@a%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@e%i@m%i@b%i@o%i@d%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@o%i@l%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@s. Like the sound a waterfall makes.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@s…Lit: %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@s. In this context, a priest is one who carries out the ritualistic duties demanded by the holy presence of the Almighty, similar to how priests in the OT had duties in the temple.%u@%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h…Using the word %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@s as a metonymy for the present-day ethnic groups and nations; the assumption being that all ethnic groups and nations were spawned by a single, specific tribe at their inception, in the same as is recorded in the OT, Gen. 10 in particular.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@S%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t…A strong presence of the Holy Spirit (1 Cor. 12:3) comes upon a person, often accompanied by some sort of prophetic utterance.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@m%i@y%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s. A reference to death as alluded to in the OT and to death as portrayed by Greek mythology. As Christians, John and those who read the revelation will take this as a figure of speech, as they are taught in heaven vs. hell mythology (mythology meaning the understanding of the components in the unseen world, not a fictitious story).%fn~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 2%hb~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@”%R@W%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@E%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@u%r@r%r@c%r@h%r@:%r@%vn~
      %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@‘%r@%%R@I%r@@%R@F%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@d%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@m%r@p%r@s%r@:%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@I%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@n%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%si~
%r@“%r@’%R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@%vp~

%u@[%u@f%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d …Ref. Rev. 1:16%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%I@C%i@i%i@t%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@l…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@e %fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@l%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@(%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@—%i@b%i@o%i@y%i@—%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@y%i@p%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@?%i@)%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@r%i@a%i@e%i@l%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@d%i@f%i@a%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@d. An expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@v%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n. It’s inferred from the use of the word %i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d%i@r%i@e%i@n in 1 John, 2 John, and 3 John that these are not her actual children.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@o%i@n%i@i%i@z%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h…Lit%i@:%i@ %I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h. A figure of speech.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@v%i@o%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@v%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@v%i@o%i@r%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@w%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@t…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@b%i@b%i@l%i@e…%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@b%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@w%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e. Liberties taken. The pebble referred to by John is a pebble used for voting; white is a vote for a candidate and black is a vote against a candidate.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@r%i@e…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u. An expression, likely a metaphor which compares a person to a beast of burden, a pack animal which is already loaded with materials to carry and its master refuses to weigh it down with any more materials.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 3%hb~

      %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %R@S%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@”%r@’%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@u%r@r%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@’%r@”%r@%vn~

%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d…Lit: %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%I@G%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@c%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t…Lit: %I@B%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@m%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@e%i@.%i@ Ref. Matt 24:42 for similar rendering of word %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@f%i@u%i@l.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@e%i@q%i@u%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@g%i@o%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@y…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@f%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@s…Lit: %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@b%i@u%i@r%i@g%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@i%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@,%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r. Ref. Matt. 11:15.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@s%i@y%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t…Lit: %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@—%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@m%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@y…Lit: %i@w%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@s%i@o%i@-%i@b%i@e%i@-%i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %I@A%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@s…Angels are affiliated with the holiness of God, and God uses them as attendants in the same way that priests used to attend to the temple in Jerusalem. They are bystanders, in other words, so they hear anything which is presented before God’s throne.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@P%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@l%i@p%i@h%i@i%i@a…The Quakers named the city of Philadelphia in Pennsylvania after the city this church was in, as they aspired to emulate this church, since the church received all praise and no censure.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%I@I%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m…The significance of writing a name on a person is that it puts a stamp of approval on a person, and additionally advertises that approval to everyone.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@b%i@u%i@y%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@m%i@e…An elaborate metaphor of buying purified gold, clothing, and eye ointment from Jesus. The buying aspect is to allow God to do His work in one’s life, rather than for a person to attempt it on his own. The purified gold represents trials which are allowed in one’s life, the purpose of which is, in the pressure exerted by them, to remove life’s impurities. White clothing represents righteousness that’s received by God and not a righteousness generated out of one’s own efforts. The eye ointment allows one to see plainly what the issues are in one’s life, seeing what should already be obvious.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 4%hb~
          %u@1After all of this I looked, and—just like that—a door up in the sky had been opened, and the first voice I heard was speaking to me like a trumpet %i@d%i@o%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@e%i@r%i@t, saying, “Come up here and I’ll show you what must come to pass after these things.” %u@2Immediately I wound up in %i@t%i@h%i@e Spirit and—just like that—a throne was situated there in the sky, and someone was sitting on the throne, %u@3and the one sitting looked like %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f stone, of jasper and sardius, and a rainbow that looked just like emerald went around the throne. %u@4And twenty-four %i@s%i@m%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@r%i@ thrones surrounded the %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ throne, and upon the %i@s%i@m%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@r%i@ thrones were seated twenty-four elders%u@[%U@A%u@] dressed in white and upon their heads were golden laurels, victors’ crowns. %u@5Out of the %i@o%i@n%i@e throne came thunder and lightning. Seven lamps of fire burned before the throne, and these are the seven Spirits of God. %u@6And before the throne there was a glass lake like crystal.%vn~
      In the midst of the throne and around the throne were four animal-like creatures, with eyes all over them on the front and on the back. %u@7The first creature was like a lion, the second like a calf, the third had the face of a man, the fourth was like a flying eagle. %u@8And each one of the four creatures had six wings, and they were full of eyes around them and inside of them. Day and night they never stopped saying,%vn~
%si~
Holy, holy, holy%vp~
Lord God Almighty%vp~
Who was, Who is, Who’s coming%vp~
%si~
          %u@9And when the creatures give glory, honor, and thanksgiving to the One seated on the throne, to the One who lives forever and ever, %u@1%u@0the twenty-four elders fall %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ before the One sitting on the throne and worship the One who lives forever and ever, and toss their wreaths before the throne saying,%vn~
%si~
%u@1%u@1You are worthy, our Lord God%vp~
To receive the glory, the honor, and the power%vp~
Because You created all things%vp~
And by means of Your will%vp~
They were %i@d%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ and were created%vp~
%sf~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@e%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s…In the time of Jesus and for years prior to that, Israel had a national tribunal of judges known as the Sanhedrin over all of Israel, and there were lesser such tribunals that ruled over each city. This pattern of having a tribunal board is replicated in John’s vision.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 5%hb~
          %u@1And I saw a scroll in the right hand of the of the One sitting on the throne, and the scroll %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@u%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ on both the front and back sides and was sealed %i@s%i@h%i@u%i@t%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@ with seven seals. %u@2I saw a powerful angel proclaiming in a loud voice, “Who’s worthy to break the seals and open the scroll%u@[%U@B%u@]?” %u@3They kept trying to find someone who was able to, and they couldn’t find anyone in heaven, on the earth, nor in the underworld %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@ to open the scroll or to %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n look at it. %u@4They proceeded to weep intensely since nobody was found worthy enough to open the scroll or to %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ look at it. %u@5But one of the elders %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tells me, “Don’t cry. Look here—the lion of the tribe of Judah, %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ the shoot%u@[%u@b%u@] of David, has prevailed %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t to break the seven seals and open the scroll.”%vn~
          %u@6In the midst of the throne and the four creatures and in the midst of the elders, I saw a lamb standing there looking as though he had been slain, having seven horns seven eyes, which are the Seven Spirits of God which have been sent out all over the planet. %u@7He came and took what was in the right hand of the One sitting on the throne, %u@8and when he took the scroll, the four creatures and the twenty-four elders fell %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ before the lamb, each of them having a harp and a golden vial of incense, which are the prayers of those who are holy%u@[%u@c%u@]. %u@9And they sing a new song saying %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@t,%vn~
%si~
You are worthy to take the scroll%vp~
And to break open its seals%vp~
Because you were slain and with your blood%vp~
Purchased for God those%vp~
From among every clan%u@[%u@d%u@], language, culture%u@[%u@e%u@], and ethnicity.%vp~
%u@1%u@0And you made them into a priestly kingdom%u@[%u@f%u@] for our God,%vp~
And they will reign upon the earth.%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@1I looked and heard a sound of many angels surrounding the throne and of the creatures and elders. There were millions and millions and billions and billions%u@[%U@C%u@] in number, %u@1%u@2all saying in a loud voice,%vn~
%si~
Worthy is the slain lamb to receive%vp~
The power and wealth and wisdom and strength%vp~
And honor and glory and thanksgiving %i@d%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@3I heard all of creation that’s in the sky, on the earth, below the earth, on top of the sea, and beneath the sea saying,%nn~
%si~
To the One sitting upon the throne and to the lamb%vp~
%I@B%i@e%i@ the thanksgiving, honor, glory, might%vp~
Forever and ever%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@4The four creatures proceeded to say, “So be it%u@[%u@g%u@],” and the elders fell %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ and offered up worship.%nn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@,%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@k%i@y [%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n] %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@s%i@h%i@o%i@o%i@t…Lit: %i@r%i@o%i@o%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@y…Or: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@s; %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@c%i@l%i@a%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@e. Ref. note of Rev. 1:7%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e…Or: %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@k%i@-%i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m…Lit: %i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@s. A hendiadys.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@s%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@u%i@t…The seals may have consisted of melted wax which was affixed to the scroll after it had been tightly rolled up. Before the wax cooled and hardened, the seal was stamped to give it an inscription. After the wax cooled, the scroll could not be unfurled, and the scroll thereby read, unless the wax was broken. Therefore, the seals served two purposes. First, they ensured that the scroll had never been read before. Second, the inscription was proof of the scroll was genuinely written by whomever claimed to have written it. Ref. note of 2 Cor. 1:22.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@r%i@o%i@l%i@l…Lit: %i@o%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@r%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@s. The assumption is that the literal wording of opening the scroll and breaking the seal is backwards, being an expression of a sort, and that the reader at the time would take this for granted. This is analogous to us telling a child, “Put on your shoes and socks,” which we don’t mean for the child to do it in that order, but to put on the socks first before putting on the shoes.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@m%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@e%i@n%i@-%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@n%i@-%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s. This is more of an expression than a precise numbering.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 6%hb~
          %u@1And I looked when the lamb broke%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@ one of the seven seals, and I heard one of the four creatures in a voice like thunder say, “Come!” %u@2…And I looked and—like that—a white horse %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@d, and the one mounted on it had a bow, and he had been given a victor’s wreath, and he went forth conquering and attempting to conquer.%vn~
          %u@3When he broke the second seal, from out of%i@ the second creature I heard, “Come!” %u@4…And another horse, a red one, %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@d, and the one mounted on it was granted to take the peace %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ from the planet, so that people will kill each other, and he was given a large sword.%vn~
          %u@5When he broke the third seal, from out of the third creature I heard, “Come!” …And I looked and—like that—a black horse %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@d, and the one mounted on it had a scale in his hand. %u@6I heard a voice in the midst of the four creatures saying, “%I@S%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f wheat at $100 per quart/950 ml and barley at $35 per quart%u@[%U@A%u@], and don’t tamper with %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@o%i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ oil and wine.”%vn~
          %u@7When he opened the fourth seal, I heard the fourth creature’s voice say, “Come!” %u@8…And I looked and—like that—a pale horse %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ and the one mounted on it is named Death and trailing just behind him is Graveyard%u@[%u@b%u@]. They were given control of one-quarter of the Earth, to kill it by sword, by famine, by the plague, and by indigenous wild animals.%vn~
          %u@9When the fifth seal was broken, I saw the lives of those who had been slain on account of the word of God and the profession of faith that they maintained, which was public knowledge%u@[%u@c%u@], under the altar. %u@1%u@0A loud voice cried out, “Just how long, Holy and True Master, will You continue to refrain from delivering a verdict that will vindicate and avenge our blood, taking it out on Earth’s %i@c%i@u%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ inhabitants?” %u@1%u@1Each of them was given a white robe, and they were told that they’ll %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ wait a bit longer yet, until the quota is filled with their fellow-servants, their comrades, and those who are going to be killed like they too were.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2I looked when the sixth seal was broken, and a severe earthquake occurred, and the sun turned as black as burlap made out of hair, and the whole moon turned into something%i@ like %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ blood, %u@1%u@3and the stars in the %i@n%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ sky fell to the ground like a fig tree shedding its unripe figs when shaken by a strong wind, %u@1%u@4and the sky split apart like a scroll getting rolled up, and every mountain and every island in their vicinity was displaced. %u@1%u@5The kings of the Earth, the high-status noblemen, the generals, the wealthy, the mighty, the slaves and the free hid themselves in caves and in the rocks of the mountains. %u@1%u@6They %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@c%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ say to the mountains and to the rocks, “Fall on us and hide us from the undivided attention%u@[%u@d%u@] of the One sitting on the throne and from the wrath of the lamb, %u@1%u@7because the Great Day of their wrath has arrived, and who can withstand it?”%vn~
%sf~

%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@S%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@$%i@1%i@0%i@0%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@/%i@9%i@5%i@0%i@m%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@r%i@l%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@$%i@3%i@5%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@a%i@r%i@t…Lit: %i@a%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@q%i@u%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@r%i@l%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@n%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@u%i@s. A denarius is a day’s wage and a quart of wheat is a day’s ration. Ref. note of Matt. 18:28.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 7%hb~
          %u@1After these things I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth, holding back the four winds of the earth, so that the winds couldn’t blow over the land, over the sea, or over any forest. %u@2And I saw another angel coming over from the East, where the sun rises, having the living God’s seal %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@a%i@l, and he shouted to the four angels in a loud voice, the angels who were granted to trash the land and the sea, %u@3“Don’t trash the land, the sea, or the forests until we get to put a seal %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@v%i@a%i@l upon the foreheads of God’s servants.” %u@4And I heard what the number of those who were sealed is—144,000—sealed from among all the sons of Israel:%i@%vn~
%si~
%u@5From the tribe of Judah: 12,000%vp~
From the tribe of Reuben: 12,000%vp~
From the tribe of Gad: 12,000%vp~
%u@6From the tribe of Asher: 12,000%vp~
From the tribe of Naphtali: 12,000%vp~
From the tribe of Manasseh: 12,000%vp~
%u@7From the tribe of Simeon: 12,000%vp~
From the tribe of Levi: 12,000%vp~
From the tribe of Issachar: 12,000%vp~
%u@8From the tribe of Zebulon: 12,000%vp~
From the tribe of Joseph: 12,000%vp~
From the tribe of Benjamin: 12,000%vp~
%si~
          %u@9After these things I looked and—like that—a large crowd, the size of which is unknown, from every ethnicity, clan, culture, and language was brought to stand before the throne and before the lamb, and they were clothed in white robes and had palm branches in their hands, %u@1%u@0and were crying out in a loud voice,%vn~
%si~
The protection %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@j%i@o%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@ to our God%vp~
Who’s seated upon the throne%vp~
And by the lamb%i@%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@1And all the angels who were stood around the throne, the elders, and the four creatures fell on their faces before God and worshipped Him %u@1%u@2saying,%nn~
%si~
We heartily agree:%u@[%u@a%u@]%vp~
The blessing, the glory, the wisdom, the thanksgiving,%vp~
The honor, the power, and the might%vp~
%I@W%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@ to our God forever and ever.%vp~
So be it.%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@3One of the elders reflected upon this and said to me,%vn~
      “These people who are wearing the white robes—who are they and what are they all about%u@[%u@b%u@]?”%vn~
          %u@1%u@4I told him, “My good fellow%u@[%u@c%u@], you know %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@s%i@w%i@e%i@r.”%vn~
      And he told me, “These are the ones coming out of the Great Tribulation and who have washed their robes by bleaching them in the blood of the lamb.”%vn~
%si~
%u@1%u@5Because of this they are before God’s throne%vp~
%I@I%i@n%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@%vp~
And perform a worship of religious service to Him%vp~
Day and night in His temple.%vp~
And the one sitting on the throne%vp~
Will set up camp among them%u@[%u@d%u@].%vp~
%u@1%u@6They will not ever again hunger or thirst,%vp~
Nor will the sun beat down upon them%vp~
Nor any %i@s%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g heat,%vp~
%u@1%u@7Because the lamb on high in the midst of the throne%vp~
Shepherds them and will take them%vp~
Down a path to a spring of living water,%vp~
And God has wiped every tear away from their eyes.%vp~

%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@w%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@r%i@e%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@.%i@ Ref. note of 18:4.%fn~

Revelation Chapter 8%hb~
          %u@1When he broke%u@[%u@a%u@] the seventh seal, it became silent in heaven for about a half-hour. %u@2And I saw the seven angels who stand before God, and seven trumpets were given to them.%vn~
          %u@3Another angel who had in his possession a golden incense dispenser%u@[%u@b%u@] came and was %i@u%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ made to stand%u@[%U@A%u@] upon%u@[%u@c%u@] the altar. He was given a lot of incense so that he would offer up upon%u@[%u@c%u@] the golden altar that is before God %i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@ in the form of the prayers of all the set-apart-people%u@[%u@d%u@]. %u@4And the smoke of the incense which consists of the prayers of the set-apart-people went up from the hand of the angel who was before God. %u@5And the angel %i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@d%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d %i@d%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y took the incense dispenser and filled it with some of the hot coals from the altar and flung it on the ground, and thunder and lightning, various sounds, and an earthquake occurred.%vn~
          %u@6The seven angels who have the seven trumpets got ready to sound alerts by blowing the trumpets. %u@7The first one blew his trumpet and it hailed, as fire mixed in with blood was hurled to the earth. A third of the trees were incinerated as well as all of the grass which was still growing%u@[%u@e%u@].%vn~
          %u@8The second angel blew his trumpet, and something like a huge mountain consisting of a burning coal was thrown into the sea, and a third of the sea turned into blood, %u@9and a third of the living creatures in the sea died, and a third of the ships were destroyed.%vn~
          %u@1%u@0The third angel blew his trumpet, and a huge star burning like a torch fell from the sky and onto a third of the rivers and upon the springs of waters. %u@1%u@1The star’s called Bitter-Flavoring%u@[%u@f%u@]: a third of the water became bitter, and many people died from the water, because it became poisonous due to its having been made bitter.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2The fourth angel blew his trumpet, and a third of the sun, a third of the moon, and a third of the stars were struck, for the purpose of causing a third of them to go dark and causing no light to shine during the day a third of the time and likewise %i@n%i@e%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@o%i@n%i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@l%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ at night.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3I looked, and I heard a certain vulture%u@[%u@g%u@] flying very high up in the sky%u@[%U@B%u@] saying in a loud voice, “Woe, woe, woe to the inhabitants of the Earth from the sounds of the remaining trumpets which the three angels are going to blow.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@b%i@r%i@o%i@k%i@e…Lit: %i@o%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@c%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@e%i@r%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n…Or: %i@a%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@-%i@a%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@-%i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e…Or: %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@g%i@r%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@s%i@s. %I@G%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@n is rendered %i@f%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@c%i@u%i@t%i@ in Luke 23:31.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%I@B%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@-%I@F%i@l%i@a%i@v%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %I@W%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@w%i@o%i@o%i@d. This is an actual plant.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@v%i@u%i@l%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e…Or: %i@e%i@a%i@g%i@l%i@e%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@u%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d…Here in this passage are some of the brass tacks that Ray Summers in his book %I@W%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@y%i@ %I@I%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@m%i@b claimed were grammatical mistakes. The verb %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ here is in the passive voice but most translations, such as the NASB, translate it as active. The word %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ in v. 3 translated %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@u%i@p is future tense but should be subjunctive. The words %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ is in the dative case, which is unexpected. In v. 5 the verb %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ is in the perfect tense, but is used like it’s aorist. Some observations on the claim that these are grammatical errors. First, looking at John’s contributions to the NT as a whole and not just at Revelation individually, Revelation is the only book with these kinds of errors. In the grammatical incidences enumerated from this passage, it’s hard to imagine that these would not have been mistakes caused by ignorance of the language. Now, grammatical mistakes are made when someone’s careless, perhaps writing while he’s tired or writing in too much of a hurry. And that may be the case. But inspecting a couple of the verb forms which are listed here, the passive form of %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ and the perfect form of %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ are less common than the expected forms. Someone who’s sloppy, careless, or rushed would use the more common forms instead of the less common. So what’s the conclusion? Perhaps John couldn’t remember some of the forms of words and knew that the reader would be able to figure it out. Or he understood what he was writing and deliberately chose to write it and these are not mistakes. This leaves a translator with the task of figuring out what he meant on a case-by-case basis.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%u@ %i@h%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@k%i@y…Lit: %i@m%i@i%i@d%i@-%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n. In NT times, the sky and heaven as we know it were conflated into one, and there were multiple layers (many say there were seven). Progressing through these layers, one goes from the atmosphere surrounding us; to very high up in the sky; to where the sun and the stars are; then from there into the various layers of heaven, which presumably include paradise and the throne of God. According to such a gradation scheme, mid-heaven would be half-way through, and therefore very high up in the sky, perhaps even in their minds near where the stars are. Seeing that v. 13 mentions a vulture (or perhaps an eagle), vultures (and eagles for that matter) have been known to fly as high as 37,000 feet/11,275 meters). %fn~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 9%hb~
          %u@1The fifth angel blew his horn, and I saw a star which had fallen and landed on the Earth, and he (%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r) was given the key to the bottomless pit. %u@2He opened the bottomless pit, and smoke came out of the pit, like smoke from a gigantic furnace. The sun was blotted out by the fumes from the smoke which came from the pit. %u@3From out of the smoke locusts went forth over the land, and they were granted capabilities that even scorpions don’t have. %u@4They were told not to harm the grass, nor any of the greenery, nor any of the trees—%i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@m%i@ the people who don’t have God’s seal upon their foreheads. %u@5They were not granted %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ to%i@ kill them, but instead %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ to torment them for five months—and the pain%u@[%u@a%u@] they inflict is like when a scorpion stings a person. %u@6When that time comes around, people will wish they were dead but will not be so lucky, and they’ll feel like they’re dying but death is nevertheless evading them.%u@[%u@b%u@]%vn~
          %u@7The locusts looked like horses dressed for battle. Upon their heads was something like a golden cap%u@[%u@c%u@]; their faces were like the face of a person; %u@8they had hair like a woman’s hair; their teeth were like a lion’s teeth; %u@9and they had breastplates like iron. The sound they made when flying sounds like a multitude of horses charging into battle. %u@1%u@0They have tails like scorpions with stingers in them%i@,%i@ and they were given a mandate to hurt people with their tails for five months. %u@1%u@1A king rules over them, the angel of the abyss; his name in Hebrew is Abaddon and in Greek is Apollyon (%i@i%i@.%i@e%i@.%i@ %I@D%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n).%vn~
          %u@1%u@2The first woe is over; look out, there’s two more woes coming!%vn~
          %u@1%u@3The sixth angel blew his trumpet, and I heard a voice from the four horns of the golden altar which is before God %u@1%u@4say, “To the sixth angel who has the trumpet: release the four angels who are on top of%u@[%u@d%u@] the Greater Euphrates River who’ve been restrained.” %u@1%u@5And the four angels who had been prepared for this very moment%u@[%u@e%u@] to kill a third of mankind were released. %u@1%u@6The number of soldiers in the cavalry was two hundred million—that’s the number I heard. %u@1%u@7This is what the horses and the cavalry soldiers mounted on them looked like in the vision: they have red, purple, and yellow breastplates, and the horses’ hair is like a lion’s hair, and fire, smoke, and %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@l%i@f%i@u%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@s brimstone comes out of their mouths.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8From these three curses one-third of mankind was killed—from the fire, smoke, and brimstone which comes out of their mouths; %u@1%u@9the fact is, the horses’ power is in their mouths and in their tails, seeing that their tails are like a snake having a head to inflict harm with. %vn~
          %u@2%u@0The remainder of mankind who weren’t killed by these curses didn’t repent either of the deeds of their hands, so that they wouldn’t worship demons and idols of gold, silver, and copper, those things that can neither see, hear, or walk around. %u@2%u@1They wouldn’t repent of their murders, their recreational drug use%u@[%u@f%u@], their fornication, or their thievery.%vn~

%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@p%i@a%i@i%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@u%i@c%i@k%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@e%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m…Lit: %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@k%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@e%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m. Two similar expressions; the repetition of both is a figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@p%i@s…Or: %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@s%i@;%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@f…Or: %i@a%i@t%fn~
