%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 10%hb~
          %u@1I saw another angel, a powerful one, coming down out of the sky with a cloud wrapped around him%u@[%u@a%u@] and a rainbow on his head. His face was like the sun, and his feet were like pillars of fire. %u@2In his hand was a little scroll which had been opened. He put his right foot on the sea and his left on the land, %u@3and cried out in a loud voice just like a roaring lion. When he cried out, the seven thunders spoke their own voices. %u@4And when the seven thunders spoke, I was about to start writing %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n, and I heard a voice from the sky say, “Record the fact that what the seven thunders spoke is genuine%u@[%u@b%u@], but don’t write down %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d.”%vn~
          %u@5The angel whom I saw standing on sea and land raised his right hand all the way up %u@6and swore an oath by Him who lives forever and ever, Who created the sky and the things in it, the land and the things in it, and the sea and the things in it, that there’ll be no further delay. %u@7To the contrary, %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ in the timeframe%u@[%u@c%u@] of the voice of the seventh angel, when he’s about to blow his trumpet and God’s mystery will be concluded%u@[%u@d%u@], %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t the way He proclaimed the glowing details to His own servants the prophets.%vn~
          %u@8The voice which I heard from out of the sky proceeded to speak to me once again, “Go over and take the opened book which is in the hand of the angel standing on sea and land.” %u@9I left and went to the angel to tell him to give me the little scroll, and he %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says to me, “Take it and eat it. It will upset your stomach%u@[%u@e%u@], but will be as sweet as honey in your mouth.” %u@1%u@0I took the little scroll from the angel’s hand and ate it all up, and it was as sweet as honey in my mouth, but when I swallowed it, it upset my stomach. %u@1%u@1They %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tell me, “You must yet again prophesy in about many cultures, ethnicities, languages, and kings.”%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m…Or: %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@u%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%I@R%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@n%i@u%i@i%i@n%i@e…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@k%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@f%i@r%i@a%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@d. Unexpected use of a verb tense; ref. note o8:3.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@s%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@c%i@h…Lit: %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@%fn~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 11%hb~
          %u@1I was given a yardstick the size of a staff, while being told, “Get up and measure the temple of God, the altar, and the worshippers in it, %u@2but exclude the outer courtyard from the measurement, since it’s been given to the Gentiles%u@[%U@A%u@]; the Holy City will be treated with utter contempt%u@[%u@a%u@] for 42 months. %u@3And I will give the nod%u@[%u@b%u@] to my two witnesses and they will prophesy for 1260 days %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e %i@d%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@d in burlap %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@i%i@f%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%u@[%u@c%u@].”%vn~
          %u@4These individuals are the two olive trees and the two lamps which stand before the Lord of the Earth. %u@5And if at any given moment someone wants to harm them, fire comes out of their mouths and devours their enemies. And if at any given moment someone would want to harm them, this someone must be killed in this manner.%u@[%U@B%u@] %u@6These individuals have the authority to plug up the sky, so that it won’t rain over the timespan which they specify in prophesy, and they have authority over the waters to turn them into blood and %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ to smite the land with any kind of calamity, should they so desire.%vn~
          %u@7When they do finish their public declaration%u@[%u@d%u@], the beasts which come up out of the abyss will wage war with them, defeat them, and kill them. %u@8Their corpses %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ on the main boulevard of the Great City, which, from a spiritual perspective, is called That Worldly Land of Captivity Sodom%u@[%u@e%u@], also where the Lord was crucified. %u@9And %i@v%i@a%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@s from among the cultures, the clans, the languages, and the ethnicities %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ see their corpses for three-and-a-half days and won’t be permitted to lay their bodies in a tomb. %u@1%u@0The inhabitants of the Earth will rejoice over them and be glad, and they’ll exchange gifts with one another, because this pair of prophets tormented the inhabitants of the Earth.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1%I@I%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@f%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@.%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@ After the three-and-a-half %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@s, a spirit of life%u@[%U@D%u@] %i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ from God entered them, and they stood on their feet, and a tremendous sort of fear fell upon those watching %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ them. %u@1%u@2They heard a loud voice from out of the sky, originating from heaven, say to them, “Come up here,” and they went up into the sky in the cloud %i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m, and their enemies watched them. %u@1%u@3Just about then, a severe earthquake occurred, a tenth of the city collapsed%u@[%u@f%u@], seven thousand citizens%u@[%u@g%u@] were killed by the earthquake, and the remainder became fearful and finally admitted to their guilt%u@[%u@h%u@].%vn~
          %u@1%u@4The second woe is over; look out—the third woe comes right on its heels!%vn~
          %u@1%u@5The seventh angel blew his trumpet, and loud voices started to be heard in heaven saying,%vn~
%si~
The kingdom of the established order of our Lord%vp~
Has come to pass,%vp~
And of His Messiah, the Christ.%vp~
And He will reign forever and ever.%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@6The twenty-four elders who are seated upon their thrones before God fell on their faces and worshipped God %u@1%u@7saying,%vn~
%si~
We thank you Lord God Almighty%vp~
Who is and Who was,%vp~
Because You have taken your Great, Miraculous Power%vp~
And have %i@b%i@e%i@g%i@u%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o reign %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@.%i@%vp~
%u@1%u@8And the nations became enraged,%vp~
And Your wrath came,%vp~
And %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ the right time%u@[%u@i%u@] for the dead to be judged%vp~
And to give to Your servants the prophets%vp~
The wage %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@%vp~
And to the set-apart-people%u@[%u@j%u@]%vp~
And to the nobodies%u@[%u@l%u@] and the great%vp~
Who are awestruck by who You are%u@[%u@k%u@]%vp~
And to destroy those who are destroying the Earth.%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@9God’s heavenly temple was opened, the ark of His covenant was seen in His temple, and thunder and lightning, earthquakes, and hailstone occurred.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@u%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@o%i@t. An expression. Ref. note of Matt. 5:13.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@d…Lit: %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@b%i@u%i@r%i@l%i@a%i@p%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@i%i@f%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@c%i@l%i@o%i@t%i@h. Ref. note of Matt. 11:21.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@p%i@u%i@b%i@l%i@i%i@c%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@c%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@W%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d%i@l%i@y%i@ %I@L%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@C%i@a%i@p%i@t%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %I@S%i@o%i@d%i@o%i@m…Lit: %I@S%i@o%i@d%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@E%i@g%i@y%i@p%i@t. A hendiadys.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@a%i@p%i@s%i@e%i@d…Lit:%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@e%i@l%i@l. It’s unclear whether the city physically fell due to the earthquake or their inhabitants died—or both.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@c%i@i%i@t%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@n%i@s…Lit: %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n. Or, %i@w%i@e%i@l%i@l%i@-%i@k%i@n%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@d%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@f%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@d%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@g%i@u%i@i%i@l%i@t…Lit: %i@g%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n. An idiom; ref. note of John 9:24.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@-%i@a%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@-%i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e…Or: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@b%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@b%i@o%i@d%i@i%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@m%i@a%i@l%i@l%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@e%i@x%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@t%i@y%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@s…The reason for measuring the temple is to confirm that it complies with God’s exacting standards of perfection, a prerequisite for His approval, and assuming it does, God will condescend to dwell in it. When God dwells in it, it will receive His protection. Now, the outer courtyard is not measured since God will not dwell in it, just as in the second temple at the time of Jesus Gentiles were allowed in that outer courtyard. Furthermore, the outer courtyard extends into the Holy City, which does not receive God’s protection. %fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@A%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@,%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@v%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@e%i@m%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@.%i@ %I@A%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@,%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@r…Two consecutive conditional sentences, where the conditional clauses are almost identical. The conditional clauses differ in the verb tense for the verb %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@.%i@ The repetition of these clauses and sentences is a figure of speech used throughout the Bible. The shift in the verb tense of %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@ is a figure of speech called a %i@p%i@o%i@l%i@y%i@p%i@t%i@o%i@t%i@o%i@n. The subtlety of this polyptoton is additional evidence that John’s weird use of verb tenses is idiomatic rather than the result of carelessness or neglect. Ref. note of 8:3.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@f%i@o%i@l%i@d…This interpolation was inserted for the benefit of the reader, as, generally speaking, the verbs in subsequent passage use the past tense, whereas in the previous they were using the future.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e…In this context, the word %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ does not refer to an angelic spirit, but refers to a supernatural, physical refreshing. See usage of %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@ in other verses such as 1 Pet. 3:4.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 12%hb~
          %u@1A great portent was seen in heaven: a woman clothed in the sun%u@[%u@a%u@], the moon under her feet, a crown with twelve stars on her head, %u@2and with a baby in her womb, screaming because of labor pains, the agony of giving birth. %u@3I saw another portent in heaven, and—out of nowhere—a huge red dragon with seven heads and ten horns and with ornamental headbands%u@[%u@b%u@] on his head. %u@4His tail swept a third of the stars, dragging them %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%u@[%U@A%u@], and flung them to the Earth.%vn~
      The dragon stood before the woman who was about to give birth, so that he could devour the child when she gives birth. %u@5She gave birth to a son—a male%i@-%i@c%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@d—who would %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ shepherd (rule) every nation with an iron staff%u@[%U@B%u@]. Her child was snatched away from her %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@n%i@ to God and to His throne. %u@6The woman fled to the backcountry, where nobody was around, where, %i@b%i@y%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n, a place in it had been prepared for her, so that she would be taken care of%u@[%u@c%u@] for 1260 days, allowing her to recuperate.%vn~
          %u@7A war occurred in heaven: Michael and his angels waged war with the dragon, and the dragon and his angels waged war %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@.%i@ %u@8But he was not powerful enough, nor could he establish a foothold in heaven%u@[%u@d%u@], %u@9and the Great Dragon, the Ancient Serpent, the one called “Slanderer” (i.e. “the Devil”)—yes indeed: Satan—the one who deceives the entire inhabited world—he was driven to the Earth, and his angels too were driven out with him. %u@1%u@0I heard a loud voice in heaven saying,%vn~
%si~
The end of our misery%u@[%u@e%u@], the security, the power,%vp~
The kingdom of our God,%vp~
And the authority of His Messiah, His Christ%vp~
Starts right now,%vp~
Since our comrades’%u@[%u@f%u@] accuser has been driven %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@,%vp~
The one who accuses them before our God day and night.%vp~
%u@1%u@1And they defeated him by means of the lamb’s blood%vp~
And the logic of his solemn declaration%u@[%u@g%u@].%vp~
They didn’t love their life%vp~
%I@E%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ to the point of death.%vp~
%u@1%u@2On account of this be glad:%vp~
%I@Y%i@o%i@u%i@ the sky, the atmosphere, outer space, and heaven%vp~
And those who are camped out%u@[%u@h%u@] in you—%vp~
Woe to the land and sea%vp~
Because the devil’s %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@d your way filled with rage,%vp~
Knowing that he has %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ a small window of time %i@l%i@e%i@f%i@t.%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@3And when the dragon saw that he was driven to the Earth, he pursued the woman who gave birth to the man-child. %u@1%u@4The woman was given a pair of giant vulture%u@[%u@i%u@] wings, so that she could fly to the place set aside for her in the backcountry, where she is taken care of three-and-a-half years%u@[%u@j%u@], kept away from the serpent’s single-minded focus%u@[%u@k%u@]. %u@1%u@5The serpent spewed water like a river from his mouth, going after the woman by making a torrent that would sweep her away; %u@1%u@6but the land came to the woman’s aid: the ground opened its mouth and drank the river up which the dragon spewed out of his mouth. %u@1%u@7The dragon became furious with the woman and went off to wage war with the remainder of her offspring, those who keep God’s commandments and who have something to attest to as far as Jesus is concerned%u@[%u@l%u@].%vn~
          %u@1%u@8And %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@a%i@g%i@o%i@n stood on the seashore%u@[%U@C%u@]…%vn~

%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@r%i@e%i@e%i@-%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@-%i@a%i@-%i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@l%i@f%i@-%i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@o%i@n%fn~

%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@s%i@w%i@e%i@p%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@a%i@g%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m…Lit: %i@d%i@r%i@a%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@r%i@s. Note the present tense %i@d%i@r%i@a%i@g%i@s%i@ in the GT. Although %i@d%i@r%i@a%i@g%i@s%i@ is present tense in form, it is past tense in meaning; this is a figure of speech. The interpolation %i@u%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ reflects the additional meaning that the figure of speech is communicating. Ref. note of John 1:5.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@i%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@f%i@f…The metaphor of a shepherd is used throughout the Bible: a shepherd is a leader; someone who occupies a king-like position of authority. The staff being iron indicates the firmness and totality of the shepherd’s rule.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@o%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@e…This is the starting sentence of the first paragraph of chapter 13%fn~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 13%hb~
%u@1…%u@[%U@A%u@]And I saw a beast come out of the sea, one who has ten horns, seven heads, and seven ornamental headbands%u@[%u@a%u@] on his horns, and I saw the name “blasphemy” on his heads. %u@2The beast which I saw was like a leopard, his feet were like bear %i@c%i@l%i@a%i@w%i@s, and his mouth was like a lion’s mouth. The dragon gave him his power, his throne, and extensive authority. %u@3One of his heads seemed to be mortally wounded%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@l%i@i%i@t, but his mortal wound had been successfully treated. The whole earth was in total awe of the beast%u@[%u@b%u@], %u@4and they worshipped the dragon because he gave the %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ authority to the beast, and they worshipped the beast saying, “Who can match the beast, and who can go to war with him %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m?”%nn~
          %u@5He was given a mouth to speak completely over-the-top blasphemies%u@[%u@c%u@], and he was given authority to act for forty-two months. %u@6He opened his mouth to blaspheme God, to blaspheme His reputation, everything He stands for, the place He calls home, and those who call heaven home%u@[%u@d%u@]. %u@7He was granted to wage war with the set-apart-people%u@[%u@e%u@] and to conquer them, and he was granted authority over every clan, every culture, those who share a common dialect, and every ethnic group. %u@8Everyone on the planet will worship him, %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ all those whose names haven’t been recorded in the Lamb’s Book of Life from day-one%u@[%u@f%u@], the lamb who was slain.%vn~
      %vn~
%u@9A word to the wise is sufficient%u@[%u@g%u@]:%nn~
%si~
%u@1%u@0If someone %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ to captivity,%vp~
To captivity he heads.%vp~
If someone %i@i%i@s%i@ to be killed by a sword,%vp~
Killed by a sword %i@h%i@e %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@.%i@%vp~
%si~
There you have it: the perseverance and the faith of the set-apart-people.%nn~
      %vn~
          %u@1%u@1I saw another beast come out of the ground, and he had two horns like a lamb but talks like a dragon. %u@1%u@2He exercises all the first beast’s authority under his supervision%u@[%u@h%u@]. He makes it so that the Earth and those who inhabit it would worship the First Beast, the one who was healed of his mortal wound. %u@1%u@3He performs spectacular miracles%u@[%u@i%u@], %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ that he can even make flames come down from out of the sky %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y to the ground in front of people. %u@1%u@4And he deceives the inhabitants of the Earth by means of the miracles that were granted to him under the beast’s supervision, telling the inhabitants of the Earth to make a replica of the beast who had%u@[%u@j%u@] the sword wound but lived through it.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5It was granted to him to give life-essence%u@[%u@k%u@] to the beast’s replica, so that the replica could both talk and could cause those who choose not to worship the replica to be killed. %u@1%u@6And he makes everyone—the nobodies%u@[%u@l%u@] and the great, the rich and the poor, the free and the slave—have a mark put on their right hand%u@[%u@m%u@] or on their forehead, %u@1%u@7so that any given person won’t be able to make a purchase or be able to sell %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g except if such person has the mark, %i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@i%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y the beast’s name or the number of his name. %u@1%u@8Here’s the tricky part%u@[%u@n%u@]: let he who’s mentally proficient %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@n%i@u%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@s count the beast’s number, for it is a man’s number, and his number is 666%u@[%U@B%u@].%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s…Lit: %i@d%i@i%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@m%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@m%i@a%i@z%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@t. The unusual use of the word %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ indicates that the combination of words is likely an expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@-%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@-%i@t%i@o%i@p%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@a%i@s%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@i%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@a%i@s%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@i%i@e%i@s. A hendiadys; ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@m%i@e…Lit: %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@-%i@a%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@-%i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e…Or: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@d%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e…Lit: %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d. An expression used throughout the NT.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@i%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@,%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r. A favorite expression of Jesus.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@s%i@p%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@a%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@d…Lit: %i@h%i@a%i@s. Ref. note of John 1:4.%u@%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@-%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@c%i@e…Lit: %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@l%u@]%i@n%i@o%i@b%i@o%i@d%i@i%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@m%i@a%i@l%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@m%u@]%i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d…Or: %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@t%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@n%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@n%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@-%i@i%i@n%i@-%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@-%i@c%i@r%i@a%i@f%i@t%fn~

%u@[%U@A%u@]Paragraph begun in the last verse of chapter 12%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@6%i@6%i@6..Some manuscripts have 616 instead of 666, but the weight of manuscript evidence and textual scholarship favors 666 over 616.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 14%hb~
          %u@1I looked and—like that—the lamb was standing there at Mt. Zion and with him 144,000 who have his name and the name of his Father written upon their foreheads. %u@2I heard a voice from heaven, a voice like a large volume of rushing water%u@[%u@a%u@] and like loud thunder. The voice I heard was like singing-harpists who are singing and playing their harps at the same time. %u@3They sing a new song before the throne and before the four creatures and the elders. No one was able to learn the song except for the 144,000, they who were purchased from the Earth. %u@4These are ones who haven’t defiled themselves with women, for they are virgins; these people follow the lamb wherever he goes; these people were purchased from mankind, cherry-picked from the pool of all humans and offered as the best-of-the-best%u@[%u@b%u@] to God and to the lamb. %u@5No lie is to be found in their mouths; they are without blemish.%vn~
          %u@6I saw another angel flying way, way up in the sky%u@[%u@c%u@] having an eternal proclamation of good news to deliver to those sitting on the Earth, to every ethnicity, clan, language, and culture, %u@7saying in a loud voice, “Fear God and come clean with Him%u@[%u@d%u@], since the time for His judgments has arrived. Worship the One who made the sky, the land, the sea, and the springs of water.”%vn~
          %u@8Another angel—a second one—trailed behind saying, “Fallen! Fallen! Babylon the Great—the one whom all nations have drunk from her supply of wine, drinking of the wine of the ferocity of her fornication.”%vn~
          %u@9Another angel—a third one—trailed them saying in a loud voice, “If one worships the beast and his replica and receives the mark on his forehead or on his hand, %u@1%u@0this very person drinks from out of the wine of the wrath of God, the undiluted mixture%u@[%U@A%u@] %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@n%i@e which is in the cup of His wrath, and will be tormented by fire and brimstone under the scrutiny of%u@[%u@e%u@] some holy angels and under the scrutiny of the lamb. %u@1%u@1The smoke of their torment billows up forever and ever, non-stop day and night, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ they who worship the beast and his replica, and of any given person if he were to have received the mark of his name.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@2There you have it: the perseverance of the set-apart-people%u@[%u@f%u@], those who keep God’s commandments and the faith of Jesus.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3I heard a voice from out of the sky say, “Write %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n: ‘Blessed be the dead who believe in and serve the Lord%u@[%u@g%u@] who are killed from here on out. Yes indeed,’ says the Spirit, ‘so that they might rest from their toil. The fact is, as they parade in, their deeds are showcased.%u@[%U@B%u@]’”%vn~
          %u@1%u@4I looked, and—out of nowhere—a white cloud %i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@d, and seated on the cloud was someone %i@w%i@h%i@o %i@l%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@d like a perfectly-proportioned man—the ideal man%u@[%u@h%u@]—possessing a golden crown on his head and a sharp sickle in his hand. %u@1%u@5And another angel came out of the temple while crying out in a loud voice to the one sitting on the cloud, “Get out in the field and get to it with the sickle%u@[%u@i%u@] and reap %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@e%i@l%i@d, because the time has come to reap %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@l%i@y, since the timing is perfect to reap the earth’s harvest%u@[%U@C%u@].” %u@1%u@6So the man sitting on the cloud took his sickle%u@[%u@i%u@] %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n to the Earth and reaped the Earth.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7Another angel came out of the heavenly temple, he too having a sharp sickle of his own. %u@1%u@8And another angel came out of the altar, the one in control of the flames %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@t%i@a%i@r and in a loud voice hollered to one with the sharp sickle, “Get out there with your sharp sickle and gather the grapes from the vineyard of the Earth, because her grape clusters have ripened.” %u@1%u@9And the angel took his sickle to the Earth and gathered %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@p%i@e%i@s%i@ from the Earth and took %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m to the Great Winepress of God’s wrath. %u@2%u@0The winepress was tread outside the city%u@[%U@D%u@], and blood flowed out of the winepress %i@c%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@m%i@ about shoulder-high%u@[%u@j%u@] and stretching out 200 miles/300 km%u@[%u@k%u@].%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@a%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@v%i@o%i@l%i@u%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@r%i@u%i@s%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r…Lit: %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@s. Ref. note of 1:15%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@r%i@y%i@-%i@p%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@o%i@o%i@l%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@u%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@-%i@o%i@f%i@-%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@-%i@b%i@e%i@s%i@t…Lit: %I@T%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@-%i@f%i@r%i@u%i@i%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@w%i@a%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@k%i@y…Lit: %i@m%i@i%i@d%i@-%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n. Ref. note of 8:13%fn~

%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@-%i@a%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@-%i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e…Or: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@l%i@i%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@L%i@o%i@r%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@f%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@l%i@y%i@-%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@—%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@d%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n. Ref. note of Matt. 8:20.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@G%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@e%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@l%i@e%i@…%i@t%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@l%i@e…Lit: %I@S%i@e%i@n%i@d %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@l%i@e%i@ [into the field to work]…%i@c%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@i%i@c%i@k%i@l%i@e. A figure of speech, as the sickle itself is not sent but the person swinging it is; the sickle is just a tool.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@s%i@h%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@-%i@h%i@i%i@g%i@h…Lit: %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@i%i@d%i@l%i@e. Liberties taken.%fn~
%u@[%u@k%u@]%i@2%i@0%i@0%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@/%i@3%i@0%i@0%i@ %i@k%i@m…Lit: %i@1%i@6%i@0%i@0%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@a. Ref. note of Luke 24:13.%fn~
%sf~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@l%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@x%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e…In ancient times, wine was often times diluted with water. The metaphor has God’s wrath at maximum potency.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@T%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@e%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@o%i@w%i@c%i@a%i@s%i@e%i@d…Lit: %I@F%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@l%i@o%i@w%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m. A metaphor to the triumphal entry of a general into a city, with the spoils of war carried behind him. Same metaphor used in 1 Tim. 5:24.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@f%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t. Some liberties taken. The spring rain (the “latter rain”: ref. James 5:7, Joel 2:23, Jer. 5:24) arrives at the end of the growing season, and prepares the grain for harvest. After receiving the rain, the crop must dry out, otherwise it’ll get moldy. The moment it dries is the exact moment to harvest it.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y…In those times, grape juice was extracted from grapes by putting the grapes in a vat and having the workers step on them, crushing them, causing the juice to seep out of the vat and into a pot or something. In the NT, something done %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ was something which was dirty, messy, or disgusting and consequently should be prevented from contaminating the city.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 15%hb~
          %u@1I saw another portent in heaven, huge and quite a sight to see: seven angels with the last of the seven plagues, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ because with them God’s wrath is complete.%vn~
          %u@2I saw something like a glass sea mixed with flames, and the ones who prevailed against the %i@o%i@n%i@s%i@l%i@a%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ beast, against his replica, and against the number of his name standing there at the glass sea, in possession of God’s harps. %u@3They sang the song of Moses, the servant of God, and the song of the lamb saying,%vn~
%si~
Great and Marvelous %i@a%i@r%i@e Your works,%vp~
Lord God Almighty,%vp~
Righteous and true %i@a%i@r%i@e Your ways,%vp~
King of the nations.%vp~
%u@4Who does not fear and reverence You%vp~
To the utmost extent,%vp~
To the point of fearing you, Lord?%vp~
Because You alone are pious%vp~
Since all the nations will come%vp~
And worship before You,%vp~
Since Your righteousness has been made manifest.%vp~
%si~
          %u@5After these things, I looked and %i@s%i@a%i@w%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ the temple housing the %I@G%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t Declaration%u@[%u@a%u@] in heaven was opened, %u@6and the seven angels, the ones in possession of the seven plagues, left the temple clothed in clean, bright linen and with golden sashes wrapped around their chests. %u@7One of the four creatures gave the seven angels seven golden bowls that were filled to the brim, and the source they were filled from is the wrath of the God who lives forever and ever. %u@8The temple was filled up with smoke, and the source of the smoke is God’s glory and His power. No one was able to enter the temple until the seven plagues of the seven angels happened to finish.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %I@D%i@e%i@c%i@l%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit%i@:%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%fn~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 16%hb~
          %u@1I heard a loud voice coming out of the temple telling the angels, “Go forth and pour out the seven bowls of God’s wrath onto the Earth.”%vn~
          %u@2The first one departed and poured out his bowl onto the Earth, and a wicked-bad sore showed up on the people who have the mark of the beast and who worship his replica.%vn~
          %u@3The second one poured out his bowl onto the sea, and it turned into blood, the blood like a dead %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@, and all living beings in the sea died.%vn~
          %u@4The third one poured out his bowl on the rivers and on the springs of water, and %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@r turned into blood. %u@5I heard the angel who affected the waters say,%vn~
%si~
You are correct%vp~
%I@Y%i@o%i@u Who is and Who was—%I@Y%i@o%i@u Who are pious,%vp~
%u@6Because saints’ and prophets’ blood has been spilled,%vp~
And You’ve given them blood to drink up.%vp~
They deserve it.%vp~
%si~
%u@7And from the altar I heard %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@o%i@n%i@e say,%nn~
%si~
      Yes indeed, Lord God Almighty%vn~
      True and correct %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ Your judgments%vn~
%si~
          %u@8The fourth one poured his bowl out upon the sun, and it was granted %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ to scorch mankind in flames, %u@9and mankind was scorched something fierce%u@[%u@a%u@]. They blasphemed God’s reputation and everything He stands for%u@[%u@b%u@]—He who has control over all these plagues—and they wouldn’t have a change of heart and come clean with Him%u@[%u@c%u@].%vn~
          %u@1%u@0The fifth one poured his bowl out upon the beast’s throne, and his kingdom %i@s%i@u%i@d%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@l%i@y%i@ darkened, and they proceeded to bite their tongues as a result of the pain %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l. %u@1%u@1As a result of their pain and their sores, they blasphemed the God of heaven, but they wouldn’t stop doing the deeds they were doing.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2The sixth one poured out his bowl upon the Greater Euphrates River, and %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ its water dried up, in order to form the road that the kings %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ from the East %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@u%i@s%i@e. %u@1%u@3And I saw three harassing, demonic spirits like frogs %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ out of the dragon’s mouth, the beast’s mouth, and the false prophet’s mouth; %u@1%u@4in fact, the demon spirits perform miracles%u@[%u@d%u@] that go exactly to the kings of the entire inhabited world, to gather them to the war of the Great Day of God Almighty.%vn~
%si~
%u@1%u@5See here now: I’m coming like a thief.%vp~
Blessed %i@i%i@s he who stays focused%u@[%u@e%u@]%vp~
And retains his clothing%vp~
So that he won’t walk about naked%vp~
And be exposed to ridicule%u@[%u@f%u@].%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@6And they were gathered to the place called “Armageddon” in Hebrew.%nn~
          %u@1%u@7The seventh %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l poured his bowl out upon the lower atmosphere, and a loud voice came out of the temple saying, “It has come into being%u@[%u@g%u@],” %u@1%u@8and thunder and lightning and %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@ sounds occurred, plus an earthquake occurred—a big one—the likes of which have never happened on the Earth before since the beginning of the human race—that’s how enormous it was. %u@1%u@9The Great City split into three parts, and the %i@m%i@a%i@j%i@o%i@r%i@ cities of the nations fell. God wasn’t going to let Babylon the Great slip by and not dole out to her%u@[%u@h%u@] the cup of the wine of his fierce wrath. %u@2%u@0Everyone living on an island fled, and nobody could be found up in the mountains%u@[%u@i%u@]. %u@2%u@1Huge hailstones that weighed about 75 lbs/34 kg%u@[%u@j%u@] rained down from the sky upon mankind, and as a result of the plague of hail, the human race blasphemed God, since the plague in and of itself was severe—really severe.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@e…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@c%i@h. The repetition of %i@s%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@c%i@h%i@ is a figure of speech, emphasizing the scorching.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@u%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %I@H%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r…Lit: %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@m…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y. %I@G%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y: an expression; ref. John 9:24 and note there.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@i%i@g%i@n%i@s; %i@o%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@y%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@c%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@w%i@a%i@t%i@c%i@h%i@e%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@x%i@p%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@d%i@i%i@c%i@u%i@l%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@’%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@.%i@ Some liberties taken.%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@i%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g…Same verb and same exact form of that verb is rendered %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ in the phrase %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g in John 1:3.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@g%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %I@B%i@a%i@b%i@y%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@l%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@b%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r…Lit: %I@B%i@a%i@b%i@y%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@m%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r. A figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%I@E%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@b%i@o%i@d%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@u%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s…Lit: %I@A%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d. Islands is a metonymy for those living on it; same for mountains.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@7%i@5%i@ %i@l%i@b%i@s%i@.%i@/%i@3%i@4%i@ %i@k%i@g…Lit: %i@l%i@i%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@n%i@t%fn~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 17%hb~
          %u@1One of the seven angels who has the seven bowls came and spoke with me saying, “Come, I’ll show you the verdict rendered against the Great Harlot who sits upon many %i@d%i@i%i@f%i@f%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ waters, %u@2she whom the kings of the Earth fornicated with, and she whom the inhabitants of the Earth got drunk off the wine of her fornication.” %u@3He took me up to an uninhabited, desolate place in the Spirit. I saw a woman sitting on a scarlet beast, a beast plastered with blasphemous names, %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@ who has seven heads and ten horns. %u@4The woman was clothed in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ purple clothing %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@h%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@ and in %i@l%i@u%i@x%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ scarlet and was adorned in gold, gemstones, and pearls and had a golden cup in her hand filled with abominations and with the impurity and sacrilegious nature%u@[%u@a%u@] of her fornication. %u@5There was a name written on her forehead—a mystery: “Babylon the Great, the mother of fornicators and prostitutes and of the abominations of the Earth.” %u@6I saw the woman intoxicated from %i@d%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ the blood of the set-apart-people%u@[%u@b%u@] and the blood of those who make statements about Jesus%u@[%u@c%u@].%vn~
      Upon seeing her, I was stupefied gawking at her%u@[%u@d%u@]. %u@7The angel told me, “What are you gawking at? I’ll explain to you the mystery of the woman and the beast that’s bearing her, the one with the seven heads and the ten horns. %u@8The beast which you saw came up out of the abyss in the past, is not out of the abyss at the present, but is about to come up out of the abyss, and is headed to %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n demise%u@[%u@e%u@]. The existing inhabitants of the Earth who don’t have their names written in the Book of Life from the beginning of time%u@[%u@f%u@] seeing the beast will be amazed, because the beast came %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@y%i@s%i@s in the past, is not %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@t at present, but will be showing up some time in the future.%vn~
          %u@9Here’s %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r a person who has a mind for intrigue: the seven heads are mountains where the woman is sitting. These are seven kings. %u@1%u@0Five have fallen, one %i@s%i@t%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ exists, the other hasn’t come %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ yet, but when he does in fact come %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g, he must remain a little while. %u@1%u@1The beast which came in the past and isn’t present now: it’s the eighth and %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@s out of the seven, and is headed to %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ demise. %u@1%u@2The ten horns that you saw are ten kings who haven’t gotten a kingdom yet, but instead receive from the beast authority as kings for one hour. %u@1%u@3These guys have one purpose, and they give their power and authority to the beast. %u@1%u@4These guys will go to war with the lamb, and the lamb will conquer them, since %i@h%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ Lord of Lords and King of Kings, and %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ those with him: the called, the chosen, the faithful.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5He %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ says to me, “The waters that you saw the harlot sitting on: they are cluster after cluster of folk-people%u@[%u@g%u@], are nations, and are those who share a common dialect. %u@1%u@6The ten horns which you saw, and the beast included: these guys hate the harlot and will strip her bare and have her for lunch%u@[%u@h%u@]. %u@1%u@7The fact is, God will cause them to willingly do%u@[%u@i%u@] His purpose, and that purpose is towards one goal %i@o%i@n%i@l%i@y: to give their kingdom to the beast, until %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t God’s ideas be completed. %u@1%u@8And the woman which you saw is the Great City which has a kingdom %i@b%i@u%i@i%i@l%i@t%i@ upon the kings of the Earth.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@i%i@m%i@p%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@c%i@r%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@g%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@-%i@a%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@-%i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e…Or: %i@t%i@h%i@e %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@J%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%I@S%i@e%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@,%i@ %I@I%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@u%i@p%i@e%i@f%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@g%i@a%i@w%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r…Lit: %I@I%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@r%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@r%i@v%i@e%i@l%i@.%i@ The repetition of marvel is a figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@w%i@n%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@i%i@s%i@e…Lit: %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@r%i@u%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@…Lit: %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@l%i@d%i@%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@c%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@l%i@k%i@-%i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e…Lit: [%i@f%i@o%i@l%i@k] %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@d%i@s. A hendiadys; ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@p%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@l%i@u%i@n%i@c%i@h…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@o%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@n%i@a%i@k%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@s. Two expressions.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l %i@c%i@a%i@u%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@o…Lit: %i@g%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@.%i@ Note the past form %i@g%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ is intended as future, not past.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@c%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@y%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@y%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@,%i@ %i@b%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@y%i@s%i@s…Lit: %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@y%i@s%i@s. This appears to be more of the unpolished, error-ridden writing found throughout Revelation.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 18%hb~
          %u@1After these things %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ I saw another angel come down out of the sky, one who has great authority and power, and the Earth was illuminated by his majestic splendor%u@[%u@a%u@]. %u@2He cried out in a loud voice,%vn~
%si~
Fallen! Fallen is Babylon the Great!%vp~
She has become the haunt of harassing spirits%u@[%u@b%u@]%vp~
And a prison of all filthy, disgusting%u@[%u@c%u@] spirits%vp~
And a prison of all filthy, disgusting birds%vp~
And a prison of all filthy, disgusting beasts%vp~
And of all things %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@ have come to hate,%vp~
%u@3Because all the nations have gotten drunk%vp~
On the wine of her fornication,%vp~
And the kings of the Earth have fornicated with her,%vp~
And the merchants of the Earth have gotten rich%vp~
Off the powerful %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@u%i@r%i@e of her revelry in luxury.%vp~
%si~
%u@4And I heard another voice speaking from the sky,%nn~
%si~
Come out, my people, from her%vp~
So that you don’t partner with her,%vp~
Participating in her sins,%vp~
And that you don’t receive a dose of her plagues,%vp~
%u@5Because her sins have piled up%vp~
%I@A%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y to the sky,%vp~
And God has remembered her wrong-doings.%vp~
%si~
%u@6Pay her back the way she dished it out to you,%vp~
And up the ante%u@[%u@d%u@] according to her deeds.%vp~
Using the %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ cup she did her%i@ mixing in,%vp~
Mix a cocktail for her which is twice as concentrated%u@[%U@A%u@].%vp~
%u@7So much as it glorified her%vp~
And made her revel in luxury,%vp~
Give such torment and mourning as that to her.%vp~
%si~
Because in her heart she tells herself,%vp~
“I’ve been awarded the status of%u@[%u@e%u@] queen%vp~
And am not a %i@d%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@ widow,%vp~
There’s no way at all that I’ll experience mourning”—%vp~
%u@8On account of this,%vp~
Her plagues will arrive in one day:%vp~
Death, mourning, and famine.%vp~
She’ll be purged thoroughly by fire%vp~
Because the Lord God %i@i%i@s%i@ mighty%vp~
Who judges her.%vp~
%si~
          %u@9The kings of the Earth will weep and thump %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@i%i@n%i@g over her, those who fornicated with her and reveled in her luxury, when they eventually see the smoke of her conflagration, %u@1%u@0while standing far back because they’re terrified of her torment, saying,%vn~
%si~
Woe! Woe %i@t%i@o the Great City!%vp~
The Mighty City Babylon—%vp~
Because your judgment arrived in one hour.%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@1The merchants of the Earth %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n cry and mourn over her, because no one %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l buy their inventory%u@[%u@f%u@] any longer, %u@1%u@2inventory of gold, of silver, of gemstones, of pearls, of fine linen, of purple, of scarlet, of the fruit of the citron tree, of all %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ chests made of ivory, of all %i@s%i@o%i@r%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ chests made of expensive wood, of copper, of iron, of marble… %u@1%u@3and cinnamon, exotic spice plants, incense, myrrh, frankincense, wine, olive oil, fine wheat flour, wheat, beasts of burden, sheep, horses, chariots, slaves who do manual labor, slaves in general%u@[%u@g%u@].%vn~
%si~
%u@1%u@4And the %i@l%i@a%i@r%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@i%i@e%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ fruit %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n late-summer%vp~
Consisting of your soul’s desire%vp~
Departed from you,%vp~
And all the sumptuous and splendid%u@[%u@h%u@] things%vp~
Disintegrated right in front of you%u@[%u@i%u@].%vp~
These things will no longer be found—%vp~
No—not a chance.%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@5Those who trade in these things, the merchants who got rich off her, will stand far back because they’re terrified of her torment, %u@1%u@6saying,%nn~
%si~
Woe! Woe %i@t%i@o the Great City!%vp~
Clothed in fine linen, in %i@l%i@u%i@x%i@u%i@r%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ scarlet,%vp~
In %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ purple %i@c%i@l%i@o%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@t%i@h%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@,%i@%vp~
And adorned in gold, in gemstones, and in pearls%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@7…Because in one hour such wealth will be wiped out. And every helmsmen and everyone who works the docks%u@[%u@j%u@] and sailors and whoever works in the boating industry stood far back %u@1%u@8and, upon seeing the smoke of her conflagration, shouted, “%I@H%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@n anyone %i@a%i@n%i@n%i@i%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ the same way as the Great City %i@w%i@a%i@s?” %u@1%u@9Weeping and mourning, they poured dirt on their heads%u@[%U@B%u@] and cried out,%nn~
%si~
Woe! Woe %i@t%i@o the Great City!%vp~
Everyone who put ships out to sea got rich%vp~
Off her %i@a%i@g%i@g%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@z%i@e%i@d worth,%vp~
Because in one hour she has been wiped out.%vp~
%u@2%u@0Rejoice over her, sky and heaven%vp~
And saints, apostles, and prophets,%vp~
Because the justice that we’re owed from her,%vp~
God in His judgment has applied to her.%vp~
%si~
          %u@2%u@1An angel who is strong took a stone the size of a large millstone and slammed it into the sea saying,%vn~
%si~
In the same kind of swift, sudden, convulsive slam%vp~
%I@A%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@o%i@w%i@n%i@%vp~
Babylon the Great City %i@t%i@o%i@o%i@ has been slammed%vp~
And has not yet been found—not a trace.%vp~
%u@2%u@2And any sound of harp players%vp~
And %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ musicians%vp~
And flute players and trumpet players%u@[%U@C%u@]%vp~
And every artisan from every form of art%vp~
Could not be found—even a trace—%vp~
Still %i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ in you,%vp~
And the sound of any millstone still %i@g%i@r%i@i%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@%vp~
Could not be heard in you—not even a trace,%vp~
%u@2%u@3And a lamp’s light%vp~
Won’t shine yet again in you—%vp~
Not a chance,%vp~
And the sound of a bride and groom %i@t%i@o%i@g%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@%vp~
Won’t be heard yet again in you—%vp~
Not a chance.%vp~
%si~
%I@A%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ because your merchants were%vp~
The top deal-makers of the Earth,%vp~
Because in your drug-induced sprees,%vp~
All the nations have been deceived by you,%vp~
And you have led them down the primrose path.%i@%vp~
%u@2%u@4The prophets’ and saints’ blood%vp~
Has been found in her, and the blood%vp~
Of all those who’ve been slain upon the Earth.%vp~

%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@m%i@a%i@j%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@o%i@r…Lit: %i@g%i@l%i@o%i@r%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@h%i@a%i@r%i@a%i@s%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@s…Lit: %i@d%i@e%i@m%i@o%i@n%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@f%i@i%i@l%i@t%i@h%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@g%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@u%i@n%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@u%i@p%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@t%i@e…Lit: %i@d%i@o%i@u%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@u%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@s. An expression%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%I@I%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@w%i@a%i@r%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f…Lit: %I@I%i@’%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@i%i@n%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@y…Lit: %i@c%i@a%i@r%i@g%i@o%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@e%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@s%i@l%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@b%i@o%i@r%i@,%i@ %i@s%i@l%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@g%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@l%i@s…Lit: %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@m%i@p%i@t%i@u%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@l%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@d…Lit, in Gk: the %i@l%i@i%i@p%i@a%i@r%i@a [λιπαρὰ, from λιπαρός (λιπαρός/Strong’s 3045)]and the %i@l%i@a%i@m%i@p%i@r%i@a%i@ [λαμπρὰ, from λαμπρός (λαμπρός/Strong’s 2986)]. An alliteration, rhyme, assonance, or pun of a sort, evidence that this is an expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@d%i@i%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@g%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u…Lit: %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@r%i@o%i@m%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u. Some liberties taken.%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@s…Lit: %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@c%i@e%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@U%i@s%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@p%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@x%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@,%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@x%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@t%i@a%i@i%i@l%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@w%i@i%i@c%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d…The ancients mixed wine with spices and other flavorings similar to the way we mix cocktails. When hosting a dinner, they would prepare a special wine-based mix for the guests.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@p%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@r%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@r%i@e%i@w%i@ %i@d%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@s. Attempt to emulate the ancient form of grief, mourning, or repentance, as it says in Job 42:6, “Wherefore I abhor myself and repent in dust and ashes.”%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@r%i@p%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@u%i@s%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@m%i@p%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@y%i@e%i@r%i@s…In ancient Rome, harps and flutes were the principal instruments played in amphitheaters in front of large crowds. To put this in perspective, harps and flutes were to them what electric guitars and keyboards are to rock bands. Famous performers—the pop stars of their day—went from city to city and played in front of large crowds, and all were enchanted by their music. Trumpets were third behind harps and flutes in popularity.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 19%hb~
          %u@1After these things %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@d, I heard what sounded like the voice of an enormous crowd in heaven saying,%vn~
%si~
Hallelujah! (%i@p%i@r%i@a%i@i%i@s%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d)%vp~
%I@F%i@o%i@r%i@ protecting us%u@[%u@a%u@],%vp~
%I@F%i@o%i@r%i@ the glory and the power of our God,%vp~
%u@2Because His judgments are absolutely correct in their truth%u@[%u@b%u@],%vp~
Because He’s judged the Great Harlot%vp~
Who ruined the Earth%vp~
By polluting it with her fornication%vp~
And avenged the blood of His servants%vp~
%I@W%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@e%i@d%i@ by her hand.%vp~
%si~
%u@3They completed what they had spoken by speaking a second time,%nn~
%si~
Hallelujah!%vp~
Her smoke billows up and billows up forever and ever.%vp~
%si~
%u@4And the twenty-four elders and the four creatures fell and worshiped the Almighty God who sits on the throne, saying,%nn~
%si~
The end at last%u@[%U@A%u@]: Hallelujah!%vp~
%si~
%u@5And a voice issued forth from the throne saying,%nn~
%si~
Praise our God%vp~
All His servants%vp~
And all who reverence Him,%vp~
The insignificant and the important%vp~
%si~
%u@6And I heard the sound %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ like a large crowd and like the sound of a large volume of rushing water and like the sound of strong thunder saying,%nn~
%si~
Hallelujah,%vp~
Because our Lord God Almighty reigns.%vp~
%u@7Let us rejoice and be glad%vp~
And give Him the glory,%vp~
Because %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e has arrived for the lamb’s marriage,%vp~
And his bride-to-be has prepared herself,%vp~
%u@8And she was given bright, clean, fine linen to put on:%vp~
You see, the linen is the righteous deeds%vp~
Of the set-apart-people.%vp~
%si~
          %u@9He %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tells me, “Write %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n: Blessed are those who’ve been invited to the lamb’s marriage dinner.”%vn~
      He continues, “These words are truly from God.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@0I fell before His feet to worship Him. He %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tells me, “Get ahold of yourself.%u@[%u@c%u@] I’m a fellow-servant of yours and of your comrades who keep the statement of Jesus. Worship God, %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@e. You see, the official statement about Jesus is the underlying impetus%u@[%u@d%u@] of prophecy.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@1I saw the sky while it had been opened, and—like that—a white horse and mounted on it one called Ever True to His Faithful Nature%u@[%u@e%u@], and he judges and wages war righteously. %u@1%u@2His eyes are like wheels of fire, and upon his head are many ornamental headbands%u@[%u@f%u@], having names %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@m%i@p%i@l%i@i%i@s%i@h%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@s%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@t%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@ written on them which nobody knows except he himself, %u@1%u@3and clothed in clothing that has been soaked in blood, and the name that he goes by is the Word of God. %u@1%u@4The soldier-garrison in heaven followed him on white horses, clothed in clean, fine white linen. %u@1%u@5Out of his mouth protrudes a sharp Thracian sword, %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e so that he can strike the nations, and he personally shepherds (rules) them with a staff of iron. He himself treads the winepress of the wine of the ferocious wrath of God Almighty. %u@1%u@6He has a name written on his outer garment and on his thigh: King of Kings and Lord of Lords.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7I saw an angel up in the upper atmosphere blocking the sun%u@[%U@B%u@]. He shouted in a loud voice telling any bird that’s %i@c%i@a%i@p%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ flying at a high altitude%u@[%U@C%u@], “Come gather %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ for God’s Great Dinner, %u@1%u@8so that you get the chance to eat the meat of kings, of commanders, of mighty people, of horses and those mounted on them, of free men and not just them but of slaves, of the insignificant, and of the great.” %u@1%u@9And I saw the beast and the kings of the Earth and their soldiers gathered for the purpose of waging war against the one mounted on the horse and his troops.%vn~
          %u@2%u@0And the beast was seized and with him the false prophet too, the one who performs miracles under his supervision, by %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@s he’s deceived those who’ve received the mark of the beast and those who worship his replica—the pair were thrown alive into the Lake of Fire, the lake burning in brimstone. %u@2%u@1The remainder were killed by the Thracian sword that comes out of the mouth of the one mounted on the horse, and all of the %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ birds ate their flesh until they were too full to eat anymore.%vn~

%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@p%i@r%i@o%i@t%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@a%i@l%i@v%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@a%i@b%i@s%i@o%i@l%i@u%i@t%i@e%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@t%i@h…Lit: %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t. A sort of hendiadys; ref. note of Matt. 3:11.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%I@G%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@h%i@o%i@l%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@f…Or: %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@’%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@l%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@i%i@m%i@p%i@e%i@t%i@u%i@s…Lit: %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%I@E%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %I@T%i@r%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@H%i@i%i@s%i@ %I@F%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %I@N%i@a%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@e…Lit: %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e. A hendiadys.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s…Lit: %i@d%i@i%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@m%i@s%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t…Lit: %i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n. This well-known Hebrew word which, depending on the context, has one or more of the following meanings: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t;%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e; %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@i%i@t; %i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o; %i@s%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t; %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@o%i@k%i@e%i@n; %I@I%i@/%i@w%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@f%i@i%i@r%i@m%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@y%i@o%i@u%i@ %i@j%i@u%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@i%i@d%i@/%i@d%i@i%i@d%i@;%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d; %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@a%i@s%i@t.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@u%i@p%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@m%i@o%i@s%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@l%i@o%i@c%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@n…Lit: %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@n. The ancients’ perception of the sun is that it was a lot closer to the Earth than it actually is. Consequently, a liberty taken to adapt the wording in a way that fits the modern perspective of astronomy.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@i%i@r%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@p%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@t%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@d%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@i%i@r%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@d%i@-%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n In regard to %i@m%i@i%i@d%i@-%i@h%i@e%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@n, ref. note of 8:13. Birds which are “capable of flying at a high altitude” refers to eagles and vultures and perhaps a few other carrion-eating types of birds. In any case, what’s referred to is birds which pick at dead carcasses and tear their flesh off.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 20%hb~
          %u@1I saw an angel come down out of the sky with the key to the abyss on him and with a huge chain in his hand, %u@2and he grabbed the dragon, the Ancient Serpent who is a slanderer%u@[%u@a%u@]—yes, Satan—tied him up %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ for a thousand years, %u@3tossed him into the abyss, locked it, and covered the top over and secured it%u@[%u@b%u@] so that he couldn’t deceive the nations anymore until the thousand years were up. After that, he must be set free for a little while.%vn~
          %u@4I saw some thrones, and %I@I%i@ %i@s%i@a%i@w%i@ those who were seated on them. They were assigned the task of presiding in judgment %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@r%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@p%i@e%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t the lives of those who had been beheaded on account of the statement of Jesus and the word of God and %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@p%i@e%i@t%i@r%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@d %i@a%i@g%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@s%i@t%i@ whoever wouldn’t worship the beast or his replica and wouldn’t receive the mark upon their foreheads and their hands. And they lived and reigned with the Messiah (the Christ) a thousand years. %u@5The rest of the dead weren’t brought back to life%u@[%u@c%u@] until the thousand years was over. That’s the First Life-after-Death Epoch%u@[%u@d%u@]. %u@6The person who takes part in the First Life-after-Death Epoch is blessed and holy; the second change of bodily state of being%u@[%u@e%u@] has no power over these people, but instead they’ll be personal attendants%u@[%u@f%u@] of God and of the Messiah, and they will reign with him for a thousand years.%vn~
          %u@7But when the thousand years finally does end, Satan will be let out of jail. %u@8He’ll be set free to commit an act of deception upon the nations %i@e%i@v%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ the farthest reach of the planet%u@[%U@A%u@]—all the way to Timbuktu%u@[%U@B%u@]—to gather them together for the War. There were %i@g%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ as many as the number of grains of sand on a typical seashore. %u@9%I@A%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@m%i@y%i@ they%i@ deployed themselves in such a way as to occupy and control all the key territory%u@[%u@g%u@] and surrounded the saints’ home base%u@[%u@h%u@], which is the Beloved City—And flames came down from out of the sky and devoured them. %u@1%u@0“The Slanderer”—the Devil, the one deceiving them—was thrown into the lake of fire and brimstone, where the beast and the false prophet %i@a%i@r%i@e too, and they will be tormented day and night forever and ever.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1I saw a great white throne and the One seated on it, %I@O%i@n%i@e whom the Earth fled from %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@i%i@e%i@r%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@s%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@ %i@o%i@f His undivided attention%u@[%u@i%u@]—and they found no place %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@s%i@c%i@a%i@p%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@t. %u@1%u@2I saw the %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@u%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@y%i@ dead %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@l%i@y, the insignificant and the important, made to stand before the throne, and %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ books were opened, and apart from them another book was opened, which is %i@c%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ the %I@B%i@o%i@o%i@k%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ Life. And the dead were judged from what had been written in the %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@y%i@ books, %i@j%i@u%i@d%i@g%i@e%i@d%i@,%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@s%i@, according to the deeds they had committed. %u@1%u@3The graveyard%u@[%U@C%u@] coughed up its dead—the Grim Reaper returned his dead indeed%u@[%u@j%u@]—and each was judged according to his deeds. %u@1%u@4And the Grim Reaper was thrown into the Lake of Fire. %u@1%u@5And if any given person’s name wasn’t found written in the Book of Life, he was thrown into the Lake of Fire.%vn~
