%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@s%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@r…Or: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@D%i@e%i@v%i@i%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@p%i@ %i@o%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@c%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@l%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@s%i@h%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@m%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@w%i@e%i@r%i@e%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@o%i@u%i@g%i@h%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@c%i@k%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@f%i@e…Lit: %i@d%i@i%i@d%i@n%i@’%i@t%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@v%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@F%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ %I@L%i@i%i@f%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@f%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@ %I@D%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ %I@E%i@p%i@o%i@c%i@h…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@F%i@i%i@r%i@s%i@t%i@ %I@R%i@e%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@s%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@h%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@i%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@a%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@n%i@t%i@s…Lit: %i@p%i@r%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@s%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@p%i@l%i@o%i@y%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@m%i@s%i@e%i@l%i@v%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@s%i@u%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@o%i@c%i@c%i@u%i@p%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@o%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@k%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@e%i@r%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@o%i@r%i@y…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@y%i@ %i@w%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@r%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@E%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h. An expression.%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@h%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@s%i@e…Lit: %i@e%i@n%i@c%i@a%i@m%i@p%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t%fn~
%u@[%u@i%u@]%i@u%i@n%i@d%i@i%i@v%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@n%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n…Lit: %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@j%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@r%i@i%i@m%i@ %I@R%i@e%i@a%i@p%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@t%i@u%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@e%i@d…Lit: %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@D%i@e%i@a%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@H%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@g%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@a%i@d. An expression; some liberties taken.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@r%i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@l%i@a%i@n%i@e%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@u%i@r%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@r%i@n%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@E%i@a%i@r%i@t%i@h. This is an expression. Though the ancient Greeks knew that the world was round, expressions continued to be circulated describing it as though it were flat and had four corners.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %I@T%i@i%i@m%i@b%i@u%i@k%i@t%i@u…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %I@M%i@a%i@g%i@o%i@g. Gog and Magog are used as a metonymy for any nation of peoples who settled at an extreme distance from the center of civilization and over the centuries their whereabouts and any contact with them or knowledge of them had been lost.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@r%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@y%i@a%i@r%i@d…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@a. Some liberties taken. The sea is used symbolically in the Bible to represent the masses of humanity.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 21%hb~
          %u@1I saw brand-new sky and brand-new ground, seeing that the original sky and the original ground had disappeared and that the sea didn’t exist anymore. %u@2I saw the Holy City of Jerusalem—a brand-new one—coming down out of the sky, coming from heaven, from God, gotten ready like a bride %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@r%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@o%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@j%i@e%i@w%i@e%i@l%i@r%i@y%i@,%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@,%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@r%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@y%i@ in preparation of being joined to her husband%i@-%i@t%i@o%i@-%i@b%i@e. %u@3I heard a loud voice from the throne saying, “Look—God’s setting up camp with mankind%u@[%u@a%u@]. He will camp out with them, and they will be His very own people, %u@4and He’ll wipe every tear from their eyes, and Death will not exist, nor will mourning, nor the screaming %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@u%i@i%i@s%i@h, nor will the pains of labor exist: the original stuff is gone.%vn~
          %u@5The One seated on the throne said, “See here—I’m remaking and redoing everything.” He continued, “Write %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@w%i@n, since these very words are ever true in their faithfulness%u@[%u@b%u@].” %u@6He told me, “It has come into being.%u@[%u@c%u@] I am the A-to-Z%u@[%u@d%u@], the beginning and the end. To him who thirsts, I allow to drink from the spring of the water of life, no strings attached. %u@7The one who triumphs in perseverance will inherit these things. I will be a god-figure%u@[%U@A%u@] to him and he will be a son to me. %u@8Now as far as the cowardly, the worthless, the detestable, the murderers, the fornicators, the recreational drug-users, the idolaters, and all liars are concerned, they wind up in the lake which burns with fire and brimstone, which is the Second Death, %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@b%i@o%i@d%i@i%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@s%i@f%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@a%i@t%i@i%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@s%i@o%i@b%i@e%i@d%i@i%i@e%i@n%i@t.%vn~
          %u@9One of the seven angels (the angels who have the seven bowls filled with the final seven plagues) came and conversed with me saying, “Come and I’ll show you the lamb’s wife%i@-%i@t%i@o%i@-%i@b%i@e, his bride.” %u@1%u@0In the Spirit he took me and put me on a huge, tall mountain and showed me the holy city Jerusalem coming down out of heaven from God, %u@1%u@1having God’s glory. It was glimmering and radiating light like a gemstone does, like crystal-clear jasper, %u@1%u@2and had large, tall walls, twelve gates and twelve angels at each gate, and names inscribed %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@g%i@a%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@ that are from the twelve tribes of the sons of Israel. %u@1%u@3Three gates face east, three face north, three face south, and three face west. %u@1%u@4The city wall has twelve %i@u%i@n%i@d%i@e%i@r%i@l%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@b%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@o%i@r%i@m%i@o%i@u%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@r%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@s foundations, and upon them are the names of the twelve apostles of the lamb.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5The %i@a%i@n%i@g%i@e%i@l%i@ who was conversing with me had a golden measuring stick, so that he could measure%u@[%U@B%u@] the city, its gates, and its walls. %u@1%u@6The city is laid in a square, and its length and width are the same. Using the measuring stick, he measured the city to be 1500 miles/2400 km%u@[%u@e%u@] long, and the width and the height are the same as the length. %u@1%u@7He measured its wall to be 215 ft/66 m high%u@[%U@C%u@], in terms of human %i@u%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e%i@m%i@e%i@n%i@t, which is the same %i@u%i@n%i@i%i@t%i@s that angels use. %u@1%u@8Its surrounding wall is jasper, and the city is pure gold like a clear glass. %u@1%u@9The foundation of the city walls is decorated with every kind of precious stone and gemstone %i@i%i@m%i@a%i@g%i@i%i@n%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@.%i@ The first foundation is jasper, the second is sapphire, the third is agate, the fourth is emerald, %u@2%u@0the fifth is onyx, the sixth is ruby, the seventh is chrysolite, the eighth is beryl, the ninth is topaz, the tenth is turquoise, the eleventh is jacinth, the twelfth is amethyst. %u@2%u@1The twelve gates are twelve pearls, and each gate is %i@m%i@a%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ a single pearl. The %i@m%i@a%i@i%i@n%i@ street of the city is pure gold like transparent glass.%vn~
          %u@2%u@2I saw that there was no temple in it, since the Lord God Almighty is its temple, and so is the lamb. %u@2%u@3The city has no need to be illuminated by the light of the sun and the moon, since God’s glory shines on it and illuminates it, and the lamb is its lamp. %u@2%u@4The nations will %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@l%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@l%i@y%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ walk about as a result of the city’s light, and the kings of the Earth bring their glory to it, %i@c%i@o%i@n%i@t%i@r%i@i%i@b%i@u%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@v%i@e%i@r%i@y%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@i%i@t. %u@2%u@5Its gates will never, ever shut because it’ll be daytime all the time%u@[%U@D%u@], seeing that there will be no nighttime, %u@2%u@6and they will bring the very best things nations possess and their valuable artifacts into it. %u@2%u@7And there’s no way whatsoever that any sort of base, degenerate %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ will enter, nor will any being who lies about doing detestable things%u@[%u@f%u@]—only those who’ve been written in the lamb’s Book of Life %i@m%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@e%i@n%i@t%i@e%i@r.%vn~
%sf~
%u@[%u@a%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@t%i@t%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@u%i@p%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@m%i@p%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@a%i@n%i@k%i@i%i@n%i@d…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@a%i@b%i@e%i@r%i@n%i@a%i@c%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@n%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s…Lit: %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e. A hendiadys.%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%I@I%i@t%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@s%i@ %i@c%i@o%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@t%i@o%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g…Almost the same word and almost the same inflected form as used in 16:17; ref. note for that verse.%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@A%i@-%i@t%i@o%i@-%I@Z…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@A%i@l%i@p%i@h%i@a%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %I@O%i@m%i@e%i@g%i@a%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@1%i@5%i@0%i@0%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@s%i@/%i@2%i@4%i@0%i@0%i@ %i@k%i@m…Lit: %i@1%i@2%i@,%i@0%i@0%i@0%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@a%i@d%i@i%i@a. Ref. note of Luke 24:13 for conversion of units.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@b%i@e%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@o%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@b%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@a%i@t%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@d%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@a%i@b%i@l%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@a%i@r. A hendiadys.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%i@g%i@o%i@d%i@-%i@f%i@i%i@g%i@u%i@r%i@e…The word %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ in the GT of the NT is usually preceded with a definite article; this occurrence is not. This is not to say that God is simply a god-figure and not God. A god-figure is one who supplies what is necessary for survival. Pagans, in fact, view their idols as god-figures and credit them with providing what is needed for their survival. In the OT, the Jehovah-names for God do, for the most part, describe God as the ultimate god-figure, the one who promises to supply our survival needs. Hence, Jehovah Jireh (the Lord our Provider), Jehova Rapha (the Lord our Healer), Jehovah Nissi (the Lord our Banner), Jehovah Rohi (the Lord our Shepherd), etc.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%i@m%i@e%i@a%i@s%i@u%i@r%i@e…Measuring the city verifies that it is perfect, in the same way that exact dimensions of the tabernacle are specified in the Torah. The act of measuring confirms that it perfectly complies with God’s exacting standards; in this context, that it is made by God and not by man. Also, ref. note of Rev. 11:2.%fn~
%u@[%U@C%u@]%i@2%i@1%i@5%i@ %i@f%i@t%i@/%i@ %i@6%i@6%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@g%i@h…Lit: %i@1%i@4%i@4%i@ %i@c%i@u%i@b%i@i%i@t%i@s. A cubit is approximately 18 inches/450 millimeters.%fn~
%u@[%U@D%u@]%i@d%i@a%i@y%i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e…Gates in ancient cities were normally kept open during the day but shut at night, as to protect against bands of marauders who roamed the night and other such threats. With there being no night, there is no need to ever shut the gates.%fn~
%i@%sb~
Revelation Chapter 22%hb~
          %u@1He %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ showed me a river of living water as clear as crystal, pouring out of God’s throne and out of the lamb %u@2and into the middle of the %i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y%i@’%i@s main street. The tree of life yields fruit on either side of the river twelve %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@y%i@e%i@a%i@r%i@,%i@ each month, and the tree’s leaves are destined for the treatment and healing of the nations. %u@3No kind of curse (%i@b%i@a%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@h%i@i%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@p%i@p%i@e%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@o%i@p%i@l%i@e) will exist anymore. God’s throne will be in %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y, and so will the lamb, and His servants will ritualistically offer up a service of worship to Him. %u@4His face will be visible, and His name %i@w%i@i%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@e%i@e%i@n%i@ upon their foreheads. %u@5There will no longer be any night, and there won’t be any need for lamplight and sunlight, because the Lord God will provide illumination for them and will reign forever and ever.%vn~
          %u@6He told me, “These here words are ever true in their faithfulness%u@[%u@a%u@].”%vn~
      The Lord, the God of the prophetic utterances of the prophets%u@[%U@A%u@], sent His angel to show His servants what must come to pass post-haste.%vn~
%si~

%si~
          %u@8And, I, John, the one who’s listening to and watching %i@a%i@l%i@l these things—when I heard and saw %i@t%i@h%i@i%i@s, I fell %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@m%i@y%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@c%i@e%i@ before the feet of the angel who’s showing me these things to worship %i@h%i@i%i@m. %u@9He %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tells me, “Get ahold of yourself. I’m a fellow-servant of yours, of your comrades the prophets, and of those adhering to the words in this scroll. Worship God%i@,%i@ %i@n%i@o%i@t%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@.”%i@ %u@1%u@0He %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@n%i@ tells me, “Don’t deny access to%u@[%u@b%u@] the prophetic words in this scroll, seeing that the time is near. %u@1%u@1Let he who behaves in a worthless manner yet continue in his worthlessness, let he who is foul yet continue to be foul and filthy, let he who’s righteous yet continue to act righteously, and he who’s holy yet continue to act like a saint.%vn~
%si~
%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@S%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@—%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@h%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@o%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@r%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@t%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@h%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@e%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@i%r@@%r@d%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@a%r@%%r@i%r@@%r@y%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%R@U%r@@%R@B%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@A%r@-%R@Z%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@g%r@i%r@n%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@d%r@.%r@%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@4Blessed are those who wash their robes, so they have the right%u@[%u@c%u@] to the tree of life; and when they perchance desire to enter the city, they %i@a%i@r%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@m%i@i%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ use the gates. %u@1%u@5Outside %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@ are the dogs, the recreational drug users, the fornicators, the murderers, the idolaters, and everyone who is quite fond of lying and lies %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e%u@[%u@e%u@].%vn~

%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@I%r@,%r@ %R@J%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@p%r@a%r@t%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@c%r@l%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@u%r@r%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@-%r@d%r@e%r@s%r@c%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@[%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@f%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@]%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@D%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@B%r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %R@M%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %R@S%r@t%r@a%r@r%r@.%r@ %r@%vp~

%u@1%u@7And the Spirit and the bride%i@-%i@t%i@o%i@-%i@b%i@e say, “Come!” And let the one who thirsts come, and let the one who %i@s%i@o%i@ desires freely partake of the water of life.%nn~
          %u@1%u@8I confirm%u@[%u@g%u@] that I’ve heard all the prophetic words which are in this scroll. If anyone chooses to add to them, God will add all the plagues that are written in this scroll to his life. %u@1%u@9And if anyone chooses to delete words from this prophetic scroll, God will delete his access to the tree of life and to the holy city, which has been written about in this scroll.%vn~
          %u@2%u@0He who confirms these things says:%vn~

%u@[%u@a%u@]%i@e%i@v%i@e%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e%i@ %i@i%i@n%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@i%i@r%i@ %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@n%i@e%i@s%i@s…Lit: %i@f%i@a%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@f%i@u%i@l%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@r%i@u%i@e. A hendiadys. Same phrase used in Rev. 21:5.%fn~
%u@[%u@b%u@]%i@d%i@e%i@n%i@y%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@s%i@ %i@t%i@o…Lit: %i@s%i@e%i@a%i@l%fn~
%u@[%u@c%u@]%i@r%i@i%i@g%i@h%i@t…Lit: %i@a%i@u%i@t%i@h%i@o%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@d%u@]%i@o%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@i%i@t%i@y…Lit: %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@s%i@i%i@d%i@e. Ref. note of 14:20%fn~
%u@[%u@e%u@]%i@q%i@u%i@i%i@t%i@e%i@ %i@f%i@o%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@l%i@y%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@i%i@m%i@e…Lit: %i@a%i@l%i@l%i@ %i@l%i@o%i@v%i@i%i@n%i@g [%i@p%i@h%i@i%i@l%i@e%i@ō%i@,%i@ (φιλέω/Strong’s 5368)] %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@a%i@c%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@a%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@e. The awkward wording is a figure of speech.%fn~
%u@[%u@f%u@]%i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@i%i@r%i@e%i@c%i@t%i@-%i@d%i@e%i@s%i@c%i@e%i@n%i@d%i@a%i@n%i@t…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@t%i@o%i@c%i@k [%i@r%i@o%i@o%i@t] %i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@l%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@a%i@g%i@e%fn~
%u@[%u@g%u@]%i@c%i@o%i@n%i@f%i@i%i@r%i@m…Lit: %i@t%i@e%i@s%i@t%i@i%i@f%i@y%fn~
%u@[%u@h%u@]%i@l%i@e%i@t%i@ %i@i%i@t%i@ %i@b%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@o…Lit: %i@a%i@m%i@e%i@n. Ref. note of 19:4.%fn~
%fn~
%u@[%U@A%u@]%I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@t%i@i%i@c%i@ %i@u%i@t%i@t%i@e%i@r%i@a%i@n%i@c%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@t%i@s…Lit: %I@G%i@o%i@d%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@t%i@s…The phrase %i@s%i@p%i@i%i@r%i@i%i@t%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@p%i@r%i@o%i@p%i@h%i@e%i@t%i@s%i@ is an idiom. It also appears in 1 Cor. 14:32. These two passages qualify the idiom’s meaning.%fn~
%u@[%U@B%u@]%I@I%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@c%i@a%i@s%i@h%i@ %i@o%i@n%i@ %i@h%i@a%i@n%i@d%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@p%i@a%i@y%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@p%i@e%i@r%i@s%i@o%i@n%i@ %i@a%i@c%i@c%i@o%i@r%i@d%i@i%i@n%i@g%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k%i@ %i@h%i@e%i@’%i@s%i@ %i@d%i@o%i@n%i@e %i@f%i@o%i@r%i@ %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@d%i@a%i@y%i@…Lit: %i@t%i@h%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@a%i@g%i@e%i@s%i@ %i@o%i@f%i@ %i@m%i@i%i@n%i@e%i@ %i@w%i@i%i@t%i@h%i@ %i@m%i@e%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@g%i@i%i@v%i@e%i@ %i@o%i@u%i@t%i@ %i@t%i@o%i@ %i@e%i@a%i@c%i@h%i@ %i@a%i@s%i@ %i@h%i@i%i@s%i@ %i@w%i@o%i@r%i@k. The metaphor, used in the Gospels, is a man who hires day-workers and is expected to pay them in the evening of each workday.%fn~
